Reviews.Title: “Great Time on the Strip!”
Reviews.Author: jrgt3000jlr
Reviews.Content: This is a great spot for traveling around the strip and the city! Beautiful weather this time of year for the snow birds and lots of new places to visit. More shopping, more food, cool attractions!

Reviews.Title: “Center of it all!”
Reviews.Author: casinoluver
Reviews.Content: We really liked it there. Great view of the fountains. Beds were comfortable. Good bang for your buck...except their buffet is a bit overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and great location!”
Reviews.Author: Monkey2002
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Bally's March 10-14. Upgraded at check-in to a jr suite w/soaking tub (for $25/night and one night free). Room was HUGE and clean. Located in the South tower & had a side view of Ceasars and the strip. A bit outdated but very clean and no smoke smell. Enjoyed our time in the Bally's casino also, not too big and not too small. It was nice that it was attached to Paris. Be sure to sign up for the total rewards program when you arrive. Any points you accumulate you can use towards your bill at check out. If you are looking for glitz and glam, this is not the place for you. But if you want a affordable, clean, comfortable stay in the heart of the strip, you can't go wrong here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: gymdoggrams
Reviews.Content: Thoroughly enjoyed staying there and gambling there. Rooms were very nice, clean, and comfortable. Casino is not overwhelmingly large and easy to find your way around in there. Could use some more new slot machines but still have plenty. Evening entertainment is casual and awesome. Brought me back to the sixties! Connected inside walkway to casino Paris. Only downfall at Bally's is not having a buffet and snack area is not that great. Bartenders serve a great drink, though. Bally's just has that very comfortable atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Vomit on walls and back of door!”
Reviews.Author: TESSIERedDeer
Reviews.Content: I took my daughter to LasVegas in February and stayed at Ballys. The room had peeling wall paper, hair on the floor in the bathroom and seriously VOMIT on the wall by one of the beds and two spots on the door to the room. We were given another room that was clean but very worn and ragged. I have waited over a month for a response from the hotel management and nothing. I was not even given a fridge that I asked for. I even brought my iPad to the front desk and showed them what my room looked like. I can't believe a hotel wouldn't even apologize. Stay elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great price.”
Reviews.Author: Wildkat520
Reviews.Content: What more can you ask for??? Bally's is located in the perfect spot on the strip. Flamingo, Ceasar's, Bellagio, Paris, Planet Hollywood are all nearby. Rooms are clean. Hotel is clean. Good places to eat in the hotel and nearby. Gaming area is on the small side but has every slot machine or table game you could ask for. I have stayed there plenty of times and would stay there yet again.

Reviews.Title: “Room was good enough; beds too hard”
Reviews.Author: fortwaynejules
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the South Tower March 21 - 24. We were offered an upgrade to the North Tower for $25/night, but generally, we are in our room so little, we thought that the extra money would be better spent gambling. The rooms are fairly large size, and we had a very nice view of the Strip. Check-in was fast and friendly. The only reason this isn't four stars rather than three is that our two queen-sized beds were rock-hard. Neither my friend nor I could sleep much at all, which again, is typical for Vegas for us. Still, it's nice to be able to sleep when you want to. Other amenities - great location on the Strip, the casino is pretty nice, and I love the Sterling Sunday brunch. All of these things are good, but I wouldn't stay here again as what's the use of not sleeping when you do want to?

Reviews.Title: “Bally's Hotel - Good value”
Reviews.Author: Nicole P
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the North Tower - March 18 to 24 . rooms have recently been renovated. Large comfortable room with large bathroom versus an old rundown room with a view. Bally's is a great location on the strip - easy walking distance or bus ride to all of the hotels on the strip. Connected to the Paris Hotel. Take note that internet access is expensive at Bally's $13.99 a day and $3.00 a day for in room safe. Food is ok not great. There is free WIFI at the coffee and pastry shop at the Paris Hotel. Computer and Printer access for boarding passes or e-mail access is available in the casino or close to conference rooms for a minimum $5.00 - .35 a minute and .50 per page for printing. Free WIFI access is also available at the local McDonalds. West Jet Vacations - great deals for 5 day stays. Would recommend the Bally's Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great time at Bally's”
Reviews.Author: iwcpromoter
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Bally's from 3/18 to 3/23/2012. We were giving an upgade to a junior suite in the North Tower. Our hotel room was very clean. Bathroom was spotless. Usual smoke smell when you shower, but very common in just about every hotel casino you stay in. The Bally's pool was to be closed, so we were able to use the Paris pool our entire stay (found out the last two days Bally's pool had opened due to the beuautiful weather) We chose this hotel becuse of convenience, as it was centrally located to all of the restaurants we wanted to eat at. My convention was at Mandalay Bay, and it was worth the $14.00 cab ride to stay at Bally's (we were comped there through Total Rewards). Staff was pleasant, from the housekeeping all the way down to the front desk. We will go again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Decent Rooms”
Reviews.Author: BlueBaby05
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed at Bally's from 3/14-3/17 for our annual St. Patrick's Day weekend trip and a conference that I was attending. I'll start with what I liked about my experience at the hotel. Our room was in the south tower, so we had a great view of the southern part of the Las Vegas Strip and could see the Bellagio water show from our room. There are fairly decent dining options in the hotel in terms of affordability and quality. My favorite dining experience was at the quaint cafe, Nosh. It is a great place for a quick "snack" if you're in a rush.They charge almost ten dollars for a six inch sub sandwich, but once I took one-two bites of my turkey, bacon sub I felt like it was definitely worth the cost! Be sure to check out Tequila Bar and Grill for their $2 margaritas--the food is nothing special. The hotel is clean and the casino wasn't as smoky as I expected it to be (based on other online reviews). I liked the customer service that was provided by the front desk, especially the bellman that offered to bring my bag out to the shuttle stop instead of having me wait at the desk while he retrieved it. The hotel also provides a shuttle to the Rio hotel that picks up every 30 min. until 1am, which is used my most Bally's guests as a means to get to the Carnival World Buffett (which was nothing to write home about). I thought Bally's was in a fairly decent location in relation to most of the other casinos on the strip. What slows you down is having to walk into the courtyards or inside of the casinos to get where you are going as there is not much sidewalk along the strip. Lastly, the best part of my experience in the hotel was the maid service. I know...they are suppose to come tidy up the room, but we left the room kind of late one afternoon in a rush and returned to made up beds and our things more neatly place on the dresser. Little things like that were very helpful because it seemed like we were always in a rush to get somewhere while we there as a result of trying to fit a lot of activities in a brief trip. Now...on to what I did not like about Bally's. I thought the hotel-casino was quite average. It was more average than I was expecting from an establishment that I have seen referred to as a resort. We did not have much time to watch TV, but they still had the old tube units and the channel selection did not offer much. The beds were okay. I could have used large pillows or an additional pillow because the ones they have on the double beds are fairly small. I knew they did not have free wi-fi, but my friend did not and she paid over ten dollars for one day of wi-fi which I personally think is "highway robbery". They had a computer near the elevators of the south tower that you could use to access the internet and print, but they were charging ten dollars for it too. There were a couple of conferences going on at Bally's while we there so I am sure affordable wi-fi ($7 or less/day) would have been beneficial to those guest. Outside of the fact that the hotel needs a few upgrades, my biggest gripe about the hotel was the poor customer service and bland food at the Sidewalk Cafe. Our waiter was very inattentive and most of our service came from the lady who brought us our drinks and one of the hostesses. Other notes: I booked our rooms directly through the Bally's website, but one of my friend's (who was attending the same conference as me) booked a room at Circus Circus on one the main travel websites and received dining and drink coupons from the hotel upon arrival. There were no such amenities offered by Bally's. While it is great to view the Bellagio water show from your room at night, you may not enjoy being awakened by it at three in the morning if you are a light sleeper. Just be prepared and do not forget to close your curtains and you should be fine. There is a liquor store across the street with decent prices for those who want to get the party started before you leave your room. Lastly, Vegas is NOT a pedestrian-friendly city. I think they have a light rail system that actually had a stop at Bally's but it isn't advertised well and it cost $5 for a one-way trip. As I mentioned before the streets are designed to keep you in the hotels rather than for you to be able to walk a straight path down the strip; the crosswalks are minimal. Overall, I would recommend Bally's to someone who is looking for a clean, conveniently located place to stay with good service but no "bells and whistles". If you are looking for something fancy or flashy, this is not the place.

Reviews.Title: “Bally's - Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Jomoin
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at Bally's from 3/4/12 - 3/8/12. The location is fantastic...easy to get to all the major casinos on the strip. The room is nice...above average...big and clean...large bathroom. Our view wasn't great, but those facing the strip would have a great view. The elevators were very fast....never had to wait long. Check in after noon was quick. Would definitely recommend staying there if you are on a budget!

Reviews.Title: “Rewarding Four Days”
Reviews.Author: VonBreton
Reviews.Content: First time visitor to Las Vegas and was nto sure what to expect. Bally's is a very good hotel for both location and quality. Staff was excellent and friendly. Dealers at tables were the best! Easy to walk to other hotels and casinos, or take the monorail. Lots to see and do. Would definately go back.

Reviews.Title: “Time for some updates! :)”
Reviews.Author: NSPounds
Reviews.Content: We visit Las Vegas every year and we love to stay at Bally's. It's centrally located, has a smaller casino so you don't get lost and the entire facility is easy to navigate. It has some great places to eat and the staff is always wonderful. The rooms are always very clean and the maids do a wonderful job. They are also good sized rooms. We had a room with two queen beds and there was plenty of room and I didn't feel cramped at all. The bathroom is also good sized, with plenty of counter space and room for all your stuff. There are several places to eat within the hotel that are easy, fast and yummy. NOSH is a favorite of ours, sandwiches, bagels and soup are all delicious. There's also a Sbarro, Nathan's, Sushi Bar, Cafe that offers a small buffet breakfast which offers the basics, New York Pretzel and a few other places we haven't tried. So lots of variety to choose from. It's also connected with the Paris which offers some other places for pizza and sandwiches. (Altho I do not recommend Paris' Breakfast Buffet, yuk.) The rooms in the south tower are in need of updating and I believe it's something they are working on. The furniture and headboards are worn, table was wobbly, light switch in the bathroom needed to be wiggled just right to stay on, a strip of baseboard needed to be glued back up, shower head really needed to be replaced. So just basic wear and tear things. We love Bally's and will continue to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable, clean, nice”
Reviews.Author: Dot59929
Reviews.Content: Stayed Mar. 17-21, 2012...checked in late since our flight arrived at night...which was a good idea....less wait time to check in....got a very nice worker behind counter to check us in...thanks Manny!!! Had a jacuzzi suite in the North Tower...awesome room. Very comfortable bed...$2 Margaritas!...!!!....band was awesome at night...I loved that this hotel was in the middle of the strip...came back to a clean room every nite!! Will come and stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, affordable, center strip”
Reviews.Author: Katie M
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Bally's Las Vegas March 14-18, 2012. The first night we were upgraded to a suite, because they didn't have a standard nonsmoking room available. Square footage-wise, the suite was huge. It was on the 16th floor of the South Tower, facing Bill's Gambling Hall, with a partial view of the strip. The decor was very worn and dated, but everything was clean. The rest of the nights we stayed in a standard king nonsmoking room, also in the South Tower, but on the 17th floor. This time we had a view of the Paris pool, Eiffel Tower and the other side of the strip. We could also see some of the Bellagio fountain show. We liked this view better than what the suite offered. Again, the decor was very dated and worn -- in fact, the wallpaper in our bathroom was falling down -- but everything was clean and comfortable for our purposes. We didn't spend much time in the room anyway, because, after all, it's Vegas. We would definitely stay here again, because of the affordability factor, the cleanliness, and the great center strip location.

Reviews.Title: “great value”
Reviews.Author: badgers4life
Reviews.Content: Haven't stayed in Bally's for years. Very impressed with the staff and size of the room. One thing I didn't understand was why I was told I could check in at the airport, but the hotel staff said I couldn't. Being on the strip saved time driving from one casino to the next. The only downfall of the hotel was the parking garage. I got so disappointed trying to find a location in the garage that I finally ended up parking in the rear of the casino.

Reviews.Title: “Good Rates - Decent Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Anika B
Reviews.Content: The rooms could be more updated.. the rate was good since I had points on my card...

Reviews.Title: “We like it here”
Reviews.Author: KaperKate
Reviews.Content: We really like the location of this hotel. It's right at the center of the action. The rooms are good, and we can usually find a good deal. We've only stayed in the North Tower though. Bathrooms are quite nice. Hallways could use a refurb, but OK. Overall the location combined with the price make it a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Bally's Great for Home Base”
Reviews.Author: JGCalifornia
Reviews.Content: Feb 26-Mar 1 Had 4 nights comp at Bally’s in South Tower. Arrived at Casino around 11:00 am and was hoping a room would be ready. We had received the email a few days earlier asking if we wanted to upgrade to the North Tower for $10.00 per night. We wanted the North Tower but had always been upgraded at check in and decided we are going to Las Vegas to gamble so let’s start off the gambling before we leave. Check in had several people in line but there were several clerks working so the line moved fast. The lady who checked us in automatically put us in the North Tower on the Diamond Floor and the room was ready! Good start! We never asked for an upgrade it was just given. $40 ahead! Room was very nice and very clean and had a coffee maker! The room was quite large I believe around 500 sq. ft. All the staff was very pleasant and friendly. Our room was always made up when we went to breakfast and was ready for the day when we returned. You can't beat the location, right in the heart of things. Love being able to walk to Paris and all of their restaurants without going outside.

Reviews.Title: “Room OK - better than you'd think”
Reviews.Author: Susie20817
Reviews.Content: Coming to las Vegas for meetings during March Madness and on St. Patrick's is probably not a great indicator, but, it is what it is. Crowds of mostly men with open containers drinking in the halls,elevator and basically everywhere in the hotel. It isn't one's idea of a quiet business hotel, but we knew that for the get go. On the other hand, my room was big, clean and quiet once II shut the door. Nothing fancy, comfortable king bed and couch. Fortunately upgraded to the Diamond Floor - non-smoking in the North Tower, everything was just fine. Mediocre view of parking garages and hotels in the distance out the window. A car alarm went off early. Orning and Iwas surprised how loud that was at 6 a.m., but otherwise, just regular traffic noise that travelled all 21floors unto me room. They charge $3 daily for in room safe. I had never seen a charge for a safe before anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Wont be returning”
Reviews.Author: JoyceinNY
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Ballys for 3 nites in a comped room in the south tower...room was large with stained carpets and beat up furniture ...Pool was bland and there arent many dining choices at Ballys...no buffett no mid priced dining....the casino was big and boring...Its connected to Paris which has so much more abience/charm and dining choices...only problem was it was very crowded there with long lines due to not only patrons from Paris but from Ballys as well....to use the in room safe is $3 per day....the safe didnt work

Reviews.Title: “Good place for smokers”
Reviews.Author: Jay100
Reviews.Content: To quote Betty Davis "What a dump!". Everything about from the lobby to the rooms to the casino reminded me of a basement apartment - dark, dank and smokey. We were booked there for a week for a high tailed it over to the Paris after one night which was lovely. Please note although they promote "no resort fees" it's because you have to pay extra for everything...safe, gym, and to guarantee a non-smoking room. To be fair it's got a great location and we had a positive experience checking in and out and I'm allergic to smoke and found it really smokey...more so than any other casino I went too...which may explain why I really didn't like it. . Other members in our group who were smokers who stayed there thought it was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Impressed”
Reviews.Author: Lynette K
Reviews.Content: Just back from spending 7 nights at Ballys. Loved our experience with this hotel. A big part of us loving it so much was thanks to Joey on reception who looked after us so beautifully. The room was great with lovely furniture, comfortable beds, kept very clean every day by housekeeping and a wonderful view of the strip as well. We did not find the casino any more smokey than alot of others. Overall a very positive experience with this hotel. Once again a big Thank You to Joey. Lyn and Lauren from Australia

Reviews.Title: “Ballys Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Ken S
Reviews.Content: Nice place to stay, very nice rooms central strip connected to Paris nice sports book.

Reviews.Title: “Mid range casino on the strip”
Reviews.Author: Marseil
Reviews.Content: I was happy to have a large room, high enough in th building to have a good view over the Strip. But.... I hate casinos! I hate having to walk 15 minutes through slot machines and smokers between the parking lot and my room. On top of this, there is no way to find a decent breakfast in this place. Breakfast is both horrendous and overpriced. Bally's is a mdi range option. I do believe places like The Caesar's or Venezia are much better. More expensive too. The only positive pojtn for the Bally's is its location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, great location”
Reviews.Author: guyfromkansas
Reviews.Content: Solid in every way though not spectacular. Inexpensive rooms, clean, good beds. No problems at all, but a little shop-worn. Check-in and -out were a breeze. Staff was consistently friendly and helpful. Rating it "average" is not a put-down, it's just a fair description. Location, as many others have said, is great. Enjoyed my stay and would stay again in a minute.

Reviews.Title: “Grate hotel for reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: Alohayao
Reviews.Content: We stay here for 4 days and suppose move to another hotel for the rest of trip in Vegas, but after a day in other hotel, we decided to move back to Bally. We stay at North Tower, the room is big and clean, It was long walk from left to the room, but that's what happen when you stay at Mega hotel. We did get upgraded to suite with the $20 sandwich at front desk. The room is not brand new, but for the money, we think it is very good value. We average spent less than $80 per day, that's include weekends as well.

Reviews.Title: “Large hotel with some outdated rooms”
Reviews.Author: snowleopard5
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Room 5634 in the South tower and it was very old decor, looked like it had not been updated since before 2000. It was on the 15th floor but access to the floor by elevators was very quick.They have one set of 4 elevators for 14 and above and 12 and below. Room was very far down the hall nearing the end but this made the view of the strip truly spectacular. Windows didn't open even part way and were covered by mesh so photography is a problem. I was travelling with a large group so if you are doing likewise please notify the check in people so that they put you all in the same area. My group was separated not only by floors but different towers as well. Pricing for this hotel is fantastic, so I didn't mind the decor of the room but if you prefer amenities such as a coffee maker in your room, or flat screen television or two chairs at your small table then I would suggest another location. One plus of this hotel is that there is no resort fee which can sometimes exceed $20 US per day. Even though the pool was not open it was a very long hike from the South Tower. Casino was very nice and the sports book area is a fairly long hike to the east along the shopping mall. This hotel is directly connected to the PARIS hotel and if you are going out for breakfast there is a wonderful location right at the front of the paris hotel with seating outside(heaters) where you can see the Bellagio fountains and enjoy a nice breakfast. Overall I didn't stay in my hotel room very much during my four days but beds were comfortable nonetheless. Tips for a great stay at Bally's get a room with lower number 5612 or 14. Try and avoid the people who are selling the time share promotions. There location is at both main doors and they are persistent. They will lead you in by saying that you can get cheaper show tickets or other perks. Finally if you have the oppurtunity to take a tour or rent a car and you like photo ops go to the Valley of Fire state park north and east of vegas. The scenery is otherworldly.

Reviews.Title: “Outdated and showing its age”
Reviews.Author: megs828
Reviews.Content: I only stayed here for convienence because I attended a training class held here. I stayed in a south tower grand suite. The room had a big bathroom with his and her sides and a jacuzzi tub. However the decor is outdated, the carpets were buckling, the floor not as clean as it should have been, and instead of a fitted sheet on the bed it was just a normal sheet which kept shifting leaving the mattress exposed. Yuck. I heard the north tower is nicer but for the price I'd just pick a different hotel. Whatever you do, don't stay in the south tower classic rooms. I heard they were terrible.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, location”
Reviews.Author: DUPS14
Reviews.Content: Stayed two weeks ago, Requested north tower, pleased with room which was clean and newer. Front desk staff friendly and welcoming. A little discussed plus is a large sportsbook by food court. We purchased 24 hr buffet passes, good value, ate at Paris and PH. Good strip location. Overall good for price.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for a great stay”
Reviews.Author: Hard_3
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a trip to Las Vegas where my wife and I stayed at Bally's Las Vegas. We stayed in a North Tower Luxury (Thats what the clerk called it). It was very nice. The room was large, clean, comfortable bed, nice hot shower good water pressure, and nice view. We were on the 21st floor looking down the strip towards Flamingo. Couldn't have asked for a better room. It looked recently redone not sure how long ago that was but it did have a flat screen tv and the bath was all marble. On a side note I did not find the furniture to be worn or tired as is stated in some other reviews but I was in the North Tower so that could be why. Also room was very quiet could not hear anthing out side of the room other than the occational door close.

Reviews.Title: “In desperate need of updating”
Reviews.Author: dorchestergirl3
Reviews.Content: Just came back from Vegas with some girl friends, stayed at Bally's for 4 nights- was very disappointed with the very dated, very dirty rooms, there was garbage on the floors of our rooms when we first arrived so we left it there to see if house keeping would pick it up-it stayed there for the 4 days! The carpets in the rooms & hallways are disgusting with numerous stains(don't think they have ever seen a vacuum) We seen room service trays with left over food on them sit in the hallways for days. The Bathrooms were just as bad with broken shower handles & towel bars and mirrors that I don't think have ever seen a windex bottle! The location on the strip is good & the restaurants in the hotel were good as well. This was my 4th time to vegas & the 1st and last time at Bally's!

Reviews.Title: “Great trip”
Reviews.Author: Tamijoy
Reviews.Content: We just came back from our first trip to Vegas. We chose Ballys for 2 reasons the price was affordable and we wanted a smaller hotel as my husband has a hard time walking too much. We had a great experience. The rooms and the hotel are older but clean and offered everything you needed. The beds were comfortable and we could see the fountains of the Bellagio from our room on the 21st floor of the North Tower. The entertainment at night was fantastic. The casino had all you could want and being connected to Paris offered the opportunity to try other restaurants, stores and casino without ever walking outside. The restaruants in Bally's ( tequilla bar) was very affordable and downstairs they have a Nathans, Pretzel stand, a Sbarros and stores. At Paris there are many upscale and budget friendly restaurants. They do have a steak house and thai restuarnt which we did not try. We did venture out and see other htoels, which were newer and more grand but when returning to Ballys each day we were happy we chose to stay there. They are also middle of the strip and have a tram stop. ( although we never used it) All in All we had a great time, the Casino host was very nice to us and we are planning on going back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: buckelisttraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Bally's North building for a 2 day stay in Vegas. Check-in was a breeze as was check out. I understand the rooms in the north building are a bit more modern than the south. the room was large, bed comfortable, and had a light blue uncomfortable love seat. The other chairs were a bit worn too. All in all it was a great location and a great price. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and found all employees helpful and courteous. will stay again without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Classic, but desperate for update”
Reviews.Author: Jarimalla
Reviews.Content: The best thing about Bally's is the location. Everything else is pretty much what you can expect from a classic Las Vegas casino hotel that hasn't really been modernized recently. At least the south tower. I totally understand that these hotels want the quests use the services on the premises, but no coffee makers in the room - come on, it's 2012! In terms of comfortable staying, there are plenty of better choices around in the same price range.

Reviews.Title: “Needs some TLC”
Reviews.Author: dawings1
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Bally's last week, the room in the south tower was large, furniture was a little worn. The carpet appeared very worn with many stains on it throughout the hotel. I thought the casino slots were very tight at Bally's, spent most of our gambling time next door at Paris. We spent $45 on the Buffet of Buffet's, well worth it! We had unlimited access to 6 different buffets within a 24 hour period. We were able to make 4 visits in this 24 hour period. Our favor buffet was at Paris. This property is showing it's age but was not terrible, it's location is awesome!

Reviews.Title: “updated feel without the updated cost”
Reviews.Author: dktiessen
Reviews.Content: when we arrived ,we were given an upgrade option for very little. It was great, our room surpassed our expectations. the views are great , service was good. Our room was huge and had a jucuzzi style tub in the middle of the room, the beds were very comfortable, just a real good experience. Bally's had the best live music in the casino and the small Thai restaurant downstairs was our highlite meal , in 8 visits to Vegas that restaurant was our favorite.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite Casino”
Reviews.Author: mogcambomama
Reviews.Content: We stayed next door at Bill's but spent most of our time at the casino at Bally's. It was our favorite casino. Good selection of slots with good payoffs. The cocktail waitress were friendly and did a good job keeping the drinks coming. We had a good dinner at their Tequila Bar and Grille.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for what it is”
Reviews.Author: Liberatr
Reviews.Content: Spent a long weekend here in early March and for the value, I think it is a great place to stay as long as your not expecting the moon. When I go to Vegas, I want a comfortable hotel in a great location with easy access to the events I want to do. By no means is Ballys luxorious but the rooms are big, clean and in the North Tower, recently renovated. The big selling point was the location as we spent most of our time gambling in Paris, Planet Hollywood and Cosmo. My only negatives with this hotel was the casino was small (compared to others) and the one meal we ate there at Sidewalk Cafe was not good. If you go here and expect a basic room, you will be fine.

Reviews.Title: “In the Middle of Everything”
Reviews.Author: LAtraveler36542
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Bally's during our recent trip to Vegas. Check in was easy and our room was clean. Maid service was efficient. However, Bally's nickel and dimes you to death. There's no coffee maker in the room and coffee downstairs is very expensive. Want a refrigeator in your room? That's extra, too. The safe is three dollars a day. The fitness center is $22.00 for a visit. The pool was closed though we could visit the pool at another affiated hotel. Worst of all, the casino is extremely smoky. On the positive side again, you can't ask for a better location. I could see the Bellagio fountains from my room.

Reviews.Title: “Second time this year”
Reviews.Author: koreabound
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay at Bally’s located in the center of Las Vegas. I stayed in the North tower. I have to admit after reading some of the reviews I was hesitate in staying here for this week, but our conference for ASQ-Quality Auditors, my students and myself found the facility very good for our conference. The rooms were spacious and clean, everyday vacuumed, fresh towels, and sheets. The room was above average size for Vegas as I have stayed at MGM, Flamingo, Luxor, and Paris and others. The mattress was comfortable the food servicing was plentiful and tasted very good. I especially liked the full rack of ribs and baked potato, delivered hot and fast room service. I would recommend this facility for any conference or stay. Thank you Bally's

Reviews.Title: “Less expensive and right in the middle of it all”
Reviews.Author: FlyMe69
Reviews.Content: Bally's isn't one of the attraction resorts, like Paris of the Venetian, but it is attached to the Paris and right in the heart of the strip. The room rates were half of the Paris and the location was the same. The rooms may not have been as opulent, but they were nice, classy and modern. They were also very clean, roomy and had a great view. The bathroom was larger than most hotels I have stayed in and it was well lit and ventilated. There was no free shampoo or toothpaste, but you could buy that at the front desk (or walk down to the Walgreens a few blocks away, which is what I did). They did try to nickel and dime us, but it was all optional stuff, like the shampoo, soda machine, a $9 fee at the ATM and so on. These fees can be avoided with just a little planning. The casino was nice. I guess I am not a big gambler because they all seemed the same to me. They had a coffee shop, but I don't recall a restaurant, but they shared a corridor with the Paris, and that was where all of the food and drinks were. There is a bakery in the corridor with the best croissants I have had in the states. All of the food we had at the restaurants in the corridor was outstanding. The pubs were hopping and everyone had a great time at all of the attractions in the resort. The location is perfect, because you are in the heart of the strip. The fountains of the Bellagio, the canals of the Venetian and, of course, all of the roller-coasters are within walking distance. All in all, I would recommend this to anyone who wants all of the amenities of staying at Paris, without blowing all of the budget on the room.

Reviews.Title: “Good room Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Matthew771
Reviews.Content: A lot better then the IP, (which is in another great location on the Strip). No frills, relatively inexpensive, close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Great price!”
Reviews.Author: VTer24
Reviews.Content: We made reservations for 4 nights through the Rewards program. You cannot beat the location! Check in was quick and the room was comfy tho a bit dated. Maid service was very good. No exorbitant resort fee! Casino leaves a bit to be desired in the area of minimums for table games and the lack of variety for slots, but The Paris is right next door via an indoor walkway. Overall, this was a very good place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Best Location in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Renfrewbud
Reviews.Content: 2 x 50 something ladies just back from 5 day break in Vegas where we stayed at Bally's. Despite some less than favourable reviews we decided to book as the price was amazing (booked through Last Minute.Com) and as I had stayed in Paris last time knew that Bally's was a good enough hotel. What a bargain - rooms were enormous and spotless. Bathroom great size and fully equipped with everything you need. Room was just as good as Paris if not better at half the price. Because we booked more than 2 nights breakfast was included and we had 9 dollars to spend at the coffee take away or sit in bar Nosh where the food was great. The location couldn't be better and as it is linked to Paris you can use all of their facilities. All in all a great choice. Take my advice don't waste your money on fancier hotels after all you are only sleeping in it - save the money for all the fantastic things you can do in Vegas !!!

Reviews.Title: “Right in the Middle of Everything”
Reviews.Author: BobWE
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the North Tower. The view was in the back of the hotel--ope but just OK. I should have requested the North Tower with a view of the strip. Many restaurants. Great staff. All of the casino games you can imagine. I organized a conference with about 200 attendees. The conference center on the 26th floor is "fantastic." Large rooms with great views. The sleeping rooms are large, clean and very quiet on the 12th floor. Wished that they had upgraded the standard tv sets to flat screens. The couch in the room was too soft (you sink in about 6 to 9 inches). The working desk was very convenient although more outlets would be appreciated. Also wished that you could watch the tv while working at the desk. Bally's is a short walk to the Paris Hotel next door which is nice. If you have a wheelchair be aware that the sidewalks leading into the Paris are cobbled and will bounce you around. All in all Bally's is a very nice hotel on the strip. Great staff, every game imaginable, clean rooms, and in the center of the strip. I would definitely stay here again. Oh--and did I mention that the room rates are very good for convention attendees but make your reservations early since the prices go up as rooms fill up.

Reviews.Title: “Bally's”
Reviews.Author: Spartacus2000
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel for the money and location. I'm a poker enthusiast, so I like the tournament that they have everyday. To put it very bluntly, there is nothing special about the place but we spent all of 4 hrs over 2 days in our room so it worked for us. Bottomline is I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Birthday celebration”
Reviews.Author: mel83OD
Reviews.Content: We booked a trip thru Southwest vacations in celebration of my birthday. We choose to stay at Bally's because the cost was reasonable and its located in the middle of the strip. This was my first trip to Las Vegas and we thought the hotel being centrally located was important. We didn't pay extra to upgrade our room but requested a higher floor with a strip view if possible. Upon checking in, the desk person asked if we were here for a special occasion. When I said it was my birthday trip, she offered to upgrade us to the North tower with a view. We were very satisfied with our room. It was on the 18th floor and provided a partial view of the Bellagio fountain show. The room was clean and honestly we were so busy we spent a minimal amount of time in the room anyways. I would recommend this hotel and stay here again if I return.

Reviews.Title: “The room was just fine!!”
Reviews.Author: rco000
Reviews.Content: We'd read the reviews before booking at Bally's thru TravelZoo, so our expectations were modest. Indeed, some of the furniture was warn and wallpaper was peeling off in the bathroom...but we were there to enjoy the sites and the buffet dinners, not to spend lots of time in the room. The rooms (910 and then 1610 for our second stop) were very large and clean. We heard a bit of conversation by our neighbors before we turned the air conditioner on (not auto, which means it recycles)...the result was white noise, which was fine for sleeping or watching TV. What a great deal we got thru TravelZoo...$56/nite for the room plus 2 buffet coupons, which have face values of $33 each (tho it must be easy enuf to find discounts). Bally's location was great, in the middle of the strip adjacent to Paris. Valet parking (really, the only way to go) was fast and free, tho tips are much appreciated (and expected...hey, it's a service job, after all). We'd return.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, again!”
Reviews.Author: starzz
Reviews.Content: We requested south tower 23rd floor because we love the view of Bellagio fountains and Eiffel tower. Room was very clean and large as usual. Appeared that the carpets had been recently cleaned, I tested it by walking around in white socks for quit awhile, I am happy to report NO dirty socks! Housekeeping was great and front desk was beyond pleasant and granted our requests. It seemed all the staff we came in contact with was happy and pleasant. Our floor was really quiet this trip, made for great sleeping when we slept. If your looking for glamour this is not that place, but if you want a clean and comfortable place to stay mid strip this is it! The gambling here treated us well, and we will return again and again.

Reviews.Title: “South Tower Room”
Reviews.Author: salo0061
Reviews.Content: This was my second time staying at Bally's. Check in on a Thursday at 9pm was under a 5 minute wait. The room was comfortable and clean. Last time i stayed in a North Tower room and this room was not much worse. There is still a coffee maker in the room the only downside was the tv's are outdated but I would definitely stay here again. There was never a wait for the elevator and there is an ice machine on every floor. The hallways are not too long like other hotels in vegas and i was able to sleep through the whole night without being woken up. Checkout was also easy since i checked out through the express checkout on the tv. Drink service in the casino was fast and they still have $3 draft beers at the main casino bar. I did a room tour on youtube which you can see with this link... http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3F5l47ebXzE

Reviews.Title: “What's worse than getting stuck in an elevator that smell like urine?”
Reviews.Author: Kslacks
Reviews.Content: The only thing worse than getting stuck in an elevator that smells like urine for an hour is: being billed $325 by Bally's for getting you out of their broken-ancient elevator... I refused to pay, was asked to leave; like I wasn't going to leave after that whole ordeal anyway. Other notes: my room was very dated (I think the tv had wooden panels) and the bathroom was filthy. The casino staff is great, the hotel staff is pityful, F minus.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Bally's”
Reviews.Author: tcgw
Reviews.Content: Just back from our 4 night stay at Bally's for my 30th birthday. So we arrived early at the hotel about 10.30am, we could check in but our room was not ready so we left our bags there and went to explore. We were offered an upgrade for an extra $50 a night which included a jacuzzi bath but we declined, we didn't go to Vegas to stay in our room. We arrived back at the room about 12.30 and we collected our keys and up we went we stayed in room 6621. It was big and had a lovely view of the Eiffel tower and we could also see the fountains at the Bellagio. The decor looks a bit dated but it served all the purposes. The room had an ironing board and iron, no tea/coffee making facilities, a big comfy bed, plenty of storage space and plenty of lamps. The bathroom was a good size, clean and plenty of towels. Our room was a no smoking room and we had no issue with smell of smoke from the casino. Bally's location is great, right in the middle of the strip and they have a variety of restaurants and bars in the casino. I would stay there again, it was reasonable priced, great location, and Don the bell man who looked after our bags was great he gave us tips on where to eat and have a drink.

Reviews.Title: “Good time on the strip”
Reviews.Author: kwhatley
Reviews.Content: Bally's is a staple on the strip. Location is good and casino is good - smokey like all the others. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “great location huge clean rooms...I'd stay again”
Reviews.Author: CubaFun123
Reviews.Content: I picked up a great deal on travelzoo 57 dollars per night and included an upgrade to the north tower and 2 buffet coupons per day. We used the coupons at PH and Paris.....nice. I expected a crap room and bedbugs. I was surprised! Huge clean room ( basic furniture and small bathroom) at no time did I feel I was slumming. Huge older strip hotel.....clean large rooms....old school casino but with all the latest slots that were loose...great craps dealers. I was there on business and it was perfect. If I were to go to Vegas with my wife for a weekend getaway.....I would probably stay at the Ph or Paris rather than ballys.

Reviews.Title: “Never go back”
Reviews.Author: foggie_12
Reviews.Content: It was my first time visiting in Vegas and staying at Bally's from Feb24 to 27th was a huge disapointment. I knew in booking there, we would be staying in an older hotel, but I was not prepared for the dirt of the room. The carpet was old and there was a huge white stain on it that looked like vomit that had dried but was never cleaned, just vacumed. In the bathroom the main control handle for the shower faucet was broken in half, still functional but not fixed. The lamp beside the bed had a broken on-off switch, as well as the radio was left to full volume with the alarm set to 5 am. What a way to wake up! The hallways have dirt all along the edges of the carpet. Upon entering an elevator there appeared to be a huge white glob that looked like someone had spit up. I've stayed in older hotels before so I know the cleaning of them can be managed. At Balley's, superficial cleaning is the only thing being done there. When we checked out days later, I asked to speak to someone in charge at the desk about the housekeeping. The woman I spoke to did not argue about what I was saying. She stated that carpet cleaning is the only tthing that would remove the stains I spoke of. In the end she indicated she felt that Balley's was only interested in aquiring properties, not maintaining them. At that point I stated I would never stay there again and would be passing my concerns along to this site. The only positive thing I would say about this hotel is its location. Great to visit the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “always been a good experience”
Reviews.Author: david l
Reviews.Content: our stays at ballys have always been enjoyable. it is not the most luxurious but it has been one of the best. we have stayed at other properties but we prefer ballys for the price and convenience and friendly staff. the north tower is newer and has nicer rooms but the south tower has the best views. special requests have always been honored. we have been able to get later checkouts whenever available. ask for a free upgrade and you may get it. it is also centrally located and within easy walking distance of shopping and attractions. ballys and paris are connected by a walkway which makes it very convenient. i mention this because our favorite place for breakfast is mon ami gabi restaurant in the paris.

Reviews.Title: “satisfied guest”
Reviews.Author: margarettemikyla
Reviews.Content: stayed there for 4 nights, had a good experience coming back

Reviews.Title: “Another satisfied stay at Bally's”
Reviews.Author: tofino8888
Reviews.Content: Visited Las Vegas during Feb 26 to March 1. In one of our previous visit, we stayed at Bally's north tower. At that time, we thought north tower is a better choice accomodation that the south tower. This time, we decided to stay at the south tower. Our assigned room was on the 16th floor (room number starts with 66xx). Excellent veiw from our room -- (Paris hotel, Eiffle tower and good view of the Bellagio water fountain). I think all rooms wtih odd number gets perfect veiw of the strip. The best feature of this hotel is the location - right in the middle of the strip. As expected, room is clean and the carpet and furniture show the years wear and tear from past. We discovered a great restaurant within ten minutes walking from the hotel - see my review of Ellis Island restaurant. Highly recommended to stay at Bally's.

Reviews.Title: “The Smoke Got to me...”
Reviews.Author: Northern_Hiker
Reviews.Content: I went to Bally's for a conference and took some extra vacation time to explore Las Vegas. If you are a gambler I suppose the environment would be OK but everything is geared towards having patrons go through their smokey casinos. I got a great deal to stay at the property and the rooms were large and spacious. I stayed in the North Tower which was nicely upgraded. One of the conference attendees stayed in the south tower and said it was pretty bad and run down. It is probably a Vegas thing but everyone in the hotel was on the hustle. The only information desk was located in the walkway connected to the Paris hotel and they were trying to sell some type of ticket package. It got pretty aggravating after a while. I rented a car and getting to the property was a challenge. Access to the property is not clearly marked and you definitely want to avoid the Strip when getting there. Self parking is a huge hassle as they want you to pay for Valet parking of course. You have to walk a long way from the self parking to the room. The TV in the room was the old tube type and hardly any available network channels to watch. Internet was $15 per day which is preposterous in this day and age. Once again I was feeling totally hustled as the property wants you down in the smokey casinos putting money into the slot machines. In the end, walking through the smokey casino to get to my room really got to me and made me sick. I wont be staying at this property by choice again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: CBD76
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights, the room was clean and spacious. Great pressure in the shower and nice hot water.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location BUT!!!”
Reviews.Author: pjm560
Reviews.Content: Despite the great location good resturants at reasonable costs in this older hotel there were negatives. First the positives: It's easy to go either North or South on the strip from here and also to go easily through the corridor to the Paris resturants, shops and lobby to the bus stops. Our lower lever rooms on a non-smoking floor in the North tower were quite clean , quiet, and well kept daily by the maids. Friends in the South tower were on a high level facing the street and had a good view. The hall carpet was a bit weary and worn but not filthy. The bathroom and beds were tops. The view non-existant(roof of adjacent structure). The Tequila Bar had great food at a very reasonable cost for this location, unfortunately they were not equipped tp provide take out breakfasts for guests leaving early on day trips or to catch flghts. The Sidewalk Resturant had a good breakfast buffet for 10.99. I do not gamble so do not know about the casino operations. The staff were friendly and polite with one exception. We wanted to have a senior solo friend moved to the room which connected to ours. The desk person flapped and went on and on about all the work this would create related to both the current solo guest's stay but also regarding a future guest scheduled to arrive in the room connected to ours. It was just a little too over the top when it would have made our lives so much easier. They were not guest focussed! The negative which concerned me was the billing situation where you had to give your Visa/credit card on arrival but never recieved retails of things charged as the hotel sent the bill daily to Visa without verification. On checking out at 0400 of our final day we were only presented with the bill for that day. No itemization was given, however when requested it was finally provided and we discovered several "daily errors" had been billed and we would never have known had we not been on the ball. For example an optional safe had been charged daily, we had never requested nor used the safe. A movie was charged to our room and several buffets from Paris resturants were also charged in error. The solution suggested was to contact the hotel during the day time hours to resolve the discrepancies. Friends leaving the same early AM were very pleased with their bill, only to be shocked when we told them of our experience with billing irregularities, they discovered their bill was for the final day only. They will be contacting the hotel for an itemized account of charges sent to Visa and reporting irregularities to Visa. A third friend who was a checked out after us overheard our comments then also requested an itemized account of the whole week finding the same kind of unsolicited charges we encountered. Due to this experience I would not recommend this hotel, as I consider what we experienced to be an intolerable business practice which I could never support regardless of the hotel positives, but others would have to make up their own minds. If you chose to use this hotel 1. be an alert and wary consumer, and 2. check your file at the main desk daily - forewarned is better than regret, as out friends would have simply wondered what the Visa charges were about if they noticed at all, as they do not always check their bill.

Reviews.Title: “Trip to Vegas”
Reviews.Author: cablemanSutherlin_OR
Reviews.Content: Got a good deal on Priceline for 2 days in Las Vegas. Nothing fancy, but clean, quiet, and served it purpose for those of us on a budget. Would go back there again. Easy check in and check out. Stayed on a Monday and Tuesday. Located on the strip,so access to all we needed.

Reviews.Title: “Ballys Fits the Bill for US”
Reviews.Author: Hstead
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed the Ballys. I have stayed here multiple times and I have decided that this may be our place from now on. It is centrally located. The layout is more than easy to navigate. It is nice to be able to walk over to Paris quickly. The dealers are great, always very friendly. The poker room is not bad and the players vary from ability to first timers to locals that make their living playing. I like the casino, higher ceilings. It is a little smokey but nearly all of them are. We were given an upgrade to a Jr. Suite with the $20 trick. We will go back. Clean, nice, price is great. Best value for your money I feel.

Reviews.Title: “What a dump-outrageous!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: happysally10
Reviews.Content: We were in Las Vegas recently and were truly repulsed by the state of the rooms in the South tower of this hotel.It's truly amazing the health department has not closed this part of the Hotel down.The carpet in the rooms and hallways were so filthy that you wouldn't dare step on them without some sort of covering on your feet.I do not blame the cleaning staff as they truly did the best they could in an area that needs to be gutted.The rooms need to be stripped and the whole interior redone for them to be livable.We will never return here and wish to caution people travelling to Vegas that this Hotel is a health hazard.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, middle of the action”
Reviews.Author: edma0012
Reviews.Content: This review comes from a first time Vegas visitor. My stay was the last weekend of February, 2012. Bally's is an older hotel, but it is clean with unusually large rooms (not just by vegas standards but by any standards), has some of the most affordable rates on the Strip and is located in a fantastic spot, right across the street from the Bellagio, right smack in the middle of the strip. For 54 dollars you can take a town car from the airport, stop by a liquor store, and cruise up the strip (1 hour total). There apparently are no drinking in public laws in Vegas, you can also drink in your cab/town car. They will drop you off right at the door. Unless you have large quantities of luggage, save the tip and ignore the bellhops. The check in counter is about 30 yards in the front door on your left side. There always seemed to be a line, but it went quickly and wasn't an issue. You would probably prefer the South Tour if you can get it, as it will potentially have views of the Fountains of Bellagio (which I found extremely enjoyable to watch). I stayed in the North Tower, and our elevators were fairly close to the front desk and casino area. I would say 50 yards maybe? If you've never been to Vegas (like Myself before this trip) the scope and size of everything is staggering. Everything is proportionally over the top large, so it was nice not to have to walk a mile to get to the elevators to my room. The casino at Bally's is clean and compact, fitting into one main room, it is much smaller than many of the other casino's and not as spread out. The sports book is done a flight of escalators in the back of the casino area, and down a hallway that resembles a mall. There is a sbarro's across the hallway from the sprotsbook. It's average at best, though it was posting fairly decent odds compared to Cesear's Palace across the street. Bally's is connected to the Paris hotel and there is a walkway from the bally's casino floor, that takes you through a simulated paris street, which I found very cool and right into the Paris casino which is way nicer, bigger and cooler looking than the Bally's floor. I didn't discover this hallway until the last night, but I would definitely consider Bally's again based on that easy access (assuming the price point for Bally's was low, as it usually is). I would recommend the Bally's Jubilee show. If you get comped tickets or 2-1's that is fine, don't pay extra high prices- I doubt the show sells out continually. We went to the Sunday night late show and got moved up to a table in front of the stage. I can confirm its definitely a topless show, at least parts of it are. I was entertained by the show's variety, though I would likely not see it again. Something to note, there is no Jubilee show on Fridays and the Saturday 730pm show is not topless. The theater entrance is in the middle of the casino. If you want to head across the street to Bill's Gambling Hall (its sorta a "dive bar" casino equivalent) I would highly recommend it, but I would use the side Bally's exit, and cross the street (not the strip) to get to Bill's- otherwise its a long walk involving various flights of stairs to get around along the strip. Bill's has 13.95 prime rib dinner 24/7. I can verify that at 230 in the morning, it was delicious. Didn't eat at Bally's. I viewed it more of a good centrally located place to stay, that was affordable with a nice big room. (Older TV and no fridge being the biggest knocks on the room). Now that I know which hotels/casinos are my style, I will probably seek them out for my next visit, but this is a good place for a first timer.

Reviews.Title: “Went downhill”
Reviews.Author: Lindsay T
Reviews.Content: My husband and I always stayed at Ballys.. it's the only place we have stayed at.. the first time we were there, it was great.. we had the best time.. the room was decent.. we walked over to Paris most of the time.. Bally's is more of an older crowd, which is fine.. we are in our early-mid twenties, but we would escape every now and then off to the strip.. we enjoyed the cheaper tables, laid back atmosphere, and Paris was right down the way with our favorite restaurant 'The Eiffel Tower'.. Anyways.. the last 2-3 times we stayed at Bally's we became very disappointed. Our room was pretty disgusting. Since we used our comps for a discounted rate, we ended up getting a nasty outdated room that was far from the casino.. we spent good money at Ballys, very good money.. We felt that if we purchased a nice room to begin with for our first stay, they would match the same room with our comps.. it was a big disappointment for us. The shower felt like we were being sprayed with a fire hose.. Service at the restaurants and bars have declined drastically. I had to go up to the window and get our own food that was sitting there waiting.. the waitress called from across the restaurant asking if we needed anything else.. that was pretty ridiculous. After the last time with our visit to Bally's we made a promise to ourselves that we would not come back again, and our money will be used elsewhere - where it is deserved.

Reviews.Title: “You can't beat it!”
Reviews.Author: Maryplus3
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this property 4 times now. Yes there are newer more impressive hotels which also cost a LOT more...but why would you pay for an expensive hotel room when you hardly spend any time there? Bally's is in the center of the strip so you can walk anywhere and everywhere which will reduce your cab costs as well. I was honestly impressed with the rooms. The hotel has been clean every time I've been there and the rooms are surprisingly large. It has a tunnel to Paris hotel and you get to use their pool which is very nice. For quick bites like breakfast or lunch i have eaten at their restaurant and the food is good. however for fancy dinners walk to one of the many nearby hotels that have 4 or 5 star restaurants to meet your needs. I truly love this place and don't think you can beat it. (I have stayed at MGM and New York New York...but the walks are horribly long especially if you want to go down by Mirage and others. by the time I was done with my adventure I always ended up taking a cab back cuz it was too far to walk!) oh yes....note to self: I have had a view of the strip every time and you can hear Bellagio's fountain music. I thought this was kinda cool but if you want to go to bed early (in Vegas?) make sure you ask for a room on the other side if possible. Fountains do now go all night so it was never an issue for me.

Reviews.Title: “Classic Vegas, prime position”
Reviews.Author: McGeepers
Reviews.Content: Room type; North Tower deluxe Beds; comfy Bathroom; clean and large Room size; large with a king bed, sofa, desk and chairs. Check in; Fast for a Ceasars brand hotel. Overall impression; It's an old casino but it is in the heart of everything, our room had a partial view of the strip, the room was grat value and the casino is easy to navigate. The only real knock on this place is the fact it has no real buffet to speak of.

Reviews.Title: “bally,s hotel”
Reviews.Author: maddogg26
Reviews.Content: stayed at the bally,s hotel is was a good hotel in the middle of the strip central for buses monorail shops everything had a great time would go back to this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Strip Secret”
Reviews.Author: Aretha W
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great experience, had my doubts but that was turned around. Our room was in the North tower, for it to be a standard room it was wonderful, I was fascinated with the view, the huge walk-in closet, and the bathroom, which had both a tub & shower. Due to its position on the vegas strip you were short walks away from Caesars Palace, Harrahs, Flamingo, Venetian, Palazzo, etc,etc mind you all in WALKING distance. I was spoiled throughout the entire atomosphere I could sleep, relax, gamble, party, eat, and SHOP under one room. If it wasnt for my adventurous nature i wouldnt need to have gone outside. Even held interesting conversations with Ballys staff and retail vendors.. Thank you BALLYS for a GREAT TIME. I do recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: Dr_Drew2
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel at something like $72+ tax/night with my total rewards card. I stayed Monday through Thursday and was given a room in the North Tower even though I booked the South Tower. The room was very nice and much nicer than expected. It's about the same as an MGM Grand room from about 7 years ago. One thing about the room is that because the windows are old, the room gets really hot if your room faces south like mine did. The air conditioning can't keep up. I can't imagine what it would be like in the middle of summer. Actually the room never felt all that comfortable. It was either stuffy or hot. It could've been my room though. It seems like this hotel gets a lot of convention/meeting business since it is connected to Paris. The overall experience here was good and it's a very good value especially since they don't charge the absurd Vegas resort fee. The location is great even though the hotel is a bit dated and tired. The shuttle to the Rio Hotel is convenient and runs every 30 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: Willlow13
Reviews.Content: A group of us stayed in Ballys and had a great time. The hotel is in an ideal location, opposite Bellagio, in the centre of the strip and it is also a stop on the Monorail line. There are more impressive hotels on the strip, but for the price we paid we were more than happy. We were in the North tower and didnt have a view of the strip, but who wants to look out of the window when you can go out and walk it? The casino was quite smokey, but the croupiers made up for it by being helpful and friendly. They even high fived you when you won a big hand and John, a pit boss, was kind enough to spent his tea break showing us how to play Craps. If you are looking to go for a romantic holiday then I would suggest one of the bigger hotels Bellagio, Caesars, Monte Carlo, etc. However, if you are wanting a decent hotel; in the middle of the strip; at a cheap price; then look no further than Ballys!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for the Strip”
Reviews.Author: MoBayGirl
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Ballys and I must say it was a good value for the strip. We usually stay at the Rio and were ready to give up the wow factor for a strip hotel but gladly that was not the case. We had a room in the North Tower with a very nice east view. You could see the sunrise and watch the planes coming into McCarran airport. If you want a strip view then a room in the south tower is your option. As far as we could tell few or none of the rooms in the North Tower have a strip view. The room was one of the Deluxe rooms. Do not go by the picture of the room from the Ballys web site, the room was much older and tireder than pictured. The carpet was stained as were the settees at the ends of the beds. The furniture was worn and the wallpaper obviously patched in several places. The bed was extremely firm but the linens were clean. Be sure to use that do not disturb sign, we saw several times where at 8:45am housekeeping was knocking, they only knocked times quickly, on peoples doors then throwing the doors open and yelling Housekeeping while folks were still in their beds asleep, not a nice way to wake up. The restaurants we tried there were good and the sidewalk breakfast at the Sidewalk Cafe was AMAZING. Enough breakfast for two so unless you have a BIG appetite plan on sharing this one. Sea Thai was also very good and we often eat Thai food and were were quite pleased with the portions and quality of the food served. The casino was a lot of fun and in the mornings they remembered what we were drinking and we were never left waiting for another. All in all I would stay at Ballys again it is a good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay !”
Reviews.Author: grahamd62
Reviews.Content: Just back from Vegas. Had a great time . Checked in at Bally`s Sunday night. Pool was closed for the season but we had the use of the pool at Paris (attached next door ) The room was dated but clean and quiet ( south tower ) and very roomy. Check in was quick , staff friendly and helpful. Great location in the middle of the strip. A great place to stay for a first visit !

Reviews.Title: “Bally's Las Vegas Stay”
Reviews.Author: eagleeye64
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Bally's during a conference. We received a room in the North tower; the room was clean but, somewhat dated. Towels were somewhat thin compared to normal towels we use resulting in it being soaked after a bath. The shower had plenty of pressure although the diverter (to send water from the faucet to the shower) did not fully engage. The toilet appeared somewhat slow but, there were no issues or problems noted. We reveived two really small bars of soap, one small bottle of shampoo anda small bottle of lotion each day. The staff was helpful and polite throughout the visit. Like most Vegas casinos, cigarette smoke in the casino was prevalent but, it was better than some places. Food was VERY expensive no matter where we ate. They have a S'barro's on the lower level but, even that was about $8.00 more than eating in Ohio. Drinks were also VERY expensive at all casinos with a domestic beer usually costing aroung $7-8 and margaritas costing $9 and up. Four drinks were regularly $32+ without tip anywhere on the strip! Since the Paris casino is connected, we also checked out food there and it was comparable in price. Pizza appeared to be cheapest. A burger nearby was about $10+. We parked in the parking garage in the Paris casino next door. The garage was free for self parking and appeared secure and safe at all times but, it was a bit of a walk to the North tower.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, priced right, good stay”
Reviews.Author: mommyinmotion
Reviews.Content: After much research, we settled on Ballys due to price and location--it is really in the heart of the strip!! We had previously stayed at the Paris and really liked it, but Ballys was about half the price, connected to the Paris by a tunnel, and the North Tower of Ballys has recently been renovated, and we figured we couldn't go too far wrong. We were right. The North Tower rooms (listed as "deluxe") were very large, nicely decorated, clean and comfy. I think they are about $20 more than the South tower's unrenovated rooms, but worth it. We had a room with a king size bed, and it included a table with 2 chairs, a small desk, a loveseat and coffee table, and a spacious bathroom, with nice granite tiles, counters and updated fixtures. We were on the 17th floor and had an obstructed view of the strip (we looked over the parking garage, but beyond that could see the New York, New York). The bed was comfortable and had 4 pillows. Even though we were there over the weekend, it was pretty quiet. Sure, you could hear people in the hall in the middle of the night as they went to their rooms, but I find that happens in just about any hotel. The staff was extremely nice, and housekeeping was good. The temp in the room was fine, water pressure and temperature were good, there really isn't anything I can find to complain about. Cable TV is included, but wi-fi is extra if you want it (I think about $12/day--we did not use). The room has a safe, but it also can only be used for a fee ($3, I think, we did not use this either). Bally's is part of many hotels that share an owner--the Paris, Caesar's, the Flamingo, Planet Hollywood to name a few--so we got a sheet of coupons good for different things at these places, but DEFINITELY get the free Total Rewards players card, which also covers all of these properties. In addition to other perks, we got a coupon book & $5 for the slots or tables to spend. Yeah, just $5, but any "free" money in Vegas is a plus if you ask me. I definitely recommend Bally's--ask for the North Tower!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Birthday Experience”
Reviews.Author: DFWdealTraveler
Reviews.Content: I have been to Vegas several times, but have never stayed at Bally's. I had found a TravelZoo deal for free dinner vouchers and a night stay for $56, so I decided to stay here for my birthday. The front desk was very nice and the lines were very quick. We stayed in the newly renovated room and it was very spacious, clean and large. More than enough room for two people, could fit like 6 people. The restaurants in the hotel are pricey but that is expected, however, there are many restaurants around the hotel. I would not recommend this for young couples, because all the shows and clubs are further down by Planet Hollywood, MGM, New York, Luxor and Excalibur. My boyfriend and I found ourselves constantly walking down their to party and watch shows. This hotel is predominately filling with older business people and older aged couples. The casino is not very large and card tables fill up quick. I really loved that it connected to Paris because we went their to eat everyday. Do try the Village Buffet at Paris or the Seafood Buffet at Rio. I always eat at the Ocean Bar and Grill at Planet Hollywood, $5 express lunch. Go see KA, O, and David Copperfield. If your on a couples trip and need some spice in your life, go see Zumanity aka Topless Cirque Du Soleis Show.

Reviews.Title: “Bally's Centrally located”
Reviews.Author: rjsdls
Reviews.Content: We decided to try this Total Rewards hotel since it was comped. Requested North Tower room and was pleasantly surprised by nice bath and decent room. Floor did have a black burn mark on it as soon as you entered along with a burn mark on sofa but nothing that was an issue. Room distance from strip was long but given we only made this trip once a day it wasn't an issue. We prefered the gaming floor at the Flamingo vs Bally's do to the variety offered. Centralized location is the main thing this hotel has going for it.

Reviews.Title: “good location good for price”
Reviews.Author: bigfatposterman
Reviews.Content: been to vegas over 15 times have stayed numerous locations from high end to low end. this was a last minute trip ballys offered medium to lower prices. the casino is good has live music in lounge, big enough so you dont feel cramped, the hotel was clean, lobby clean staff was great at check in, received upgraded re-done room which was clean and nice. best part is location mid strip cant beat it.. didnt eat anywhere inside but was great for what i needed and very central

Reviews.Title: “Bally's gets 2 stars for location and nothing else”
Reviews.Author: DianeLepore
Reviews.Content: I only stayed at Bally's because I was there for a favor to a friend. One night only in the South Tower. The room is big, the view was ok, BUT....the cleanliness in the bathroom was poor as there were hairs on the floor and in the tub. The shower tile was old and cracked all over. The grout was not white anymore and lacking in many places. The toilet leaked. There was pealing paint. The rugs were shabby. The furniture was old and the mattresses were hard. I forgot hair conditioner and they do not have any. They have conditioning shampoo, but i had a miserable time combing out my hair. I have stayed in a different tower at Bally's a few years ago and that room was much nicer and newer decor. Also, the security was not good. When we got off the elevator at 5am there was a drunk guy slumped in a chair in the elevator foyer. I guess I'm used to the Palazzo and the Venetian which is where I normally stay, and its safe because they check room keys before you can use the elevator, and the rooms are extremely nice and kept up. Bally's...you need to remodel and do some upgrades.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Renovated rooms worth upgrade price.”
Reviews.Author: Brian T
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival, we were given the option to upgrade to new renovated rooms, but decline. When we got to our room, we immediately changed our minds and upgraded. The un-renovated room had a lot of wear and tear, unpleasant odor and out-dated furniture. The renovated rooms were worth the price. Big rooms, big bathrooms, and the bed was very comfortable. The front desk personnel were very friendly. The hotel in general is in a good location, middle of strip and also close to the monorail.

Reviews.Title: “Another consistently "more than adequate" stay at Bally's”
Reviews.Author: racegrrl
Reviews.Content: This is our fourth stay at this property. We have been comped every time and have been upgraded from South Tower to at least North Tower everytime as well. This time we stayed in a North Tower regular room and it was large, clean and comfortable just as always. All staff members we encountered throughout the facility were friendly and accommodating. The location on the strip and the consistently good experiences here keep us coming back. The rooms are not fancy or super spectacular, but they are spacious, immaculate and more than sufficient. We were getting married during our stay there, and they were able to put my parents right down the hall from us, which was very nice and convenient. Though they charged them for the "upgrade" to the North tower and did not charge us.

Reviews.Title: “Convention Hotel”
Reviews.Author: smlhi
Reviews.Content: My husband, daughter and I booked the North Tower for a week in January 2012 during a convention my husband was attending. We had a much larger room than expected. The biggest problem was no coffee pot in the room for my husband who had to be at the convention very early, or for me when I would prefer to have coffee while getting dressed and watching the morning news. Otherwise, the hotel is in a good location, parking is adequate and free, lovely cafe's for breakfast, and good shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Bally's In Vegas = A Great Time!”
Reviews.Author: cityroute16a
Reviews.Content: Like most people, I want the best for the price. I don't mind spending a little more to get a little more. And I don't mind saving money and still getting a great deal. That is Bally's. If you want the Bellagio or Wynn, don't read anymore. If you want a place that is centrally located, clean rooms with ammnenities, good food, and gambling to satisfy the most ardent player, stay here. The staff is helpful and competent. Upgrades are possible and please thank them when they do. My wife and I have been there several times to Vegas. We have stayed at Bally's the past three times. We stayed at Planet Hollywood, Paris, and The Mirage. Bally's is better. Take the overall picture and you see the best bang for the buck is Bally's.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased with value and customer service”
Reviews.Author: sueblue02
Reviews.Content: I stayed here twice within the past year and one time my friends and I got here late and they upgraded us to a suite! The suite had a hot tub and gorgeous bathroom area, it must have been at least 1,000 square feet! I like that it is walking distance to earl of sandwich and ellis island casino, my two favorite places to eat in vegas. The second time I kindly asked the staff upon check in if I can have a north tower room and they upgraded me.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value With Superb Location - Go For Upgraded Room”
Reviews.Author: RJP33
Reviews.Content: This place is value – it’s got almost the best location in Vegas, right in the middle of the strip with all the major attractions in walking distance, the rooms are nice and restaurants are good. Feels like you’re staying in a nice hotel without a huge outlay and you can walk straight through to Paris and other hotels should you wish. I would recommend you go with the upgraded north tower deluxe rooms as from our past experience some of the south tower rooms were a little tired. Great value in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money - Staff needs a make-over”
Reviews.Author: KartikSharma29
Reviews.Content: So let me start with the downside first Downside: 1. Check-in Staff was highly rude - never seen a frontdesk staff talk so rudely thats the first impression one gets on the hotel. Sarcastic - cocky expressions . 2. Lobby area is very confusing - there is no designated travel desk 3. NO KETTLE IN THE ROOM - i have traveled to most part of the world - all hotels give you a kettle of coffee sachets etc . Upside : 1. Good size of rooms (North Tower) 2. Clean bed linen - improves quality of sleep 3. Proximity to the strip 4. Lobby is always very lively -bustling with action - Live band

Reviews.Title: “Great room, clean, central location!”
Reviews.Author: 1yummymommy
Reviews.Content: Nothing wrong with this room! Got a great rate and an upgrade suite for free. Took a day or two for me to realize we were sleeping on a Murphy bed. Still comfy. That's a lot, coming from an experienced business traveller used to 4-5 star hotels. Room spacious and clean and well serviced. Showerhead could be upgraded but no issues. Really great housekeeping staff. Fantastic location, central to anywhere you'd want to go.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent First Stay at Bally's”
Reviews.Author: Alex W
