Reviews.Content: This was my husband and I's first time in Las Vegas and after booking Bally's back in October and then reading reviews on Trip Advisor I was a bit worried! I am happy to say that my worries were for nothing and we had an excellent stay. Upon arrival we were checked in very quickly and were upgraded to the North Tower room free of charge. The room was very nice, clean and very minor signs of wear. We didn't have much of a view but we didn't come to Vegas to sit in our room. The Hotel is close to everything and it is a nice bonus that it is connected to Paris, we ate there several times. The monorail located in the hotel is super convient and made it easy to go to either end of the strip. Although this hotel does not have any major attractions like some of the others on the strip it was a great value for the money and I would stay there again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “crappy but if you want a cheap room in the heart of the strip, AWESOME!”
Reviews.Author: justin q
Reviews.Content: Dont stay here if you are concerned with nicities such as new furniture, clean smells and wall paper that is on the wall. Stay here if you are going to vegas to party and drink your face off. Super cheap and close to the hotels that you want to go to. You dont really do anything in your room anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Fun in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: PamWpg
Reviews.Content: Bailey,s is a nice hotel for a very good price. It has a comfortable feeling, is very clean, friendly, and fits the bill while in Vegas. We asked for an upgrade, and received one Free as it was my husbands Birthday. The staff was very friendly, the beds clean & comfortable, and the location on the strip was Great.

Reviews.Title: “Run-of-the-mill facility . . .”
Reviews.Author: tripilot
Reviews.Content: We selected Bally's Las Vegas for it's location and price, not so much for any other reason. A quick check-in on Wednesday 1/18/2012 at about noon was appreciated. We were upgraded at no additional cost to the north tower and received a non-smoking room. The room was as expected and nothing more. The two complaints I have are: 1. The smoke from the casino floor reached into out room on the 7th floor and, that was, needless to say un-pleasent. On subsequent nights I placed a used, damp towel at the bottom of the door and that helped to some extent. 2. Each time we would move about, to and from our room or around the lobby area for any reason, we were "smothered" by representatives of the Wyndham Group, pitching time-shares. "Not interested, again!" If I were asked to give put a rating based on a scale of 1 (least) and 10 (best), I would rate it a 5 and my Wife rates it a 6. As an aside, we travelled the not-too-far distance to the Trump hotel, which is a non-smoking facility - It's beautiful! After checking rates for certain dates I found that it netted out at only $22.00 more per night. If that sounds like a lot and you don;t need a casino downstairs, go to Trump and ask see a room. You will be so impressed. One last item at Bally's and, I have no one to blame but myself for this. The daily internet access charge is per device. Not good considering my Wife and I have between us three devices we use. That'll never happen again - lesson learned.

Reviews.Title: “Oldie but Goodie”
Reviews.Author: paul b
Reviews.Content: Great location on the strip, the venerable property is just fine for a short stay. Remolded tower may give up views for quiet but that works well. Nothing glitzy in room but a good sleep (beds and bedding not like home but ...what is? except Heavenly Beds) Casino is OK but definitely visit neighboring property sites. The stage show has been there for years but is still vintage topless Vegas. Employees tried hard to make us feel special and shuttle and bus stops are most convenient. Overall pleased with the stay. Good elevators, tour guides etc but I guess I will never get used to the smoke, anywhere in this town.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value on Strip”
Reviews.Author: eco6
Reviews.Content: Good Value for the location on the strip, next to Paris and across the street from the Belligo.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable Strip Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tommy C
Reviews.Content: We liked the Hotel but we like Fremont better - rooms and casino was nice and excellent if you consider the price!

Reviews.Title: “Good but not great in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: captaindaveny
Reviews.Content: As soon as I walked in the door I was overcome with cigarette smoke. I forgot that you can still smoke in casinos in Vegas and at Bally's they do. A LOT. I had never stayed there before and i was in town for an event and that was one of the hotels connected with the event. Overall, you can't say anything bad about the place, but then again, there is not much you can say great about the place. To compete in Vegas today you need to update and upgrade and they haven't. The casino looked dated and was heavy with smoke. There is not much in the way of shops and restaurants there so you have to go somewhere else. My room was a single kid bed and there was space, but the old 22 inch tv got like 8 channels in English and wasn't very good. They charge $14 a day for internet service, pretty outrageous if you ask. My room was clean and serviceable, but not anything to get excited about. the good parts - excellent mid-strip location. The Paris is a much nicer property and connects. The Flamingo with the Margaritaville Cafe and Casino is a block away. Caeser's is across the street. and Planet Hollywood is just next door to Cabo Wabo. So if you are looking for a cheap hotel room in a good location Bally's will work for you. Also, i had a car and the parking staff was great.

Reviews.Title: “No dissappointment here”
Reviews.Author: MNM7
Reviews.Content: Stayed here Feb. 7-11th. Budget minded travellers looking for a good location. There were 8 of us in the group - half spent the majority of the time gambling, half sight seeing. Worked out great for all of us! Rooms Check-in was a breeze. (arrived around 5pm on a Tueday). We had room 6112, with the $25 upgrade for the roman soaking tub. Um yeah, husband thought this would mean hot tub and really it's just a big bath tub but it did suit his needs as he needed to soak his aching legs after walking all day. And better yet, the room had a single serve coffee maker so we could each enjoy a cup of coffee while getting ready each morning. The room was dated and there were some stains on the carpet but overall it seemed clean. Tons of space, dual vanities, two big closets, walk in shower, toilet stall and a fancy little drinking fountain (oh wait, that was a bidet). Others in the group had the standard room and enjoyed views of the fountains. Some complained of the noise - but in our room we didn't hear a peep. We had a view of Bill's Gambling Hall :) Casino The casino was decent size but small enough that we could find the other members of our group. I even hit an $800 jackpot while there and another member of our group won $900! Sign up for the players card and they give you $5 free play and you'll receive discounts at the shops, including the ones at Paris (probably other sister properties but we didn't do much shopping). Eats & Drinks Had a couple of meals at the Tequila Bar. Husband enjoyed their burger and I loved the $2 tacos and $2 margaritas. We even attempted the nacho platter one night to soak up some booze - should have waited until all 8 of us were there as we couldn't even put a dent in it. Very yummy but HUGE! There were also restaurants downstairs by the shops. They closed at 11 but we did managet to hit up Nathan's one night (look for buy one get one 50% off coupons), and the hot dogs and cheesesteak were good. Several people in our group ate at Nosh and enjoyed their food from there (right by the elevators to the rooms). Location, location, location This is the biggest draw in my opinion. The location was perfect, center strip. Close enough for Bill's drink and breakfast specials, O'Shea's frozen Bailey's, and not too far from Ellis Island's cheap meals (though we never made it there). Right across from the Bellagio fountains and a hop, skip and jump to Caesar's Palace if you're looking for some fancy shopping. Bally's is connected to Paris which has even more fun to offer. At check in we received coupons, including a 2-4-1 ride on the Eiffel tower where we viewed the Bellagio fountain show from the top of the tower at night - very cool. And the casino at Paris was fun too, great music playing there. Also enjoyed the trip to the Sugar Factory and bought souvenirs using our discount from the players card. Overall, this hotel worked out great for our group as it had something for everyone and wasn't so huge that we couldn't find each other when necessary. It's not fancy, so if that's what you're looking for keep looking. But the price was right and I would be happy to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, good location”
Reviews.Author: andylong76
Reviews.Content: My brother and I stayed here for three nights a couple of weeks ago. The rooms aren't anything to write home about, but they are clean and I thought the bed was comfortable. This was fine, since the only thing we did here was sleep. I'm a member of their rewards club and even though I don't gamble a lot we were able to stay a Friday, Saturday, Sunday night for just under $70 night. I thought this was pretty good for being in the middle to the strip. I felt we were close to everything we wanted from here being right across from Bellagio and Ceasar's and connected to Paris. We spent most of our time at Harrah's just down the way. With the piano bar and carnival court it was a pretty fun spot to hang out!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel Stay”
Reviews.Author: Evelyn S
Reviews.Content: We stayed here end of January, 2012. We arrived much too late to get a room in North Tower, so we spent first night in south tower. The next 3 days we moved to the North tower, and room was excellent, very large. Very clean with great view of the Bellagio fountains. What a view. The best thing about the rooms was we could not smell any smoke at all !!! The beds were fine, nice linens, towels, etc. We could not hear any street noise at all. Bally's has the best bands that we love and many people were dancing and having a great time. We of course, were playing slots, close to the band so we could see and hear and enjoy. And we had the best cocktail waitress in Las Vegas,((Liz)) She was absolutely awesome, very pleasant and present. We really appreciated her, and tipped her well, as she is very deserving. We have stayed at many hotels and visited many more, playing at all, and I must say some hotels have cocktail waitresses that really don't like their jobs. And some hotels where you hardly ever see a waitress. We will definetly be back. All the staff was very pleasant and helpful. And the shops downstairs are varied and reasonable. We had a car and valet parking is the best. We have absolutely nothing but praise for this gem of a hotel. Make sure to sign up for a rewards card and use it in every machine as you accumulate points for future promotions !

Reviews.Title: “One of the better places to stay in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: shoredude2
Reviews.Content: We usually go out to Vegas twice a year. I was pleasantly surprised by Bally's. The room was large. The furnishings were new. And the view was good. The staff was excellent. The beds were comfortable. The location is central (although the parking garage isn't easily accessible from the street). I'll probably stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby”
Reviews.Author: gary1801
Reviews.Content: After scoring a Travelzoo coupon for $59 a night we booked a 3 night getaway, we also felt we got lucky when an airline we never flew before “Spirit” had a sale. Spirit Airlines will require a separate review. A coupon/groupon is only worth it when a customer feels they really received value for what they paid and our stay at Balleys was not the case. The good, the ONLY good was Ballys location in the very middle of the strip. The room was very large but all the furnishings where worn and shabby, no mini refrigerator, an iron but no ironing board, no coffee maker, a spongy soft, thin mattress, limited channels on an old school TV with poor reception and wifi for $15 per day. I would feel a lot better if I had paid $29 a night for the lack of amenities and comfort at this hotel but thinking back I have to say I would not return even at ½ the price I paid. I you like the retro feel and I don’t mean in a good way, book a stay at Ballys but shoot for under $29 a night so you can at least say you got what you paid for. I should have listened to my brother and brother-in-law.

Reviews.Title: “Our stay at Bally's”
Reviews.Author: cyndy5
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at Bally's.Check in was fast, check out was fast. The room was just fine. Yes you pay for the safe, but there is no resort fee and the price for the room was great. The staff is attentive and polite. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Yikes”
Reviews.Author: coqueliquot
Reviews.Content: I stayed here before and had no complaints. I think the quality of the rooms varies widely, which is why some reviews are great. This time I stayed in the South Tower Grand Suite. The picture on the Bally website shows a spacious room, King size bed, bench at the foot of the bed, arm chairs. When I arrived, I found that the carpeting was washed out from way too many cleanings with ripples all over the room. The bench at the foot of the bed was missing, the chairs were stained, the shower door was falling apart and had to be coaxed just so to close, the grout in the shower was moldy, the wall paper seams were separating everywhere. The furniture was chipped, the table was covered with scratches and what appeared to be glue residue. Some of the lamps had switches that only worked if you jiggled them just so, and the lighting was so bad that it was almost impossible to apply makeup. The lighting near any of the mirrors was just too weak. It was a nice touch to put a phone into the bathroom, but the receiver was damaged and felt like it was going to fall apart while I was talking on it. There was not much water pressure, and the "hot" water was not hot. Jeez, are those enough complaints? I felt like I was in a very large Motel 6 room (I have stayed in Motel 6 rooms that were better than this), and had to pay through the nose for it. I complained at the front desk but didn't want to change rooms for just one more night, so they gave me a (small in my opinion) discount, which was better than nothing. The person I spoke with just said: oh yeah, the rooms need "updating".... Needless to say, I will not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for great value”
Reviews.Author: biendad
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at Bally's. The pool area was relaxed and service was prompt, unlike my previous stay at the Flamingo. Our room faced the Bellagio Fountains and was clean and comfortable. The location of this hotel is wonderful as it is right in the heart of the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Thanksgiving 2011”
Reviews.Author: saitken69
Reviews.Content: Our annual thanksgiving trip to vegas - this time with only four of us. We reserved a South Tower Grand Suite. The kids had a South Tower regular room. Our Suite was ready when we arrived around noon. Their room was on our same floor but was not ready yet. We hauled our gear and stored it in the suite while we hit the gaming floor. Their room was still not ready at 4pm, but they took a room one floor down that was. In retrospect, for checking out purposes, I think they wished they would have just waited for their original room! Bally's was, as usual, a great place to stay and to game. The grand suite is nice - sure it's dated, but that doesn't bother us. The sunken tub is my favorite feature in the room. My husband enjoys having his own sink/counter and closet. One thing we do miss at Bally's is the Big Kitchen Buffet. It used to be our favorite buffet on the strip. Then they closed it. boo. The cafe isn't a great place for breakfast - I've only ordered from the limited menu - never done their $10.95 "buffet" but it is not a place we say "Hay, I'm craving food from the cafe, let's go eat". We'd rather drive or shuttle to Rio for the Carnival World buffet. We've already booked the same type of room for Thanksgiving 2012!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!”
Reviews.Author: LV_PHX
Reviews.Content: I checked out all the reviews for Bally"s before my trip, there must be something that I missed because I had zero problems during my stay and I was there for 3 nights. The staff was great they were are friendly and answered all of questions, nothing came up missing, and like I said no problems.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: hotelguest1982
Reviews.Content: Nicer than Flamingo or Harrahs. Ballys is cleaner, less smoke, better clientele and central location. Old tvs and rooms look outdated. Good value for price.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious!”
Reviews.Author: winnerManitoba
Reviews.Content: We have never stayed at Bally's before, however, as a Total Rewards member who receives comps, we were very pleasantly surprised by the extremely spacious room we were given on the 24th floor this trip. Although we didn't face the "strip", the room was clean, the king size bed quiet comforable. But more than anything the room was huge! We found it comparable to the rooms at The Paris, getting older obviously, but still very functional. Also, much better then the last comped room I received at The Flamingo a couple of years ago.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: LovesWeekends
Reviews.Content: We were attending a convention off site and Ballys was one of the participating hotels for the event. This made it very convenient as there was shuttle service to and from the convention and the pick up area was very close to the hotel elevators. The nice thing about Ballys was it's just the right size, didn't have to walk a mile to get to the places we needed to in the hotel. We ate at the Sidewalk Cafe for a nice quick breakfast and Ichiban for dinner. Both restaurant's service was very friendly, priced right and delicious. Carrie at the front desk was very accommodating and friendly when we checked in. She made a very pleasant first impression of the hotel. Even the bell desk employees were helpful in providing directions out on the strip. We would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “vegas baby”
Reviews.Author: cjstrips101
Reviews.Content: loved the hotel and close to alot, walking distance. love the shops and next to good hotels to browse too. great room very nice and remodeled, spacious. nice pool , very large, plenty of chairs when searching for ones together.

Reviews.Title: “Large and spacious rooms”
Reviews.Author: officematt
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the North Tower and the rooms were large and appeared to have been recently renovated. Good price for mid-week for 3 of us. Central to everything. I would book this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “So So”
Reviews.Author: Yzhctur R
Reviews.Content: Room: Just fine. not really awesome but its good for budget travellers Location: perfect ( on las vegas strip) Service: So so

Reviews.Title: “This is the penthouse?!??”
Reviews.Author: kadels_s
Reviews.Content: Staying in one of the penthouse suites. We have stayed in several of the other suites. The penthouse is impressive-looking, but upon closer inspection it was one frustration after another. I could see stains and other people's hair under the top sheet. We had to call maintenance to fix a TV, the safe, and the shower head. Also, standing in 2 inches of cold dirty water while taking a shower is not fun. On the bright side, maintenance was always friendly and helpful. Room is extremely spacious.

Reviews.Title: “Nicer than I expected!”
Reviews.Author: diaworld
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 977 in the North Tower. We were told it was no view, but it was actually a north facing strip view of the Venetian, Wynn, etc. Rooms have been recently re-done and all was fine. Nice large sitting area with sofa. Definitely would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: Thelma75
Reviews.Content: We arrived very late on a Friday night for a 6 night stay and there was only a room by the elevators left. Seems like we had a rollercoaster in the walls... We froze all night despite the heating unit and at 2am, the smoke detector started emetting loud bips. We asked for additionnal blankets in the morning and were offered another room instead without even asking. It was a lot quieter. We even had a view on the Bellagio foutains, talk about and upgrade! Checking in and out was quick and easy. Very good service. The cons are a 14$/ day for wifi and 3$/day for using the safe.

Reviews.Title: “Middle of strip”
Reviews.Author: vicki_kilroy
Reviews.Content: Had a great time at Ballys Las Vegas. Rooms were comfortable and clean. Casino is situated centre strip so it was great exploring other casinos like Paris and Caesars Palace also. The monorail takes you up and down the strip and we were fortunate enough to have a station close by at Paris Casino. All in all a great stay and a very reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Trip”
Reviews.Author: vegasfan19
Reviews.Content: Bally's has become my "go to" hotel when staying in Vegas. Nice rooms, good casino, and good restaraunts. I'm not a shopper, but they have places to pick up some things to bring back home if that's your thing. It's central location make it a great value too. Sign up for the total rewards and you'll soon be staying for free. It's also connected to Paris via an indoor walkway, so it's two casinos/restaraunts in one. If they are all booked, try Flamingo.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: MONIKAMS
Reviews.Content: Very nice location, in front of Bellagio and next to Paris. Unfortunatelly the strong smell of cigarrets.

Reviews.Title: “Center of the strip”
Reviews.Author: netlie
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Bally's Jan. 15-19th 2012 started with a quick and curtious check in. We were up in our room in no time looking out over Paris and the Bellagio fountains. Once we got settled in we found our safe did not lot. After a trip to talk to the front desk, they had a security worker in to check it within the 1/2 hour and once confirmed it didnt' work they moved us to a new room which seemed to be a little cleaner and now our view was of Ceasars Palace and the Flamingo (and just a peak again of the Bellagio fountains). Rooms were decent, tidy and comfortable. We chose this hotel because of it's proximity to the strip. We were central to both ends of the strip and had no problem walking from Mandalay bay right up to Circus Circus. Casino are was clean, the bar servers were cheerful and available which made for some fun entertainment. We had a chance to see their Jubilee Showgirls Show and were pleasantly suprised at the production, the stage changes and the quality of the show!!! This was your classic, as you think of Showgirl show! Lots of singing, dancing, costume changes, full out set changes that were amazing. Very well done. They even have their version of the Price is Right...we saw it with Joey Fatone. Fun! Our favorite hang out was the Tequila Bar and Grill, good eats, fun atmosphere, and lots of drink and fun. We also had a meal at the Sidewalk cafe and it was reasonable meal and atmosphere. Would I stay here again. Probably, because of it's location. We felt safe and and moving through the facility was easy. All in all a good spot.

Reviews.Title: “Bally's Once Again”
Reviews.Author: slashba
Reviews.Content: This was my 4th trip to Las Vegas and staying at Ballys. It was once again a pleasant experience with a quick, friendly check in (11am) and nice North Tower room. My rooms have always been comped and have always been in the North Tower. This one was by far the nicest view. 14th floor with a nice partial view of the Bellagio fountains and strip. Once again the room was a nice size, clean, and well stocked with towels. My only complaint would be the pillows. I'm used to the huge, fluffy, soft ones at Ballys in Atlantic City and these were somewhat hard, flat and lifeless. You can't go wrong with the location. Pretty much center strip within walking distance of many other large and small casinos and shopping. There is a little casino/store across Flamingo Ave (north entrance) that is great for picking up a six pack, sodas or what ever little necessities you may need and don't want to pay an arm and a leg for in the Hotel store. Catch the Deuce bus either in front of Paris or Flamingo for $7 (24 hours) and head to Fremont street or the many other stops along the way. There is also the monorail station, but that can get expensive at $5 a ride. They also offer a free shuttle that runs every half hour over to the Rio Hotel and Casino which is also part of the Caesars total rewards family. The Carnival Buffet at the Rio was excellant. Once at the Rio you can catch the shuttle back to Ballys or over to Harrahs on the strip. In the coupon book they give you at check in, one of the coupons is a buy one, get one for the Car Collection at the Imperial Palace. If you are a car lover this is a real treat at $8.95 for two people. Bring your check book as most of the cars are offered for sale. Across the street is Bill's Gamblin Hall. They have good beer specials and a free Elvis show that can't be beat. There is a one drink minimum and get there early as it does get crowded. I think shows were 3pm, 5pm and 7pm 3 or 4 days. I understand that you can transfer comp dollars earned at Bill's to your total rewards account so sign up for a card. It's a fun little casino with good drink service a great Prime Rib special. The Tequila Bar and Nosh are great little places to catch a bite to eat. Beware of the Nachos Grande at Tequila Bar! They are excellant but they are indeed GRANDE!! $2 Tequilas ($3 strawberry), great burgers, pulled pork sandwiches and cole slaw. Nosh has fabulous sandwiches on fresh baked breads. We ate breakfast twice at the Sidewalk Cafe out of convenience. It's ok for eggs over easy, hash browns and toast, but nothing at all special. We passed on the buffet after having had it in previous visits. Service however is fast and friendly. The Indigo Lounge is right by the Tequila Bar on the casino floor and offers music nightly with an enjoyable live band that will make you want to get up and dance a bit. Not necessarily for the younger crowd but 40's on up will really enjoy it.

Reviews.Title: “December vacation”
Reviews.Author: Rosa1
Reviews.Content: Overall, this is a great hotel, the rooms are big and very comfortable, the only bad thing about the rooms is that the walls are too thin and you can hear what is going on in the room next door if they watch tv on high volume. The casino is very nice. The lines at check in were very long, I think because most of the guests asks for an upgrade or they have special needs. The only problem we had was that I called before our arrival and asked if they charge for holding packages and someone told me not, and when I checked out we had a total of 100 usd charge for the packages. The best thing that this hotel has is LOCATION!!!

Reviews.Title: “Upgrade to suite”
Reviews.Author: Balls99
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a short trip to Vegas and stayed at Ballys. We upgrades to a suite for an extra $122Cdn for four nites and we had a great room. My wife also has a need for a refrigerator which was comped for us for her medication. The room was in the south tower and was very quiet and well appointed and exceptionally clean.

Reviews.Title: “North Tower not so renovated!”
Reviews.Author: mikerot
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews for Bally's on numerous sites before booking there. From what I had gathered the North Tower was the place to stay since it was newly renovated. So I called Bally's and was able book 3 nights North Tower Deluxe (Thurs,Fri,Sat) for $299. I was pretty excited since the online rate was much higher than that, I was able to negotiate a North Tower Deluxe for the same rate as the the South Tower Deluxe. At check-in, I ask the gentleman if he might be able to upgrade me to a suite, he checked and was nice enough to "upgrade" to a Junior suite. I tipped the gentleman $40...Now I am extremely excited..got an upgrade to a suite, let the festivities begin...We open the door to our room and were really shocked. Renovated??? Well, maybe....when Bush Sr. was in office.. The Bed was huge...but was the thinnest we had ever slept on..but it wasn't horribly uncomfortable. It was decent. The carpet was extremly worn as well as the wallpaper and popcorn ceilings. On a postive note the bathroom was nice and the it also had a sink and mirror for your wife to put her makeup on while you are in the shower. Bottom line is....it's not horrible but it's not average either..If a Holiday Inn were a 4 this place would be a 1.5. If I could get the same room for 40 dollars or less per night I would stay there again but if not, I would pay the extra money to stay somewhere else...

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Old room”
Reviews.Author: Traveler62001
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Bally's for the weekend, and had a so-so experience. The staff was great - very helpful and friendly. The location was also great! We did not eat at any of the restaurants, or go to any of their shows, so I can't comment on those. The room, however, was so old and outdated. They definitely need to remodel the rooms. They are surprisingly large, which was nice, and we had a partial view of the Bellagio fountains (which we were not expecting). Overall, this is not a bad hotel - but if you want the luxurious Vegas experience - stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great stay!”
Reviews.Author: pinkykt05
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights on our trip to Las Vegas. It's right in the middle of the strip, so it's convenient if you're there to see the sights of Las Vegas. We had a basic room, we could see New York New York from our window. It was spacious and comfortable. Really not a lot is needed when you're staying in Vegas, although a fridge would have been nice. Check in and check out went smoothly, and we got some good discounted prices. The hotel is connected to the Paris hotel, so a short walk gives you some brand new scenery. The monorail stops at Bally's so if you're tired of walking from hotel to hotel, it's easy to hop on the monorail and get to either end of the strip fairly quickly. One of the negatives for me was that you have to pay extra to use the fitness center... Other than that everything was great! There's even a mexican restaurant where you can get $2 tacos and $2 beers. I'd recommend Bally's as a place to stay because of the convenient location, and the value.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for good value”
Reviews.Author: jgr83
Reviews.Content: Ballys is an old hotel. But its also cheap, with a great location, large rooms... Would stay here again, in vegas you dont spend that much time in the room anyways...

Reviews.Title: “So Disappointed after all these years!!!”
Reviews.Author: redjet
Reviews.Content: We were terribly disappointed with our lates stay at Bally's, while always one of our favorites due to its decent room size, affordability and most importantly location on the strip. This however, will be our last stay there. We were only able to stay for a night and we were graciously 'upgraded' to a Jr. Suite on the 15th Floor in the south tower. We entered our room to find it was very large, however a bit too large for the furniture. The bed was one one wall and the tv/work desk was a good 20 feet away. They could have put in a nice couch or seating area, and rearranged a bit, it was odd. The bathroom, sunken tub was odd as well. The tub was set right in the middle of two walkways...one to the toilet and one to the bdai...sp??. With mirror all around...it was creepy!! The room had beach stains on the carpet, the light was falling out of the ceiling and the grout in the shower and bathroom tile was gross. The worst was that it was pretty fithy. The floor of the bathroom was dirty with hair and other things. I took towels to 'sweep' off the floor and put them under my feed. Other than the general disrepair, it was in need of a huge overhall. It was pretty 80's dated, Cesars Entertainment needs to step up and renovate similar to what the MGM properties have done. Sad that after so many years here, they have let it go to crap...

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Muriel S
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights. Valet parking was great, room service was the best and service was wonderful! definitely returning! :)

Reviews.Title: “Better than last time”
Reviews.Author: SiteCer
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at Ballys for a business trip. I stayed at another hotel last time (this conference is held in Las Vegas annually). I decided to go back to Ballys because it's dependable and reasonable. This stay was better than my last one a couple of years ago. The room was spacious and very clean. The staff was extremely helpful. The water pressure was great and there was always hot water. I decided to back to Ballys because it's generally a dependably middle-of-the-road hotel and I was not disappointed. If the rates remain reasonable, I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Third time was better then other two.”
Reviews.Author: lorimann
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Excalibur, and the Luxor and this time we stayed at Bally's and with its location it was far better then the other two. Was upgraded when we got there. Says there were a charge if we used the safe but was never charged. The staff was wonderful and our room was very large and clean. I'm sure it is not as glamerous as say Cosmo or the Plazzo but hey I would stay there again. Use your Totalrewards card it comes with great perks. Planning another trip. Guess it will be a christmas present for now on.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: kayjen
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the North Tower. From our window, we could see the back side of the strip. It was beautiful in the evenings with all the lights! The room was very clean, spacious, comfortable bed, nice sitting area to watch TV or read, and a comfortable desk & chair. I would highly recommend this hotel to everyone! Bally's is connected to the Venetian which is very convenient. Check in/out was quick and easy. Employees and housekeeping were so courteous. The positives of this hotel is absolutely endless. We would not hesitate to come back to Bally's! Rate A+. Trust me...you will NOT be dissappointed!!

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievably disapointing”
Reviews.Author: randy623
Reviews.Content: I go to vegas every year for 7-9 days for a large industry conference. When I found out I could get a grand "suite" for about half the cost of what my employer was booking, I was thrilled. I've always tried to stay and gamble at Harrah's family properties....don't think I'll be returning here. The good: Bally's is in a prime location. Right in the middle of the strip, walking distance to most places. The room was clean. Maintenance and housekeeping were very responsive and polite. I was impressed with that. Other than that... The bad: I feel cheated. I feel stupid. And I don't like places that make me feel this way. The website shows the Grand suite as a gorgeous room with an in room jacuzzi (only available in the north tower I came to find). I booked over the phone and believe (I can't be positive) I was told this. When I inquired about getting the same room in the north tower (after reading trip advisor reviews) I was told there were none available. I can live with that, ok. Fair. I was offered a junior "suite" in the North tower. When I inquired about an in room jacuzzi, like I thought I was getting with my original room, I was told that there wasn't one in either room. The picture on the site was simply a sunken tub. Really????? Who on earth wants a plain sunken tub in their bedroom??? Dumb. So I took the Junior "Suite". What made it a suite...NOTHING. It was a large room with an extra mirror outside the bathroom. That's it. Absolutely no different than an oversized standard room. Make sure you don't fall for the "incidentals". Bally's will try to get you to pay for your whole stay up front but will ask if you want to put a hold on "incidentals". How much you ask...$100/night. You've got to be kidding me. Take it if you want to jam up your credit card for the week. That's a heck of a lot of towels. The casino you ask...terrible. Plenty lively. Plenty tiny. Such a large property should have more than 3 craps tables. The only time I could get even near one was early in the morning before work. "Bills" right next door is a dive place but it's casino is infinitely better (and cheaper). Don't worry slot suckers, i mean players, there are plenty of these at Bally's. Overall I would never stay here again. I am seriously questioning if I want to give the Harrah's family any of my business ever again. It's a shame too because I had such a good experience at Harrah's Reno.

Reviews.Title: “Another Good Stay at Bally's”
Reviews.Author: Eddie S
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Bally's from Jan. 15th - 19th for another good stay. I stayed in the North Tower which has nice spacious rooms. The furnishings are a bit dated, but I am not in Vegas to hang out in my bedroom. The room was large and comfortable with a good staff taking care of me. My hat is off to the housekeeping lady I could set my watch as to when she cleaned my room which I appreciate. I have stayed at Bally's on numerous visits to Vegas as I always get a good price and they have a great spa and since Bally's and Paris are connected it is like having two resorts for the price of one. I, also, have to mention Bally's is located in the middle of the strip an easy walk (for the Vegas strip) to other resorts. Between Bally's and Paris there are several good restaurants not to mention Napoleon's piano bar with the dueling pianos for entertainment in the evenings. I go to Vegas solo or with family and friends several times a year and about half the time I stay at Bally's for the reasons stated above.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Monica S
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews, my husband and I were a bit nervous about staying at this hotel. We are not big gamblers, but we were able to get the room comp'd. This is why we booked (hey, free is great!). When we checked in, we were told that we could get a room in the South Tower and get a great view or one in the North Tower which are nicer. I really wanted a room with a view so we opted for the South Tower. It was older, but very clean. Unfortunately, the air was not working well so I called down to the front desk and they did not hesitate in getting us another room, but in the North Tower. We were very pleased with how nice and helpful the staff was in accommodating us. The room in the North Tower was definitely nicer and we were very happy with how everything worked out. The location was great. In the past, we have stayed at one end of the strip, but staying in the middle was wonderful!!. The bed was very comfortable and the room was very clean. Again, even though we are not big gamblers, we have been fortunate to have rooms comp'd before, but in different hotels. My husband and I agreed that this was a wonderful stay and would love to stay at Bally's again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Accomodations and Fun”
Reviews.Author: rashad1234
Reviews.Content: I have visited Las Vegas for the pass 8 years and I must say that of the 8 years in a row I have visited Las Vegas, my best time was at Bally's hotel and casino. I have stayed there 3 of the 8 times. They have great hotel room (North Tower). They provide great free entertaiment in the club on the first floor with live music. The house bands are great. Love Bally's.

Reviews.Title: “Nice surprise”
Reviews.Author: MrsOlson
Reviews.Content: We weren't sure what to expect since the reviews are mixed, but stayed here July 2011 and thought it was just fine. Although the check-in line looked crazy busy, it went quickly. I was comped 4 nights and at check-in, we were upgraded to a suite in the North Tower. Room was large, dressing area and bathroom were large as well. Everything was clean, which is most important to me. Also, the location is perfect! The best location on the Strip. The TV sucked (tube tv) but who the hell goes to Vegas to watch TV?!?! We did find the Paris casino floor to be less smoky than Bally's, but enjoyed both. We are staying at Paris our next trip, but would certainly stay here again. Oh and the tequila bar/restaurant had great food and drinks.

Reviews.Title: “A nice one!!!”
Reviews.Author: VikramHercop
Reviews.Content: This hotel is on the Vegas strip, and just in the middle of the other top hotels.... The hotel rooms are very very big, and so is the hotel itself that it gets a little annoying walking to your room.... :). The hotel has a huge casino in the ground floor...when you book a grand canyon tour, their pick up bus comes to this hotel, so that is an advantage. The staff there are very helpful too..

Reviews.Title: “Nice location but rooms need a major overhaul!”
Reviews.Author: mrwheels
Reviews.Content: A great location right on the strip with easy access to Other great casinos. Paris, Bellagio and Cesar's to name a few. The down dies is the rooms. Once inside you would think you were in a roadside motel. Old 26 inch box tv was propped on a small table and the speakers were blown on them. The room was rather roomy much bigger than normal size. I was in the south tower. If you don't plan on spening much time in your room then this may work for you.

Reviews.Title: “Mostly an excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: ClumsyIsis
Reviews.Content: I will agree with what has already been expressed in that the furniture was outdated and a bit worn down. However, the room (South Tower) was large and more than adequate. We had a view of Paris and the Bellagio fountains. Check in and out was smooth. I found it odd that they did not require a credit card for the room, since it was paid for online. My displeasure with the hotel was with their Spa. For $18 a day, you could purchase a pass with access to the sauna, steam room, and whirlpool. The whirlpool area was under construction. There was a huge black garbage bag "tarp" blocking off half of the room. there were some large rolling garbage bins that were jutting out, making it hard to get in and out of the whirlpool. Both days I was there, I saw roaches. I will say that I was impressed that the spa employees were not hassling with trying to sell certain procedures or upgrades. If the spa area had been cleaner / not under construction, or, if I had been made aware of that before I had purchased, I may have felt differently about my experience. All in all, large rooms, for a good price, on the center of the strip. Kinda hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: doucesgirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and a large group of family and friends stayed here when we got married in Vegas (The Grove is a gorgeous spot for weddings about 15 mins from the strip!) The best thing about Bally's is the location! The rooms are a bit out dated and I personally find their casino drab and very smokey! The drinks and restaurants are fine, the buffet is pretty good with a nice selection. The pool at Bally's is actually really nice with a good layout. Much better than Planet Hollywood (that pool need a major overhaul!)

Reviews.Title: “Fun in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: Girls50
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Bally's for four nights. Room was large but had very dated furnishings! Bally's location is great - in the middle of the Strip. No coffee maker in the room. Room was clean!!

Reviews.Title: “One of my favorites on the strip”
Reviews.Author: byoneshige
Reviews.Content: We love staying at Bally's because of its location in the middle of the strip. We stayed in the North Tower. It was so quiet you couldn't tell if there were others in the hotel! I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs - Nasty”
Reviews.Author: Denny219
Reviews.Content: 12-15 bed bug bites, many leaving welts. To say the response from customer service was a joke is an understatement.

Reviews.Title: “Great view for NYEve”
Reviews.Author: Oznurse
Reviews.Content: Location in the middle of the strip was perfect. There is so much to do in Vegas plan your day if you want to do more than gamble and drink. Pack a fat wallet you will need it - drinks food, souvenirs

Reviews.Title: “Coffee please!! Great location”
Reviews.Author: tryin2
Reviews.Content: Location IS great. Although, bus passes are $7,00 for 24hres, yes, they run 24hres. The room was average, but I REALLY missed having a coffee maker. In the casino cafés, a coffee is $3,95 !! We stayed in the south tower, average room, however housekeeping.....for two days, a contact lense sat on the bathroom floor (neither of us wear them) No contour sheets...just flat sheets. The room service was very good. Great breakfast for $10,99 at the café, north side of the casino. Elevators very slow, onnly three of them could reach our room, and one was broken. The view from our south side was spectaculer, we could see the Eiffel Tower and Bellagio fountains. All in all good for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location,best value”
Reviews.Author: southseapearl
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3days with my family. The best value along the Strip with a very good location (center of the Strip). Just across the Bellagio, walking distance to the mall. Friendly and very accommodating staff, helped us with directions and gave us tips, being first time to travel in LV on our own. Hoping there'll more available front desk officers during peak hours, so as not to have a long queue. But overall, it's has the best value for money, especially if you plan to spend the whole day sightseeing along the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “A surprising experience”
Reviews.Author: ctdel
Reviews.Content: We have been avoiding Ballys and low and behold, last New Year's weekend, it was the most affordable rooms on the strip. Surprisingly, the walk from the strip to the Casino or hotel entrance were not as "far" as we preceived. The staff were great. The room was larger than the Standard room on the strip that we've stayed. Also, we were not met with "drunken or rowdy" crowds right as you step out of the casino. The distance between the strip and entrance was an unexpected relief. The airport and Rio shuttle buses were just outside of the hotel entrance. Waiting lounge and benches are available while you wait. What else can they think of! One draw back - no buffet though Ballys is part of the "Buffet of the Buffets". But no biggy- Paris is just a few meters away, passing several stores and eatery.

Reviews.Title: “Las Vegas on a deal”
Reviews.Author: MollyDollyBaby
Reviews.Content: I visited Bally's through a last minute deal on a popular website. The exterior of the hotel pales in comparison to the other newer hotels on the strip, but if a place to lay your head is all you require, then Bally's is your hotel. It is almost directly across the strip from Caesar's Palace, and beside the Paris hotel, so a nice central location on the strip. Our room was on the 14th floor and faced Caesar's Palace...gorgeous view, especially at night. The room was a bit shabby...gold shag carpet in the bedroom, and the decor was pretty beat up. The bathroom was very dated but clean. Considering we got the hotel for 4 nights, and airfare from Portland, Maine for the low price of $425 US, this was an excellent deal. I wouldn't recommend staying there if you are looking for the luxury you see on tv, but for a decent place to park your carcass for a few nights, Bally's works.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and big rooms”
Reviews.Author: Larry F
Reviews.Content: We stay at Bally's often as the location on the strip is great and the rooms are large. They could upgrade by changing the TVs to flat screens. Their coffee shop is good and there is a great restaurant which connects to Paris that has custom burgers called Le Burger Brasserie. The pool is average and the casino is comfortable with a variety of games. I like that it is not a mega resort. It is a short walk from many other hotels and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Bally's Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: abbyford
Reviews.Content: Clean, good service and super location. Pool was nice. Saw Jubilee show and that was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: Politikal
Reviews.Content: We arrived late on the first day and were placed in a suite. Wow...that was an amazing experience. Unfortunately the next day, we were placed in our regular room (which could -of course- never measure up to the luxurious suite). We had a standard room, 2 beds. There was an issue at check-out with a discrepancy with the bill, which took some time to clear up but besides that it was fine. Thankfully I was warned about the cigarette smoke before heading to Vegas...jeez, it really is a problem in casinos but you get used to it. I wouldn't stay there again, there are much better hotels around with just as good deals, but it was good for a first timer.

Reviews.Title: “New Year 2011/12 in Las Vegas at Bally's was superb!”
Reviews.Author: lightweightkat
Reviews.Content: We booked to stay at Bally's because it was a good rate for staying in Las Vegas over New Years Eve and didn't charge resort fees like Circus Circus had on our last visit to Vegas. After 2 planes later and being awake for 24 hours, we arrived at the hotel at 8pm on New Years Eve check in was extremly quick and the lady was very polite and welcoming, we had booked 2 rooms for a party of 4, we were assigned rooms on different floors in the North tower, having to use a different set of elevators for each room, we were slightly annoyed but didn't really mind this as we expected the hotel to be busy considering our late arrival on New Years Eve. However, we got over the inconvenience when we realized we had each been allocated a diamond suite at no extra charge! We took advantage of the free phone calls between rooms to make plans rather than use 2 elevators to visit our traveling companions room. The North tower doesn't have a direct view of the strip, if you want a view of the strip, request one but expect to be in the South tower which other reviews say are not as nice as the north tower so if you want a nice room and a view pay more at a different hotel! We only used the room to sleep so didn't need a view as we were out on the strip enjoying the sights. The quality of the rooms were superb, the cleanliness was excellent and the maid service could not be faulted. If we wanted a lie in we put the do not disturb sign on the door and she skipped us until we went out. The bed did fold down from the wall, but it was kept laid and down throughout our stay and was extremely comfortable. We were so exhausted from our days out, I probably could have slept on the sofa in our room, that was also extremely comfortable! Other reviews say its a long walk from the north tower elevator to the exit to the strip, its not that far considering you can walk a long distance between hotels on the strip. I would recommend walking from Bally's through to Paris which is connected, its a pretty walk on the cobbled floor, exploring the french themed shops and cafes. We went to the Guns N Roses concert at The Joint at the Hard Rock Hotel for our New Years Eve celebrations, they were superb, Axel certainly didn't act his age. Definitely worth the wait considering we arrived at 9.30 and the concert started at 8 we felt extremely lucky to enjoy the support group and have a relaxed few drinks before the Guns came on stage at 10.30, some people were complaining but this is Axel we are talking about and he can come out whenever he is ready, the performance was amazing and non-stop! Celebrating the New Year was very special and would recommend to anyone if they ever get the opportunity in the future. I would recommend Papillion Helicopters for a helicopter trip over the Grand Canyon and Hoover Dam, their service is extremely efficient and reliable and have used them on both visits to Las Vegas, we just rang then from the hotel rather than booking through an agent as it cut out the commission. Both trips were superb and we felt excellent value for money. The hoover dam tour was very informative and the helicopter ride ,over the dam really finished the trip for us. The coach driver, Big O, was particularly funny and interesting, request his coach if you can! If David Copperfield is at the MGM and you like to be amazed, then book! All tickets are one price, $106, if your in a party of 4 you get your own seated table, if your a 2 you may have to share with another couple. He was spectacular! To eat after the show then I would recommend Wolfgang Pucks Bar and Grill in the MGM, the 2 different steaks on the menu were melt in the mouth and extremely tasty, 5 stars! If you like milkshakes then try the Sugar Factory restaurant in Paris, the vanilla malt was exactly like drinking malteasers, and the club sandwich with fries was just what I was expecting, delicious and huge portions, take advantage of the doggie bag and eat the rest as a snack later! My partner and his mum did the Sky Jump at the Stratosphere. It's a controlled free fall from 108 floors, they reported it was an exhilarating experience which is an easy jump before a bungee or sky dive. $125 for the wristcam DVD and jump which is about £80 in the UK. You can guarantee you wouldn't find an experience that cheap in the UK, if your an adrenaline junkie then do it. The view from the stratosphere is well worth the $16 admission up the tower and if you do the skyjump you get a free pass! If your interested in history of the mob and its connections with Vegas then go to the Mob Experience at the Tropicana, we really enjoyed it, watch the short film, it's very enlightening, we watched the Godfather as soon as we were home... This was a second visit to Vegas, but my partners mum and husbands first time, we all enjoyed the visit. Definitely plan your days so your not walking back on yourselves and use the monorail its $12 for unlimited trips within 24 hours from MGM right up to the stratosphere, or $5 for one trip, much cheaper than taxis in that traffic. Also visit downtown, the Fremont Street Experience is well worth the trip up but the area does feel more like the original Vegas, you do see more local vagrants so watch your handbags and cameras, there are loads of security around but I was more wary. We enjoyed the best hibachi meal at Lillie's Asian Cuisine in the Golden Nugget, our chef really made the night with his jokes and cooking skills, the food was magical. The Emperors Feast at $44 may seem pricey but was well worth it. Las Vegas never fails to impress, definitely worth a visit. We are not big gamblers but the slots are fun. Just set a limit to spend and if you win, keep it!

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not a jackpot!”
Reviews.Author: easterndixie
Reviews.Content: From check-in to check- out, this place was a plug nickel. The room I reserved was not available so I was told that if I wanted similar accommodation that I would have to stay on a "pet friendly floor". Not a problem... I responded that as long as the room was clean that that was acceptable. When I reserved the room, I originally requested that I not be located near the elevator. I inquired about this for the "pet-friendly room" and was told: "But we always keep our single guests near the elevator". Upon my insistance, and with reluctance from the staff member, I was provided a room away from the elevators. I am aggravated before I even get to my room. I get off the elevator (this was a 6 pm arrival) and proceed down the hall to my room. This was like a drunken party obstacle course. Even worse, these same party leftovers remained in the hall for the entirety of my stay which was 48 hours. Wi-fi is an extra charge. Use of the gym is an extra charge. No bottled water in the room. This was a huge disappointment, particularly given that it's not a cut-rate hotel. Definitely a bust!

Reviews.Title: “Great location for the price”
Reviews.Author: Riki M
Reviews.Content: Bally's is one of the older hotel's on the strip, but the location is unbeatable. When you are checking in, ask for what you want if you would prefer the newer north tower, I also wanted a higher floor so that the view would be better. We were given a higher floor room with a mini-fridge which was spacious and clean. The view wasn't much- if I really leaned and looked far to the right I could see the Bellagio fountains. The hotel and rooms are older, but ours was clean and everything was functional. The best part about Bally's is that you are right in the middle of the strip, right across from the Bellagio Fountains. You are even on a monorail stop so if you want to head north or south quickly you have a great way to get there. Bally's is also connected to the Paris which is convenient. I didn't check out the pool because it isn't heated and it was November when we stayed. Didn't eat at any of Bally's restaurants except for the Taco place because I hadn't heard much good about them. The Taco place is great though- dollar tacos are a great deal in Vegas and they were actually pretty good. I was worried that the entire hotel and casino would be very smokey, but the air filtration does a very good job- not quite as good as the fancier hotels like The Bellagio or The Cosmopolitan, but it was never smokey and my clothes never got that gross smokey smell. For the price it can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Las Vegas Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nicole G
Reviews.Content: Bally's is in the perfect location! Me and my Mom stayed in the South tower on the 21st floor and the view was phenomenal (make sure you ask for a high floor). The room was pretty modern it just had a old drawer but the rest was perfectly new and modern! The best part was that is was right in the middle of the strip and it was connected right to Paris! The view from our window was the Eiffel Tower, The whole entire strip and every night we watched the Bellagio Fountains right from our window. Make sure when you go to Las Vegas you get the Total Rewards card because you will get discounts and if you are a casino player you will get 5$ in casino play money plus every time you play you will get points that you can later use on Food and other things! Make sure you book the South Tower and ask for a high floor!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: RealMagpie
Reviews.Content: Had been to Las Vegas twice before and had stayed in five or six hotels on the previous visits, and hadn't even been in Bally's before. Wasn't certain what to expect when I booked but was assured by the reviews I read on here and I'm delighted that we made the choice. The last time we visited Las Vegas was in November 2009 and the prices were just crazy good. This time around though we were staying over New Year's so obviously the prices where much dearer. That said we still got great value for money at Bally's and Vegas really was something to experience on New Year's Eve - they close down the Strip to traffic and it's just one big party and as for the fireworks - one word - magnificent. Back to Bally's - on check-in we received a free upgrade to the North Tower and the room we received was fabulous. It was just short of a suite and was beautifully decorated. The service was excellent and everyone in the hotel was very helpful. The casino isn't the biggest on the Strip but the staff are really friendly. As every other review on this hotel will mention, this hotel's number one advantage is its location. It literally is the centre-point of the Strip and is ideal for first timers to Vegas who want to explore as many of the other hotels as possible. Would highly recommend Bally's and will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great price for a nice room”
Reviews.Author: Sims3
Reviews.Content: The room was spacious and clean. The hotel staff is very friendly and helpful. The hotels location is in the middle of everything. Great room for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Problem free Stay”
Reviews.Author: Ichiriffic
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over New Years and I have delayed my review because I really can't pass along anything that hasn't been mentioned before. Check-in was above average at 10:30am on Wednesday Morning. No line and we were able to move right in to our room on the 23rd floor of the North Tower. The room was clean and kept clean throughout our stay by excellent housekeeping staff. We had a beautiful view towards the Flamingo and saw a couple of great sunrises to the east. Considering we were there at New Years, we were still very happy with the rate and the location is perfect at Centre Strip. Although there are no "Resort Fees", they did charge us an extra $3/day to use the safe. They can call a fee what they want, apparently this property gouges the same way as the others - just without the "Resort Fee" name. At least I had a choice to use it or not. New Years was extremely busy (the busiest I have seen in 25+ visits), we had a tonne of fun. I would definately recommend New Years to anyone who enjoys visiting Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome for Cheap!”
Reviews.Author: Drkbella143
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Las Vegas for an interview and were only going to stay two nights, I did some research and found a great rate at Bally's. We wanted to stay on the strip and the location could not be more perfect, its right in the center of the action. We got a room upgrade when we checked in and were given a very large room in the North Tower. Our room had a queen size bed, a sitting area, dining room table area, large marble bathroom, dressing area, bar with sink and a balcony ( which unfortunately you can't go out onto). The room was clean, not the most up to date style, but it was creme de la creme a few years ago. One amazing thing about this room was the fact that it was extremely quiet, not a peep from anywhere was heard. We were expecting a noisy stay, but were just amazed. We were there from a Wednesday to a Friday. We could see the Bellagio fountain from the window. Only thing lacking was more tv channels. While there one night we ventured to the Tequila Bar and Grill downstairs, they have two dollar tacos, and we got a pitcher of very tastey margerita. We ended up paying $60 TOTAL for our stay. This hotel does not charge resort fees which was one of the reasons I picked it as well. If you are looking for a clean, quiet place to stay in Vegas that is affordable (aka ridiculously cheap for what you get) stay here. Don't expect perfection but it lets you spend your money elsewhere. We would stay here again. Awesome location, affordable, quiet, clean.

Reviews.Title: “Good for low budget, but only okay room”
Reviews.Author: SaraB73
Reviews.Content: Bally's is central to most everything on the Strip, which was pretty much the reason we picked it. I found the location very convenient. Check is went fast, there wasn't a lot of people in line. I had requested a fridge when I made the reservation, two months before, and called a week before I came. I was told that I had to ask when I arrived, as they can't guarantee it. I also asked for a view of the fountains, as I wanted to watch them at night. When I got there, they didn't have any rooms with a view, and said I could wait for one if I wanted. I choice to take one without a view as I had things to do that day. I asked for the fridge, and she told me it would be up soon. I got to the room, and after unpacking a bit, I went out to a show. I came back about 5 hours later, no fridge, so I called the front desk. The lady replied that I was 'on the list, and it should be up soon'...it came about 5 mins later. So, if you want something, you pretty much have to stay in the room/keep calling to get it! The room itself was very large, two queen beds, a table with chairs and an older style TV. We didn't care it wasn't flat screen, as we weren't hanging out in the room that much other then to sleep, anyways. The washroom was also large, while showing it's age. The room was fine, carpets weren't the cleanest, but we just wore socks in the room. For what we paid, the room was good. If you are really picky, don't stay here, but if you're just looking for a place to sleep that's cheap, I'd recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place - Has an "Old Vegas" Quality”
Reviews.Author: Diamond-luv
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at Bally's several times when I was in Las Vegas and found it to be a comfortable hotel in a convenient mid-strip location. The hotel has a walkway that connects it to the Paris Hotel and although the Paris seems to attract more attention with its trendy atmosphere, Bally's is a far better value. The rooms are spacious and interestingly enough, you can get a room that offers a great view of the Eiffel Tower at the Paris. The staff is courteous and there is a Monorail stop and food court at the property. I'll stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: christy8_77
Reviews.Content: My second trip to Vegas. LOVED Bally's!! Room was very big, clean, and beautifully decorated. Check in was super fast. Never had a lack of towels or wash cloths. Found no flaws in the cleaniliness of the room at all! Convenient location, coffee shop, and Krispy Kreme Doughnuts! :) The pool was beautiful, quiet, and spacious. Will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the price...”
Reviews.Author: Yvonne I
Reviews.Content: The accommodation are clean, but a little outdated. The pool isn't that great, especially compared to other pools in the area. I would recommend this hotel if you are on a mid-ranged budget.

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: Bmouland21
Reviews.Content: Great location, near the heart of the strip and walking distance of nearly everything. We had a room overlooking the Eiffel Tower and Bellagio fountains....amazing view of the strip at night...Room was spacious and clean... Decent amount of restaurants, and the food was good. Cleaning staff was hit and miss. Some days we got an amazing job done and other times they appeared to do a quick job and not really care. Only downside was getting hassled by annoying timeshare people immediately when you enter the lobby. One guy approached me with the same speech twice in 10 minutes and had no idea he just spoke to me. I understand they have a job to do and we can ignore them if not interested but in other hotels, they are in other areas. Annoying paying customers 10 seconds into their stay is not a great way to start. I might consider staying elsewhere next time because of this but overall it was a good place. Price was really good.

Reviews.Title: “good if you dont plan on being in the room”
Reviews.Author: Daralynn11
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Bally's for one night. We flew in through Las Vegas to drive to San Diego the morn, and Bally's was one of the cheapest hotels to stay in. The room was a nice size, but the bed was a queen, and we have a king at home, so that was interesting. It was kind of dated, but good enough for one night. Nothing fancy. The check in was easy, but you have to go in the entrance not on the strip if you don't want to walk through the whole hotel to get to check in.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel was excellent, the staff was wonderful and helpful.”
Reviews.Author: sederia
Reviews.Content: This was my 3rd time staying there and as always it was a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Ballys Hotel The Strip Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: cherryburn24
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was clean and you where made welcome at the Desk when you check in.The overall hotel was made clear, with large spacious rooms with hair dryer, TV, iron and ironing board,shampoo and body cream, as well as safe which comes at a small charge per day.Bedding in rooms are keeped clean and bath towels changed every day.If you require extra sheets call house keeper.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Hiched
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. Location was amazing - smack dab in the middle of the strip and close to everything! We upgraded the rooms for no charge and got a beautiful room in the newer wing. Our room had a view of the Bellagio fountains (an obscured view but you could see parts of the fountain). Service was outstanding and the front desk and customer service area couldn't do enough for you. The pool was amazing, but the drinks were outrageously expensive. Bally's is connected to The Paris and the corridors between the two hotels are incredible - great restaurants and stores. Gambling was fun and the casino isn't so big that you'd lose your friends in it. Restaurants in the casino are incredible and reasonably priced. The nacho platter serves 6!! Drinks are not watered down...they are yummy!! I would DEFINITELY recommend staying here and will be making my own reservation every year to celebrate my birthday. Enjoy!!

Reviews.Title: “Beware of reduced show tickets proposed in the lobby”
Reviews.Author: Eric046
Reviews.Content: Was approched by a tour agent in the lobby of the hotel with a welcome gift. A 75$ show for the Jubilee was sold for 10$ including a free meal . The deal included to visit and provide feedback on one of their chain hotels nearby. I was travelling with wife and kids and was ready to give 2 hours of my time for such a good promotion, especially since my wife and I travell quite a bit. By the time we reached the other hotel ,we realized they were trying to sell us timesharing, which we were not interested at all. It was never mentionned in the lobby . At the same time, the staff realized that we were not applicable and were practically kicked out of the room. Nothing was said about this before and no apologies given. Moreover, food was less than average served on a cheap paper plate with plastic cutlery. This was our worse welcome gift in history... I feel bad for all the other people present in the room with us who got manipulated Welcome to Vegas,city of no scrupule...

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for New Years Eve”
Reviews.Author: USgovt-traveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights over the NYE holiday. Great location close to everything. Connected to Paris and free shuttle to the RIO. Stayed in North Tower 11th floor. Room was nice and updated. No complaints. Hotel is kept clean and is well maintained. No coffee pots in the room. No free wireless, $14 per day. Check in and out was easy. Great Thai rest. called SEA.

Reviews.Title: “My go to place - Balley's”
Reviews.Author: one1badpirate
Reviews.Content: Yes, Bally's is an older place but it is one of my favorites. They gave us a very nice room with a comfortable bed. Walls are a little thin but not too bad. I know Bally's and i am very comfortable knowing my way around..nice coffee shop, nice restaurants,nice sports club and good pool.. I have always had good luck in the casino with their very friendly staff. Laid back and fun place. Also i love the cobble stone walk way over to the Paris.. all the fun and not have to leave unless you want. Only Con is they need to upgrade the Spa.. old and dirty

Reviews.Title: “Bally's Las Vegas - good value”
Reviews.Author: locolomo
Reviews.Content: Although Bally's is somewhat dated compared to other hotels on the strip, you can't beat their prices and location! The amenities are fine and the hotel was clean. The casino is not too large to be overwhelming, but has plenty to offer. The location is great and the cost can't be beat for being in the middle of everything. I would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: CindyWin
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 4 nights in August. One of the finest hotels in the strip. I did not gamble. The room and the beds are comfortable. Although the ground floor is crowded and noisy, the rooms are quiet and peaceful. You will find many travel operators operating tours, it's a place to be and indulge.

Reviews.Title: “Good value in the heart of the Strip.”
Reviews.Author: jforbes01
Reviews.Content: Nice and clean room with older decor. There wasn't really a view or anything special about it, but it was unbeatable for twice the price. Ballys does have a newer tower and more modern rooms if you're into that. My only gripe is that the guy at the desk told me I was getting upgraded, only to arrive at exactly the room I booked. You don't have to lie, and even if I didn't pick up on that, telling clueless people that this standard room is an upgrade just makes Ballys look bad. Don't forget your walking shoes!

Reviews.Title: “Are they even trying?”
Reviews.Author: melhojo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are pretty independent travelers, and we rarely spend much time at our hotel. We have always felt that as long as a room is comfortable and clean, we don't need much else. Our stay at Bally's has me questioning that philosophy. I knew before going to Vegas that staying at Bally's isn't exactly "cool," but I liked the location, and of course, the price. We did not have much contact with the staff, but the check in line was ridiculously long. They only had two people on, and we had to wait for a very long time before anyone else was called to help. This makes for a very frustrating first impression. Our room in the South Tower was depressing. Sure, it was big and sure, it was clean. We even had a view of the Eiffel Tower at Paris next door. The furniture was old and depressing. I joked with my parents that if they came to Bally's when they were my age, the room is probably exactly the same. The furniture was all scratched up, and my husband remarked that it looked like it came from a garage sale. The carpet was worn. There were only about 5 stations available on the TV. There were cracked tiles in the bathroom. I just don't get how they could think that this is acceptable. The saving grace for this hotel is the location. It connects to the Paris hotel, so we had all of those options for eating, and we entered and left the strip through Paris. If the hotel was not so centrally located, it would not be worth visiting. I would be willing to pay more for a nicer stay.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: Lizzy79
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I stayed at Bally's the week of Dec. 11 for a quick pre-Christmas vacation. After reading some of the negative reviews we went into it without huge expectations. We were pleasantly surprised! With our player's card they comped us for 3 nights and we paid for 1. They also upgraded us to a north tower room. We were very happy with the room. Very large room with a comfortable bed and very clean (which was the most important to us.) The only complaint we would have with the place is you have to pay for WiFi. Didn't buy it, thought it was too expensive. The casino was not bad. We liked the fact that it is smaller and easier to get around. With Paris attached it is almost like two casinos in one. The tequila bar was a great place to grab a bite to eat and get a margarita for cheap. Two dollar tacos and two dollar margaritas. We didn't try the other restaurants here. Loved the location on the strip. Very easy to walk in any direction to some very nice hotel/casinos. If you are looking for a good steak, Ellis Island which is right behind Bally's has a steak dinner for $7.99. You have to ask for it, it's not on the menu, but you get sirloin steak, choice of potato, salad, rolls and choice of glass of beer or root beer. They have their own brewery there, and pretty loose slots as well. Overall we really enjoyed our stay at Bally's. Would definitely return. As long as you know it's not as fancy as some places, but for the price and comfort you can't go wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay "but"”
Reviews.Author: Crusaders
Reviews.Content: Value for money, clean tidy etc BUT they have to either ban smoking in the public area's or set aside a non smoking zone with walls, within 2 hours of sitting down to gamble I had a sore throat and had to keep moving away from smokers. If one casino went smoke free they would make a killing as I wasn't the only person who was driven mad by this. This is a city problem not just Bally's as all casinos allow smoking. In the end I just gave up gambling and avoided the casino's which was their loss. As for the room it was great value for money but I will not return to Las Vegas until they join the 21st century

Reviews.Title: “In the right spot”
Reviews.Author: Goanywhere28
Reviews.Content: No issues here....stayed w a bunch of friends and it is centrally located and we had rented a car and the parking garage is easy to get in and out of. The front bar seems to have some real nice people working it no matter what time of the day it is

Reviews.Title: “Bally's bad rap”
Reviews.Author: LovedLV
Reviews.Content: After reading the first reviews regarding Bally's I regretted my choice. Not any more room was very spacious, had excellent view of Paris' Eiffel Tower restraurant and also a great view of the Bellagio's fountains. Could ask for more we were in the middle of EVERYTHING Awesome location. Will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Nice and clean for the price”
Reviews.Author: Manico
Reviews.Content: I was expecting worse. I stayed at this hotel way back when it first was the original MGM Hotel (before it expanded) and knew that this was one of the oldest properties in Vegas. So I was expecting horrible rooms with stained carpets, moldy bathrooms and broken beds. Imagine how surprised I was when I entered my room and saw how large it was (King size room) with a small sitting area and large desk/workspace area. There were no visible stains on the carpet and the bathroom was clean (yes, the tiling/motif was dated but it was still very nice and kept up ). My room faced into the L-shaped area of Bally's so there was little noise except that you could hear the "whoosh" of the Bellagio fountains at night when the show was on (luckily the last show ends after 10 pm I think). I didn't hear any of my neighbors and had a restful sleep on the bed (it wasn't the most comfortable ever but it didn't sag and was great for a good night's sleep). All in all, I was quite pleased with the room as for an older hotel, it was in much better shape than the rooms at the Westin across the street (stained carpets, broken door jams, bathrooms that need cleaning/fixing). My only complaint wasn't with the room but with the lack of 24 hour cafe's/dining places in the property-------actually, I couldn't find any place nearby that was open at 5:30am on a Wednesday morning. Does this mean that Las Vegas is really finally dead??

Reviews.Title: “More than adequate”
Reviews.Author: XYNYJAYDUB
Reviews.Content: Thsi hotel served our purpose.It has location, lots of really nice staff and a really great band on 12/24 and 12/25 in the lobby. I am extremely happy to report the room was very clean.NO bedbugs in our room and believe me I checked .The water machines on two floors were broken . I went to the desk to get a refund.$ 2.50 and was told I needed ID to get a refund.I did not feel like walking the half mile to my room to get my ID.I called the number on the broken machine.The were useless.
