It is sad to lower my review number but these are the things that bug me.Two days later, there was still no out of order sign on the broken machines on two floors.Yes I was stupid enough to try two machines..The price is right and there are no resort fees.

Reviews.Title: “meh...okay for the price”
Reviews.Author: talurius-the-great
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 6 nights the week before Christmas in the North tower. Room was clean, no complaints there, but just very average. Walls are paper thin, the people in the next room were talking in the middle of the night and it was keeping us up...they were just talking!! The place is infested with timeshare leaches, I know they are all around Vegas but there seems to be a concentration of them at Bally's. The day we arrived we realized we forgot the key to our luggage, called hotel maintenance and they were up immediately to cut the lock for us. Housekeeping was good. Can't beat the location. View from the room was poor, mainly just rooftops and ac units. If you want a good view I think you stand a better chance booking the south tower. Room was okay for the price we paid, but defenitely want to try somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Bally' s did not disappoint.”
Reviews.Author: back2
Reviews.Content: After reading other hotel reviews including Ballly's I decided to book with Bally's and was not disappointed. We stayed in the south tower and had a view of the Bellagio's dancing water fountains and the Eiffel Tower room was 6O19. Plan to visit again and will stay at Bally's again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Andja A
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Bally's south tower with family for a long weekend. Rooms are big, beds are very comfortable and the bathroom was very clean. Hotel staff was quite kind and pleasant. Very good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “2 hotels in one”
Reviews.Author: jeff8007
Reviews.Content: While staying at Bally's you can walk directly into the Paris hotel shops and on through to the Paris casino without having to go outside. When it is 2000 degrees outside, or raining this is very convenient. Bally's rooms are bigger than most others. The maid service was excellent and every time we asked for more towels they were there in less than 20 minutes. The casino dealers and waitresses were very friendly and helpful. The entire staff from the valets to the security were very friendly. There was a snag in the trip, literally, a piece of metal on the escalator grabbed my shirt and ripped it. I was reimbursed for the shirt and they fixed the area immediately, so I was satisfied with how it turned out. Room service was fast and good! I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time”
Reviews.Author: Sneaky12
Reviews.Content: My first trip to Las Vegas. Check in was easy and quick, despite it being 5pm of friday night. My room in the North Tower on the 10th floor was awesome, as I could see several other casino's and the mountains beyond! Hotel staff was great! On the casino floor, it was very obvious the female drink waitress's severed men before women. (This was obvious because everytime I turned around my son had a drink and I'd not even seen the waitress!) The mall connection the Paris Hotel/Casino was great. Lots of shops, bars with music along the way. I'd go there again in an instant.

Reviews.Title: “We were well pleased”
Reviews.Author: davide542
Reviews.Content: Bally's is an older resort/casino and pretty short on glitz. It is, however, well maintained and has a very superior staff. Noteworthy were Ester at check in and the lady bellman who brought us our bags. They were efficient and very welcoming. Our room was dated but quite clean and very large. The rate was low enough that the room was a significant bargain (mid-week). All of the rooms facilities operated flawlessly (A/C, heating, sinks, tub, shower, etc). The hotel is entirely adequate for a stay and has the usual amenities. Most importantly, the entire staff seems to have been well trained and are always helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Just retuned from staying at Bally's”
Reviews.Author: TwoTexasn
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Bally's for the first time last month, and stayed again this past weekend. We stayed in the north tower. Very clean, updated nicely. The rooms are large and the common areas are pleasant. The pictures here from travelers are realistic. Didn't see the damaged furniture depicted in a couple pictures. We stayed in the North Tower. It's connected to Paris, so you can take advantage of their restaurants and shops without having to go outside. And, its location is perfect on the strip. We were comped, but the prices here are good. Don't expect the Bellagio, but for the price, you can't beat it. Oh one negative. The pillows!! to hard, but if you call and ask for others they will accommodate.

Reviews.Title: “Always a great experience”
Reviews.Author: Byron F
Reviews.Content: We visit vegas at least 2 times a year and always find ourselves back at Bally's hotel and casino. We were there from December 15-18 2011. The reason we always go back is 1. We are treated right and the staff are always friendly and helpful 2. We have never asked for an upgrade but have always been upgraded. 3. The rooms are clean and the beds are comfortable. 4. Location location location. What can I say its smack dab in the middle of the strip. This time we were roomed in the North Tower which had a clean and spacious room. We took advantage of the coupons and discounts afforded to us. If you like asian cuisine our experience at SEA the Thai restaurant was amazing! Expect though spicy food so if you ask for medium it will be HOT! next time im going mild

Reviews.Title: “Great location center strip, and for the right price it's a great choice.”
Reviews.Author: Jade M
Reviews.Content: We had planned a trip to Vegas just because we had tickets to the new Michael Jackson Immortal cirque du soleil show. This was our 7th time to Vegas and we have stayed at 6 other strip hotel/casinos. We just wanted to find something cheap in a good location. After checking the total rewards website and entering in our information we found out that we could get all 3 nights for free at either Bally's or Flamingo. After researching each one and reading reviews we definitely wanted to go with Bally's. We arrived at check in about 12:45 p.m and were given the option to upgrade to a Jr suite in the North tower ( $25 a night ) from what I had read the north tower rooms had been re-done and south tower rooms were a lot older and run down. The room was ready immediately, so no waiting. We took them up on the offer and were very pleased with our choice to do so. We were almost on the top floor, it was a diamond floor and we had a great view of Flamingo, Caesars, Venetian, Palazzo, Wynn Encore etc..., plus we could see the mountains so a bit of everything. The room was huge it had a lot of space. There was a nice clean king size bed with a padded wall behind, 2 bedside tables with drawer space, the bed was comfy but the pillows were not great I got a little bit of a stiff neck in the mornings. A little velvet bench at the end of the bed. Then there was a big TV unit with an older TV that could do with an upgrade, but most people are not in Vegas to watch TV in their room. There is a desk and chair and then a living room area that had a couch, chair and coffee table. The Bathroom was very nice and spacious. Outside of the bathroom there was a large 2 door closet with plenty of room for our stuff. Also there was a separate sink and mirror and then a make up area with a chair. The room had a coffee maker, but no fridge. In the bathroom is a huge sink area, no problem putting out all our stuff, then shower and toilet, darker tile throughout, I was pleased with how clean everything was, the shower was very nice and clean, no grime anywhere or stains. As far as for the casino, it is not that big of a casino, and isn't the most fun casino to be in, but the lounge inside late night played a lot of good music. It has a lot of food options and at reasonable prices which is good for Vegas. A couple of extra perks are that it it is connected to Paris, so it's a nice easy walk to get there and we liked the Paris casino, we also got very good drink service in the Paris casino. The other perk is Bally's has a free shuttle to Rio, it runs until 1 a.m, so that is great because a cab there and back would cost you about $20 or so with tip. We never had any complaints about the hotel, and it's location is perfect center strip. We like to walk a lot and we walked one direction to Encore one day and the other direction to Mandalay bay for the show, never took long. There is obviously a lot nicer hotels on the strip, but for $25 a night you really can't beat that except free like we originally had, but I am glad we did the upgrade after hearing about some of the south tower rooms. Every employee we encountered at Bally's was very friendly. I wouldn't pay more than $40 a night to stay here, but anything less than that I believe you would not be disappointed with your choice. It is an older Vegas hotel/casino so if you stay here with that in mind and don't expect anything fancy you will be happy with your choice as we were.

Reviews.Title: “as advertised”
Reviews.Author: carl1881
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at bally s Dec.11-12 2011 Las Vegas its a older hotel but it was good. My room was clean and nice size. The carpet is old but the maid came in both days and vacuumed the floors. Ive definitely stayed in worse hotels and paid a hole lot more. Could it use up grading sure maybe brightening it up some, but its not a dive and for $47.00 a day its was a good value

Reviews.Title: “No Free WIFI!”
Reviews.Author: caribegrl
Reviews.Content: I thought the room was nice since we were upgraded but what I thought was strange is that they wanted to charge per day to use the wifi. So we didnt use it. They also said they dont have wifi anywhere in the building. I thought that alone would make me not want to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Always a great convenient place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: EMCEESanDiego
Reviews.Content: Being a Vegas guru, I can honestly say that Ballys have rooms that are spacey and adequate. Rooms are not as luxurious as Cosmopolitan, Bellagio, or the Venetian. However, the value of being at the center of the Las Vegas strip is what makes it go. They do have a huge sports bar downstairs along near the pool if you wants to place bets on football, boxing, etc. For eats they got, Ichiban (Japanese food), Haagen Daz, Nathans Hot Dog, SBarro Pizza. a walk to their neghbor hotel, Paris, you can find yourself dining at their buffet area. The poker area is friendly and their lounge known as Indigo is quite hip. thats where you can Shuffle, or "Work that Twirk That" if you feel you aint twirkin it at the craps/roulette table. And for those who want value, you can book this room and take a walk across the bridge in each direction to hit the likes of Aria, Cesars Palace, Venetian and Planet Hwood.

Reviews.Title: “Forced to run the casino gauntlet to get anywhere”
Reviews.Author: CLK10
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Bally's in November 2011 as part of a conference. I have to say that my check-in experience was more positive than most of the other reviewers, and I was fortunate enough to get a room in the recently renovated tower. I know that my conference-mates who were not as fortunate were extremely unhappy with their rooms. Despite my nice guest room, there was little else to commend this property. Conference attendees were forced to walk back and forth between the North and South Tower rooms for breakout sessions, or from their guest room to workshop room. Every single such trip forces you to walk right through the casino where it is loud, extremely smoky and full of flashing lights. Even if you skirted the edge of the casino near the registration desk, you still had to walk through enough of it to get to the meeting rooms. Many of us complained about how all of our clothes would have to be washed or dry cleaned when we got home because the smoke smell permeated everything we wore on any day. And of course, people with health problems were just clean out of luck. The only place to grab breakfast in the hotel? Right there on the casino floor, smoke and all. Even if you were having dinnner in the fine dining restaurant, you were still forced to traverse the casino and the smoky haze just to get to the ladies room. Never, ever, ever, again. Other hotels on the strip make their casinos very easy to get to without forcing every single person who walks in the door to tramp through it, so I know it does not have to be this way. Unless you are there for the gambling, I can't think of any reason to stay at Ballys.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: jsms25
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at Bally's on a weekend trip to Vegas and had a really nice stay. We checked in at around 4:00. There were maybe 3 or 4 groups in front of me and things moved pretty quick. The staff was friendly and courteous and we were offered an upgrade. The room itself was nice...dated, but nice. They definately could use an update, but I guess I got what I paid for. Hot tub in the room was a nice touch and the view was magnificent! I had a couple issues with the shower not being as clean as one would like. I stopped by the front desk to let them know and was offered a different room. Told them I would just like it cleaned and it was done by the time I got back in the afternoon. Overall, Bally's is a decent hotel. I would definately stay there again just because of where it is located and it is affordable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Strip Location”
Reviews.Author: kkirwan
Reviews.Content: Husband and I went to las Vegas for a quick "Merry Xmas to Us" trip and decided to stay at Bally's due to great price and location (center strip , total price for 3 nights in South Tower was like $160). Stayed Wed to Sat, during National Finals Rodeo week and there were cowboys everywhere! Asked for "best view of Belagio fountains" and was given (early checkin at 10 am) a South Tower room on the 22nd floor that had a partial view of fountains with a full view of Effiel Tower and Paris hotel/pool. The room itself was pretty run down with very worn/stained carpets, old TV, hard beds (but ok linen) and a horrible torn up dresser. The bathroom was large, sliding door shower/tub was clean, hot water and pressure good, tons of mirrors, but a huge, distracting stain near faucet that make me say "yuck". We seriously considered changing rooms, but then we saw the view and decided the compromise was worth it. We saw many , if not all of the Belagio fountain shows over the course of the trip, and for me, that was a huge plus to the room. The housekeeping was fine, except they DO like to start early and pretty much woke us up around 8 am every morning (ugh!). Also, they had their huge carts always in the hallway almost blocking the looong walk to elevators (which were not slow). The casino at Bally's was just ok, a little boring, but small enough to navigate easily and not get lost. The walkway to Paris hotel/shops was very convinient and nice when it was cold at night. The pool was not open, as it was Dec, but it looked a little boring, but not too bad, just in need of an update. We loved the Tequilla Bar and Grill here for the drink and food specials ~ $2 margaritas, tequilla shots, beer and yummy tacos (chicken and beef, crunchy type). Went here pretty much every evening for drinks. And they are right next to the Indigo Lounge, so we could enjoy the live bands without paying the 2 drink cover there! Very busy place, very tiny though, with not much 'atmosphere", more like a sidewalk type cafe. We loved the show "Jubilee" here too , and even though it was topless, thought it was really well done, with amazing costumes, perfect dancing/singing, and over the top sets. The location of Bally's is also a huge selling point as it it pretty much dead center strip. We were able to walk all the way down to Luxor and up to Mirage very easily. Didn't do too much gambling, a little video poker and slots and cocktail service was always good. Other service personel were friendly as well. I think over all this is a nice hotel that really could use a good face lift, then it would be amazing. I would stay here again but probably try a better room without the view maybe.

Reviews.Title: “Tsk, Tsk, Tsk. Traveler beware”
Reviews.Author: wrldtrvlerhrtfvr
Reviews.Content: Being that this was the first time I had been to Las Vegas, I was quite surprised by what I got myself into when we stayed at Bally's. For starters, we stayed there during "Hall of Fame Nationals" and were warned the minute we walked in that it would feel like you walked directly into a lounge. NO DOUBT, we were warned and stood corrected. Secondly, the toilet flushed very slowly and we had to call the desk several times to report incidents to be corrected and they were never corrected. When I would go down to the casino to play slots, I felt like I was gasping for air that a short walk to Bellagio made my experience of playing machines better. In fact, it was cleaner at Bellagio and Paris because the smoking was not as bad in either of these places. The rooms were comfortable, that though the beds had to be share it felt like you were king / queen of your own bed. Some of the highlights are that there are restaurants on the lower level of the hotel that provide a competitive price for eating. I do not suggest eating at the restaurant on the strip, go to Fremont St where you can have a Prime Rib dinner at Du Par's for $8.95 with a baked potato and drink. If you want a good breakfast, go to La Salsa in the Miracle Mile Mall; there you can get two eggs, bacon, and southern potatoes for $3.95 and beats the hell out of having to wait in line for those breakfast buffets. If you want to save on Sodas, you can purchase a refillable 32 oz. beverage cup at Sbarro and get unlimited refills 24 / 7.

Reviews.Title: “dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: mickychan
Reviews.Content: We booked 2 nights in Thanksgiving's week through Expedia. We checked in late around 7 pm. By the time we came, we had been told that there were no room with 2 queen beds available. We understood it since we came late. They sent us to the room in North tower which is old towel compare with South. We know that since we are returning customer. When we got into the room, all the towels were all over the floor in the bathroom. We called front desk and requesting house keeper . She said we wait while she calling someone to clean it up. After waiting for half an hour, we called again since nobody came. Another wait. 15 minute later, we called again, they told us that the house keeper was not available at that time since already late. They said that they will upgrade us to another room. We were really tired at that time since already midnight. We came down and kept waiting for changing room. They sent us to upgraded room in South tower. We got into the room and almost freaking out since somebody luggage were in the floor. We walked out right away, then we saw a security guide walked by, we called him help. He checked out the room and suggest we contact the front desk since they might made a mistake. I ran down the front desk let them know that, we made me wait for 20 minute then assign a final room that we booked for. I was really mad since they told us that they don't have room with 2 queens beds available, after all those mess which took us almost 2 hours, we got the available room with 2 queen beds. After all that , I figure out that they wanted to save some rooms for much higher rate. Eventhough I told us that we are returning customer, but they don't make any effort to keep us please. Anyway, I won't come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, fine room for the price.”
Reviews.Author: em5585
Reviews.Content: With a Total Rewards Card the room was $57 plus tax total for two nights in the North Tower, and I'm a low roller. The location is great, but the North Tower is set really far back from the strip. But the room was clean and quiet. Showing a little age (paint peeling on the wood in the bathroom, etc.) but fine when all you need is a clean, quiet place to rest for a little while! Smoky casino floor and the cocktail waitresses didn't come around too frequently, but they were quick and pleasant when they did.

Reviews.Title: “Will not return to bally's”
Reviews.Author: STUCKONSALTSPRING
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at Ballys several times but this time, she just didn't measure up. While the view was still great, the rooms need upgrading and for the price, we could have had nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Vegas getaway was a blast!”
Reviews.Author: Lolo50
Reviews.Content: Went for a short getaway to Vegas November 24 to 27 and it was great! We stayed at Bally's and were quite pleased with the hotel and casino. Rooms were very nice....staff were very helpful! We managed to squeeze in a lot of sightseeing etc into those 4 days. We checked out Margaritaville restaurant and casino.....watched the fountains at the Bellagio.....went up the Eiffel Tower at the Paris hotel....went for a gondola ride at the Venetian Hotel......saw the Pirate Fight at Treasure Island and saw the Cirque Du Soleil show (Love) at the Mirage! WOW is all I can say! We rode the monrail from one end to the other....had no problem taking the bus to the South Outlet Mall for some Black Friday shopping. It was a great trip!

Reviews.Title: “Nice quiet room”
Reviews.Author: SIWST852
Reviews.Content: I got what I requested a nice quiet room. The lady at check laughed and said "you know your in Vegas?" but then said her mom was a light sleeper also and gave use a great room with a view of the mountains we saw snow It was clean and decent sized. The maids were absolutely super. We tipped and requested extra lotion the second day and they gave us 3. They also did something else nice that oops I have forgotten but the feel good lingers. Do be careful of the elevators they are quick and smash your fingers

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mitch64622
Reviews.Content: Centrally located on the strip. Very friendly staff. Nice perks (BOGO show tickets) for rewards members. The jubilee show is excellent. Middle age down to earth crowd. Bed was a little hard but not uncomfortable. Bathroom was clean. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely stay again....”
Reviews.Author: CindiC33
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 5nts at Bally's for my daughter's 21st bday. We arrived early on a Tuesday and our room was ready - we were able to check in at 10AM! Reserved a 'classic' room and was asked at check in if we wanted to upgrade; we decided to stick with our original requested room. Low and behold, we had a great view of the Paris' Eiffel Tower and the Bellagio's fountains from our classic room. It was great. Room was clean, furnishings a bit older, bathroom spacious and clean. Staff was very courteous; requested extra blanket and pillow from housekeeping and received right away. Overall, Bally's is a great value and the location is perfect - right in the middle of the strip with the monorail stop right there. No doubt, our next trip will include staying at Bally's again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location on the Strip, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: buraksan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Bally's in November 2011. The location is great, right on the strip and next to many big hotels such as Paris, Bellagio, Mirage etc. The reception is big so as the casino floor. We stayed in the South tower in one of the higher floors. The room was spacious, good, and nice view towards Mirage hotel and the Strip. The bed was comfortable, A/C worked fine. The furniture looks old but it wasn't that bad. Overall we liked the hotel and its location. I can recommend it if you want to stay on the Strip at reasonable prices.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Charles T
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Bally's Las Vegas about 5 years ago and absolutely loved it. Oh how times have changed. Check in was rather slow and the lady who checked us in was very rude. Later that night after eating out we discovered our toilet was broke. I called the front desk and was told maintenance would be up shortly. After a half hour I call the front desk again and was told they had nothing to do with maintenance at all and was told to maintenance directly, which we did. After another hour my wife and I decided to just wait until the following day when we were out and about. We schedule the repair for 5pm and they showed up at 8am. I've never stayed at a hotel which was so indifferent to serious defects in a guests room. If you want to be treated well in Vegas, I suggest you look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Poor value”
Reviews.Author: richard154914
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Ballys in November 2011 as part of a Westjet Vacation booking. The hotel is old and little or no renovations or repairs have taken place for a very long time. I can take an old hotel but I can't take a dirty hotel. This hotel was filthy. Stained and dirly carpets dirty walls and beat up damaged furniture (wow). I complained when we checked out and the person checking me out said" yes the rooms are terrible arn't they" We won't stay here again and Westjet should partner with better properties. Buyer be ware, especially in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “BALLY'S LAS VEGAS HOTEL : MOLD, MOLD, DIRTY, UGLY ACCOMODATIONS!!! USELESS STAFF!”
Reviews.Author: Bklynli
Reviews.Content: Checking in is always an ugly experience! They never have your room that you requested nor the views. Then they put you in the oldest tower that is so gross. the furniture is older then dirt! The showers have mold, mold and more mold! The carpets look like hundreds of people spilled stuff on them,fluids and more and extremely defineable! The grout has mold, the wall paper peeling and dirty. The entrance door to your room has coffee and other fluids on it. The maid staff says they don't use nor have bleach, what a surprise. They need humidifiers because we all had bloody noses daily, nightly and the entire time. I fell on the lower level while walking and fell on the concrete and killed my knee because too slippery with no traction, scary slippery! The casino was entirely too warm, and video slots and more video slots...Crappy! The staff looked like deer in the head lights without a clue when you asked them for directions or inquired about almost anything except for the bell staff, those people were on the money all the time. IF NOT FOR A CONVENTION AND MANDITORY THAT WE STAY THERE, THIS PLACE WOULD BE CONDEMED!!!!!! DON'T DO IT, STAY ANYWHERE ELSE!!!!!!!!!!!!!! BALLY'S IS DONE!!!!!!!!!!!!! YOUR GONNA BE ANGRY, SICK AND EXTREMELY PEEVED!

Reviews.Title: “Big Room and Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: livinlifeRockford_IL
Reviews.Content: So I have stayed at multiple places in Las Vegas and I did not mind this place at all. The room was very large. We did not have a great view, but It was ok. We really did not have a need to deal with the hotel staff too much because we did not have any issues. When we checked in they were friendly and when our key stopped working the fixed it immediately. I would definitely stay here again due to the location. You can walk almost the entire strip from this hotel. It is the perfect location right in the middle of the strip. Attached to Paris, across from Bellagio and Ceasar's Palace. Nothing other than location stood out for me as amazing, but it was not bad either. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “NEEDS UPDATING, BUT OTHERWISE, GREAT PLACE TO STAY!”
Reviews.Author: maryne66
Reviews.Content: We went to Vegas, in Nov. We picked Bally's, because of the central location. My friend's Mother is in a wheel chair and we could go either direction, to see the sites. The rooms were huge. Lots of room, we had a king size bed, they had 2 queens. We wanted connecting rooms, but were only down the hall. The elevator was fast! The employees were very helpful. The place needs some cleaning and paint (the desk in our room had sticky rings from pop or something, that had not been wiped) But, overall, I would stay again, and suggest a stay, to my friends and family. The price was about in the middle, and worth, it. Oh, and I would have brought the bed home with me if I could have....lol!!!

Reviews.Title: “Well Loved Rooms”
Reviews.Author: 2oldtourists
Reviews.Content: I spent Halloween 2011 weekend at Bally's while attending my nieces wedding. This is my 6th visit to Las Vegas - having stayed at MGM, Treasure Island, NY, NY, Luxor and Mandalay Bay in the past. We were told that most of the hotels are pretty good in Las Vegas, so when my sister got a deal on it, we thought - no problem. Unfortunately, upon arriving, we quickly noted that the room showed signs of age. The furniture was quite dated and could use a facelift. The bathroom, although clean, showed its age most. There was loose and missing tiles in the bathroom, around the bathtub as well as the along the base of the wall. The grout was stained and could have used replacing. The bathroom fixtures were old and the shower fittings loose. The water pressure was not that great nor was the fluctuating water temperatures great - OUCH! While staying at the resort, there were several occasions where the escalators on the outside exit to/from the strip were broken. I didn't mind this so much at this time of year as the temperatures weren't as scorching, so walking wasn't as bad as it could have been. However, this was an inconvenience for many disabled who stayed at the resort. On a good note - the room that stayed in had a great peek-a-boo view of the strip and we could see a little bit and hear the Bellagio fountains going off. Also, the staff at the resort were very friendly and eager to assist us. The entertainment seemed to be pretty good as there were plenty of people up dancing to the band at the nightclub. The food at the nearby cafe was also good for that midnight snack. If you get a good deal on this resort, I would still recommend a stay here due to it's location. However, if you are looking for something more modern, you may have to check other alternatives.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Mamas Z
Reviews.Content: This was our first time staying in this hotel from Nov 20 - 24 2011. It's very convenient as there's bus stop near the hotel. The room was spacious and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Break away, but remember it's 'al la cart'”
Reviews.Author: Mary H
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ballys Las vegas this past week, and overall it was ok for the monies paid, as it was a five day package. The rooms were very clean, but the whole hotel is worn, and dated. The security was top notch, and I liked that. If you are thinking of staying here remember that it is 22 dollars extra for the gym per person, and the pool is closed for the season, they do not have an indoor one. I should of looked closer before I booked here as this one of my favorite things to do is visit the gym and the pool. I will look into the holiday inn next time. If you want your hair done correctly and proffesionaly, then look to JC pennys, and a hairdresser named EVA. This is probably the best haircut I have ever had, besides my old nieghbours. The kitchen service is good, but they left not only ours, but a couple of more rooms dishes outside the door for two days, it was not picked up until I told the front desk. I thought that was unproffesional. If you have never been to Vegas avoid the front desks at the side of the hotel entrance, and they try and hook you into time shares, or real estates 'whatever', with a promise of 1/2 price tickets, or free show tickets . Go to 'tickets now' which is a walk down the street, you may have to pay more, but you do not have to put up with some deseperate wanker selling properties. I liked this place, but I will not consider staying there again, as I do like the extras at a full service hotel, and do not mind paying extra to have it. My best advice is read everything completely, and do not skim over, the website makes it look great, but does not show the upclose stuff like- cracking ceilings, and worn out carpet, scratched furniture, and old tube televison sets, and holes in the blackout curtains. If that is ok with you, then this is the place, as the bed mattress was new and the room well cleaned. Thanks Mary Ann

Reviews.Title: “Stinky and uninspired”
Reviews.Author: Suzanne R
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at Bally's in Las Vegas, and it will be my last stay. Checkin took forever, the place reeks of cigarette smell. The room I booked no longer existed, and I was offered the same room in the smoking section of the hotel. We ended up upgrading and that room was large but shabby. The mattress has truly seen better days. Additionally, while other hotels in the area provide free internet, Bally's charges $14 a night. Staying at Bally's was not one of my better ideas. If you haven't booked the room already, I'd recommend you try somewhere else. Sad, but for what you spend at Bally's, you can get better elsewhere. I'm stuck, but have vowed, what they've gotten out of me financially will be all they ever see from me. I'll do all my dining and gambling elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “What A Dump!”
Reviews.Author: MustEatOut
Reviews.Content: Reviews had nothing positive to say about the older South Tower so I spent the extra $15 to upgrade to the 'newly remodeled' North Tower. Really, really disappointed. If the North Tower was recently renovated then I would hate to see the South Tower! Blue spotlight shining right into the room and a beautiful view of nothing but a roof. Hair all over the bedding. The carpet and all the furniture could benefit from a thorough shampooing. Flushing the toilet sounded like a 747 taking off. Would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing stay!”
Reviews.Author: Iamsupersweet
Reviews.Content: Ballys has a perfect location in the strip. You can watch the bellagio fountains in the afternoon while you are in your room. Food service was excellent and staff are helpful too. We'll come back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: PSampa7
Reviews.Content: Although I'd booked a "classic" room, at the time of the check in, I asked for a "good" window view, since the best rooms were not available, I was simply upgraded to a room on north tower which was very pleasant. The view was not great at all, but the room itself was perfect (clean, silent, comfortable). I have heard that south tower rooms are wornout, but I can not tell about it.

Reviews.Title: “No frills Vegas hotel”
Reviews.Author: adz1388
Reviews.Content: This was my fifth time in Vegas, but my first time staying at Bally's. The location of the hotel is definitely its best feature. It is right in the middle of the strip making it easy to walk North or South on the strip and even to the Rio and the Palms within 25 minutes. The amenities offered at this hotel are minimal compared to other hotels I have stayed at in Vegas. There are few food choices, especially for convenience quick food. The rooms are clean and the maid service is okay. The decor is certainly dated and the rooms could use an uplift. However, for the amount of time you spend in your room, it certainly did the trick! Well I wouldn't book this hotel myself again in the future, I think it is a good option for people wishing to stay in a convenient location at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Bally's Baby!”
Reviews.Author: Della I
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to Vegas (me and my sis) and we were not dissapointed at all! The moment we walked into Bally's we were impressed with their service and entry decor (and my sister is picky). I told "Traci" at service counter of my love of the Eiffel Tower. She wasnt sure there was a view of it, but of Bellagio. A view of anything would be wonderful! To my surprise when I opened the curtains, we had the best view--ever! I had a great view of Paris and of the Bellagio. My vacation was starting off perfectly! The dealers were friendly and helpful (since I didnt know the rules to any of the games). The entertainment at Indigo Lounge was great also! Basically, our hotel was in the perfect location--central to everything. I would definately go back to Bally's!!! And we could NOT beat the price. Under $300 for 5 nights for 2. 11/13-18 2011

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel Needs Some Help”
Reviews.Author: stevesmobilepc1204
Reviews.Content: I stayed here about 6 years ago and went back again in November 2011 and found that nothing has been updated. Nothing outside of the casino has been updated. The carpet in the rooms and hallways is old and dingy. The wallpaper is torn up all over. The beds are hard and the bathrooms are small and dingy. If they weren't charging strip prices it wouldn't be a big deal because it is a GREAT location and you are rarely in the room. So if you can get the rooms for less than $100 go for it, otherwise go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare”
Reviews.Author: wildkate
Reviews.Content: No problem signing into room, staff was fantastic and very pleasant. Hotel seemed fairly clean, but the carpets were filthy. I had noticed up on the 22nd. floor the carpet was splitting where a person walks. You had to be careful that you did not trip and fall in the hallways where the carpet was seemed together. Towels were extremely rough to the touch. Hair in shower. Windows were filthy to look out. Took a photo from my window and all the spots showed up on photo.Curtains were dirty. carpet was dirty. Now for the prices they were to high, because they are so called on the strip that does not mean to raise the prices. Hotels on the strip are way overrated. Why spend all the money you have to sleep in a room that you spend so many hours a night.Machines were tight to pay out any great amount.The walkway between the Paris and Bally's were excellent. Clean and wide assortment of shops that had a wonderful array of items.The food was to expensive for one person. I was in one of the conference rooms we were asked to please do not bring food or drink into that area. If you wanted to drink please feel free to purchase a drink from our service bars. For a can of soda or tea the price was $4.00, this was out of sight. For a case of tea or soda the going price nationwide is $6.99. I personally feel this price was uncalled for. At that rate the mark up price was $89.00. I understand they need to make a buck but to raise prices that much is not feasible, and then tip too. We could go out into the casino put a dollar in the machine and get one for free and throw a dollar tip to the waitress. And for a bottle of beer was $6.00, a pitcher of cheap beer was $10.00. Sandwiches were dried out and not tasty all bread. Pizza was dried out under heat lamps and like shoe leather. Needless to say I would never stay at Bally's again. My first experience and my last time there. Im in Las Vegas a few times a year and would never recommend the dirty over priced place to stay .

Reviews.Title: “Fairly good hotel but aging”
Reviews.Author: Danno_99
Reviews.Content: Checkin was fast - not a short queue but a lot of efficient and friendly staff. I was upgraded to a Diamond floor, so the review is for a room on the 28th floor. The room was very large by Vegas standards. Fair amount of storage space, desk, chair, sofa. Wireless internet - at a cost of $14 or so per day. The in-room safe, having seen better days, had a sticker on it indicating a charge of $3 per day would be added to the bill for each day of use (although in my case, it wasn't). So when you pay no resort fee, as their ads indeed promise, you end up paying for everything else... The room was fairly clean but not great. There were stains on the curtain and sticky spots (!) on the desk. Location is good - central strip. The casino is reasonable - not great. Self-parking is actually at the Paris hotel, so there's a bit of a walk from the car to the room (5 minutes or so).

Reviews.Title: “North or south”
Reviews.Author: Smythe99
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the north tower last week and from location thru to the room I thought it was excellent. Perfect location to stroll up and down the boulevard Will definitely return

Reviews.Title: “Always a good value”
Reviews.Author: Shaunr52
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here numerous times and keep coming back! When you factor in location, price and relative quality of rooms, I think this is one of the best strip hotels in Vegas. Good sized well appointed rooms right in the heart of the Vegas Strip. given the amount of time you spend in your room while here I can't justify paying for a high end hotel though I am willing to pay a little more to not stay at the similarly located IP. The Victorian room at Bill's offers some great deals for food ESP breakfast and Ellis Island behind Bally's on Koval Lane has great deals for dinner

Reviews.Title: “It's all about the location”
Reviews.Author: EricBristol
Reviews.Content: The hotel is bang in the middle of the strip. Yes the rooms could do with updating, but it was very clean. The beds were huge and very comfortable. We paid $25 extra a night to upgrade to a suite because there were no king-size left in the non-smoking rooms. (i did originally book non-smoking - this may be a ploy to get more $$$$$$$).

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable for the strip”
Reviews.Author: hrman46
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed the room and the staff. Restaurant selection was limited, but with Paris adjoining the food selection was much better. I wish the reservations really reserved the room you asked for. We got there early afternoon and I had to pay for an upgrade to get the king non-smoking room I reserved. Otherwise, a very reasonable and nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: WindwardGal
Reviews.Content: Had two stays here in the last two weeks , the first in the South Tower with amazing views of the strip. more dated rooms but I preferred it to the more modern North Tower where we had our second visit.View over the car park was not as good! Both rooms were clean. Would be good if there were coffee makers so you could make a drink . Wifi is $13.95 a day .But all in all fine and a great position on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: TechPinkLady02
Reviews.Content: Bally's is in a great location on the Strip. Its basically right in the middle! The rooms were just fine for the price. We stayed in some that had just been recently renovated and we thought they were pretty nice, since you dont really come to Vegas for the rooms anyways. We would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “My stay”
Reviews.Author: john115599
Reviews.Content: I ve been staying here many times.Good location.Nice room.Good service. I really love Sunday brunch buffet at steakhouse. But I had a bad experience at poker room. There was one obnoxious man who looked like caveman in GEICO commercial talking bull crap non stop and smelled bad and he claimed he was a professional.I liked Bally poker room as most players are friendly and just having fun. I hope management come to senses and takes out undesirable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay, great location”
Reviews.Author: danamp
Reviews.Content: We had a speedy check in and I asked if there was a possibility of a free upgrade. We were upgraded to a very nice suite,with a jacuzzi tub and a separate shower. Very large clean room.. We enjoyed our one night stay. The staff was friendly and accommodating. The casino was fun, but a little smoky. This hotel is connected to the Paris Hotel and center strip. Great location.

Reviews.Title: “Marvellous Trip”
Reviews.Author: Wolvesfan62
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Bally's earlier this month. Stayed 5 nights, first 4 comped and last cost $70. No line up upon check in and even though I paid for the $10 North Tower upgrade, Bally's comped that as well. We were upgraded to a junior suite at no extra cost. Where can you get 5 nights on the strip, upgraded to a junior suite on the 24th floor for $70. WOO HOO. Room had a partial view of the strip and was very comfortable. Staff were all very friendly and the casino was not at all smoky. Even better news was the slots were loose. Between us we won 5 or 6 progressives, I even won one for $800 (playing 1 cent slots). Thanks Bally's for making our vacation a MARVELLOUS one....

Reviews.Title: “Economical”
Reviews.Author: 2tll4u
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my two night stay with three of my friends @ Bally's in the heart of the Las Vegas Strip. We came to relax and celebrate a birthday. The rooms were clean, comfortable beds with additional blankets and pillows stored in a large closet. Toiletries were very handsome as was the large bathroom with big towels and lots of hand and face cloths. In room Safe. If you make reservation way ahead of time you can get great deals! Staff was very nice..The Tequila Bar offers $2 shots & $2 Tacos. Paris Hotel & Casino is attached by a long shopping mall. Bring comfortable walking shoes! Fun was had by one and all.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean, treated well”
Reviews.Author: laprairiegirl
Reviews.Content: We went down with several other couples for a 10 yr wedding renewal. We received a $10 upgrade per night for the North Tower that we took advantage of and were upgraded to a junior suite which was huge and very clean. It's not the fanciest hotel compared to some, but the location is great- we could walk to O'Shea's and Casino Royale for late night food/gambling. We paid $80 for five nights- Mon-Thur was comped with our players rewards and we only payed for Friday. We were never charged the extra $10 a night for the upgrade. Woo-hoo. And let's be honest, the only time you spend in your room is to shag and catch a bit of sleep. Most of our time was spent in Bally's casino which turned out to be to our advantage. The slots were loose during the week- we kept winning on everything. My boyfriend won a $800 progressive the first day and we just kept on winning smaller amounts-until Friday when the slots tightened up. Used the spa- good prices with a coupon. We never tried the restaurants, but apparently they were good, and our friends swore by the 99cent tacos. All in all, it was a great place to stay, great amenities, and close to everything. I'd stay there again in a heartbeat...especially since our slot winnings paid for the trip.

Reviews.Title: “Who Sleeps In Vegas?”
Reviews.Author: TYOTP
Reviews.Content: My high score is based upon value, service, location, and size of room. It it not intended for the frequent Vegas visitor, or based upon getting comped. We have stayed at Ballys Las Vegas numerous times over the past twenty years. I enjoy that the hotel is not a mega-hotel and that it doesn't take an hour to get to your room. The casino is small but effective. The price is always reasonable (try to book out as far ahead as you can). The location is perfect, right in the middle of the Strip. Stay in the North Tower, it's been remodeled. The rooms are spacious and clean but a little dated. We have never had an issue with poor or inadequate service. If your are a Spa person, it's reasonable here unless your are looking for ultimate luxury. Plenty of places to eat here or within a 5 minute walk. While in Vegas, how much time do you spend in your room?

Reviews.Title: “Bally's - Las Vegas stay”
Reviews.Author: DawnD79
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Bally's during the week of November 14-17. Nice hotel. It's in the middle of the strip, so walking to places was no problem. They have eateries down in the basement level, plus in the back of the casino, there is a hallway that leads out to restaurants, lounges, shops, and it's hook on to the Paris hotel and casino. I didn't think the casino paid out very well, but it's there or you can walk to a place close by. Bally's is near the overhead sidewalks to get across the streets. The monarail has a stop at Bally's too, but it's down in the lower level, so it's a walk, but so is everything you want to do. Just wear good walking shoes! Good shows. We went to see the Blueman group and Jubilee shows. We would stay there again. Use the bus system or monarail to site see and to get back to your motel from various areas.

Reviews.Title: “Great strip location”
Reviews.Author: prisha40
Reviews.Content: Super convenient strip location - about midway if your going North or South to attractions. Skip the breakfast buffet, it was expensive, very limited and everything was COLD. I complained to the front desk staff, and they could have cared less. The Tequila Grill is a MUST for AMAZING $2 frozen lime margaritas, tacos, and beer.

Reviews.Title: “Very Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: stevoinfranklin
Reviews.Content: Was hesitant to stay @ Bally's after so many negative reviews.I am a Total Rewards member and my stay was free for 4 nights.I upgraded to the Newer North Tower (25th floor) for $25 per night and for me it was worth the money.The room was very spacious (720 sq ft) and clean. I even checked for bedbugs before I unpacked! No problems...daily maid service etc.,high enough up for no traffic noise. The hotel is very centrally located on the Strip...walked everywhere...but it is right on the monorail system if you are not into walking. The hotel staff was friendly and attentive both during check in and check out...less than 10 minutes waiting time. Thanks Bally's for making this trip enjoyable!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent room and maid service”
Reviews.Author: THEWAD
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed in Bally's South Tower and I was very pleased with the maid service and also I want to express my appreciation for the complimentary fruit basket I received in my room on the final day of my stay. Bally's front desk staff was excellent and again I had no problems with anything at this hotel

Reviews.Title: “smoky”
Reviews.Author: CarolineMcMuffin
Reviews.Content: Ok hotel. Nice room in North Tower. Very smoky lobby. Smell of smoke throughout. Gross. Close enough to the Strip. Nice cut through Paris. Hotel employees not present near the shuttle area. Bellman tucked away in a corner near checkin. If you had a question about shows or shuttles or anything located in that segment of the lobby, there was not really anyone to ask. Other negative: street noise, but I guess that's just Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “My preferred hotel because of CRAPS tables & proximity”
Reviews.Author: APTexan
Reviews.Content: Although the rooms are lacking, I like to stay at Bally's because I like the craps tables here. Also, it is not as crowded as the other hotels, and it is fairly centrally located. I do agree that customer service is not fast to jump on disputed bills. However, we do not like overcrowded loud hotels with tons of kids and people running into us everytime we turn around. Bally's has its crowds but they do not seem to be as bad as other hotels. I'm sorry to hear about the bedbugs...kinda scary. Housekeepiing staff is very accommodating. Just wish Ceasar's would put some money into this hotel to re-do rooms...even the North Tower rooms appear old. Also, Bally's could invest in some ozone equip to get rid of the stale smoke smell in the smokers' rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Gone down-hill”
Reviews.Author: setter3
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at Bally's for about 10 years. It's centrally located and easy to navigate. In the past it was well-known that one should stay in the North Tower because it was recently renovated and a bit more upscale than the South Tower. I don't know what the South Tower rooms were like but our room (2074) in the North was pretty run-down. Examples: Carpet was terribly stained and worn Mildew on ceiling in bathroom Bathroom walls and vanity were spattered with what appeared to be dye or nail polish Windows were filthy Toilet leaked and left a wet puddle on the floor Someone had put scotch tape on the wood trim... it was still there after three days The only reason I rated it three stars instead of two was because the rooms are large and the staff was pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but they really need to update their rooms!”
Reviews.Author: P P
Reviews.Content: I stay here an average of 4 times per year. For the most part, the only reasons I stay here are because of the location and the price - and I usually travel with a large group that wants to be in the same hotel. The benefits of Bally's: It's great to be at a hotel/casino that has it's own monorail stop. Great benefit. And it's located in the heart of the strip. Very convenient. The rooms are generally priced on the low side for the strip. Those are the major benefits of staying at Bally's. The negatives: Front desk staff - not overly helpful. They kind of look like they hate their jobs. The people trying to get you to sign up for something near the front door - super obnoxious. The rooms are not very nice - very outdated and worn looking. The restaurants are sub-par. Boring selection that doesn't seem to ever change - and it's not all that good. I find myself heading next door to Paris for even just a late night snack. Bally's is severely in need of a face-lift, some better staff and some new chefs. Time for an upgrade, folks!

Reviews.Title: “Never Dissapoints.”
Reviews.Author: ErnieBC
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at alot of the strip hotels...but we keep heading back to Ballys. Love the staff, the bars and the entertainment. The location is superb. It might be a no frills hotel but honestly the staff are the best on the strip that i have found.

Reviews.Title: “Typical older-school hotel on The Strip”
Reviews.Author: ElectricalTraveller
Reviews.Content: Like the Flamingo, this is a typical older-school hotel on The Strip. It is dated, but works well. Like other hotels, internet access is extra. I chose internet for the whole property (rather than just my room), and it worked very well throughout the parts of the property I visited. The check-in staff is a lot faster than that of the Flamingo. The location on the strip is great so, if you're not too concerned about super fancy frills, this is a good property.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms and great location but nothing special for the strip.”
Reviews.Author: EvanUTVol
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very nice and the location is great, but Bally's is nothing special for the strip. I have stayed at other hotels nearby for less such as the Paris and liked it much more. The main thing I did not like about the Bally's was the service. The casino atmosphere seemed more as if it was targeting the college age/spring break crowd. They have numerous silly rules to prevent giving out free drinks in the casino that I have never seen at any of the nicer casinos. The rooms are nice and the location is definitely great but I would not stay at Bally's again.

Reviews.Title: “Worked for me”
Reviews.Author: JKeef65
Reviews.Content: I read reviews before going on vacation and the mention of a dirty hotel and bed bugs had me scared. The hotel was clean and bed bug free. We stayed in the North Tower in room 661A which was very big and roomy. I would stay there again. The staff was friendly and accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Clean Room”
Reviews.Author: castaways01
Reviews.Content: Booked 3 nights at Ballys in early October through Total Rewards - the room was comped. This was my second stay at Ballys this year. Yes, the hotel is older and somewhat tired, but the excellent location, variety of restaurants and the rewards program are the trade-offs. If you are looking for fancy and upscale - don't look here! I rated the hotel "very good" because of the excellent employees and clean room. Arrived around 11 p.m. on a Tuesday night and check in was quick and efficient. Was given a queen room in the North tower instead of the king I had requested. The clerk said I could move to a king the following day, but I opted to stay put. The room was clean and the bed comfortable. The bathroom was small and tv was one of the older tube types but it wasn't an issue. I mostly played the table games (BJ and 3-card poker) and poker machines at Ballys. Also played in their poker room a couple of times. The central location makes it easy to walk anywhere. I took the monorail, located on the lower level, to MGM one rainy day. Then continued to Mandalay Bay, stopping in Luxor, Aria, and a few other hotels on the way. Also walked north to Flamingo and Venetian the next day. A burger at Le Burger Brasserie one evening was excellent. Sat at the bar and chatted it up with a couple of nice tourists. It was a fun atmosphere with baseball on the big screens. I opted to stay at the Trump on my last night (Friday) in Vegas. Getting a taxi from Ballys was hassle-free. Be sure to tip the bellmen, housekeeping, and anyone else who provides good service in Vegas. They rely on our tips to supplement their salaries.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel - great value for the money!”
Reviews.Author: MSmom1965Mississippi
Reviews.Content: I got a great rate so I wasn't too sure what to expect, but this was a very nice hotel. I booked a cheaper room but they were full at check in so I got a free upgrade to the newly remodeled room. Room was very clean, and had plenty of room. Bathroom was spotless. There were plenty of hangers in the closet, and there was an iron and board (not that I used them). There were a couple of reasons I didn't rate this hotel a 5 star- 1. No coffee maker in the room. Almost all hotels have a coffee maker now, and I really like my coffee in the morning while I get dressed. I sure missed one here. 2. No fan in the bathroom. The only sink and counter was in the bathroom, so the mirror was fogged up after a shower. Our housekeeper was great every day. I asked for extra towels and paper cups, and I got a big stack of both. The hotel location was excellent - right in the middle of the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome view”
Reviews.Author: Heather K
Reviews.Content: Had an awesome view at Balley's, got to watch the Bellagio fountain every 15 minutes (while we were in the room) and the strip looked like a postcard. Room was half the size of my house, clean and beautifully decorated. Was in the older tower, but looked fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Good Balance of Strip Experience & Retreat”
Reviews.Author: RiKiTiKiNiKi
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at Bally's LV Hotel twice, both times with friends. What I appreciate about the hotel is its location and proximity to the typical Strip stuff, and also being a pleasant place to relax in a clean environment. Upgrades abound, and there are lots of dining options within a ten-minute walk. For those who haven't visited the Strip much, I think it's a good balance between crowd-control, convenience, and Strip fun. Go to the pool. Don't bother with the expensive drinks at the cabana bar, just relax and enjoy the birds that hang out in the lush foliage around the pools. This is one of the perks of Bally's.

Reviews.Title: “It was okay”
Reviews.Author: MJonesAZ
Reviews.Content: We went to Las Vegas for my daughters 21st birthday, we always stay at Harrah's but they were booked, so we stayed at Bally's, we knew this was an old hotel, so like the other reviews suggested, we made sure we had a room in the newer north tower. it was just okay, the beds were uncomfortable and the room was okay. Coctail waitress are difficult to find in the casino and there are not a lot of choices for quick inexpensive food, and they have NO STARBUCKS. We are going back to Las Vegas in December and were staying at Harrah's. We know were not booking in 4 star hotels. but for the money Harrah's is much better

Reviews.Title: “BED BUGS and 6 welts size of Quarters. No customer service.”
Reviews.Author: marrrrr
Reviews.Content: Just left the flea bag.Oops I mean Bedbug bag. Got 6 quarter size bites And No customer service. Soo disappointed. Don't stay unless u Like to be treated like crap :(

Reviews.Title: “Horrible customer service.”
Reviews.Author: Jdino117
Reviews.Content: Customer service is some of the worst I have ever seen. The hotel staff were nice, but refused to go out of their way to assist the customer when booking issues arise. Will never stay there because of this. Book elsewhere and save yourself possible trouble.

Reviews.Title: “Ok not bad just too far from strip”
Reviews.Author: mjmisgka
Reviews.Content: The reason I give this three stars is because it is far off the strip and the escalators did not work all week! One nice feature is that it is connected to the Paris Hotel & Casino. However the self parking is connected to the Paris, so you have another long walk too and from the parking garage. If you like this check out the Flamingo and Harrahs.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience at Bally's Las Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: lovegamlin
Reviews.Content: We arrived from our flight at about 1:30 pm on a Sunday. We took a shuttle for $6.50 per person from the airport. We were lucky that we were the first stop, as the shuttle drops people off at all hotels. Check in was very courteous, however our room was not ready for 3 hours. we had reserved a suite in the North Tower for our 35th wedding anniversary, so we wanted to wait for the suite we reserved. we put our luggage with the bellman and went to gamble for a while. The desk took our cell phone number and called us when the room was cleaned. ( The room supposedly had a "rush" on it!)--actually besides the slow room, everything else was wonderful. The room was beautiful and very clean. Some of the furniture was a little outdated, but still attractive. They need to update the TVs..but still ok. The bed was comfortable. We like the thermostat--it was easy to set the temp. We were forunate to be on the "Diamond floor" so we did have a coffee maker. The other rooms do not have one. we did not have a refrigerator. There is a difference in Vegas and Atlantic City--Vegas seems to have the "old" ways of amenities in the rooms. We did have a large, beautiful jacuzzi, a separate shower, separate toilet, double--his and hers sinks--and a bidet..( I think that is what it is called..lol..) anyway..room very nice. Casino---pretty good variety of slots, table games and video poker--better than some casinos. All the waitresses we encountered were great! They got to know us the 4 days we were ther and remembered what we liked to drink. Food--the Bally's Steakhouse has the best service that I have ever had in an upscale restaurant. The filet migon I had melted in my mouth and although expensive, it was enough for me and my niece to share. My husband had the "add-on" LB of king crab legs and it was the largest crab leg meat I have ever seen--and I live on the coast! Anyway, the best food, cooked perfect and the best staff!!..well worth it if you want to splurge..or charge to your room and try to get it comped off. Check out was just a good. We decided to talk to a host before we left and see what we could get comped off. They were very nice and we were very pleased. I thank the staff at Bally's for making our 35th anniversary the best trip!!

Reviews.Title: “The Heart of the Vegas Strip”
Reviews.Author: 50-and-retired
Reviews.Content: The location is worth more than the room and the room was nice. Why not stay in a clean comfortable room in the middle of the vegas strip for as little as possible? We have been to Vegas many times and usually look for deals. Sometimes you get what you pay for, a cheap hotel for a cheap rate. THIS WAS A DEAL! Clean, quality, a great location and at a great price. The hotel connects to Paris and is across the strip from Balligio's amaising fountains.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: baunkst
Reviews.Content: Outstanding hotel! Pet friendly!!! Room and service -- first rate!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and pool area”
Reviews.Author: Scandinavian54
Reviews.Content: We visited this hotel mid 70's so had to get back there this summer. When we visited there +30years ago it was the talk of the town, very top rated. Not it is probably the cheapest choice in the Strip. It is not the best hotel on the Strip, on the contrary, but the location sure is great, walking distance to all major Strip hotels. The rooms are of good size, could use some update though. All the necessities are there, no thrills though. We spent a lot of time around the splendid pool area, you would not get any idea that you are in the middle of the Strip, more like some Caribean or Mediterranian resort. The pool itself is better than most Vegas pool, here you can also swim, not just sit by the pool and take occasional dip in the water, the pool is large and deep enough for actual swimming. We did not gamble so no idea of the action there. We spent 3 nights here and enjoyed the relaxed pool and the very central location on the Strip. If you are looking for an economical hotel with some Strip atmosphere, this is a good choice. Not the best hotel on Strip but definitely good value for your money. No need for a car, so you start boozing at breakfast !!

Reviews.Title: “Stay in the North Tower”
Reviews.Author: SuziQ22
Reviews.Content: First, my bias is that I'm not a Vegas fan, but came for a family reunion. I had stayed in Harrah's about 10 years ago for a conference and was not impressed, so was glad that the family wanted to stay somewhere different. My cousins and I decided not to upgrade to the North Tower of Bally's like our parents did, and we were sorry we didn't. The family members who stayed in the North Tower were all satisfied. Like many hotels in Vegas, the smoke smell hits you when you walk in, and even if you are on a non-smoking floor, it stays in your clothes/hair. Our room in the South tower was basically an economy room that had seen better days. The hallways were dimly lit and the carpet was old with lots of suspicious-looking stains (puke puddles is my guess). One day the cleaning crew had a box of "Urine Off" in the hallway - nice! There were yellow stains on the wall in our bathroom - we didn't want to know. The shower/tub combo has old sliding doors that didn't work too well, and the old showerhead sprayed all over as well. And I think I saw some mold in the caulking, luckily I am pretty blind without contacts and I decided not to check once they were in. The one plus was the room was large so having a rollaway bed was not a problem. I slept on it and it wasn't too bad, just squeaky for my cousins to hear every time I rolled around! The first night it was a little hard to get used to the "boom" sound of the compressed air from the Bellagio fountains across the street. I don't think they run the fountains all night long, or maybe I just got used to them. The wallpaper is peeling, the dresser was old, as was the TV, but overall we agreed it could have been worse, and we weren't hanging out in the room a whole lot. But for $170/night on the weekend, it could have been better. I wish we wouldn't have been so cheap and upgraded for the $20/night more they offered. We just didn't know better.

Reviews.Title: “many complaints”
Reviews.Author: Debbie F
Reviews.Content: we stayed at ballys oct 2011 the first thing when we arrived the timeshare people stated that they were hotel check inso we follwed them wasted 15 minutes of our time we were tired and exhausted just wanted to unpack and have a beverage it was 1 am then through out our stay the price of beverages changed through out the day same drink 3 different prices the beds are old and very hard not easy to get sleep most of the staff were unfriendly no one smiled it was odd as i had never been to vegas and knew that alot of people work for their tips so needless to say i came home with more then i expected because i did not tip like i thought i would was pleasantly surprised by other hotels staff definitely would pick some where else to stay house keeping theres another issue they did not take dirty glasses from room in the 6 days we stayed makes me wonder what other short cuts they take

Reviews.Title: “South Tower”
Reviews.Author: Michael P
Reviews.Content: It is time to implode Bally`s this place is a dump,buckled dirty carpeting. Not a good restaurant in sight. Sarcastic employees. Never again.

Reviews.Title: “Average, although better than expected”
Reviews.Author: KermitNC
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 nights at this hotel while attending a conference at the Convention Center. The hotel was right in the middle of The Strip. I stayed in the North Tower, which was recently renovated ($20/day surcharge). As with all Vegas hotels, one had to walk through the casino to get anywhere and every public area was smoke filled. But my non-smoking room had no trace of smoke. The grounds and lobby did not have any interesting displays like many of the newer hotels. It was connected to Paris via an indoor “streets” that emulated France. It was also connected to the monorail station via an indoor mall. There was a workout area that cost $22/day, which was so outrageous that I did not use the facilities. There were several overpriced but decent restaurants onsite and the indoor mall had a couple of inexpensive places to eat (Sbarro Italian, Nathan’s deli, sushi). The room was quite large and quiet, except minor outside Vegas noise. Décor was pleasant. Everything, including carpet, was clean. Bed was comfortable enough. Bathroom had granite countertop and tiled shower. The toilet sounded like a freight train though. There was an old TV, a small laptop-size safe, no coffee or refrigerator. Internet access was wireless, not blazing speed but serviceable, and cost $13.99 a day ($24/day if you want to use it in other areas of the hotel). Summary If you want to stay on The Strip, this hotel is in a good location with nice size, quiet, reasonably priced rooms and good access to the monorail. Overall, it’s not bad but nothing spectacular. Be aware of the potential extra charges ($14/day for internet, $22/day for workout, $20/day for refurbished rooms). I think I would stay elsewhere next time though.

Reviews.Title: “LOCATION & SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: sctraveler4519
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a North Tower upgrade($10 per nite). Well worth it because of the south tower rooms still in need of upgrade. The things that make Ballys great are the location and the service. I felt the service has gotten better since my last visit and the pit crews-especially Tyrone,Christopher, and Mike really treat you right. The easy access to Paris and the center strip also make Ballys the best value on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Poker Room Review Only: Very Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: pick6king
Reviews.Content: This is a review of the poker room only. I played in a small tournament here recently. It was my first time in this casino. I found the poker room staff, including the dealers, to be very friendly and competent. There were some rookies in the field, and the dealers made them very comfortable while still managing to keep the action moving.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: admtiger
Reviews.Content: We stayed five nights in the North Tower. The room was good sized and very clean and kept that way every day. The view wasn't the best but have run into that at other hotels also. We would have liked a coffee pot and small fridge. The casino was clean and not very smokey. It is a good location on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, hotel needs a make-over.”
Reviews.Author: Duckling5
Reviews.Content: Rooms were okay, not super clean ie: carpet stains, mildew in the shower. Was cheap and convenient but wouldn't stay here again. Buffet was okay but head over to the Paris Hotel for your meals AMAZING!!!

Reviews.Title: “JUST EXPECTED MORE”
Reviews.Author: chin00k
Reviews.Content: It was virtually my husband's and my first time to Vegas since neither one of us had been there since the 70's! Check in was fairly quick but our desk clerk started by telling us that we only had the classic room and asked us if we would like an upgrade? I asked what would that mean because I had nothing to compare it to since this was our first time here. He said it would be $20 and that we would have a view of the strip. I thought that would be nice so agreed. Went up to our room and it did have a view of the strip....I mean, I could see other hotel lights & signs and cars but the actual room was no better than a standard Queen room in any Best Western or the like....some of them we've been in have been better! Someone had also put their fist through the wall beside the bed. yikes! Silly me, when I checked out, we had been charged the $20 each of the 4 nights we were there. That never occurred to me since I had heard other Vegas goers say that they'd slip the desk clerk a 20 and get a really nice room...that's what I expected too. Just didn't expect it to be a daily thing. I won't fall for that again! I must say, the beds are sooooo comfortable and the pillows just perfect. Room service was very prompt and the delivery people very friendly. We had supper at Ballys Steakhouse and our waiter, John was so accommodating and patient. We just wanted to chill and chat over appetizers and wine to start and he left us alone but seemed to know when we were ready for our entree and was attentive without rushing us. The very best thing about Ballys is how central it is. You can walk to Paris and not even go outside....though I thought we were at first!! The monorail is right there and so are buses that will drop you right at the door of other hotels/casinos. Good little Tequila restaurant there too and they are the friendliest people ever and just make you feel like you are a regular there! In fact, I think that's their motto!! I guess I could say that because it was in Vegas, we never spent much time in our room...only to sleep but that's not the point. We just expected more and though we will return to Vegas, I doubt we will stay at Ballys again.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: MarilynJ6354
Reviews.Content: My best friend and I stayed here in room 2238 October 20-24. We paid in advance for an upgrade to the North Tower (we had booked a free room in the South Tower). For the $11 more per day, it was well worth it although a few people told me they got a free upgrade when they checked in, so for the time you spend in the room it's probably best to book the South Tower and maybe you will get an upgrade. Our room was HUGE, but the North Tower rooms don't have a nice view, except at night. The rooms do not face the strip/Bellagio. But the staff was excellent, including housekeeping. Even the gambling was great. The only complaint I have is they charge you $3/day to use the safe, which I think is ridiculous. We could have gambled that money instead! The beds were very comfortable, but the tv channels were very limited. I guess they don't want you in the room. We rented a car and used the valet daily. They were fast and courteous. The location is excellent, within easy walking distance to so many strip hotels, so we only used the car to go Downtown and outlying areas. We have stayed at other Harrah's hotels and I think Bally's is one of the best.

Reviews.Title: “Return to Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Zwinbawie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to Las Vegas to have a nice weekend. He reserved at the Bally's from Saturday to Tuesday. At check-in, we were upgraded to the North Tower which is closer to the entrance. Everyone was friendly from the front desk, bell captain, rewards desk, pool people up to the room cleanning personal .The hotel has not changed since i went last time 2006. The only thing we did not like was the heavy cigarette smell around lobby and casino area. We crossed to the Paris(we found employees were not as friendly as Ballys). We spent a lot of time at the Cosmopolitan( which is almost in front of the BALLY'S and more upscale. Excellent service and a lot nice restaurants. We had dinner at Jaleo(Spanish Tapas restaurant) kind of high price, but excellent service and quality of food. We visit Planet Hollywood too noisy. Of course, the Cesar and Wynn classy as always and service very good.

Reviews.Title: “If you smoke, you'll like it here..”
Reviews.Author: mags1951
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and two other couples stayed at Ballys this past October. The rooms were clean, nice new bathrooms but the smoke in the lobby area and casinos was UNBEARABLE! Everyone there was smoking cigarettes or cigars and our hair and clothes smelled awful. One night we tried to sit in a small club off the lobby and the cigar smoke was killing us! we had to leave. We walked through other hotel lobbies, like the Bellagio, Venetian and Winn (gorgeous hotel) and the air in the casino areas in those hotels was just fine . I would not stay at this hotel again. Pay a little more for a better hotel, it's worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Second time here, probably the last”
Reviews.Author: canyonbound
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to Vegas and second stay at Bally's. The location cannot be beat. The rooms are large but lack amenities that most other hotels offer now - no refrigerator or microwave, for example. Very few TV stations, not that one goes to Vegas to watch TV. There was a rather gross stain on the desk chair. Enough said about that. Check in was okay, but we had a buffet package, and we had to ask how the package worked, and then it was not explained to us correctly. We had problems when we went to a few of the restaurants. It all was sorted out but front desk staff should have known better. I see with other reviews people have booked and then found the same room much cheaper if they had waited, and we fall into this category as well. The same package we booked was almost $50 cheaper a few weeks later, and it was prepaid, and non-refundable. Keep checking back to get better rates. Housekeeping appears to only come around once a day to collect room service trays / dishes, so when we checked in the tray already outside our room was still there until the next afternoon. Breakfast buffet in the restaurant is strange; half of the things listed on the board outside the restaurant as part of the buffet still have to be ordered off the menu. It wasn't that the hotel was "bad", but there were just enough little things that weren't quite right that should we come back, we will try another property.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place to Sleep”
Reviews.Author: Roadmite
Reviews.Content: This is one of the older places midway on the strip but it still has that Vegas appeal. Great location and the rooms are large. Has a casino and eating places and is connected to the Paris. Very nice.

Reviews.Title: “never again”
Reviews.Author: Rose H
Reviews.Content: As a group staying at this hotel, we were very disappointed. Our reservations were not recognized in the system even though we had our printed confirmations. The rooms were very run down -as they had to find us some rooms. That must explain the sale price of $79 a night. We were also interupted by the cleaning/housekeeping on the last night becasue they insisted that we were supose to have been checked out. After all of this and there was no appology or off for compensation for this horible stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed at all in the South Tower”
Reviews.Author: Sean S
Reviews.Content: I stayed on 65 in the South Tower for a convention in October 2011. The first impression of the room was terrible. The A/C was not working and the room was warm and stuffy.
