After resetting the thermostat and verifying that it was on, the A/C was not keeping up. The carpet was stained and lumpy. The bathroom had some "stuff" on the floor. I could feel the springs through the bed. The TV was the old Tube type. The furniture was old and disgusting. I certainly would not put my clothes in the dresser. The safe was older and I could not fit my small laptop in the safe. I am not happy or impressed and felt like I was staying in an older budget motel. The room felt dirty and the climate control was useless. I would NOT stay here ever again. On another note, my colleague is staying in the North Tower and said his room was not bad. I don't have any more details.

Reviews.Title: “Average at best. Vegas is way too expensive these days!”
Reviews.Author: dfndr90
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at Bally's Las Vegas. I was in the renovated North Tower. If this is newly renovated, I cannot imagine what the South tower rooms are like. The room was just average. The carpets need replacing, the TV was a conventional 21". Even the La Quinta I recently stayed in had new flat screens. There was no microwave, or fridge in the room. These should be standard. Of course there is a very good reason for this.....they do not want you in the room. They want you downstairs gambling....Ugh! I am not a gambler, and was there on business. Everything in Vegas is outrageously expensive. Everything. An iced vanilla latte $8.00. Any burger from just about anywhere $13.00 minimum. Breakfast in the cafe was $18.00. A bowl of oatmeal $5.99. I think everything in Vegas needs to be 50% less. I do recommend the little liquor store across the street on the North side of the hotel. A liter bottle of water $0.79 cents. It's a little sundry store with lots of different snack foods, toiletries, a decent wine selection, great prices, and open 24 hours. The casino is easy to navigate, but way too smoky compared to other casinos. Very tight slots, and expensive tables. I'm not a big gambler, so maybe I'm a little critical here. The Spa is very nice though. They have nice cardio equipment and a very nice weight room. The connection to the Paris is nice. Overall, it was an okay place to stay. I would look to other newer strip hotels before I would pick Bally's again. The one positive is the location as it is central to many other casinos one might want to visit. For example, it's about a 10 minute walk to the Forum Shops, and maybe 5 to 6 minutes from Bellagio. The new area around The Cosmopolitan, Vdara, and Aria is very nice.

Reviews.Title: “I stay in this hotel the week of the 10th OCT run as fast as you can from this place.”
Reviews.Author: roblee f
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Ballys for a conference and was placed in the south tower. The hall way carpet was dirty and stained. The furniture was from the 60s and was turn and the beds were the worst I have seen in a hotel. My wife swears there was bed bugs in it. I complained and was moved to the north tower. The beds where new but not better. The Tv in both room was the old tube type and the Chanel selection was poor. For the money the charge you can do allot better on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Ballys - My 50th BD - Outstanding Service!”
Reviews.Author: Yukon2010
Reviews.Content: Each time we return to Ballys we get better treatment and excellent customer service! This visit was the most memorable....We are delighted to have become valued customers. To Eric the Sterling Bruch Chef....sorry to publically embarass you Big Guy but you are the best! From the jacuzzi upgrade, the front desk check in, the room service and the Brunch we had a fantastic visit! This is our home base when we go to Vegas...and simply stated ....it will always be...I wont get into the many splendid things that Eric did for us but...it was heart felt and very generous...thank you Ballys and thank you Eric...see you in February..!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Just my opinion”
Reviews.Author: Reginaoma
Reviews.Content: Just wanted to write a few things about our experience of staying at the Bally's Oct. 17-21.We booke with westjetvacations,the flight was good.Just one thing,do not take the shuttlebus from the airport,even the transfer is included in your vacation,we lost about 2 hours,it took that long to get to the Bally's.We were the lost ones to get dropped off.It cost you just 12 or 13 dollars by cab and you are at the hotel in about 20 minutes.Now to the hotel,checkin was quick.We did get a room at the southtower,the rooms are very big,we had a view of the Bellagiofountains,that was nice,but the rooms are very outdated,scrachted furniture,marks on the walss,not once vacuumde during our stay,very sloppy cleaning like spots on the bathroom mirrors very never cleanded off either.the only good thing about this hotel is the location,it is midstrip and you can walk in every direction quite easy.Spend a little bit more and get something nicer and maybe cleaner.Also there was a very ugly smell in the roomeven it was a nonsmoking room.Next time we pay alittle bit more and get something better.And by the way,don't play the slots in this hotel,they are not paying a thing.

Reviews.Title: “Oldie but Goodie”
Reviews.Author: PatF_8
Reviews.Content: Bally's is often thought of as one of the older, less hip places on the strip, but it provided us with everything we needed for an enjoyable trip to Vegas. Perfectly located on the central part of the strip, it was easy to get to wherever we wanted to go by foot or by the monorail station right at Bally's. The staff was excellent at all turns and went above and beyond to meet our needs. The upgrade to the North Tower provided us with a spacious, clean room. Our Total Rewards cards brought us perks on room and food. We will certainly return here for our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Bally's was great!”
Reviews.Author: Pam S
Reviews.Content: We were at Bally's with friends from Sept. 25 to Oct. 2 and it was wonderful. The rooms were clean, the cleaner was wonderful, the staff were friendly at check in and check out. Casino was great, as were the restaurants and shops. Bonus was that Paris was next door. No compaints, we were in the North Tower. Will stay there again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Great price and Great view. Older but nice”
Reviews.Author: cnnroma
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the South tower. The room was huge. We had a great view of the Eifel tower and Bellagio fountains and entire strip. Room was clean. Furniture a little dinged and bathroom dingy but still very clean. We were only in the room to sleep -- so it was a great value at $40.00 a night.

Reviews.Title: “North tower crappy upgraded view”
Reviews.Author: Iwillnfa
Reviews.Content: So we upgraded prior to coming and they told us we were to be upgraded on the check in- I feel that they lied- this whole thing on upgrades is a ploy- our overlook was to the roofs and south toward buildings and could see the Eiffel tower between buildings. Room smells like smoke despite on a non smoking room and floor- being a past smoker I can smell it. Room furniture seems as reused and worn. Bed no bad- pillows not feathered- foamy and bouncy but pseudo comfortable . Thermostat seems like either is cold or too warm. Froze the first night but that may have been self done. Bathroom seemed clean tiles were nice and coffee maker in room- no fridge. Shower nice and hot forceful head but towels are skimpy- need bigger and softer towels- size of bathroom good for two but not three- even if kids- overall for 149 per night w conference seems ok, next time gonna splurge for more room.

Reviews.Title: “Huge, has everything, not too smoky”
Reviews.Author: Carrotty
Reviews.Content: I hate huge hotels, and hate smoky casinos even more. But Bally's provided a good experience for a two-day conference. The rooms are enormous, clean and comfortable. Wifi cost $10 a day, which is a gouge. I had to walk through the casino a dozen times a day, and even though I could smell cigarette smoke, it wasn't as bad as it could have been. I was pleasantly surprised. A person has to enjoy walking, because the place is huge. It's easy to be disoriented at first, but I quickly learned to navigate. Staff is helpful and friendly, which is saying a lot for a busy place like this. I wasn't happy they charged conference registrants nearly twice the online room price.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for regular people”
Reviews.Author: dim6family
Reviews.Content: I'm not into the smugness of those mega resorts like Bellagio. I'm more of a regular guy who loves to gamble among friend players and dealers, so whenever I go to Vegas I stay at Ballys. It's in the center of everything on the strip, yet a feel of downtown with low limits, and a very relaxed and friendly atmosphere. The rooms are big and clean, if not modern, but who stays in the room too much when in Sin City. The bell, front desk, valet and cleaning services are all top notch. We stay there every year and are never disappointed. If you are a big shot and going to vegas, stick to those massive hotels, but if you are a regular guy who wants to be treated like a big shot then Ballys is the place.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: DONALDDORAN
Reviews.Content: Centrally located. Close to everything. I've stayed at Bally's several times(at least 15) and never had a bad room, North or South Tower. Tip the check-in person and you can have whatever room you want. Never has it taken longer than 15 min to check in. Get over the smokey casino, you have that almost everywhere. Valet parking is excellent.Some people on here are way too picky! E-mail at ddoran@mchsi.com if you have any questions or concerns.

Reviews.Title: “First time experience”
Reviews.Author: daveandjoann
Reviews.Content: The rooms themselves were clean and neat , however the furniture was old and badly worn in spots. Halls had a musty smell. I would rate the room as comparable to a Holiday In Express, Casino floor was kept up, The Upscale restaurant in the Hotel was clean, well appointed and the meal was excellent. Staff was very helpfull.

Reviews.Title: “Pleased with our stay at Bally's”
Reviews.Author: TropicaltravelerMO
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Bally's Las Vegas Hotel & Casino October 4th - 6th. We booked a standard room which ended up being in the South tower. Upon entering our room we were very pleased. The room was spacious and clean with a great view of the Bellagio fountains and the strip. We stayed in room 7017 and had no trouble with any surrounding noise. One evening we ate at the Tequila Bar and enjoyed $2.00 taco's and margarita's. One morning we ate breakfast at Bally's Sidewalk Cafe which was very tasty, and another morning we ate at the Flamingo breakfast buffet which was very very good. If we were to return to Las Vegas we would not think twice about staying at Bally's again.

Reviews.Title: “Frustration”
Reviews.Author: Maikolo
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here many times as a kid on family vacations, and thought that this was a classy hotel. But that was ten years ago. Now, this hotel ranks as one of the WORST based on my recent stay. Check out my break down below. Hotel Property: Hotel property is pretty average, nothing special or unique. If anything, it actually looks outdated compared the the other hotels on the strip. As you walk into the hotel the smell of cigarette and cigar smoke overwhelms you. But, that's normal for a lot hotels in Vegas. Bally's is connected to the Paris hotel with a small row of shops and restaurants. Pool area is big but that's all its got going for it. Looks like it's straight out of the 70's, all the pool furniture is old and crusty. Don't expect quality service at the pool area either. Hotel has a gym but you must pay $22 per day to use it. Nobody wants to work out that bad, c'mon. Room: I was told when I checked in that I was receiving an upgraded room because they did not have a single king size bed that I requested when I reserved the room. Of course, I was excited and agreed to except the upgrade instead of taking a room with two queen size beds. But when I stepped into my room, oh how I was upset. I was in what use to be the living room area of an old suite. This room looked like no one had stayed here since the 70's. All the furniture was sooo outdated and dirty. My bed was a "fold-out" bed out of the wall!!! I of course called the front desk and they told me that there were no rooms left and that I could not change rooms until the next day. Riiight... So in short, be careful of the so called upgrade at Bally's. You will probably get a bigger room, but it just be a bigger dump. Casino: The casino was average. Nothing special, mostly old slot machines and no one at the tables. Cigarette and cigar smoke is pretty bad there because they do nothing to try and mask the smell like most new casinos do now. They must have bad ventilation in there or something because you will feel dirty just from the walk from the front door to the elevators. Customer Service: I arrived at the Bally's in the afternoon and the lady at the front desk was sooo unpleasant. She seriously looked like she would rather be eating glass than work there. She had a big frown on here face and was very short with me. There was no hello, have a nice day, or anything. It was pretty depressing. My toilet was broken when I got to my room and it was making this screeching loud noise. It was so loud that even with both doors closed you could hear it from two doors down in the hall. But the worst part is, I had to complain about it for two days before anyone would fix it. I had to personally search out a maintenance person to come to my room and fix it. This took a total of 5 phone calls to maintenance and the front desk before I finally had to just search for someone myself. Took him about an hour to replace parts in the toilet and then he said that I could have fixed it myself. I couldn't believe it! Conclusion: All in all, I would say that the Bally's has long surpassed it's prime. It seems like it's falling apart in all areas. I have seen little effort to keep the hotel rooms and property updated. Unfortunately the staff is not what it use to be either. Nobody cares about their jobs or the customer. I really wish I could have given Bally's a good review because I had so many good memories here, but this stay was just the worst i've had in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “A real nice stay”
Reviews.Author: johnamg
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Bally's from 10/8 to 10/12 for a convention. Booked 2 rooms and was upgraded to North Tower upon checking in at 10:30 am. The rooms were both ready. We loved the location, centrally located on the strip. Very convenient to Paris or Bellagio. The room was clean and the bathroom had granite counter top. Beds were very comfortable. Would definitely stay here again for our next trip. Staff was friendly & helpful. There was a line but it only took us 10 minutes to check in on a Sat morning. The only negative thing was the casino was very smoky. You have to walk through the casino to get to the elevator to the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location”
Reviews.Author: DingDongNobody
Reviews.Content: I reserved this hotel on Hotels.com on September 19, 2011 for a stay from September 30 to October 3, 2011. The total costs (including taxes and fees) was $531. I had up to September 27, 2011 to cancel my reservation. On September 28, 2011, I checked again on the same web site and I could have obtained the same room for $243. Unfortunately, I could not cancel my reservation. Because, the month of October is not overly popular, I would recommand to wait until the last minute to reserve your hotel to benefit from excellent deals available. Our room at the Bally's was outdated, Furniture from the 1980's and bathroom needs to be renovated. However, the room was big and had a large window facing the Eiffel tower which was great. The hotel is connected to the Paris. Therefore, there are plenty of nice restaurants easily accessible. The hotel is right accross from the Bellagio. If location is more important that quality of hotel, I strongly recommand the Bally's.

Reviews.Title: “5000 mile Roadtrip Stop 11”
Reviews.Author: Martin_Joan
Reviews.Content: Exterior: Stands back at good location on South Strip, Station approach theme with moving walkway and escalators. Reception: Car valet, bellboy and desk all friendly and wecoming, felt they were really pleased that we had chosen Bally's - Very good Ease of access:Just superb, valet parks car, bell takes cases, desk clerk directs us to lift - what could be better? Room: Huge, desk, table, monster armchair, office chair, ottoman at end of bed, wall to wall plush headboard for really comfortable bed. Seperate dressing area, with wash basin and mirror, then en suite with bath/shower, wash basin and loo. Excellent value for money. Breakfast: Not provided, room only basis. We used Sidewalk Cafe and ordered from the 'sides' menu as the buffet was immense but not what we wanted. Tips: Accept it is Las Vegas and expensive, at least twice the price of anywhere else we had been. Exception is room rates, something to do with gaming we think! Mention: Wow factor is what Vegas is about, but no coffee maker in room (common trait we understand) is just a little mean.

Reviews.Title: “impressed!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: oneeddy1
Reviews.Content: wasn't really wanting to stay here, but i would stay here over most other harrah's properites. room in the north tower was recently redone. pool was cool. tequila bar was GREAT!!!!!!!! THANK U STEVEN AND FANG!!!!!!!!!!!! their happy hour at night was excellent and the nachos were the largest i have ever seen! bedding nice. accessibility to paris property............close! right across the street, next door to bills gambling, is an italian restaurant (yum) and a sports bar, that prices for food and drink were very reasonable on flamingo only thing i didnt like was there sportsbook! outside of that..........great job bally's!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Las Vegas Loser”
Reviews.Author: NikkiN_11
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took our first trip to Vegas this year and we stayed at Bally's on a recommendation from a friend. However, he must have stayed in a different part of the hotel because we were not impressed. They have a renovated section which has air conditioning and a non air conditioned side which is the unrenovated part of the hotel. When we checked in we were asked if we would like to pay extra to stay in the air conditioned part which we agreed to because it sounded like a better room. There was nothing about the room that I liked and it was probably renovated a good number of years ago. The hotel was average in every sense of the word and we definitely would not stay there again. After walking the strip and going in just about every hotel, there are some much better choices probably for the same money. The pool was so far away from any of the rooms that it didn't seem worth the effort to go there, the shopping and restaurants within the hotel were also disappointing. We ate breakfast at the cafe on the casino floor and the staff were unpleasant and one was even quite rude. The best thing about Bally's was the location. Next door to the Paris and right across the street from the Bellagio, it was central to everything. Overall we enjoyed our trip to Vegas but give low marks to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, had an excelent view from the 22nd floor (South Tower)”
Reviews.Author: ilillo
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel, very good location. My room all though in the older south tower, was good. I do not mind older furniture or old TV sets. I had a 22nd floor room in the south tower, looking twards the Paris Hotel, and the Bellagio fountain. It was awesome. I was there for 4 nights and can say I have no complaints. The two queen beds were confortable and had clean sheets. The room was perfectly cleand every day when I came back from the trade show i visited. Would come back again.

Reviews.Title: “First time in Las Vegas was perfect”
Reviews.Author: OceanTravelerTroy_MO
Reviews.Content: We thought Bally's Hotel & Casino was very nice. We stayed in the older tower (South tower). We were very pleased with our room. Our room was big, clean, quiet, king size bed, nice size bathroom, great view, and good location. We could see the Bellagio fountains from our window. I was a little apprehensive about the standard room in the older tower due to some reviews on trip advisor but there is nothing to worry about. Check-in and check-out went very smooth and everyone working at the hotel is friendly and helpful. We went to Las Vegas for a wedding and had an enjoyable time.

Reviews.Title: “Better than I expected”
Reviews.Author: Vanna729
Reviews.Content: I just completed a 7-day stay at Bally's. I can honestly say that prior to the trip I was not looking forward to staying at this hotel. While the exterior of the building stands out like a sore thumb amidst all the new glitz and glamour of the Las Vegas Strip, and the casino is well worn, I have to give a thumbs up to my room. I stayed on the fifth floor in the North Tower. I believe the North Tower has the newest rooms. While my room was simple, it was spacious and clean. I felt safe and comfortable. The standard king room was extremely large and accomodated two desks, loveseat and coffee table along with the standard hotel room furniture. The bathroom was large, with good lighting, ample vanity space and towels were abundant. If you are a television watcher, you might be disappointed as the rooms have not yet converted to flat screens. My stay at Bally's was for business reasons. I ordered room service twice... once for breakfast and once for dinner. Both meals were delivered in less than 30 minutes and were hot and tasty. No complaints at all. If you don't care about the casino, and just need a decent room at a good price, then you might check out Bally's. It is centrally located on the Strip and connects to Paris which is a huge plus. I was at Paris multiple times during my stay both to connect with friends, for my business meeting, and to enjoy the shopping and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Clean but dated.”
Reviews.Author: fredheadsaskatoon
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Bally's last week on our first trip to Las Vegas. We booked the hotel as part of a package. We were initially given a standard room in the south tower that was large but very run down. The whole place could use a makeover, but this room was a little past a few supeficial shortcomings. I approached the woman at guest services the next day, (Kathy I believe) and explained our disappointment with the offering. She was very understanding and offered us a choice of two different rooms. We viewed both and settled on a suite in the south tower. It was very clean, (I even checked some of the less obvious places for dust) and spacious. It was still dated and in need of some repair, but a big step up from the first room. The room we passed on in the north tower had been more recently renovated and had a very nice bathroom, but I didn't like the view of the roof and airport. The hotel casino was fine though my luck wasn't great. A pretty decent band played in the open bar. The Mexican restaurant was to our liking and quick even though busy. There is also a pretty good Japanese place down at the end of the shopping area that was good value for Vegas. All of the staff we dealt with at the hotel were at least o.k., and many exceeded that, especially Kathy at the desk. The location couldn't be better.

Reviews.Title: “North Tower a Must!”
Reviews.Author: Ustravelgirl13
Reviews.Content: I recently spent four nights at Bally's and had a very nice experience. I wasn't for sure what to expect because I had heard this was an older, more run down hotel. I was lucky that when I checked in they upgraded my room for FREE and placed me in a suite in the North Tower. It was recently updated, very large room with a nice bathroom. My only complaint about the room was the tv was a bit outdated, but since I wasn't in the room much it really didn't matter. I did hear that the rooms in the South Tower were not as nice. It was very quiet and all the staff I had to deal with were friendly. My only other complaint is the Internet. Make sure you use the Bally's Internet. I accidently connected to what I thought was Bally's Internet but it was not. I paid for three days but only received one and there was not contact information to get ahold of the company to complain. Also, the gym is way overpriced. It is $22 per day, very small with outdated equipment. You are better off to take a stroll down the strip or workout in your room! Overall, nice trip to Vegas. Also location is great!

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad!”
Reviews.Author: SMLTC18
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a work event and was originally booked at the Paris but was switched to Bally's due to overbooking. I was pretty upset when I started looking at the pictures of the 2 hotels but once I checked in and saw the rooms myself it wasn't so bad. The room at Bally's was actually a little larger and looked more updated. The bed was comfortable. The room itself was fairly clean. There was some small wear and tear but it's Vegas...what do you expect. The bathroom was nice although the shower made some weird noises. As far as the hotel itself...I can't say too much about it as we did not spend much time there. I did enjoy the casino and atmosphere over at the Paris much more. The Bally's casino was just so much like many of the others we saw along the strip. The shops downstairs were nothing special. I did enjoy the Sabarro's pizza place that was still open at 4 am one morning! Got room service one morning and the pancakes and ham were excellent! The location for the hotel was excellent! Bottom line.....there was nothing really wrong with this location. I would reccommend it. However I don't know if I would stay here again given all the options available in Las Vegas. There just wasn't enough pop to make me say "Man I really have to go back there"

Reviews.Title: “Bally's is an old dirty hotel.”
Reviews.Author: linxey
Reviews.Content: Bally's is not a 3 star hotel. The staff are friendly and helpful. The hotel is really dirty. The rooms had thick thick dirty dust behind the dressers, beds and even the lamp and telephone were covered in dust. The drawer of the night table didn't close and previous travellers belongings were left in the drawer. The bathroom was never cleaned. There was hair stuck in the sink on check in. EWWWWW. The drink staff on the casino floor were for the most part polite, except for one. It is a really really old hotel and that would be okay if it wasn't do dirty. It was really noisy, banging, loud music all hours of the night. Sorry I stayed here, and wouldn't again.

Reviews.Title: “Not for non-smokers!”
Reviews.Author: MarvinAnchorage
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a conference. The lobby and casino have NO non-smoking areas that are separated by any barriers, so in effect there is absolutely nowhere to escape the smoke until you get to your room and the hallway leading to it. I had to walk through the very smoky casino to get to my room the North Tower. The conference rooms are smoky, too! This includes the ballroom, the meeting rooms, the hallways, everywhere. This hotel needs a better ventilation system! Conference attendees and presenters were red-eyed, sore-throated, and miserable. I rated it Average only because my North Tower room was quiet, spacious, and comfortable and the staff was great.

Reviews.Title: “Another good stay at Bally's”
Reviews.Author: dallasc5
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Bally's from October 2 thru 5th. I have stayed here before several times and have always had a good experience. The rooms are older, but clean and bigger than most of the other strip hotel rooms. The staff is always friendly, which makes the stay more pleasant. The casino is "tight", but that’s about par for Las Vegas, after all they did not build those BIG hotels on winners. I did manage to win $ 400.00 on a video poker machine the day I left which help cut my losses. Another thing I like about Bally's is it seems to attract more people my age (45) or older....not so many of the "kids" that just want to get drunk, loud and make an butt of themselves. I would defiantly recommend Bally's if your looking for a classic hotel that is comfortable and friendly. If you are looking for top end luxury with snobby employees and guest...don’t stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Trip”
Reviews.Author: ken m
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went on our trip Oct 2,2011." Vegas Baby" Stayed at Ballys Had a great time. Asked for a Comp up grade and ended up on 23 floor in North Tower, Very Large room with good view. The Bar was good with great service. We found everyone very frendly. The Hotel was very busy but we had no problems getting service. Great location,and lots of street enterment wright outside front door. I would stay there again, and tell my friends to do the same.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent bargain!”
Reviews.Author: NOLA14
Reviews.Content: We got lucky in that with our Total Rewards card we were able to get 6 nights for a total of $60 (average of $10 per night!). We stayed from a Wed-Tues. Our check-in was pretty smooth, though they did not have our reserved room ready. We were SUPPOSED to have a king-sized bed room in the South Tower for all 6 nights. They upgraded us for one night upon check-in to a king sized suite the first night. It was oldish and dated, BUT very spacious. We had his-and-hers vanity areas, sunken tub, separate shower AND a bidet (hey, who doesn't want that???) When we had to move the next night, we checked with the front desk and were actually "upgraded" for the next 5 nights to a king room in the north tower. VERY nice room (though the TV COULD be flat screened and a bit bigger to watch TV--ROLL TIDE) and no complaints. Everyone we encountered with Bally's was very nice, the location was centralized and great. Tequila's Bar had cheap and good food, Nosh was also good. Had a GREAT vacation. Like someone else said, I won no jackpot...I've also stayed at MGM Grand (loved it), Luxor (not bad), Treasure Island (a favorite) The Flamingo (soft spot for that one) and Venetian (WOW)--didn't win a jackpot in any of those places either!

Reviews.Title: “Much better than expected”
Reviews.Author: OcalaGator
Reviews.Content: After reading a lot of the reviews I started looking for another hotel but the prices were much higher and time was short. I'm glad I stuck with Ballys. The Good- Excellent location on the strip. Walking distance to great hotels/casinos. Connected by a nice walkway to Paris. (walk thru shops, restaurants etc) Short walk to Paris's buffet. (ate breakfast and it was very good) Rooms in NORTH TOWER were very large, clean and comfortable. Had a great view from room 2124. Coffee stand next to check-in is open all night and have great coffee and Krispy Kreem donuts! Smoke in casino was not real bad. (could have been better) Bills Gambling Casino is next door (formerly Barbary Coast). Had an excellent prime rib dinner for 15 bucks. (VERY good) Valet was fast and very pleasant. Mexican restaurant was very good. (Nachos will feed 4 people). The Bad Check-in was a little slow with only 4 clerks but clerk was very nice. Room walls are thin so bring ear plugs unless you like hearing the neighbors at 2am...if you know what I mean. DO NOT eat at Ballys $10.99 breakfast buffet (bad). Go to Paris's for 5.00 more. This was my first time at BALLY'S and will return.

Reviews.Title: “First time staying and I Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: salo0061
Reviews.Content: My Bf and I stayed here for a friends birthday from Sept. 11- 14. We arrived around 10am and after waiting in the check in line for about 10 min we were able to get a room early. We had originally booked a south tower room but we received an offer to upgrade to a north tower room for 10 a night. I loved this room! It was very spacious and the bed was comfortable. The room did have a coffee maker which i did not use. The only thing that I did not like was the shower because although it did have good pressure a lot of water fell onto the bathroom floor. I loved that Ballys and Paris are connected because during the summer its very hot outside and i get sunburned easily so walking through the air conditioned casinos make it much better. The sports book was hard to find at first but we figured out it was downstairs and u can take the guest elevators to go there. We ate at the tequila bar... theyre open til 6 am and its a good place to go if ur looking for cheap food and drinks... they have $2 tequila shots, margaritas, tacos, or draft beer. We didnt have to wait for a table which was great. we also checked in on facebook and received a buy one get one free drink at any casino bar and we found a casino bar that had $3 draft blue moon and we were able to use the coupon there which was awesome! When we were checking out we didnt have to wait in line and the check out person checked to see if we had any comp dollars on our accounts which no one had ever done before so i appreciated that very much! all in all i would definitely recommend this hotel to everyone because of the central location and because of the awesome rooms! =)

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location yet inconvenient neccessities”
Reviews.Author: luckynutmeg
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Bally's for a business trip for three nights. There were several issues I encountered here. First, they do charge for wired and wireless Internet - $14/day for room access and $25/day for whole hotel access. The food service was horrendous - it took then fifteen minutes to cook a breakfast sandwich, and I refused to leave a tip at the Tex Mex restaurant because of the lack of service. The entire hotel smells of smoke, so if you are allergic, stay away! Even my non-smoking room had a stale smoke odor. There are a distinct lack of outlets in the bedroom - I could choose to charge my phone or my laptop but not both at once. When I arrived, it took the woman fifteen minutes to check me in, although she was being trained by another front desk person. The trainer was rude to me while I checked in and acted as though I was unwelcome. It took them ten minutes to locate my reservation because the trainee kept looking under my first name and not my last name (they are distinctly different - no reason why she should confuse them), and the trainer accused me of cancelling my reservation and showing up anyway. I will NEVER stay here again and will tell all of my clients and associates to go to another hotel/resort instead.

Reviews.Title: “Annual Trip”
Reviews.Author: John C
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my wife and three other couples. Upon check-in I was told they had only smoking rooms left. I explained that I couldn't stand the smell of smoke. I was told the only thing they could do was move me the next day. I then was taken aback when two of the three couples I was traveling with received non smoking rooms after I had checked in. I have worked in hotels my whole life I get that on a sold out night you are going to have to upset someone but why wouldn't you give the guest that shows up first their preference. I understand that higher rated players are going to get their room choice first but the people behind me where first timers to Bally's. The move of the rooms the next day was not smooth. The new keys didn't work and I had to go down to the front desk again. I stay at Bally's becasue I like the location and the pool. The pool it self is old but the staff at the pool is great.

Reviews.Title: “right on the strip”
Reviews.Author: notkersegg
Reviews.Content: The Bally's is well situated next to Hotel Paris and Hotel Bellagio. The rooms are large but poorly equipped (e.g. without fridge). Nice pool.

Reviews.Title: “Vegas Trip”
Reviews.Author: M B
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in Vegas many times staying at Harrahs.. thought I would try a new hotel and I picked Bally's BIG MISTAKE!!! Hotel room was terrible, dirty carpet, air conditioner did not work, safe did not work, we asked for a new room they gave us one no problem however the safe didnt work, the phone did not work and it was a old room. This hotel was a great location but I will never stay here again. The entrance to the strip was a pain to get to when the moving sidewalks did not work the escalators did not work hallways were hot. All in all not happy with this hotel at all. Casino was very smokey and the machines did not pay out anything the 4 days I stayed and played. If your looking for a hotel to stay when traveling to Vegas DO NOT GO TO BALLY'S!! go to Harrahs or Rio you won't regret it..

Reviews.Title: “Inexpensive and a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: electricfeel
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Bally's from September 21st to September 25th 2011. We were in one of the newly updated rooms in the north tower. The room was huge and very spacious. The bathrooms had nice marble counter tops and floors which seemed relatively new. It was very clean overall. Check-in was fairly quick and the room was available as soon as we arrived around 12pm, which was nice. Bally's is in a great location; right in the middle of the strip. (Across the street from the Bellagio and right beside Paris). It was convenient being attached to Paris because there are so many great restaurants in that hotel. The pool area seemed nice, but a little small. We were told we could use the pool at Paris and Planet Hollywood as well. We ended up only using the pool at Paris. It was really nice and we never had trouble finding lounge chairs. We ate at the Tequila Bar Restaurant everyday! They have great nachos and $15 margarita pitchers. I would definitely stay at Bally's again. It was very inexpensive, clean and in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Typical casino hotel”
Reviews.Author: 1happydisneygirl
Reviews.Content: Stayed here after attending a convention at the Paris hotel because I couldn't stomach paying what Paris (Bally's sister hotel) wanted to charge. RESERVATIONS: Fairly easy, though they do charge the first night to your credit card BEFORE you stay and also have a 72 hour cancellation policy. CHECK-IN: Fast, friendly and efficient. I was in and out within 5 minutes. ROOMS: I chose the North Tower based on TA reviews and after talking to the reservationist. However, I must admit...I wasn't all that impressed. The room was a good size and had a nice sized bathroom. However, the carpet was FILTHY! It looked like it hadn't been cleaned since the beginning of time. (I wore socks while in the room and they were dark from dirt after a couple of hours.) The beds were quite firm, so I used my trusty mattress pad which made it a comfortable night's sleep. The room was VERY quiet and I only heard a door shut once. It was hot in Vegas, so I kept the air conditioner on all night. Thankfully, the conditioner was very quiet and didn't keep me awake. The toilet ran all night long, so I had to keep the bathroom door shut. The t.v. is the old "tube" kind and had terrible reception. There was a refrigerator, iron, blow dryer, etc. No microwave. The bathroom soaps and shampoos were Gilchrist and Soames which are my favorite. There were 2 writing desks. (I'm not sure why because one would have been enough) and an ample closet. There was a ridiculous charge for the internet...which I think is unbelievable since most hotels don't charge for internet these days. (I'm sure Bally's can afford free internet based on all the people I saw gambling and losing!!) FACILITIES: This is where Bally's falls short! The trek from self-parking is quite a long one, so if you decide to bring your luggage from the parking garage...good luck! Most of Bally's restaurants and all of their shopping is in the "basement." I wanted a caramel apple (that cost me $12) and had to walk a ways to get it. The pool is REALLY a long walk and quite crowded. The Monorail is also in the basement and VERY inconvenient. (Note to anyone wanting to travel around Las Vegas...TAKE A CAB!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!) RESTAURANTS: We ate at the Sidewalk Cafe for breakfast and my husband talked me into getting their breakfast buffet. I'm not into buffets, but we had eaten at the Paris buffet and were blown away by the exceptional food and low cost. ($15.99 per person.) The Sidewalk buffet was $10.99, but didn't include oj ($2.00 per glass) like they dad at the Paris. Though the service at the Sidewalk was MUCH better than at the Paris, the quality and selection of food was subpar. So, I would suggest walking a few extra "steps" and eating at the Paris Buffet for a couple more dollars. You won't be disappointed. CHECK-OUT: I used the express check-out and it was very convenient. OVERALL: If the North Tower is the "nice" section, I shudder to think what the South Tower is like. But, I'd rather pay less to stay at Bally's than to shell out $200-$300 a night at the Paris. I bring my own Lysol wipes, so I gave the room a good scrub. (Which I had brought a carpet cleaner...just kidding).

Reviews.Title: “Right on the Strip and right on the service!”
Reviews.Author: ControlsGuy
Reviews.Content: Due to flight delays, we didn't get to the hotel until 1AM. The desk was as friendly and sympathetic as could be. She even comp upgraded us to a North Tower Suite. The room was clean, huge and had a wonderfully big hot tub in the center. The tub was a welcome sight every evening! We were in town to visit family and attend a convention. Stayed five nights and was given excellent accomodations, friendly and efficient service, great housekeeping and even managed to break even in the casino! The hallway connection to Paris gives you easy access to great eateries and while there were a lot of sales pitchmen in the Paris side, we didn't see any in Bally's.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: DarlenePortMoody_BC
Reviews.Content: Our room was clean and newly renovated. Check in was fast and easy and the hotel is in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful clean and good location”
Reviews.Author: cd1964
Reviews.Content: resort was nice clean loved the location we had a good view, service was pleasant and promt would highly recommend staying here

Reviews.Title: “Back to Bally's”
Reviews.Author: slashba
Reviews.Content: This was my third time staying at Ballys and once again it was a great trip. Our room was comped and upgraded to the North Tower and while we didn't have the best view ( along the back section looking at back of Flamingo) it was large, clean, modern and had a coffee maker. Since we arrived early from the East coast and checked in at 10:15am a room ready and waiting was a nice surprise. Check in was quick. We have platinum cards so there is a separate line, but regular check in line was short and moving quickly also. The receptionist was very friendly and searched and searched for a room that was ready. The beds were very comfortable although I must say Ballys in Atlantic City has much better pillows. The room was quiet with plenty of towels for two. Rather then pay for a frig, we take along a soft sided cooler (flattens to fit in suitcase) and some zip lock bags to fill with ice. Works great to keep left overs, drinks or snacks cold. The casino floor is laid out quite nice. Lots of choices to play and if you get bored here Paris is connected or being in the center of the strip you can head in what ever direction you want to find some action! There was a band playing in the evening by the Tequila Bar and they were quite good. We did the Jubilee show last time here and it was fabulous! A true Vegas production! We ate at the breakfast buffet one morning and it was just ok. Scrambled eggs kind of warm and bacon not real crispy. The fresh fruit was delicious. The servers now bring you toast or a bagel if you want. It was not up on the buffet. We ordered off the menu the second day and it was very good. I'm not a hash brown fan, but there's were delicious and bacon was cooked perfectly! The service was excellant and again there was a separate line for platinum, so no waiting. We ate at the Tequila Bar one evening for a quick bite and it was very good and reasonable. Excellent Chile and pulled pork sandwich and you can't go wrong with a $2 Margarita!!!! Service was quick and friendly. Nosh over by the escalators also has fantastic sandwiches. The bread they use is so fresh and delicious. Great place to grab a sandwich or hot dog. The pool is beautiful and during the week it is pretty easy to get a lounge chair. Drinks there are quite expensive and you cannot bring in your own. It is also a pretty good walk to get to especially if you are in the south tower. We had purchased buy one get one free monorail tickets off of the monorails facebook page. Usually $12 per person, so we got 2 for $12. We hadn't ridden it yet so thought this was a good opportunity for the price. The platform is a hike like the pool, but it was nice to check out some of the other casinos. It was not heavily used and during the day it was fine, but I don't know that I would want to have to use it at night. The platforms can be quite desolate with no security that we saw, but there may some at night. We had originally booked the Flamingo for this trip, but after reading review after bad review we decided to switch back to Ballys and I'm glad we did. On our shuttle ride to the airport we heard some folks that had just left Flamingo complaning about it. Can't wait to return to Ballys, hopefully in January!

Reviews.Title: “Recent stay Sept 8 2011”
Reviews.Author: simbaPalmCoast_FL
Reviews.Content: We have been going to LV for many years and have seen many changes; Bally's is still one of our favorites. Yes, it is showing it's age; I agree that it does need some work, however, all in all, our room was clean and we received clean towels every day and anything else we needed. The bed was comfortable and the linens were clean. I did notice that all the nice landscaping they used to have is no longer, but under the circumstances we are facing, as a country, putting allot of money into renovations may not be an option right now. We received all that we expected for the money we paid. The location is great and we had excellent valet service. One last important item, "THEY HAVE NO RESORT FEES" be sure to check with your hotel when booking your trip, many charge resort fees.

Reviews.Title: “Bally's was Average - Good Location, Okay view, Simple decor”
Reviews.Author: ldang
Reviews.Content: We chose Bally's because there was an online sale for $79/night for the SOUTH Tower Classic which also included TWO Buffet of Buffet 24-hr passes. (Which is normally $50 each!). What a deal! After we booked our hotel, they sent us an email with the option to upgrade to a North Tower Deluxe for $10 more a night, which is still a good deal. We were afraid to try the $20 "secret slip" at check-in on Sunday (apparently on websites it says it works easiest at Bally's). Lines were pretty busy, I got an Asian lady worker at the lobby desk, who didnt' seem to budge or seem helpful. I asked her if there was any kind of upgrade available aside from the email I got, and she said only suites for $xxx more (I don't remember the price she said). We get to our room, #847 of North Tower. I wanted a room that was close to the elevator, but I guess none was available. Room was clean and smoke-free. Decor is very simple, but not a big deal. No flat screen tv. Bally's is known for having spacious rooms, which it was. Bathrooms are new and more "modern" design to it. Overall, an okay hotel. Cheap and good location in the middle of the strip, but when I think of Vegas... I'd probably wanna try something more "glamorous" next time. I've stayed at MGM Grand and Palms before, both of which are alot nicer/more classy... but further from everything.

Reviews.Title: “Great trip to Las Vegas with Girls”
Reviews.Author: GFarrall
Reviews.Content: Had a great 5 days in Vegas staying at Bally's. We appreciated being in the North Tower and on a totally non smoking floor. Hotel is in a great locationb on the strip. It was really nice walking to Paris. My only complaint was going to the bar where they serve tequilla shots for $2.00 and being charged $17.00 for a vodko (which wasn't even a premium brand) on the rocks. I stood there a little stuned, paid and never went back. The staff was very courteous and professional. We ordered show tickets and they answered our questions in a helpful way.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great location!”
Reviews.Author: Nonester
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Bally's South Tower in September for 5 nights with a friend who had never been to Vegas. I have nothing but good things to say about my stay there. Check in on a Friday night actually went quite quickly, although it was after 10 p.m. before we arrived so that might have made a difference. I asked for a room facing south in the south tower and we ended up being on the 16th floor pretty much near the end by the elevators so we were actually in a room that had a wet bar and it was super roomy. The windows are dirty to look out of, but we could see the fountains of Bellagio from our room. The room was clean even though the furniture is getting older, but the beds were very comfortable. We quickly got more towels and blankets from housekeeping when we needed them. The pool area is a wonderful place to hang for a few hours as it's relaxing and you don't have to fight to get a chair. Also, I enjoy swimming laps and there is an area in the middle of the pool where there's a rope dividing the shallow and deep end that I would swim beside. It made it very enjoyable as I didn't feel I was in anyone's way. There's lots of options for food in the lower level and the coffee bar always seemed to be busy but they worked hard to get you through quickly. I have no complaints about Bally's and will definitely be staying there again. For the price, the location is the best on the strip and really, how much time do you spend in your room anyway, other than to shower and sleep?

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay!”
Reviews.Author: musumekiller
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews from trip advisor, I am willing to pay 10 dollar per night for north tower. Overall, it was ok since the room was clear and Ac works great. The casino was a bit small and there a sales all over the place.

Reviews.Title: “Hot shower, comfy bed, and inexpensive~just what I want in a room!”
Reviews.Author: VisitingHawaii
Reviews.Content: Booked 4 rooms at Bally's in the older tower. Our rooms were very spacious, but a bit outdated. Not exactly deep down clean, as there was dust buildup on the vents, and some wear and tear in the bathroom and on the carpet. The furniture/decor/TV were all very dated. Check in was not quick, but they were busy. That being said, it was exactly what I expected for the price. Great location! Comfy Beds! Hot shower with decent pressure! I don't go to Vegas to spend time in my room... It's a bonus that it's connected to Paris, and all the little shops/restaurants there. And the monorail is fairly accessible too.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Stay”
Reviews.Author: Rocker08
Reviews.Content: Lovely, Very clean hotel. Even though we arrived quite late, check in was hassle free and the person at the desk was very informative with great information on where to go and what to do etc. We got a room upgrade which was really nice. There were 2 of us and we had a really nice big room

Reviews.Title: “Don't go to Bally's Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: VacationLoverLA
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Bally's Hotel at 11:45 Monday Sept.19.2011. we had been tired of driving from Los Angeles to Vegas, wait 20 minutes to get help with luggages not by Bell Man but by one of the valet parking employee and end up to move my luggages to carrier by myself. We reserve this room at least 4-5 weeks a head of time for mammogram and during the reservation and a day before check , we mention type of room, beds and late check in , the answer was yes and they said your room and type of selections are OK, and don't worry about it. The Lady at check in desk said , all the rooms are booked and there are some restriction on your choices like, she said the only way to give us Non smoking room is to accept accessible room , we where OK with that choice and she said the rooms are close to elevator , base on my experience , i asked her about noise and she said, you shouldn't hear any noises , after we arrived at horrible room , which is i'm evaluate that room not more than ONE STAR, noise was like a train in your brain , Long story short she lied to us about room, and finally we start fighting with reservation desk over the room's phone and screaming about room noises and dirtiness of the room , finally we got a suit two rooms away from elevator with a lot less noises. this room was dirty and carpet was stained , sitting chairs were stained . it took one hour and 50 minutes to get that room. they lied to us at check in time. when i compare the rate with MGM GRAND i can not rate them more than even ONE STAR Don't go there it is horrible hotel

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT EXPERIENCE”
Reviews.Author: EJS1350
Reviews.Content: Great location. Fast check-in and friendly staff. Spent 4 days at Ballys 9-19/9-23. Only nice things to say. Slots were great too. Pleasantly surprised by all Bally's had to offer. Would definitely stay again. Rooms spacious and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Fun place in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Lookout II
Reviews.Content: Bally's has a lot going for it. The new wing rooms are large, attractive, and have a coffee maker. One of the best things is the connecting hallway to Paris so you have two casinos, Paris's buffet and bakery. The night club that opens onto the casino floor is a lively place at night. Very casual and has a lot of interesting dancers. Location is convenient to Planet Hollywood, Bellagio and many others in this area of the Strip. There is a free shuttle that goes to Rio. Very quiet rooms and everything seems to go very smoothly when staying there.

Reviews.Title: “stay somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: tourcy
Reviews.Content: We booked at Bally's for a birthday celebration as it used to be pretty good until Harrahs came onboard. We checked in and were offered an upgrade at $20.00 per night per room which turned out to be a "rip off". The hotel is very worn, stained carpets, dirty vents and generally poor housekeeping. We brought this to the attention of the management in a nice way but basically got the brush off saying it is an old building. There are quite a few older hotels in Vegas but they are still clean. I was amazed at their poor attitude not to even bother with a meal comp or something like that. I had stayed at the Mirage a few weeks back and got an upgrade and it clearly was worth it as well as $40.00 per day at the buffets. Bally's may not have the resort fee but think twice about staying with them as they do not care about their guests at all. Also we were in the "nicer" building so I shudder to think what the other tower was like. Do yourself a favour and book elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME”
Reviews.Author: candace c
Reviews.Content: I love this place staff was awesome the bartenders (Robyn) in particular were amazing! nothing like 2 dollars for tequilla shots, margaritas and tacos. Food was great! I stayed in vegas for 5 days and had to go there everyday. Qudos to Melissa the manager for running a great establishment. WAY TO GO!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Good Value”
Reviews.Author: BigGus79
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Bally's for a guys' trip which consisted of gambling, drinking, and all-around fun. Since this was a guys' trip and not a romantic getaway, location and price was waaay more important than an updated room or a flat screen TV. Bally's definitely fit our needs. It's close to Bill's, the Stage Door, and Ellis Island, which in my opinion, are "must do's" in Vegas. We stayed four nights in the south tower. The room was definitely dated and fairly plain but was very clean. In my opinion, clean is important. Even though the room was dated, it was in good shape and not worn out. I was pleasantly surprised. We did have some issues with needing towels, so we called housekeeping. I was impressed as they responded to our request within 1/2 hour of calling. A+... The only downside I can think of is that the parking garage is a long way away from the south tower, but in Vegas, what hotel's garage isn't a long way away? For us this wasn't an issue, but for some it may be. Well, I will say that if you are a person who is looking for a good location and a great value, I recommend staying at Bally's.

Reviews.Title: “Beds were comfy, casino was not”
Reviews.Author: SassySusan60
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the North Tower with a perfect view of the Eiffel Tower. Room was a good size and beds were very comfortable. The casino and restaurants left a lot to be desired though. The proximity to all the other major hotels made up for what was lacking at Ballys. We only slept at Ballys while gambling, eating, shopping and enjoying the entertainment elsewhere. Would recommend the room only and that is compared to strictly 2-3 star hotels. Coffee maker in room would have been nice.

Reviews.Title: “Center of Strip but felt something was missing”
Reviews.Author: pkotcher
Reviews.Content: Ballys has the best location on the strip you get a very good view of Paris and Bellagio from your room, if located appropriately. We had a room overlooking bellagio, fountain show... which was great. However we were disappointed with the quality of room, The bathroom was very old and never updated saw some rust on the shower and the toilet... We thought overall this is an average place to stay. Next time we will be careful when reserve a place from credit card rewards points...

Reviews.Title: “Great trip!”
Reviews.Author: traveller0525
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights! Vewry busy spot! Rooms are huge! Very comfortable and nice and clean! We were in the North Tower! On the 18th Floor. No complaints here! I slept well! Some good restaurants on-site too - had Nathan's for breakfast. Swam in the pool- it was busy but you could still find chairs. I'd go back!

Reviews.Title: “Bally's needs to refurbish”
Reviews.Author: 1037wolf
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Bally's and was upgraded to a Suite in the North Tower, 11th floor. Not impressed at all. Jacuzzi was not clean (lots of "stuff" jetting out of the sprays) Shower heads and sprinklers in room were all rusted, which could have looked at lot better if replaced or polished. Just a very basic run or the mill suite. Still had the old tv's. ugh!! Be very specific what kind of room you want and view it ahead of time. My daughter had a north tower room which was nasty and paid a lot for it because of the weekend. Not worth half that amount. Bally's needs to really class up their rooms. Excellent location!! They have a lot going for themselves in that catagory. Buffet not the best either.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: DianaDix3
Reviews.Content: Bally's is in a perfect location, close to shops and clubs and pretty much in the centre of it all. Room was very clean but also very outdated, I was told there are renovated rooms in the north tower but didn't mind since we had an amazing view of the paris hotel and the bellagio and the water show. If you are thinking of staying at this hotel be aware that it not as fancy as most other hotels but great for the value, no resort fee was also a bonus! I would definately stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, family celebration.”
Reviews.Author: Gerry-ped.
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Bally's for 6 nights, (5 were comped, 6th 44.00/n), With email offer I upgraded to North Tower for $10.00/n, .When I checked in, I was given a free upgrade to a parlor suite in north Tower. Wonderful room with wet bar, separate makeup area, large bathroom, sofa, extra lounge chair, desk, and table with 4 chairs. Best part of the room was a coffee pot and refrig. Beds were really comfortable, These rooms end with A (my room was 2276A) All staff at Ballys were cheerful, helpful, and seemed to like their jobs!! From the front desk clerks, C.W., bell desk, security, and housekeeping. Had some small wins at the slots, which kept me playing !!! C.W. were great, never had to wait very long for a drink. I had to go back and forth to MGM freq. as their were family events (and lots of family were staying there), so really appreciated the monorail at Ballys, also the walkway to paris is great, lots of extra dining areas, shopping, and the buffet is there also. Ballys has several eating areas, Nosh near the south elevator is great for sandwiches, also a Sidewalk cafe, Java Coast, (coffee place), and Tequila Bar and Grill has great $2.00 margarita and tacos. (ask at the bar) Downstairs are several fast food places, Nathans, a pizza place, etc. This was my 2nd stay at Ballys, have been to many other hotels, and find this area very central, close to many of the other big hotels, and even tho casino area slightly smaller, has good representation of new and old slots. (I don't play tables). I would definitely stay at Ballys again.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: BeechBeaut
Reviews.Content: I must say this hotel is not bad at all. I was comparing this experience to Bally's in Atlantic City and this by far blows them out of the water. The room we got for 4 nights was upgraded to a suite at no charge whatsoever. The suite was rather spacious. We didn't have a great view but who cares when you're there to only sleep! It's in a nice location across from Cesaers and the Bellagio. It is connected to Paris as well. Beware of the buffet at Paris. Overpriced and not that good of food. Try the Tequila Bar in Bally's $2 draft beer and $7 for a pitcher which isn't bad at all. Also try the steakhouse next door. All in all my husband and I had a great time and it was our first time there. Try Bally's!

Reviews.Title: “IT IS VEGAS, BABY !!!”
Reviews.Author: lijedo
Reviews.Content: NICE EXPERIENCE. I stay here pretty often and I think it is a really nice place. The view is great. The restaurant is ok, the line is long and the service is slow, but what do you expect, this is Vegas, Baby. The north tower is more convenient and cleaner. Housekeeping was excellent. We even got a room with a coffee pot (a new amenity). The rooms are large and beds are fairly comfortable. The bathroom was very clean. The location is close to the tram and lots of shopping areas. Check-in was quick and the agent, April, was knowledgeable and very friendly. Common areas were very well kept. Furniture is antique and not in a good way. TV was 20 yrs old. I did not win any money, but had lots of fun.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: travelgs
Reviews.Content: Six of us stayed at Bally's from Sunday to Thursday. When we checked in, four of us were offered an upgrade for $20 a night. It was to a room in the tower that has been renovated. We decided to take the upgrade but when we got to the room we saw that the view was of a cement roof. That's all you could see and there were spotlights down below that pointed upwards right outside our window. We went back to the desk and said we did not want the upgrade with that kind of view so we were downgraded to the tower where the rooms have not been renovated. The view from this room was awesome. We looked out on the Eiffel Tower and the pool at the Paris resort. We could also see the water and light show at the Bellagio. The only difference in the room is that the other one was more modern, newer furniture, flat screen t.v., new carpet. This room was fine for us, we didn't care how outdated the furniture was, the room was spotless. We didn't spend very much time in the room anyway except to sleep and shower. The bathroom was always clean and lots of towels, etc. The staff at the hotel was great. The bartender that works the graveyard shift, Brett, always made us ceasars in the morning. We went for early morning coffee to Sbarro, a pizza, etc. place, that is downstairs. There are a bunch of shops down there also, pretty decent prices. We went to the restaurant upstairs for breakfast every morning. The staff was always friendly and cheerful. Good food, large portions and fast service. The hotel is in a perfect location, everything is in within waliking distance. My mother was with us and she needed a wheelchair. We were able to rent one from the hotel for a reasonable cost. There were elevators or ramps pretty much everywhere, very accessible. There is a small bar/restaurant called the Tequila Bar that had nachos, quesadillas, a really good cheese dip and fries with some kind of spice that was very good. We ate there twice and it was very good. Check out was easy, you just do it through the t.v. and leave the keys. The bell captain held our luggage for us until it was time for us to leave and the valet guy arranged a limo to the airport for us. I enjoyed our stay at Bally's and I would go back to Vegas, but I would probably try a different hotel next time. If they update the other tower and a few other things I would maybe go back.

Reviews.Title: “1st timers, hubby & I had so much fun...Sep 5-9/2011”
Reviews.Author: IlandPrincess
Reviews.Content: Again, 1st timers. We had so much fun. Airport experience was good, easy to find transport to strip. We did pre-purchase our shuttle ($14 round trip p/p) with our Delta flight. Less than 10 min ride to Bally's from airport. Bally's is located in center of strip. Did not eat at Bally's, we were always out and about, we did order in from outside eatery (+$4 delivery fee) one night. Stayed in the north tower which we were upgraded to(from south tower classic) at no extra charge, all we had to do was ask nicely wtih a smile, no tips or tricks necessary. We did return to the airport to rent a car for 1 day ($40 all fees included, mid size), the rates were better there than at any hotel. We drove to the Grand Canyon South Rim, and Hoover Dam. Watch out for Time Share marketers at the hotels, which we took advantage of and in return got free show tickets for 2 and a few buffet coupons for Harrah's whos food was great.

Reviews.Title: “A place that feels like home and better!”
Reviews.Author: murmin
Reviews.Content: My husband , myself and my sister and her husband , just came back from Las Vegas! We drove to Minot and caught a plane from there . We flew in on 9/11/2011. We had been told not to stay at Bally's casino resort hotel, by someone who just thought it was an older hotel! I must say were were surprising overwhelmed. We arrived at about 8:30 in the evening with reservations in place. The lady at the from desk was more than friendly , and she even upgraded us to a suite. As my sister has had arthritis for years she saw she was uncomfortable. We were put in two suites with jucuzzies , king beds the whole nine yards, so to speak. We ate and the restaurants leave you with no need to even leave the hotel. The foot was spectacular at all three, and if you can believe it the service was even better. There was not ONE employee that was rude or without a smile . Seems they have there staff in place to cater to the customers. Even though they did get some rude customers. Each was handled individually .. The rooms were clean and the hotel was kept up so well . Smelt clean , fresh, and I would reccommend it to anyone . it is right on the strip and It was fabulous . Great Job Balley's we will be back in April. The reason is we have never found better service and entertainment. Oh did I mention the band was fabulous. Ty again. I would rate this hotel and casino . 7 out of 5 :-)

Reviews.Title: “Bally's feels like home”
Reviews.Author: johnwGA
Reviews.Content: Rooms large and well kept up. Staff very attentive. This is a smaller casino and I felt like home. Great location to be on the strip. The Total Rewards program can get you a big discount on the room rates.

Reviews.Title: “Unimpressed”
Reviews.Author: jeffcat
Reviews.Content: While the people were friendly, the room itself was in need of some refurbishment. My room was in the south tower. The T.V. had to have been at least 10 years old and the bathroom had a poor quality shower head. Look around before booking at Bally's.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect choise for us!”
Reviews.Author: YoungFriend
Reviews.Content: We booked a double room, we got a huge room with two queen beds. The room had a very nice view. The hotel is a bit old, but the room and bathroom were clean and the bed was comfortable. You can use the self-parking for free. The location is just perfect, Paris is just downstairs, Jubilee show is performed at Bally. For most of the attractions you don't need to use the car. They don't have buffet, but you can use the one at Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Looking forward to my next stay here”
Reviews.Author: mymanc
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Bally's in February and had a great time. Even though it was the same weekend as the Super Bowl, the staff were friendly and helpful with no signs of stress or fraying. The location is perfect: right in the middle of the strip where all the action happens. The room was huge (North Tower) and had a nice, bright bathroom. There was a flat screen TV, but I don't think we even turned it on the whole time we were there. The lobby was clean, check in was a breeze and there was access to several restaurants right from the casino floor. A quick jaunt through the tunnel next door to the Paris expands on the dining selection. Access to the strip is via the moving walkway, which was under repair for part of our stay, so we had to walk a ways, but that's to be expected anywhere in Vegas. There is a sandwich shop right beside the elevators for the South Tower that makes one of the best turkey clubs I have ever eaten. There's a coffee shop in the lobby that gets pretty busy in the mornings, but gets the job done. The only criticism I have of Bally's is that service on the casino floor leaves a little to be desired. I played craps for about 45 minutes and not once did a waitress come by. I ended up spending most of my time at other casinos. I highly recommend signing up for the free Total Rewards program for anyone staying here, or any Caeser's property, even if you barely gamble. The cards can be used for discounts in some restaurants, and you get e-mail promotions that can knock $$$ off the price. In all, Bally's provided what we wanted: an affordable, clean and decent hotel without the price of the higher end properties, but also without the grime of some of the lower end properties.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for a terrific price”
Reviews.Author: amtrak11
Reviews.Content: After staying at places like the Venetian, Wynn, and Treasure Island and paying $22.40 a night for resort fees, I decided to find a hotel without resort fees. Thanks to trip advisor reviews, I decided to give Bally's a try. I was able to save a ton of money by booking a room with a free upgrade to the North Tower. The location of the hotel was very centralized and convenient. Room was very spacious, clean, came with hair dryer and coffee maker. The check -in line was extremely long due to conventions in town, but move along quite fast. I found the front desk staff to be very efficient and professional. The housekeeping staff was friendly and did a wonderful job cleaning my room during my four night stay. So, with the money I saved on the resort fees, I was able to give the housekeeper staff a more generous tip.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: twr1981
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Ballys for 6 night's, price was very reasonable, can't complain about anything. Room was big and clean, staff were very friendly both in hotel and casino.would definitely stay here again mostly cause location was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Location location location”
Reviews.Author: collegefootballfan
Reviews.Content: If you want a hotel from which to explore the strip on foot this is a good option. It is connected to the Paris property on the south east end. Pool was nice and relaxing with a good sized deep end for by Las Vegas standards. Music was at a relaxing level compared to other pools in town that tend to drown out your conversations.Plenty of day loungers to go around. The room furniture was definitely outdated and some of the wallpaper in the bathroom was peeling but overall the room was clean. We stayed in the south tower and had a room that had windows that faced south. Our room had outstanding views of the eifel tower, Paris Pool and most of the Bellagio fountain show. Overal I think the room was of good value for the money you spend to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap & great location!”
Reviews.Author: laxeash
Reviews.Content: If you aren't looking for a fancy place to stay, the South tower in Bally's is the place to be. Paid just over $100 for 3 nights. Large spacious clean room, right in the middle of the strip opposite Bellagio. We walked everywhere from the hotel, didn't need to take a bus or hire a cab.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Bally's”
Reviews.Author: Karinsue
Reviews.Content: We checked in on Friday at 3:30pm. The line was only five deep and they had four people at the desk, it moved fairly quickly. We asked for a complimentary upgrade to the North Tower but were told it would be an extra $20/night. We took our chances in the South Tower and I'm glad we did. Our room was 7122 and faced Flamingo. The view was great. The room was of course worn and dated but it was clean with no major issues. It was more than I expected for the price we paid. Housekeeping was great and unobtrusive. It is set back from the strip a little and the people movers are sometimes down but we never thought it was a big deal at all like some other reviewers. The actual time it took to get to the strip from the room was less than what its taken before when we've stayed at other places. I liked the easy square layout of the casinos and the high ceilings helped with the smoke factor. I also liked the access to Paris and we used it many times as a shortcut to the strip. We ate at Sbarro's twice and the food was fresh and tasty. We ate at Tequila Grill and had the nachos, only order this if you have 6 or more people as it is monstrous. Do try the $2 margaritas. They are the frozen variety and are delicious! We also ate here the morning before our flight for breakfast. Very good and inexpensive before 6am. We did use the pool one day and it's not anything special necessarily but the water was cold and there were plenty of chairs. It does have a deep end which was unusual for Vegas. We enjoyed it. Overall we would definitely stay here again as it was hassle free and the location was great.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel stay”
Reviews.Author: prosperology
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I were there friday nite August 5, 2011 through saturday noon August 7, 2011. The rooms are very nice with excellent air conditioned. A few things we were not pleased were, no coffeemaker, no fan in the bathroom, room service food was ridiculously high, housekeeper walked in 2 hours before check out time (WHILE MY HUSBAND AND I WERE NUDE DURING OUR INTIMATE MOMENT). <<<WE WERE FURIOUS>>> My Husband called and complained to management and they just brushed us off. My Husband reminded management and housekeeping manager that the housekeeper only knocked once and entered our hotel 2 hours before check out. Housekeeper manager yelled at my husband and hung up on him. He was not rude, but talked with calm voice and was still respectful. Most of the housekeepers on the South Tower barely spoke english. Because we were not valued as customers, we will stay at another hotel. We do not recommend the South Tower. From what I heard, the North Tower Staff are way more professional and treats their guests with the utmost respect.

Reviews.Title: “It's all about location”
Reviews.Author: t1andjoyce
Reviews.Content: If you can deal with the old style, Bally's is clean and the pool is awesome. But the key factor is LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION at an affordable price.

Reviews.Title: “Showing it's age”
Reviews.Author: NATIVETEXANLUBBOCK
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel for it's location on strip.Check in was a little lengthy but moved @ a good pace.Clerk was very friendly & prompt.Rooms are large clean.Furniture in room is 70's style.Beds are old & very uncomfortable.The pillows are nasty & just need to be thrown away. For the price you pay room is ok,but I will look for another place to stay next time.Over due for a complete over haul.Casino is small & very smoky.Didn't eat @ hotel but did have several places to eat.Attracts an older crowd.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price and location!”
Reviews.Author: MontanaTam
Reviews.Content: We picked Bally's for its great location on the strip and very reasonable price. Bonus is that it is attached to the Paris so that give a person more dining and shopping options! Our North Tower room was clean w/ comfortable beds...yes, carpets were quite worn but rest of the room was more than adequate...we really weren't in our room that much. I needed a fridge in our room to keep my medication cold and the hotel did not charge us due it was needed for medical reasons (I am diabetic). That was really apprecaiated as was NO RESORT FEE. Other hotels give you "stuff" for their resort fee but I never use their "stuff" so why pay the fee. We enjoyed the Tequila Bar for $2 draft beers and $2 margaritas - although they weren't large drinks, they were just right to get a taste and we jsut wanted a quick night-cap anyway! They also had $2 tacos if you ask. One downfall was the smoky casino...back home many of our bars and casinos have gone non-smoking and that is greatly appreciated BUT hey, it's Vegas...we aren't big on the gambling bit anyway except for a few bucks here and there. We spent some time at Harrah's and their casino wasnt near as smoky but could have just been being inthe right place at the right time. I think Harrah's has a few more eating choices to my liking so we may choose that hotel next time (another no resort fee hotel -yeah!)...but we will see what the prices are - BOTh are in fantastic locations for mid-strip Las Vegas! The main thing that annoyed me was over and over and over being offered free shows or dinners IF we sat thru a time share breakfast or lunch...we finally just told them we were leaving in the morning so not interested - just to get them to leave us alone! Seemed this was worse in Bally's and The Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great upgrade at Bally's”
Reviews.Author: Gerry-ped.
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Ballys from Sept 4 for 6 nights (5 comped), had upgraded to North towere with email offer of extra $10.00/night. When I arrived was given a great upgrade (comped) to a parlor Suite (room #2276A), Room was great with wet bar, coffee maker, refrig, comfortable queen bed, chairs and table, sofa, lounge chair, desk area, makeup area and large bathroom with shower/tub combo. Loved the room, it was clean and very comfortable. Also inside access to paris, with monorail on site, which I used freq. to go to MGM where other family were staying The staff were great, from housekeeping, desk clerks, bell staff, security. the CW were freq. and I even won a little on the slots. Close to other casinos, (Mirage, P.H. etc.) This was my 2nd stay at Bally's, and it did not dissappoint!!! Certainly would recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay and reasonable”
