Reviews.Author: janet11120
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Bally's Labor day weekend. This was my first time staying here, although I have been to Las Vegas around 40 times. The rooms were very comfortable, clean and reasonable. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Bally's is right beside Paris and across the street from Bellagio's and an short walk from Caesar's, which I consider the middle of the strip. If you are looking for clean, reasonable rates can't go wrong staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: SchofieldBC
Reviews.Content: We love Bally's. It's right in the middle of the strip.We have stayed ther many times and always go back..You can walk right through to Paris which is joined to Bally's.The staff is great.

Reviews.Title: “Had so much fun, I am going back!!”
Reviews.Author: pinky27Shreveport
Reviews.Content: Bally's is a wonderful hotel the rooms were large and the room service was unbeliveable. We ordered room service one night and it was to our room on the 26th floor in less than 30 minutes. was everyone was so kind and helpful at the hotel. We went for a concert and enjoyed it so much we are going for a week in october. the shopping and casicios are beautiful. If you go you have to go to "old V Vegas" as the locals say. The food and shopping there are at rock bottom prices!! Can't wait to go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: Edinburgh_Castle
Reviews.Content: Expect a long walk to a very noisy pool (plus an even noisier DJ at weekends) through an underground passageway where you will be harassed daily by stall traders. The rooms are not nearly as nice as in the pictures. I have always said everbody is so polite in the USA but I think maybe they need a refresher course as the veneer was thin and barely concealed at times. Not my best experience of Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: skoala
Reviews.Content: We arrived on Suday afternoon and the line was long so we dropped our bags at the bell desk and went to eat and came back. The line was shorter and moved quickly. We had the sweetest clerk. We were reserved a south tower room and I asked to be close to the pool. She put us in the North tower at no extra charge. We had other family coming in around midnight so we asked if they could put us all on the same floor and she did and she also said she would check them all in and they just had to come get their keys when they got there. 2 of the rooms were comped and one room only cost us $23 a day. This was a great deal. Our room was VERY nice. It was big and clean. It had a table and chairs to go with it and then another comfortable chair. We were very pleased. I liked their shampoo/conditioner and wrote a note asking for extra and they left about 10. I thought that was very nice. We used the pool every day. We went early since we were on east coast time. The pool is very big and they have many chairs. The only bad thing is that you have to walk through a little mall downstairs. It is much closer when you stay in the north tower. The walk isn't as bad as I thought it would be. There are cheap eating places here and you can get coupons on line for them. We ate at Nathan's twice. Their food is pretty good. We also like that Bally's and Paris are connected so there are many eating places between them. We ate one lunch at the Sidewalk cafe in Bally's and the food was OK but the service was SLOW. We also ate at Nosh(it's right by the South tower) and that was pretty good too. We only stayed here 2 nights. The rest of the family stayed for 5 nights. We had reservations at Caesar's. We hadn't stayed there before and we got a pretty good rate so we wanted to try it. The room at Caesar's was wonderful but I did like the vibe at Bally's much better. The day that we checked out I noticed that I couldn't find my glasses. I only use them for distance so I only wear them to shows or to drive. I asked at Bally's thinking maybe I had left them in the room. I was hoping I hadn't left them at a slot machine. They told me to check lost and found and sure enough the maids had found them and taken them to lost and found. I was so excited and so glad that I had left a tip in the room. Everyone at Bally's was so nice(much nicer than at Caesars). Bally's has a great location and their rooms were very nice. They aren't the Wynn but for the price they are a great value. I have stayed at both towers and I do prefer the north tower especially since it's closer to the pool. I would stay here again in a minute.

Reviews.Title: “Ballys has a great location at a decent price, but dont expect over-the-top Vegas.”
Reviews.Author: brysonlane1
Reviews.Content: Location. The main reason to stay at Ballys. The staff is friendly and quite helpful, at check-in i was given a great deal on a suite and the Total Rewards can be used frequently. The suite i stayed in had a great view of Paris and Planet Hollywood plus it was huge with a nice tub. Overall i was very pleased with my stay at Ballys, its nothing fancy or extravagant, but neither is the price. So if your looking for a decent cheap hotel to save your money for more important Vegas things (gambling, strippers, clowns) then stay here, and dont worry about how ugly the carpet is.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: AverageTraveller1
Reviews.Content: Pros: 1. When I booked, it was cheaper by about 20% than 4-5 other hotels (on The Strip) that I checked. 2. The room and bathroom were spacious. 3. With thick curtains, the room kept out the lights and noise of The Strip very well. 4. Check-in was quite fast. (This can be an issue at quite a few of Vegas' large hotels.) They offer express check-out, which came in useful for me. 5. The Bally's employees in the hotel as well in the casino were very friendly. Subjective pros: 6. They do have rooms for smokers. 7. I like Bally's for being one of the (increasingly) few hotels that aren't a fake Paris or New York or Venice. Cons: 8. The room had no coffee-maker. However, they do have room service and a few sources of coffee downstairs. (See the tip below.) Subjective con: 9. Bally's isn't one of the newer hotels, although I think one of the towers is new. This didn't make a difference to me, as the room was comfortable. Tip: If the morning's cup of coffee is important to you, note that there can be lines at some of the in-Bally's places that serve coffee (e.g., Nosh, which serves a lot of things besides coffee). (The nearest Starbucks is at the Westin - walkable, but not easily. ) Luckily, there's a specialized coffee-place within Bally's. It's called Java Coast and it's by the check-in area. The line moves fast here.

Reviews.Title: “The leaky light”
Reviews.Author: flowerrose425
Reviews.Content: Came in at 2:30 one night water leaking out of light in bathroom. Went to front desk and talked to manager. Sent engineer up to look at it, said we would have to move but would be compensated for our trouble. Moved the next day. Was hardly compensated for the trouble at all. Wonder what would have happened had I not told them about this? I'm sure had I been a Diamond member it would have been different.

Reviews.Title: “Needs to be improved - we will try elsewhere next time”
Reviews.Author: seasonedtraveller169
Reviews.Content: Demand accomodation in North Tower without additional charges Say no to $100 a day charges being demanded at checkin for incidentals Breakfast elsewhere other than Bally's Nosh - slowwww service and expensive Very basic coffee maker placed in bathroom but not available in South Tower South Tower rooms decor jaded and in urgent need of upgrade Dirty uncleaned windows in both towers Very hostile reception at check in Ignore Bally's brochure entries about places to eat - only Steakhouse operational Avoid the Thai restaurant - rude and inexperienced waiting service

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: travelgal084
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in the centre of the strip, great location. The hotel itself is dated but clean. The hotel rooms were spacious. The hotel is connected to Paris which expanded eating options. Though there are a lot of hotel choices on the strip I would recommend Bally's for the location, reasonable price and no resort fees. There is shuttle service to other hotel/casinos right from the hotel at no charge. When in Vegas I recommend Viva Elvis, Penn & Teller but do not take the double decker sightseeing bus it was definitely not worth the money and was basically a shuttle from hotel to hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: jbjbjb24
Reviews.Content: Check-in was fast and they accomodated our request for adjoining rooms. Our South Tower rooms were clean and spacious. We had a view of the Eiffel Tower and a partial view of the Bellagio. The beds were comfortable and the rooms were relatively quiet.The rooms were definately dated but we did not spend much time there. The staff we had contact with were very friendly. There was a good cover band playing at the Indigo Lounge both nights we stopped. The Tequila Bar had good food and margaritas at reasonable prices.. We had no problem getting drinks on the casino floor. Ballys center strip location and monorail stop offer easy access to many top attractions and restaurants. We especially enjoyed the attractions at the Bellagio, shopping at Caesars and dining at Mon Ami Gabi ( Paris-request outdoor patio) I would recommend Ballys if you want a good room with an excellent location at a great price. Tips You can use any Harrahs property pool if you stay at Ballys If you want to use the Flamingo pool go early if fills up fast The ABC store in the mall beside Planet Hollywood is a good place to stock up on drinks and snacks Get restaurant reservations to avoid long waits Mini refrigerators are $15 a day Print boarding passes in advance (business office) Check Groupon, Living Social , Facebook and Restaurant.com for deals

Reviews.Title: “loving vegas”
Reviews.Author: sunchiller
Reviews.Content: Arrived on a monday night, We were a group of 4 ladies in the 45-55 age group, check in at bally's was quick and easy. We ended up in the south tower but was no big deal as we were giving adjoining rooms with our friends on a non smoking floor which was perfect. Our room was 6030 and I have to say was spacious and very clean. Yes it was dated it reminded me more of a super 8 room but larger. The only trouble we had was the internet cord in the room was broken. This didn't make or break our trip. I have to say Tequilla bar and grill have fantastic nacho's and 2 dollar margaritas the only other place that has wonderful margaritas was at the fremont hotel on fremont street has them at the sports bar for 99 cents. we also ate at the fremont hotel at tony roma's and had ribs that were to die for. You also can get a pitcher of beer for 8 dollars. we did a few shows Le Reve worth every penny at the Wynn, we did Legends very good impersonators at the Harrahs, and we did Menopause the musical that made you laugh so hard this was at luxor. 3 of the girls had never been to las vegas and so they did the bus tour to vegas it was a long day but did enjoy seeing hoverdam, the grand canyon. this tour was about 10 hours from pick up to drop off, a few years ago I did the helicopter tour and seen all this in about 4 hours. Take in some of the free shows that are offered at the hotels most are worth the time to see. You really need to go to fremont street for the experience, its worth the visit. As for gambling we are not much for that so can't really say much for the casino's Be friendly to the taxi drivers as some are just funny as heck once you get to chatting with them, hope you get a ride with fred he is a southern bell, who will sing for you. All in all this was another wonderful trip, and all the ladies want to go back. check out was as easy as check in when we left on the friday, had no wait for a taxi to get to airport. The airport was another story, not really that helpful at the counter when checking in.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible breakfast buffet”
Reviews.Author: wendl23
Reviews.Content: We stopped here while looking for someplace to eat breakfast and saw they had a buffet for 9.99, so we thought we would try it. What a mistake! Horrible service and The worst looking scrambled eggs I have ever seen!! Very limited selection of food and by the time I was able to get someone to bring me butter and syrup my pancake was cold. I'm not a picky eater and not a complainer, but I would want someone to tell me if they had such a bad experience.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: TheLoneTraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Bally's 8/28-9/1. Arrived about 1 p.m. and room wasn't ready so checked in our bags with the Bell desk and went to eat and get a couple of necessities. Went back about 3:30 and the room was ready. We were on the 8th floor in the South Tower towards the west end (non-smoking floor). Our windows looked out onto the eiffel tower at Paris and the Paris Pool. We could also see about half of the Bellagio lake and water show. We had a 2 queen room. Room was clean, bathroom was okay, beds were good. The carpeting in both the room and the hallway to the elevator is badly in need of replacing. Housekeeping was good. There is a room safe, but, there is a 3 dollar/day charge to use it. The elevators were good, no long waits. We did not use the pool or hotel restaurants so can't really say about those. Overall, good location, clean rooms (in need of some updating in the south tower), reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “A good value if you use it right”
Reviews.Author: Ken241
Reviews.Content: Check-in was inexcusable, over 5 minutes per party for "credit card please, sign here, here is your key." the line backed up out the lobby to the entrance on a sunday afternoon. understand you have to value ballys for what you are buying. for less than $50 per night, we had mid strip, clean, spacious rooms right on the monorail. Ballys is definately dated, smallest casino floor of any casino we visited (18 total) and the strongest smelling of cigarette smoke. the food options are limited and not very good. however, you are connected directly to paris, a monorail stop, and within 5 minutes of the bellagio. we used ballys to sleep, and it was a tremendous value for that use. the pools are not crowded and easy to access. the harrahs etc is only two monorail stops away, or a 20 minute walk after the sun goes down. so sorry if this seems like a negative review, but understand what you are buying. A good, clean, spacious room in the heart of the action. However, you will likely want to travel to other properties for your vacation needs.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Casino”
Reviews.Author: chuckebuck
Reviews.Content: Rooms are large and spacious and quiet even though party was going on next door. Casino is just right size with all favorite slot machines

Reviews.Title: “Two thumbs up!”
Reviews.Author: Snugg-ee
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have been to Vegas a few times and this was our first time staying at Bally’s; we booked a room comped for 5 nights via Total Rewards at the South Tower, which is the older one. I read quite a few reviews online and was looking forward to try the “20 dollar trick” (if you don’t know what this is, search online and you will find lots of postings). We checked in at around 1pm on a Monday, we waited in line for just a minute and it was very smooth. The staff member that checked us in was very nice and I’m not going to mention her name for privacy reasons. When handing in my ID, TR card and credit card, I had a folded $50 bill in between, she saw and said: “oh is this for me?”, I said yes, she put it in her pocket and I said: “we were wondering if you guys are not too busy if it would be possible to get an upgrade”, she said that she would see what she could do and with a smile on her face started typing away.....she was able to upgrade us to a Junior suite in the North Tower (which is the upgraded/renovated one); the room was huge and very nice as you can see from the pictures. A few minutes after getting in to the tower, the check-in staff member called us in the room to ask if everything was ok, if we liked the room.....that was awesome! We had read reviews and some people were saying to use $20 for a 3 night stay, $50 for 4 nights or more and $100 for 7 days or more.....so we tipped her $50 and it worked out great, after all our room was originally comped, so a Junior suite for 5 nights for $50 was a pretty sweet deal! Bally’s doesn’t have a buffet but there are a few food options by the casino or towards the sports book, or you can walk to Paris which is right next door and they are internally connected. There are other options close by as well as Bally’s is very well located on the strip and even a few options very close by a little off strip. The casino floor has been renovated and it looked much nicer since the last we were there, one of their casino bars have Guinness on tap which you don’t see very much in Vegas, so you can play video poker while enjoying a Guinness! The 2 bartenders we interacted with were very nice, professional and friendly and even surprised us with water bottles in between drinks before we had to ask, a very nice touch. The sports book is a couple minutes away, on the lower floor on the way to the pool area, it is tight and a little dated. There had a small pool with heated water and a very large one with room temperature water while we were there in May; the pool area is large and had lots of chairs and also cabanas for rent. There were also a couple of options for drinks and food. We had read a few good reviews for the Tequila Bar & Grill, which is right by the casino, but it wasn’t as nice as we thought it was going to be, just ok...one night we were seated but waited for service for 15 minutes, so we left. They had a stage with a lounge area also right next to the casino and every night they had a band playing and there was one particular one that was awesome, I wish I knew their name. They had no sign and Bally’s didn’t seem to advertise that particular entertainment area much, at least we didn’t see anything and heard the band one night while walking by. We had seen Jubilee before in 2008 but we didn’t like it, it was boring and thankfully they had some pretty good entertainers perform in between the Jubilee dance acts. We had won tickets, which was a good thing otherwise it would have been also a waste of money for us as we felt that it was a waste of time, we actually left before the end. The cleaning staff kept our room spotless and they were very nice as well, overall every staff member we came in contact with was very friendly. The floor we were in had a very large sitting area next to the elevators, I have never seen such a large one like this before, it was huge with couches and chairs. One day we went down a few floors and it also looked the same, very nice! We were very happy with our stay at Bally’s, had a great experience and would definitely stay there again; we felt that comped or not Bally’s is worth the money! They don’t seem to get as much credit as they deserve, we all know that Vegas has been pretty hurt with the economy still recovering, and we thought that Bally’s treated us extremely well. We are not high rollers and like to treat staff as people (and not as servants like others), a friendly approach and a tip, which doesn’t have to be a lot, will definitely get you a long way and Bally’s has proven this to us, after all it is one of the motivations for the ones who work in the service industry. We definitely recommend Bally’s and look forward to our next visit!:-)

Reviews.Title: “It was worth the price”
Reviews.Author: realst8ace
Reviews.Content: The hotel was the location for the conference I was attending. The nightly rate was reasonable to begin with and then, about 2 months prior to my visit, Bally's reduced it all on their own, which was a nice surprise. About a week prior to my arrival, I received an email that offered an upgrade to the more spacious rooms in their North Tower for just $10 per night. I accepted and when it was check-in time was told that there were no rooms available in that building. After a lengthy argument with the front desk staff, they backed off and gave us a room in that building. The room was spacious and worked well. It was clean and the housekeeping staff was diligent. The bathroom fixtures, although not original, looked old and paint was peeling from the cabinets. As far as the complex and facility - the pool was very nice, although a very long walk from the North tower. These were all insignificant considering that the price was right. Would I stay there again? There were several very well priced restaurants within the hotel/casino. The complex adjoins the Paris Hotel which also offered reasonably priced food options. Would I stay there again? Only if the next conference I attend is in the same building.

Reviews.Title: “Location...Location...Location”
Reviews.Author: Dennis T
Reviews.Content: Wow what a location. Forget about luxury or elegant restaurants because location is everything. Walk out the door and your at the flamingo, harrah's or imperial palce straight to the south. Walking time 5 minutes tops. Cross the street via the walking bridge and your at Ceasar's. Go north to Planet hollywood ( 5 minute walk). Remember the Paris Casino is attached to Bally's so you get 2 casino's in 1. Need to get to the Rio? Get on the free shuttle from Bally's. From the Rio take free shuttle back or go to Ceasar's harrah's for free. Monorail is also in Bally's. Go north as far as the convention center or the hilton or go south all the way to the MGM. Who cares how great your room is because you will be on the go anyway. By the way my stay from aug 22nd thru the 25th was good. Nice clean room and easy check in. Food court wasn't the greatest but the Paris had good restaurants and cheap breakfast. Trust me when I say that the location is what you want. Everything is surrounding you at Bally's and that will save you time and money getting around.

Reviews.Title: “2nd Stay at Bally's---much better than the 1st time.....”
Reviews.Author: Moni4Now
Reviews.Content: Checked in around 10:00 PM on a Thursday. The wait was unusually long with only a few guest waiting to check in. Stayed in the North Tower on the 19th floor (Diamond non-smoking floor). This was suppose to be the renovated tower but I found the decor was out-dated. The bed was firm and not as comfortable as I am accustomed to for a hotel stay. There was a safe in the room that was free for Diamond & 7-Star players, along with a coffee pot. You can also request a refrigerator. The pool is a nice size with a siting ledge along the side of the pool--great for sitting and sipping a cocktail. If you sit near the bar area, be aware that around noon the DJ starts spinning records and there are HUGE speakers next to a few of the chairs. This is also the area with constant shade. Tequila Bar-- stopped in for lunch to go. Hint- you need to go to the bar to order "to-go" orders. I had to talk to three employees for this information. As I was waiting for my Taco Salad (approx $12.00) the gentlemen next to me had the $2.00 taco, which is not on the menu--you just have to ask. The taco was like the crunchy tacos at Taco Bell--lots of lettuce, cheese and tomatoes. I suggest forgetting the Taco Salad and order to of the $2.00 tacos. I like to play video poker and I did find some 9/5 machines over by Nosh. There is also a Suited Royal Flush Bonus poker (by Nosh) that pays a progressive depending on what suit your flush is. All the other pay-outs are similar to the regular Dbl Dbl bonus poker. Overall a nice stay, better that the 1st time I stayed at Bally's and vowed t=never to return. So give it a second chance--you may be pleasantly surprised

Reviews.Title: “Good, but service not perfect”
Reviews.Author: artmc
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the North Tower, which was clean and comfortable. The price was excellent and you can't beat the location. Almost everything on the Strip was within walking distance. I also liked that they don't charge a "resort fee". I wasn't impressed that it cost $22 to use the fitness centre, but I gather that's typical in Vegas. I simply went for early morning runs on the Strip, and used the pool (which was excellent) for free. My only complaint was with some of the service. My wife has medication which needs a fridge. When we booked the room, we specifically asked and were promised that we'd get a room with a fridge. We check in and there's no fridge. We call the front desk and they say that all the room fridges are in use, and they'd put us on a waiting list. We explain that this isn't to keep the beer cold, and that we really NEED a fridge. So they offered to move us to another room. We then were waiting for over an hour watching TV, not exactly what I planned to do in Vegas. So I went downstairs and got the room key for the second room myself. I suggested that it might be appropriate to get some sort of comp, discount, etc., and they said no. When we checked out at the end of our holiday, they asked how we enjoyed everything and we mentioned this incident. The clerk spoke with a manager who agreed to waive our safety deposit box and phone charges (about $25). That was fine with us. I'm just not sure why they couldn't have been more considerate in the first place. Despite this, I'd probably stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Vegas style for a reasonable rate”
Reviews.Author: CJ_Sanders
Reviews.Content: You can't beat the location. This is the Caesars Entertainment property we've been staying at since before the old Park Place days. Steve at the Casino Bar makes an excellent Beefeater Martini. We play there an hour or so before heading out to dinner. Speaking of dinner, Bally's Steakhouse is tremendous. Split the house salad (with rose petal) to start. The ribeye is among the most flavorful and tender I've ever had. I hit the men's spa at least once per visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, but could use some updating”
Reviews.Author: sbgabor
Reviews.Content: This was our first time staying at Bally's and the size and location of the room were fantastic. The beds were not comfortable at all, the shower head will not accommodate anyone over 5'5", but this hotel really is right in the heart of everything and connected to Paris hotel. The free parking was a plus, as was the free shuttle to The Rio. The Palms is a 2 minute walk from Rio, so we were able to party there which was a lot of fun. Check in/out was a breeze and the staff was very friendly. We did not like being hassled throughout the casino to purchase timeshares, but this seemed to happen at every hotel we visitied, so... We would stay here again if the price was right, the location cannot be beat!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location - What it all comes down to”
Reviews.Author: MrHawk_1101
Reviews.Content: Returned recently from my stay at Bally's. We booked via Southwest Vegas Jackpot Vacations and we really hit a good deal. Check -in was pretty quick given it was Saturday afternoon. We did not get asked for an upgrade, as the hotel was "Sold out". No big deal, the South Tower rooms are closer to the casino and entrance. Easier to navigate in and out from. We had room 62222 (12th floor) and had a view facing the North End of the strip (Caesar's, Mirage). Front desk clerk was very friendly (A common attribute amongst Bally's Employees as will be described). Room was very spacious, and actually clean. Bed was a large King, with what small pillows. We did not ask for more. We had a problem with our safe, and we got someone up in our room within 5 minutes. Our safe worked and had no problems. Very friendly person. Shower included a tub/shower combo with all of your standard ammenities. Safe is $3/day, Wireless is $14/day and Fitness Center you can get for $11/day if you sign up the day you arrive. Casino is easy to navigate and connects you to the tunnel for Paris. Lots of good limits for the tables and penny slots. Drink service is pretty fast for how busy it was and the two slot attendants who repaired a machine problem were also very friendly. We only ate at Tequilla Bar. The nachos are easily for a party of 4-6 and the $5 breakfast is fantastic greasy nourishment at 5:30am. Overall it was fairly good. We ate essentially at other places I had my eye on. I would highly suggest this hotel if you want a great location and a good value. I will be returning here, especially with the Caesar's Properties against resort fees. Any questions, shoot me a line.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and often very good rates”
Reviews.Author: EnglishGirl-AngelM
Reviews.Content: This is my preferred Vegas hotel as the location is right in the middle of the strip, opposite the Bellagio and you can often get rooms for around $40 weekdays. Prices can hugely rise with events in the area though. It's a large hotel/casino with good size rooms. The North towers have been refurbished and are a little more expensive but the first few visits I stayed here and loved the huge rooms. One time though there weren't any available so we were put in the South tower and although the decor is not as modern...the views were a great surprise. We had a side on view of the Bellagio fountains...so now I prefer to stay there just for the views and slightly cheaper price.

Reviews.Title: “"Updated North Tower??? Don't think so"”
Reviews.Author: 1WineLover54
Reviews.Content: We went here for a conference and were told to get the rooms in the North Tower as they were newly updated. Well the room looked nice, but the couch was a little dated with it's light blue velour cover. The hard goods seemed to have been upgraded and looked nice. However the mattress was only comfortable if you had taken a sleeping pill or had a drink or 3! Hard as a rock! The room was hot when I got into it, but turn freezing cold as the night progressed. Mind you there are no good views from the north tower. The parking lot of Bill's or the parking structure of Bally's and Paris, oh and the monorail. The best part about the room was the bath, which had GREAT lighting, wonderful water pressure in the shower and marble counter tops. However they are chintzy in their amenities. Bar soap for face and bath, hand and body lotion and "Conditioning Shampoo" which means they are too cheap to get separate conditioner. Come on Bally's, how about some bath gel, like the others do. Oh yes, another really nice thing is that all the hotels under the Cesar's label have no resort fee. Very Nice! Oh yes the sink did back up twice while I was there, filling the sink with stinky water, which drained away in a few minutes, but yuck!

Reviews.Title: “Great bargain, Great location!”
Reviews.Author: RockTIlUDrop
Reviews.Content: Bally's is located in the heart of the Strip, or just a little south of center. Across the street from the Bellagio fountains ~ one of the best free shows in LV. This was a terrific bargain - stayed here for about $65/night! The room was huge and clean. Not a fancy view, so if you want to overlook the strip, you'll pay more. Elevators were VERY FAST. Don't know why there were occassionally VERY long lines at the check out desk?? You can check-out in 2 minutes on the TV in your room! My only complaint was parking. I didn't want to valet park my rental car and didn't know where to go. The staff gave me confusing directions. I panicked when I pulled into the Paris garage, but found out the garages are all inter-connected and parking is FREE at the casinos. Whew! BUT the garage elevators dump you out into the maze of Paris's shops and casino. Sweating and pulling a suitcase across faux cobblestones through fellow vacationers was embarrassing. If you're smart - VALET PARK!! Parking is free, so the only $$ you'll pay would be a tip if you're inclined - it's well worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Simple, Class Vegas”
Reviews.Author: binthinak
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Bally's from July 4 - 10. We had no problems during our stay. The hotel's location may not be in the center of the strip, but the monorail station at the rear of the casino made it a convenient location to stay. This might not be a hotel that you spend a lot of time in, but is a less expensive option on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Annette45
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a week at Bally's while at a convention. Arriving on Sunday, check in was fairly quick. Through the email an offer was made to upgrade to the North Tower for $10 extra a night and we took advantage of that. The room was decent sized but I wish we had had a fridge, for $15 a night we could have had one, I just couldn't justify the cost. I could see the corner of the Bellagio fountains from our room, and the rest of the view was just the rooftop of the Paris complex, rather ugly. The fountain was noisy when it would shoot water really high, but the air conditioner tended to help drown it out. Maid service was great up until Saturday when they didn't bother picking wet towels off the floor or emptying the trash or taking dirty glasses. The channel selection isn't that great, but then they don't want you staying in your room. The shops in the hotel were bland, I found a much nicer selection going through the attached Paris hotel and I wish we had had our convention on the Paris side, beautiful, though space may have been an issue, the Bally's convention area was enormous. I appreciated their policy of always asking for I.D. when you would use your credit card and the shop staff were very friendly. If you don't mind really spicy meat, the Tequila Bar's taco salad was ok and the Sidewalk Cafe had a nice variety of food, though it was similar in quality to a Perkins. If I was going there again for pleasure I'd pay more for a better experience, though for the price it was a good bargain hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Old, but clean and it worked for us”
Reviews.Author: bofeb14
Reviews.Content: A friend and I met up in Vegas, I booked Bally's through a US Airways Vacation package, because of the price and location on the strip. We were booked into the South Tower. Had never stayed at Bally's before. The guy that checked me in offered an upgrade to the North Tower for an add'l $20.00 per night. I declined, since we wouldn't be in the room that often other than to shower and sleep. He said the North Tower had recently been remodeled, and the South Tower was "retro" - a.k.a., older. Our South Tower room was fine, it was spacious and we had a great view of the Strip, and we could see the water/light show at the Bellagio. The only icky thing was the carpet piece had partially come away from the wall and was flopping onto the floor, and the inside of the windows were filthy.

Reviews.Title: “Old, outdated rooms”
Reviews.Author: ErinR1138
Reviews.Content: Bally's motto is "Stay Classic" which is their way of saying "We haven't updated these rooms since the 60s." I know it is on the cheaper end and it is totally adequate, but the rooms really are pretty sad. There is old wallpaper peeling off, the furniture is old and beat up, and the non-smoking rooms still feel pretty smoky. The one good upgrade is that there are duvets on the beds, not gross bed spreads. If you can find a deal somewhere else, I recommend you take it.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Bally's”
Reviews.Author: LindySouthBend_IN
Reviews.Content: I had not stayed at Bally's for 14 years and only stayed because of a Total Rewards offer for free play that was offered to me. I was totally impressed with Bally's. Check in was very quick on a Sunday night. No wait at all. The check in staff was very pleasant and concerned that I got the room that I wanted. The room itself was HUGE! King bed, two desks, sofa and coffee table, large bathroom with coffee maker in the North Tower. I could not have been more impressed with Bally's. I usually stay at Flamingo and am treated very well there, but Bally's did a comparable job. I would consider staying again. Kudos to the entire staff at Bally's for their care and consideration. Also, thanks to Vickie on the casino floor for giving me some great direction on how to use my free play coupons! Thanks Vickie!!!

Reviews.Title: “Really run down - NOT recommended”
Reviews.Author: SS D
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights. All the carpets - corridors and rooms - are musty, dirty, stained...The sheets are not crisp and fresh. The staff at reception desk not particularly friendly. NO WiFi. Internet charges are twice what is available from other providers.

Reviews.Title: “wow!”
Reviews.Author: prideworks
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Sept 2010 for first time in Vegas. HUGE room with a bed to die for. Plenty of soft pillows. Treated myself to room service the first night and it was excellent; delivered a spot-on medium well steak. Locked myself out of the room the next day and the security personnel were with me in 5 minutes to let me in my room. The casino was excellent; especially for a first-time vegas goer. Right on the Vegas Strip with bus stop at the front corner. All desk personnel were helpful and professional. Room rates were very reasonable and competitive with the rest of the strip. I did not see any part of the property that was not easily handicap-accessible.The only reason I don't give them top rating is because check-in was long. When they have a line of people checking in they need more personnel at the desk.

Reviews.Title: “Our 7th or 8th stay here, always nice and great location!”
Reviews.Author: rkastrup
Reviews.Content: We usually go twice a year and always stay here. The rooms are oversized and the beds and pillows are so comfy! This N tower room had a loveseat and a nice view N of Wynn and the skyline. We had a sink drain stopper that didn't work and I called maintenance and they were at the door within 5 minutes to fix. The location is ideal, a covered walkway to Paris, outside and then on to Planet Hollywood, across the street from Bellagio and the new City Center, and kitty/corner from Caesars. Not much else I need for a 4 night stay! The Mexican restaurant on site (think it'sTequilla's) serves wonderful burgers and ribs (who would think?) and Sully's Bar has the best bartenders to take care of you while you play quarter poker. All in all for the money (especially Sun-Thurs) it's a great deal.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Galaxycow
Reviews.Content: Business and pleasure trip. All I can say is Ballys went above and beyond. I traveled with an amputee/wheelchair person and they treated us like gold. Rooms were big enough to fit two scooters, wheelchair and all our luggage and we still could have run a race in the room! Room was clean altho needed a little work on a lose sliding bathroom door and some low lying wallpaper in the bathroom, but nothing major. I plan on taking my daughter back to Vegas. THis was my first trip and was amazed ....thus want to share it with her. The pool area was great with a great bartender named Nacho. The staff at Ballys is fantastic!!! I will definately stay here again. I did look at alot of other hotels while there and for the price.....this hotel wins!

Reviews.Title: “Comped stay at Bally's”
Reviews.Author: 16gauge
Reviews.Content: My wife and I generally prefer to stay on Fremont Street when we visit Las Vegas. However, HET decided to give us 5 nights comped at a handful of hotels on our most recent stay. We chose Bally's. We were given a room on the 21st floor of the North tower - facing the pool with a view of Excalibur and Mandalay Bay. Room was good size and clean. The wallpaper and furniture were showing some age/wear, but that did not bother us. The King bed was quite comfortable to sleep in.

Reviews.Title: “More than expected"”
Reviews.Author: Majestic14
Reviews.Content: After reading several reviews about Bally"s I was fearing what my stay here would be like. To my surprise I really enjoyed my stay here. Our room was very nice and clean. The room was a little dated, but very pleasant. The bathroom was updated and very nice. Room service was very quick and very enjoyable when I didn't want to leave the room. The hotel is in a very nice location of the strip. No Bally's did not have a shopping center like the other hotels, but Paris was located right next door with plenty of restaurants and shopping! Overall would stay here again....

Reviews.Title: “Little Dated but Worth the Money”
Reviews.Author: heltom1
Reviews.Content: Although the room decor was a little dated, we really enjoyed our stay while at this hotel. Because there were no king suites available when we got there, we were upgraded to one of the very spacious queen parlor suites which had a fridge,wet bar area and small 1 cup coffee machine that worked great. The room was kept very tidy by the cleaning staff.Plus we had a pretty good view of the strip which was awesome. The air conditioning was a little noisy but we were greatful for it as the Temps reached 109 Deg F while we were there. Just beware though that everything costs in Vegas and although there are no resort fees at this Hotel there were some unexpected costs like $14.99 /24hrs for broadband internet, $24.99 / 24hrs if you want wireless and surprisingly local calls of which I made 2 to arrange for airport shuttle service cost $1.25 each. In all fairness though, I did note later that there was a shuttle phone located in the casino area that I probably could have used at no cost so live and learn. Also the fitness center which was not very well advertised cost $22.00/day per guest or $11.00/day after 3:00pm. I guess my point is to never assume that anything is for free in Vegas. The pool area was very nice and surprisingly not overcrowded and we were always able to find an available chaise. All in all a great stay and we would definitely stay at this Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: SteveRalegih
Reviews.Content: I always stay at either Paris or Ballys. Very nice location. The hotel was great, no complaints. It is Vegas, you should not be in the hotel that much anyway

Reviews.Title: “We wouldn't stay here again”
Reviews.Author: kath210
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the South Tower in order to be able to see the Bellagio Fountains from our room. Well, seeing the fountains was the best part of the room! The room was large as was the bathroom. The bathroom was clean. The best way to describe the room was "tired." It was a bit dusty and the furniture was from the 1970's. The casino was small and smokey. The hotel is in dire need of updating inside and outside. It was cheap, but I wouldn't stay there again. I would pay the extra money and stay somewhere else. It was our first trip to Vegas....live and learn!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, descent rooms.”
Reviews.Author: haros
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for the first time (we noramlly stay in the Palazzo, but getting to expensive $$). The location is great and the Hotel is descent. Obviously you get for what you pay , hotel is not updated and although we upgraded to a room with a Jacuzzi and double steam shower the Jacuzzi did not work at all:( so beware if they offer you an upgrade; make sure you ASK if evertyhing is operational) other than that the place is clean and comfortable. We would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value”
Reviews.Author: Kevin186220
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fab for LV strip area, great value. Checking in we had to wait a while but worth it on our first trip for 24 years to Vegas but with the family for the first time. We were in the South Tower which I am led to understand is not as good as the North. But it was OK. My daughters had a huge room which was probably classed as a suite. We also had a large room that had a great view of the Eifell Tower. Swimming pool is OK but I reckon possibly you could use the Paris Hotel pool ( sister hotel) which is much better. LV itself was brilliant and at the low priced rooms we had, we will be back soon! My daughters being 18 and 20 did cause problems with not being allowed to drink in local bars BECAUSE they were not even allowed in. And of course not allowed in the betting areas. But there is still lots to do and see. Especially the shops where the daughters were in the shops at different hotels at every opportunity. The Hotel was attached to Paris which had a fab walkway. It was hot, so try to use the air conditioned hotels link corridors and monorail. Plenty of choice of a shows to see, so can't get bored. Could get away with the spending budget though. Treasure Island and another hotel with Dolphins (which I can't remember the name) is worth a visit. There is also a place to see tame lions. Fab place which we all enjoyed if though exhausting walking from hotel to hotel. Recommend to be over 21 when visiting if you are beyond a child..

Reviews.Title: “Good Strip Location with Adequate Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Cratt97
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at Bally's over a weekend. The check in line on Friday afternoon was pretty short so the wait was only about 10 minutes. The front desk agent was very friendly and accommodated all of our requests. We stayed in a two queen junior suite in the North Tower. The junior suite is basically and oversized room with a wet bar, fridge, coffee maker, and vanity that sits in the small hallway to the bathroom. The rooms in the North Tower were updated more recently than the South but, the updates were still quite a few years ago so, be prepared for some imperfections. The room was adequately clean but, as we expected, there were carpet and furniture stains, chips on pretty much every wood like surface, scuffs on the walls, and water damage under the wet bar and in the bathroom. Having said that, the beds were fairly comfortable, the a/c worked well, and the water pressure was great for showering. We did not spend a lot of time eating, drinking or gambling at the resort. The drink service during a couple of short slots sessions was okay, not non-existent but not consistent. We hit the Tequila Bar one night for some quick eats. There's nothing quick about it but, the plate of nachos was tasty and big enough to feed 6 people. Overall, I would recommend Bally's for the great location and good rates (particularly through the Total Rewards program). If a more luxurious room is a higher priority, then Bally's is likely not the best choice.

Reviews.Title: “Good location!!”
Reviews.Author: Maureen H
Reviews.Content: This was the first time going to Vegas, and we stayed at Bally's. Not knowing what to expect, but were very pleased with what we received. We would go back again. The hotel was clean, staff very helpful. The location of Bally's was good because you were located pretty central to Cesar's Palace, Bellagio. WE WOULD GO BACK!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great service”
Reviews.Author: Colesjr
Reviews.Content: I am Vegas regular and found ballys service on my last trip above the expected. From vallet to maids to maintenance. Centre strip location ideal for hotel hopping. Rooms clean but tv in rooms older style with crappy reception.

Reviews.Title: “Not Fancy - but holding it's own as it grows older!!! I'd go back!”
Reviews.Author: uhohfiveoh
Reviews.Content: Wife and I stayed 3 weeknights. Check-in was a bit too slow for as few people as were in line. Room was definitely older, but was also much larger with a much bigger bathroom than a regular hotel room. The extra space was quite nice. This was a north tower deluxe room - I believe. Casino was open and dealers were friendly, but were again, a bit too slow with bringing drinks, especially to the slots. Pool was not fancy, but we were able to get chairs with no problems and waitresses were easy to be found for drinks. The pool is simple, but it did the job - get wet for 15 min and back to the chair! We also liked in-door walkway to the Paris and their spectacular breakast buffet. Bally's location is also pretty convenient, as it is near center-strip. We would go back again, if the price is right. No frills, but no complaints means we are happy!!

Reviews.Title: “So-so.....”
Reviews.Author: BlueWater42
Reviews.Content: Wasn't all that presses with this hotel as I was hoping for a little bit more. The casino itself was average, the buffet was poor at best, and the 'ambiance' was minimal. I booked a junior suite in the North Tower, which I read had been renovated, but the overall feeling is that they added a few items (granite, furniture, etc) to a poor quality room. I was in room 509 and faced the front of the hotel and all weekend long, motorcycles went by revving their engines and it kept me up quite a bit. The service was pretty good and the nicest part of the hotel was that it was connected to the Paris hotel, which is where I spent the majority of my time. Will not look to stay jere again, but better than when I stayed at the Saharah...what a POS!

Reviews.Title: “BALLY'S NEEDS A FACELIFT”
Reviews.Author: ADELEL9
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at Ball's several times and looked forward to our return to the hotel. It had been 4 years since we were at Bally's. Our check in took awhile, there were a lot of people in line, the desk staff was friendly, knowledgable, and did the best it could at getting everyone looked after. The room we were given was not acceptable. The floor was stained, I don't mean little marks but large black spills, the bathroom was filthy and the bedspreads were covered in huge stains. I called and asked to be changed and the desk was very helpful and sent a security guard to take us to the new room. He had a pass key to the new room. He opened the room and discovered it was occupied. We waited in the hall until aother room was found. Very nice. We noticed the halls and room doors are in desparate need of repainting and the carpeting in the public hallways was very worn and stained. Fresh paint and new carpets is all this hotel needs. The restaurants are good, location is perfect, great pool, just needs a facelift. One of the tours we took this time was at Bally's, we did the backstage tour of the Jubilee Show. It was excellent not to expensive and really shows what the performers go through to put on this show. Well worth the money. Paris and Bally's are connected. You can can access the monorail by going to the lower floor and follow the signs and the Hop On Hop Off Bus stops out front. Go out the lower doors from the casino to the second drive through area. You can buy tickets from this stop as well. Will I stay at Bally's again? For sure if they do some sprucing up, maybe if the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “WE LOVED BALLY'S”
Reviews.Author: sushifarmer
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Bally's on August 1st, 2011 for a 4 night stay! We were impressed with the cleanliness of the lobby and the casino. Check in took all of 5 mins and the staff were very friendly and helpful! We were given a room on the 69th floor in the south tower and had awesome views of the street, facing Bill's and you could see the Caesar's Palace and part of the Bellagio and the mountains in the distance. Our room was spacious and very clean, even if the furnishings were a bit dated. Housekeeping kept our room clean and fresh towels daily. Bally's was centrally located and we would definitely stay there again. We had $2 margarita's and $2 tacos at the Tequila Bar restaurant. They are open 24/7 and you have to ask for them, as they are not on the menu. Delicious food there! You can even get a good breakfast, for under $10. Plenty of slots and table games! Also there is a walkway thru to the Paris, so you don't even have to go out on the street to get there. Planet Hollywood is nearby also and Bellagio is across the street. We also enjoyed the pool one afternoon. Not too crowded and very clean area. Go to Bally's and have a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Casino was good for the deal that we received.”
Reviews.Author: jkelsh
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Bally's for 6 nights. I asked for an upgrade at the desk upon arrival and they gave us one for free. The rooms were older but large and more than adequate since you are not in your room very much anyhow. My only minor complaint was that we had asked for a non smoking room and it did have the odor of smoke. It was not intolerable however. The casino itself is smaller than the Bellagio or Planet Hollywood and does get very crowded. This makes it impossible to get a cocktail unless you leave your machine and go to the bar. Also, on Friday and Saturday nights Bally's has 2 or 3 female dancers around casino for your viewing pleasure. Most people are gambling and not even paying attention. I think if they are going to waste the money on this they should at least give women some "eye candy" too. Put a few men up there dancing in a speedo. There are alot of women in Vegas these days too. Bally's Steakhouse is excellent. (You can get 50% off coupons at Half Price Tix for Tonight). Price is Right is an incredible show as well. We also loved Terry Fator but he is at the Mirage. Since we received such a great deal at Delavacations I was more than satisfied with Bally's. Just don't book your transfers through ODS. We ended up getting a different shuttle to resort and took a taxi back to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Vegas As Expected”
Reviews.Author: xsdv8
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Bally's Vegas on our annual friends vacation and had a great time. The property is as you would expect for an aging mega-resort. Not the top of the line, but then you're not paying $400 a night for it either. Good casino action, and well located in the middle of the Strip. Rooms were clean and comfortable. TV channels sucked, but you're not there to watch TV are you? Our view was not exciting. We looked out over the casino (or something) roof toward the back of the hotel. No excitement there. One thing about the property is that it is so immense, you are going to walk for a long way just to get to the Strip. Thankfully, they recognized the distance and put in people-movers. Except for the night they were inoperable, they were greatly appreciated. I did love the fact that Bally's and Paris are connected through an inside shopping corridor. That was a treat when you wanted a different atmosphere. One note to anybody from Harrah's who might read this...it's not all about room service all the time. A coffee- maker in the room would be GREATLY appreciated!!!

Reviews.Title: “good clean hotel, friendly staff, nice pool”
Reviews.Author: ElissaClaire
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Bally’s Aug 2-6 and had a great time. Been before and had the same experience this time, actually, this trip was even better because of the friendly staff. Purpose of my trip was to relax with a few books at the pool during a brief get-a-way. I was frustrated at my airline arriving over an hour late, which timed it so that we had 2 jumbo planes unloading thru Customs in front of us – took an hour and a half to get thru Customs and that was a first for me (I’ve been to Vegas on vacation about 20 times and never waited more than 10 minutes at Customs in the past). Got to the hotel around 830pm and was lucky to have only a few people in front of me to check in … this hotel is known for long check in lines. The employee who checked me in was very nice, I simply said hi and asked how his day went, and then asked what it would cost to upgrade my room to a North Tower room. He said $20 per night and I said okay, let’s do it. A few minutes later, the employee said he gave it to me for free at no extra charge. I thanked him and then generously tipped him. He thanked me for the tip, and tried then to upgrade me to a suite, but I declined as I was traveling alone suggested he keep the suite for a couple who might check in later. He asked what else he could do for me – I said how about a late check out and he confirmed me a 3pm check out at no fee. That was the highlight as many times when you can get a late check out, they don’t confirm it until morning of check out and then even with a fee it’s only until about 1pm most of the time. I was also able to get a quiet, non-smoking room as requested. I ended up with a decent view up on the 20th floor overlooking part of the roof and also the pool. The room was decent, clean, larger than most Vegas hotels. I have never stayed in the the Classic rooms (ones without a reno) so cannot compare, but the North Tower rooms suit me fine. Spent 3 days at the pool. I never had a problem finding a lounge chair, but really, due to the heat, most people are in the pool and not lounging outside the pool. Like any other Vegas hotel, drinks are a rip off at the pool but since you cannot bring in outside food and beverages, you don’t have a choice but to pay those prices. The food at the Blu Café at the pool was good and reasonably priced for Vegas. FYI: On Fridays thru Sundays, the DJ at the pool cranks up music at 1230pm to an ungodly volume so be prepared. I don’t gamble so cannot comment on that aspect. I dined a few times at the Paris Hotel buffet, but made a point to hit the Wynn’s buffet – totally worth the extra money eating there as there is a delightful selection and the quality of their food surpasses anywhere else I’ve eaten on the strip. Some others I know say the Bellagio buffet is the best, but being from Vancouver I’m not eager to eat seafood in Vegas when it’s readily available fresh at home, and that seems to be the bragging rights at the Bellagio buffet – their seafood. Don’t buy bottled water in any of the hotels on the strip – that’s just wasting your money. Bottled water is cheaper in the ABC Store in the Miracle Mile shops at Planet Hollywood OR also at the corner store behind Bally’s – if you exit Bally’s by the Sports Betting area, that immediate cross street has a bar on the corner (sign says 19 years left on our lease) and also is attached to a corner store. If you’d like to walk further, there is a Walgreens done across from Monte Carlo as well as a CVS Pharmacy too and those places sell bottled water and other items at decent prices.

Reviews.Title: “It's Time To Up-Date”
Reviews.Author: Prine041745
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at Bally's off and on for years. It is obvious the management is not spending any money on the property and it shows. The buffet is closed, and the other food options arn't much to talk about. There are better options in the same price range.

Reviews.Title: “great once again”
Reviews.Author: sparkly1968
Reviews.Content: this was our 2nd time staying at ballys,we was hoping for a free upgrade again to north tower but didnt get one,i was a bit worried about staying in the south tower because of reviews on here not being to good,i neednt have worried we were given a junior suite which was huge,yes furniture is prob from the eighties but was fine.it was a fair walk to the pool,which is great by the way, but everything is a fair walk in vegas lol. I cannot find fault with the hotel,for the money we paid it was great,no charges upon check out either,id used the phone once and the safe everyday normally a $3.00 charge evevryday,got charged for that last year,i guess it depends on the reception staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good spot ! Nice price & Clean !”
Reviews.Author: Sostraone
Reviews.Content: Very well situated on the strip. Staff very professional and helpfull. Gave me an upgrade with a room on the strip view, No credit card required for a deposit, it was a prepaid booking for a ridiculous price and it was a very nice stay. Also, be aware that everything is overprice in Las Vegas (eat-drinks-coffee-breakfast-etc...)

Reviews.Title: “Older but still nice”
Reviews.Author: nmfallguy
Reviews.Content: Ballys have some good rooms and some not so good rooms.I stayed in the south tower this time and was shocked at the size of the room,more spacious than some of the 3 or 4 star hotels in town.Rember this is an older property some of the ammenities are not provided,what makes this property so appealing is location.Every thing you might want or need is a short walk away,from Caesars to the Venetian just a quick walk and you have some great shopping.Any kind of food you may want is nearby also.So book early and get the deals,stay at one of Vegas Icons............

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfull Place to Stay, north tower rooms are much better than south.”
Reviews.Author: travellotcities
Reviews.Content: Cleanr Rooms, wonderfull location, connected to Paris Hotel and located in the middle of the strip, parking is really easy on the Paris casino side.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Iraqi
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is in excellent location, The rooms were very big, clean and quite with good room services, I liked its swimming pool and the Don Arden Theater. over all it was an excellent choice with reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “NEVER AGAIN!”
Reviews.Author: Mageri55
Reviews.Content: From the start at the check-in counter, I have never been treated so "coldly.' I was not greeted with a "welcome to Bally's" I even let the front desk person know it was my first time in Vegas - no response. I had to ask to point me in the direction of my room, and he just pointed and never said, "Thank you for staying at Bally's and have a wonderful time.

Reviews.Title: “the best on the strip”
Reviews.Author: teemc
Reviews.Content: Looking at the reviews and some not so favorable I decided to take my chances and draw my own conclusion. The hotel staff was excellent,. From the desk clerk to the bellman. We were checked in by Rita who was extremely pleasant. Our rooms were upgraded to the North Tower, The room was nice and clean. The view was great. The pool area is nice also. It is an older hotel, but all was good. Looking forward to staying at Ballys again. For the price it can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value”
Reviews.Author: anjelina55
Reviews.Content: Great location, right across the street from the Bellagio, connected to Paris, right in the middle of all the action. Price was right and the room was very nice and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: DM85
Reviews.Content: Me and a friend (25 yr old females) stayed in Bally's for just under a week in June. We found it clean and our room was a generous size. The decor was modern and our curtains blacked out the sun in the morning. The pool area was nice and we always managed to get a seat/sunbed. The music seemed to go up a notch over the weekend, as you would expect. The music wasn't to our taste and was quite hard to drown out even with my i-pod on full blast, but it was expected. We had some drinks in the tequila bar which were nice and good value for money. We also ate in the cafe/diner place near the pool (breakfast) which was nice. The best aspect of the hotel was the location, which was brilliant. It is connected to Paris and opposite the Bellagio. Right in the middle of the strip and it has a metro type connection to several other hotels, though all the hotels it is linked to are quite easy to walk to (maybe not depending on heat though!) We ate in Paris a few times and really really enjoyed the food there. All in all, i would most certainly recommend staying in Bally's. Often with big hotels, it is the luck of the draw, whether you get a room in need of updating or a room with a good view etc. We had no major complaints about our room. (the only ones being- it was a non-smoking room and we could sometimes smell smoke in the bathroom- maybe it was coming in from vents? and we would have expected free wi-fi as we got in many of the other hotels on our travels but maybe that is just a standard thing in vegas?) For the price, we found Bally's great as a base and would return if we come back to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel on the Las Vegas Strip”
Reviews.Author: vegasteach
Reviews.Content: The hotel is older, but very nice. I liked my room. It was very clean. The staff was friendly. Bally's location is within walking distance to the other casinos where I was seeing some shows, so that was nice. It's right next to the Paris Hotel, and shares their parking garage. You can also use the pool at the Paris, and it is a nice pool. All in all, it's a good hotel with a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Not great - won't stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: cerwin814
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Vegas for the first time this past spring and had our choice of certain Harrah's hotels at varying discounted prices. Bally's has an optimal location right in the middle of the strip and it was in the median price range so we chose it. Wrong choice. Service was awful. The staff are not very friendly and customer service is not a priority for this establishment. If you're going to stay, I would advise going for the upgrade which was offered to us for an additional $50 a night. It sounded very nice and we should've paid the extra cash because the room we got was horrible. It was very dated, not very clean and the view was crappy. We had a problem with the toilet, it wouldn't flush, the handle was broken and we had to be moved in the middle of the night, such a hassle and we weren't offered anything for the convenience. No one offered to move our luggage and It took us an hour to find the other room because the front desk gave us wrong directions. I'm not hard to please, though I expect to be treated well and that's just not a focus here. We visited a couple other Harrah's while we were there and was impressed with Ceasars (obviously) and Rio. Rio was off the strip but a fun place to be. They have shuttles that will take you to other Harrah hotels and we'll probably stay at Rio next time. Anyway we go, we're definately not staying at Bally's!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it and will be back!”
Reviews.Author: MrsBigA
Reviews.Content: My friend booked this impromptu trip for us to Las Vegas from June 27-30 and chose to stay at Bally's. I've stayed at many other hotels on and off the strip over the years and I must say that my friend made a great choice! I was able to call ahead an reserve a refrigerator because we knew the temp would be high and we wanted to keep some cold drinks in our room (just water folks!) After we came in, it arrived without delay. When we were checking in we were asked if we wanted to stay in a renovated room for $-more a night... nope, not necessary, so we got our room in an 'old' wing... but holy-crow, when we opened the curtains in our room (6537) we had the most spectacular view of the Eiffel Tower, LV Bvld and the Bellagio fountain. My friend had always wanted to stay at Paris, but we never found the right deal... but when we had a chance to now overlook the Paris pool, we could see that it was 1/2 in the shade of it's own tower most of the day... not great for sunbathing. We found our way down to our pool and oh my... the first day we were able to find a lush green belt surrounded by palm trees - heavenly. Later we wanted to be closer to the pool and had no problem finding pool side loungers. The pool-side drinks were crazy expensive, but anyone who is Vegas savvy knows that isn't where you choose to drink! They have a great food court, but our favourite breakfast spot was cutting through to Paris and grabbing a croissant! Tres magnafique! Our room had the nicest attendant too. Very friendly and sweet. We had the chance to see Jubilee! BUT the best advise we could share is to tell you to go see the backstage tour. Pasty did an amazing job showing our group around and it was a great experience to see the costumes and sets up close! Well done everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Great all around hotel”
Reviews.Author: SDtoSJGirl
Reviews.Content: Central location, connects to Paris hotel. Easy ramp access to Bellagio and Caesars Palace. PH also walking distance. Standard rooms are very spacious and clean, but no fan in the bathroom. Charge for internet and fridge (w/o freezer), but no resort fees. Very friendly housekeeping staff. Great price and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: wandergirly
Reviews.Content: My stay at Bally's was for 1 night only, booked by a travel service for the company who invited me to participate in a business meeting. Arriving at nearly 10 pm, I was tired and cranky. The desk reservation agent was friendly, competent and professional. When I asked for a room close to the elevator so I wouldn't have to walk far (health issue), she worked and worked and worked and finally upgraded me to a small suite that was steps from the elevator foyer. She smilingly declined a tip for the extra service. The room was average in quality, but clean and comfortable; it was the service that rocked.

Reviews.Title: “probably the best located hotel on the strip”
Reviews.Author: wavemermaid
Reviews.Content: My family always use the free nights to visit Vegas, and Bally's happens to be our most visited hotel. We recently went on another family trip, and I just love its location and room. Its in the middle of the strip, connected to Paris hotel. The famous Bellagio is a bridge away, and lucky guests can view the fountain show from the room. They have two towers (North and South), but South is the best!!! I believe it is the newer tower, and the room is very clean and tower itself is quiet. I would love to give 5 stars, but the bottom line is you can't compare Bally's with other luxurious hotels like Wynn, Aria, and new Cosmopolitan. Regardless, this is my favorite place to stay. And the staffs are very attentive and sweet!

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms in the North Tower”
Reviews.Author: eringlas
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights. Our room was very spacious and clean but our friends in the South Tower did not have as new nor as big a room. Don't eat in Ballys, we tried a couple of places in there and they were not worth the money. Overall, clean rooms, good value but the pool could do with a clean.

Reviews.Title: “Totally worth the price, would go back for sure- perfect location”
Reviews.Author: travelbugg444
Reviews.Content: We took a package from Alleginat air flying from bellingham (way cheaper than any other deal out there)... I had read the reviews, so i was prepared that it wasn't a 5 star hotel.. but my friends were staying at the cosmopolitan .. and it was super close... When we arrived i was blown away... it's actually very nice inside!!! We had to wait a little bit for the checking in, but the line did move quick, mabe 3-5 min wait but it looked longer..... The lady did try to 'upsale' us to the north tower, we were in the south, but you know what we didn't take it.... because our room was HUGE... huge huge, way more space than what we needed and everything looked clean. Ya okay i'm sure they're not scrubbing the tiles or the ceilings everyday... but whatever, i paid like 750$ for Air AND hotel, for 4days.. for two people, like i care .. bed sheets smelled like bleach so that was a great sign!!! Hotel has krispy creams and coffee for cheap.... make sure you sign up for their card and you get points. There is also a tunnel from the casino into Paris!!!! that's so awesome!!! Out of 10 i would give them a 7 .. and i would totally go back :)

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Great price!”
Reviews.Author: KosTravelisLife
Reviews.Content: Ok... the Hotel and Casino feel like they are due for a remodel. But that's partly why we were able to get an excellent price for such a prime location! The room was decent, spacious and nothing to complain about. There is a moving walkway to Paris that gets you right on the strip. So if you are planning to spend all day sightseeing and don't spend much time in the room, this is the perfect spot!

Reviews.Title: “Went for business, stayed for pleasure.”
Reviews.Author: savvykat74
Reviews.Content: I arrived at Bally's for a work-related class/seminar on Monday, March 7th at approx. 7pm. Check in was super easy and the Attendant was wonderful! I wanted to arrange to stay in the same room after my class which ended on that Friday as my Husband was joing to join me and we were going to stay for the weekend. She made that happen and even held an extra key at the desk so my Husband could get it when he arrived and not have to wait for me to get out of my class! Great service! The room was nice - in the remodeled area. I was SUPER happy that there was a coffee pot in the room - a rare find in Vegas! I ran into a problem though - in the age of technology, I have 2 cell phones and a laptop. There were NOT enough outlets in the room - not even a strip of outlets at the desk. I had to unplug the lapms... I called my Husband to tell him to bring a power strip when he came - because he will add 2 cell phones to the mix as well! My co-workers who attended the seminar with me complained of the same thing. Meals and snacks during the class were catered by the hotel and were "fine" but nothing to be excited about. I ate at a couple of the "food court" establishments (Nathan's, Sbarros, etc.) and those were good. I was disappointed that the Buffet was gone ("The Kitchen" or something like that..). We ate there during our last trip to Vegas in 2007 and it was GREAT! I was really looking forward to eating there again. The staff were all very friendly - I always received extra towels when I asked and the room was kept clean and stocked. I would probably stay there again - the location in the center strip, a monorail stop and the shuttle to Rio were a must have for shopping and sightseeing!

Reviews.Title: “I went back for more recently...”
Reviews.Author: jthutmd
Reviews.Content: Another visit to Ballys Las Vegas this summer. I did not go to the shows. This time we were put in the north tower. Clean room. No coffeemaker, clean bedding, No phone in the bathroom. Granite bathroom countertops. Clean toilets. Carpet worn and stained. Furniture dated but not worn or broken. Nice fluffy pillows. Air conditioning is great. Walls showed worn area around air intake duct. Closet big and more than adequate to set two suitcases into it. Tub has granite walls. Lots of towels and face cloths. Ironing board and iron are full sized and work well. TV flat screen 25 inch in cabinet. Internet charge it is not free. Desk in room. Two phones. Two bedside tables. Lounge chair. Elevators still working well. Staff was very nice but make beds at 8 AM on weekdays or try to do so. Nothing to put on the door to stop the staff from knocking on the door. Food is put on tables for service not as in some hotels with just a tray. Food is reasonably priced but with Total Rewards it was free. Gambling is not paying out there since the economy is pretty weak. Casino has not changed. Tequila Bar had 2.00 Margaritas and 2.00 Tacos. Creme Brulee is fantastic.Lots of table games, slots, as usual. Easy access to back for elevators and restrooms in casino. Fast check in and out. We have Diamond status so we go to Daimond Club to check in. If you are Gold member get ready to stand in a long line. Platinum members not bad only a few people there in line. Seven Star members must get royal treatment. We had a standard room. New bridge over Ballys to go to Bills and Flamingo next to each other. Escalators and electric walkways out to the front of LV Blvd. for impaired. Easy (fastest) way is to go across street on Flamingo at Bills and go up to LV Blvd and Flamingo if walking. Side entrance is my favorite. I had a car. Park in back and go thru mall area to elevators at mall level to room. Mall is downstairs from casino and escalators lead to tram/monorail. Lots of mall shops and eaterys with pizza and hot dogs and a pool at back. Overall about the same as most visits to Ballys. We did not use the pool. Another 4 star visit. I knocked off for the worn down carpet. You can check out over the phone or at the desk, or on TV. We tried the phone route and found out today that part of the food bill was not put on the account since it was charged on the day we left. This was quickly resolved with a call to Ballys billing department. But if you do not gamble or play with your players card, you have to pay for it. There are coke machines on every floor but it was empty and could be they want you to buy it from room service. Its 2.50 in machine and 4.00 in the hotel. There is a 7-11 behind Ballys and a convenience store at the side on Flamingo as well. Prices much cheaper outside the hotel for bottled water as well...3.50 a pop in the hotel. They raised prices and changed the menus out while we were there. I think prices go up often. Nosh is a deli that has DELICIOUS pastrami sandwiches, soups, and parfees as well as baked items. Also has a coffee bar near check in with desserts. Wine list in room. Cable TV. Movies. Video games for the kids for a price on TV. Adult movies....etc. Wheelchair rooms. Lots of elevators.

Reviews.Title: “Doesn't get any better!”
Reviews.Author: krstn425
Reviews.Content: My friends and I went to Las Vegas and we stayed at Bally's. We paid $34 a night between the three of us! It was SUCH a great deal and such a great hotel! I've been to Vegas before and let me tell you, its all about location. You want to be close to everything. Bally's is pretty much in the middle of the strip, it is connected to the Paris across the street from the Bellaggio. Honestly, I don't think i would want to stay anywhere else when I go to Vegas in the future. The pool was great, the rooms were nice, monorail stop, good food, GREAT location!

Reviews.Title: “Must get into newer rooms”
Reviews.Author: midoririta
Reviews.Content: I guess I was in the older rooms and wasn't the happiest with my room. The hotel is in a great location, and after a minor glitch checking in, we hit our rooms around 11p. We lucked out and got a room on the 22nd with great views of the pool, the strip, and the airport with mountains in the background. My aunt who had paid the same rate, was on the 5th floor with a view of a rooftop. Who knows. The rooms were dated, and not very clean. We were in a smoking room becuase my grandmother smokes, there were ashes on the back of an arm chair and paper stuck to the desk in something sticky! Housekeeping called us at 930a beucase we had our do not disturb sign up... isn't that the point of do not disturb... very upset by this. Have stayed in many, many hotels and never been woken up like that. The best thing that I can say about the hotel was their pool are. Blu was awesome. Very young party crowd, great atmopsphere, great DJ. Would consider staying there again if I could guarantee newer room and cheap rate just for the pool!

Reviews.Title: “Great location but service needs work”
Reviews.Author: euphamia
Reviews.Content: Our intial impression of Bally's was not great. When we checked in i wanted to give the Front Desk Agent my credit card so that we could charge to our room. We were told that the hotel does not take credit cards at checkin. Needless to say we didn't charge anything to our room and ate at other properties. Love that there is a coffee maker in the room!! Housekeeping was very courteous and helpful. My only comment on the room is that for all the smoking rooms we have had in Vegas this is the only one that smelled horribly of smoke. Location is in the middle of the strip so is very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: kristy_haines
Reviews.Content: Bally's has some pros and cons but is all in all a decent place to stay in Las Vegas.
