Check in was quick and painless, and we were upgraded to a suite the first night with a jacuzzi tub the size of a small hot tub! The rooms had everything you needed although they were a little dated. All that really mattered to us was that there were lots of towels and they were clean (which they were) as we spent most of our time exploring what Vegas had to offer. The pool always had lots of available chairs and was quieter than the other pools we visited, although we preferred to use the Paris pool as it was nicer and had the best music. You can get into the Paris pool by showing your Bally's room key. We didn't eat at Bally's very often although we found the Tequila Bar a great place to get cheap tacos and margaritas ($2 each). We found that the adjoining Paris hotel had great restaurant options including the Sugar Factory (where you can sit on the patio and watch the Bellagio fountains). We had a pleasant stay at Bally's and found that for the price it was a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “A Good bet”
Reviews.Author: businesstraveler93
Reviews.Content: When you go to one of the very large hotels in Las Vegas you pretty much know what to expect. At times there will be long lines to check-in/check-out, restaurants may be full when you want to eat, etc. Maybe i was just lucky, but I experienced none of that at Bally's. Yes, there were people ahead of me at check-in--but with plenty of agents on duty the line moved swiftly--same thing at check-out. Rooms (deluxe North tower) were spacious, clean and well designed. These are definitly not high-roller suites, but having stayed in several Las Vegas mega hotels over the years, I can say that these are among the best "normal" rooms to be had. I ate at the Sterling Brunch (in the steakhouse) on Sunday and that definitely lived up to the hype--best brunch I have ever had--anywhere! but most meals were in the sister property "Paris" where the food was good and had fewer long lines waiting to be served. Most times, i simply walked up to the Host stand and was taken in immediately. With a central location on the "Strip" Bally's provides easy access to several other casino hotels and a good selection of independant restaurants as well. If you are there for a convention, or vacation, Bally's is a good bet.

Reviews.Title: “Big improvement”
Reviews.Author: Southland
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed one night at Bally's and then had an opportunity to move to the Paris Hotel next door. Our experience had always been that while Bally's was a great place to stay, it was a little dated compared to the rooms at Paris. Well, we were really pleasantly surprised by the updated room at Bally's and wished we had spent all of our nights there.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad..we will stay again.”
Reviews.Author: tiffnshay421
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel. Excellent location. We upgraded to the north tower anotherwards the newer rooms...they were very nice. I can't imagine how the older rooms looked considering she said they haven't been renovated in 17yrs. No fridge which for twenty bucks extra a night to upgrade we thought would come with a fridge. All around Great location. Hotel/casino itself is beautiful. First stay in vegas and would definitely come back to Ballys to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Bally's, your our 'one and only' - Thanks for another terrific stay!”
Reviews.Author: toby1111
Reviews.Content: Bally's provided the perfect 'kick off' for our return vacation to Las Vegas this year. Our great accommodations coupled with Bally's friendly staff, punctuated our stay. We were a long way from Pennsylvania, but felt safe and secure, as though we were in our own back yard. Las Vegas is exciting! Bally's is outstanding! What more could one ask for. Thanks again Bally's. Your the best!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, clean, not much else going for it”
Reviews.Author: Cymbolz
Reviews.Content: Typical casino hotel where you have to walk through the gaming area (a long way) to get to the elevators. But the location is very good, in the middle of the strip. I got a reasonable room rate, and the room was a good size and clean. But that’s about all it has going for it. Rip off internet, as most Vegas hotels on the strip seem to have….so head down to a coffee shop and buy a coffee or snack. The service was ok but nothing spectacular…you do feel like a number and just part of the process (eg check in….)

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay at Bally's”
Reviews.Author: columbia409
Reviews.Content: This was the 4th stay at Bally's. I received a great offer from Total Rewards (two nights free) and chose to stay at Bally's. Bally's is perfect is you're looking for a nice, quiet, clean and cool (great a/c!) room.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: PRSFLAME
Reviews.Content: The check in process at this hotel was a nightmare. Check in time was 4PM. After standing in line for 2 hours, with only one clerk working the desk, we were told our rooms were still not ready, and to return in one hour. Long story short, it was close to 9PM by the time we were able to get In to our rooms. We were in the south tower. The rooms were clean and comfortable, but in serious need of updating. The hallway carpets were filthy and really needed to be properly cleaned and vacuumed. Room service trays were left out in the hallways for several days before anyone came by to remove them. The staff at the hotel seemed disinterested in providing good customer service. I did enjoy the swimming pool area. The hallways were quite, and never noisy. The location and proximity to the strip was ideal. I paid 35 per night for my room, so I can't really complain. If you can get a cheap room rate, and don't need lots of frills, or mind older hotel decor, this hotel can't be beat. I think that if you have to pay more than that, there are other hotels on the strip with much better customer and amenities.

Reviews.Title: “great”
Reviews.Author: ddpankov
Reviews.Content: first of all: if you don't like your room just ask for another and you will get, in our we had smoking cigar left by previous guests. new room they gave us was great. secondly: this is two hotels in one paris+balley's so you could enjoy both w/o leaving a building. pool is good, food is good, shows are nice. and Belagio fountain just across the street.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for..good location but old style”
Reviews.Author: DesiMan
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at bally for 3 nights in mid-July. This is a good economy hotel. The location is right in the middle of the strip and service is OK. My regular room in South tower (#5939) had a good view of Bellagio fountains from the room itself. If you stay here, the part that kills your overall vegas experience is the very outdated decor from the 70's in your room. It is a downer for me. If you don't care about that, I think you will have no complaints. However, the rooms were clean.The sweetest part is the low price for this location.

Reviews.Title: “South Tour Grand Suite”
Reviews.Author: Sooner9196
Reviews.Content: We received an upgrade to a suite because they did not have a non smocking room ready for us. It was great!! We had a huge, clean room with a great view and the A/C worked great. The furniture was dated but we loved our room. The Tequila Bar was very good and the monorail service was also a bonus. Overall all you can't beat Bally's location. One tip instead of going all the way to the front to go towards the Flamingo, go right just outside the main doors of Bally's and there is a cross walk that takes you right to the back side of Bill's Gambling Hall. It is much quicker than taking the long way up and over the street and will save you a very long walk.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location, good price, rooms are just ok.”
Reviews.Author: denisi11
Reviews.Content: I think the title says it all, the location is amazing right accross from Bellagio, next to the Paris hotel and the price is just right. The rooms were quite spacious but dated, beds were comfortable, rooms were also clean. The pool is nice, but nothing out of the ordinary. The hotel is connected to the Paris via the Paris shops, and there is also a monorail stop at Bally's. If your main concern is being in the middle of the action and the room itself is not a great concern, Bally's is the place for you!

Reviews.Title: “Inflated, overrated and 2 thumbs down on service.”
Reviews.Author: 67malibuman
Reviews.Content: On a week long conference so we decided to arrive a day early. Had to book and pay for the extra night which ended up being $360 which is extremely high for this hotel. So if you have to pay $360 for one night you would expect certain ammenities to be included to make it worthwhile. At Bally's they seem to think differently. Want to use the safe to safe guard all the money you'll need to pay your pill? $3.99 a day. Want a cup of coffee when you wake up? call room service and ask the price, that'll wake you up. Want to go work out at the gym that is off site? $22 a day please. Wifi access $13.99 a day. No Concierge service available and the front desk was lined up with people waiting to check in. In Vegas I expect and can get better at any number of hotels. The room we had was nice and overlooked the strip but certainly not a $360 a night room. The conference rate for this room was $149. You are on your own at Bally's, two thumbs down!!

Reviews.Title: “Not Very Happy!”
Reviews.Author: norainydays
Reviews.Content: Geeze they really need more clerks to check people in, as the line was crazy, and it was a Monday! I noticed the next day as we walked by it was the same for those checking in. Hey, fill those windows with clerks, and keep your customers happy! Later that evening we thought we'd play some Keno, and after sitting there and filing out our numbers, when we went to turn it in, the girl said they were not doing it as they were short handed! WHAT! Also, they took out the coffee pot, so you have to pay $10. for Room Service to bring you up a pot. REALLY! They had them in the rooms a year ago. Las Vegas was sooooo crowded at this time of the year, that the crowds and traffic made it less enjoyable. I thought weekdays would be ok, but it was still crazy crowded. Next time I will try a different hotel, and a different time of year. The location of this hotel is good, and the rooms in the North Tower are roomy, and clean. Must of our interaction with the staff was just ok or poor, except for one blonde older waitress who was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “What a pleasant experience!!”
Reviews.Author: mexicanwannabe
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at the Flamingo last summer, my mother and I like the location on the strip but refused to stay at that dump again! We stayed at Bally's last week, and what a breath of fresh air!! We were put in a room in the North Tower, since the manager knew the problems we had at the Flamingo. The staff at this hotel were friendly and tried to make everyone happy and comfortable. My 72 year old mother requested a lower floor, and we were put in a room on the 5th floor. The view of the room overlooked a roof, so we had absolutely no view, but the room was nice, bathroom looked to be new, and the staff were very pleasant! The ONLY complaint I have is that maid service could have been a little better.....when we arrived, there was a bottle cap under the desk. At the end of the week, it was still there. We intentionally left it there, to see if if was ever picked up. Just proved to us how little attention was paid to basic things like vaccuuming! Beds were comfortable and we had no trouble falling asleep, however the pillows are small and flat, so I had a stiff neck the whole week! The room we were in was a far hike from the elevators, but was extremely quiet, which is shocking in Vegas. We never heard noise in the hallways or from neighbors. Bally's attaches indoors to Paris, so we didn't have to go outside for a change of scenery. We spent every day out at the pool. The weather was beautiful while we were there- hot with a breeze, yet the pool was fairly empty. There are plenty of chairs for everyone. There are plenty of waitresses taking drink orders around the pool as well, which was nice! Oh, one more thing I noticed.....there is no refrigerator in the room, so if you like to keep cold drinks in your room, bring them from downstairs.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay - see you soon!”
Reviews.Author: moneygirl55
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Ballys from June 10th to 14th. While waiting to be checked in, everyone was offered bottled water, which was a nice touch. Danielle S. checked us in and was the most pleasant and professional as they come. She upgraded us to a North tower mini suite on the 21st floor. The room was lovely and very, very clean and had a coffeemaker. Moments after we arrived in our room, Danielle called to make sure everything was "ok" with our room. How thoughtful is that! Thanks Danielle! As far as the casino the slots were very tight and it seems that they were doing some upgrades to the carpet. The entertainment in Indigo lounge was great and the food in the Tequila Restaurant was also good. Overall it was a wonderful stay and we will definately be back soon! Thanks Ballys!

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased”
Reviews.Author: nicoleGoodyear_Az
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at Bally's in one of their North Tower rooms. I read that the North Tower rooms are better than the South Tower, but can only comment on the North Tower. The room was large and clean. The bathroom was huge! The check in process went smoothly. We ate breakfast at the Cafe/Buffet they have. We didnt do the buffet and just ordered off of the menu. The food and service were both good. The location is great....center strip! I would stay at Bally's again.

Reviews.Title: “Always a great place to stay on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: 007DAWG
Reviews.Content: Perfect location, friendly staff, large inexpensive rooms. Pool area is very good as well, nothing fancy, but you can always get a chair and the pool is very large.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, OK hotel”
Reviews.Author: ORTraveller51
Reviews.Content: Bally's is a huge hotel right in the middle of "The Strip." Our room was in the new tower. I'm told the rooms are better there. Room was very big . Bathroom however was small (but adequate). Room was a little shop worn and in need of a paint job and new wallpaper. Beds were comfortable and sheets clean. Bathroom was pretty clean and came with lots of towels. Tub/shower combo was substandard because the shower head didn't work properly. I tried to adjust it, but it was beyond help. If I go to Las Vegas again I will probably stay at another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Junkie745685
Reviews.Content: We stayed here recently as we had friends getting married in Vegas. I had read the Trip Advisor reviews in advance as always (thank you, everyone!!) and therefore knew to request the north tower at checkin. We were told there was a $20 upgrade charge per night but let them know it was our anniversary and first time in Vegas and they found a room for us there at no charge. Apparently the 7th floor is the dog floor (??) as there were many guests with dogs there but we didn't care! The room was very spacious and clean and the beds were quite comfortable. We had no problems during our stay except 1) When a tour confirmation was faxed to us, we didn't realize there was a $4 charge for a one page fax to be received until we received the bill at check out (really? $4 to print one page?) and 2) It's $22 a day to use the fitness center. 95% of hotels include this for free so this seemed a bit misleading, and no, we didn't pay it. The pool was not spectacular but the DJ there was very good. Compared to the other hotels in Vegas, the casino and theme were pretty boring but the rooms are apparently much bigger. Overall, it was a nice place but didn't wow us, and in Vegas, you kind of expect to be wowed. I would recommend Ballys to someone who wants a large, clean, comfortable room and doesn't care about the glam and gltiz.

Reviews.Title: “lot's of fun”
Reviews.Author: katnmousemich
Reviews.Content: My family and I just returned from our 4 day trip. We also stayed at Bally's because it was comped. We arrived very early Sunday morning (7:30am) well before check in, our bags were held for us until we were able though. The staff was great as we were upgraded to the north tower at no additional charge. Rooms were quite large which was a plus with four adults in there at one time. There wasn't much of a view because we were only on the fifth floor but we didn't spend much time looking out the window anyway, all the fun was outside! What a great location!!! right in the heart of the strip. Our children ages 22 and 24 were in heaven. There is so much to see and do within blocks of us to eather side. And yes the Tequila bar was great.... lot's of good food at a great price. Will stay again:)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Andyrhino
Reviews.Content: Huge room, really clean and comfortable. Great location, lovely pool a good choice of shops and places to eat. There's a monorail station at the hotel which is a cheap and efficient way to get around Vegas. You're not getting a themed hotel with Bally's but don't let that put you off. We used our room to shower, change and sleep in! Too busy having fun to stay in it for longer than necessary!! The staff were very helpful and friendly in spite of the hotel being incredibly busy. Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Could not honor their package deal they sold me”
Reviews.Author: Speaktok
Reviews.Content: I bought a 5 day package deal called thier "Fun in the Sun" package. With this comes a 25 dollar pool credit to be used on drinks or food. Well not only did I have to put a credit card on file for this but when I did that it kept telling the computer system I had checked out! Then I was comped two drinks at Sully's Bar for my haggle since it took them 4 days to straighten out the problem and the day after I come home they charge my credit card for the ONE sandwich I bought at the pool. Then when I called them to complain that they screwed up, I was continuously hung up on due to them not even willing to look at my account. Also was supposedly "upgraded" to the room I actually bought. Every time we went to take the huge people movers out to the main street they were also broken and forcing all the foot traffic to have to go through the vallet drop off causing the staff to get ticked at the guests staying at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay/Will Definitely Be Back!!!”
Reviews.Author: upteacher
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a 5-night trip to Vegas!! We stayed at Bally's because we had comps. I was really nervous about staying here because of previous reviews, but we had a fantastic experience!! We checked in at 6:00 pm on Saturday night and there was NO line at all. We were not offered a free upgrade, but we did upgrade to a North Tower room for an additional $20 a night. We were on the 22nd floor, room 2248. No view of the strip; we had a view of the pool, Platinum Hotel, and the back of the Hard Rock. It was VERY quiet, which was nice. The room was huge, clean, and quiet. Nice updated bathroom. We DID have a coffeemaker in our room and requested a fridge which was brought up to our room less than 10 minutes later! If you are expecting something super fancy and elaborate, then Bally's is not for you! But, if you are ok with a room comparable to a Hampton Inn, then this will suit you just fine! Casino is big, but not over the top! If you get separated from your significant other, you WILL be able to find each other without walking miles. Bally's and Paris are connected, which is nice! There is a pizzeria located in the walkway between Bally's and Paris that has yummy pizza. The Tequila Bar at Bally's has good food at reasonable prices. Try the Nachos appetizer (as your meal), it's $16 and is big enough for 4 people to share. They also have $2 tacos and margaritas. Hungry in the middle of the night? Walk right across the street to Bill's and eat at The Victorian Room. $4.99 Breakfast special and $8.99 steak and eggs special. Location is GREAT!!! You walk out of the hotel and are right in the middle of everything! If you need a cheap place to buy drinks, snacks, etc there is a convenience store right behind Bill's - a very short walk. Bally's-- we'll see you again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, quiet and friendly...Joey was the best”
Reviews.Author: Sissy038
Reviews.Content: Was pleasantly surprised by the quality of our room. It was in the north tower, which apparently is the nicer of the towers, so I can only speak for our room. It was very spacious with a very large private bathroom and an extra area outside of it with an additional sink and vanity, a large glass double door closet, then around the corner from it a very spacious sleeping area with a nice sitting area with sofa, chair and desk/table. Our view was not of the strip, however I didn't ask for that and was not expecting it, we have had that in the past at other hotels and it is nice if it is your first time to Vegas, but not necessary if you won't be spending much time looking out the window anyway, we did have a view of the pool area of the flamingo (a distant view, not a close up) so it wasn't like we were staring at a parking garage. Our check in was a snap, we arrived very early due to our flight and the front desk agent, "Joey" was fantastic, he took our cell numbers and promised to call as soon as a room was clean, and he did just that a little after 9am. I believe housekeeping starts at 9am so he was really on top of it for us. I would defiantly stay here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel.........”
Reviews.Author: PlatinumMember0702
Reviews.Content: I was a platnium member therefore I did not have to wait in the LONG line at the reservation counter, but if I was a regular or Gold member I would have been very upset! The line was unbelievable and they only had about 4 Reservationist working the counter that afternoon. The Hotel is older and does need an upgrade, however, our room was very BIG. I noticed lots of dust even after housekeeping dusted the tables, it appeared that it was just floating in the air.(hum) Also, while I was showering one night, I heard a strange noise coming from the sink, well, to my surprise BLACK MUDDY water was perking up from the sink!(YUCK!!!!!!!!!!!) It frighten me at first, but then I remembered reading a review from a previous customer that stayed there and she had mentioned the same thing happen to her. When I finished showering it did start to go back down, but the sink was really, really dirty so I flushed it out and told housekeeping the next morning due to the lateness of the night. They were suppose to send someone to check it out, but I never saw anyone unless they came after we left. Also, the CARPET was really, really dirty!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! I called housekeeping and asked them to have someone come to shampoo the carpet. When we came back from breakfast someone had come and cleaned it, so I was impressed with that, however, housekeeping should be more aware of the condition of the rooms and make the necessary adjustments before they book someone else in those rooms. I never saw the BLACK MUDDY stuff in the sink anymore. The air conditioner didn't seem to really cool the room unless we had it on 69, which I never have my home AC that low, so perhaps it's due to the oldness of the Hotell and the AC Unit. Overall, our trip was very good, however, my next visit I would prefer trying a little more upscale hotel. The service was great!

Reviews.Title: “Second stay was better than our first”
Reviews.Author: RUDRIDER
Reviews.Content: This is our second visit to Bally's, the first stay we were inthe south tower, this time we were in the north tower. Upon check in, I asked if we could stay inthe north tower this vist. She than asked me if I wanted to upgrade for $20 per night, I said No. Then she said, welcome back again to Bally's, I put you in a mini suite in the north tower, a free upgrade. I was very pleased with her. The mini suite was very nice, a lot better than the south tower room we had last year. The room was large and clean and it was just nice to seat and look out the window. We did not notice the traffic noise, only when the fire department came by with their sirens on. The only down side of our visit would be the pool. We were looking for a place to sit when I heard a man say "Do you smell that, it smells like sewer gas". Well, he was right, there was one spot by the deep end of the pool area that smelled like sewer gas, some where in the bushes. Otherwise, we had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Never again... smelly, dirty, rude staff”
Reviews.Author: HOAAA
Reviews.Content: The hotel and the rooms were dirty, old, and smelly. The people at the front desk, as well as the bell boys, were rude and unpolite, as if they hated their jobs. Even though we stayed in a "nonsmoking floor," the room smelled like smoke and mold. The shower was full of mold as well. Once we got there, we realized that for that price we could've stayed at a nicer, cleaner place. The staff was totally unwilling to help you, give you directions, etc. To top it off, they even charged you $3/day to use the safe in your room. Even Motel 6's give you that for free!

Reviews.Title: “Good place”
Reviews.Author: enj080809
Reviews.Content: Overall average place to stay. Comfortable, clean, and convenient. Rooms were spacious. It's not a fancy place, but I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Eye opener”
Reviews.Author: taptaw
Reviews.Content: Las Vegas well what can you say but that it is certainly an "eye opener". We stayed at Bally's Casino. It is in the centre of the strip. We had a Delux room in the South wing. The view from our room was great we had the Effiel Tower right outside our room and you could also see the Bellagio Fountains and it also overlook the hotel's pool. The bed was very comfortable and being king size we had plenty of room. The room was cleaned promptly and there were always plenty of towels. The only downfall was that there wasn't a fridge in the room but you could request one at a cost of $3 per day, although if you needed it for medication you could get it for free. We had not booked our next destination after we left Vegas but we went to the business centre and they were very helpful. The Jubilee show was very entertaining and when you book in you receive a booklet that gives you a discount to the show. If we go back we will definitely book a room there. Be aware that if you go to Las Vegas it is a smoking town, they smoke every where so you may want to factor that into the length of you stay. That is the only thing that got to us during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: jenbrown731
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Bally's recently for four nights. The room was clean and pretty big for Vegas. The bathroom was large, had great water pressure, and an ample supply of towels. The casino was fairly quiet, but had $1, $2 Texas Hold'em early in the morning, which made my husband happy. Staff was courteous and the location can't be beat. We were very pleased with our stay and while this isn't a fancy place, it is just fine for a clean place to rest your weary head to sleep. Thanks Bally's!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Comfortable, Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Sky_Castles
Reviews.Content: For a "Sisters" Getaway we choose Bally's because it's centrally located on the Strip, had Monorail access, and was a good value. We arrived before check-in time, and had only a 5-minute wait in line to register. A very nice lady named Esther helped us. We upgraded our room for $20 a day more and were able to get in immediately. We had a nice, quiet, comfortable room on the 14th floor in the north tower. It was roomy, clean, had firm mattresses, good air-conditioning, and a good shower and was a step or two above your standard room. Housekeeping was friendly and did a good job. We didn't have a view, fridge, microwave or coffeepot, and there is an extra charge to use the room safe, but for our Getaway it worked great-- we had a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Was my first time, but won't be the last one”
Reviews.Author: Migue51
Reviews.Content: Bally's Hotel in general, although it's not a new hotel, still shows its luxury. The service is excellent, the Casino is OK, the Jubillee shows is amazing, the location is the best as it's located in the middle of the strip. I did not select the room, but the view was spectacular as the Eifeel Tower was in front of us, also the Bellagio's fountains shows were able to be seen from the window/balcony. The recommendation would be: do not spend too much money in luxurious hotels as Bally's has what is needed, a confortable room and bed to rest/sleep after a whole busy day in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Central strip for an unbeatable price!”
Reviews.Author: snsmith27
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a long weekend over the 4th of July with family, and we were looking for something on the cheaper end on the middle of the strip. We found a great rate for Bally's on priceline and decided to give it a try. It is an older hotel and is lacking in a lot of the glitz of some of the newer hotels we have stayed in on the strip, but overall I have to rate it very good due to its location and price. The rooms were clean and updated. The casino is nice as well. I also like that they didn't try to charge us an extra "resort fee" which has become the norm on the strip. I only had 2 complaints: 1. When we arrived they said they had ran out of non-smoking rooms, despite me already booking the room and paying in full. We ended up getting this squared away with the manager, but they still contend that this is their "policy." 2. The pool is pretty lame, but you can always go to another hotel to go swimming.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Rooms in South Tower”
Reviews.Author: bronxvonnie
Reviews.Content: Stayed in South Tower during visit in June 2011. The bathroom had mold over the tub and behind the door. The decor is something from the 80s and the halls are dimly lit. Would not recommend staying there again. North Tower is 1000 times better. Please renovate the South Tower. It looks like some cheap motel.

Reviews.Title: “I like Bally's!”
Reviews.Author: ljr88888
Reviews.Content: ... especially when you can get an internet special of $29/night! The registration clerk suggested we could upgrade to the newly-renovated rooms in the North Tower for an extra $20/night ... but we were too cheap to do that! Our room in the South Tower was very large with a nice-sized bathroom, plenty of drawer space, a view of the Eiffel Tower at Paris and a view of the fountains at Bellagio if you kind of looked sideways out the window! It appeared to have new carpet. So what if the furniture was a little old-fashioned! A breakfast place - "Nosh" - was right by the elevators we used to come down from the room ... very convenient. Bally's is a great location in the middle of the strip ... walking distance to almost everything. Monorail stop is right there. Pool is large and nice with plenty of deck chairs. And it is one of the few places on the strip with tennis courts! As a tennis player, I love going to the 8 a.m. clinics ... Ann Rockwell is a great instructor. For the price, it's hard to beat Bally's!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, average accommodations”
Reviews.Author: Jensuemart
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed in the Bally's resort while in Las Vegas. The location was great; central on the strip. Our room was in the North Tower, which had been "recently" renovated. The room was average - the bed somewhat comfortable. The staff was kind and accommodating. Great price for location!

Reviews.Title: “South tower grand suite”
Reviews.Author: lovefun99
Reviews.Content: My 2nd time in ballys. This time I choose a suite because last time I was disappointment with the regular room. The room is big, nice view but very old school and the shower needs to be clean better. The only reason I stayed here is cause they told me they have balconies but they never told me that is just for looks u cannot go outside lol. I think the rooms r good if the price was 3 times less. Is way to much money for that room. I love Vegas and I don't care staying in small rooms cause most of the time I'm not even in the room and i get them comp but paying for a room that the shower is nasty and looks like is nothing remodel or new in the last 30 yrs is not cool. I would not recommend this hotel. If u get it free is k but DO NOT PAY!!! For it.

Reviews.Title: “Okay Stay”
Reviews.Author: DolphinsVan
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 3 nights at Ballys - The day before I went I read the review about the 23rd floor north tower haunting presence. Very Wierd review - My sister and her boyfriend arrived at Ballys and with the 20 sandwich we were upgraded from south to north - she booked us in two rooms on yes the 23rd floor 2324 and 2310 - Now I was a little weary - But after 3 nights there I can say there was absolutely no haunting wierd presence in either room - Ballys itself is nice but nothing really special either - but with the good prices and great location I would go back if nothing else was available

Reviews.Title: “Not Up To Snuff!”
Reviews.Author: Edwina_11
Reviews.Content: We were assigned to a South Tower Room - our stay - June 26-July 1 for a convention. Our room had fingerprints on the windows, wall pictures smeared,. Furniture very scratched and gouged. Three big dead cockroaches were in the light fixture in the room entrance. The same dirty dishes littered the hall for at least 12 hours. The hall carpet was dirty. There was a board under the mattress - plain to see. The room temp would not go below 80 degrees. The next day my husband asked for a room change. The clerk offered us a north tower room for twenty more dollars a night. He said he wasn't interested in paying more. She gave us the room at no extra charge. It was much better and cleaner. Another area of neglect is the swimming pool. A big grimy greasy ring of suntan lotion residue clung to the pool tiles around the entire pool and rope buoys. It was obvious that it hadn't been cleaned for a long time. I asked the lifeguard why not.? She replied they would have to clean it all of the time. So? The pool ladies restroom was not clean when I arrived at eight a.m. when the pool first opens. Also, the lounge chairs were grimy. Obviously not cleaned in a while. Not what you would expect at a resort. On the positive, the lifeguards were serious with their duty. Towel attendents were friendly. The pool water was clean. Pool staff well-groomed. The gambling area was okay. I ate at the Thai restaurant and it was nice. Staff polite and attentive and the food seemed good although I don't have much experience with Thai food.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!!”
Reviews.Author: smasters
Reviews.Content: We checked in late on Sunday evening and got an upgrade . Wonderful room. A bit dated but still very nice. Staff was accomodating and friendly. Nosh was great! Location was perfect right in the middle of things and no suprise charges. We will likely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Always good choice”
Reviews.Author: singleguy77
Reviews.Content: We upgraded to the north tower as it is nicer, large rooms, comfortable and of course the perfect location. The hotel is attached to the Paris and across the street from two wonderful other resorts. Pool is also very nice and good service throughout.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was fine, Casino cocktail waitresses hate their jobs”
Reviews.Author: Mobley_g
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a romantic weekend getaway at Bally's. We booked a standard King room & were treated to a free upgrade! The room was dated but it was clean and very spacious. The mini fridge & the partial view of the strip was nice. The disappointment here was in the Casino, not good if they want you to gamble there. We've stayed at several Harrah's properties & this seems to be the pattern. For some reason, nearly all of the coctail waitresses hate their jobs, dish out plenty of bad attitude, and let you know that they are doing you a huge favor by bringing you that 4 oz. drink. The last straw was waiting over an hour to order a drink while playing slots. A smile and wave to get her attention after 2 previous walk-bys was greeted by "The Hand", an eyeroll and another "I might be back later walk away". I mean, just slap me and tell me I'm an idiot if I drop any money in Bally's Casino again!!! We tried to relate this experience to the P.J.(Food & Bev. Mgr.) & Jason(Night Slots Mgr.) but that only prolonged our drought another hour! Put a coke machine in the corner and I'll get my own. We gave up and went to the room where I called the Night Hotel Mgr. To his credit, he had Room Service bring up 2 complimentary drinks. He apologized for Denise, his coctail watress, and promised to have her Supervisor call me. Still Waiting. Although I would stay at this hotel again, MY GAMBLING DAYS HERE ARE OVER. Do yourself a favor. Save the frustration and walk across the street to the BELLAGIO!

Reviews.Title: “Bally-riffic!”
Reviews.Author: CanucksKickAzz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Ballys in June 2011, and had nothing but good things to say! Rooms are much larger than other rooms of the same price in Vegas. I wasn't looking to spend $500 a night on something I would only sleep in, so we went to Ballys. I've read other reviews before booking, and saw mostly good things were said. We slipped a $20 to the cashier/check in desk upon arrival, and we were upgraded to the North Tower (newly renovated). This is one of the hotels that accepts "bribes" to upgrade. Like I said, the rooms were fairly large. Ours had a couch and desk, in addition to a king size bed, TV, side tables, safe (which you are charged $3 a day to use), and a beautiful washroom. The floors in the washroom were granite, same with the countertops. There's no coffee maker in the room, but there is a coffee shop in the lobby, or anywhere else in Vegas! Rooms were quiet, and we never heard the next room at all! There is also somewhat of a food court downstairs on the way to the pool. The pool itself is rather boring. Just a rectangular pool, but if you only need to tan and go for a dip, and not party, it's sufficient. I would stay at this hotel again in a heartbeat! Have a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Decent price for a Great location”
Reviews.Author: 3farmboys
Reviews.Content: We weren't expecting much from Bally's. Just a place to sleep. We arrived fairly late and were still met with a line @ check in. Seemed to always be one. We had the *RUDEST* guy, ironically named Elvis, check us in. After calling us over, he rudley looked at his screen, pecked on the computer in cyber speed. We tried to make small talk and he wouldn't even look at us. I asked if there were any upgrades available and he said "No way". Um, okay then. Turns out they were sold out of the rooms we had booked and we were upgraded to a suite for the night. Only it was made abundantly clear this was for one night only and we would have to change to our regular rooms the next night. The size of the suite (1700 square feet) and the view of the strip/pool were quite impressive. The decor was hideous and hadn't been redone in about 20 years. The suite was filthy dirty. Dust everywhere. There was a jacuzzi tub in the room that I had to clean before we would even step foot in it. The maid hadn't cleaned the very visable ring around the tub off. Ewww. I didn't expect to have to spend our first night cleaning that, but what are you going to do? Thank goodness I travel with a small can of Lysol. We went down to "guest services" the next day. What a joke. Had one clerk waiting on the whole line of people. Stood in line for 30 minutes at least to change rooms for the mistake that THEY made by overbooking. How's that for customer service?? I asked what it would be to stay in the big room, was told an additional $150 a night. She tried to tell us that normally, that suite went for $800 a night. Ha! If I paid that much for that dump, I would be furious!! We didn't pay $800 for our whole trip (airfare included). We decided to save our money and move to a regular room. She sent a bellman up. He was a very nice elderly man, but don't let his age fool you. That guy threw our bags on and practially ran through that hotel. After that marathon, we arrived in our regular room. It was in the back tower. It was much cleaner, decor was updated. The view of the parking garage sucked, but you get what you pay for I guess. Our A/C was working very well, kept the room cool. Bed was comfortable. Housekeeping came every day and did a good job cleaning up. No complaints after that. Check out was easy. I would stay here again if I had to. I am glad that none of us expected more out of the place than what we got.

Reviews.Title: “First stay in Vegas and Bally's”
Reviews.Author: ChuckTN56
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Vegas and first stay at Bally's. I booked the North Tower deluxe room and was upgraded to the deluxe suite. Very large and nice room with in-room fridge. Check-in went smooth with just a little wait. Tried some of the in hotel restaurants and they were good. Housekeeping did a very good job. The location was excellent being at mid-strip. Used the monorail from here to other points. Was never really warm enough for pool weather, so I did not use the pool. Overall, I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay again”
Reviews.Author: UGA_Alum
Reviews.Content: Stayed here after changing rooms from Caesar's Palace in order to extend a business trip to a personal trip. The difference was night and day. Though Bally's casino area looked nice enough, the room was horrible. It looked like it had not been cleaned in a week, there was hair on the vanity and the floor was unvacuumed. The decor, paint, furniture, & bathrooms looked every bit like the 30 something year old hotel that it is. The breakfast buffet offered in the restaurant was only a little cheaper than that offered at Caesar's but was worlds apart in quality and selection. I have had much better food at a Denny's at a much cheaper price. The location (is right on the strip) and price were the only redeeming features about this hotel. Would pass this casino up unless price is your reason for wanting to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Classic Vegas Rooms??”
Reviews.Author: huntbeach123
Reviews.Content: We made reservations at this hotel thru a popular online website. Upon arrival we were offered to "upgrade" our room for an extra $20.00. I did not realize, nor did the travel website mention there were 2 types of rooms, a "classic room" and a "upgraded" room. I declined to spend the extra money thinking how bad can the rooms be at a major casino/hotel in Vegas. Upon arriving in the room, the first thing I noticed was the old worn out furniture, old bedding and tube TV from the early 1990's. I went to get some ice from the machine down the hall and when I picked up the ice bucket it was half full of old water, which indicates poor housekeeping. The TV worked half the time, losing signal on and off. The first morning I was there, housekeeping knocked 2 times, announced themselves, and entered the room, all within a matter of 5 seconds, this was at 8:30 am. The closing of the door woke me up. There was no fridge, coffee, or even a pen and paper in the room!! I visit Vegas several times a year on business and pleasure. Ive stayed in both luxury and mid-range hotels. The bottom line is for the money I spent the room was a total ripoff. The room is straight out of the early 90's with the old TV, worn bedding, and old furniture. It is indeed "classic", but the price is straight out of the year 2011. For the price you pay you can find a much nicer room on or off the strip. Upon checking out I mentioned the issues to the front desk manager? She appeared attentive by writing down the issues with the room, but really could have cared less. Her response was " The rumor is these rooms are going to be updated". Im never coming back to find out. Ballys is a big name in Vegas, the outward appearance of the casino/hotel looks very nice, but theres a racket going on with them renting out old, outdated rooms. My advice is to shop around and spend your money elsewhere. If you are just wanting a clean room at a decent price for a pleasure trip stay at Bills across the street. Ive been there a couple times and have never had any issues and its the same price or cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay at Bally's”
Reviews.Author: 10Man
Reviews.Content: Bally's is horrible. The place needs a complete remodel. Furniture in the rooms looks like something from a garage sale. The carpets are stained, the bathrooms are filthy, and the place smells like a mixture of cigarette smoke and Pine Sol. Most college apartments are nicer than this.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we'll definitely be back!!”
Reviews.Author: jsan72004
Reviews.Content: Great atmosphere, friendly employees. They gave me the wrong room at first because I had asked for a king bed, but right away they gave me another key and exchanged the room for me.

Reviews.Title: “Usual good stay at Bally's”
Reviews.Author: 10withamop
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the North Tower. I like Bally's in that it is an inexpensive hotel located in the middle of the strip. Room is decent sized and updated. It is always clean and always has great service. I have stayed at Bally's 4 or five times now and never had a bad experience.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great Location”
Reviews.Author: mohit2
Reviews.Content: Great location directly on the strip! We stayed for 4 nights and got a "free upgrade" when we checked in. It was overall a nice hotel, the rooms were quite large and comfortable. The casino itself was pretty small and seemed very dated; but it was conveniently connected to the Paris hotel which had a nicer casino and restaurants. One concern however was that the hotel doesn't have free internet, which I suppose is why they don't charge resort fees. The swimming pool was also closed when we went but apparently you could use the facilities at the Paris hotel instead.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: sunspirit2b
Reviews.Content: You would think that for the money you pay to stay on the Strip in Vegas, you would get a coffee pot and a daily supply of coffee in your room....not so. We were told you need to be in a room above the tenth floor....we lost...we were on the tenth....just missed it. The beds were as hard as rocks, as were the pillows, I had to ask for a couple softer pillows. I have no idea how anyone could sleep on the ones provided. The food and drinks were outrageously priced, $4.00 for a cup of coffee?? When we gave the waitress in the casino a dollar for a beer (which is FREE) she was loud and rude as if that wasn't enough for her to walk herself 30 steps to the bar and pick up a beer and bring it back..... This is our fifth trip to Vegas and have stayed at the Monte Carlo, MGM, Tropicana before, and if we ever go again, we might stay downtown where the prices are more normal. We had a great steak and lobster dinner at Tony Roma's at the Fremont for only $11.00 each andit was wonderful. It's a bus trip downtown unless you rent a car which we normally do, but not this time. Everything is much more expensive in Las Vegas these days than before. Be prepared to have thousands of people shoving papers and tickets in your face on the strip and homeless, and beggars. In my opinion, Las Vegas is not what it once was, and Bally's is also not what it once was.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay At A Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: GregKara
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel at about 10:30 in the morning and there was a bit of a line up to check in but moved very quickly. waited maybe 10 mins . When I checked in I put a rolled up $20 bill into my passport with my picture and was asked if there was anything they could do to make my stay more enjoyable. I was upgraded to a suite in one of the newly renovated rooms with a king bed . The room was clean , bed was huge , bathroom was clean and spacious, closet space was ample. Maids cleaned it everyday . quiet halls. Some pluses ....elevators are not too far from the front door so a quick walk to the room after a long day is nice. the hotel is located right in the middle of the strip which is perfect. The pool is not the most elegant but its nice and relaxing and big enough to enjoy . staff was super friendly . $2.00 Tacos and Beers at the Tequila Bar in the lobby . Some negatives....very few to be honest. The charge of $3.50 a day to use the safe in your room was the one that stuck out the most to me. The Sports Book Room is on a whole other floor and a far walk from the Casino so go back and forth got tiresome . not that I watched much TV but not a lot of channels in English As you can see, the postives far out weigh the negatives and the important aspects of a hotel such as price, cleanliness, friendly staff and comfy beds all surpass expectations...is it the Bellagio ...no...is it the Motel 6 ....no....good prices good location great rooms...cant go wrong. Defintley book it

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME hotel, will be back again for sure!!”
Reviews.Author: jones91605
Reviews.Content: Before going on my trip I was a little worried about staying at Bally's by some of the reviews written. We had an awesome experience here! The price was super cheap and we got upgraded from a south tower room to the north tower suite on the 24th floor. Our room was huge and very nice! The bed was comfortable, bathroom was big, and the best of all was we had a coffee pot (which we were excited about since hearing most of the rooms don't). We went to Ballys pool to lay out everyday. The pool is big and the perfect temp. We never had a problem finding a place to lay. My only complaint is that the waitresses by the pool are SO rude. It's hard to find them some of the time and then you feel like they hate you when you ask for a drink. They are not friendly and I don't think I ever saw one of them smile! We also would have liked the music to be a bit louder, it was pretty low. The tequilla bar had awesome $2 tacos, draft beers, frozen margs, and shots of tequilla. The margs. were too sweet for me so I just ordered another $2 shot and it was better. They also have a Sabarro on your way to the pool that is open 24hrs, it was good also. We never tried any other resturants in the casino. The casino smoke did not bother us, and we are not smokers. It was pretty easy to put a few dollars in the machine and get a free beer or cocktail! The one thing we didn't know until the last day is that you can use the Paris' pool since they are connected. I would def. recommend that pool over Ballys! It's way cleaner, had good music, and a half off happy hour around 4:00 I think. The location of Bally's is awesome!! It's centrally located so you can go either way down the strip. I def. would recommend this hotel to couples or younger people who are on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: priestfamily5
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here from June 13 - June16, 2011. We arrived at around 2:00pm with a short check-in line. I asked if there were any complimentary room upgrades and was given one (I did give her a $20 tip for giving it to me). We were given a room in the North Tower, room 2540, I believe she called it the Diamond Room. The room was not ready, we were asked to return about an hour later to get our keys. That was not a problem for us, as we wanted some lunch (we were able to check our luggage during our wait). Room was on the 25th floor and the elevators moved quickly. It had a very comfortable king bed, with a love seat / chair area. The room was very big. Bathroom was nice and the shower was great (nice water pressure). All of the staff was friendly and spoke to you as you past them. The only thing negative about the room was there was no view of the strip, I think you either have to chose between a view of the strip or an updated room. The hotel in located in a great spot - right in the heart of the Strip and connected to Paris. We booked this hotel as part of a vacation package with Southwest and got a great room rate and for the price, I would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “No Complaints especially after being leary from reading reviews...”
Reviews.Author: Heatrav
Reviews.Content: As the title states, my husband and I were leary after reading some of the reviews. The review that sticks out in my mind is a gentleman's picture in which it shows a stain on a blue loveseat...he states "looks like something from CSI and I don't mean blood"! Oh my gosh, I was horrified. And then we walked into our room and it was fine. Blue love seat but no stain....lol... This was our first time to Vegas and we had no idea what to expect. Visual overload. The lights, the sounds, the enormity of the hotels...just amazing. We had to see it to believe it. The hotel was fine for the price point. We were hardly in our room! There really isn't much to Bally's except rooms, the casino and the Showgirls show (which we went to - was fantastic). We also liked how it was connected to the Paris! Wonderful! If you want a hotel basically for the bed - this an ok place for sleep but don't expect much else.

Reviews.Title: “The good and the bad”
Reviews.Author: lasvegasjunkie
Reviews.Content: Lets start with the room... We checked in on Saturday June 11, 2011 around 7pm. There was almost no wait to check in which was great! We quickly dropped our bags in the room and headed out for dinner. It was late when we got back to the room and we went straight to bed. In the morning, when we were settling in, my fiance found a womens hairclip in the nightstand drawer. Strange but easy to overlook I suppose. But things quickly went downhill. I went to shower and get ready for the day. As I'm standing in the shower, I look over to see that there was a used bar of soap left from the last guest as well as a dirty washcloth hanging over the curtain rod. GROSS. I was able to get past the hairclip but someone else's soap and washcloth was too much for me! I spoke with a manager who apologized and offered us a new room, which of course we accepted. The new room turned out to be an upgrade to a suite, which was beautiful but most importantly clean! The pictures attached are from the suite. There was a great jacuzzi bathtub that is located in the living room, but unfortunately it wasn't quite big enough for my fiance and I to sit and soak together. We are not large people by any means but were unable to sit side by side. Also, this suite had an amazing view of the strip, but the tub faced away from the windows. So sitting in the tub soaking left you facing the bathroom walls instead of the lights of the strip. Not great planning if you ask me. We did not feel like Bally's provided the same level of customer service or care that the other Harrahs(now Caesars Entertainment) properties provide. There was a sign on the safe stating that your room would be charged $3/day that the safe was used. Seriously? We carry alot of cash with us to Vegas and always secure it in the safe. I know $3 per day isn't a large fee, but for me it was the principle of the matter. I really felt like the hotel was just nickel and diming us. Also, I realized that I had somehow managed to lose my toothbrush, but when I called and asked housekeeping for a new toothbrush they informed me that they don't have any and that I should check the gift shop. I was shocked! I have forgotten many things on vacations and never has a hotel not been able to replace them, everything from toothbrushes, to razors, even contact solution! I ended up buying one in the gift shop ($1.79). There certainly were some positives to our stay however! We purchased the all-access stage pass which allows you to see as many shows at the Harrahs properties as you can in 48 hours. We managed to see 5 shows in 2 days. We saw Legends in Concert at Harrahs, great show! Then we saw Jubilee at Ballys, wow, this is a must see, absolutely amazing! The next day we saw The Price is Right at Ballys and my fiance was a big winner. He got to "come on down" and won an expresso maker, an elliptical, a lawnmower, a chaise lounge, and a slot machine! (They are shipping them all to us for free). That night we saw Vinnie Favorito and George Wallace at Flamingo. Vinnie is hilarious and I can't wait to see his show again. Warning: he picks on the audience so don't sit close unless you can take it, but it's all in good fun, great show!. George Wallace was entertaining but I definitely wouldn't see him again. Bally's pool was wonderful, although the cocktail service left something to be desired. We ordered drinks ($14 a piece frozen margaritas!) but the girl never came back even once to see if we wanted another round. There were plenty of chairs around lots of room to spread out. The Tequila Bar in the casino has some wonderful specials that are advertised around the casino, but they aren't on the menu so be sure to ask for them. $2 tacos margaritas draft beer and tequila shots. Everything was excellent. The Sidewalk Cafe serves breakfast and lunch, we ate breakfast there one day and loved every bite. Their french toast was perfect and my omelet was great. There is an indoor walkway to Paris which has a lot of other food choices. Don't miss their made to order crepes! I have stayed at just about every hotel on the strip and I would not stay at Ballys again. We almost always stay with Harrahs properties (Harrahs, Ballys, Paris, Planet Hollywood, Flamingo, Caesars) because of their total rewards program, and all of their other properties have made us feel more taken care of than Ballys did.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: TdotGal
Reviews.Content: Great location directly on the strip! We stayed for 4 nights and got a "free upgrade" when we checked in. It was overall a nice hotel, the rooms were quite large and comfortable. The casino itself was pretty small and seemed very dated; but it was conveniently connected to the Paris hotel which had a nicer casino and restaurants. One concern however was that the hotel doesn't have free internet, which I suppose is why they don't charge resort fees. The swimming pool was also closed when we went but apparently you could use the facilities at the Paris hotel instead.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value for $$”
Reviews.Author: Femme_Canuck
Reviews.Content: My husband and stayed here for the first time from May 29-June 4 as part of the VNEA Pool Tournament. The rates were reasonable especially considering the Memorial Day long weekend, and the checkin process was painless. They offered to upgrade us to a suite for an additional $25/night, but we declined. We had two small problems during our stay, which were both addressed in a fairly quick manner. The first was a missing alarm clock, which they brought promptly, however the second problem took a little too long to correct for my tastes. On our second night there when we got to the room at midnight the sink had backed up and was full of gross brown water. I had to call twice before maintenance finally showed up but it was within an hour, I as just cranky because we had to be up in a few hour to play pool. It took them about 45 minutes to fix the problem but it did get fixed. The rooms are otherwise clean and tidy and quite spacious. A little freh paint could be used in the bathroom, but overall was a very pleasant stay. Only ate at the regular restaurant and the Thai restaurant, both were good. I would definately stay here again web with our small problems.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for work and play!”
Reviews.Author: sadt0mat0
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Bally's in the south tower last month during the Electronics Distribution Show hosted at Paris. Bally's is my hotel of choice when staying on the strip. You can't beat the location, the rooms though older are large, the staff is super friendly and helpful and they have Goldfish machines! The rooms aren't spectacular but they are big and they have very nice sized bathrooms. I had to call maintenance during my stay because the shower head had a leak and was spraying onto the ceiling and dripping cold water on me. In less than 5 minutes the maintenance man showed up and instantly fixed the problem. He was courteous and quick. Everything you want in a maintenance man. If you are craving tacos stop off at the Tequila bar for the $2 tacos. They just might be the best cheap eats on the strip. The other restaurants are good as well. If you are looking for a high end super fancy place then Bally's isn't for you. Travellers looking for a good rate, great location and friendly place to stay should consider Ballys. If you've got questions please don't hesitate to ask me!

Reviews.Title: “Vegas Fun”
Reviews.Author: ECHere
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Bally's on a three night company reward trip. Pleased with rooms, service and gaming. Clean, spacious and comfortable rooms. We didn't spend much time in the room but had a blast at Ballys and loved Coyote Ugly at NYNY.

Reviews.Title: “Great value. Excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: cnmor-trvlr
Reviews.Content: With rooms slightly larger than most strip rooms and the perfect location (near Flamingo, Bellagio and Caeser's), Bally's provides great value. I love Nosh for a quick breakfast or lunch. Sea - for great Thai / Viet Nam food in a serene setting. Tequila's has great food and drink specials and a fantastic view of the entertainment at Indigo Lounge. There's the 'Price is Right' show and the only surviving classic feather show 'Jubilee'! Monorail to MGM or up to Las Vegas Hilton past Steve Wynn's gorgeous golf course.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, great value hotel”
Reviews.Author: meliee_sorciere
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Bally's 5 nights, the location couldn't be better, in the hottest spot on the strip, the first night the gave us a suite with jacuzzi because they didn't have regular rooms available, the next day we changed to the regular room. Staff is great, rooms are clean but they look old, like a 70's movie. The casino is small in comparison with others and is not very lively, shops in the lower level are good they often have great deals in shoes and bagagge, there's also a Sbarros's where you can eat great pizza. There's no much to do in Bally's but you can easily get to all the great hotels and casinos on the strip, that's the huge advantage of staying at Bally's, the price is good but is even better if you buy it in their website with 2 or 3 months in advance.

Reviews.Title: “another great time in vegas”
Reviews.Author: lizard-16
Reviews.Content: my husband and i stayed ay bally's recently for six nights comped. the rooms are great and the check-in was easy. my husband plays the horses and i play video poker. the pool was great again. we stayed at bally's last year also.it is central to everything- saw the fountains at bellagio from my window. i would recommned bally's to everyone. the staff are great. could not ask for a better timne andf had great weather.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad deal”
Reviews.Author: Dale S
Reviews.Content: Location is great. Service is ok. Good value. Rooms need a renovation.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: cherbear731
Reviews.Content: We chose Bally's for the location on the Strip and the price. We knew the hotel was older and were not expecting much. It exceeding our expectations. We stayed in the older South Tower and found the room to be basic, but most importantly, clean. We reserved a non smoking King, but were given a non smoking with 2 queens. We had a great view of the Strip and a partial view of the Bellagio Fountains. Our friends upgraded to the remodeled North Tower for $20/per night. Their room was the same size as ours, but more modern looking. Personally, for the small amount of time I spent in my room, I do not feel the $20/night fee would have been worth it. Neither room had a fridge, which I would have liked. Given the location of the hotel, the price of the room, and the cleanliness, I would definitely stay at Bally's again.

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Hotel To Stay !”
Reviews.Author: winefun
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed so much our stay, close to everywhere. The room was extremely clean, nice, comfortable bed and worth the money we spent. The staff was friendly and helpful. The facilities were great and spotless as well. Even the breakfast was delicious. For sure, I'll come back and highly recommend to anyone to stay here !

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel, casino and buffet”
Reviews.Author: Windkissed
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Las Vegas in the heat of summer. It was a sweltering 102 when we excited the plane.....however, not being used to the dry air I wore a long sleeve top but was still cool. I could not believe how comfortable I was even in the hot air. A quick pick up of our rental car and off to our Hotel Bally's. I was so impressed with the service, atmosphere and food. Although we only stayed 3 nights, it was great.....isn't the food one of the most appealing comforts of travel. The buffet in the Hotel was superb....it was more like gourmet food rather than buffet food. The desserts were excellent and I would definitely stay there again. My friends and I had a wonderful time and would like to return again........

Reviews.Title: “Vegas was great,”
Reviews.Author: ann17_11
Reviews.Content: we went to Vegas 2 yrs ago & stayed in Treasure Island Hotel, great hotel and nice bedrooms, this time stayed in Bally's, the rooms were very old fashioned, and felt creepy, the room was very large with a sunken bath, which we never used, as we prefer to shower, clean bedlinen was supplied every day, no coffee making facilities, and just glad i did not stay there the first time we went to vegas, we did visit the Mirage a few times as they serve a nice Buffett $25 pp good value,better than Ceasers Palace, also went to see the Jersey Boys, tickets are half price if you buy them in the kiosk's situated on the strip on the day. we also went to eat in a cafe called Ellis Island which is situated behind Bally's hotel it looks like a transport cafe from the outside, but brilliant food, thanks to the person who left that info on tripadvisor, def worth a visit, the duce bus is good value for $7 for 24 hrs up and down the strip,which will take you to old Vegas. another nice visit, will visit Vegas again

Reviews.Title: “Ballys is tops!”
Reviews.Author: 2Sweeties
Reviews.Content: Decided to spend a significant birthday in Las Vegas with a group of old friends from the UK and other parts worldwide – did the research on the net – and Ballys Casino was the choice. Bally is dead central on the Vegas strip and within an arms throw from all the best happenings in town, so was an ideal choice that seemed to offer good value for money. It was, and we were not disappointed. The sales team were very helpful regarding group bookings right from the offset nine months before D-day when the planning started, but as we eventually did not have enough people to do a group rate booking, booked through Tripres. Despite all the internet hoo-haa about Tripres/Vegasview, my group of eight had no problems with their bookings at all. Check-in was seamless, and we all had nice large twin rooms on the 14th, 16th, and 18th floors of the north tower (went for that after the reviews on the web). They were clean, spacious, comfortable, and functional. So they charge $3/- a day for using the safe – so what? Well worth the peace of mind. Ballys suited our partying crowd down to a T, as we could walk the to all the other bars/clubs on the strip. Compared to all the other casino’s we stepped into, I found Ballys spacious and well laid out, with all areas easily accessible. The pool has to be one of the best in Vegas, a classic area ideal for afternoon chilling and the weekend pool parties held there with resident DJ Roger de Gangi. Birthday meal was at Ballys steakhouse – great steaks, and efficient courteous service. As with my previous trip to Vegas, most of my daily sustenance was catered for by an ample meal of eggs ‘easy-over’ with bacon and toast at the Sidewalk Cafe each morning, that thankfully was in typical American Diner classic style with great service and value. Our group made good use of the rapid walkway through to sister casino Paris next door, which was spectacular, offering a wide range of bars/clubs/restaurants. We did venture out to my old stomping ground of three years ago at the Palms Resort off the strip on my birthday to go to the Ghostbar on the 55th (significant!) floor, to show the boys the spectacular view from the rooftop balcony there at night. But what a hassle with security letting in a group of eight 40 and 50 year olds who had pre-paid in advance! Was worth it in the end though. So can’t really knock Ballys at all. I would recommend them to anyone and any group, whatever the function, who want to spend a few days in Las Vegas. No hesitation. Keep it up Harrah’s group!

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Ajtlawyer
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at Bally's. Got there about 10 pm and was able to check in very quickly. Asked for a room with a view of the Strip and was quickly accommodated. Room had tremendous view of Paris' Eiffel Tower. Room wasn't fancy but spacious, clean and a large bathroom. Cleaning service was excellent. There's nothing fancy about Bally's although the steak dinners we've had at Bally's Steakhouse were outstanding. The gaming area is basic and smaller than most of the other hotels. But it's centrally located and an easy walk to the other hotels where we caught shows. Bally's is a good value and worth checking out

Reviews.Title: “ID Rather stay at MOTEL 6 NEXT TIME”
Reviews.Author: tdovlet
Reviews.Content: Do not stay here its disgusting ..very outdated ..when people walk above your room there is a squeaky noise that doesnt stop, the carpets are old and smelly eww ,the pool looks like an old apartment complex pool eww..The whole hotel needs renovating BIGTIME..Its right on the strip so they need to remodel and compete with the best around them .NEVER AGAIN Ballys your gross!!!

Reviews.Title: “Tired hotel but great location”
Reviews.Author: Singhjee
Reviews.Content: Great location, and the only reason for staying at the hotel, and the very good rating. Right in the middle of the Strip. Otherwise an average hotel. Stayed in the south tower, which had large rooms ( 2 queen sized bed) but no tea/coffee maker. Breakfast was not included in the tariff but adequate other nearby options are available, so it was not a big deal. Large casino downstairs, so you do need to walk too far to lose your money. Please check out the booth near the entrance for discounts on shows, as we got tickets for the X Burlesque show for USD 40.35, instead of USD 66.

Reviews.Title: “Great affordable hotel in a fantastic location.”
Reviews.Author: IrelandMac49
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last week and I would definatelt recommend it to anyone. It doesn't look great from the outside compared to some of the other hotels but dint let that put you off. The rooms are clean, spacious and very reasonable. Discount vouchers are given out at the reception when you check in which came in handy. Free parking is available at their sister hotel next door called Paris. Both hotels are joined together.

Reviews.Title: “Paper thin walls”
Reviews.Author: wyotravel123
Reviews.Content: Bally's location is superb for accessing the center of the VEGAS strip. We spent the weekend in the North Tower and could hear EVERYTHING in the rooms next door and the hallway. Our room also was along the street and the sirens and emergency vehicles went up and down the road all night long. We've stayed at other Vegas hotels that are not as noisey, so needless to say, we won't stay there again. The room was a little shabby, but you do get what you pay for, so I'm willing to spend a bit more for a quiet room.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, so it's not the Bellagio...”
Reviews.Author: revision-x
Reviews.Content: The room was free and we got a free upgrade to a deluxe room in the north tower non-smoking floor. Yeah, the furniture could use a good steam cleaning and the t.v. wasn't LED or plasma... so what! The room and bedding were clean although the bed was a little too soft for me. Air conditioner worked fine, bathroom was spacious, water pressure was fine and there was plenty of hot water. We were pleasantly suprised after reading some of these reviews. The casino is kind of smokey but no worse than some of the others. Even though our stay was free, I'd still consider $50-60/night a good value. I'd rate this as a good 3-star hotel. they do charge for the room safe and wifi so we didn't use them. they also put a hold on our credit card which hasn't cleared yet.

Reviews.Title: “Ballly's, loved it!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Gerry-ped.
Reviews.Content: This was my first time at Ballys, but have stayed many times at Flamingo, harrahs, MGM, Luxor, paris, etc. I arrived at Bally's at 09:30am for check in, but after waiting for 1/2 hr in a long line i was taken to the Diamond check in and received a free upgrade to the North Tower, room 254l.(I originally was reserved for the South Tower). Also near the elevator as I had requested. The room was immediately available, and had a great partial view of the Bellagio fountains, Great room, large and clean, seemed to have been recently renovated. The room had one queen bed, with 2 side tables, plus a large table with 2 chairs, desk with chair, loveseat, and a plush armchair. large armuair, (sp)? with tube tv. (which i never used except for check out!) Plenty of drawer space, and closet space. Large immaculate bathroom, The bed was pillowtop, and extremely comfortable, with plenty of pillows. Room was very quiet and I seldom heard other people. Hallways were kept clean, never trays laying outside rooms more than a few hours that i noticed. All the staff were friendly and helpful, from the front desk people to housekeeping to belldesk to CW. i felt so very welcomed by everyone. i had to rent a scooter this trip, due to a broken bone in my foot, and the belldesk staff were great at explaining the functions and i felt very comfortable using it around the hotel, and even in the monorail. The slots were off and on at Ballys, but i did win enough to play for hours at a time, and had a few larger wins that i was happy with. C.W. were great, around all the time, never a problem with getting a drink or water. As for restaurants, i had breakfast 2 times at the sidewalk Cafe, and although the choices were limited in their buffet, the food was good and hot, and very resonable at $12.99 I did have room service 2 times, once for dinner and once for last morning breakfast. both times food was excellent and very resonably priced. Waited only 15 min. for the dinner one., but waited almost 1 hour for the Fri morning breakfast. The only other rest. i ate at in the hotel was nathans hot dog, It was ok. I did have the breakfast buffet at paris one time, and was not really impressed with the quality of the food offered. But the service there was excellent. Many quick eateries, on the lower level is nathans, nyPretzle, haagenDazs, and on the main casino floor is the Cafe, Tequilla Bar and Grill, and java Coast (coffee,etc.) Housekeeping was great, did excellent job with cleaning, fresh towels, etc. Also there is a walkway from Ballys to paris from the casino floor, (near the NT elevators) great as a few of the days were very cold, and you didn't have to go outside. All in all i would certainly stay at Ballys again, loved it there, and would highly recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Deep in the hot of Texas
Reviews.Title: “I'm only sorry I waited so long to try it”
Reviews.Author: SpinyNorma
Reviews.Content: I'd never spent a lot of time in Bally's during my previous Vegas trips. This last trip, I had an offer to stay free for 5 nights and I couldn't resist. I admit I was a little concerned. I'd heard good things about the rooms but the way the hotel is situated so far back from the strip had always put me off. If you've been to Vegas, you can understand being reluctant to walk any further than you absolutely have to. It wasn't as much of a problem as I'd feared. The moving sidewalk thing from the strip helps a lot and if you're heading north, you can always cut across Flamingo and through Bill's. It's also connected via a corridor to Paris. I loved my room! It was huge by Vegas standards and extremely comfortable. I especially loved having the loveseat in the room, which was so comfortable for when I was using my laptop as I recuperated from my latest excursion. There's a nice computer table and chair as well but I liked also being able to see the TV, look out the window, and prop my feet up on the coffee table. I was in a North Tower room. I'd actually wanted a South Tower room for the strip view but I was able to see a good part of the strip from my room. The bathroom was nice-sized. The shower had good pressure and good hot water and the towels were good as well. The bed was comfortable and soft. The window was big and allowed a nice view. The elevators worked well. The TV was the old kind but it was a decent size and worked well with a good selection of channels. The drawbacks were that it was a considerable distance to the elevators to my room and another good hike from the elevator to get to my room. On the bright side, they did have express elevators for the upper floors. There's also not much in the way of places to eat. They had a few but they didn't really appeal to me for what it would cost to eat there. I ate at the Tequila Bar & Grill once. The burger was good but the service was really slow, even though they weren't busy. Bally's is connected to Paris, as I mentioned before, and it had several options for places to eat, many of them surprisingly affordable. The distance to the rooms and from the hotel to the strip is the only reason I rated it lower on location. It's close to several other hotel/casinos once you finally make it to the strip. It's also close to Ellis Island, a great place for affordable eats. Overall, I really enjoyed my stay and hope to stay there again some time soon. I would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Needs Refurbishing”
Reviews.Author: KaylaMinnesota
Reviews.Content: Too bad Bally's has has not upgraded their rooms or even made necessary repairs. The lobby looks good but the rooms are worn out and dirty! Torn wallpaper, dirty carpet, second hand looking furniture and the bathroom shower should have been replaced long ago.

Reviews.Title: “Basic older style rooms”
Reviews.Author: Judjud70
Reviews.Content: We just came home from a visit to Ballys. We wont be staying there again, it reminded me of an old haunted hospital. We were there for 4 days and for 2 off them, dirty plates and trays remained in the hall ways, rubbish left in the hall not cleaned up. The rooms near the strip are old, the beds are hard, and the decor is old, broken, stains, broken smoke alarms hanging from the ceiling, and everything has dust over it, never gets cleaned.
