They did make our beds up each day and replaced our towels, but thats all that was good about this hotel. The Casino was good. Maybe the newer rooms are nicer. We did have a good view of the strip, but it had an outside sign on the windows which did not give us a clear view of the strip and taking photos was difficult. We will stay at The Mirage or Paris next time. Checking in and out was easy, but they need to improve on their house keeping.

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough”
Reviews.Author: Samantha1979
Reviews.Content: Nice enough stay. We brought our pack n play for our daughter but she ended up sleeping with us anyway. Really liked the roominess of the bathroom and the room itself was a good size too - 1 king size bed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: goldeneagle446
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Bally's March 6-10th of this year. I arrived at roughly 11AM. They told me my South Tower standard room was not yet ready, and offered to upgrade me to a South Tower Suite for $20 more a night. Since two nights were comped, I jumped at that. Beautiful room, beautiful view of the South end of the Strip. Their poker room is arguably the most well run of the Harrah's/Caesar's rooms. The room service was quick and very tasty. Hotel Management was always quick to help with any questions about the city, nightlife, gaming etc.. This was an excellent choice and I will be staying here again in June. My advice to those who are trying to decide where to stay....find a Hotel/Casino that TRULY Appreciates their customers. Bally's goes out of its way to accomodate customers, unlike some of the mega-resorts in Vegas! I highly recommend Bally's Las Vegas!!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Like It On the Strip!!!”
Reviews.Author: Seasoned1958
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love Bally's. I have been going to Las Vegas since 1989 and with the exception of two trips, I have stayed at Bally's. It is very laid back; very different from the other hotels on the strip. Regular people are at Bally's where you don't feel out of place if you're in jeans and tennis shoes. This was the first time for my son and daughter-in-law to visit Las Vegas. After walking the different hotels on the strip, they said Bally's is the place for them when they come back......and we have decided to make it an annual trip!! Bally's is not the newest or prettiest hotel on the strip but they make you feel at home.

Reviews.Title: “Too smokey”
Reviews.Author: Delmar72
Reviews.Content: Stayed four nights for a conference. Both the hallway to non-smoking rooms and the non-smoking conference area reaked with stale smoke. The rooms were clean. The food was very acceptable and there is a choice of several restaurants. Hotel is centrally located on the Strip and the price was acceptable (although I learned others got a room rate less than half of the offered convention rate. As a non-smoker, the stale smoke was a real turn-off.

Reviews.Title: “BEST HOTEL STAY EVER”
Reviews.Author: fieldschild
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived, were treated incredibly well. I am handicapped and was afraid I would encounter problems renting a scooter for mobility in and out of the hotel. Balley's had scooers on site with very reasonable rates. Everywhere I went, people would ask where I got my scooter. The room was perfect -- clean, well stocked. Every kind of food you could want is available. Hotel is centrally located and security was plentiful.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special, but good for the money!”
Reviews.Author: jyl246
Reviews.Content: My flight got in super late (midnight) so I decided to book a room at Ballys before moving to Vdara for the rest of my stay in vegas (Vdara sucks, by the way). Anyways, right when I checked in, they upgraded me to a Suite! I was solo, so it was a little excessive, but defintely appreciated! Dated rooms, generally clean...bed was old/flat mattress. Definitely sleep-able, though. The suite: very 80's-esque layout. It must have been a pimping room back in the day! Bed/suite area and bathroom are all 1 open area. bathroom/jacuzzi is separated by 3 steps up. hard to explain so i give up. pool: good amount of sun. i got there around 11am on a thursday and had no problem getting a chair. i noted that around noon, it would still be easy to get a pool chair. i think it's b/c it's an older scene there and with higher turnover b/c some people can only tolerate the sun for 1 hour before calling it a day. i made it to 1.5 hrs. check out was a breeze. casino: i won $200 so i'm happy. =) they have my favorite game here: texas hold em bonus. and bonus i did. thats it for nowwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwww. thanks ballysssssssssssssssssssssss. would stay here again to save $$ and not to impress anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised!”
Reviews.Author: 2009G8
Reviews.Content: 2 rooms comped for 2 nights. There were several people in line at check in but the staff handled it very efficiently. Free upgrade was given to both us and my parents to rooms in the North Tower, with my parents being given a Suite and we had a regular room. Both rooms were very spacious and comfortable, clean and quiet. The casino was well laid out. We know most Vegas rooms don't have coffee makers so we just bought coffee at the little coffee shop by the check in. Valet was efficient and friendly, actually all staff we encountered were really nice. After reading so many bad reviews and knowing how old Ballys is we were extremely happy with our experience!

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay!!”
Reviews.Author: TonyT
Reviews.Content: Second stay at Bally's in last year and a half. Was upgraded to North Tower again. Room was very nice but not the greatest view since on the 7th floor. Seems they're accepting dogs now as well as a lot were on this floor so if not a fan of dogs, request the non-pet floor!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: BigDave055
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Bally's for 5 nights and found the room to be obove average but well used. Bed and towels were change every day and any mess was cleaned up daily. All waste buckets were emptied every day if needed. No tea making facilities so had to go out in the morning for a early morning cuppa.The location is good and easy access to all strip hotels and evening activities. The help desk at checking inn counter was helpful on every occasion when asked. Booking inn was quick even though there was a lot of people booking inn and out. Did use the breakfast bar downstairs and found them to be cheap compaired to the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Central Strip Location”
Reviews.Author: cdk89
Reviews.Content: I have to say, I was quite terrified after reading about the south tower rooms. I booked a standard two bed room for two nights. When I checked in (surprisingly, the line up was not that long on a monday afternoon), I asked for an upgrade. The guy at the check in said I could upgrade for a north tower room, but it would cost me an extra $20 a night! I decided to check out the south tower room I was given, then make a decision. Turns out it was actually a really nice room. The room was very clean,the bathroom was really nice, but the view was Amazing! It was an odd numbered room, facing the south part of the strip. Out the window I had an awesome view of the Eiffel tower, Planet Hollywood, The Cosmopolitan, MGM grands, and best of all a very good view of Lake Bellagio. I had such a great view of the water show, I didn't even have to leave my room! (Though obviously I did, since this was Las Vegas). What I did not like is that there was no coffee maker in the room. I had to go either to the lobby or to the restaraunts to get a cup of coffee. Thankfully there was also a McDonalds within walking distance, by Harrahs (for those who prefer their McD's coffee). Overall, I thought my stay at Bally's was great! The hotel was clean, the staff was nice, and the casino was nice, though a little smokey. I did not expect it to be soo busy after reading the reviews, but it was. The best thing about Bally's definitely has to be the location. Being located right in the middle of the strip, I had great access to whichever end of the strip I wanted to go to. There were shops and restaraunts within walking distance. I would definitely stay at Bally's again.

Reviews.Title: “Third Time at Ballys and Still Think It's a Good Value”
Reviews.Author: TFopinion
Reviews.Content: Like other reviewers stated, Bally's isn't perfect but they do a pretty good job for the per room night cost. Had Deluxe North Tower room that was very spacious, nice furnishings that felt like it wasn't too long ago that they were renovated. Room was clean and kept that way by a pretty good housekeeping staff . . . and we're fussy. Had the typical desk for laptop work and a nice sofa (clean, wasn't stained) with coffee table. Overall a very nice, comfortable room and for around $ 100/night, a great deal, in my opinion, considering Bally's location. The only negative was we had to change rooms the very 1st night due to roady neighbors (not Bally's fault) but Bally's accommodated us, apologized and gave us a new room without delay. The rest of the time, no problem. Ate in the Sidewalk Cafe twice - very good - but you must try their corn beef hash - the best I've ever eaten. I think Bally's could improve upon their air recirculation system because I think they are one of the smokiest casinos on the strip. As a non-smoker I don't like the smoke but put up with it. Since I was driving, the free parking was great (not typical at other properties) but the tips to get your car do add up. The pool was great but crowded. Two negatives: getting charged for internet usage and to use the room safe (!) - amenities lower tier hotels provide for free. Come on !! Overall a very nice stay. Just for the sake of trying somewhere else, on my 4th visit to Vegas I may try Bellagio . . . . or will I be drawn back again by the great rate and nice accomodations?

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at a Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: msrplnr
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel at a great rate through the website (watch the specials!). I stayed for 4 nights. Check-in on Wednesday at 11am was quick with only a 5-7 minute wait. I had a room reserved in the North Tower. It was ready for me when I checked in. The room was large, clean, and quiet. I had a good view of the northern strip including the Flamingo, Venetian, and Wynn. I did not spend much time in the room (why would you in Vegas?) but was very happy with the room. One small complaint - I could have used a comforter for the bed. The casino was fine and being connected to Paris was a definate plus. We ate at the Paris buffet one night for dinner and at Le Burger Brasserie (sp). both were very good and I would recommend them. I did not like the large number of 6/5 payout blackjack tables, but the georgous go-go dancers helped to offset this. Drink service was prompt and profesisonal. All casino employees I encountered were polite and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “not bad but not perfect”
Reviews.Author: ragmaker
Reviews.Content: We found the room to be clean and the maids were great, always cleaned the room when we were not there, no knocking. I don't recomend the breakfast buffet, very limited choices. Staff was friendly and helpfull, a security person took a pic for us. Pool prices for food and drink were way high, 8 for a beer , lots more for a cocktail. Location could'nt be better, I would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel if you don't mind the half-butt job they do cleaning your room”
Reviews.Author: AlanaB55
Reviews.Content: First let me say we walked into the hotel and there was a looong line waiting to check in, but were up to the counter in about 15 minutes! Excellent! We paid the extra $20 a night ($100) to get a bigger, better, newly renovated room. The room was huge! Very nice room except for the carpet was old. Clearly they decided not to update the carpet. It was worn right down in all the usual wear spots in a room. The first 2 days we had wonderful housekeeping service. the last 3 days were horrible! All they did was remake the beds, empty garbage cans and provide new towels. I even called housekeeping to let them know they forgot to clear away our dirty drink glasses or clean the ashtrays. She assured me they would take care of it. Guess what? The next day, same thing! Dirty, untouched ashtrays, and the SAME dirty drink glasses, plus 2 more, still sitting on the desk. Called again, but it was of no use. They did clean the ashtrays, but yet AGAIN ignored the pina colada glasses (whipped cream long since hardened on). We did see the show Jubilee (my 2nd time) with BOGO tickets provided at check-in. It was a wonderful show! Well worth the money! Would recommend it to everybody! A true Las Vegas showgirl show! The valet service was wonderful, also. Always brought the car in a timely fashion. The casino was always neat and clean. The only other complaint was that they really need a Starbucks. Even the adjoining Paris doesn't have one! I thought Starbucks was in all the major hotel/casinos. Guess not. What they do have is a little coffee kiosk directly across from the front desk. They have a nice selection of coffees and pastries. Everything we tried was quite tasty. No complaints. The servers, however, need to polish up on their english. They were difficult to understand and they had difficulty understanding. Overall, I think I would rate the hotel a 3/5 Wouldn't stay again, though.

Reviews.Title: “Best bang for the buck in the middle of the Strip”
Reviews.Author: norcalnick
Reviews.Content: I remember the first time I stepped into and stayed in Bally's was in '93 when I accompanied my Mom during a convention she was attending. Granted I was only a teenager at the time, I had a buddy along so we walked up and down the strip to Circus Circus everyday. Through the years, the Strip has changed but the hotel hasn't. I've stayed at Bally's a few times after that and the rooms have had minor upgrades here and there, nothing major. The rooms are spacious and every room we were in always had a sofa, which was nice. As of recently, the beds are dated and sagging but I've slept on far worse beds. They still have tube TV's but hopefully that'll change. One thing that I hope will change are their popcorn ceilings. The bathroom was spacious but when the toilet flushed, it was loud, you know, that public restroom SWOOSH kind of loud. Also, the shower head was some type of water saver so the stream of water wasn't quite strong for my taste. There are no resort fees, which the hotel really touts but, they charge $13.95 for internet access, what a rip off. The casino has remained the same over the years and their little shopping area has slowly deteriorated. I remember the pool was always fun, but it's been a few years since I've been there. Several family members have told us to try out the Sterling Brunch on Sundays but warned us on this trip to probably skip it as the quality has gone down. Well for $85 per, I'll take their word for it. Overall, Bally's is an okay place to stay, it's in the center of the Strip so you don't have to drive out, it's connected to Paris and within a short walking distance to the other casinos. Honestly, you can get one hell of a deal on your stay here! It's not my first choice to stay when in Vegas but it's not the last!

Reviews.Title: “At this price- you can't go wrong..”
Reviews.Author: timsontheroad
Reviews.Content: After reading some dubious reports on T'A my partner and I were not champing at the bit to make a reservation... Having done extensive research on what was available in our price range we decided to take a chance and prove the negative reports wrong. At $38+ tax we were more than happy with what we received. Our room on the 17th floor was quiet and clean. Services were fast and friendly. The Tequila Bar on the lobby level was fabulous value for money and a great way to get into the Vegas frame of mind... Over all- if you can get in at a good price, you can' go wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Wyndham Vultures Annoying”
Reviews.Author: Zemoger
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Bally's for four nights beginning April 21. We liked the accomidations and staff but the Wyndham Timeshare vultures made us very uncomfortable. Every time we walked into the front door someone at Wyndham Timeshares hounded us with questions makeing offers of gifts if we attended a presentation. Not only were we accosted at the front door but also before we got to the elevators. At one point a man pretended to be a Bally's employee by offering directions and help. He had no name tag, but then he come on to promote Wyndham. We certainly did not appreciate the sly tactics and being apporached constantly every time we walked in the door or went to the elevators. Next time we want to stay at Bally's we will make sure to call and ask if the Wyndham vultures are going to be there. If so, we will find someplace else to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Grimy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kellyfromcanada
Reviews.Content: Bally's is great because it is situated in the middle of the strip, and shares access to Paris. It was also one of the grimiest hotels I've ever stayed in. The hotel itself could use a refresh in terms of carpeting etc. While I felt the bedding was clean, the bathroom left a lot to be desired. Long, black hairs were in the sink, as well as on the shelving units. Not nice. Check-in staff were unpleasant and said as little as possible to us. All in all, a very underwhelming experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for the Price”
Reviews.Author: Lorraine154914
Reviews.Content: Upgraded to renovated room. Very large, not much of a view, but good value for the price nonetheless. Can smell smoke from the casino even on the 15th floor, but not really a problem. Great pool with lots of loungers. Monorail does go right next to the pool so noise is a factor. Casino very smoky, checkin was quick, staff very courteous and helpful. Mid strip, so close to everything, which was great! Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Less expensive, no frills hotel and casino that is centrally located.”
Reviews.Author: mmdobie
Reviews.Content: If you want a less expensive, no frills hotel and casino that is centrally located, then Bally's is a good pick. Getting in and out of the hotel is easy. Parking was relatively easy. The room was very spacious, but the furniture and decor was extremely old and dated. The room and bathroom looked clean from afar, but upon closer inspection, was somewhat dusty and dirty. The cleaning crew didn't do a very good job day-to-day. Other examples of inattentiveness include the door to our room not staying flush to the door jam and carpet in the elevator lobby was coming up off the floor. It fit the bill for my stay, but if you want something a little nicer, then it's not the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “o'k”
Reviews.Author: ChiucagoPrettyeyes
Reviews.Content: The hotel was o'k but the carpet needed shampooing. My house slippers were diry at the end of my stay The room could have been a bit fresher. Hotel staff was quite nice. location was good Un decided if I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “better than expected”
Reviews.Author: T2D4
Reviews.Content: after reading some of the reviews, we were very nervous. upon arrival, our fears were never realized. booked a standard room through allegiant air, and was offered an upgrade to one of the "older" grand suites for $28 per night, which we accepted. the room showed signs of wear with a random stain on the carpet and milden in the shower, but the value made it worth it. we were given a room right off the elevator, right next to the ice machine as well. one of the major negatives is the walk to the pool. we were in the south tower, which was a quick 5 minute walk to the strip, but a solid 12-15 minute walk to the pool (through the casino, down the walkway past the sports book, then FINALLY to the pool). between the pool and the casino there is the aforementioned walkway with various shops, a nathan's famous, a sbarrao, and other random eateries. you'll likely get accosted by a wyndham resorts salesperson, but nothing out of the ordinary for vegas. some minor construction in the casino, but nothing trip-altering. long story short, if youre willing to accept some tradeoffs in room quality and cleanliness in favor of location, then bally's is for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel perfect price incredible location”
Reviews.Author: Big_guy411
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a bachelor party and it was great. Nothing insanely fancy but clean nice rooms. Cheap booze everywhere except in the lounge over by the stores/check-in. We paid the $20 upgrade for the north tower and I suggest everyone do the same. Highly recommend the 50 oz margarita from the slush bar and the Burger Brasserie was awesome too. Hotel is in the middle of everything and has a monorail stop. Couldn't ask for anything better. Would go back in a second!

Reviews.Title: “Room Upgrade Ripoff”
Reviews.Author: MrBean32
Reviews.Content: Do not fall for the "Newly Renovated Room Upgrade". I know that this city is fouunded on the "Sucker born every minute" principle and I still fell for this one. We have stayed at Bally's several times in the past and quite enjoyed it, but this time our $20.00 upgrade to a newly renovated room was a real ripoff. The only new thing in the room was the carpet. The light in the shower worked only 50% of the time and the hair dryer didn't work at all. The desk chair was so worn that the backing showed through and there was peeling paint and wall paper in the bathroom. Complaining got me a hair dryer to use.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value at Bally's”
Reviews.Author: HoustonNiki
Reviews.Content: Upon check-in I was greeted with a warm welcome and upgraded to a deluxe room. The room was clean and had updated amenities all except for the old school t.v. but who really cares? The bed was super comfy and I slept like a baby, the only flaw I saw was the ceiling in the shower was cracked open and corroded from water damage. (see pic). For $40 and with the free upgrade, the room was definitely worth the stay!

Reviews.Title: “Spacious, clean, well-maintained, and NO RESORT FEE!”
Reviews.Author: KimFryslie
Reviews.Content: I go to LV each year to help with an athletic event. I was annoyed last year when Treasure Island sprung their RESORT FEE of $20/day on me. I didn't use their resort services; I just needed a place to sleep, and TI was the team hotel. It struck me as a sleazy scam; maybe someone from one of Nevada's infamous telemarketing scams had joined the TI marketing department. Why not have a daily vacuuming fee, or a daily water heating fee? Obviously, this has nothing to do with a resort fee, but is obfuscation for the sole purpose of slyly boosting the take. So, this year I stayed at Bally's. I found my standard room spacious, fully equipped, well-maintaned. The bed was firm, I had a partial view of the Bellagio fountains, and the room was quiet. The pool was nice. The casino carpet was very clean (unlike TI's stained carpet), The casino connects directly to the Paris casino, and the cross-town monorail has a station next to the Bally's pool. The service was very good. I appreciate Bally's straight-forward, business-like approach. They have not adopted the share the wealth model espoused by TI (that everyone should pay for their resort services whether they use them or not). For the traveler who needs clean, well-maintained lodging, good service and a square deal, I strongly recommend Bally's Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “great location...ok hotel.”
Reviews.Author: MrsGordo
Reviews.Content: it's in a great location...the rooms are clean and thats about all I can say. The places to eat are limited...and the service in them are not the best. BUT...the location and price are great!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant expeirence”
Reviews.Author: Tara089
Reviews.Content: Brilliant hotel, great location, middle of the strip and excellent shows. Would definately recommend it to all travelers.

Reviews.Title: “2nd stay....dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: nan065092
Reviews.Content: The hotel location is central and we enjoyed the location, however, the state of the upgraded room was poor. The furnishings were very outdated with stains on the loveseat and chair.There were cigarette burns on the nightstand in our "non smoking" room. The curtains had stains on them and were difficult to open because they would get stuck after they were closed.. Our bedding had holes in the linen and the iron actually "blew" the socket blowing the cord right off it when Ii plugged it in. The bathroom vanity needed paint and the toilet had to be flushed twice. The room had no telephone book or information about the hotel services and had no amentities likea coffee maker, fridge or WiFi. They charged $3.00/day to use the safe. We don't recommend this hotel and certainly won't stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Best location on the strip IMO”
Reviews.Author: LeVisitant
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 9 nights; that's a lot of Vegas time! Absolutely loved the hotel for so many reasons: *Location: it's centre strip opposite the Bellagio so you get to watch the fountain show as much as possible Casino: Much more homely and manageable than the mega resorts, staff so friendly and you don't have to wait ages for complimentary drinks Restaurants: lots of cheap diner style eateries downstairs but the sister hotel Paris is connected by a walkway and they have a stunning array of restaurants including the outstanding Le Village Buffet; best breakfast I ever had but be prepared to queue at the weekends Room: Large, comfortable and well insulated against noise Price: Always seem to be discounts on offer, try and get in the tower block nearer to the Strip as the walking distances are deceptive There are scores of hotels in Vegas and its fun to visit them for the thematic experience but Bally's doesn't go in for that kitsch, it's just a wonderful hotel

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, Great Center Strip Location”
Reviews.Author: Wordman113
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Bally's for the first time, with a friend who had the room comped. Large hotel room, with two queen beds and it was nicely appointed. Bally's has a great location, right in the center of the Strip. Bally's is also connected to the Paris Casino via a walkway with shops and restraurants. Bally's Casino is a little more dated looking and doesn't have any real theme, if that is important to you, but the Paris does. Having stayed at the Paris before, I think that Bally's is a lot better value.

Reviews.Title: “Sports bar not hockey friendly”
Reviews.Author: LeelowRegina_Canada
Reviews.Content: NHL playoffs and the bar has about 30 fans to watch hockey. Some Chicago some Vancouver fans. The bar plays basketball audio despite virtually all fans watching hockey and asking for hockey audio. (about 35 people in the lounge) Maybe not a big deal to most but they lost a few customers in future. The sports lounge sucks anyway. Know your customers.

Reviews.Title: “Bally's Las Vegas Just OK”
Reviews.Author: Punktravel
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a good location on the strip. Rooms are large and nicely decorated. Modern Bathroom, Old style TV, Beds were comfortable. Room was cleaned and serviced daily. If the price was right I would stay here again. Staff was nice My only compalints are 1- The carpet was worn out & looked dirty 2-At check out they had a $3 a day charge for the in-room safe that I had never used or touched. They did take it off the bill with no questions asked. 3- Towels were as rough as sandpaper. A few of them had stains or holes in them

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: PCPP
Reviews.Content: the location of this hotel is awesome, your room is not that far from the casino so your feet take a break staying here, upgrading room is cheap and you really get a nice place to stay. Love that the Paris is attached and a short walk to the piano bar. If you are looking for someone this smaller casino makes it easy to find. Rooms are clean and nice. You don't get ripped off buying water or pop here - Ate breakfast at the restaurant and it was good. Stayed here 3 times now and can't believe i didn't book here for our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: BJSueB
Reviews.Content: Ballys of Las Vegas is a large resort close to all the action Vegas is famous for. We stayed in the North Tower and throughly enjoyed our visit. Great Room and a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, great location but room needs some attention”
Reviews.Author: texasgirl1969
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 2 nights at Bally's (April 10-12th). I love the location of this hotel as I stayed at Paris last year. I love how it's connected to Paris and very close to PH and the tram goes everywhere else from here! Our rooms were comped but we decided to upgrade to a jacuzzi suite(never used the jacuzzi though). I felt the room was a bit dated for a newly renovated North Tower room. Mold in the shower, stains on the sofa, chair, carpet, etc. I didn't like the view either. It faced the side of Bills Casino and it was on the 7th floor so the street noise made it very difficult to sleep at night. Having said all this, I would still stay here if given the opportunity because I love the location so much. I would definitely pick a higher floor though! Oh, the casino was soooo smoky, my eyes stayed bloodshot! Restaurants were very reasonable(except for breakfast) and it wasn't that great either! Loved the fast food type eateries like Haegan Daaz, Nathan's & Sbarros!

Reviews.Title: “Ballys Glad I took a chance”
Reviews.Author: mintyclean
Reviews.Content: I was so worried about our stay here, We were booked in South but got upgraded to North with a request and a tip. NO LONG WAITING To check in. They were fully staffed. Walk not so bad from casino to parking and valet service also Good. Bell service good. check in staff Wonderful and friendly. Rooms a bit dated but large and spacious. Bathroom looked new granite counters and floors. Great water pressure and shower, Older tv but who cares it worked for the short time we watched, Location is great. I am used to staying off strip so dealing with traffic at peak times was a pain. I did go to check out the South Tower and a woman said the rooms were bad there, she had stayed in North before and said it was Heaven, She got South through a package deal. Also thank you Trip Advisor for providing a venue to learn more about accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “Good Quality”
Reviews.Author: Makole
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a center of Las Vegas Blvd. Price is average. Room is good with this price. A little bit old but OK.

Reviews.Title: “Could not have been nicer”
Reviews.Author: Billfone
Reviews.Content: Pros: North Tower. Huge, clean, standard room. Fast elevators. Nice staff. Responsive to requests. No resort fee. Reasonable Mexican restaurant with the best pitchers of Margaritas. Cons: None really if you consider you are in Las Vegas where EVERYTHING costs $$.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel and staff!!”
Reviews.Author: troi41
Reviews.Content: I have to say that Bally's was amazing to stay at. The staff and the desk were so helpful and friendly and the housekeeping staff did a excellent job with the room. The room I had was on the north tower and was very spacious. Love the bathroom and shower and having the desk in the room was a big plus. Thankyou for such a wonderful stay!!

Reviews.Title: “some room dated but hotel ok”
Reviews.Author: seacat123
Reviews.Content: Booked a room in the south tower tried to check-in at 13.00 hours (check-in is listed as 16.00) was told I could upgrade room for $20 per night and check in now as my standard was not available until 16.00, staff was very polite. The view from the room was nice as overlooking the Paris hotel pool and the Eiffel tower. The room was quite big, the rooms are outdated with holes in the wall where the TV table had been fastened to the wall and came away, the door stop was hanging off the wall and a bit of mould on the tile of the shower. There was food trays left in the hallway for a couple of days. The room housekeeping was good and the staff helpful with our queries. They do charge $3.00 a day for the room safe. The hotel in a great area on the strip. Better value hotels in vegas.

Reviews.Title: “brilliant central location.”
Reviews.Author: brennabeeLondon
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Ballys for 5 nights, found check-in quick and staff friendly and helpful. Our room was in the south tower with a great view of the eiffel tower and bellagio! the room although dated was large the bed was enormous by UK standards. bathroom was clean and complimentary toiletries were useful. we used the safe and were NOT charged as some previous customers have stated. We were disappointed that there were no tea/coffee making facilities in the room, Nosh didnt open til 7am so had to dress and walk through casino to get early morning drink.!! The casino floor and bar areas were smoky and as a non-smoker i found it uncomfortable at times. We ate tasty breakfast bagels from 'nosh' and had an amazing meal at the thai restaurant (Sea garden??) I would definatly go back to Ballys as value for money and location it cant be beaten.

Reviews.Title: “Okay hotel for the price, good location”
Reviews.Author: Mosqito
Reviews.Content: Rooms were okay. When we entered the room for the first time, our second bed seemed like someone had taken a nap on it and used the bathroom as well. We informed the reception and the cleaning staff took care of it. Other than that the rooms were good for the price. The internet connection cost a lot, around 15$/day. That is way too much. The hotel had free parking which was great. The location of the hotel was great, not so far from either end of the strip. And although the hotel address is not the Strip, the hotel is practically on the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “great value”
Reviews.Author: sctraveler4519
Reviews.Content: I,ve stayed at ballys several times and find the staff to be extremely friendly and helpful. Only complaint is South Tower rooms are hit and miss. This time I was in rm. 7222 and found it to be old but very clean and comfortable. Highly recomend Ballys as a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Time warp”
Reviews.Author: SuePT
Reviews.Content: The first thing that hits you when entering this hotel is the smoking. No smoke free areas here. There is no lobby so the very long wait to check in is accompanied by second hand smoke. The distances from main section to rooms is very long, expect a 10 minute walk so if you have mobility issues this is not the hotel for you. There is also no where to eat here that isn't on the casino floor. The rooms were large and had a great view of the strip. It connects to Paris via the casino and the Bellagio fountains are right across the street. For a bargain hotel it isn't bad but they have no free WiFi or breakfast. I suggest for a lot less you stay at the Comfort Inn; free breakfast, free WiFi and non smoking property, they also have a free shuttle to the strip locations and airport.

Reviews.Title: “better than expected”
Reviews.Author: DoctorRDenver_CO
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a three night stay at Bally's North Tower. Based on prior reviews I was not sure what to expect. The check in process was swift and efficietn, Malynda was exceptional and took care of my friend getting the same rate I was paying. Upon arriving in the room I found it very clean and large. It does have an older tv set (the tube type), bathroom was large and had plenty of counter space. It was very quiet on our floor which I liked. The only meal we had was at the Tequila Bar, it is quite a bargain and the Manager was very good an welcoming. While Bally's is not a 5 Star resort like the Wynn and does not have the same clientle it was fine for a guys basketball weekend. Casino was quite smoky, but I come fro ma non-smoking state.

Reviews.Title: “Good with issues”
Reviews.Author: azeddie
Reviews.Content: I treated my niece and her friend to a week in Las Vegas for my niece's 21st birthday in January 2011. I am the favorite uncle that spoils her. I have stayed at Bally's before as I always receive good quality service with clean rooms and in summer i have often been given a comp upgrade to the north tower. With my past experience and the location of Bally's, in the middle of the strip, choosing Bally's was a no-brainer. The rooms were very nice and clean with prompt housekeeping every day. I have to compliment the front desk personnel as she went out of her way to get us rooms that were adjoining. I have absolutely no complaints about the stay at Bally's. My only issue on the week was with the Paris Resort, which adjoins Bally's. In the first 24 hours, when crossing over to the Paris side, we were stopped three times, by a Paris employee, with the question "How are these young ladies related to you?" In no way were my niece or her friend dressed as other than tourists, i.e. jeans, t-shirts, jackets, etc. This was extremely uncomfortable and after the third time we simply did not return to the Paris resort. After returning home I complained to Bally's in an email about the incident and received a polite email apologizing and explaining that it was Wyndham Resorts, a timeshare company, employee who was approaching us and they are taking care of the issue. I have been approached by Wyndham Resort sales people before and they have always identified themselves while the guy at the Paris did not identify himself. Even if Bally's explanation of the incident is correct it is very uncomfortable to be approached with the question: "How are these young ladies related to you?" In the future, if on my own or with male friends, I will consider staying at Bally's it is a wonderful resort at a great price and location. However, if with female family members or friends I will go elsewhere to hopefully avoid this situation.

Reviews.Title: “South Tower not renovated in 2 decades”
Reviews.Author: food&beverage
Reviews.Content: I checked in with my Mother for a 4 night stay, after carefully checking the AARP/Expedia website and photos for each room type, selected a standard classic room, which showed a big easy chair with arms. When we arrived at the hotel, there was a lengthy check in (only 4 clerks on the desk) our room was a disaster, old and broken furniture and a big empty spot where the chair belonged. I called housekeeping for the missing chair and eventually a houseman arrived and told me there were no big chairs, but he had found a single chair in the hall with torn fabric that had arms on the chair. The next day I complained to asst mgr. Eric, who listened carefully to our concerns and promptly arranged for us to move to a room with more suitable furniture in the North Tower. The rest of our stay was pleasant in the renovated room with a comfortable chair for my elderly Mother. Prior to our check out we received a call from the bell captain saying they had drycleaning for a Joseph and was that person in our room. I clearly told them we had no drycleaning and there was no Joseph in our room. I did express check out to avoid the lengthy lines (our room was pre-paid for 4 nights and we charged no incidentals to the room). Upon returning home I received a statement showing they had charged $8.50 to my credit card for valet cleaning for Joseph! I called the hotel, and a desk clerk told me he couldn't handle the refund, that it would need to be done by asst mgr, Roxanne. After two further calls to Roxanne, I received a revised statement with the $8.50 charge for Joseph's drycleaning removed. This hotel is all about gambling. There clearly is no interest in serving room guests. Use of the pool involves a long walk from the North tower through the arcade of shops and restaurants in the basement. If you are staying in the South tower you must first walk through the entire casino in your swimsuit before descending to the basement and walking through the arcade. The hotel is lacking the most basic standard amenities and there are no coffee makers in the room. There is no free wifi in the Bally's /Paris complex, $12.99 per day is the charge to go online. The coffee cart/ nosh place and restaurants looked so dreadful and were expensive for the poor quality they had to offer, so went went off property daily for meals and to enjoy longe entertainment at the Bellagio, Mandarin, and Paris. This hotel is not suitable for anyone for anyone interested in dining and entertainment, there isn't even a lobby! The bell staff is very pleasant and helpful, as were the room cleaners - desk staff was always overwhelmed and provided no hotel information. By the way, upon check-in we were given a promotional booklet for Harrahs properties attractions and dining - the book had expired 3 months earlier!

Reviews.Title: “Predictably Good - Consistent - Fells Like Home!”
Reviews.Author: Yukon2010
Reviews.Content: This is our third visit - each time the visit get better and better. We stayed for our third anniversary and we received a room upgrade when asked for! The room was spacious & the front desk personnel were fantastic. We stayed and ate at the Steakhouse which is magnificant, great food and good service! Then there is the Sterling Brunch - Eric The Chef and Illaro are amazing - professional and always interested in giving customers great service and superb food! We will be back in November for my 50th birthday. Thanks Ballys you always make these Canadians fell like its home!!!

Reviews.Title: “A Charge to be Safe”
Reviews.Author: Imua50
Reviews.Content: Bally's is the only Hotel on the strip that charges you to have your valuables Safe, through the use of the in room safe. Bally's has done away with their Safety Deposit Box and forces customers to pay for securing their valuables which I believe should be a customer service complementary product. The other services at Bally's are fine except they don't have their own buffet or Diamonds Lounge. Rooms are well kept and serviced. It's a fun place with a lot of restaurants and gaming. Had to call Security at 1:30 am due to Spring Breakers running and yelling down the halls to the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay because of free upgrade”
Reviews.Author: edgar90
Reviews.Content: I checked into this hotel December 6-10th and my stay was average. When I checked in, there were 5 people doing check-in and during my wait in line the number dropped to 3 doing check-in. And this was at 4:30 P.M. (right when you expect it to be busy and it was during NFR). When I finally got to the front counter and received my room, I headed up there. Upon arriving at my room, I immediately noticed that the room hadn't been made. There was a big empty box of beer in the corner by the trash can and the bed had still not been made. This was a South Tower room which I had booked. I immediately headed back down to the front counter, I waited in the Premium line since the person who had taken care of me was helping that line. When he was finally free, I told him I needed another room as this one wasn't made. up. He apologized and then asked me if I would like an upgrade to the North Tower. I jumped on it and headed up to my room. When I got to my room I found it to be quite spacious. I do wish that it had a flat screen TV instead of a CRT 19" tv. The room did also come with 2 queen beds.but no refrigerator or any way to keep any thing cold except the ice bucket.To get to the room one has to go around 3 corners. The towels were nothing special and the beds were average. This seemed like an average room but was a little nicer than.the original South Tower room. The room was quite at night and the elevator was quick.

Reviews.Title: “North Tower Was OK - Pleasant Staff”
Reviews.Author: castaways01
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed five nights in Vegas - took my sister, a non-gambler. The first two nights were at Ballys. I've stayed at either the Venetian or Palazzo numerous times over the last several years and really love those hotels. However, when offered a couple of comp nights in Ballys North tower, I decided to try it. My expectations weren't very high (based on TripAdvisor comments) but as long as the room was clean, I figured we'd be happy. We arrived early (11:30a) and had no problem checking in. The front desk clerk was very pleasant and the line was short. Our room faced the parking garage and Platinum Hotel (where we stayed the other 3 nights) and it was fine. Wasn't upscale by any means, but it wasn't a dump either. Everything appeared clean and in good repair. Beds were comfortable and halls were quiet. The Teguilla Bar on the casino level was a lot of fun - the $2 tacos and $2 margaritas were a treat. We also ate at Le Burger Brasserie (shared a hot dog, hamburger and onion rings) and it was good. We're not big eaters so it was plenty of food. One evening we saw Jubilee, using the buy one, get one free coupons they gave at check-in. The show was awesome - reminescent of the old Vegas shows with the sexy costumed, gorgeous show girls. Have no complaints about Ballys, but I wouldn't want to stay in an old room in South Tower, either.

Reviews.Title: “Ok--but needs improvements.”
Reviews.Author: NSPounds
Reviews.Content: This was our second time staying at Bally's. For location, you can not beat it. It's right in the middle of the strip and has easy access to the monorail and the many mid-strip attractions. They have several places to eat if you are looking for a quick meal. Nathan's is fantastic, NOSH is amazing and Sbarro is ok and open 24 hours. They also have a New York Pretzel and a Hagen Daaz that are available during the day and early evening hours. There are a couple of other places that we didn't try. NOSH has amazing sandwiches and they are so big that you can easily split them between two people. The bagels there are also very tasty. Knowing this was an older hotel my expectations were not overly high. Last year we stayed at the Luxor, which was a dump and was dirty, so anything was a step up. When we checked in we asked for a room with a view, we were told there was only one available and it was not clean yet, so we were happy to wait. Once we got to our room we were pleasantly surprised as the view was absolutely phenomenal. It looked out on the Eiffel Tower, the Paris Pool and you could even see 1/2 of the Bellagio fountains. Beautiful. Our room, 7231 was HUGE. It was a double queen room and had a lot of room to spread out. The furniture was a bit scarred up, but was functional. The TV reception was poor, but that was not just for this room (my parents were staying in a suite which had the same problem.) But who wants to watch TV while in Vegas anyways. :) The bathroom was spacious, but was in need of some love. The fan did not work. The sink was missing the nozzle, so the water kind of splashed on the counter when you washed your hands, brushed your teeth, etc. Most disappointing was the shower. The shower head was in desperate need of being replaced. The water flow was very poor and there was a strange odor, almost like a sewer smell, coming from the shower when you ran the water. It didn't make you feel the most clean. The room was cleaned everyday and fresh towels were given. The comforter on the bed was changed after 3 days. The staff was always friendly and pleasant. The air conditioner was more than sufficient and cooled the room very quickly. The room was also very quiet, except for our final night we had some noisy neighbors, but they calmed down just after midnight. For the money, I definitely would recommend Bally's to anyone who is not looking for a high-end place to stay. It's clean and in a great location. The casino is smaller and the hotel/casino as a whole is very easy to navigate.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location. You get what you pay for.”
Reviews.Author: HHdreamin
Reviews.Content: For $60 a night on the Wedsnesday and Thursday on March Madness, this is a great deal for the location. We stayed in the classic rooms. Classic - 1970's decor. But the room was huge. I would have paid the slight upgrade in price to stay in recently renovated tower [north?], there is a HUGE difference in quality.

Reviews.Title: “Good Price, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: nicnac41
Reviews.Content: I went to Vegas with 5 friends and we booked at 2 rooms Bally's, they were unable to give us rooms side by side, but they were able to give us rooms on the same floor. We got one of the newer rooms in the North Tower. It was a very basic, clean room for the amount of time we spent in our hotel room it did the job. The location was prime! I do recommend going to the "Tequila Bar & Grill" it is located on the Casino floor. They have $1 tacos and $2 breakfast any time....comes in handy when you are getting home late or early...

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay in South Tower”
Reviews.Author: mikeyb56LongIslandNY
Reviews.Content: At check in, as a Total Rewards member, I asked for a free upgrade to North Tower. The nasty clerk at the desk informed me that it would be an extra$20 per night. I declined. I went up to my room. Beautiful view, but the stink of mold and mildew was horrendous. I went back down to tell them that I could not breathe in that room and was upgraded to North Tower for free. Low floor so no view, but It did not stink.

Reviews.Title: “Going downhill”
Reviews.Author: AdTrosa
Reviews.Content: I expected something cleaner, more up to date and a higher service level. The rooms are big, but noisy and old. The carpet needs cleaning and the sink in the bathroom has cracked. A long line just to check in and front desk people not very helpful. I will pick another hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to visit, but would not stay there again”
Reviews.Author: goochnj9
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the south tower - big mistake. Although it was a suite, we will not return. The room was in need of a renovation. Carpet was very old, old TV, and the maid service was average. Stay out of the restaurants, except the Steakhouse which was exceptional. Better to eat next door at Paris! The Casino was good as most others and the service in the casino was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, quiet & great location!”
Reviews.Author: rio2009
Reviews.Content: OK... so the hotel is a bit outdated however... it was CLEAN!! We were upgraded to a suite...Yes the rooms showed their age but it was clean, the beds were comfy, no noise from neighbors or slammin doors We missed the rush so we only had to wait 5 minutes in line to check in. Room service on sunday night only took 30 minutes and the food was really good. And the staff was extremely nice! No complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Awsome”
Reviews.Author: wyobiggirl
Reviews.Content: Awsome view, was worried about staying at Ballys especially in the South Tower. They offered upgrade to north tower but chose to stay in the south tower becasue the room offered the best view. The room although had some dated furnishings was very clean, and comfortable. There was so much space did not feel cramped. The staff was so very pleasant. The housekeeping was excellant. i would absolutly recommend this to everyone. Location is awsome right on the corner walk to everything. Teh Paris is connected. The spa was very accomodating as well, and would recommend to all that you try the massage on Sunday morning. Had a great time and will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Got an amazing deal, great location and got lucky with my room”
Reviews.Author: zimmazimm
Reviews.Content: I booked 2 months in advance on Priceline, and I got the lowest price I 've ever seen for a decent hotel on the Strip. When I got there, they did not have a non-smoking room with a King bed for all 5 nights I was staying, so they put my in a Suite....and yes, it was SWEET! It had a huge tub, 2 vanities with sinks, restroom w/ a phone it it, budé (sp?), a huge bed, table with chairs, 2 nice stuffed chairs and an ENORMOUS room. The furniture in the room was a little outdated but still classy....few stains on carpet (no biggie). Great casino. Great location. Great staff. Great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Need a renovation.”
Reviews.Author: Tilap
Reviews.Content: Ballys, need a renovation, casino always dirty and smelling bad. Rooms with old tv set, wirelles paid and poor quality. The good thing is a japanese restaurant, Ichiban, best of Las vegas. You must try Ichiban, if you like a good sushi.

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect but...”
Reviews.Author: RaveDJ
Reviews.Content: I've literally just landed back in the UK, having stayed 6 nights at Bally's. My previous stays in Vegas have been at the Monte Carlo and Paris (both excellent) and Bally's compares favourably with either. However, if I'm going to get picky, the shower head was too low and the flow lacked power, WiFi is not free ($20/day!), and they even charge for the in-room safe. Everything else was very nice, having just been redecorated, I'd say. The bed was comfortable and the maid did an excellent job each day (better to tip in advance) This is rightly a 3.5* property, ideally located on the centre of the Strip, but without the refinement and classy touches of its competitors. It's almost perfect except for the minor flaws others have highlighted. But then, you don't spend much time in the room, do you?

Reviews.Title: “Decent Stay”
Reviews.Author: coconutfan2010
Reviews.Content: The location is great because it's in the center of the strip. We upgraded to the North Tower. The air conditioning was a bit noisy and was limited in our ability to adjust it. Sometimes, it was just too strong. The staff was okay. The line up could be a bit long to check-in. Our room was spacious.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: TNedge
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the older part, but my room was still HUGE. We booked through priceline and got a great price and almost the top floor! We had a fantastic view of the strip. Our window ran the legth of the room. My only gripe was there was no coffee maker. Loved this hotel ,it was a fantastic value and great location. Pool was not open but we were not there to swim.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Bally's”
Reviews.Author: farbes
Reviews.Content: My sister and I just stayed at Bally's for 3 nights and had a great stay!! Before we got there we toyed with the idea of upgrading our room, I am so glad we didn't! We were room 6929, breath taking view! We looked out at the Paris and all the way down the strip towards Excalibur and we could watch the Belagio fountain show many times a day!! The furniture was a little out dated, but I dont go to Vegas for flashy furniture! I have stayed at the Tropicanna, Excalibur and Circus Circus and this is the best by far! The location of this hotel is the best!! Mid-strip, you can walk anywhere from here!! Next time I go it will be Bally's that I stay at!!

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed my stay, happy to recommend hotel.”
Reviews.Author: CrispinB2
Reviews.Content: Checked in on a Sunday night (2/13) at around 2000h line took about 8 minutes to clear. A desk agent brought out a vase of long stem carnations for the waiting ladies as it was Valentines Day Eve. Very friendly woman at the counter. I asked for a room in the tower closer to Paris and got it w/o a problem. "Classic Room" 2 queens very spacious with views to Paris, PH Westgate and McCarren. You could also get a partial view of the Bellagio. (Warning you will here Bellagio fountain jets from room 2026) Great view from elevator lobby towards Wynn end of main strip -encore/wynn end. General area staff (hallway/electricians/maintenance people) very friendly. Good water pressure in the shower, room was very clean and looks a lot like the rooms at the Sheraton Centre in Toronto if you are looking for a comparison. The monorail station is a good 5-7 minute walk from the lobby. I did not gamble so cannot comment on that the elevators are not too  "deep" into the casino from the registration desk, although it is a long walk from the elevator to room 2026 and the link to the Paris is terrific, in fact the rooms t Bally's are closer to the confrence side than their own hotel rooms!

Reviews.Title: “OK but not great”
Reviews.Author: skivail007
Reviews.Content: We had a great location, looking right at the Paris' Eiffle Tower and half of Bellegio's fountains. That was the best part. The rooms are very old and worn. The bathroom grout coming out, bath fixtures tarnished and drywall damage on the ceiling. The windows were super dirty. If you just want a place to sleep, you are ok. And the worst of all, down by the night stand were old toenail clippings...Gross!!!

Reviews.Title: “excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: spidy1000
Reviews.Content: traveled to vegas via allegiant air and got a package to stay at Bally's. Up graded to a north tower suite. We read alot of reviews before we left and was unsure about Bally's but some people you just can't please. Bally's is just fine! Stayed for 10 days and ate alot of buffets and got to say Stratosphere has the best eats, whether it is the buffet or the diner. All american good food. Cearers buffet was good also. Right down the back street of Bally's is a Brewry/restaurant called Ellis Island, they have the best food for very cheap with homemade root beer, check this out. Safe to walk to in the day time. Stay at Bally's and enjoy yourself.

Reviews.Title: “Great location at a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: rjostwald
Reviews.Content: Bally's was a great location and convenient to so much on the strip. Stayed in North Tower, with 3 women in the room, it was very spacious. Beds were comfortable and halls quiet. Loved having mirrors in the room so we could put make-up on outside the bathroom. The Tequila's Bar in Bally's was great with cheap tacos/margaritas, great for end of day after shows to relax and sit and visit with our group. Didn't like smokiness of casino. Housekeeping was prompt and cleaned rooms while we were out and about. Check-in/out personnel was courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Just fine with me”
Reviews.Author: DEWEaston
Reviews.Content: I have been to Las Vegas several times and stayed at the Palms and Four Queens, they are both nice hotels to stay at for their own reasons.I have also stayed at Bally"s a couple of times,the last being Oct. 27-Nov. 3 2010.When you consider the price and location it's hard to beat.Yes, it is old and needs some work but it's alright with me. I don't go to Vegas to sit in the room, all I need is a shower and a place to lay my head.

Reviews.Title: “A little dirty”
Reviews.Author: WorldsOfFun
Reviews.Content: We were a little disapointed when we got to our room which was supposed to be a free upgrade to the north tower. The carpet was filthy. It just seemed dirty. But it was cheap. The casino was ok, it was hard to get a waitress. Its sits back a little from the strip but is easy access to the strip and the tram.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: thinktwice1209
Reviews.Content: We arrived in vegas for my bday. Check-in was pretty quick and the lady upgraded our room. The only thing that I would recommend is that they at least have a fridge and/or microwave in the rooms. Other than that, it was a nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel expierence was excellent!!!”
Reviews.Author: AndiMilwaukee
Reviews.Content: We were comped three nites,,,had never stayed there,,so decided to try it,,also had comp nites for other hotels,,but chose Bally's....The hotel and casino could use a re-vamping,,however I cannot say enough good things about the employees!! They were phenomanal! From desk, check in and check out, to houskeeping, to floor personnel, to security...everyone we came in contact with was professional, friendly, out going, helpful, just plain great! I am a hotel snob,,,but I would stay here again, in a heartbeat..yes we don't spend much time in the room,,but contact with employees is a very important part, in making your stay enjoyable...and believe me,,they were great!!! I really cannot say enough good things about the hotel personnel on all levels.....we stayed in the south tower,,my husband thought the room could use an upgrade,,,but it was fine...beds very comfortable....and housekeeping was a hoot! our maid was so sweet....try and find that in the higher end hotels...it won't happen,,believe me. I am going back to Vegas again in early summer,,,,and I will stay there....maybe it is not the best example of a "hot" hotel,,but I would rather have it be what it was,,and the excellent personnel,,,than have a great room, and snobby personnel.....they really made our stay very enjoyable!

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: TheVBs
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay at Ballys. Traveled with my husband and friends to celebrate birthdays. Can't beat the price and location. We were all upgraded to the North Tower and the rooms were clean and comfortable. Didn't gamble there but did enjoy the cheap tacos late one night. Service was excellent and check in was actually quite easy. Only complaint was the breakfast buffet...nice server but very limited selection of food and what we did get did not taste very good. We ended up eating at Paris most of the time. Overall great trip and we will likely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Pros and Cons of Bally's Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: 35000ft
Reviews.Content: Pros: Inexpensive: $89/night Fri/Sat Excellent Location on the Strip Hospitable Staff Clean Bed Linens Cheap Bachelor Parties Only Responsive Housekeeping staff Dirty Windows Cons: Comparably Poor Casino Air Quality Rooms Circa 1988 Stained Furniture, Curtains, Carpet, Chairs Worn/Dirty Carpet Weak Shower Stream without stable Temperature Tarnished/Worn faucets Stained Tile Shower Stall Popcorn Textured ceilings Water Leak inside the walls Casino bar/lounge entertainment had serious feedback issues with deafening music Swimming Pool closed in the winter While it is clear that they work hard at custodial, housekeeping and general service oriented activities, 20+ years of Las Vegas traffic shows in every aspect of this hotel. It was probably fine about 10 years ago, but has since lost its fastball. I wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here!!!”
Reviews.Author: Steven51
Reviews.Content: If you are considering staying here, think again!!. We stayed here about 10 years ago and it was a nice hotel. The rooms were well kept and it was close to the Strip and other hotels. So we thought we would try it again. I have tried several other hotels over the years and thought it would be nice to go back to Bally's for my 50th with my wife. What a mistake! When we got there, our room had been given away so they offered to upgrade us to a suite. The catch was we would have to move the next day unless we paid $50/night more. They assured me it was a great suite and I wouldn't regret it. So we agreed and went up to the room. While the room was bigger, it was filthy. There were stains allover the curtains and the sofa was so dirty and stained my wife wouldn't even sit on it. The carpets were stained as well, it was a mess. So we told them we wanted to move and they told us we could move the next day but would still have to pay $20 extra per day as they had none of the room type we had booked available. The next day when we had to change rooms we went to check out the new room first. I didn't think it was possible, but this room was filthier than the first. There was fluid of some kind dripping down the bathroom door frame, the carpet was torn and dirty. We went back downstairs to say we wanted another room and were kept waiting for over 45 minutes while they tried to find a new cleaner room. When they finally did, it wasn't much better than the last but we were too tired to fight any longer. This is by no means a 4 star hotel as advertised. It needs to be imploded and rebuilt. I wouldn't recomend this hotel to any one. We will definitely not be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal”
Reviews.Author: tgroverhaddox
Reviews.Content: The price was great and so was the location. Our room was very nice and clean. we had the breakfast buffet every day and it was delicious as well as affordable. I scheduled a spa/massage appointment and was able to get in same day.

Reviews.Title: “Still Our Favorite”
Reviews.Author: MarkSSeattle
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stay at Bally's at least once a year, most recently in late February. We continue to find it the best value on the strip. Reasonable rates (and no resort fees), superb location, generally friendly staff, large and clean (though dated) rooms make it a great choice. If space is available and you ask, they will often put you in the north tower, which has more recently been updated and is brighter than the south. Our room, as usual, was large, clean and had an excellent mattress. We always ask for a room on the "back side" of the north tower. The view's not great, but it is very quiet (hard to find in Vegas!). Food choices are rather ordinary, but the Mexican cafe in the lobby offers great deals on tacos, margaritas, and beer. You are at the main intersection of the strip (Flamingo and Las Vegas Boulevard). If you can't find the atmosphere or activity of your choice at Bally's (or Paris, which is attached by shops), you can find it close by.

Reviews.Title: “Not an excellent hotel, but a great deal & location.”
Reviews.Author: Helenmb01
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is excellent. It is right in the middle of the strip and it is easy to get to all of the central strip hotel and casinos. We got a great deal on the mid week room rate, but the room and hotel quality was not excellent. For example, my husband and I walked past the same used drink glasses with cigarette butt in it in our hallway for the whole 5 days we were there. It was really gross. The rooms are good sized, but very basic. It was certainly worth the $50 a night, but it is not a classy hotel by any means.

Reviews.Title: “low price for a big room at the Strip”
Reviews.Author: 8050traveller
Reviews.Content: older hotel directly at the strip, so everything is very close. very low price compared to the neighboring hotels (Bellagio, Paris, MGM) but everything is there. as in most hotel rooms in Las Vegas there is no coffeemaker but coffee and breakfast items are available downstairs. Do not miss the shows in Las Vegas and good luck in the casino!

Reviews.Title: “There are better options in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: sunbunny31
Reviews.Content: I have been conflicted about what to write about my experience at Bally's, as I take no satisfaction in writing a bad review. This trip, I traveled with my 9-year-old daughter for a competition being held at a local arena, so our travel arrangements were made as a group and some decisions as to location of the group within the hotel and room class were out of my hands. However, I have come to the conclusion that why the experience was overall sub-par was because somehow Bally's staff is acting as though there aren't hundreds of other options for hotels of a similar class and location and are treating their guests as though the hotel is the only game in town. My first impression of the hotel was at the front driveway. I had rented a car, and was greeted with "valet parking full" as my welcome. I wasn't interested in valet or long term parking, only in dropping my bags, checking in, and moving the car when I was through. This is not an option at this hotel. The busy and pressed valet was relieved when I told him I was only interested in where to park in order to check in, and gave me directions to the garage which is shared with the neighboring Paris hotel. He did ask if I needed help with my bags, which I declined, though considering the very long walk from the parking garage through a shopping mall then through the casino floor to the check in counter, in hindsight I might have accepted. The line to check in was incredibly long. We waited 55 minutes to check in. I will compare this to my experience only a month earlier at the Aria, where I was checking in as a member of a large group (a couple thousand) from my company, which you can imagine led to long lines. At the Aria, every workstation was fully staffed, and there were waitresses working the line offering free water, as well as Aria staff making sure they answered our questions and helped manage the line. At Bally's, the very long counter had only three workers and they moved very slowly. One guest had an issue with the billing or the reservation, and that took one of the clerks out of circulation, which slowed the line down even more. During this wait, a worker came out of a room and matter-of-factly told someone she was on her lunch break. Well, sure, I'm sure you need it and earned it, but note to customer service folks, tired people waiting to check in after traveling to your hotel really don't need to hear that. When I finally did get to the agent, she was extremely efficient and polite and was a highlight of the hotel. The room. Well, we were given floor 5 in the North Tower. My room had a view of: a wall. There was a gravel roof for the adjoining floor (banquet hall or -- ?) directly below our windows, littered with cigarette butts from guests who chose to smoke in the non-smoking floor room. Well, we weren't here for the view, but it was disappointing. The room itself was clean and comfortable. However, signs of wear and use were to be found - peeling wallpaper in the bathroom, scuff marks everywhere. However, on the plus side, the rooms were very, very quiet and the beds were very comfortable, and large, plus the room was spacious and didn't feel crowded, with plenty of closet and drawer space for belongings. If my overall experience had been better, I would be happy to stay here again. I should note that the pool was closed, "for the season" which was disappointing, because even at that time of the year, it's not that cold during daylight and we would have taken advantage of the pool. Also, I paid for internet service which worked the first 15 minutes I used it, but didn't when I returned to the room later that day, or that evening when I finally had a window of time in which to call tech support. The support guy (from Cox) was great, but wanted to have someone come up to the room to check everything, and with a child who was competing the next day, I had to decline a late night visit. "in 45 minutes or so". The fees were waived, but it was an inconvenience to have to troubleshoot an internet connection that could have been disabled inadvertently by another guest, due to the way the service was set up. There was a person in our group who complained about what she thought was an excessive fee for the room on a weekend night, considering that there was absolutely no view, and was dealt with quite curtly by the agent, who stated that "you should have said something to us right away and we would have changed it" and "that's the rate for that class of room". The manager called over had the same attitude. Bally's, you need to understand customer service. You are not the only game in town. Service makes or breaks a place, and the "take it or leave it" attitude tells me to never intentionally visit again. With so many other choices in town, I will not seek out Bally's again. I discussed the same issue (viewless room) with the agent, and got the same attitude from the management. I don't complain often. In fact, I'm probably too easy to please, but that is the wrong tactic to take with guests. Sorry, Bally's, after waiting almost an hour just to check in, what makes you think that a reasonable person would want to request ANYTHING from the front desk staff? People don't travel to deal with inconveniences. A good travel experience is that the experience is seamless, and not a hassle. A great travel experience is that you feel welcomed and appreciated on top of that. Bally's totally dropped the ball. I will not actively avoid this hotel, but given the number of other options, I will look elsewhere the next time I visit Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Within Budget, first time to this hotel and was comfortable"”
Reviews.Author: bashaj22
Reviews.Content: So i booked this hotel + flight as a package for cheap amount the 3 star hotel. Overall the vacation was great in terms of room service, amenities, room space , dinning. But i could have spent $200 more to book the 5star hotel to keep all the requirement in one place. The tequila one restaurant inside Bally resort offered a tasteful Mexican food. The quantity was huge and the quality was amazing. I would recommend to eat here if you stay in Ballys

Reviews.Title: “Beware!”
Reviews.Author: kygirl6
Reviews.Content: Not really a trip report, just some information I would like to pass along. Just returned last night from a four day trip. DO NO put in a companions reward number, if that person is not going to be there. That happened to me, and they insisted that the other party show up at the reservation desk, or I would be charged full price. My companion is 84 years old, got sick the night before, and didn't make it. They told me at Bally's that they just started this a few weeks ago. Other than the check-in problems, I had a nice stay at Bally's.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for!!!!”
Reviews.Author: molly_bees
Reviews.Content: I would rate this as a 3 star. No better than going to Cuba! Wallpaper peeling off the bathroom wall, toilet running. You have to pay for your safe. A charge to make local calls. Don't eat at the Paris buffet. I found cross contamination with food handelling. The line cook was picking up raw poultry with his bare hands and then touching prongs and wiping his hands dry on a dish towel. I wrote a complaint and I did not even hear a reply from them. Poor customer service. As far as seeing Jubilee, it is not advertised that the show girls are partially nude. There is no refund either. Ask before you purchase a ticket if there is nudity. Not everyone is comfortable with that type of show. The rest of Vegas I enjoyed and would go back again but not at that hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed with Bally's”
Reviews.Author: CarolynJean
Reviews.Content: We go to Vegas each year, but never stayed at Bally's before. We decided to there this time because of the good reviews. Our experience, however, was not good. The room was old, furniture about ready to fall apart, rug spotted, beds hard, pillows awful, and the shower was unsatisfactory. We had a great view, but the inside of the window was filthy. We won't be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Worst than Motel 6”
Reviews.Author: LindseyBelyea
Reviews.Content: Like an old tired hooker, this place has seen much better days. For one, who charges $25 for 24 hrs of wireless internet service that isn't even wireless. Get with the times and give complimentary internet service. They could pay their entire internet service bill for one month with one person's purchase. You would think by making so much money raping you with internet fees that they could put some of the 3,000% profit back into refurbishing their property. The hotel was horrendous. Do not expect to take a shower unless you don't want to wash off any soap because there is no water pressure. Also, be careful about moving around the shower head as it will pop off and hit you in the face. Sounds delightful right? By the third shower, my hand - eye coordination had improved tremendously from all the practice. I also may take up boxing since my defensive moves have improved from dodging the showerhead. You would think the jacuzzi tub would be a nice substitute for a shower that attacks you, however, it was possessed. Not only was it chipped in places, but it also turned on and off at will. At least that was comical. What was not comical was the air unit that did not work, the dirty hallways unvacuumed and littered with trash and broken glass, the upgraded room that had a television from 1990, the exit sign right outside our room that buzzed ridiculously loud, the carpet that had been oh so lovingly laid by carpet layers who obviously do not know that you are suppose to match the seams on patterned carpet, dirty bathrooms in the casino, and terrible dining. If chicken strips are the best thing on your menu, something is considerably wrong. The balcony had a nice view, however, after staying for a couple of days I understood why there was no access as I wanted to throw myself off the said balcony. I don't need to really elaborate anymore, but I would never stay at the hotel again and recommend that everyone else spend your money on a place that is equivalent to a Motel 6 or Roadway Inn. Oh, I guess you can't gamble at Motel 6, but at least you can take a shower.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: ColoradoElkheart
Reviews.Content: Love the location, great place to stay We upgraded to a spa suite, well worth the money. For us this was a perfect value.

Reviews.Title: “Not my first choice in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Antkneee
Reviews.Content: I first stayed here 20 years ago and I thought the room was incredible...that was 20 years ago. When I checked in here the woman at the front desk encouraged me to pay 20 bucks to upgrade my room to the newly remodeled tower. I was not going to do it but she then said, "Everyone in your group did the upgrade and you want to be near them!" Nothing like a little peer pressure at the front desk. So I took the upgrade. I could not believe that my room had been recently remodeled...it still seemed old. I probably got suckered into the upgrade so the hotel could make more money. The room is very big...there was also a powder room and a large bathroom. I could have probably lived in the bathroom, if I wanted too. I really did not need the powder room but if my wife was with me she would have definitely enjoyed this. My iron was complete broken...it looked like someone cracked the metal and the water was leaking out of it. I called down to housekeeping and received a brand new iron...that made me feel special. Also someone Australian Guy left his money, air travel documents and passport in my safe. The hotel had to send up two security guards to remove the items...it felt like one of those movies where I get whacked because I knew too much...I called my co-worker when they arrived and told them if they lost contact with me to run for there life and call the police. There are so many hotels in Vegas...I would only stay here in the future if I had to stay with my group or if the rooms were free.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, Good value”
Reviews.Author: ggmon76
Reviews.Content: Excellent location on the strip with walk through to Paris and walkway to Bellagio. Rooms are dated and shabby but the bed was clean and comfortable. We were in the South Tower and i cant see how the North tower can be much better so wouldnt waste money on the upgrade. Its not the nicest hotel in the world but for the price they charge its well worth the money and the casino has some of the lowest priced drinks we could find. Rooms suffer slightly from the noise of the Bellagio fountains and music but then again it is Vegas so should be expected. Stayed at Harrahs last year for around the same money and would recommend it over Ballys for centre strip cheap hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value. I would go back!”
Reviews.Author: AuntieJo7
Reviews.Content: Our four night stay at Bally's was great. The room was very clean and made up early in the day so if we returned for an afternoon nap all was quiet. The room was also quite spacious, which is a bonus if you plan to spend a lot of time in your room.
