We spent most of our time exploring and seeing the Las Vegas sights and were therefore not really concerned about the room decor. The location of the hotel is fantastic. Being in the middle of the strip gave us the opportunity to take a break in our room and drop off our purchases as we made our way from one end to the other. The convenient walkway connecting Bally's to Paris was a nice way to come back in from the south end of the strip as well. The casino seemed quite busy at any time - we did not play any table games but did stroll by and it seemed that all of the tables were busy by comparison to many of the other casinos we explored. The atmosphere was fun. The pool was closed for the season, but we had access to the pool at Paris if we chose. We had breakfast at the cafe and also checked out the food court downstairs one late night. My overall impression was good and I would stay at Bally's again.

Reviews.Title: “terrible place to stay”
Reviews.Author: dakotaohio
Reviews.Content: We have been going to Vegas for many years , stayed at many of the hotels- thought we would try Ballys this time. I will never stay there again! Our reservations were from Feb 9th-15th, was told we had to leave the 14th, reservation was wrong. Called Flamingo and they got us in the 14th. Front desk made no apologies and were very rude. When you make your reservations for the Harrahs owned resorts you are talking to a call center which could be overseas. The rooms at Ballys are terrible- very dirty and outdated- also there are hardly any restaurants worth eating in. Ballys also charges $3 per day for a room safe, which is not told to you until you use it.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT STAY AT BALLYS”
Reviews.Author: grahamh34
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at Ballys from 10th to 15th Feb 2011 and had a fantastic time. We upgraded to a deluxe room in the north tower and had a fabulous view straight across to Bellagio, Rio and the Palms hotels. The room was very spacious and the bathroom was beautifully clean, the shower had great water pressure. The bed had white sheets which were pristine (something I always check) and were really comfortable. We could also see the sun rising over the mountains every morning as we had early tea before starting the days sightseeing. The Breakfast buffet at Ballys was very good and we also had the lunch time menu in the same restaurant which was great value for m oney. We tried the Tequila Bar and the Steakhouse and honestly couldnt find fault. There was just one hiccup in our trip, on the Sunday we came back up from breakfast to find our bathroom awash with black sewage pouring from the sink, maintenance was very quick he arrived within 5 minutes of one of the housekeepers ringing down. As the problem was sewage and very unhealthy and it was being walked in and out of the bathroom over the carpet we decided it would be best to change rooms, I spoke to the manager Jose who was very nice and immediately arranged for us to change rooms with free upgrade for the last 2 days of our stay for our inconvenience. We spent a lot of time in Paris, they have a lovely selection of restaurants and shops. We also spent a day at the Las Vegas shopping outlet , bought lots of bargains especially Levi's and wrangler jeans which were at incredible prices. We had a great stay and wouldnt hesitate to recommend the hotel to other family and friends. Just a word of warning, I have been to Las Vegas before so picked up straight away on the taxi drivers trick which was every time we got in a taxi they said they had to take a back route as the traffic was bad which effectively put between 7 - 10 dollars on the trip as sometimes they were going around in a circle. I caught on pretty quickly and told them we would take our chances in the traffic going up and down the strip and guess what, we flew through the supposed traffic without any holdups and saved a lot of money. So beware.

Reviews.Title: “ballys”
Reviews.Author: comfort55
Reviews.Content: Nice place to stay with the upgrade. Location great and suite was clean and the bed comfortable. Would return no problems!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Bally's”
Reviews.Author: Angie030878
Reviews.Content: Our family came to town for a wedding and I was in charge of hotel arrangements. Everyone was very pleased with Bally's. We stayed in the updated rooms. The location was great and the rooms were clean. We would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “shabby”
Reviews.Author: treker10
Reviews.Content: checked in at ballys Sunday Feb 7. 2011 . know now why room was discounted it looked like it was out of the eighties. have not updated furniture or bedspread. thick dust on headboard and edges of carpet will not stay there again. drinking glasses had lipstick on them.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: rje2
Reviews.Content: Overall Bally's is a nice hotel, with a great location. Square-footage wise, the standard rooms are larger than most I have seen in Las Vegas. The rooms are a bit dated, but I found mine to be very clean. For instance there was a tube TV, and a lack of outlets (a bit of a challenge to charge 3 cell phones, plus have the laptop plugged in). However for the price, it is hard to go wrong. I also found the hotel and casino staff to all be very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff, but needs refurbishing”
Reviews.Author: indytraveler1
Reviews.Content: Stayed Super Bowl weekend , paid $ 87, $117, $ 70 for Fri, Sat., Sun. When I checked in was told I could upgrade for $ 20/night to the North Tower, or for $150 a night a suite- I chose the tower. Am a frequent Harrahs property guest and love the location of Ballys, however money needs to be spent on refurbishing this hotel. The upgraded room was nothing more than a Holiday Inn Express room, old picture tube tv, outdated furniture, bathroom with no working fan, and shower heed that gave minimal spray. Was told at front desk upon checkout that some showers are set to low pressure for water conservation. Everyone at the hotel was friendly, but the casino needs updated, and they are in need of some new restaurants. The main thing Ballys has going for it is the location, directly across from Bellagio, and connected to Paris. I realize Ballys doesnt advertise themselves as a 5 star resort, but for close to the same money there are many other choices available.

Reviews.Title: “One of my favorite places to stay”
Reviews.Author: Jetsettergal_11
Reviews.Content: Bally's is in a great location. It is smack in the center of the strip and directly across from The Bellagio. It is not a 5 star hotel, but the rooms are clean, modern and cozy. The casino is small, but if you enjoy a low limit table like I do, you can find plenty of them here. The dealers are super friendly and make losing your money entertaining. The pool is average, but the waitresses come around a lot. If you are looking for a fun pool scene, do not stay here. The North Tower has renovated rooms, so I recommend staying there. Unfortunately, there are not a lot of restaurants to choose from, so you will definitely be going somewhere else to eat. It is also connected to The Paris Hotel and allows you to move from one hotel to another without walking outside.

Reviews.Title: “Better to upgrade”
Reviews.Author: TravelingCouple25
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a decent place to stay, located in the center of the Las Vegas strip, Ballys would be a good place. We booked a CLASSIC room and when we checked in, we were asked if we wanted to upgrade to a different room and tower. We declined the offer. We went to the room, went inside and everything was old and very worn. It even smelled worn. I called the from desk who offered us to upgrade to a better room and different tower for an additional $20.00 per night. We were told to come down to the VIP check-in. I exlained my situation and was told that the original room assigned and everything in that tower was not upgraded in a very long time (actually we were told that they coulnt remember when it was last renovated) and the tower we would be going into with the upgraded room was renovated 5 years ago.The front desk staff were very professsionally and we were given the upgraded room in a different tower immediately. DO NOT TAKE THE CLASSIC ROOM. We ate in a Mexican restaurant on the first floor who's prices and specials were very reasonable. Gambling at Ballys was OK but the Paris hotel which was connected to Bally's seemed to pay out better (maybe just luck). All in all Ballys worked out fine for us. When going to Vegas go to the tickets 4 Tonight Booth where you can get some really good eals on shows and restaurants for the same day or sometimes the next. Definately hit the RIO buffet which you can get to via a free shuttle outside the side entrance to Bally's. (got a half price voucher from Tickets 4 Tonight.

Reviews.Title: “One of the very best for location and value”
Reviews.Author: NLCPleasanton_CA
Reviews.Content: We visit Las Vegas twice a year and have stayed at different hotels throughout the years ( Paris, Planet Hollywood, Bills, Caesars, TI, Bellagio, Palazzo, MGM,) but always like Ballys. It's located right in the middle of the strip, close to many great restaurants, shopping, and you don't have to walk half a mile from your room to get onto the strip. Yes, the rooms are dated and can benefit from a face-lift, but the benefits outweigh the room decor. The ceiling in the casino are high so it doesn't get too smoking, which is great if you are a non-smoker. Bally's staff are nice, friendly and want to provide quality customer service. Heading back in May.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, spacious room”
Reviews.Author: Vallyn30
Reviews.Content: Had a north tower room 25th floor. King size bed. Very clean and big!! Staff was friendly checking in. I lost my key the second day, and the front desk lady smiled and said it was no problem, it happens all the time! Booked the Jubilee! Show with the 2 for 1 coupon i had with a girlfriend that met me in Vegas. No problems there, she split the cost of the one ticket for us so we didnt need to do the math :) Easy to navigate around hotel/casino. Wonderful location!! Perfect fit for the trip i took.

Reviews.Title: “Bally's North Tower Suite/Casino/Room Service”
Reviews.Author: ethelmorris
Reviews.Content: We booked Bally's for the price and location. We've stayed in many of the top hotel/casinos in Las Vegas and must stay that Bally's has been our favorite so far. The North Tower suite we stayed in 2533 was huge with a large jacuzzi, his/hers vanities, a large comfy king sized bed, love seat, side chair with ottoman and large tube tv. Room service was fast and very reasonably priced. We especially liked that we could order a "movie night" popcorn, candy and soft drink combo for $15 to a steak and shrimp dinner for same to the $2 tacos. The variety was great. The rooms may be a little dated but the amenities and view from this room far outweighed that by far. The casino was large enough and offered everything we desired for gambling. All of the dealers were extremely friendly and helpful. This goes for the front desk clerks, the Total Rewards counter, the Box Office and the floor housekeeping staff. We did see long check in lines several times during our stay but we were able to walk right up and check in quickly at 5:30 pm on Thursday with no wait. Check out was easy and quick for us as well although I do believe the desk is under staffed most of the time. The variety of eateries within Bally's itself was great from the Tequila Bar with $2 margaritas and tacos to the Steakhouse which is pricey but excellent to the sidewalk cafes. Even at that the walkway from Bally's to Paris and the Avenue shops and eateries offer anything you want in closse proximity. You absolutely cannot beat the location, none better on the Vegas strip. We cannot recommend Bally's North Tower enough. However, in speaking with guests staying in the South Tower, the rooms are dated and in poor condition. Based on that, please consider the nominal upgrade to at least a Deluxe Room in the North Tower.

Reviews.Title: “First time in Vegas...Loved this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: lookingforwardtoGSRM
Reviews.Content: this was our first time in Las Vegas and had no idea what to expect..after reading some previous reviews we were a little nervous about the hotel; but let me tell you don't beleive what you read, we arrrived about 9:00pm on Monday night and were in line to check in no more than 3 minutes, greeted very friendly by Nilo told the him it was our first time in Vegas and we really wanted to be as far away from smoking as possible. He without us asking upgraded us to a suite in the newer renovated North Tower at no additional cost and told us to enjoy our stay. The lobby was clean and smoke free unless you were in the gaming area. We had the breakfast buffet at the hotel and it was very good. The room was very large with everything you could possibly need. Great location accessible to everything right in the middle of the strip. Would definetly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Joy1234_1
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Bally's from January 15th - January 18th. We had a fantastic stay. We stayed in the new tower of the hotel and it was very nice. The room was very large and the beds were extremely comfortable. Every staff person we encountered was very helpful and professional. Our house keeping woman was wonderful, did a great job, and had such a friendly personality. We ate at the Mexican place at the hotel (can't beat the $2 tacos) and enjoyed our meal there. The location is wonderful as you are right in the center of the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms Purposefully in Need Of Updates to Ensure Time Spent in Casino”
Reviews.Author: DineWithDani
Reviews.Content: The staff and guests are friendly, but if you are under 40- this is not the hotel/casino for you. Being under 30 I'd like more of a party scene, but Bally's is exactly what they advertise- classic vegas: gambling and shows. Fine dining and shopping are not an option at Bally's. But being the middle of the strip- you have everything nearby. As is par for Vegas, the cigarette smoke is stifling. So avoid here if you have allergies. Even the non-smoking room was slightly smoky. The rooms are dated, dark and slightly damp. But I think they keep them that way to make sure you hang out in the casino. So if you don't plan to spend time in the room i suggest you get the cheap room, bring some lysol, buy some crocs (lots of walking) or hop in cab to go wherever you like.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing hotel and casino, even when comped!”
Reviews.Author: steeelblu
Reviews.Content: As a frequent gambler I have stayed at Bally's many times in past 10 years, usually with complementary rooms but have recently been more and more disappointed since parent company was bought out by private equity partners. Guest rooms show signs of years of deferred maintenance: worn linens and drapes, broken bathroom tiles with discolored grout; very dated furnishing. Even the gaming options have gone downhill as evidenced by 6:5 Blackjack payouts. Despite great location, I'll be looking elsewhere for next Vegas visit.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but you can do much better”
Reviews.Author: Ozzie_Dan64
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Bally's for a business trip. I found the staff to be reasonable but not going out of their way for you. The room was ok, but the view was out over a sand covered roof. It was pain to travel the distance across and through the slot machines to get from the check-in to the elevators. Having to walk through all the deadbeats slumped over slot machines was not fun. I didn't both going to the Restaurant, I didn't know if they even had one.

Reviews.Title: “if you need toilet paper, good luck!”
Reviews.Author: globetrotter13177
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at hotels all over the world, including hotels in so called third world countries, and I have never had to ask for toilet paper. The bathroom had a partial roll of toilet paper and 4 single sheets of tissues. All hotels I have stayed at usually have a few extra rolls of toilet paper and at least one full box of tissues, but not this place. It is 6 a.m. and I had to call housekeeping to get an additional roll. The housekeeping person informed me, in a rude tone, that she could send ONE roll. Apparently Bally's cannot afford to put more than one roll of toilet paper in each room.

Reviews.Title: “Bally's - A Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: Griz57
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Bally’s in late May of 2009 for a graduation trip of fun and partying. While Bally’s is not a flashy hotel by any means, the value is probably the best on the strip. I will explain. The best thing about Bally’s are the large, spacious rooms. I have stayed at other budget Vegas hotels (Tropicana, Flamingo, Excalibur, Caesar’s) and Bally’s has by far the largest rooms. They also have some of the best views. Right out our window we got a great view of the Paris pool, the Eifel Tower, and the Bellagio fountains. The bathrooms are average but our’s was clean and well lit. You get a nice closet as well. Improvements could be a better TV and a refrigerator in the room. The hotel is not confusing at all. Very straightforward and check in lines are not too long. The location is both good and bad. It is good in that the hotel is right in the middle of the strip. However, it is kind of a disadvantage on where the hotel actually sits. You have to walk a ways to get to the hotel as it is pushed way back relative to the actual Strip sidewalk. The pool is very basic. However, it was never crazy busy. Chairs were always open and it was very relaxing. The house show, Jubilee, is very outdated and pretty corny. Pay the extra $50 and go to a cirque show/other decent show in Vegas. The Mexican restaurant (forgetting the name) in Bally’s is money! Try it and of course get the nachos. If you are on a budget, don’t want any gimmicks/themes, want a large room, and want a good location, give Bally’s a shot!

Reviews.Title: “Caution Run down and Poor Serivce”
Reviews.Author: liz48
Reviews.Content: Greetings Everyone: We stayed 4 nights @ Bally's over the Christmas Holiday, Dec/10. 1st time to Las Vegas. We won't stay here again or recommend anyone else does!! Paid extra $28 US dollars for an upgraded room per night, North Tower. First room had dirty carpet through out and curtian falling off the window. Requested another. At first they wouldn't believe me. They sent up a housekeeping supervisor. She realized I told the thruth. 2nd room no better. Dirty stained carpets through out. Furnisher was majorly old and finish peeling off. Sink backed up. Dirty window view. Along with terrible bed. No comfort @ all. We didn't mind paying for an upgrade but this is unacceptable. Waited in line again for 10 mins to speak to the front desk clerks. I was told can't do anything only take another room. I said no this is the second room. So we just stuck it out and were very unhappy but made the best of Las Vegas. Please think twice about staying here. The whole casino area is run down.

Reviews.Title: “very good stay”
Reviews.Author: thegoodtraveller78
Reviews.Content: stayed for 4 nights, they upgraded us (sandwich trick) to a jr suite in the north tower, large room, very clean , good staff, very nice, and location is great , would definately stay again, no reason not to

Reviews.Title: “Great location and price!”
Reviews.Author: sunmoon1969
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights in the south tower room 6539. Beautiful view of the strip including the Eiffel tower at Paris, The Cosmopolitan and Bellagio. Able to watch the Bellagio fountain show from our room. Room was clean but dated. Housekeeping was very good. Able to stay for additional night at no cost due thanks to front desk! Would definately stay at Bally's again.

Reviews.Title: “Great bang for your buck”
Reviews.Author: cp111
Reviews.Content: Bally's is cheaper than other hotels we've stayed at on the strip and basically just as nice. I saved over $100 / day and couldn't complain. Our room even had a mini fridge, and not the worthless one filled with $10 bottles of beer -- an actual fridge! We went across the street to the liquor store and bought some beer and orange juice. Room service breakfast was pretty good, we shared the all-american breakfast. It was big enough for the both of us and about the same price as we would have paid downstairs anyway. The location is great, center strip. We could even see the Bellagio fountains from outside our window. The casino limits are low-mid stakes. If you need lower stakes Bill's is just across the street, and if you need higher stakes Paris is next door through a shop-lined walkway and the Bellagio is across the strip. Can't go wrong with $2 tacos at the Mexican restaurant and the poker room was great. It's midsized, spreading $1/2 NL and $3/6 Limit. The Bellagio is across the street and Venetian isn't that far if you need bigger rooms with higher limits.

Reviews.Title: “would stay here again in a heart beat.”
Reviews.Author: Sherryhall46
Reviews.Content: The service we had was amazing. The hotel room was huge and very clean. The location was awesome. I really can't think of anything i didn't like about my stay here. I can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Best Experience at Bally's!”
Reviews.Author: Vegasjunky123
Reviews.Content: I can't praise enough how much I loved staying at Bally's! The best thing was that we had an early flight into Las Vegas and we were concerned that we weren't going to be able to check in until much later in the day. We arrived at the hotel for 9am and to our delight our room was ready for us to check in! It just started off our entire trip on a fantastic note! The rooms were very clean and large. I am going back again in February and staying at Bally's again!

Reviews.Title: “Gamble at night if your room is near the elevator”
Reviews.Author: brownbeer
Reviews.Content: I arrived in Vegas late so didn't complain about the room next to the elevators (6704 of the south tower). I should have complained. Instead, I endured a night of rumbling elevators; so much so that it was impossible to sleep. In fact, it was quieter riding the elevator than staying in a room next to them. In fairness to the hotel, I asked to change rooms and they did without a fuss. I can only assume that it happens all the time. They moved me to 6723. It had a superior view of the strip, was very quiet and comfortable. 6704 did have a small fridge and wet bar which 6723 did not, but the noise in 6704 is simply unbearable. If you stay here, and are given a room in the south tower ending in 04, don't bother trying to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Ballys is a winner”
Reviews.Author: opussteve99
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here several times, and the property delivers consistent value. I was upgraded upon arrival, with out asking, to a great room. The price of the room was outstanding. Food was good (connection to Paris helps). Location was perfect. I will stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Best bang for your buck”
Reviews.Author: Fanman47
Reviews.Content: Went to with my Fiance to celebrate her birthday. We booked a standard room, and after some confusion at the check in desk, we were upgraded to a suite with jacuzzi. We had a minor problem with no cold water in the jacuzzi that was fixed the same day we reported it. Room was big, clean and luxurious. The hotel does seem a little tired, but its in a great location and the price was right. We spent most of our time gambling in other casinos but we did use Ballys casino a couple times and had decent luck. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “vacation”
Reviews.Author: wixie20
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Bally's for our vacation. They talked us into upgrading our room. The room they gave us we could not get into because they did not activate the keys so we had to wait 15 minutes for security to let us in.. It was supposed o be a smoking room and it was not, we went back down and got a different room and we couldnt get in that room, the room they gave us had no shampoo or creme rinse and only 1 towel so had to wait for more. The shower only worked half way and what did work about blew your skin off it actually hurt . Bally's was the worse expereince ever.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, big room, right location”
Reviews.Author: JCM10_11
Reviews.Content: Check-in takes a while with the long lines and limited staff. Didn't notice these types of lines in other casino's. However, once being served the staff was very quick and friendly. Stayed in the newly renovated side and the room was large and comfortable. Could use the Paris pool since Bally's pool was closed for the season - and the Paris pool was great. The casino floor is average - not the nicest (by far) but not the worst on the strip (by far). The location of the hotel is great. Parking, although free, was a walk from the rooms. We ate elsewhere and attended shows elsewhere as well as we had certain things in mind that we wanted to see and do, but that didn't influence our stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Bally's Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Echoman
Reviews.Content: Had a great trip to Bally's. The check in personnel were prompt and courteous and our room was clean and spacious. The hotel staff encountered were friendly and polite. The room rate for the three nights was very reasonable. Would definitely stay here again. Also, the all day buffet card is well worth the 40.00 (Total rewards members, 45.00 nonmembers.). Now if I could only get the tables to be as cooperative. TF

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: slsmith007
Reviews.Content: we recently stayed for for a three night special rate and I was pleasantly surprised at the quality of the hotel. The rooms were big and everything was clean and first class. Loved the fact they are connected to the Paris and smack dab in the middle of the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “not as bad.....”
Reviews.Author: joy704
Reviews.Content: the location of this place was really good. It was pretty much in the middle of the strip.. i ended up staying there for 8 nights in the deluxe room on the north tower.. so i don't really know how the south tower rooms look. the room and bathroom were very spacious..the bed wasnt so bad but for some reason those pillows weren't so comfortable...but i would return to this hotel.. if your looking for a highclass hotel then this place isn't for you.. but if you want a decent room for a good price in a good location then try it.. and i don't know about the taxi from the airport to the hotel but i used the shuttle and i spent 7 dollars per person which i thought wasn't bad at all...

Reviews.Title: “lots of hidden costs”
Reviews.Author: Horizon080
Reviews.Content: location is good , just where the famous strip starts. house keeping is bad. they dont clean room perfectly rooms are big and not bad but they want to make money everywhere. internet/wifi is free in motels also but they wann 15 usd for 24 hours they even charge for locker in room. be cautious before usuing anything

Reviews.Title: “Good Value in an ideal location”
Reviews.Author: Towny72
Reviews.Content: Went for an after Christmas break and found Ballys a ideal location, as your in Vegas how much time will you be spending in your room anyway? We checked in an was offered a deluxe room for an extra $20 per night which we were glad we did as the room had a partial view of the strip and flamingo road. The hotel has a station for the monorail for getting around on that side of the strip and is also convenient for the duece bus when wanting to go downtown or to the outlet mall at the south of the strip. Plenty of food places in there and in the connecting Paris hotel and you can't go wrong with the $7 pitcher of miller lite. Would definitely stay there again if the price was right as the staff were also friendly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Super friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Drama_Diva
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at Bally's - December 27, 2010 for one night and again January 4th for three nights. We were given the North Tower both times and my rooms were comped. The room was very clean, a good size and quiet. I thought the bed was very comfortable but those pillows! I will definitely bring my own from home next time, as I had a hard time sleeping on those small pillows. The tub was slow to drain from the shower, but we had plenty of fresh towels and our room was always cleaned by 11am each morning. You cannot beat Bally's location on the Strip in my opinion and that to me, makes up for the less elegant and posh surroundings, as does the friendly service. The casino was very quiet for our entire stay. I expected for it to get busy on the Thursday night as the CES was starting but the casino remained fairly quiet. I must say that all of the staff members we came across were super friendly and helpful, this includes everyone from the shop gal to the bartender to the dealers. The friendliness and location of this casino combined with the price (free) is a winning combination in my book. While Bally`s does not compare to the Venetian (the other hotel I frequent) it sure does serve up a great recipe for the price. We spent a lot of time in the tequila bar enjoying $2 mexican beers and $2 tacos. Note to Bally`s management - please change your promotional material throughout your hotel and website as you are still advertising $1 tacos. I recommend everyone give this cheap place a try. Well worth it for the price. They also have $2 margaritas. I spent a lot of time at the tables and although Blackjack used to be my game, Crazy 4 Poker has taken its place. I simply could not lose this time around at this game. Thank you Bally`s! Finally a winning trip. Back in February and staying at the Wynn, due to a great deal, but I will be back to Bally's again, guaranteed.

Reviews.Title: “Bally's at Chrstmas Time.”
Reviews.Author: Viajar_de_Alberta
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I spent Dec 24th to 28th 2010 at this hotel. A hotel like this gets so many reviews so I will just give you my overall impression and a few short bits of information in quick point form.. Taxi from the airport, speak up and tell the driver to not use the tunnel because it costs approx. double to Bally's instead of the shorter route. The line up to check in is long and slow. ( 1.5 hours ) The management doesn't put on enough staff to accommodate the flow of people. Be kind to them it isn't their fault their managers don't staff appropriately. We stayed in a Grand Suite 2 nights and then in a standard room for 2 nights. Both in the North tower Reason we didn’t have just one room is because we arrived later in the day upon check in and they didn’t have enough standard rooms left for us so they bumped us up. Of course they didn’t tell us this at first, we were just told that we were such nice people that we were being bumped up for 2 days. Later when we had to go down and be moved to a different room we were told the truth. The Grand Suite was neat to see and stay in for a few nights in all its 1985 glory but we liked the standard room better because it was newer and more comfortable. All in all Bally’s is worth the money spent being that it is cheaper than most of the other hotels on the strip and you are in the middle of all the action. I probably won’t stay here again but I would still recommend it to those on a budget. Buffet at the adjoining Paris Hotel was too long and expensive so we ended up eating at Denny’s, Subway, and a few other out of the way places. Go downstairs in Bally’s for better restaurants and shops. We found these on our last day which was too bad for us. Also the pool is closed at this time of year. We had the most fun downtown at the Fremont Street Experience and Fitzgerald’s Casino. On our Trip we found anywhere from $1 to $9 bottled beer so always ask about drink specials as they are usually at the smaller casinos. That’s about it for my quick little review.

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: ChrisP78
Reviews.Content: Had to stay here 1 night when my flight was cancelled. Price of $45 was excellent. Room was big, but needed new carpets and all the lamps were broken in some way. It was adequate and is an excellent location near the much nicer hotels on the strip. If you don't have a lot of money to spend this is a decent choice. If you were paying over $100 for this I would be unhappy.

Reviews.Title: “Fits My Needs”
Reviews.Author: lytsout1
Reviews.Content: I pretty much do not care about what type of room I stay in while in Vegas. I mainly care about the location. Ballys fits my needs perfectly. After having visited Vegas about 15 times in the past 8 years, this hotel ranks as one of my favorites. I'm a sports gambler and they do have a very nice sports book, although I do not spend a whole lot of time there (due to other sports books having free drinks). The rooms are basic, but perfect. I spend very little time in my room. I want to get out and walk and this location gives a great starting point. It's in the basically in the middle of the busy section of the Strip, so when it's time to stumble home, you're never too far away. Also, I'm a member of the Harrah's Players Club and Bally's is generally a free stay for me.

Reviews.Title: “DON'T DO IT!!”
Reviews.Author: cgan22
Reviews.Content: If you value clean linens, carpet and bathrooms do not stay here. One of the worst hotels I've ever stayed at. Staff was awful, rooms were awful and disgusting. In addition to the hairy linens, the carpet was filthy, the lamp shades had blood stains and to my horror I discovered a foreign substance on the spicket of the faucet (see attached images). Unfortunately, I discovered the substance on the spicket on the day I was checking out. So I had brushing my teeth and drikning water from this infested faucet for 3 days, hopefully I did not catch a disease. Overall, I just didn't feel like touching anything in the room and felt dirty every second while in the room. I would not recommend this hotel to my worst enemy!!

Reviews.Title: “Relentlessly OK”
Reviews.Author: madmatthew
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Bally's for the 2011 Consumer Electronics Show and got what I expected -- a decent basic room at a decent price. Check-in was quick and easy -- the gal at check-in tried to tell me about upgrades, but I was in a hurry and on a budget so I cut her off, so I can't tell you what the opportunities might be. South Tower Room 5520, classified as a standard room with two queens, was large and very clean. The bathroom was also unusually large for a room in this price range. But the furnishings were old and the table was actually shabby (nicks, notches, burn marks, etc.). Other downscale touches -- the 27-inch CRT TV that was bolted to the table, and the table bolted to the floor, so you couldn't change the angle of the TV, and the half-broken clock radio. But at least the Serta Perfect Sleeper mattresses were nice and firm, and the wake-up call service was reliable. (Some places aren't. I always use the alarm on my cell phone as a backup.) I had one meal room service -- a terrific deal for $15 for a delicious small New York strip steak and four gigantic shrimp, vegetables and mashed potatoes. The casino is small and not particularly elegant by modern Vegas standards. But I found it a hoot that this place hires cocktail waitresses who are, shall we say, north of 30, and let's say, not anorexic. (They still make those ladies wear short skirts, but at least they have the decency to put them in opaque tights.) The odds are the odds wherever you gamble, a "free" beer tastes just as good here as anywhere, and no, that six-foot goddess in the micro-mini at the Venetian is not coming home with you anyway. The best thing about Bally's (besides the price) is the location. It's connected directly to Paris by an interior walkway lined with shops (that also has access to Paris' huge free self-park garage if you don't want to monkey around with valet). It's directly across the street from the magnificent Bellagio and its fountain, and kitty-corner from Caesars and its many attractions. And out back is a stop on the Monorail, the best way to get around Vegas if you're actually there to do business at the convention center. The basement monorail access hallway is also home to the sports book, a bunch of gift shops, the health club, a Nathan's Famous and a terrific Japanese restaurant. That's also where the pool is, but the pool is closed in January. It looked OK from the monorail, not as nice as, say, the Mirage, but then you aren't paying Mirage prices for the room, are you? Check-out was a breeze, fast and easy on a Saturday morning, and the staffer at the counter was happy with my compliments about the property. All told, I'd say Bally's is a fine choice for those doing Vegas on a budget. And the suites look really nice and are as bargain-priced as the standard rooms. The motto of Bally's is "stay classic." Given its prime location, it may be the next major Vegas property to face the wrecking ball. I'll just bet whatever replaces it won't offer $50 rooms!

Reviews.Title: “We played "Guess the Stain" on the carpets”
Reviews.Author: olozbal
Reviews.Content: Picked this hotel solely on price and location. Group of four late 30's guys meeting up for a long weekend in Vegas so not picky on a lot. Got a Junior Suite on the 70'th floor (it said 70 but I assume it was not). Room 7001. Basically it's a dated room with faded furniture and stains in various places. But we were fine with it. If you're looking for a place to crash that's walking distance to the strip then this is fine.

Reviews.Title: “Great option”
Reviews.Author: Javier_AG
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is the location, close to every other hotel. Rooms were clean and they are very large. We found a restaurant at casino level that has tacos, beers and great margaritas at only $1, great for after hours. Price was great and once again, location is excellent. Customer service is also very good, they helped us with everything.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Ft_Garry
Reviews.Content: I try to sample a different hotel every trip to Vegas, and have always thought the Bally's corner was a terrific location. Tied right into Paris, shuttle to the Rio on sight, across the street from the amazing Bellagio fountains... basically in the heart of the action. I love the Mexican restaurant located in the casino, and there's a great restaurant in the hall joining Bally's and Paris. I don't think this hotel has anything that any other hotels doesn't. I didn't find the sportsbook overly comfortable or that well situated. The casino has a decent amount of tables, and slots. Service was okay. It was a long line to check in, and when catching the airport shuttle there was no doorman or anything at the door where it goes.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Value”
Reviews.Author: xinotx
Reviews.Content: We booked a standard room for one night for $30 and were upgraded to a suite. The suite was very large and spacious and had 2 big closets. The bathroom was large and had two different sink/ counter areas. There was a sunken tub in the center of the bathroom. The staff was very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre but great location!”
Reviews.Author: sofia028
Reviews.Content: My girlfriends and I (7 in total) decided to do a road trip from Vegas to LA this summer! Since Bally's was sooo cheap (ended up costing about 70$ for three nights) and the location is prime, we decided to go ahead with it! The hotel itself is big and busy but the encrusted old cigarette smoke has completely taken over every inch of the hotel. With the hot dry air it is a lethal combination (and I'm a smoker) The hotel is old and i guess it shows! Compared to all the other beautiful hotels around such as the Wynn, Encore, Bellagio, Caesars... it is pretty mediocre in my taste! However, it is very cheap so if you're looking to spend the least possible, its quite acceptable. If you have a bigger budget DO NOT GO THERE! you will be disappointed (I was) The price goes with the crowd. The location is absolutely amazing though, its right in the middle of everything so you wont have to abuse the taxis! The pool is pretty big and there's good music!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to park, far to walk to Las Vegas Ave”
Reviews.Author: ToddNugent
Reviews.Content: This is another middle of the road hotel although in our opinion not as nice as Harrah's but much better than the Imperial Palace. The hotel's front only occupies a small part of the Strip, with most of the hotel extending way to the back. Good since you can park right away and go up to your room but the walk is a bit long when you want to explore Las Vegas Blvd. Reminds me of MGM Grand. The rooms are fine, clean, basic, no frills, everything works as expected. We only stay to bathe and sleep then venture out again. Good to stay when they have cheap rates.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for what we wanted”
Reviews.Author: akerryo
Reviews.Content: You could not get anymore central with Bally's in Las Vegas as it is bang in the middle of the Strip opposite The Bellagio and beside Paris. We had a little hiccup with our initial room in the South Tier but a lovely receptionist by the name of Rita upgraded us to the North Tower and we were perfectly happy with this room. Room was cleaned every day and fresh towels left as requested (they have an eco system where will only leave clean ones if requested). We ate in the the Mexican and the Steakhouse in the Hotel and both were excellent - as a steak lover the Steak house was very good. Overall we had a good stay in Bally's and would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “They Treat You Right”
Reviews.Author: Mrs_T_2000
Reviews.Content: This is an older resort but the staff sure knows how to treat you right here. Location is awesome .. right on the strip and walking distance to other larger casinos. Rooms are nice and the casino is clean and well maintained. Lots of variety of clubs, shows, and restaurants. My only complaint is the people who accost you as soon as you leave the check-in desk and try to sell you a timeshare .. felt like I was in Mexico!

Reviews.Title: “Ballys was great!”
Reviews.Author: jocelynbok
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Ballys Las Vegas from 23 - 30 Dec 2010 - overall stay was really good (it was better than i expected) - very happy with ballys - would certainly recommend this hotel and would go back... - my room was in the south facing Paris with fantastic view of the Eiffel Tower, the strip, and the Bellagio dancing fountain - amazing view night and day!! - room was clean, spacious and so was the bathroom - location was very strategic - its in the middle of the strip with easy access to Paris, Bellagio, Ceasars and etc. - bed was good - slept very well each night :) - most day tours do pick up at Ballys

Reviews.Title: “It was what I was expecting from a 3* hotel”
Reviews.Author: SCASTRO
Reviews.Content: I travelled with my husband and 2 friends only for a couple of nights beginning of December. The hotel as 3* is ok, and the specials they have in the mexican bar are great!. The best thing about the hotel is the location, just in the middle of The Strip. Rooms need to be remodel as they have the old tv's, chairs and carpet a little broken, but the rest is fine. If you don't have a lot of money to spend in the hotel but you want something decent, the hotel is perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Change!”
Reviews.Author: MShort33
Reviews.Content: I had booked two rooms with Bally's at their Internet Special Pricing. 1 was for my Wife, and I. The other was for a friend that was traveling with us on our way to California. We were delayed by bad weather from Colorado all the way to Las Vegas. When we arrived I was expecting a hassle, but instead we were both Upgraded to Suites. What a pleasant Surprise!!! Some of the Reveiws that I had read dealt with the Hotels Cleanliness. What I saw was a Staff that was very focused in every aspect of Cleanliness!!! Sure the Hotel looks older, but then again so do We !!!

Reviews.Title: “What a great surprise, Bally's was BETTER than I imagined!”
Reviews.Author: jensmith7
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised at how nice Bally's was. I was expecting that because I paid a small price for my room that it would be old and outdated. I was wrong! First of all, the man who checked me in was very nice and gave me a complimentary upgrade to a deluxe room. This room was HUGE!! It was probably the size of two standard rooms and easily fit the king bed, couch, desk with a ton of extra open space. The window on the 12th floor overlooked the strip and I could even see part of the Bellagio fountains from my room. Parking was free and easy to find in the garage and you can't go wrong with Bally's location, it's right in the middle of the strip. I loved the tequilla bar - be sure to get the $1 chicken tacos and $1 margaritas - any time of day. They were delicious! I will definitely stay at Bally's again. It is a great choice for a small budget.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for your Vegas Vacation!!!!”
Reviews.Author: pmbryant73
Reviews.Content: Our first time in Vegas and Bally's sure will not make it our last. Dec 10-16, 2010. The location is great for the price. When you walk out of the front door you are in the middle of the strip. We were on the 14th floor in the south tower. Huge room and quite at night. The dealers were experienced and helpful at the table games. Everyone from the pit bosses to the waitresses made it fun to win. No problems with checking in or out. We just had to wait until 4pm to get our room so plan accordingly. Thanks to Bally's for making our first Vegas trip a pleasant experience. It has several restaurants down below or choose from Paris which is closely connected to the casino area for more options to choose from. You shouldn't go wrong with Bally's. Phillip/SC/USA

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel.”
Reviews.Author: kickbutt554
Reviews.Content: The check in was very slow. The room was great. Large,clean,coffeemaker,ample towels,bed was comfortable but most of all it was very quiet. We were on the 24th.floor and we never heard any noise at all when we were in our room. The Tequila bar was great for food and drinks. The staff there were wonderful and the portions are huge. Good value there. The location is good but it is set quite far back from the strip and the moving floor did not work part of the time. We had rented a car and it was always brought to the door promptly when needed. We liked it at Ballys but would book a different hotel next time simply because we like to try different ones each time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money for it' excellent location on the strip”
Reviews.Author: AussieTribeMildura
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Bally's for 4 nights during our 5 week trip to the States. We have stayed here before and had no hesitation in selecting to stay here again. It didn't dissapoint, although check-in was a little long. We had to book two rooms for the size of our family but when asked we were given connecting rooms. There was very little change from our last stay. The rooms are a very comfortable size with enough room to easily move around even with a baby crib and are very nicely furnished. The bathrooms again are very roomy and nice and have all the ammenities you would expect. We have always found the rooms and floors to be extremely quiet. The hotel itself is just an everyday casino with no theme to it and there is a decent treck to the strip, but we have 4 kids with two in a double stroller and it still doesn't bother us. We leave once in the morning and return once in the afternoon, but if you were frequently coming and going you may find it a problem. There is no longer an onsite buffet but Paris has one located through the walkway which is OK. I recommend purchasing the 24 hour buffet program where you can utilize any of the Harrahs buffet's and including the buffet in Planet Hollywood. If you time it right, you can have breakfast, lunch and dinner and then breakfast again the next morning. The hotel was a convenient location for us as we could venture out and experience half of the strip a day, without going too far in one direction and then having to go all the way back. All in all, we would absolutely stay here for a third time and I would recommend it to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great, absolutely great location”
Reviews.Author: Vikram1210
Reviews.Content: Bally's is one of the best hotels right on the strip. The hotel in itself is very good, the location adds to its charm. The differentiating factor from other resorts is the resort fee. When almost all the hotels/ resorts charge a minimum amount of resort fee ranging from $8 to $60. This hotel charges nothing. The outlook of the hotel is modern. However, the rooms require a revamp. We reached the hotel around 1200 HRS, the check in line was big. However, within 10 Min we are attended by front office staff. The front office staff were very friendly. We requested for a room with a good view. The attended informed me that the room with the good view will be available at 1500 HRS, however if I wanted a normal room she offered to give it right away. As I was about to stay in the hotel for 4 days, I decided to go with the room with a good view. Oh boy, what a room she gave. The attendant gave me the best room in the hotel I suppose. I was able to see Bellagio water show right from my bed. So for the next four days, I would have seen the water show like 25-30 times. It was the best room with a view I every stayed in. There were plenty of slot machines & table game options. There were plenty of food options right in the hotel and in and around the hotel. Several coupons were given which included discounts on food, entertainment shows, and some free passes for automobile shows. The best part of the hotel is undoubtedly the location. If ever I visit Las Vegas, I will definitely stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the time to bother with here!”
Reviews.Author: trishka17
Reviews.Content: Our stay started out with not getting the rooms we booked, wanted to upgrade us and charge us$ 20.00 per room per night with an additional 12% fee. The front desk people were rude and the manager didnt really care or give a darn. The rooms were old outdated and dirty. you get what you pay for. We will never consider this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Probably the Best Value on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: Smaug
Reviews.Content: Ballys is exceptionally good value. I stayed here in December 2010 and would highly recommend it. Last time I was in Las Vegas I stayed at the Bellagio, and I was wondering whether or not I would be disappointed by Ballys, but I was pleasantly surprised. My room was very large and, even with the huge king size bed, there was probably enough space to throw a disco party. The bed, by the way, was superbly comfortable. As well as the bed there was a luxurious sofa, a coffee table, three chairs and a desk in the corner. The room had two telephone handsets, a big TV with all the usual services (movies, hit TV, guest services etc) and a decent size bathroom with combined bath and shower and a hair dryer. There were plenty of towels (replaced daily) together with soaps, shampoos, body lotions and so on. I must also say that the room was very clean and the decor was nice. The room was a shade of caramel with a nice thick pile brown carpet. It is true that the paint had worn away on the odd small area and there was the odd scratch in the wallpaper, but this was not too bad and was not instantly apparent, I only noticed this on careful inspection. The location of the hotel is top notch. Bally’s is right at the centre of the action and actually joins onto the Paris resort, so that they are effectively the same hotel. The Bellagio and Caesars Palace are just across the strip, to the left is Planet Hollywood and to the right are the slightly smaller hotels and bars which together make the teeming heart of the city. So you really are right in the centre of things with too many restaurants, bars, shops and casino’s to mention literally minutes away from your room. There was no mini bar or extortionately priced snacks to tempt you inside the room (although there was a snack machine in the corridor near the lifts and, near Ballys casino, there is a pâtisserie which was open all hours (as of course were the casino bars)). My room didn’t have a view either, but this did not bother me. (I was asked at check in whether I wanted to upgrade, perhaps if I had done so I would have had a better view). As for check in, well I am afraid it is true that you do have to wait. Or at least I did. There was a double lined queue and only about four check-in desks open. But this was a minor inconvenience only. I loved the Bellagio with its massive glass cage showers, opulent luxury and every little need catered for, but Bally’s compares well in my opinion. If you want what feels like four star luxury in a prime location and can do without things such as bathroom scales, and if you want to feel like you’ve made a relatively sensible choice, then you really can’t do any better than to stay at Ballys.

Reviews.Title: “The location is great but the rooms were not.”
Reviews.Author: danesrule
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Las Vegas and we heard that Bally's is located right where you want to be and the rooms are reasonable. We were not disappointed with the location. Our room had a sign advertising the buffet package on the window, somewhat blocking our view of the strip. There was no refrigerator in the room so if you wanted something to drink you had an incredibly long walk down a dark corridor to the elevator and then into the casino to find a beverage. We bought a cooler for our room and solved that problem. The bank of elevators for the South tower is poorly located at the far end of the casino so if you were walking from the parking garage you had quite a hike. Bally's allows people hawking time shares to hang out in the lobby and pester you about free show tickets. The room itself was dated but ok for our needs. I would only recommend this hotel for its location.

Reviews.Title: “Do not waste your money here”
Reviews.Author: travellingchick22
Reviews.Content: I am writing this review from my stay at Ballys. Never in my life have I received such horrible customer service. If you talk to 5 people, you will receive 5 different answers. Rooms are very dated. The beds are basically wooden boxes with foam on top,no comforters,just sheets.if you ask for a blanket,they give you something that looks&feels like a potato sack. The bathrooms are dirty. The shower is horrible. A complete lack of standard ameneties and toiletries. Managment is very unhelpfull and condescending. My advice, spend $10 more a night and stay at Planet Hollywood or MGM. I visit Vegas about every 3 months&this was by far the worst experience.

Reviews.Title: “Location is the most outstanding feature”
Reviews.Author: ShowMeVegas
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at Bally's several times and have never had a bad experience. It's just that I never had a really great experience either. The property is a safe bet but just not special. Located in the heart of mid-strip, the hotel is central to most everything of interest. It also has a monorail station that is convenient for longer distance trips to the north and south strip areas. The hotel and casino are offset back from the strip so it is half a block walk just to get stripside - really kind of a hassle compared to other strip properties except maybe Caesars, Bellagio or the CityCenter area. Check-in lines can be long. The casino is not as large as some with a lot of under-utilized space but can be quite lively at times with a decent selection of tables and machines. The sportsbook is adequate if you like stadium seating and viewing. There are several dining and lounge options, some of which can be quite entertaining. The connection to the Paris property next door is convenient and useful if you want to upgrade your casino setting or avail yourself of better dining options. Access to the rooms was decent with plenty of elevators. The north tower rooms need renovation in their decor and ammenities. The TV's are old CRT models with limited channels, the bathrooms are small and a bit tattered, the furniture is dated, and the beds could use a mattress upgrade. The toilet in our room ran intermitantly and two days worth of calls to the front desk got us nothing but promises. It was never repaired. We had to shut the door to avoid having our sleep interrupted. However, the rooms were clean, quiet and comparatively large. Our view was non-existent but the hotel was rather full due to a convention and we were subject to the luck of the draw. Really, it was no big deal to us. It was not pool weather so I cannot comment on those facilities or those for exercise/spa. If location, price and access are important, then Bally's is a safe, reliable choice. If you are seeking something more upscale, then you may be disappointed. Taste is relative but there are many nicer properties in the immediate vicinity to conveniently play while taking advantage of Bally's price and location to stay. In all, a comparatively average property.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, large, comfy room in one of the Strip's blander, uglier hotels”
Reviews.Author: mezaco
Reviews.Content: Perfectly happy with my recent stay at Bally's. Asked for and received a renovated North Tower room, it was really large, very clean with a king bed, great view of the strip northwards. No complaints with the room at all. The hotel is one of the strip's blander and uglier hotels, no theme unless you count Ugly 1970's Design as a theme. Long, tedious line up to check-in. Despite the long-line, there was only 2 agents working check-in which made it a bit annoying. That would be my main complaint. Yes, it was after 10:00pm, but the lineup was long so they should always have the staff to back it up. The casino was smoky and unappealing. However, there is a convenient indoor mall/walkway connecting to Paris Las Vegas next door that had some nice little restaurants. And the location of Bally's is pretty perfect, right on the central strip.

Reviews.Title: “Dated and Noisy...”
Reviews.Author: Kasino-Kat
Reviews.Content: I would not want to stay here again, especially not in the south tower. Room was very shabby and dated. Horrible creaking noises the first night due to heavy winds (sounded like rats?), and loud, drunk people in the halls at all hours of the night. Well, the rooms were comped with Total Rewards, and included Barry Manilow tix, so I can't complain too much.

Reviews.Title: “Stay elsewhere if you want an updated clean room.”
Reviews.Author: Oma66
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the South tower. Rooms are large, but very outdated. Rugs in hallway are very old and "wrinkled" in places. A used condom found on the bathroom floor, made me realize that cleanliness is not up to par. Stay elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful time at Bally's”
Reviews.Author: imso808
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at Bally's. It's an excellent value for the being on the Strip. Location, location, location! The rooms were huge and clean. We stayed in the South Tower and the room was outdated but fine. We hardly stayed in the room anyway. The view from our room (7337) was AMAZING!!!!! The Eiffel Tower was right outside our window and we could see the Bellagio fountains do their dance very clearly. This is not a luxury, fancy property but certainly not a run down dump. I would most gladly stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting”
Reviews.Author: kzavala11
Reviews.Content: One of the nastiest hotels I've ever slept in. Room was filthy and smelled like mildew, and the bathroom was so nasty that the grout was black in some places. I slept in my clothes all weekend and didn't want to take off my socks because the carpet was so nasty. I was just happy I didn't get lice from sleeping in the beds. A friend of ours got staph infection the last day we were there. The Casino in the hotel was nice and had a lot going on, that's why I picked the hotel, plus I liked the location. I was very disappointed in the rooms and I would advise everyone to pick somewhere else to stay. A total dump, we had 3 rooms, and all 3 were just as nasty. If your in a worst case scenario, please sleep in your car.

Reviews.Title: “Great value & outstanding location”
Reviews.Author: Maui Coconut
Reviews.Content: Pleasantly suprised by the size of the room. We were in the north tower on the 8th floor and it was very quiet despite facing the street. While our checkin only took a few minutes (Thursday early evening) we did notice some very long lines there at other times. They honored our request for two rooms that were near each other. Would definitely choose this hotel again merely because of its location. Loved that it connected to Paris hotel where we enjoy dining and their live music since there are not many good dining/entertainment options at Ballys. Parking was convenient and easily accessible. Bed was comfortable and we got a good night's sleep. My only complaints are that they charge you to use the safe and that the linen is of very poor quality. After those long Vegas nights, I appreciate fine sheets and a soft pillowcase. You definitely won't find that here. However, that is not enough of an issue to be a deal breaker...we'd definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Run if they offer the south tower rooms!!”
Reviews.Author: picosmom
Reviews.Content: Our trip started like a nightmare as we encountered a miserable front desk clerk, she informed us bally's does not offer upgrades. We told her we were renewing vows and could she give us a nice room with a view, she gave us a room in south tower with a view of air conditioning unit! The room was disgusting smelled of dirty feet!holes and burns in carpet etc etc (depressing) went back to the miserable clerk, she gave us another room which she said was better and ended up alot worse with a large hole in carpet near the door! and ripped bedding!! We proceeded to go back and demand a manager after waiting 20 minutes the manager told us we would need to pay either 20.00 or 50.00 to get a newer room in the north tower. we asked why the clerk didn't tell us that when we asked twice for a nice room for our special occasion. the manager told us to look at the rooms first and a housekeeper would let us in then come back after we decided to pay the difference. Finally we got a new room after paying the 100.00 up charge! employees at Bally's are unfriendly and will not go out of their way to help guests. The hotel was inexpensive compared to paris where we usually stay when we visit Las vegas, I guess you get what you pay for, hospitality is a big problem at most of the harrah's owned properties. Stay elsewhere!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: Peaches451
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice for the price that we paid. The rooms could have used some updating, but were clean. It was in a good location near the center of the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel at just right location at an affordable price”
Reviews.Author: Dipayan
Reviews.Content: A very good hotel at a very affordable price. Includes an in-house casino, a lots of shopping provisions, coffee shop, lounge bars and so on. Room service was great. Prompt attention to any requests. Rooms were very spacious and no questions were asked to us on extra visitors. Has front office services to cater to visitors need like city tours, event tickets etc. Good hotel for family or group of friends or even when alone. Hotel Bally's is definitely a good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Do not bother,try else where”
Reviews.Author: litew8t
Reviews.Content: After Reading reviews on this hotel, I should of known better but another family member whom we were with picked it. YES the checkout lines are long and painfully slow. Not friendly desk staff at all. About 30 in line 2 people working. It was like this each time we walked past the desk. The casino it self was very old and dirty looking. Very smoky and stunk. The resturants were decent however. But the line to get a coffee from the shop by the front desk was long and slow. I reserved a room to overlook the fountains across the street but they did not honour it. So why take a reservation for it? The rooms in the north tower were very big which was nice. The bathroon needs work. We had a quilt on the bed with holes in it. Rugs were dirty. The beds were nice though,slept good and it was quiet. We rented a car and used the valet service which was great,they had super service. If all the employees worked this hard,it would be a fantastic hotel. All in all I would not stay there again. There are so many better hotels,but this was our first time so live and learn.

Reviews.Title: “Older Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sallgall
Reviews.Content: Older hotel, PERFECT LOCATION. It does the job if you are look for a hotel to not stay in the whole time, which you should not in Las Vegas!! Great location and good value.

Reviews.Title: “Marvellous, Fantabulous”
Reviews.Author: Aanch
Reviews.Content: If you are visiting Vegas for 1st time,,,, a stay at Ballys is a must... Lovely location, right on the strip... I and my Hubby had a beautiful experience ,, its right across Bellagio !! Its definitely value for the money ( found a great deal on tripres.com) with grand buffet option. If enjoyment & fun is top on your agenda of Vegas, Ballys is place to be !

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: Fred53934
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Bally's Las Vegas Hotel (South Tower) Nov 10 - Nov 12, and will never stay at Bally's again. Check-in service was slow and even with advance reservations was unable to get the room on my reservation, instead had to move during our stay. Rooms were very outdated and in poor state of repair. Furniture in our room was from the 70s. Hallway was dirty and dingy. Check out was the same as check in - s l o w. Recommendation is to take your business elsewhere, I will.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable priced hotel”
Reviews.Author: melhorn23
Reviews.Content: Bally's was an affordable hotel to stay at, close to the strip and attractions. Rooms were comfortable but need some updating.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: tiffers1982
Reviews.Content: We just came back from Bally's halloween weekend. Location is Great! Right in the middle and easy access!I I got a great deal through Wyndham for $59 all 3 nights with viewing their presentation for times share ownership so as far as pricing , that was incredible! Only thing I would complain is you have to walk over to Paris if you want to use pool or hot tub. Also, not very many choices for food inside the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel...”
Reviews.Author: mouse66
Reviews.Content: This hotel is pretty much bang on the center of the strip. Upon checking in they of course upgraded our room for the night at no extra charge.....but should we decide we wanted it they offered it for a reasonable price. Lots of outside maintenance taking place, I guess it never ends with these resorts. Couch in room was stained pretty bad but otherwise the room was good. You could hear the elevators go up and down all night long so I would reccommend you walk a ways and stay at the far end of a hall.Only had a quick snack there otherwise we ate else where. Only complaint is I used the television checkout and requested my bill be e-mailed and it never was.

Reviews.Title: “dreadful”
Reviews.Author: whitey17
Reviews.Content: we have stayed at ballys a fare few times,but after last time we will not be going back. first off the tiles fell off the bathroom wall every time you took a shower,secondly someone entered our room whilst we were in bed at gone 1.30am when we complained to reception we were told to dead lock our door as this was our fault for not having the dead lock on.and 3rd the slots do not pay at all but this seems to be the same in all the harrah properties. 4th ballysdoes not have many places to eat and doesnt have a buffet unless you go thruogh to the paris which is very nice.on the plus side its in a great locaction and is joined on to the paris hotel which is a lot nicer

Reviews.Title: “very poor service”
Reviews.Author: daisey33
Reviews.Content: This was my first (and last) time that I have stayed at Ballys. The service was VERY slow. I waited in line for 45 minutes to pay for internet service to my room. There were only 2 people working at the desk and approx 30 very upset people in line. When it was my turn, I found that I couldn't pay with cash and that I could come back the next day! The clerk told me that I could have gone to the customer service line which he said "doesn't exist right now." Our room was semi clean. The mirror had what looked like makeup on it and the magazines on the table had a glob of food on the cover. No coffee pot or fridge and the pool was closed for the season. It may have evened it out a bit if the staff were friendly, but 98% of the staff that we dealt with seemed bothered by us. Very frustrated by our accomadations.

Reviews.Title: “this is the worst hotel on the strip”
Reviews.Author: sbmilkmaid
Reviews.Content: stayed for four days, and nothing by problems-- dirty carpets, old tv, warped lampshades, broken bureaus, stopped up toilet for 2 days, housekeeping was horrendous--never emptied trash, left diry glasses and never replaced them, took ashtrays and did not replace, had to call for them. no concierge, front desk never answered when called from room. the breakfast buffet was the worst i had ever been to. everything was pre cooked and u had to pay for juice & coffee. they never came over to refill your cup--the food was just horrible. i will never stay there again--also, i took my own coffee pot--no coffee pots in room

Reviews.Title: “If you are on a tight budget, I’d look for another hotel.”
Reviews.Author: California Sun
Reviews.Content: Second time to visit this hotel, if you want to be in the middle of everything on the strip this pretty much has you there. Across the street is Bellagio’s, next door you have The Paris Hotel (from inside Bally’s there is a CUTE corridor that is attached to Paris so you can access The Paris Hotel easily)and within walking distance you have many others. The food is extremely expensive in both Bally’s and Paris. Be prepared to spend $15 for any meal you purchase and dinner entrees starting at $25 or more a plate. I’m being modest on dinner prices. As you enter the cute little walkway from Bally’s to Paris you have the outdoor European feel and look. Very, very cute. In this walkway you have a 7 island buffet restaurant you can purchase meal tickets for 3 meals a day at $40 each person. It looked like each island had food of every sort. Italian, Mexican, Asian, dessert ect……They do have a Nathans Hot Dog and Hamburger joint in Bally’s but you will still pay $10 bucks (at least you get fries with it) plus a drink and tax will round you out to $15. Got a turkey cold sandwich at a deli in Paris and a drink $17 buck a roo’s!!! You don't even have coffee in the room, really? Not good after a night of partying! TAKE CASH WITH YOU DO NOT USE THE ATM!!!! Man, this is where you really loose unnecessary money $5.00 each time you use the ATM. Dang, you don’t even get to roll the dice on that one! The rooms were ok, bed not comfy at all, pillows needed to be replaced. They were extra small pillows that smelled like 3,000 heads had laid on them. Bathroom very nice and clean with updated marble counters and tile flooring. Make sure you play the HUGE (I mean like 6 ft high) $1.00 slot machine on the right as you exit Bally’s BEFORE going into walk way to Paris. I saw one lady win $450 bucks and another $750, plus several people won anywhere from $40-$100 consistently. If you are on a tight budget, I’d look for another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Awful!”
Reviews.Author: Traveler12Virginia
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the South Tower. The room, while really big, was filled with old furniture that looked like it had been there since the 1970's. No coffee pot. No hotel literature. Dirty stained carpet. Tile grout in the bathroom was black. The place gave me the creeps. Check-in took forever. Long line with too few people at the desk. You can do much better in Vegas than this. Without a doubt this is the worst hotel room I have stayed in, in a very long time.

Reviews.Title: “Good Over all”
Reviews.Author: blacksnowe
Reviews.Content: 4 day stay Sat-Tues for Halloween. Checked in 1pm (early) They tried to accommodate my request which was a unit close to the elevator. They were booked for a conference so they offered a smoking room or one with two beds. We opted for a preferred non smoking one mid hall. Worst view ever (a roof and parking garage). Room 878. But was not a big deal. We could have waited until 4pm for a view and closer to elevator but decided to take what they had. The Food court style restaurant in basement on the pool level should be avoided at all cost, unless an emergency slice of pizza is needed. The Thai Restaurant though was fast, delicious and made up for it. Also the Mexican place has a great Quesadilla and all restaurants are located in the same area. That adds to the easy navigation of this Hotel/Casino which can not be said for all places on the strip. A couple points, The rooms no longer offer Blanket/comforters which I was surprised at and then requested ( at no cost ) but soon realized that with the individual thermostat in the room one was not needed. Also the rooms tub did not drain that well. It did have an Iron/Board, Safe, local TV. Safe is 3$ extra per day. Those small nit picky details aside. The room was very large and clean. The staff at the hotel was kind, friendly and prompt to reply to any requests I had. As stated in other reviews this Hotel is centrally located and being someone who has been to Vegas before this is the reason i chose it. You can easily walk to some cheap tables and many attractions. It is part of the Harrahs chain and also has an underground passage to Paris hotel with much shopping and sight seeing along the way Overall it was a good stay. For the same price I would stay at the Planet Hollywood again as we made are way back there for quiet a few meals and the ABC general store for cheap Liquor and it is a bit of a walk. And if you have been to Vegas before you know you need to save your legs...

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: jarez71
Reviews.Content: Arrived early around 1:00 PM and was given an excellent room, the staff was friendly and helpful, it exceeded my expectations. We were very concerned due to other reviews seen here, however, I guess that by staying in the north tower made a difference. The location could not be better. The casino is not much to look at, not horrible either, any others around the area look nicer. I could recommend this hotel as long as the stay is in the north tower.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite hotel in Vegas, by far!”
Reviews.Author: Janmor10
Reviews.Content: The location is GREAT and I have always been a winner, (well almost always). The close access to the Paris Hotel is like staying there too!

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad At all”
Reviews.Author: nearnorthOntario
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 4 night stay. After reading reviews were not sure we had made the right choice. We were pleasantly surprised. Check in was a breeze and we had our rooms upon arrival 1:00 p.m., expecting to have to wait until 4:00 p.m. We had booked with West Jet Vacations and transfers were included and went smoothly and received the upgrade to the north tower 14 th floor. Room was large , clean and had just been redone. The view was o.k. looked towards the airport. Also received the coupon book upon check-in. Everyone was very friendly. Check out was easy done via the t.v in you room. Location was perfect Would not hesitate to return to Bally's. Stayed at Wynn Encore last year and with the $'s we saved this year staying at Bally's were just as happy. The pool is closed until March we believe but you could use the one at Paris. They also have the internet stations to print boarding passes for $5.00.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms, Fabulous Service”
Reviews.Author: katt42saves
Reviews.Content: We selected Bally's for their prices and location on the strip. Our room was towards the back of the building, but we had a South facing window with a great view of The Strip. We could see Paris and beyond. Check in was quick and friendly and as we arrived at our room, an employee was wheeling a cart by and greeted us. My husband is military, with the requisite hair cut, and the employee noticed, thanked him for his service and asked him if he had been deployed recently. We chatted with the gentleman for a few minutes and he offered some tips on places to visit and eat while in town. Our floor was quiet, everything was clean and when we decided to add an extra day to our stay they gave us the same discounted rate as we had for the previous nights.

Reviews.Title: “Overall, pretty darn good!”
Reviews.Author: pbcchicago
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Bally's Monday through Friday and overall it was a very positive experience. I am upset that my bro&sis-in-law had a coffeemaker in their room and we did not even though I had called the hotel and asked for one. Overall the cleanliness was not an issue, no trays left in hall, no garbage laying around. We lucked out and it took about 5 minutes to check in, our other family members waited in line over 40 minutes. Staff were all courteous and friendly.We rarely heard any other guests from our room and the bed was very comfortable. We did pretty well on the Bally slots but my b-i-l had much better luck at tables elsewhere. Dinner at Red Square in Mandalay Bay and Dos Caminos at Palazzo were both amazing. Bally's food(we only ate breakfast buffet & Nosh were pretty good. Prices for food in Vegas are totally outrageous. Cocktail service at all the casinos was hit or miss! To sum up, we had a great week!

Reviews.Title: “Location location location”
Reviews.Author: vigs85
Reviews.Content: We love Bally's and the location that it offers. You can go either way on the strip and are able to do it walking. Check in was fast, room was great and service was good.

Reviews.Title: “Poor in all aspects”
Reviews.Author: HedoZen
Reviews.Content: Carpets were dirty/stained and need a good steam clean from the elevators and throughout the guest rooms, also dangerous to walk on. The number of staff on the counters was inadequate although they have about 20 counters saw 4 employees serving with a line that seemed to reach miles. LAME CUSTOMER SERVICE, bed & shower not great, no accommodations whatsoever even for people with physical disability. Internet service very expensive. Location accessible right in the middle of the strip connected to Parris, walkway to the Bellagio and free bus shuttle to other hotels. So far, Harrah’s hotel is way better then this 1 for price and service comparison

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC Location, everything else good!”
Reviews.Author: NeednSun
Reviews.Content: I just got back from 3 nights in Vegas with friends. Bally's is in the middle of the strip and all everything you'll need.
