The hotel itself is clean, easy to navigate, and an all around great deal. Everything is nice here, but nothing fantastic except for the quiet rooms, location, and price!

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay at Bally's”
Reviews.Author: em5585
Reviews.Content: Arrived late due to weather delays. The rest of our party had to wait to check in because two people had combined their Total Rewards points for a free room and they had to check in together. They stood in line several times since the line was long and they wanted to be able to check in as soon as we got there. Once we did arrive we were given a free upgrade to the North Tower (3 rooms total for 3 nights each) and while we couldn't get adjoining rooms, they were all just one door over from each other on the same floor. The view was lousy, but the room itself was nice. Everything seemed relatively new and clean. No issues getting extra towels/pillows, etc. Housekeeping called us early in the afternoon each day to find out when a good time to come would be. That was nice since we were out late and night and not up very early. We left a note for the housekeepers when we needed things (clean glasses, etc.) and our requests were always met. Food options at Bally's seemed fairly limited. The cafe was only open until two and they had few other decent options in the early afternoon (when we finally made it out for lunch). No problem getting cabs at night, which was nice. No luck gambling here, but hopefully we earned some more free nights. We also called and asked for a later check-out and were given an extra hour at no charge. Not much extra time, but definitely appreciated!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was just ok”
Reviews.Author: rangers2
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for value with location this is where you should stay. The hotel seems to be in need on some upgrading. It needs a face lift! Gambling was great with friendly and helpful dealers. It is located in a nice place on the strip. I will be staying somewhere else next year. Pool was closed for the year but you could go next door to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “The Best of Bally's!”
Reviews.Author: Pals4Ever
Reviews.Content: My Mother & I were in Las Vegas the first week in October. We have been going to Vegas for years now & know it quite well. Before our trip we had read many of the reviews on this site. Almost all were good but some had us concerned, as we've stayed at many Vegas strip hotels, but never at Bally's. We had no need for concern! We had a very enjoyable stay & with a few minor exceptions we found Bally's to be a very nice place to stay. Many of the negative reviews on this site had to do with the age & cleanliness of the rooms & the attitude of the staff. We checked in on a Sunday at about 6:00 PM and when we arrived at the hotel there was a long line up. We were thinking "oh, oh" maybe what people had said about waiting in line for an hour to check in was true?! ! We only waited in line for about 20 min. At first there were only 3 front desk clerks on, but then 2 more showed up & we were through the line & checked in, in about 1/2 hour. The clerk, Lucy, was extremely friendly & helpful. We specifically asked for a high up room with a view. She even asked us what was more important to us the view or the height? We said both & thats what we got! 22nd flr. South Tower facing south strip & the Paris hotel & tower with a part view of Bellagio fountains. What a spectacular view! I was going to try the $20.00 tip approach that some people on this site said they had done & even had the money in my hand, but she granted our requests anyway. She did ask if we wanted a more upgraded room in the North Tower for an extra fee & we said no. If she had upgraded us to the North Tower for no extra fee I would have tipped her, but we certainly didn't need to. By the way Bally's internet site says that they take a $100.00 deposit per day on your credit card upon check in, but that wasn't the case. We even questioned her on this & she seemed kind of surprised at the question. It seems that only if you're planning on using the in room internet connection & phone alot that there is a deposit taken. Who wants to spend all their holiday time on the internet & phone anyway?! I know that I don't! Because we've been hearing alot about the bed bug epidemic all over North America we did a close inspection of our beds before we even unpacked. Everything was fine. VERY clean, comfortable beds & the room was HUGE!! Yes, the dresser drawers were a bit banged up in the corners & there were a few minor old stains on the carpet, but we weren't going to sweat it! So many people have complained about that stuff, but I say if you have time to be noticing every little scratch & tiny bit of grime in a corner somewhere then you're either too fussy, or spending way too much time in your room!! Its Las Vegas people, get out & have fun!! Without fail all the staff on all levels that we came in contact with were very friendly & helpful. The only criticisms we would have of the hotel are that the pool is a very long walk. Its situated at the back of the hotel, so especially from the South Tower its a long walk, as you have to go across the casino & then through the whole lower shopping mall to get there. My mother is a senior & really wanted to spend more time at the pool, but found the long walk to be too far for her convenience. However, I will say that once you're there the pool area is very clean & nice. Also, we found the ventilation in the casino at times to not be so good. I found that you could really notice the cigarette smoke and my throat was dry & my sinuses were acting up. Overall we would definately recommend Bally's! You can't beat the location, as it's right on the centre of the strip in the middle of all the action! I will be honest & say that our room was comped, except for one night, but even if you were paying for it I would say anything from $50.00 - $100.00 a night for the room we were in would be worth the money. It is a slightly older hotel & needs a bit of sprucing up here & there, but try & keep things in perspective. You're in Las Vegas on holidays, so don't get uptight about the little things! A few general travellers tips: 1) Buy the 3 day unlimited rides bus pass for $20.00 The bus service is very good. and they also have a new Gold Line which is an express bus that only stops at certain points on the strip, but is much faster. You can purchase tickets for the bus at machines that are located at most of the main strip stops. 2) DON'T buy the bottled water from the street vendors that sell them for $1.00. I had a few tummy troubles after drinking some of this water. I have a feeling that they just took old bottles & rinsed them out & put tap water into them & then sold them as new! Walgrens Drugs or any of the small stores on the strip sell bottled water cheap & its safe to drink. 3) We wouldn't recommend buying the 24hr. all access buffet pass. For most people thats way too much food for one day! DO go to the Flamingo Hiltons dinner buffet though! It's beautifully situated in a tropical garden setting & what a spread!! One whole section was nothing but Asian cusine and the desserts!! OMG!!!

Reviews.Title: “Bally's Consistently Good Value - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Yukon2010
Reviews.Content: This was our third time @ Bally's we have stayed in a variety of rooms and I must say we are always please with them. Although it is not one of the more expensive places it gives you good value, good service and the casino is nice. The location has distinct advantages for us as we wander around to the different Harrah's properties and make Ballys our base. Whenever we stay we also go to the Sterling Brunch and enjoy that immensely. We have booked another week in Jnauary 2011 and hope we ge the same calibre of service as we always have...thanks guys its like for us!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and Great Price!!”
Reviews.Author: cross3434
Reviews.Content: Hotel and rooms were clean. The location was great it was right in the middle of the strip connected to Parris, walkway to the Bellagio. The dollar margaritas and tacos were great. Service was somewhat lacking or met with a smile, however they did correct any issues. Hear a lot about the wait at check in, lines were long but moved quickly. For the price and no resort fes and the location this is a great place to stay and I would definately reccomend it to anyone. Do not waste your time going to Circus Circus, it was a dump, nasty smell we wanted to see it and walked to the end of the strip and found it to be very disapponting. Definately go to the Wax Museum at the Venetian.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised with hotel, not thrilled about casino”
Reviews.Author: TSLive
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Bally's this past saturday-tuesday for $75 total (initially) using my players card promotion. Paid $20 extra per night to get upgraded from the south tower (which I hear is awful) to the north tower. The north tower room was spacious, clean and good value for the $45/night I paid. As for the casino... 20% of my gambling was at my hotel casino, Bally's. I had 2 brief combative exchanges at Bally's during my trip - both at Bally's. The first was with a pit boss, dressed in his sunday football jersey, who was responsible for playing the R&B music that was playing that night. All good for me. But him singing out loud to the music on his knees like he's Boyz II Men to a married woman at the blackjack table... distasteful and unprofessional. I asked this same guy about drink service, saying it's been about an hour. He snapped back "No way has it been an hour". I said "well I was playing slots for 40 minutes before I sat here", he said "that's not my problem". Nice. The other incident was with a roulette dealer. I walked up and gave him $100, asked for red chips which he gave me. I put some down and he said I can only play outside. I politely asked why, saying I've been playing red inside throughout my trip. He said "and I'm sure that would be fine if the guy next to you wasn't playing red chips on the inside". Ok sorry, I didn't notice him. Didn't need to ridicule, and you should have told me up front. I bet, lost, and walked away (a common theme for this trip!) Overall, drink service at Bally's is inconsistent. Sometimes I am asked if I want another 2 minutes later, but often I can't flag down a waitress if I had air traffic controller glowsticks. The sportsbook is all right. If you bet over $100 at the sportbook, ask for a drink voucher. They'll only give it to you when you ask, I learned this $600 later (hey, it was my first football sunday in vegas). Also, when I ordered a drink without one not knowing I would have to pay full price, the waitress said "it's only free if you're betting horses". She misinformed me, not sure why, but how could she not know? Overall, good trip even though I lost. I went to las vegas indoor skydiving which I think it well worth the $75. Bellagio is still the class act and it's nice to see a casino with good drink service and clean/classy decour, yet still have reasonable table limits for the middle class. This hotel gets 4 stars because it's all about bang for your buck. Great location and connected to Paris, which is a pretty solid casino itself. I just wouldn't gamble at Bally's again with Bellagio directly across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lovely room and very reasonably prized”
Reviews.Author: Brightrob
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 2 nights during our visit to Las Vegas in September. Check-in was pretty straightforward and hassle-free. Our room was clean and very spacious. Most of the hotels in Las Vegas look more or less the same, but this one seemed quite reasonably priced. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, but very slow checkin”
Reviews.Author: redpurple
Reviews.Content: The stay did not get off to a good start with a ridiculously long wait just to check in. The number of staff on the counters was woefully inadequate. It is surely not a surprise when guests arrive, so I can't imagine why they wouldn't have more staff working - there were plenty of counters for them to work at. Once checked in, the room was nice, and the location was central. That said, on my next visit I'll stay elsewhere, and this is mainly because of the time taken to check in.

Reviews.Title: “They do not value your business”
Reviews.Author: aveley2g
Reviews.Content: I booked my stay through Delta Vacations for 2 nights with an additional two nights using my Total Rewards comps. I had 2 rooms for 4 nights. I tried to call Total Rewards & Bally's several times before my trip to insure that my rooms were close, if not connected, and that my party would be able to stay in the same rooms for the entire 4 days. The people I talked to acted like they had no idea what I was talking about. Since we were arriving late on Saturday night & I knew rooms would be scarce, I also tried to guarantee a better location & hopefully, in the North Tower. No luck except I was able to pay $15 per room/per night to guarantee connecting rooms which I was finally told on the morning before my arrival (no-one mentioned it as an option before). I still had South Tower rooms at the very end of the hallway, difficult for a member of my part with leg issues. The clerk who checked us in greeted us with "need to see ID ladies", instead of "hello". The manager I spoke to was apologetic but offered no help in upgrading our rooms/location & seemed to indicate that because I booked through a "3rd party", I had second-class status. I was very disappointed in Bally's because I felt they had no interest in getting or keeping my business.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: Jeff57910
Reviews.Content: Don't stay here ... unless you like REALLY LAME CUSTOMER SERVICE! - My call and question "Do you have a free shuttle from the airport to the hotel?" was answered "No". Later, I found the waiting area where there are several paid shuttles (hotel to the airport), but no hotel employee was there to explain/answer questions. - Our conference needed three breakout rooms. Two were on the 26th floor, but an honest 10 minute walk away from each other. The third was on the 4th/casino floor at least a 5 minute walk ... AFTER you get off the elevator! An unheard of arrangement! - It was 91' the two days I was there and the pool closed at 6 p.m. (darkness at 7) and didn't open until 10 a.m. - The location is very good and my room was fine, but a colleague and a new acquaintance were both very unsatisfied with their room. One of them was actually asked "Would you like to pay an additional $20 for a recently updated room?" - The Business Center was totally set apart from the conference rooms and business traffic areas. AND ... it closed at 7:00 p.m. - My check in (3 p.m.) was fine/normal, but every time I walked by the check in area there were some 30 - 40 people in line! - My check out (10:30 a.m. - not "rush hour") took over 30 minutes. I counted 35 people in line and there were only TWO clerks to process us. I asked about getting more help there and the employee (same area, but doing other things on her computer) said they didn't have anyone else to staff the check out. She said she'd have a manager come out, which never happened. Worst of all, no one seemed to notice or care about the huge line and obvious frustration of the departing guests. Don't stay here! They haven't earned and don't deserve our business!!

Reviews.Title: “Central Location to the Strip”
Reviews.Author: JillE49
Reviews.Content: This was my first time to visit Las Vegas and we were pleased with our choice of Ballys as our hotel for our 5 day stay. It was in the middle of the Strip and joined to Paris Hotel so easy to walk to other attractions. Car parking was easy as well as the rental which was just a short walk to Paris Hotel. The double room was larger, than our friend's room at Monte Carlo Hotel. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “awesome location but bed & shower not great”
Reviews.Author: tripsonsticks
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a great stay at Bally's. We arrived early on Thursday, around 1pm and there was no line up at check in. The lady offered us an upgrade to the north tower for $20 a night which we took and I was glad we did, it was a nice room, very clean with a big bathroom. We had no view but we didn't care because it was quiet! Bally's was a great location, very central for coming back and flaking out after a long day of walking around in the sun! The bed was too soft for us but we managed, the only real complaint we had was the shower--no water pressure and it was very low which is fine for me because I'm 5'5" but my poor husband said it hit him in the chest (he's 6'2" tall). We flew Allegiant out of Bellingham and saved $200 each over flying out of Vancouver Canada so we had no real complaints!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Vegas-y hotel...takes forever to check in and out!”
Reviews.Author: Brandx01
Reviews.Content: Bally's is a great big fun Vegas-y hotel...great staff...friendly and polite...nice rooms...great shopping area...nice big loud flashy casino with everything you need for a fun time gambling. But it takes forever to check in!! We arrived Saturday at 3pm and of the possible 22 'check-in' stations...they had a TOTAL of 5-clerks behind the counter!! That's right...22 stations available...5 clerks working! It took 45-minutes to check in. Same at check-out...since check-out time is 11am...the line went on and on and on...and they had maybe 6-7 clerks behind the counter...it took another 45-minutes to check-out. Needless to say some of the people in line were quite 'upset' at the long wait. I would definitely stay there again...but I'll be ready for a long long wait.

Reviews.Title: “Was Well Worth 39.95 and not much more”
Reviews.Author: icemanxxx
Reviews.Content: If your are looking for a convenient place to stay on the strip for a bargain price this place is for you. The room was clean and large with two queen beds. The decor was decidedly 1970's. no coffee maker, Iron or amenities besides soap and shampoo. The rug was slightly stained and you could see the mold in the grout in the bathrooms. Overall I could not complain though. I will not be staying on the strip next time because of the horrendous crowds, crappy odds, tight slots and overpriced meals. I will be heading downtown to the El Cortezs and try my luck their.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Locatio”
Reviews.Author: ankurgupta26
Reviews.Content: I visited this hotel one week prior to Christmas on 2009. I got a good deal for 4n/5d from expedia for 40$ per night. The hotel has excellent location right in the center of the strip, rooms are very spacious so are bath rooms. However, the furnishings are outdated...like no LCD tv. There is no complimentary breakfast. room service did not have lot of options. Internet service from room is too expensive around 20$/ hour. Given the excellent location of the hotel, you have sub way, chipotle, walgreens and other food joints for options. The top of the line restaurants are also available in the hotel. Overall - Value for Money, excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “No coffee in room, poor service”
Reviews.Author: Sasha_N
Reviews.Content: WE waited in line very over 40 minutes to check-in. It was 1PM. Bally's has a virtually unheard of check-in of 4PM. We were told our rooms by 4PM and to go to the end and claim our check-in keys at that time. . We weren't offered an upgrade. I noticed a few ppl bringing in their own coffee maker and I thought to myself, boy, they really like they coffee maker. Little did I realize there is no coffee maker in the room. Anyway, we checked back around 3PM and we could not see where exactly we were to check in to claim our room keys. The line was very disorganzed and there was nobody directing people. Finally, I asked an employee of the hotel who happened to walk-by where can we pick up our room keys. She said, just line-up at the VIP line, so I did. That was the best tip I got in Vegas! The lady at the counter said our room isn't ready. I was shocked since it was after 3 and we were able to check-in to another Harrahs hotel before at noon when the (standard) check-in was 3PM. She said in a sarcastic manner that check-in is 4PM and your room is not yet available. Huh?? So, we go and kill some more time and return at 4PM. Still, there is no official direction to pickup our room keys. The check-in line was crazy. I walked back to the VIP line and my wait was minimal. The asian girl was most delighful andhelpful, unlike the previous two clerks. She apologized and said your room is not available. I said, this is ridiculous, we've waited since 1PM. After less than a minute, she says I am really sorry, I have upgraded you. I said, thank you, thank you for your understanding and help. We arrive in our room and it wasn't nothing special. But nothing to complain about either except no coffee maker. There was really no view except viewing the other Bally's tower and the roofs. The Bally pool is awful, we walked over to the Paris and used their pool and facilities instead. For the location, we would stay at Bally's again. The long walks to and from our room is a pain though. However, considering the price we got for under $40/night for right on the strip and access to the Paris hotel's pool, I am not going to complain. However, in general, the hotel is really old but in fair shape. Still, I do have to give the hotel an average to poor rating for the flaky service but I would recommend this hotel to others, just be aware of the check-in problems..

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: jkcummins
Reviews.Content: We had a very nice experience at Bally's. After reading several reviews, we were hesitant but decided to "wait and see". When we got there, the line to check in was long but moved very quickly. We were upgraded to the North Tower at check in. Our room was clean when we got there and was tidied up and the nice, fluffy white towels replaced each day when we were out. The beds were great with lots of pillows to choose from. We are pretty self sufficient so we didn't need a lot from the hotel staff. When we did deal with them (show tickets), they were helpful and efficient. It is a convenient location and was a good central spot to start and end each day. The show was excellent and our overall visit was so much fun. We didn't have to worry about our room at all. One note: the toilet flushes fast and furious and will scare you the first time you use it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - would stay again”
Reviews.Author: Jcad
Reviews.Content: Went to Las Vegas Sept 3-6, 2010 with a girlfriend for a quick much needed getaway! We were upgraded to the North Tower, and can't complain one bit about the room. It was recently renovated, so very clean. Not the best view out the window, but for the amount of time you spend in your room, its no issue. Nice to see they provided you with one cup coffee makers, more than I have seen in other hotels in Vegas. Not the best coffee, but nice to sip while you are getting ready for your day! Lineups upon arrival were lengthy, but there were many staff working so the line seemed to go fairly quickly. Check out was a breeze. Staff were all pleasant. Didn't eat in Ballys, other than a quick snack of $1 tacos and margeritas and they were great for sure!!! Spent the days shopping and of course some time in many casinos in between. Its great that you can go thru to Paris without going outside. Of course we did spend some time in Ballys' casino as well. We plan to return to Vegas in February with both sets of our elderly parents, and likely will stay here again with them as location location location is the key. Easy to get to Caesars, Paris, Flamingo etc. Not huge amounts of walking will be necessary to get to see some of the major attractions. We are looking

Reviews.Title: “We had great "tribal" birthday celebration”
Reviews.Author: slickynyc
Reviews.Content: My niece wanted to celebrate a big birthday in her favorite city. Parents, aunts, uncles cousins and her extended family had a wonderful time We came fromNY, Fl, CA, Az and Canada, a motley crew. We had the use of a double cabana, food drinks, a cookie cake.The pool staff was very attentive to our needs. We ate in the restaurants in the Paris which were convenient. Some of us saw KA, Cher, Carrot TOP, And visited in the Ice Bar-what fun. The accommodations were good, clean. The handicap room was very large and well equipped unlike others in Vegas. Mobility scooters were available for rental ln the hotel. A big bonus. Needless today the casino was just that.

Reviews.Title: “A little dated but good atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: CMunster80
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Bally's as a part of a comp deal through their total rewards program with Harrah's. Obviously with the room being free if was a great deal. The rooms were a little dated with their decoration but when we arrived I asked for a room with a nice view and I was quickly and easily accomodated given a choice between facing north or south in the south tower. We had a wonderful view and the room was well kept during our stay. The air conditioner leaked a little but you really had to look to notice. The casino itself is a little smokey and seems to cater to the slightly more mature crowd, those who aren't coming to vegas to party. I would say that if you are interested in gambling and are on a mid range (say 1500-2000) or less gambling budget don't gamble here or at any of the other big resorts past like 10 in the morning. All minimums go up to about 10 dollars or more and with Bill's right across the street and Casino Royale a little ways south you are better off going there. I enjoyed staying here and the emenities I did experience were good. I would recommend this for a mid range, mid strip stay and play type of vacation that you won't be in your room except to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond my expectation”
Reviews.Author: AuroraSunnyvale
Reviews.Content: I booked a south tower room on line, cause it was very cheap, and location is very good. We were lucky to get a north tower rennovated room during check in, without even asking. The room was very big, clean, nice bathroom. The kingsize bed was very comfortable. There is nothing that I can complained about!

Reviews.Title: “Needs a Remodel, but Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: Sammyt27
Reviews.Content: If you need a fancy, 4 star hotel with all the upgrades, then don't stay here. If you just want a reasonably priced room, a comfy bed and a shower so you can spend your money on other things in Vegas, then stay here. I stayed in the South Tower, which I knew going into it would mean an older room, but that being said, it was a huge room, with a view of the strip, and did the job. Walls were a little thin, but I slept with ear plugs. We used the monorail for a day, which was located at the back of the hotel. My friend stayed at Paris, which is connected by the shops in between the casinos of the two hotels, so that was convenient as well. My only complaint was that they don't offer free printing of your boarding pass, you have to spend $5 for 5 minutes at the kiosk downstairs in order to do that.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was fine”
Reviews.Author: 4qqqq
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my husband and mom. We were upgraded at no charge to the north tower and was very happy about that after reading some of the reviews about the south tower. When we got to the 6th floor of the north tower and the sign read that this was a no smoking floor. My husband was not happy. We got my mom into her room and it was very nice. Marble bathroom sink and shower. Newer carpet, newer furniture, clean and plenty of space. Our room was 2 doors down and it was the same. My husband kept sniveling about the no smoking. I called the front desk to change rooms and there were no smoking rooms available in the north tower. We moved over to the south tower. Wow, what a difference!! This room smelled from smoke, the furniture was like going back in time to the 70's. Very dark wood, dirty carpet with lumps, tile in the bathroom (some cracked), ugly bathroom countertop, and very old bedspread. Needless to say I never took off my shoes or sat on anything without a towel under me. It wasn't the end of the world staying in this room, but I did see the difference and the grass was greener on the other side. I was happy my mom stayed in the north tower. The elevator stated the floor was 73. I don't think so. I don't know why they listed it that way. Well, if it was I would be surprised considering we could hear people partying and screaming on the streets very clearly. This was at 2 am. I'm glad that people were having a good time, but considering they are saying we are on the 73rd floor, I would never think you would hear people partying. Pool area was nice. We ate the the Cafe in the hotel and it was ok. All in all, this hotel was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Bally's - too old for me!”
Reviews.Author: nanpink
Reviews.Content: I had stayed in Bally's back in 2005 had a wonderful experience back then and when I knew I was going back to Vegas, I knew I wanted to stay there again. I booked a reservation to celebrate two special birthdays in my family for September 23 through September 27, 2010. When we went to check in @ 10:00 pm the wait time was unbelievable - so long! They had only 2 employees at the check-in counter. The wait was at least 45 minutes until it was our turn to check in. The employee at the front desk was extremely rude when I requested a room in the "North tower". I also mentioned that it was celebration visit and if she could upgrade us to a bigger room other than standard, and she just snapped saying "if we upgraded everyone who was here to celebrate an event" we would not have any standard rooms to give out. I'm already giving you an upgrade to the North tower." It was just her attitude and annoyance of being asked that I was turned off from the beginning. The room they gave us was 713 North Tower. I have to say that the room was VERY clean, we inspected throughly for any presents of bugs - thankfully, there were NONE. However, the room was so old - the wallpaper was peeling off and the carpet was disgusting. They really need to update these rooms. On the plus side, housekeeping was there early every day and did a great job when we called for extra pillows & towels, they were there immediately. We only ate at the cafe for breakfast - nothing to rave about. The buffet was pathetic looking but, when it's only $10.00 what do you expect. Overall, I found the staff to be rude and with all of the other choices of hotels to stay in, I would try another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Las Vegas is the Birthday Place!”
Reviews.Author: shirleyfaye_9
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Bally's for my birthday. There were 7 girls. We had the North Tower Suite with the extra bedroom. 3 bedrooms, 3 baths. It was great! Nice, clean, enough linens, refrigerator, wet bar and super great jaqcuizzi bathtub in the master suite.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: carolinagirl91
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed in the North Tower. I was a bit leary after some of the reviews but I was pleasantly surprised. Our room was very clean. The room and bathroom were quite large. We did not have a nice view but I did not request one. The room was very quiet. Overall, a nice place to stay with a great location. A good value....

Reviews.Title: “what a pit....”
Reviews.Author: HeywoodJ
Reviews.Content: i've stayed at Bally's before and had a decent time. Apperently I've never stayed in the South Wing before, or I've never paid any attention at all to the room. The room was straight out of 1975, with a 21" TV sitting on a stand that looked like dorm room reject piece of plastic. The rest of the decor was equally poor. Showerhead was almost detached from the wall. The room was simply sad and barren. plenty of parties / noise coming from nearby rooms, but it was a weekend night in vegas, so what do you expect?! WON'T be going back.

Reviews.Title: “I will not stay any place else after staying at Bally's”
Reviews.Author: Northwoods0
Reviews.Content: Bally's is awesome. We have been to Vegas many times, but have never been treated as well as we were here. The check in process was very fast. We took the room upgrade and the room was incredible. It was clean and fresh looking and it stayed that way thoughout our entire trip. All of the staff was fantastic. Everyone that we encountered was very helpful and courteous and made us feel welcome.

Reviews.Title: “You pay for what you get.”
Reviews.Author: mweh
Reviews.Content: This hotel needs to be updated. The 10-year old renovation of the North tower needs another renovation. we actually paid $20/night to upgrade to that section. Which we demanded back because both of the rooms were dirty. the vanity had paint hanging off it. The walls were dirty and the mirrors throughout the room were dirty. Dirty Carpets..Smoke smell everywhere. There also was a very musty, moldy smell at the top of the escalators which you needed to use to go out of the hotel at the street level. I held my nose every time. Also they do not supply a shower cap and they do not sell any shower caps in the kiosk within the hotel. What's up with that ?? Internet is $13.95/night AND they charge you $3.00 /day to use the in-room safe. They "Nickel & Dime" you. I actually visited the spa and surprising that was nice. Sauna, Jacuzzi, Steam Shower, Fruit & Juices. You could get a service and use the spa facilities all day until 6:00 PM. After 3:00PM You could pay Only $11 and use the spa facility until 6:00 PM. I thought that was reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “terrific”
Reviews.Author: i4poker
Reviews.Content: Stayed in North Tower. Found Staff extremely helpful and friendly. Room was clean and very nicely decorated. Quick checkin, but suggest checkout from room as wait could be long. Would stay again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE, LOVE, LOVE, BALLYS!!”
Reviews.Author: OHIOGIRL2010
Reviews.Content: My last stay here was in May 2009. This was my second time, and there will be a third. The location can't be beat. The pool is awesome. The casino is totally comfortable. Great selection of slots and enough machines to go around. Asking for an upgrade to stay in the North Tower is a must. Don't expect anything fancy, but you will be pleased. Perfect for a nap and shower, and you are out the door anyway. Love the Java Coast coffee place and the little store. Great for neccessities. Had the toothbrush we forgot, the club soda we ran out of, and the snacks we needed as we returned to our room a little hungry one night. Stayed with my sister and daughter. Their first time at Bally's. Both had a great stay. My only suggestion would be a little updating in the rooms. New carpet and/or fresh wallpaper would make a world of difference. I have stayed at Caesars, Flamingo, and Imperial Palace and I like Bally's the best. Can't wait to come back!

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Alright prices. Bad food.”
Reviews.Author: faruz
Reviews.Content: Probably the only hotel on the strip without food options late at night. When you have the munch late at night - you need a local McDonalds to save you. We stayed at the North Tower Suite. And although promised to support a bunch of friends, it was weird that the Jacuzzi was in the middle of the room and the shower was open as well. Also, they decided that it's better to have a Bide in the room instead of a 2nd toilet (?!) The room itself was alright, the rollover bed was alright too (though short). If you're looking for cheap blackjack tables around this hotel, look outside the window and go to Bill's Gambling Hall & Saloon. Also, it's a shame you have to pay for an internet connection.

Reviews.Title: “good place”
Reviews.Author: guaguaguagua
Reviews.Content: nice location, room is big. will stay here for another time.

Reviews.Title: “Bally's South Tower”
Reviews.Author: tutfam
Reviews.Content: This was our third time staying at HET properties in the last five months. Arrived around 9:30pm on October 3 (Sunday). Only waited about 10 minutes for check-in. No regular rooms in South Tower for that night so they put us in an executive suite for one night. The room is a little dated but wow, was it big! There was a bar area, refrigerator, coffee maker, 1/2 bath, closet, 3 full size sofa's, a chair, love seat, 2 tvs, and table with 4 chairs in the first room. Go thru a door to the bedroom and there were 2 more chairs, dresser, tv, king size bed, table and 2 chairs. Go up 2 steps and there were 2 vanity/sink area's, sunken tub, 2 closets, bidet, shower, and toilet. Monday thru Thursday nights we were in a regular South Tower room. The south tower room wasn't as bad as the reviews led me to believe. We were on a non-smoking floor, had a view of the Paris pool, Eiffel tower, Paris balloon, south strip, and part of the Bellagio water show. I begged both times at check-in for an upgrade to north tower regular room or south tower mini suite, the clerks wouldn't budge. Even told them this was our 3rd time staying with them in the last 5 months, still no budging. I did use the internet. It was $13.99 for 24 hrs. I wasn't convinced of the '24 hr' rule as it wouldn't let me log back in before my 24 hrs was up. The first night in the regular room we could hear doors slamming, people running above us, and in the halls. After going in and out of our room during the week, we could tell that the door slamming didn't seem intentional. The doors just close really quickly causing them to slam and be loud. If you have any questions, feel free to send me a message.

Reviews.Title: “First time at Bally's . . .won't be the last!”
Reviews.Author: keenan9
Reviews.Content: I arrived at Bally's with a little trepidation. This passed quickly. Check in a breeze. Upgraded, with comps, to a North Tower room. Check in gal was friendly actually glad we were there. Room was great. Queen bed, not much of a view but didn't care, had a wet bar frig and plenty of space. Before we even went into the room, hit the video poker bar in the middle of the action. I can't say enough about the bartenders especially Rick and Ben, and staff. Eagerly comped our drinks, played lots of video poker throughout our stay at the bar. Hit 3 four of a kinds and could play forever on a 20 spot. Other slots were a bit tight. Didn't play BJ here. Treated ourselves to the Sterling Brunch on Sunday. Never have spent 3 hours at brunch. Staff was in no hurry to push us out. Food was fabulous. Took our time and I think we tried everything. Champagne flowed freely. Everyone from doorman, to housekeeping to security were friendly and always thanked us for staying with them. Paris and Bally's seem like one hotel. I used the pool at Paris just cause I could. We had $1 tacos at the tequila bar on several occasions along with late night breakfast for 5bucks. Food was great. We also discovered Ellis Island right behind Bally's . . . .this is the BJ scene, Clean, friendly, pays 3-2. Woo hoo. we could walk in about 5 minutes. All in all Bally's is our new favorite home base in Vegas. BTW, I wandered own to the Imperial Palace for a quick bloody mary before we left. Sat at the Geisha Lounge I think it's called and hit 4 aces straight away. What more could a girl want? If you have any questions, let me know. Thanks Bally's for a great experience!

Reviews.Title: “Good location and nice room but don't think we'll stay here again!!!”
Reviews.Author: HEVER
Reviews.Content: We arrived on September 22nd and our stay was for 14 nights. Check in was quick and we were offered a "free" upgrade but was told that there wasn't much of a view.We were given a room in the North tower and we were on the 6th floor. The room was huge with one queen size bed, a double sofa and chair with a coffee table and a large dining table (which we didn't really use but was there if needed). We also had a fridge in the room which was really helpful for keeping our water nice and cold as it was very hot in the room. As we were told at check in, there wasn't much of a view and we looked out onto the car park and the side of the monorail but we weren't that bothered as we didn't intend spending much time in the room anyway. The room also had a dressing table and mirror area outside of the bathroom which was great for me to get ready if my husband was in the bathroom and there was also lots of storage space for hanging clothes and drawer space was plentiful too. We had a safe in the room which costs (approx) $4 a day but it gives peace of mind to know that our valuables are secure when we're not in the room. Housekeeping were nice and friendly and were in everyday to make the bed, replace the towels and restock us with any toiletries if needed. Now to the part that makes us NOT want to stay here again though (which is a shame). The service in the casino was absolutely terrible. It was virtually impossible to get a drink from the cocktail waitress as there were never any around. One evening we watched as one of them stood and talked to another member of staff for about 20 minutes and people were waiting to be served whilst playing the slot machines. My husband really got annoyed by this and refused to do anymore gambling in the casino and instead we started going across the road to Bill's every night where it was so much better. I have to say that we're not big gamblers but we do put a fair bit into the slot machines. I also wasn't particularly keen on the casino either. I know it's not anyone's fault but I felt that there was just no atmosphere and I got bored in there (which isn't like me at all). Overall, Bally's is a nice enough hotel and in a great location especially with having the Monorail station behind it but I can't see us staying there again. I think we'd both prefer to go back to the Excalibur again where it seems to be more fun.

Reviews.Title: “Super cheap in the middle of the strip”
Reviews.Author: lityerses
Reviews.Content: This place is great for a cheap trip to vegas! The casino is also connected by underground walkway to Paris which helps tremendously when looking for good tables or machines. I absolutely loved staying here when I was in a gambling mood.

Reviews.Title: “Bally's did not provide a clean room”
Reviews.Author: mikew414
Reviews.Content: No problem with check in at Bally's. I used the old $20 trick and was upgraded to a "mini suite". I did not see a difference between Bally's normal room and the mini suite. When we arrived we noticed a stir stick from a drink under the desk. The stir stick stayed there until we checked out 4 days later. I purposely left a candy wrapper in part of the room. It was never picked up. I don't think the room was vacuumed. Now on the the bathroom. It did not have a fan so the mirror and the room were total steam by the time you finished taking a shower. The heat vent was caked with dust and dirt. Disgusting! Las Vegas has too many newer places to waste your money at Bally's.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value for money”
Reviews.Author: fyeolm
Reviews.Content: Loved Bally's. It is not themed like a lot of the big hotels but it as central as you can get so it is walking distance to most places you would want to go. We were upgraded at no extra charge and the room was brilliant and very quiet. We had breakfast in the hotel which was a buffet and good value for money. Some people say the hotel is dated but we found it to be bright and clean. They could do with more people on reception. If you catch it wrong you can end up in a long queue waiting to check in/out. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Ballys was a wonderful hotel in a great...”
Reviews.Author: radawalk
Reviews.Content: Ballys was a wonderful hotel in a great location, mid strip. Very clean & modern & excellent value. We will be staying here again when we go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Locale, average rooms”
Reviews.Author: johnnytaco733
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at Bally's twice. The first time I was with my girlfriend so I upgraded to the north tower. Room was pretty nice and renovated. Second time I went I got a south tower room with college buddies. This room was pretty gross and could easily have been at the sahara. Missing furniture, broken lamps, etc. Since we don't care about that kind of thing, it was still fine. All I wanted is a bed, and these rooms had them, and they were clean. I would recommend staying here because the location is good. The casino is also kind of boring if you're under 30 years old. I wouldn't pay more than $100 a night to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Very central, not themed therefore quieter than themed hotels.”
Reviews.Author: Pedalkath
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel twice and each time we have been very pleased with our room. The first visit we did not upgrade our room and was very happy with that room, this visit we did upgrade but it seemed to be the same as on our first visit. On our first visit we were allocated a room on the floor which had just been refurbished We have visited Vegas 7 times and still prefer this hotel; although we have not stayed at the very expensive hotels (sorry to say !) Other hotels we found to be noisier. In any case do not accept a room opposite ice machine or lift. But then again, in Vegas do not have a room too far from lift - as those corridors are very very long. Each visit my husband and I were accompanied by my sister and her husband. We shared the cost of a cabanna. The first time it was very good, but this year there did not seem to be as many soft drinks, etc. in the fridge. We decided to hire a cabanna as my brother-in-law burns in the sun (even more than I do !). The pool at Bally's is very clean and large with plenty of sun loungers. To get the "very expensive" feel you can, of course, visit all the most expensive hotels/casinos. A must is the Grand Canyon trip - we went by helicopter to the floor of the Canyon and had a champagne lunch. Expensive but well worth it. The Hoover Dam is also amazing. The atmosphere of Downtown with the laser show is well worth a visit. A taxi doesn't cost the earth. One more thing - we booked direct with hotel via phone. Got a good deal and when we phoned again, we got a reduced price. So all in all, very pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Awful rooms dirty and they smell!”
Reviews.Author: Askluytr
Reviews.Content: We arrived 9/29/10 checked in and went to our room walked in and right back out. The room was so awful I would not have even let a dog stay there. It smelled of vomit and urine and had stains on the carpet and would be afraid to even sit down for fear of getting something. We went back to the desk where they upgraded us for 20.00 dollars more a night. It wasn't worth it the room smelled and we ended up buying room air fresheners just to complete our stay. Customer service left alot to be desired ( people not very friendly). I would not recommend anyone to stay at this casino. We won't stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised!”
Reviews.Author: Islandguy53
Reviews.Content: After a great deal of reading reviews, we decided on Ballys. Asked for a North Tower upgrade. They were gonna charge $20/night. Said no, so they upgraded the 4 of us for free! What a treat. The room was awesome, clean and everything worked. Didn't see the S.Tower rooms, so can't compare. Pool was fantastic. $1 margarita bar kept us going all night long. spent lots of time on the slots and as long as we tipped the waitress $1 ea drink, the booze flowed! Slots payouts not bad. Staff all very pleasant. even met a woman at the front desk from Richmond, BC! Sidewalk Cafe food was good and reasonably priced. if you like dancing, you have to check out the lounge w/live band. They are fantastic! Can't say enough about Bally's. As far as shows go, Tony & Tina's wedding is a must see. We've never had so much fun.

Reviews.Title: “One lonely jelly bean!”
Reviews.Author: wingriderAustralia
Reviews.Content: We just stayed for three nights. Overall, we had a great time. We arrived and check-in took about 10 minutes and our room was ready. All very friendly. Our room was spacious and in the north tower. This is considered the nicest. It was very clean, well serviced during our stay and everything worked well. The tvs are a bit out of date though.... We ate at a number of the restaurants and they were all good, maybe a bit pricey? The sandwich shop in the corner was good and the japanese in the arcade very good value and great food and service. We did find the extra charge for using the safe of $3 per day a bit strange as in Australia these are free! Check-out went smoothly too.... So, the "lonely jelly bean" I hear you ask? Well, this is our only gripe.... the corridors have food trays and glasses left in them that don't seem to be cleared up. Similarly, the corridor carpets are not vacuumed. Two doors down there was an orange jelly bean on the corridor floor.... it was there the whole three nights and four days of our stay! But out room was very clean..... we'll take the good with the bad! On balance a very good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Needs Updating”
Reviews.Author: trlett
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Bally's sveral times and like it, however, this time I stayed in a South Tower Classic room. Big mistake. Pay the extra money for an upgraded room. The carpet in my room has a big stain in the entrance, and the furnitire is worn and broken. This is a room I would expect in a budget hotel, but not at a hotel in the Harrah's chain. I still like the hotel and casino, just not this tower,

Reviews.Title: “I would stay here again. Great Location. Everything around you.”
Reviews.Author: aleahmarie
Reviews.Content: This was our frist trip to Vegas for my birthday and we got an amazing deal so we didn't know what to expect from this hotel. However, I must say that we had a great time at Bally's/Paris and even won some $ while we were there. They do not offer a free shuttle service, however, they recommended ShowtimeTours and for $12 you get a round trip ticket from the airport which was a good deal vs. paying for a cab. They only downside to that is you have to stop off at several other hotels to drop other passengers off depending on where you are located on the strip so it may take about 40 mins from the time you sit in the shuttle to the time you are in the line at check in. The check in line was fairly good except for the party of 50 Asian Tour Bus travellers infront of us with one check in window open for a Monday night. We were standing in line for about 10-15 minutes when they opened another window. Check in was a breeze and we stayed on the 12th floor in the North Tower. I got the two queen beds because it's nice to have an extra bed for clothes, shopping, stuff- the extra space is nice. The room and bathroom were very spacious and seemed clean enough which was a pleasant surprise. The only negative was the huge stain on the floor of "whatever" but this is Vegas and not a 5 star resort so we didn't care and besides you are never in your room anyways. We had a view of Paris next door & a partial view of the Fountains at Bellagio next door. This hotel is in a prime location in the middle of the strip so it just depends on how far you want to walk "up or down" it. Visiting other casinos/hotels I did notice that the air quality in Bally's was horrible if you plan to sit there for a long time. Everything reaked of smoke and the air was thick. At other places it was not this bad. We did not make use of the shuttles etc. perhaps next time. We just walked all the way down to MGM and got as far up as the Venetian. It was about 100 degrees outside so take water with you. There are several restaurants in the Bally's/Paris casinos. We didn't get to try the ones in Paris but we ate at the Sidewalk cafe- Most disgusting food EVER!!!! Do not eat there. It's cheap and the food is horrible. At the Tequila lounge the $2 tacos are good and the quesidillas are good as well...you would think it would be the "same food" in the same casino but OMG the food at the Sidewalk Cafe is gross. Overall our stay was good. If we get a deal that good again we would probably stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Bally's North Tower was Awesome”
Reviews.Author: rahop22
Reviews.Content: I have heard some negative reviews about Bally's and was a little nervous about staying here. I had comps for most of the nights of my trip for the South Tower room and upgraded to the North Tower room at check-in. The rooms were very spacious and the bed was comfortable. I liked the room better than Paris or NYNY. The casino is small compared to other casinos and doesn't have as much slot variety but still enough to keep me entertained. The food offerings in the casino were small as well. However, overall the stay was perfect and I would definitely recommend anyone (except for real snobs) to give Bally's a chance and stay there. I will be going back in November and staying at Bally's and may even give the South Tower a try and post a review about the room.

Reviews.Title: “We Liked Bally's”
Reviews.Author: AlbertsMom
Reviews.Content: We were VERY skeptical after reading several reviews, but we liked Bally's. Stayed in a North Tower Room 9/25 thru 9/29. Check in on a Saturday morning around 11am and waited about 10 minutes. Room was very clean and each day housekeeping was there by 10am. Went to the Tequila Bar for $1 margaritas and $1 beef or chicken tacos. While playing table games and/or slots, cocktail servers came often and wait wasn't that long for a drink. Went to the pool a couple days. Only complaint would be the lifeguards don't show up until 10am and you can't go into the pool until they are there. I think I heard the pool closes around October 21st and reopens in April. Cocktail waitress comes around often for drinks and/or food service. Casino is fine-- I hit for 250.00 on a nickel machine playing only 5 lines. You cannot beat the location of Bally's. It was right across the street from Bill's and we saw Big Elvis. We have also stayed at the Venetian and Planet Hollywood (loved them both), but still enjoyed Bally's.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Big Rooms, and clean!”
Reviews.Author: Gwen1981
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 days and 4 nights, we went on vacations, the locations of this hotel is the center of everything but the hotels that are at the begginning of the strip and the end! felt very far away!! We were right infront on the bellagio fountains!, having breakfast was great because you have lots of choices surrounding you. The Staff was very nice since we got there they were very helful, the line to check in was a little long but was going fast. I made the reservation via travelocity with a package of flight, i did not specify if i wanted non-smoking or smoking, so as soon as we got there i requiere a smoking room cause my parter smokes and they gave us a 2 queen bed room very spacious! nice view, and very clean!! I had read riviews from other users and was doubtful of what i was going to get of a room! as soon as I open the door i was very pleased! and happy with the choice made of reserving in ballys. The nights were very quiet just the last night we got a neighbor that did not stop talking out loud and we could hear her like it was in our room! the walls are not sound proof.. About the cleaness everyday the hotel maids take care of the room left it like we had just arrived. So I am very happy with our Stayed.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed with upgrade”
Reviews.Author: TripLoverMA
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at Bally's for two nights. Upon checking in we were asked if we wanted to upgrade our room to a suite at an additional cost. We decided to do the upgrade. The room was very large with a spa type tub, shower, two closets, two vanity/sink areas which were all open to the sleeping area. The tub and shower etc. area are two steps up from the sleeping area. As a precaution they have installed a light in the bath area that goes on by motion. This is very annoying at night, if you have to get up, however we do understand the safety reasoning. Our other issue was maid service never happened which we never discovered until very late at night. It was our word against housekeepings word that the room had been cleaned. Hotel management did however, comp us for one night upgrade. They also called to let us know about the comp after we had already gone to bed and were asleep. Also, we felt the room is very dated and could use a new look. Overall we were not happy with our accommodations and probably won't stay again.

Reviews.Title: “South Tower is decorated a la Goodwill - prepare for poor service throughout”
Reviews.Author: COSpringSkier
Reviews.Content: If you absolutely MUST stay at Bally's pay the extra $20 for the North Tower, prepare for lines at the front desk no matter what time of the day or night you check in. They specialize in being understaffed and sullen service. I had a ridiculous urge to get a vacuum with an edging attachment in the halls of the towers. And if you saw my housekeeping at home you would know this is a unusual urge for me! You could see the dust and dirt at the edges of the hall. If you go with the South Tower bring your own cleaning supplies and perhaps sheets. We switched rooms after the first night so I will summarize both: South - second string on cleaning crew and linens. The sheets had lots of holes, definitely fodder for the rag bag. They were so gray my daughter put a t-shirt over hers as a pillow case. A few of the towels were either dirty and folded well or clean and folded very poorly. We decided on dirty to be sure. The caulk in the tub was black. The paint in the bathroom hadn't been touched in years and the wallpaper was peeling A LOT. Our furniture was so beat up I swear the stuff we got at Goodwill for my son's college apartment is nicer. The lamps were broken - not just nonfunctioning, but with lampshades askew, or in one case - below the light bulb. When they say "nonrenovated" to account for the price break, they mean NEVER renovated. The furniture has never been upgraded since the 70's. The cleaning crew was dismal. We came in to our room after it was made up and I thought my kids had made the beds. They were messy and lumpy. The carpet was just nasty. Overall just to unpleasant to stay in for three nights. North Tower room - better, but still holes in the sheets. Carpet still filthy, but a perfectly adequate room. Since the building is older the ventilation in the casino is horrible. It is the smokiest one we went in. I think they compensate for this by keeping the AC cranked up. The halls in the towers were like meat coolers. Again, if you must stay here (we had a wedding reception there and didn't want a long walk back afterward) go with the North Tower and then get to another casino to play. Unless you are a smoker, in which case you won't mind. Bright spots - the pool staff is very friendly. They'll help you scrounge for chairs when it's full and are very welcoming. The pool, sadly is nothing special and quite loud. (We coveted the Ballagio Pool A LOT). There's no catch to the $1 margaritas and tacos at Tequila's and the bartender was great. He needs to give lessons because he's the only friendly staff member we found outside of the pool. We will never stay here again. Even if there's a wedding there, we will stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Downtown value on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: jtothemfnk
Reviews.Content: We took a cab from the airport and the cabbie recommended Ellis Island Casino for the steak special( we haven't gone yet )we let the very friendly doorman take our bags, he gave us a claim check, we tipped him and went to check in unencumbered. No line to check in, it was Monday. The desk clerk was very friendly and efficient. We walked through the casino to the elevators and up to our room. It was a short walk and then on the 10th floor we walked through a pretty long hall to the very end to find our wonderful suite. Walked into a small hallway opening up to a living/bed area with a nice couch and coffe table and armoir with drawers and tv(regular). Just up two marble steps was our great Jacuzzi with mirrored closets and his and hers sinks on each side and seperate shower, so nice. Our window was a balcony that did not open but we would not have opened it anyway as it was 100 degrees outside. The view was the side of Imperial Palace and looking to the right we saw the Bellagio Fountains! So cool. Great room for the money. We called the bellstand and gave them our claim check number. We were told that Cliff, their best bellman, would be up soon with our stuff. A few minutes later he arrived with our bags and a smile and a bucket of ice! We got to have cocktails right away(we brought booze in the suitcase, mixers in the hallway vending machine, bellman brings ice, voila!) He deserved the big tip we gave him and helped us with some info we needed to get to chillin' right away. We unpacked and went to the pool. You walk through the casino where they have a few very affordable restaurants. One Mexican place with $2 beers and margaritas. There was also a pizza place and many other places to eat with inexpensive drinks, cheaper than gambling and getting free drinks! Ice cream and hot dogs and shops of all sorts on the way to the nice pool. The pool was large enough and not crowded plenty of chairs in the sun and a large bar with fairly cheap drinks for Vegas. They had 2 for 1 beers that they brought in ice buckets. No water slide, bummer. Jacuzzi area was like kiddie pool. The monorail goes right by the pool which was a nice sight. We joined the Total Rewards and got the coupon book which had 2 for 1 Jubilee! tickets. It would have been great at full price. The location is perfect to go to all the other casinos. We will be back

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: Flyers111
Reviews.Content: Room was not as we were told when we made the reservations. We were told there would be a jacuzzi tub in the rooms, but it was a bath tub. We were told there would be refridgerators in the rooms, again there wasn't. They did bring my room a fridge, but it would get or keep anything cold. There was mildew in the shower area. And the icing on the cake, the last night were there I found a long finger nail in our bed. It had probably been there the whole week. Definitely would not stay there again. We had a total of seven rooms and upon check in the upgraded one room. So, he was very happy with his room. The other six however were not so great.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't stay and wouldn't”
Reviews.Author: winpop
Reviews.Content: We had considered staying at Paris this time, but ended up at Venetian instead. Glad we did. Ran into a couple at Jubilee who had stayed at Bally's and got the bait and switch run around -- that is, booked a non-smoking room, but were handed a smoking room, with the sorry, we're full story that I've read elsewhere here. Only provided the correct room after complaining. Our experience: After making our way through the gauntlet of 'flippers' that congregate in front of this hotel, we thought we were safe. No such luck, as soon as we entered the hotel, we were accosted with shouts of 'free show'. No problem -- we have learned that these people are liars, so we always lie right back and say "We are flying out later today". Wandering through the property, we were accosted no less than three more times for free shows, free TV show, etc. and once more before leaving by the same person who shouted at us as we entered. Seriously! Can you imagine staying at some place so aggressive and annoying. The flippers are more polite. At least they stop when you don't reach out to take the flyer. Bally's staff actually stopped us outside the bathrooms after dinner to ask us a second time if we wanted to reconsider 'now that you've eaten'. (You were watching us?) Another refused to answer a question regarding directions when we indicated that we weren't interested. Another, in response to my "I'm flying out today" answer, "what are doing right now?". I know times are hard, but that type of aggression makes for a very unpleasant atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Aside from the parking, would stay again”
Reviews.Author: tamick
Reviews.Content: Room was in the North Tower 18, roomy but always felt too warm, did not like the way the air is set up for that style of room, blows one way, directly out and the bathroom was always warm and humid. They did accomodate a late check-out as we had a red-eye flight the day we were to leave, and charged half the rate of that days' room rate to check out at 4:00. They share a parking garage with Paris, and it is quite a walk for those who rent or have their personal vehicles. We literally spent 1/2 hour one evening "circling" to even find an empty space. overall, *I* would stay again, my husband says he would not. "split decision." And I was a bit surprised at the so-called "surcharge" for internet. We thought $14.00 per day PER laptop was excessive.

Reviews.Title: “Big rooms, great location, old and dated hotel.”
Reviews.Author: IronmanNC
Reviews.Content: We were here for a convention and it was our first time here so the location was great being in th heart of the strip. The rooms were big and so were the bathrooms, but the carpeting was old and the furniture was worn. The place also needed a fresh coat of paint. The food at the hotel was horrible and pricey, take a tip and walk out to another hotel. Hash house a go go was a great deal and so are the restaurants @ planet hollywood miracle mile. Ballys has a free pool but you've got to pay for gym use @ $22 a day. Overall, it's just ok and noth the Vegas wow we were expecting. Next time, we'll stay @ Ceasars or one of the newer hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Tys63
Reviews.Content: Bally's is great value for money. Its location in the heart of the strip allows acess to all the main casinos. We had a room in the North Tower with a King Bed. It was clean and serviced very well every day. Bally's might be a little bit older but is still in good condition. Its not going to be as plush as Bellagio but your are not going to have the cost either.

Reviews.Title: “Classic Vegas Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JerryOXeniaOhio
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for six nights in September 2010. This hotel/casino is a classic Vegas style hotel. We enjoyed our stay very much. We have visited Vegas many times before and this hotel is as good as you can get. They don't have a buffet, but this hotel is connected to Paris, and they have an excellent buffet. The pool at Ballys is also a classic. It is a no frills quiet place to relax. I will comment on the housekeeping service. Whenever we travel we always seem to get lousy housekeeping service. ( Not cleaned or no fresh towels etc.). Our room at Ballys was always cleaned up when we returned from the pool or casino or sightseeing. I do wish they would put in a food court like other properties have done. The only complaint I have with this hotel is that the elevators are way too slow. The location of this hotel is on the center of the strip. It is very close to a lot of other Harrahs properties. I would not hesitate to recommend this property to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with Ballys”
Reviews.Author: Texas_Bubba
Reviews.Content: This was our first time to stay at Ballys and even though it was comped, I was concerned after reading some of the other reviews. We also got a second room for my daughter and granddaughter who flew in from Hawaii to see us and we got a "Friends and Family" rate for them at 40.00 a night. I was really concerned about the reports of slow checkins. We arrived about 6 pm on a Wednesday and there were about 20 people in line but we got the counter in about 10 minutes. I explained to the clerk that since my kids had never been there before, we would like rooms as close as possible and she was able to get us on the same floor ( 24th North tower) about 10 rooms apart so I was pleased with that. They have elevators for floors 16-25 and we never waited more that 3 to 4 minutes for an elevator. Rooms were quite large and had all the standard features including a coffee maker. The safe was 3 dollars per day and we didn't use it but my grandaughter did decide to try it out. This charge was removed on checkout. Overall, we were very please and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “STEADY AS SHE GOES”
Reviews.Author: blueswriter
Reviews.Content: Ballys is the model of a "good:" enduring second generation las vegas casino hotel...Not Great, Not mediocre...but definitely showing it's age. Rooms and Services are still good, and the casino has a comfortable layout...not too big that you get lost in it (i.e. MGM) and not too small that you can't move around if the people in your area annoy you. Spa and pool are also "good" but nothing "wow" about them. Connecting walkway to Paris Hotel and close access to Bill's, Caesar's, Planet Hollywood, Bellagio and even City Center still give Bally's a great central Strip location with easy access from the Airport. Food choices are limited and lack the flash of higher priced neighboring properties. Harrah's continues to annoy with ridiculously high prices for silly items like coffee, etc...and there still is not Starbucks or comparable vendor on site ...perhaps that's intentional so you must visit neighboring Harrah's properties, or just buy their overpriced coffee from the lobby kiosk...still annoying for a hotel of this size. I still give it three and a half yawns for still being around and viable. Not a bad place to end up, especially if you don't want to pay a fortune for a room at some of the newer properties. Good place for a layover or short visit.

Reviews.Title: “Bally's is worth the value for the location alone."”
Reviews.Author: maggiesdadIllinois
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at this hotel. Both rooms were spacious and clean. We paid a convention rate for the rooms which provided added value. The hotel is centrally located on the strip, which made walking convenient. Being connected to Paris provided additional shopping and gaming benefits. The pool is large and has a nice, private setting. Some decor is a bit dated and the landscaping along the walkway to the strip needs more care and attention. It reinforces the visitor that Bally's is not in the same league as Bellagio, Mirage, MGM, and Caesar's Palace. But that would be easy to rectify by replacing dead plants. None-the-less, we would not hesitate to return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “no concern to offer amenities”
Reviews.Author: honestchobe
Reviews.Content: I had requested a coffee maker and was told they never offer those to guests. The manager refused to assist me with my concern and did not even apologize for their lack of customer care. If conceirge was available to assist, I was not informed. Also as a single traveling business person, I usually use the exercise equipment- again, they do not have that either. There is a spa next door that opens at 6am ($22 a day) but for conferences and work, this is too late in the day. Also to use the "business center" to print my boarding pass, $5 for 5 minutes. They offer bare bones accomodations. No airport transportation. I have never stayed at such an expensive hotel ($185) that offered me nothing in the way of ammenities. I was booked here for a conference and had not known about the lack of ammenities until the last minute. I am a frequent traveler and NEVER experienced this previously. If I could have stayed at the Hilton or Marriott I would have changed my plans if I hadn't already been locked in to this facility.

Reviews.Title: “Bally's has the best location!”
Reviews.Author: stomps1955
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in Bally's on the two ocassions I have visited Las Vegas and each time it has been a very enjoyably stay. The location is great - right in the middle of the strip with great access to Bellagio, Paris, Caesar's, Flamingo and the rooms are HUGE! Unlike most casinos on the strip and in Vegas, it is clear in Bally's exactly which way to go to find your room and you do not have to wander around the casino area to do this - there is a clear walkway from check-in to the guest floor elevators. Staff are very helpful and friendly, the pool is great. There is an indoor walkway to next door Paris hotel and down by the Bally's avenue of shops is the monorail station. Although I have never eaten in the restaurants I'm told the steakhouse is the best on the strip and will definately be checking that out next time I am in town!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, would stay again”
Reviews.Author: kg57
Reviews.Content: First of all - we were fleeced by the cab driver on the way from the airport. Not the hotel's fault of course, and naturally we had no one but ourselves to blame for volunteering the info that we were first-time visitors. We didn't find out until the way back out to the airport, when our reaction to the second cab ride was "we're here already??" Check-in was pretty good, only about a 15 minute wait; however it was early evening on a Sunday, and I did see much longer waits on Thursday afternoon. We were offered a small upgrade to the North Tower and took it, mainly because of reviews I'd seen here. The room was quite large and the bathroom had been recently refurbished. The furniture seemed fairly new but was rather bland - however if I want fancy furniture I'll go to the Bellagio or Venetian. We didn't eat at the hotel much; only small snacks at the Sidewalk Cafe and Tequila Bar. The pool was excellent with great bar service (no food except on weekends at this time of year). However, as others have said, the pool is a loooong walk from the rooms. You'd better be sure you have everything you need before you head there. Transportation - we got a 3-day pass for the monorail which was quite good value (regular 1-trip is $ 5.00, the pass is $ 28.00). However, be aware that there can be a long walk at the stations. In some, you actually have to take an "up" escalator before going back down to the street level. Also, the south-end station is the MGM grand. We had such a long walk through the casino that I didn't think we were ever going to see the light-of-day again before we finally got back out to The Strip. We did see the Jubilee revue show which I would rate "very good" and my husband would rate "superb". Bally's might seem a bit ho-hum compared to the big "theme" resorts but it's a great value.

Reviews.Title: “ROOM WAS A DUMP”
Reviews.Author: sjmballer
Reviews.Content: My husband and I along with my parents stayed here only one night after a long flight from Texas because of delays due to bad weather. .... the rooms are very very very dated ..carpet appeared to have dirty white stains did not walk barefoot at all...we were even scared to lay under the bed linen and we froze all night because the air conditioner would not cut off to comfortable temperature even with air off the room kept a damp feeling ...just all around dirty feel....Ballys probably had it going on back in the day but the entire hotel needs a major overhaul expecially the ancient age rooms.....we did not feel like we were in vegas it felt like we were being punished ...the next morning we decided to check out of this dungeon of hotel....what an experience..

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, Great location needs a bit of a makeover but enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: andytudor46
Reviews.Content: All of us stayed in 2 standard room with a connected door to another room for 5 nights We arrived at the hotel and checked in and went to our rooms, the room was nice a bit standard i guess but clean couldn’t fault a thing could do with a bit of modernisation The reception area was nice but I am use to a non-smoking hotel and was a bit much Smokey in the evening, you can access the Paris hotel via Ballys and there are plenty of restaurants which was nice They charge for the gym that is very disappointing and they don’t have wi fi the Location was great couldn’t fault the location it was in the middle of everything The casino was great we had a really good time drinking and playing the games, we met some right people anyways lol On a whole i would stay at the Ballys again cause of the location and for a budget hotel, it was far better than some hotels we visited eg circus circus!! but i would stay somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “4th stay at Ballys, can't wait to go back next year”
Reviews.Author: ksgsnooki
Reviews.Content: Just back from a week at Bally's. 4th time at this Hotel, not disappointed. Everything about our stay was perfect and the rates were great. The drinks service was very slow, other Hotels had a better cocktail service. Champagne breakfast the Hilton was fab, renewed vows for 30th anniversary in Lake Mead, Cannot get enough of Vegas and Bally's.

Reviews.Title: “good price, great location”
Reviews.Author: penelope&skipper
Reviews.Content: Bally's is a great place to stay! Great location, right by tram... if you don't want to take a taxi. It seemed to be rigtht in the middle of Las Vegas. We even got a free fridge for the room. I will stay here again! Beds were comfy... did not feel at all like a regular hotel bed. I also enjoyed that it was connected to the Paris hotel via an indoor shopping route.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: TheVicster
Reviews.Content: I have been to Vegas many times and have stayed up and down the strip. I like to stay in the middle though and usually stay at the Mirage. This time was traveling with folks with limited resources so tried picking a hotel that cost a little less. Our room for four nights ended up being a total of $674, which I felt was not much of a bargain. Part of the price was an upgrade which cost an add. $80. The upgrade was offered at check in for the North Tower that we were told had been redone. If these rooms were the refurbished rooms I would not have wanted to see the South Tower. The rooms were clean, the beds were comfortable and the towels plentiful. The carpet was old and worn with stains in places but did look like it had recently been cleaned. The bathroom was clean, no mold around the tub/shower and the shower curtain was clean. Around the vanity though the wood was marked with peeling paint and chips in the wood and the wallpaper. Check in was easy as there were very few people at the hotel when we checked in on a Wed evening. The tables and slots had almost no one at them, I had never seen a casino this empty before. But I will say the airport was pretty empty also. Our cap driver did say that things were slow. We had breakfast the first morning at Ballys buffett, but was not worth the $10.99 it cost. Very limited selection and there was only one person working to refill items and there were enough people eating that most dishes were empty for a while, the wait staff though were very good. All in all this is an ok place to stay if you get a good room rate. Nothing fancy but nothing horrible either. The greatest drawback in my opinion was the distance you had to go to get to the pool. Yes it is a nice pool with lots going on there but it is a good 15 min walk from your room. And we did have a coffe pot in our room.

Reviews.Title: “Value for the money”
Reviews.Author: Iam2cold
Reviews.Content: We booked a 4 night stay at Bally's for $65 per night.
