I appreciated some of the comments of previous reviewers and I would note the following: Service was prompt and staff were very pleasant to deal with. We were upgraded to the North Tower. The room was spacious and very quiet. My only complaint (and it is a small one) is that the toilet was quite noisy when flushed . Bally's is central to the strip so the location is excellent. You can pick up the Metro Bus to Freemont in front of the Paris 1 block south. I would not recommend the breakfast buffet at the sidewalk cafe (average at best). We did not use any of the other restaurants at this site. I thought the pool was great, with lots of lounge chairs. The fitness center\spa was $22 per day which was a little hard to swallow. However, if you go after 3 pm it is half price and well worth it for a work out, steam and hot tub. For the North tower we experienced no issues with the elevators (as I have noted from previous reviews). When we checked out there was no charge on the room for the safe (which was supposed to be $3 per day) and they waived the local phone charge. If you are happy with a 3 star hotel that is centrally located on the strip I would recommend this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: airbrush101
Reviews.Content: I was comped 2-nites here in mid August, I also spent 2-nites at the Orleans on this trip. I would rate Bally's a 3.5 because of their great location on the strip. I walked to Ellis Island twice while staying there, and I also like the easy access to the mono-rail. I stayed in a 2-queen bed room in the north tower. A decent room with a view of Bill's/Flamingo. Never ate there, and didn't like gambling there because they didn't have $5, 3:2 blackjack tables. They did have a good band in the lounge though! I'm not sure I would stay here if I had to pay for the room.

Reviews.Title: “Going down slowly...”
Reviews.Author: jthutmd
Reviews.Content: Excellent front desk speed at check-in. Friendly staff. But the room is atrocious. Old furniture and worn out carpet. Some of the hardware in the bathroom probably should be rerplaced. Good security. Nice functioning change machines. Parking is good around back. BUT I go to Vegas 2 or 3 times a year and Total Rewards has other places to stay. I probably will pick somewere else. No coffeemaker in the room. No water in the room. Menu is nice but overpriced. Good room service. Basically we did not stay in the room making it easy to ignore the place.

Reviews.Title: “Great, Central Location”
Reviews.Author: LeahBelle22
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a comp visit with my fiance and his 10 year old daughter. The room was clean and big enough for us three. Bally's is not the most updated hotel but for the value it's great to be right in the center of the strip. We were able to walk to the Bellagio fountains and to the M&M and Coca-Cola stores. The hotel is connected to the Paris hotel, which has a delicious buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Never EVER return to this hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Juicealyn
Reviews.Content: I've just recently returned from Vegas for the long weekend, and the purpose of the trip was for my cousins wedding. The main reason I had booked Bally's was because of the location, and it was one of the more affordable hotels located right on the strip. The first 24 hours was horrible!!! After a long night of casino hopping, we had returned to our room around 1:00am, I had pulled over the covers to my bed and what do I find, bed bugs crawling on the top sheet. I was horrified and disgusted, so I had called the front desk and was informed to come downstairs to get keys to a new room. When I had arrived at the front desk they were apologetic but that was it. I had then moved rooms, and around 4:30 am was rudely awaken when 2 men tried to break into our room. I had called down to the front desk again and had told them that there are 2 men outside trying to force the door open and if they could send security up immediately to handle the situation. This continued for 10 minutes and no one had shown up, nor did anyone follow up with us. The next morning I went down to security and spoke to the manager as to why no one was sent up, they had said that the front desk had never informed them of a complaint, so that's why no one was ever sent up. After this conversation I went and spoke to the front desk manager who was again apologetic but that was it, she never addressed the fact that her staff did nothing when I had called that evening for security to be sent up. She offered nothing for the inconvenience that we had experienced. I had told her that I was very unhappy with the service and the way the hotel and staff had handled this situation. Overall, the location was great, however, I will NEVER EVER stay at this hotel again, nor would I ever recommend this property to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Our room was a hell hole”
Reviews.Author: vagabond21
Reviews.Content: I cannot believe Bally's had the nerve to charge money for this room. The dressers had broken drawers. The lampshades hadn't been dusted in months. Dust was caked around the base of the lamps & TV. There was no comfortable chair to sit in. I was offended that Bally's thought so little of me as a guest. Bally's obviously doesn't want me back. Nor do they want me to recommend them - so I won't go back and I won't recommend Bally's to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Another great experience...but beware”
Reviews.Author: laponzio
Reviews.Content: We had another great experience at Ballys. However, our las stay a couple of months ago the carpet was filthy. That being said, the service was great. Even recovered a Chanel purchase left at the machines (dummy me). The guard that steered me to lost-and-found was especially nice. Stakes are good. Shopping VERY mediocre. Spa. Too far from rooms but, excellence service!

Reviews.Title: “Great location no personality for check in staff”
Reviews.Author: MsMimee
Reviews.Content: The service to check in was slow and the line was not even long. The staff behind the counter was trying to see who can do the least behind the counter. We made our reservation 2 months in advance and we had to beg for everything that we had requested. The maid service was great the location was nice. The people movers were always broke, at least one or more. I loved the Casino I just wish they would have better smoke removal system. I wish that they would have a no smoking section for gamblers. We used the vending machine and it ate our money we tried to get it back and that was a joke. Best to go to Walgreen's or CVS. It would be nice to have a coffee maker in the room and get a free news paper like USA today. I hope the hotel management reads this and learns from their mistakes.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth the trip!!”
Reviews.Author: Blvdgrl55
Reviews.Content: Went to Vegas in Nov. 2009 for son's wedding. Extended families flew in and had 4 rooms booked for 5 nights. Staff was very apologetic when room was not ready at check in time. Gladly took our luggage and stored it while we waited. Were greeted promptly and was amazed at the lobby and people that were there checking in. Check in moved quickly as did check out when we left. Rooms were clean and it got a little confusing as to what tower we needed to go to. Had a view of the Paris hotel and could see the fountains at the Bellagio at night although did go across the street to watch also. Have stayed in Vegas twice before and this was the best value for the money and it was convenient for walking and getting around. One of the nicer places to stay in Vegas

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: MSCBrisbane
Reviews.Content: This property is great for those who can't afford to stay at the Bellagio or Ceasar's Palace but want to be on the strip & amongst the action: *Clean/ large rooms *View wasn't anything special * Good facilities * Not over crowded/ too busy *Front desk staff very helpful I would stay again

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Acmeflower
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 days on our 25th wedding anniversary. We have stayed at many hotels in vegas. We had booked a room with king bed. On check in, they could not accomodate us but the next morning they gave us directions on how to change rooms and this was done in a very quick manner. I will give them kudos for that. The hotel lobby is very noisy. The casino was not the best I have been in but we always ended our night gambling here. The location of this hotel is good. The towels were very large, soft and fluffy. This is an important item to me. Soaps were very nice too. For the price, this was a decent hotel. I would say that it serves the average person well. The pool was really nice. It is large and we were able to find a cozy spot that gave us a bit of privacy. The bar is very nice. The drinks are pricey but well worth it. We always purchased the $16.00 drinks in the blue plastic container because we could refill with ice, water or pop. One of those alcoholic beverages is all you need to last you all day. There was a DJ, encouraging guests to join in dances and contests to win drinks - what else - its vegas!!! I had a good time daily at the pool and I know you will too. There is no free wifi that I came across at the hotels in Vegas, It is available for a daily fee but I think they really want you to be in the casino. Afterall, what other reason do we go to Vegas for???

Reviews.Title: “Yes, Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: wesley1982
Reviews.Content: Looked at a lot of reviews, locations, and prices and this seemed to be the best for what we wanted to do: stay in the heart of the strip, in a safe area, inexpensive, bus stop close, and a shuttle to Rio. It is true that at times there is a long wait (like an hour) to check in. We made the best of it and talked to the other people standing in line. We were cheerful when we checked in and rewarded with an upgrade to the North Tower and a jacuzzi suite. It isn't their fault that management doesn't open enough check ins. Of course this is probably because sometimes throughout the day there aren't many people checking in. It would be nice if they could have a few people on stand by to fill in when busy. Our room was large. My daughter and I each had our own sink with a mirror as well as our own closet. We stayed on the 6th floor and had a view of the side street which showed part of Flamingo and Caesar's Palace. It was quiet in our room. Paris connects to Ballys and we had fun walking there and checking it out. The pool is a little of a walk, but the hotel and Casino are big. What would you expect? But the pool is worth the walk. There's a great Japanese Restaurant near the pool area: excellent service and reasonable prices. Shops along the way, too. I called the desk several times to ask questions about restaurants, the shuttle, the bus, etc. I was always greeted cheerfully and given good answers. The maids gave us anything we needed off of the carts. We don't smoke and didn't notice a smoke smell in the casino or on our clothes later. There isn't a fee for hotel use like some casinos. For the spa, but we weren't there for a spa. Lots of walking on the strip. Wear comfortable shoes. Email me for places to eat cheap. Very clean casino and hotel. Our first trip to Vegas and we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “less than average”
Reviews.Author: Sophiedward
Reviews.Content: Location of the hotel is excellent. Staff is very polite Bed is confortable, pillows are no so comfortable But the negative sides are: Gym is not free Pool is too far away, you need to go to another hotel to get there. AC is to loud and wakes you up at night Old TV set in which the remote control did not function properly No fridge No Wifi Have to pay to able to use the safe in the room No coffee machine No complementary water bottles that we usually get in other hotel rooms Shower is old, with mildew and shower head corroded and not able to adjust The room need a bit of renovation or upgrade.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, OK Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bulldogbaker
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Bally's when we went to Las Vegas last October for my Wife's birthday. The location really can't be beat. You are right in the middle of the strip and within walking distance to basically any hotel/casino that is located on the strip. A long walk is required for the hotels/casinos located on the far ends of the strip. The price is also very good for your location, but that is about where the good things end. The hotel itself is fairly old and in need of a renovation. The rooms are old and just not very nice, but I guess that is why you pay the lower price. The people in the room next to our ordered room service one day, and the leftovers set outside their room in the hallway for 3 nights before it was picked up!!! The casino is decent, but you are attached to Paris which has a much better casino you can go to. All in all if you want a hotel on the strip for cheap, this is a good one to stay at. Just don't expect too much out of your stay there.

Reviews.Title: “WOW awesome”
Reviews.Author: Srikantha
Reviews.Content: I booked a North Tower room for $38/night and got a free upgrade to a suite. The room was HUGE with his and hers bathroom sinks, full length mirrors all over the bathroom, a deep bath recessed into the floor, etc. We loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price and location.”
Reviews.Author: radegrote
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Bally's the week of August 15 through August 22. Yes, the rooms in the South Tower are not updated, but when you go to Vegas you don't spend a lot of time in your room. And the rooms are HUGE. We didn't mind that it was an older room. We found that even though the parking is a long ways away from the hotel (parking garage is shared with the Paris hotel) that is is one of the nicer and easier parking garages to use. The casino floor is not one of the larger ones on the strip, but it is about average in size. We thought that it was fairly nice sized. The bottom line is, you get what you pay for. If you want to be in a really nice hotel, then pay the extra. We knew that we were going to be in one of the medium priced hotels on the strip, and we got about what we expected.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: mike1Ohio
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at Ballys three to four times a year since 2007,and have allways had a wonderful stay. The service is second to none. Its location is the best in Vegas. If you want a great steak dont miss Ballys Steak House,best steak in Vegas. I would recommend staying there to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “NOT A 4 STAR HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: segedunum
Reviews.Content: The location is good - right in the centre of the action and it was probably attractive in the days of Sanatra/Dean Martin. Your room has no fridge, no coffee maker no wifi. If you want a 20 minute jog in the gym it costs 22 dollars. The hotel unashamedly exists to relieve you of your cash - hence the spartan bedroom facilities, even the pool closes at 7 pm to get you out spending money more quickly. Given the high cost I would stay in a less central economy hotel on a future visit and even after paying for a taxi you will have cash in pocket.

Reviews.Title: “awesome stay at a less fancy hotel”
Reviews.Author: xcapee
Reviews.Content: Ballys is not considered as an upmarket hotel by any means as it is part of the older generation of hotel/casinos on the Strip. However I was pleasantly surprised by the entire hotel and our room - mind you we were given a free upgrade. Our room was on the 24th floor with north views which looked very good at night. The room was spacious, luxurious and very clean. The beds themselves were the best I had on this trip and extremely comfortable and helped us get a good sleep despite the limited hours we were actually sleeping. Check-in was painless and quick and front desk/concierge were very helpful and housekeeping would leave messages on our phone to ask if we needed room service they would come up and fix it up as we had hung out the 'do not disturb' sign in the mornings. The hotel is centrally located, next to Paris Paris, Planet Hollywood, Flamingos and across the road from the ever popular Bellagio and Caesars Palace. They have special $1 tacos and margaritas which were pretty good and we took advantage of them. The gaming casino itself seemed okay, I didn't spend much time there as I preferred the party atmosphere of Planet Hollywood. Made gambling more fun even when losing! Ballys also has a pool out the back and although I didn't use it despite the ridiculous summer desert temperatures, I know it was popular from all the noise coming from it. Another highlight of Ballys is the Jubilee spectacular. It is the longest running Vegas production and you know why when you attend. Awesome costumes, dancers and sets make it a spectacle to remember and was definitely a highlight of my trip to Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, Centre Strip Hotel”
Reviews.Author: andrealantz
Reviews.Content: We arrived to Vegas in the afternoon, this was our 2nd time down. Our room was ready, and we checked it. Front desk staff were a little high pressure with upgrades. They showed us all our options starting at $25 extra per night. We were not interested, and politely turned her down. She asked several times. I got a voucher for a free spa service, but then had to pay $35 to enter the spa to redeem it, according to the spa receptionist. I thought this was ridiculous. What kind of gift is it when you have to pay to use it! HAHA, needless to say, I didn't use that. As with all other major hotels - there are time share sales people everywhere. We got asked about 4 times on the way to the elevator to get to our room. They just want you to tour the new hotel they are building, and there is no obligation to buy a time share. After it's all over, you have been fed, and get free show tickets. I would try it out, but I don't know why they want my credit card number. This makes me nervous, and is the reason I always say no. A couple tips to avoid the sales people - you have to be at least 25 and married. We would always say that we are younger, or we're leaving tonight, no time for a show. The room was nice. Updated within the last few days. Very large bathroom which was nice. Full closet. Couch and coffee table, as well as a desk. Very very spacious room. Probably one of the largest rooms I have been in. Nice view of the strip facing north. We were there for 5 nights. The room never got vaccummed. I spilled some crummbs in a very visible place on night 1, and they were still there when we left. We ran out of tissues that were never replaced, and I'm not convinced that our sheets were ever changed. We stayed in the North tower. Apparently this is the older one. You could see age in the hallways, but the rooms were very nice. My only complaint is that the room was actually pretty far away from the hotel lobby. We were near the back of the tower, elevators quite far, so to get out to the LV Blvd Sidewalk took a good 5-10 mins of walking. I had no problem with it, just would have been nicer to have been closer. The casino and lobby area are nice, although we didn't spend much time there. They didn't have any of the table games we liked open. They had a lot of tables closed when it was busy, which was strange to me. The esplanade down below the lobby floor is handy. A few gift stores and restos to grab a bite late at night. The pool is also down here, but was closed when we got there, which we did not know about. We were able to use the pool at Paris, but we did not. At the end of the esplanade, there is a stairway to go up to the monorail. We used this to go to the sahara ave area a few times. It was very quick, and handy. I don't think it's worth the price to go one or two stops, but when you want to travel the strip end to end, there is no faster way. The front of Bally's is awesome. Long moving sidewalks and escalators to get you up to the lobby. Neon lights, waterfalls and gardens. Quite the site at night and day time. Overall a great stay. We pretty much just slept there, and did not use the casino or restaurants there. The check in/out counter is very busy, and the casino is busy, but not many tables open. If we can get this hotel cheap, I would stay again! Although, given the choice, I actually prefer Bill's Gambling Hall, which is across Flamingo.

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: wildanimalpark27
Reviews.Content: We upgraded our room to a 2 story townhouse and the drapery motor was broken and so was the AC. The AC motor was so loud that you couldn't hear anything said in the room. I compared it to being next to the Hoover Dam motors. The furnishings were very dated, which surprised me. For an extra $65 per night, the room should have looked better. Who could sleep with drapes that let the sun in and I'm sure this problem had been reported and they knew it! We had a short time before going to a concert and all our free time was spent changing rooms. We wanted to take a shower before it but had no time. We were told to wait by the door to be let into another room and after 30 minutes, had to call for security to let us in. My husband went downstairs to get keys to the room 3 different times, since 2 didn't work but they acted like it was our fault! The chairs and carpet were filthy! There was too much light to show in the picture exactly how nasty the chairs were - dark stains and dirt all over the chairs. All the machines in the casino were set very tight so we don't think it's possible to win anything over a few dollars.

Reviews.Title: “IT IS OLD”
Reviews.Author: lydia57
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from las Vegas, this was my 5th trip and have stayed in other hotels, but Bally's was th worst. They did not make up the room when we left late (12noon), they did not clean it properly before we arrived, there was hair in one of the drawers (a clump) and an old soda bottle behind the curtian. The rooms are large, the beds okay. But the hotel is OLD and it looks it and feels like it. I have stayed in older hotels which made you feel like you were entering another time period, but this one made you feel like you entered an old deteriorating hotel. The Casino is okay, but the Waitresses are not a plentyful as the newer Casinos. As for location it is great as it is in the Mid-Strip Area.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: BigMikeOregon
Reviews.Content: Very Clean Friendly Staff Not very friendly of helpful front desk Tend to have numerous errors on bills and were hard to get rectified but ultimately did .

Reviews.Title: “Beware of check-in agents and so called "free" upgrades”
Reviews.Author: diasnanna
Reviews.Content: What a shame that the used car salesman ease of lying by the check-in agent caused a lot of grief on check-out over her so called "free" upgrade. We enjoyed the room, and Bally's rooms in the North Tower are great. Beware that the fine print on the check-in slip is for the extra charge of the upgrade. We were told it was just the cost of the room which we were signing for at the time (I even pointed to the room cost per night to ensure how much it would cost per night and repeated my question of the cost), but came to find out they use your initials to tell you that you knowingly signed for the additional cost of the upgrade. I asked the clerk three times to explain the cost of the room. She definitely told me it was free and I was going to pay the price I already had reserved. But, explaining that at check-out even to the manager, does absolutely no good. Luckily, I had the extra funding to pay out of pocket, but if you are on a tight budget for the stay, please be careful to read every last word on the check-in slip.

Reviews.Title: “I would not stay at this hotel ever again-”
Reviews.Author: Aquos
Reviews.Content: I would not stay at this hotel ever again, and can only tell you to think twice before booking with any Harrah's property- My outdated room with worn out stained carpet also had a very large ugly visible stain on the ceiling in the bathroom. On the last night when getting ready for dinner out with friends - while sitting on the 'throne', brown water dripped down on my head and back. I looked up to see the ceiling was bulging like a balloon holding back water. The brown water that dripped on me was most likely sewage from an overflowing toilet in the room above us. I called the hotel operator who sent a plumber. The plumber said the most obvious - that he had to move us to another room. This would have made us late for our dinner reservations with friends so I said we'd have to deal with moving us when we got back from dinner. A few hours later, we came back from dinner and I went immediately to front desk. The plumber had not notified the desk of bathroom disaster. Front desk clerk did not care about the sewage, nor the mess, nor the hassle that their hotel's negligence in maintaining their property caused us. The hotel manager would only offer us the obvious - a new room and a $25 voucher for dinner, which was pointless - We had already eaten and It was close to 10pm, on our last night, we had to check out by 4am that morning to catch flight. When the bellhop moved us from the south tower to the north tower room - we passed front the desk. I asked the bellhop to explain to the front desk clerk how bad the bathroom was. After the bellhop explained it to her the clerk said it was "no big deal". Just unbelievable rude uncaring staff!!! . I'm left with an overwhelming dislike for this disaster of an accommodation. If you are reading this - and are thinking about staying here don't! By the way - what kind of stupid hotel closes their pool at 7pm?

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value for money, superb location on the strip”
Reviews.Author: alamo25
Reviews.Content: Stayed with a friend in August 2009. Last minute booking online and got the room at about $60 a night. Even though we requested a twin room there were none available on the first night so we were upgraded to a suite which was very nice. Only negative remark I have to make was from the hotel cleaners who muttered 'how could backpackers afford to stay in a suite' when we left our room. Bit rude, but anyway... The location is right in the heart of the strip. The casino/hotel joins with the Paris Casino. Its across the road from Caesars Palace and opposite the Flamingo. It really is the nice end of town. You don't want to be down the Stratosphere end of the strip after dark, its very seedy. Its a 4 star hotel for a bargain price, what more could you ask for really? Ballys avoids the themed tackiness of other casino hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and cheap”
Reviews.Author: mrwilliam2646
Reviews.Content: The first room I stayed in was okay. The view was not so nice. It was a view of the Paris pool as well as the rooftop break area of the workers. Had to strain to see Belliagio water show. Which I was told I would be able to see. The bed was very uncomfortable to sleep in. The TV was pretty far from the bed and was small and difficult to watch. After a free upgrade due to a complaint, my new room was a lot nicer. Bed was a lot more comfortable. The view was a little better. The tv was also easier to see. The hot water in the shower did not last too long. The \was not very much pressure either. The shower head was dirty and poured water out instead of spraying it out. Overall it was a decent place to stay for the price I payed.

Reviews.Title: “Overall - Good Deal..”
Reviews.Author: kilimeister
Reviews.Content: Made reservations through Expedia for 3 nights (Mon-Wed). The rate was $66-76. It would've been cheaper but we signed up for the "24-hour buffett pass for 2" (which was a big mistake, in my opinion). We stayed in a deluxe north tower room. The rooms were nice...however upon further examination, it was observed that there were two white stains; One on the sofa and the other on the bench at the foot of the bed. Usually you need a black light for stains like that to pop out... gross. The carpet was dirty (possibly dirtier that the outside hallway carpet). 24-Hour Buffet Pass: Really, how many times can you stuff yourself with buffet food in 24 hours? Plus, there are so many other restaurants and specials offered in the vicinity it makes it not worth it... Well, maybe if you're Takeru Kobayashi it might be. The in-hotel cantina has a $1 tacos (similar to taco bell tacos) and a $20 128oz margharita which comes in a fishbowl (good for 4 people).

Reviews.Title: “brilliant time had by all”
Reviews.Author: sparkly1968
Reviews.Content: stayed at ballys for 2wks in july and had a great time.on arrival waited in line for about 10mins,told front desk would like a nice view was told i could upgrade for an extra $20 a night to the north tower,said thats a lot of money over a 2wk stay to which the the front desk clerk said lets see wot i can do,an found us a room there at no extra cost,nice one.the room itself was great nice and spacious and clean,the view was of the paris hotel and part of the bellagio fountains,beds were comfy pillows a bit lumpy but after a day walking the strip id manage to sleep on a brick lol.never heard any noise outside room all stay.one thing i really liked was the elavators went straight down to pool level so no need to walk through the casino.the pool itself was brilliant you could find a sunlounger at any time of day,no need to get up at the crack of dawn to get a decent seat,something i had to do when staying at the flamingo.yes the pool is open to the public but it never gets to busy,even at the wkend.they have a dj at the wkend who is great.the casino seemed nice and the walkway through paris was handy,the moving walkways outside to get to the strip broke down frequently which was a pain.ate breakfast at the sidewalk cafe most mornings wasnt bad for the price and there are pizza and burger places on the avenue shoppes level also not bad for the price.saw a couple of shows le reve absolutly brilliant cant recommend enough and the blue man group my 13yr old daughter really enjoyed them,went to hoover dam and ethal m choc factory that was a nice day out.been to vegas 5times and can honestly say this was my fave trip there largely thanks to it being such a nice hotel.would not hesitate in recommending this hotel to friends.only bad thing i have to say is the charge $3 a day for using the safe never known that before but on the plus side no resort fees which a lot of hotels seem to be charging these days.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but could be better.”
Reviews.Author: stdese
Reviews.Content: Pros: - Convenient location on the strip - Free self parking. Note: the lot is always crowded. - The North Tower is recently renovated. - Monorail is conviently located on the pool level (below casino level). Cons: - The South Tower is run down. When you walk through, you just know that it needs renovation. - Our sheets were torn and had holes in them. I would have hoped they could at least afford a nice pair of sheets. - None of the restaurants are that great. If you want decent food, walk through the casino to Paris. (You don't even half to go outside). Or if you don't mind braving the heat, walk directly across the street to the Bellagio. - Don't bring your laptop. Wifi is $15/day. Use your cell to access email and everything else. - Likewise, don't spend $22 to use the fitness center. There's a 30 minute time limit anyways. For exercise, just walk from the North Tower to the South Tower and back. It will probably take you about 30 minutes and it's FREE.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad - Good for the value”
Reviews.Author: T-dot_Traveller_76
Reviews.Content: To start with, I'll preface this review by stating that my room was comped. I used the $20 trick and got upgraded to a suite (Sweet). We stayed in the South Tower, 60th floor. The room itself is spacious but very dated. Had a great view of the Paris pool and the Eiffel Tower. In terms of the room, outside of the size, it was a little bit worn out. If I had to pay more than $99/night for this room, I would feel ripped off. Considering all of the current hotel options in Vegas, Bally's wouldn't rank high on the list, however, if you can get a comped room, then this isn't a bad option. Obviously location is extremely awesome. On a side note, the most annoying part of this hotel and maybe all of Vegas are the Timeshare sellers. I don't know how many people I had to say 'No' too. After awhile it just became annoying.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and quiet room”
Reviews.Author: Mississippi
Reviews.Content: Bally's location was perfect. Our room in the North tower, although not a rennovated one, was spacious and we never heard a sound in the halls or from other rooms. Our room had dated blonde wood furniture although the art deco look was charming. the tv, although a flat screen one, had adequate reception. the floor to ceiling windows were a nice bonus. The room had a comfortable love seat and several chairs, which made it very comfortable for entertaining friends who travelled to Vegas with us. The casino, although not glamorous, had an open spacious feeling unlike many casinos in hotels. The room was basically clean, although we found a cup under the armoire. Maid service was timely. We checked in on a Tuesday, and check in was speedy. Toward the weekend, however, we noticed very long check in lines and were told by other guests that they had to wait over an hour to check in. We enjoyed the $l margarita's and $1 tacos at the grill in the hotel. This hotel was connected to the more upscale Paris Hotel by a mall with restaurants and shoppping. I believe that overall that this hotel was a great value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - My room had a great view- A bit run down”
Reviews.Author: SeanTravelz
Reviews.Content: When I checked in I was thinking I made the wrong choice,, I got a great deal at Bally's at 47.99/night -call them and ask them to beat the expedia rate--> The check in line can be long especially at peak hours and I said to the check in girl I don't mind if its smoking or none as long as I get a view, I was put on the top floor for the south tower and the view was amazing! I could have thrown a spiral and hit the top of the eiffle tower at Paris, also had about a 2/3 view of the bellagio fountain, the room was big and quite, the bathroom is dated...The house keeping staff was really nice and I think that Romeo needs a promotion..Bally's is connected to Paris which i didn't know and it was a bonus because i think Paris is much better for food (didn't eat at Bally's) I got the buffet deals the paris buffet line is insane but planet holly wood and flamingo were better. internet - 13.99/day

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: SallyHopwood
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Ballys Las vegas in October of 2008 and found it to be generally a really good hotel. The rooms were clean and well maintained and the services were ok, it is one of the smaller hotels on the strip so it wasn't too busy which i thought was great! when we sat down to play at the slots or tables we were brought drinks straight away... The hotel is attached to the Paris hotel which was stunning! a dinner up the top of the effiel Towel is well recommenend. Ballys hotel has no diner rooms so you will have to venture into the paris for your breakfasts and dinners.... The major plus of this hotel is its location, oppersite the Bellagio in the middle if the strip, you are walking distance to all the big sight seeing hotels. So if your looking for a more practical and on budget hotel i would well recommend Ballys.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: daymeeyan
Reviews.Content: I first reviewed this hotel in 2007 and have since been back twice. I can now say that the North Tower is extremely nicer than the South Tower. This time I was given a free room in the South Tower. I'm definitely not complaining about something that's free which is a great value, but it is extremely dated. We got a room with an excellent view, but the room had an odd smell which we believe was from the really old and stained carpets. This tower is in need of a make over. The bathroom is really dated. Our sink had a long crack down the middle. The shower was really just spitting out water at you although we never ran out of hot water. However, we did like the soap and shampoo provided. The rooms are really large. Our room was so large they could have added 2 more beds fitting 4 full sized beds in the room. It was actually so large it didn't feel comfortable. I still don't like the idea of charging for internet access. What made the experience even worse was going down to use the business center to print boarding passes. They charge $5 for 5 min of internet use, then $1 per page printed. I'm not sure why they need to nickel and dime guests when we are already pumping money into their machines. We had extremely nice and friendly staff at the front desk on check in and check out. Our family had 2 rooms and they were kind enough to put us close together on the same floor. The cleaning staff was also very friendly and thanked us for leaving tips. I would still recommend this hotel, but try to get the North Tower if you want a nicer room.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal for value seekers, location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: Neil38
Reviews.Content: Just got back from staying at Bally's. If Bally's was a mall it would be your city's simple but comprehensive mall that has a Sears and a grocery store. It's not the fancy-schmancy mall with Neiman Marcus and Saks Fifth Avenue (that's across the street i.e. The Bellagio). Great deal if you are not looking for luxury accomodations. No complaints really after 5 nights there.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: mel08_10
Reviews.Content: the room was cleaned every morning.it was quiet, air was good for a smoking room

Reviews.Title: “1st time to Vegas”
Reviews.Author: slashba
Reviews.Content: I've never written a hotel review but since this site helped me so much I thought I would pass along my great vacation experience. Check in was a breeze. I told my host it was my first time visiting Vegas and I got a very, very nice room in the North Tower with a mountain view plus little view of some of the strip. It was VERY convenient being around the corner from the ice machine and elevators but not too close to be disturbing. Our room was clean and with plenty of towels for 2 people. The AC could have worked alittle better, but I've heard the same about other hotels as well. I would have like to have had a refrigerator, but was not going to pay the extra $15. We are so used to going to Atlantic City and always having one in the room. We were prepared thought and brought a soft sided cooler (fit in suitcase) and some zip lock bags for the ice and it worked prefectly to keep our snackes and left overs (midnight munchies!) nice and cold.We also bought mugs at a little store for our drinks. I don't like those little glasses in the rooms. We did not use the safe either as their was a charge for that as well. We just locked our suitcases when out. The location for us was just perfect. Sort of in the middle of everything. Walkways and overpasses are very convenient and near by. Duece bus stop was right up at the Flamingo and I recommend it for going to either end of the stirp or Freemont street. It's only $7 for a 24 hour pass. Well worth it, although they can get a bit crowded later in the evening. Jubilee show was absolutely fantastic. I highly recommend it. Old style Las Vegas show. Breakfast Buffet at the cafe ($10.99) was ok. Nothing special but good food, friendly servers and quick in and out to start your day off. Also the little eatery "Nosh" is good for a late night bite to eat as is Sabbaro down on the pool level is open 24 hours. There is no dinner buffet that we found at Ballys but we did enjoy the buffet over at the Flamingo. The pool is nice but not very big. Drinks are expensive and you cannot bring in your own. Friday, Sat, and Sun they have a dj and pool behavior and music may not be appropriate for the younger kids, but during the week it is very nice. Lots of chairs available when we were there. To sum it up, I definitely enjoyed my stay at Ballys and would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Still the best overall resort in Las Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: Priggly
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Bally's from 2-20 July 2010, a total of 18 nights. It was more than enough time to take the true pulse of this aging but still vibrant resort. This is the third year in a row I have stayed at Bally's and the quality and overall experience are consistent. My room this year was on the eighth floor of the North Tower. The room itself was quite acceptable with nice touches like marble tabletops and vanities in the bathroom. The A/C unit was excellent and maintained the room temperature consistently and without fuss or noise. The carpets in the room are getting a little worn and could do with updating. The paint on the cabinetry in the bathroom was peeling rather badly and again this needs refurbishing. The plumbing worked well. There were NO bed bugs, a plus in this day and age of wide dissemination of same now that the ecofreak crowd has been successful in doing away with the only truly successful eradicant of these disgusting pests, DDT. Still, it does not hurt and is probably wise to carefully inspect your hotel room, any hotel room, carefully upon check-in for these vermin. The room was for the most part quite quiet except for two nights when drunken revelers came staggering down the hall, shouting and carousing and banging into doors. But this is expected in the Entertainment Capital of the World, right??! The price of the room was quite reasonable except for Friday and Saturday nights when it rises to rather lofty extremes contingent upon demand. Sunday through Thursday are the best nights for price. The thing about Bally's that is so attractive is that it is located smack dab in the middle of the Strip and everything is convenient. Bellagio is just across the Strip, Paris is next door, City Center is close as are the Venetian, the Palazzo and Caesar's Palace. The other thing about Bally's is that it has one of the very best steakhouses on the Strip and the BEST by far Sunday Brunch in the form of the Sterling Brunch. This is absolutely the best brunch in the city and is not to be missed. The food, champagne, caviar, lobster and prime rib as well as the rack of lamb and seafood offerings are without doubt the best quality there is to be had in LV currently and the price is very reasonable at $85 for 5-6 hours of sheer eating and drinking bliss. Ilario, the manager of both the steakhouse and the Sterling Brunch is a true gentleman and maintains a very, very high level of quality in this establishment. For those desiring more economical sustenance, there is what I refer to as the "basement" (pool level) where there is a Sbarro's, a Nathan's, a Haagen-Dazs ice cream outlet and a Japanese restaurant. All are good, especially the ice cream outlet. The pool at Bally's is large and single without ostentation and can be quite raucous on week-ends where amplified music keeps the largely young crowd involved. One thing I do not like about the pool set-up is that, in contrast to most of the better resorts on the Strip, it is open to the public. Instead of showing your room key for admission, you simply walk right in. Not too exclusive but the place is pleasant overall nevertheless. Unfortunately, there is no hot tub access unless you pay an additional fee for same at the Spa. The housekeeping staff at Bally's is top-notch. They are efficient and honest and keep the rooms clean and well-supplied. They are happy to come to your room late in the day to make it up if you request so by telephone. Overall, I give Bally's high marks. I will return there every time I am visiting Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Large room, everything was great except an old fridge and no kettle”
Reviews.Author: Lovetravelalotyes
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights. We love the size of the room (large bed, large bathroom, big table, sofa, dressing table, iron board, etc.). We believe it is located in the middle of the Las Vegas strip. On its left side, there are Paris, Bellagio, Monte Carlo, Grand MGM, etc. On its right side, there are Venetian, Caesar, Mirage, Treasure island, fashion shopping mall, etc. The front of the hotel does not look as fancy as any other hotels do but it is not important to us. In our opinions, the room size, the cleanliness, the location are more important. Few things that the hotel can be improved are the waiting time for being served in the lobby for check-in, and it should offer free wireless internet as their internet charge is too high.

Reviews.Title: “Decent place to stay, lousy front desk service.”
Reviews.Author: DW9075
Reviews.Content: The room was spacious and clean (north tower). The hotel is well located. The front desk service is extremely slow and they appear to understaffed or they don't care. There were probably over a 100 in line waiting to check in when we arrived. I think there were three clerks on duty and probably 20 or so empty check in stations. There was a manager type who was handing out bottled water but he needed to be checking people in rather than passing out water. My wait was well over an hour but the clerk did upgrade our room. Other than the initial wait the room was clean and very adequate for our needs.

Reviews.Title: “Ballys LV, Smooth Sailing”
Reviews.Author: StevieR
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Ballys on a 5 day comped trip after spending the initial night elsewhere (Main St. Station). No complaints about anything important. I do most of my gambling in HET properties in Atlantic City and noticed many distinct diferences between there and LV. I am a mid level Diamond Card holder. In AC there are several perks, most notably being the Diamond lounges. Although not gourmet, the food choices are numerous and you could eat lunch & dinner there daily with no problem. THe lounges in LV are nice but generally offer just drinks and munchies, maybe a light hot hors doerve but that's it. Other than the above there is really a big deal made about Diamond players in Vegas. A private lounge for check ins, private, expediated valet service and seperate lines everwhere made having this card a big deal. I was also struck by the good attitude that everyone had at Bally's and LV in ge neral. From valets to bartenders to maids, everyone seemed to sincerely care about you and your stay. I always seem to encounter some bad apples in AC. One small negative was the lousy pay tables for VP at all of the strip properties. I played some obligitory slots and poker at Ballys but did most of my serious gambling at downtown or outlying casinos with full pay VP and 3/2 BJ. Its really hard to complain about anything in Vegas but even with that in mind Ballys met or exceeded my expectations in all areas. Would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at Bally's was the hub for our great vacation-"Bally's was Great."”
Reviews.Author: toby1111
Reviews.Content: From the very moment we arrived to the moment we departed, we felt we were among friends. The entire staff ranging from check-in to general hotel staff were very helpful in guaranteeing a pleasant stay in Las Vegas. Ballys gave us three nights complimentary and placed us in a scenic view room overlooking Paris casino and the strip. We are from Eastern Pennsylvania, a long way from home, but felt safe and secure at Ballys. We will surely stay at Ballys again in the future! "Thank you Ballys for your outstanding hospitality."

Reviews.Title: “a right choice baby”
Reviews.Author: PrabhakarBelavadi
Reviews.Content: nice reception, good rooms, cordial atlmosphere, centrally located at the strip, reasonable charges satisfying all budgets. Gives a beautiful panaroma of the strip from the room. However, the distance from the parking area to the front desk and the rooms is uncomfortable. If you wish to stay in ballys remember this, " LESS LUGGAGE, MORE COMFORT, MAKES YOUR STAY AT BALLYS A PLEASURE!!!!!!!!"

Reviews.Title: “Bally's - good location, nice pool, friendly staff, would go again”
Reviews.Author: ElissaClaire
Reviews.Content: I am a bit delayed in writing this feedback on my June Vegas vacation – better late then never. I checked in Sat June 19th for 1 week and returned home Sat June 26th. I booked a package from Vancouver to Vegas, with Air and Hotel, for staying at Bally’s. I’ve been to Vegas over a dozen times so an elaborate hotel wasn’t my priority. I was simply there to relax in the hot sun by the pool during the day and read some books, and walk, shop, whatever in the evening. I hadn’t stayed centre-strip in a long time so decided to give Bally’s a try. With all the resort fees at many other properties, the price was the same for my package to try Bally’s. I am usually an MGM or Excalibur fan due to their pool set ups. I’ve tried the Flamingo Hilton too in the past. I don’t gamble so cannot comment on their casinos. I have read some online reviews so was a bit worrisome about Bally’s. I suppose if your expectations are super high, as it is Vegas, then you might be disappointed. I must have totally lucked out, as when I arrived at the hotel to check in around 7pm Saturday there were only 2 people in front of me in line. Mind you, those 2 people seemed to take forever to check in so this front desk team isn’t the speediest around. My check in was quick once at the agent, got the non-smoking quiet room I requested, and was on my way. I was in the North Tower and it only took about 3 minute to walk to my elevators. Many online reviews say the walk to the North Tower is long, but it isn’t unless you stop to talk or get a drink. During my week at Bally’s, I never had to wait more than 30seconds for an elevator. It was quick. My room was high up and had a view of the roof, but I didn’t care about view, just a quiet n/s room, so was very very happy. Getting a n/s room in Vegas is a challenge. Anyhow, the rooms in the North Tower facing Flamingo Road were noisy that week due to roadwork so my non-view on the other side of the building was good after all – to be honest if I put my face next to the window, I could see the Bellagio Hotel and the fountains going at night too. The rooms at Bally’s are huge, clean, and well kept in my opinion – I must have been in a different North Tower room than that of the negative reviews online. There was a large closet, spacious bathroom, small desk mid-room, armoir with TV/drawers/ice bucket, and then another desk (much larger desk) and a sitting area with a love seat sized sofa and coffee table. It was by far the largest room I’ve ever had in Vegas. I found the king bed very comfy and there were 4 pillows too and all were plump and full - had a great sleep every night. The walk to the pool area was quick and took 3-4minutes from my room to the pool. The elevators in the North Tower go right down to the shops area in the pool level – just walk thru there for a quick walk to the pool. The pool area consists of one huge pool, plus a 100-person hot tub (so I’ve heard) but the jets were never going in the hot tub and it was more like a kids pool or just a smaller place to relax in the water. The large pool is awesome: there is a sitting bench/wall in the pool along the entire length which is perfect in the heat to drop yourself there with a drink and book for the day. They also have several seats for 2 or 3 people around their pool where it gets deeper. There is also a deep end for swimming laps. I saw people on floating mattresses which you could rent too. The food place at the pool has good variety and at reasonable prices (reasonable for Vegas). The drinks are where the hotel nails you for money. I ordered what would be considered a slushy virgin drink at 7-Eleven and it cost me $eight for a small at Bally’s pool. They are always playing music at their pool. However, on Fridays/Saturdays/Sundays be prepared because the week I was there at 12:30noon those days their DJ comes alive and cranks up the music for a pool party – on one day there it was so loud you could barely hear the person next to you talking. If you are a person who likes to sit in the shade by the pool, then at Bally’s you’ll have to rent a cabana … they have no shad at their pool after about 10:30am. If you are a person who thrives on ambience then this likely isn’t the best pool complex in Vegas for décor. All the staff I encountered at Bally’s were awesome, friendly, polite, helpful. Bally’s Hotel is very easy to find your way around. I didn’t like that Bally’s no longer had their own buffet outside of Sunday brunch. You had to go next door to the Paris Hotel, and their buffet lines can be super long at over an hour at times. There are several food options at Bally’s, like the food court type of options on the pool level on the walk to the pool/tram (sushi, pizza place has huge variety, deli place). The food options at the Paris Hotel were all delicious, but pricy too. They also have 24-hour buffet deals but I didn’t do that option. If you are looking for cheap bottled water on the strip near Bally’s there are a few options. Next door to the Paris Hotel in the Planet Hollywood miracle mile shops there is the ABC Store which sells bottles of water. If you exit Bally’s by the doors near the North Tower, that intersection (on Flamingo Road which is parallel to Las Vegas Blvd but 1 block off) has a 24hour place that sells various 7-Eleven type of items – I cannot remember its name but the sign on the building says something like “our lease has another 20 years on it” and the place is attached to a bar. If you’re up for a longer walk, over next to Monte Carlo is a pharmacy (CVS I think) selling various items and bottled water. Same across the street from Monte Carlo is another pharmacy (Walgreens) with great prices. Would I stay at this hotel again? Yes, but it’s not a priority to stay there again. I enjoyed myself but wouldn’t mind another property too. I am flexible where to stay next and it’s more about convenience of the pool, location I want for that trip, and price.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Service, Loud Rooms”
Reviews.Author: JeremyRiverside_CA
Reviews.Content: The hotel screwed up my reservation and placed me in an inferior room when I paid for a suite. Spen an hour dealing with them regarding it and they did nothing. Just a very condescending apology. The room they stuck me in in the North tower was nice, but even on the 9th floor I could hear the traffic and people yelling all night from the street. The Tequilla Bar and grill in the Hotel was terrible. food not good. At least the beer was cheap. I would not stay here again ever.

Reviews.Title: “sisters birthday”
Reviews.Author: ratkins811
Reviews.Content: If your reading this because you are riding the fence about staying at Bally's, well I know exactly what you are going through, because I was in the same position 2 weeks ago. My sister and I were comped 4 nights at Bally's and were not sure what we were walking into. We took advantage of the upgrade to the north tower they sent us by mail and are very glad we did. We also had a great front desk agent ,"Sosee" , who took the time to find us a room with a view. We simply asked and she came through with a view to die for!!! Our room was on the 22nd floor and the view was of the fountains, Paris, Effile Tower, and all the way down to the Rio and Palms. The service was great, the food was excellent, and the hotel is located in a great position along the strip. Take time to eat the after midnight special at Bill's- Great meal for $5 and dont forget the $1 margarita's and tacos at Ballys either. What can I say. It was a great trip and I cant wait to go back next year. Thanks Bally's!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel-Great location!”
Reviews.Author: mhughes57
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to Vegas and decided to stay at Bally's. We didn't have a long wait to check in which was good! Our room was in the south tower (I think) and our room had an excellent view of the Paris hotel pool & Eiffel Tower. We could also see the fountains at Bellagio! The room and bathroom was a very nice size. The actual furniture was dated and the TV was not a flat screen! The beds were very comfortable! My only complaint was that there was no free wireless internet service! There was a wireless hookup but it was $13.95 per day...UH, no thanks! We didn't eat at any of Bally's restaurants nor did we use the casino. There is a corridor that connects Bally's to The Paris Hotel next door which is very nice....lots of shops & restaurants on your way into The Paris! The location of Bally's is one of the best on the strip....Bill's Gambling Hall on one side, Paris on the other, Bellagio & Caesar's Palace across the street! There is also a free shuttle service from Bally's to the Rio Resort/Casino which is located just a way off the strip! Battista's Italian Restaurant is just a short walk behind Bally's (you can actually walk to the back of the hotel & out the side door straight to the restaurant). This restaurant is excellent! I would recommend Bally's to anyone traveling to Vegas and would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: dimpprob
Reviews.Content: Super clean rooms, unbeatable location. The gambling & restaurants in the hotel are not the best Vegas has to offer but you are right in the middle of everything. Overall an extremely positive experience.

Reviews.Title: “Bally's Offered Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: Bdbc
Reviews.Content: Read the Bally's reviews and was not disappointed. Our check in was a little slow but all in all not to bad. Our room was large, clean,comfortable bed. View not so great but just walk outside your right in the middle of the strip. Great location. We got a great price on the Bally's website. I would not say it was a 5 star, for the food at Tequila Bar and El dente was margainal. We enjoyed the location, room and pool. We did tour Flamingo, Paris, Cesars's.,and Rio. Bally's was fine for us.

Reviews.Title: “Saved the Day”
Reviews.Author: conigs
Reviews.Content: After a less then desirable few hours at the Flamingo (see the review), I contacted Harrahs Total Rewards and was moved to Bally's. This was first stay at the hotel and could not have been more pleased. The room was huge and modern, and had a great view. Housekeeping was great everyday. Loved the sports book and Taco bar. All these years going to Vegas, for some reason I have never been to Bally's, even this past January, while staying at the Paris. My mistake, would go back in a heartbeat. Will never hesitate to go back. Only thing I don't like, the Harrahs properties seem to pushing 6/5 blackjack and not 3/2.

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: TKVAN41
Reviews.Content: My wife and I, as well as other friends, booked this hotel as a meeting place before a Grand Canyon River Rafting trip. The hotel was average at best. Great location, very old and tired rooms. No wireless internet - amazing. Bally's needs to get with the program. Our group was assured that we could leave our luggage in a "secure" place while we went to the Grand Canyon, which we all did. Upon our return, I was shocked to find that my suitcase had been opened while in Bally's custody and my Cartier watch was stolen. Bally's refuses to take any responsibility whatsoever. Beware that there is a limit set by Nevada State law to liability when something is stolen while at a hotel, even if the hotel staff themselves steal your goods. Bally's advised that the limit is $500.00. In any event, Bally's would not even fess up and pay that small amount, which pales in comparison to my loss of a family heirloom. I have been treated by Bally's with distain and as if I was a scam artist throughout this entire ordeal by Bally's. Never again will I or anybody in our group ever stay at this hotel and I strongly advise anybody to stay far away from Bally's!

Reviews.Title: “Not what it used to be!”
Reviews.Author: WillTravel62
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Bally's numerous times over the years and always fealt like we were going home. This last trip was different. The staff was helpful but the hotel is showing its age. It's time for a major renovation if they are going to be a player on the strip. We were disappointed that the Buffet was no longer open as the lines for the restaurants at Paris are so long. The room was dirty and showing its age.

Reviews.Title: “What a really welcomed and unexpected surprise!”
Reviews.Author: bigbart66
Reviews.Content: I was very lucky to have received an amazing deal at Bally's, otherwise I would never have thought of staying there. It is in the center of the strip, so the location is amazing; across the street from the Bellagio and the fountains, with a tram stop to go up and down the strip - couldn't really ask for any better! Our rooms were right across the hall from each other - 870 had been completely redone; 871 had been redone except for the bathroom cabinets etc, which were really dreary - otherwise the granite had been replaced etc., so I don't understand why they would make it 75% better, instead of 100% better??!!! However, the beds were really comfortable, and not noisy to the outside; our room looked out on the AC units and all concrete of other hotels, but that's part of Vegas, I can't fault them for that; you aren't going to get strip views unless you pay full price ...... what more can I say??!!! there is a cafe in the hotel that wasn't crowded, seated us straight away, and the food wasn't too bad at all - I ate at the Aria buffet the next night and was sick for two days ........ And the pool ...... what can I say? It is AWESOME!!!! I have stayed all over the strip - the week before at the Bellagio, and the pools are actually better at Bally's - there is an adult pool and a smaller kid's pool, which is great. We rented out a cabana for the day, which gave us space for 8 people, including sun beds, misting beds and misting spouts; free fridge full of sodas, water, and a basket full of sunscreen, munchies, popcorn, cookies etc; all included in the price of the cabana, which is worth booking during the week for a day - $150 versus $300 on a weekend day. It was SO WORTH IT ..... ask for cabana 8, 9 0r 10 - they are right by the kid's pool, and 10 steps from the adult pool. You also get a hostess for the day, who will bring you beers and cocktails for an extremely reasonable price - so worth it! All in all, a great deal ... don't listen to people saying it is a bad place; it is perfect for the price and the location ......... it is my new place to stay on the strip .........

Reviews.Title: “Bally's is great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: CaFaHi
Reviews.Content: The room I had in the North Tower was really large, very clean and quiet. The beds were very comfortable and the weekday price, I located on the hotel website, was very reasonable. The hotel itself is centrally located and close to the monorail.. Also the pool is great. Every staff person with whom we came in contact was very cheerful and accomodating. I will probably stay there again when I return to Las Vegas. The one negative would be the cost to use the exercise equipment that is apparently located in the Spa..

Reviews.Title: “It wasn't for the upgrade...”
Reviews.Author: travaille2travel
Reviews.Content: We got upgraded to a suite because the rooms were overbooked, so we were excited about that, especially with the great rate we got for the room. The suite was VERY spacious and seemed like it was over 1000 sq. ft. (don't quote me though). Ample space for 4 guys to have your own space and try to throw a few parties. The furniture was straight out of the 70s though...it doesn't look like anything had been updated in years and the televisions were all tube televisions! The space was nice, but when you think of a suite, this is not what comes to mind. I can't complain though -- it was a free upgrade! The location was nice, close to the center of the strip and the monorail stop is there (when did they start charging for that?). Easy to walk to all casinos and only about a 20 minute walk all the way down to Wynn. Casinos are casinos, so I didn't really see anything special about Bally's. The interior was okay, but I guess it's about winning, not ambiance, right? If you are looking for a place to crash while enjoying all the activities of Vegas and/or have a good nightlife planned (i.e. not spending much time in the room), the value and quality of Bally's cannot be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Bally's was bigger and better than I expected”
Reviews.Author: JoeZimmy
Reviews.Content: My fiancé and I took a last minute trip to Vegas to scope out some possible wedding locations. We checked in around 9pm on Saturday, July 3 and while there were a few people in line at that time, the line moved swiftly. Our registration clerk greeted us with a smile, always a plus, and quickly pulled up our reservation and confirmed our check out date. She offered an upgrade to a Jacuzzi suite for $50 more a night but was not pushy or indignant when we declined the upgrade and stuck with our original non-smoking king sized bed room. I have been at other places that tried the hard sell for the upgrade, which greatly annoys me, but there was none of that here. Just a quick couple of computer taps, more smiling, room keys and directions to the elevators. Check-in was a breeze. We got to the room and could not believe how big the room was. The bedroom area was roomy with enough space for 2 night stands, desk, desk chair, a big comfy chair and TV armoire. There was plenty of space to walk around without bumping into each other or the furniture. Plus there was a space for the suitcases so we didn’t have to worry about tripping over them. The bathroom was spacious and nice, if a bit plain. Only one sink but that was ok as there was an extra vanity/sitting/make-up area outside the bathroom so my fiancé and I didn’t have to fight over the sink or counter space in the bathroom. The room was clean when we checked in and the AC kept the room comfy without being noisy. The only issue I had was the $3/night charge to use the safe in the room. I thought that was ridiculous and decided that we wouldn’t use the safe. Other than that, I was happy with the room. The cleaning service was good and unobtrusive, though they did reset the AC a bit higher the one day so the room was warmer than we would have liked when we came back at night. Annoying but nothing major. Bally's left a note in the room reminding us that check-out time would be busy and that we should use one of their automated services to check out. I called the check-out number and was processed in seconds. The hotel is mid-strip, near Bellagio and Caesar's and connected to Paris so the location is good. We found low-limit tables at Bill's next door which was convenient. We didn’t eat at Bally's but that's because we have other places we like to eat so it’s no reflection on the quality. Overall, a nice hotel in a good location with pleasant and professional employees. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for what it was worth”
Reviews.Author: SimonSez24
Reviews.Content: Because of my Total Rewards card, we were comped a week at Bally's. Despite arriving at 1pm, we were told (after waiting in a LOONG line) that our room wasn't ready. We weren't terribly aggravated at this point, we went to eat lunch at the Japanese restaurant downstairs. Our room was in the south tower and it was your everyday standard hotel room. We didn't appreciate being hustled by the timeshare people coming in and out of the hotels. That's one thing I would change about Las Vegas! We wish Bally's had some sort of a buffet to eat at but we didn't mind walking to Paris for their FANTASTIC breakfast buffet. To sum up our trip: if the room wasn't free, we wouldn't have stayed there!

Reviews.Title: “Best deal in LV”
Reviews.Author: VancouverValleyGrl
Reviews.Content: I am very happy that I choose Bally's! The room was great - clean, comfortable, and LARGE! The location is ideal - in the middle of the strip and walking distance is close to EVERYTHING, including a walkthrough to Paris LV and its restaurants, casino, shops, and city bus stop (in front of Mon Ami Gabi's). I got a great price, cheaper than Paris but with all of the perks! My view was of the Eiffel Tower - SWEEEET! :-D

Reviews.Title: “Overall Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: mom2tomany
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Ballys in North Tower Deluxe Room for 3 nites. Check in line was long and took about 30 minutes on a Wednesday afternoon. After that, everything else was great. Room was very spacious and comfortable. The bed was great and housekeeping was very quick and responsive. Overall, a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Best time "ever"”
Reviews.Author: moneygirl55
Reviews.Content: I submitted a review upon returning home on the 15th of June - but I failed to write comments and felt I really needed to comment on my wonderful stay at Bally's. Here is my review with comments. Arrived at Bally's on June 9 for a six night stay. My husband and I have been coming to Vegas for the past 6 years, but our first time at Bally's. Check in went smooth, wait time approx 20 minutes as we arrived close to noon. The check-in clerk (April) was very nice, delightful and professional. We asked for a refridgerator - to our surprise the fridge was at the door when we arrived at our room, maybe a 7 minute commute from the front desk to the North Tower, 24th floor. Our room had a beautiful view of Bellagio fountains, and the strip also was very clean and very spacious. I read many reviews before coming to Bally's and they made me very leary about the hotel. I came with mediocre expectations, but was pleasantly surprised! Room service was great, no dishes left in the halls, no noise from the other rooms or hallways, rooms were cleaned by 2 pm daily, so it was a perfect stay. Casino was always busy, and the band (JAMM) performing at the Indingo lounge was AWESOME! Don't know if there is a buffet at Bally's but we bought the Buffet-to-Buffet 24 hour passes (best deal on the planet) and enjoyed Paris, Harrahs and Planet Holywood buffets the best. The location is great! Easy access to the monorail, and the bus stop for busses going downtown. We used the free shuttle to Rio Suites, very short wait time and very convenient. We met up with our cousins from Australia, who we learned a few weeks before our vacation were also going to be staying at Bally's. They also had a great stay. We came with another couple, who's been coming to Las Vegas to celebrate their anniversary for the last 15 years. This was their first time at Bally's and they loved it! Check-out ws a breeze, and NO hidden charges. Keep up the good work Ballys, KUDOS to the Harrah's group! One thing that was a slight turn-off is upon our arrival at the hotel, we were immediately approached by time-share folks! I politely said "could we please at least get through the doors and check-in?" Other than that - it ws a delightful stay! I will reccomend Bally's all my friends and family, and I anxiously looking forward to my stay at Bally's next year.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at Bally's!”
Reviews.Author: davethegr8
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a short 2 night Sun/Mon trip to Las Vegas. I decided to stay at Bally's as it happened to be comped for that time period. I choose this hotel on location and convenience. When I arrived at around noon hour there was a fairly long line of people checking in. It still did take around 45 minutes to make it to the front counter and the agent. As I was checking in solo I made a request for a non smoking king bed room but because of the early check in I was only given the option of non smoking 2 doubles. I didn't want to wait so I decided to take it. To the south tower I go. I have to say for some of the negative reviews of these particular rooms, I had no issues in what was presented in front of me. I walked in to a very large room with a great view of Caesars, Mirage and a part view of Bellagio and the fountains. Now the room is a bit out of date with its older furnishings but that did not bother me at all. Bed was nice and soft and the air conditioning worked great. Sure there was a spot of wallpaper peeling in the bathroom and a cracked tile as well but nothing that was overblown. Its an older tower and unrenovated so I would say it was quite good knowing that. The non smoking room did have a bit of a minor smoking smell to it but nothing that made me nauseous. For a comped room I was very pleased and wouldn't hesitate staying in those rooms again even if I had to pay. Room service was mediocre as it didn't arrive hot on 2 occasions and was slightly overpriced. As for the casino itself, very very smokey. I did get headaches from the strong smell. Again because its an older casino with poor ventilation. I liked the fact that it was attached to Paris by a nice indoor walkway lined with stores and restaurants. I like the casino in Paris so it was a bonus. I did have a rent a car this trip and used the self park on multiple occasions. It shares with Paris and makes for quite a long hike to get to where the rooms are located. No big deal breaker. Overall I was impressed by Bally's for a basic clean hotel with superb location. Just don't be expecting a 5 star quality hotel and you will be just fine.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location! Great value!”
Reviews.Author: AH2301
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Bally's from June 21st to June 25th (Mon-Fri). The hotel is in a perfect location, mid-strip! We attempted to check in early, around 9am, but a room was not ready yet. A very nice lady named Rene helped us check in and gave us a room number, and told us to check back in a few hours to pick up the keys as the room had not yet been cleaned. Checked our bags with the bell desk, and they informed us that they would bring them to our room when it was ready. We were able to pick up our keys around 12noon, and had a South Tower room (which was comped). We were offered a North Tower upgrade for $25 per night but declined. We were surprised at how spacious the room was! The furnishings are a little old and the carpet was a little lumpy, but the room was extremely clean. We were very happy with the room, and the view was absolutely awesome! You could see the whole south strip plus the Paris pool, as well as about half of the Bellagio fountains. It was a beautiful view both day and night. I have included photos of the room, as well as the carpet and of the view. All of the staff we encountered during our stay was very nice and friendly. Housekeeping did an excellent job cleaning our room each day. The only complaints we had was that there were not enough pillows for the bed, only three very small pillows. My husband says the bed was not comfortable enough for his liking, but I was satisfied with it. The showerhead in the bathroom was likely the worst showerhead on the planet. The water came out in one strong stream, but we managed. The casino at Bally's is always pretty busy and has a lively atmosphere. We listened to live music a few nights, which was really good. Overall, we were very happy with our stay at Bally's and would have no problem staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: BrendanVancouver
Reviews.Content: We checked-in in the middle of the night as we had a delayed flight but quickly went through and too our room. Took advantage of room service a couple time and the food came quick and hot. One marker was we put a tray outside the door at one point and it sat there for a day and a half. The room is large and clean with an attentive cleaning staff. We were in the North Tower in a modern room, it was up to date and clean, nothing spectacular but very comfortable. The other downside I would say was the wait checking out, I had forgot to do the auto check out the night before and when I went the next morning there were 4 kiosks open and one had an individual training. Our clerk was very polite and professional, but everything took 10x longer than it should of. I figure a hotel that deals in that quantity of clients would have things down by now. Overall though I would definitely suggest this hotel as a good, clean, central and inexpensive hotel in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “I f every Hotel was as accomadating as Bally's Vegas would be the number #1 destination in the world”
Reviews.Author: portlandbooster
Reviews.Content: We've met several people that work in the hotel ... one of the managers (Nilo) has been a godsend as far as suggestions on our trip & we were honored to meet him & he does his job very well !!

Reviews.Title: “Great time, can't wait to go back.”
Reviews.Author: RUDRIDER
Reviews.Content: My wifeand I just got back from a four night stay at Bally's. We were unable to check in right away so, we did other things for two hours. I was asked if I wanted an upgrade for $25.00 more per night, I declined. We were put in the South Tower, the one that has not been remodeled. If you can, stay in the North Tower. The room was large as well as the bathroom. The a/c worked extremely well, as compared to the room I had at Paris last year that did not work good at all. The downside would be that the furinture is out dated, big time! If I had to guess, I would say that the furinture is from the early 80's. This was not really a problem for me since I do not use the dressers. I belive that the in room safe is $3.00 per day, no resort fee though, a bonus. The internet is not free either. The beds are ok, nothing special. The room was cleaned everyday, not the vacuuming though. Overall, the room was nice and extremely quiet, I did not know there was somebody next door until I saw a small gargabe bag by their door. I would stay here again, even in the South Tower. The Nosh restaurant is nice, you can get a huge breakfast sandwich for $5.00 They also carry two kinds of Krispy Kreme Doughnuts. Lastly, the hotel staff was nice and polite except for the check- in people.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful help at Ballys in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: punky1933
Reviews.Content: I traveled with 8 other extended family members last week to Las Vegas and we all stayed at Ballys, where some of were comped and the others had good rates...I am suffering with a leg problem and the staff couldn't have been nicer to me the whole trip. First off the fellow at the check in suggested I take a handicapped room, which as it turned out was a marvelous idea...It is in such a great location and the casino is small enough that you don't get lost and can easily find your friends...I also had good luck with the slots when I played them.. I know some of you don't care for Bally's, but we certainly had no regrets staying there.We were all well taken care of...

Reviews.Title: “Clean Room, Good Service, GREAT Value”
Reviews.Author: htwheels
Reviews.Content: I was in town for a convention at Caesars Palace. Ballys is just across the street and their rates were SO much better. William at the check-in desk was very accomodating. I got a great room on the 24th floor. Housekeeping was very attentive. The room was serviced well each day and was clean and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “no problems”
Reviews.Author: margene
Reviews.Content: We booked through Vegas.com for 3 nights. Upon check-in we asked for an upgrade to a remodeled unit.
