We were given a suite with a partial view of the Bellagio for $20 extra per night. The room was very nice. One perk that we weren't expecting was having a small coffee maker in the bathroom. That was really nice to have. We also got 2 free 24 hour buffet passes good at any of the Harrah's buffets. The buffet for Bally's was actually in the Paris section. The lines were lengthy at times, but so well worth the wait. We spent at least 70% of our time at Bally's. A trip over to the Rio for the WSOP and down to Fremont was all the traveling we did. They provide free shuttles between Bally's and the Rio. From the Rio you can go to another hotel or two within the Harrah's group. The only downside was the timeshare people and some of the kiosk people in the mall area below the casino.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Prime Location”
Reviews.Author: G1_H
Reviews.Content: I would rate this hotel as a good three star, it was clean, comfortable with pretty new mattresses in our room. I gave it a 4 rating because of its prime location, drinks service and casino area. taxi from the airport costs about $25-30 including tip. We stayed in the older part of the hotel (the south tower?) and after some of the reviews I was a bit worried. Not necessary! Yes I agree it was tired but good value for money with the great room rates available (paid about £30 per room per night for 6 nights so great value for money), the rooms were HUGE, plenty of room with 2 twin beds, older/damaged furniture though purely down to guest abuse I would imagine (which if replaced would make it feel much higher quality), its not a flat screen tv yet but it does the job so not a big deal. Bathrooms were big, good shower, plenty hot water, plenty towels & big mirrors. Rooms were clean, cant fault that,. Im sure over time this area will get a re-furb as well, but to maintain building of this size with the amount of guests it must be a never ending task. How long do you spend in your room in Vegas anyway? the hotel charges $3 per day for the safe, I think they should scrap this, really it is expected now in hotels such as this but still its a nominal fee at least. The casino area was good, was always really busy, very entertaining and the drinks service/cocktail waitresses were good, the pool was a great size with plenty loungers. The bufftet was always busy but I never ate there so cant comment, did look like good value for money though. Everything is close by, paris is linked by a nice walkway (with a good little live music bar en route), bellagio & ceasars palace just across the road, planet hollywood & paris on one side and bills gaming hall & flamingo on the other. I slept well in this hotel, quiet for the area and never heard any other guests, we were at the end of a very long corridor ao this may have been why.... I never experienced a long check in line, it was about 15-20 mins, but i did see some long lines, i guess thats just luck. I saw some man being a bit irrate with one of the reception staff, really getting him no where and it was not the poor girls fault some guests take longer than others. If your are looking for a high end hotel, this is not for you, for good value for money and a nice comfortable place to sleep close to the action then ballys is a good choice. I like nice hotels but I also like good value for money. I was very happy with ballys as a good value hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: chezal
Reviews.Content: This was the second time we have stayed in this hotel,we thought the first time was good but this time was even better.The line for check in was quite long and it took about twenty minutes to get to the desk ,but once there it took just a couple of minutes to get checked in.We tried the twenty dollar tip ploy and got a free upgrade to a room in the smarter north tower with great views over the strip. Last time there we were in the south tower ,now this was a little dated and in need of a revamp but still great value for money, but the north tower has had its revamp and was very nice. The room was huge with a king size bed , sofa ,glass and wooden tables and chairs,plenty of chests of drawers, tv in a huge cabinet and a large bathroom and a bonus of a coffee maker with free coffee cream and sugar replenished every day.Ballys is not the biggest or most modern hotel and casino in las vegas but its position right in the middle of the strip can't be beaten for the price.Maid service was excellent with the room cleaned everyday and all the staff that we came in contact with were very helpful and polite.Cant wait to go back to vegas and to Ballys where we got good value for our money

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: traveller666
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews I was very wary about staying at Bally's expecting the worst and was very pleasantly surprised. We arrived at check in to find a long line up but there were lots of agents and we moved very quickly. I asked if I could have a renovated room and the agent said yes and gave it to us without charge. We were in the north tower on a non smoking floor and the room was great. The cleaning staff were very good and there was even a coffee maker in the room. In our package was also a free 24 hour voucher for the buffets. However we did not use this as we don't like long lines. We paid $3. daily for the use of the safe. The pool area has limited shade but had lots of chairs. The prices for food and drink were reasonable. The mexican restaurant had good food and beer and reaonably priced. The hotel is in a great location in the middle of the strip. I did find the casino very smokey and wished there were no smoking areas. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “CHECKOUT SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: gwentie
Reviews.Content: I checked into Balley's June 6th to attend the PHADA Conference. My stay was okay but checkout was a nightmare. I attempted to checkout on June 10th and found that there was only one person assisting checkouts. The senior lady was very chatty with all of the customers while the line grew and customers geew more frustrated. I was trying to get to the airport to catch my flight. I waited in the line well over 40 minutes. I do not understand why the hotel had only one person assisting checkins and checkouts whilte the other representative assisted premium customers. This does not demonstrate customer appreciation.

Reviews.Title: “I was very disappointed with my room and the service I recieved.”
Reviews.Author: K2Indiana
Reviews.Content: I go to Vegas at least once a year. This trip was for my son's 21st birthday. Being a rewards member a portion of my trip was comp. Upon checking in room # 6229 I was very upset at how dirty the room was as well as the wooden head board was busted and splintered.(took pictures) A friend met us there and her room was #6225 and I shared her room so I didn't have to sleep on a bed with broken head board and my son stayed in #6229 not minding the other bed being broken. My friend was departing a day before us on 6/9/10 so I went to the front desk and asked to keep her room (2 doors down from mine) so I would have a bed that was not falling apart. They told me that would not be a problem. To shorten this review I will say that I made 5 trips to the front desk taking up most of my day to get this taken care of just to get a message on my room phone that they were going to charge me an extra $44.00 to keep room #6225. Keep in mind the only difference in the rooms were the broken head board. I again made a trip to the front desk and stood in line another 45 minutes to get this corrected. The $44.00 charge was removed as they acted like they were doing me a favor when my reservation papers (in hand) showed that I was not to pay for that night anyway. Bally's in no way tried to compensate us for our trouble of wasting an entire day trying to correct their mistake. I have kept all paperwork in case anyone from Bally's denies and/or questions my review. I really felt bad for my son because it took a whole day away from his special trip that can't replaced. Not to mention the stress. I feel that they should have offered some type of discount tickets to anything in their hotel or anything to make the stay better. I normally stay at the Palazzo and have stayed at Stratosphere as well as several other hotels in the past. I honestly have never had a bad trip to Las Vegas until last week. Also good luck getting a drink or cup of coffee while gambling. Next year I will plan my trip to Vegas as usual but will make sure that I don't spend any time or money at Bally's. There are several hotels that are available to total rewards members so do your research people.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT for what we needed!!”
Reviews.Author: rocknrowlands
Reviews.Content: Our 3 night stay at Bally's was great! The room and bathroom were very clean and spacious. We were on the 19th floor and the view from our window wasn't anything spectacular but we weren't in Vegas for the room view! Our room was also very quiet! The access to the strip is awesome and the little mexican restuarant inside Ballys had $1 dollar maragita's and $2 cuervo shots or beers ALL THE TIME!! We did an air/hotel package deal and our hotel ended up being about 51 dollars a night! Now that's a STEAL for a 450 sq ft clean room and bathroom! No matter what time we can in from the strip, the staff was always very friendly and helpful! Check in was a breeze! We were pleasantly surprised when they gave us a coupon book with hundreds of discounts in it and we didn't even ask for it! All in all our stay at Bally's was better than we expected and we will stay there again the next time we go to Vegas! Rowlands - Bellingham, WA

Reviews.Title: “great location and good service - but needs to hire staff and repair escalators & moving sidewalks”
Reviews.Author: talk2me923
Reviews.Content: previous reviews seemed to indicate that negative reviews came from travelers in need of refurbished rooms versus positive reviews for those in newer rooms. I was a bit concerned, but my room turned out to be very spacious, clean and up to date. It was cleaned daily and towels were replaced even when trying to participate with conservation program hotels often recommend. No complaints for the fresh towels. I did eat at the breakfast buffet and found that the wait time to be a bit long, and then to discover once inside, that sections of the restaurant weren't open. Perhaps hiring more staff would resolve that problem. The food was ok, limited selections, but the buffet was a good price. You also have the option of ordering off the menu. There are several restaurants in the hotel, plus the hotel is linked to the Paris hotel, with also several restaurant choices. There were issues with escalators and moving sidewalks not working. One sign pointed to an elevator, but the elevator was not working. It was very hot for this time of year, and having working escalators is important. In fairness to Bally's, there were similar issues at another hotel and with the escalators at the overhead crossings, of course the one at Bally's crossing to the Bellagio, so it was more obvious and frustrating . One last suggestion, dropping the daily cost to use the room safe would be a good idea. Overall, good customer service and a clean hotel, you can't beat the location. The underground connection to the Paris hotel was also great.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: famc
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Ballys. Never stayed there before so I was a little worried. It was terrific! The staff was so friendly. Got upgrade to a suite for a great price. The room was huge and very clean. The casino staff was so much fun and they will help you learn the games. I am a poker player and even though the poker room is small, the staff was incredible. The pool was good and didn't get too crowded. Ballys is connected to Paris so that was really nice. I would definitely stay there again!!! Great fun and terrific staff.

Reviews.Title: “Be Prepared for Bizarre Human Interaction”
Reviews.Author: ThePrince49
Reviews.Content: We checked in about 11pm on a Wednesday night. There are three lines to check in: One for the highly favored, one for the merely priveleged, and one for the commoners. We waited through a long line and went to an older lady who was going to check us in. We had booked everything on Expedia and our rooms were already paid. What could take that long? I have checked into Marriotts in less than thirty seconds. They have all of your information from the Computer, you show an ID, you give them a credit card, and they hand you a key. Easy. Somehow at Ballys checking in with an Expedia prepayment takes 15 minutes. We were partway through the process and our desk clerk announced that it was time for her to go home so we should return to the end of the line. That would have made the check-in process for weary travellers take over one hour. A neighboring desk clerk took pity on us and we had our three rooms. I would note that when you tell Expedia that you want a non-smoking room you are merely stating a preference. Actual non-smoking rooms are rare in Las Vegas so you may not get one. We had to accept one smoking room and it was very nasty. The Sidewalk Cafe at Bally's has a gatekeeper whose behavior is as bizarre as our first desk clerk's. The location at Bally's is excellent and if you minimize contact with the staff you can have a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but terrible customer service”
Reviews.Author: NeoWB
Reviews.Content: We have chose to stay in this hotel due to its good locality but was disappointed with their customer service during our arrival. We reached the hotel earlier in the morning around 8am and we went to the front desk to ask whether we can check in. Almost immediately, we are put off with the bad altitude with the front desk (at the platinum check in) as she replied in a impatient manner to tell us to check in after 11am only. After we check in around 5pm, we went back to the front desk to ask some question and the response was "can't you see i am serving other customers, can you wait?". Overall, their front desk customer service needs improvement. For the rooms, it is pretty standard and we are ok with the rooms. However, there are not much of good shows in the hotel like those in the nearby hotels. Will not stay there again and would choose hotel like Planet Hollywood instead.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay...Especially Location”
Reviews.Author: Chris7575
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Bally's for 3 nights the 3rd week of April. I had never been to Vegas before, so I chose Bally's for the location. Bill's Gambling Hall is on the opposite corner, and many friends were staying there. I noticed that Bally's was only $60 more for the entire stay as compared to Bill's (Who advertises the lowest stay on the strip). Online booking was easy, I only had one person in front of me at check in, and getting to my room was easy. I chose Bally's because of all of the ammenities, location, and price. The only downside was that the escalator at the entrance was broken 3 of the days I was there to I had to take a detour when I wanted to get to the sidewalk on the strip. I would stay at Bally's again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay at Ballys”
Reviews.Author: Krozair
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the North Tower on the 24th floor. Outstanding view looking North up the strip. These are non smoking rooms, and are Very large. Room for King size bed, desk, loveseat and large chair and not feel congested. The conditioner could have been better, but I think it was a design fault caused by intake being almost directly below output, so the outer edges of the room stayed warm. The location on center strip is excellent, andjacent to Paris and Bills / Flamingo. Games weren't very kind to us, but it is the strip. If posible the Buffet of all Buffets is the way to go. My personal opinion after breakfast twicw at Paris is that it isn't as outstanding as some people make out. PH was very good for dinner, and without the ridiculous lines at Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: BradandReese
Reviews.Content: We are a couple who stayed at Ballys for three nights, with 3 other couples. We booked our package through Expedia and paid a total of $623 for air/room out of Portland, OR. Check in: We arrived on Sunday at 5, and there was a long line. But it moved quickly and, and the agent was happy to honor our request for a room in the North tower next to the others in our party. We did not offer the $20 that some other reviewers had, but if the agent had been difficult, we would have. We were able to check out painlessly using the form provided in the room using the directions on TV. Room: Room 1229. We did not think to request a king, so we ended up in a room with two queens. The room was large, the beds were comfortable, and the linens were clean. The bathroom was nice with granite countertops and also quite clean. There was no coffee machine or fridge, but our friends who stayed in room 1875 had both and did not pay more than we did. Yes the television was older, and not a flat screen, but the picture was fine and we didn’t watch TV anyway. It was a very quiet room; we never heard other guests or noises from adjacent rooms, which is rare in Vegas. The only complaint I had was that there was some sort brown schmutz on the woodwork above the desk near the ceiling that was rather gross, and there was a ripped up receipt behind the nightstand that had probably been there a while. We did not have the cleaning staff make up our room while there, so I can’t comment on the staff other than they honored our Do not Disturb sign. Food: Paris is connected to Ballys, and offered many good restaurant choices. At Ballys we all had the $1 tacos and margaritas at the Tequila bar, and all in our party agreed that they were decent to good. Don’t waste the 10 bucks for the Express Breakfast Buffet, it’s cheap, but the lines are long and there was nothing to choose from. We all very much enjoyed the Spice Market buffet at nearby Planet Hollywood. Drinks: We never went without drinks while playing in the casino; and we all found the waitresses and bartenders to be friendly and attentive. Tables/Slots: Of all the places we played at on and off the strip, Ballys was the best for all those in our party. Aside from 2, all of us walked away with winnings from either playing the slots, poker or roulette. Pool: We had friends who arrived on a Saturday. They said the crowd at the pool was absolutely insane, with empty cups and cigarette butts floating in the water, music thumping and lots of drunks. We all met at the pool Monday afternoon, and it was a completely different scene —clean, no trash, and mellow music. I suppose the weekend crowds are larger and notably rowdier, which is why my husband I usually like to come to Vegas during the week. Spa: The spa itself is nothing special but the staff was very helpful and friendly and everything was sparkling clean. I loved their steam room; it had just the right amount of steam and eucalyptus. I had an 80-minute signature massage that included hot stones. I’m a spa junkie, and I was pleasingly surprised at the quality of the massage. My mom had the same massage and the pomegranate facial and was happy with both. Although we enjoyed the facility and the services at the spa, I would probably opt to try the spa at Caesars or the Bellagio next time, just for an added bit of decadence. Overall, we would return to Ballys. The location is great, yes it’s a bit dated and lacks the granduer of the Bellagio and the Venetien, but the price is right, it’s clean, and we were happy with the service.

Reviews.Title: “Great time”
Reviews.Author: NEcruiser9
Reviews.Content: We thought that Ballys was a great location and we couldn't beat the price for what we got. Our room was huge and service was excellent. We were traveling with some friends and the hotel was very good about making sure we were together. Considering the hotel is huge with 2800 rooms we were happy to be together. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Ugh...Bed bugs !!”
Reviews.Author: Jett8
Reviews.Content: They booked me in the South Tower that was built in 1975. Standard room...I was afraid to sit on the bed. Carpet was stained and buckled. Walls filthy with black scuff marks. Furniture chipped and dated from the 80's. Disgusting! The manager moved me into the North Tower after three phone complaints that resulted in me breaking down in tears at the front desk. North Tower was newer but still the pits. My friends complained about Bed bugs in their room next door. I am not joking.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location, great value and amazing entertainment indigo lounge! V51 was incredible and soooo much fun!”
Reviews.Author: PaGirl079
Reviews.Content: The location is great! right in the center of all the action. North tower view is perfect! Casino is fun, and so much to do. Dealers were fun and very professionall. Food and shopping was great. the best part of the hotel was the band in the Indigo Lounge. V51... they were all so talented and energetic. Great dancers and musicians. Fun for any age!!!! Wish they had a schedule of when they will be there in the future so I can make sure i stay where they are playing! Put the indigo lounge schedule on your website!!

Reviews.Title: “Much better than anticipated”
Reviews.Author: nelliebobellie
Reviews.Content: After reading so many reviews of Bally's that were less than favourable, I was pleasantly surprised when we arrived. Word of advice - book a transfer before you go! A taxi will cost you $25-$30 from the airport and about $15 on the way back. I believe transfers are around $10-$15 return per person, so it's worth it. At check-in, the clerk advised me I was booked in a South Tower room. I'd heard those rooms were not the greatest, so I asked if there were any upgrades available. She offered us a jacuzzi suite, but the room only had a king size bed and we needed two beds. We settled for a 17th floor Deluxe room in the North Tower and gave the clerk $20 for her efforts. The room was very clean and surprisingly large - about 450 sq ft. - enough room for the two of us to mill around without being under each other's feet and the bathroom was big enough for two people to get ready at the same time. Full length mirror, makeup mirror and lots of counter space. The TV was old (but who cares, we weren't there to watch TV!) and there was no fridge, but you can just use a garbage can to fill with water & ice and you've got a fantastic cooler for your drinks! If you plan on keeping food in your room, you might be SOL - not sure if they have mini fridges or not. Aside from the fan on the AC unit, it was very quiet. If you are a light sleeper, maybe ear plugs are a good option but it didn't really bother me. We actually kept the DND sign on our door the whole time we were there - we would get back to our room between 4am-6am and didn't want to be woken up. The housekeeping department did call our room later in the evening to see if we needed anything so the service is quite good. We asked for extra towels and they arrived within 10 minutes. Downside is that they have no other toiletries - I had forgotten my razor and hair gel but they didn't have any. I know some of the more expensive hotels carry these items. All in all, I found the hotel to be quite enjoyable. Yes, the casino was smokey, but they all are. Considering we were only there to sleep and get ready, it was everything we needed. The location was perfect for what we had planned - I enjoy walking, so I didn't have any problem. I even walked to Mandalay Bay and back. Just wear comfy shoes! For those who don't enjoy walking, there is the monorail that stops at Bally's. Didn't go on it, so I have no comments on it. I suppose if I had money to burn, I could go for a fancier place, but I don't. I was very happy with my experience at Bally's and definitely wouldn't hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Looked like they were herding cattle”
Reviews.Author: DSPIRATE
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently attended a business conference in Las Vegas. We were to be there for 5 days. The host of the conference failed to secure rooms for the entire 5 days which left us to find other accommodations. Ceasars Palace ( our conference hotel) offered to secure arrangements with Bally's. I assumed I would receive the same lodges as CP. WRONG. This was like going from luxury to the slums. I have had better loding at hotels with 2 stars. Bathroom around toilet smelled of urine, room seemed unclean, maids YELLED back in forth in Spanish as they bumped the vacuums against the walls/doors of the hall and my room. I had a Do Not Disturb sign on door at 2:00 in the afternoon. When I opened the door and looked at the hall I was ignored but these two employees creating the noise. Decided to take a swim, forget that, you have to travel a distance under the hotel to get to a pool which also seemed dirty and very over populated. The view from our room the parking lot of another hotel and did I mention the lights that were turned up toward the marquee that blinded our room with light. Thanks to the curtains we were able to sleep. NOISE from outside unbearable. By the next day I had enough, left the hotel. The line to check in and out are the same and at both times there were no less then 50 people waiting. Seems a better system is needed. Express check out did not work. I was compesated a mere 60.00 for my trouble. No problem will never recommend this hotel and will continue to leave reviews telling others to find other lodging.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nice Rooms!”
Reviews.Author: MNTraveler01
Reviews.Content: With some of the bad reviews, we were unsure what to expect when booking at Bally's but were pleasantly surprised by what we found. Upon arrival we were upgraded to a room in the north tower. The room was very large with two queen beds, a sitting area, a desk, and a large bathroom. There was also a large closet, perfect for storing luggage. A few downsides, you must pay to use the safes and the room could have used a cleaning. It looked as though it hadn't been vacuumed after the last guests checked out. But these are minor things we are able to overlook. The location is great! Bally's is connected to Paris, so you don't even have to go outside to get there. Also, the Bellagio and Caesar's are right across the street. Bally's is located in the middle of the Strip, so it's walking distance to most of the other major hotels and attractions. There's a bus stop right in front of the Paris for those who choose to take the bus. The location just doesn't get much better! We had a great stay at Bally's and will be back on our next trip to Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “1st time at Ballys, and I will be back!”
Reviews.Author: royski69
Reviews.Content: I have stayed all over the strip, but have always wanted to give Ballys a try. Finally, my Total Rewards account showed all nights comped for my 4-night stay, and I booked it. I am sure that the comped room should have been a South Tower standard room, but when I checked in around 5:00 pm on a Wed afternoon, I tipped the very polite check-in clerk a $20 bill and he said "let me see what I can do". I really wanted a nice room on a high floor with a view. He gave me the 22nd floor in the North Tower, facing the Paris hotel and with a slight side view of the Bellagio fountains on the far right of my view. Just perfect! The room is very large for a "Standard" room in Vegas. About 450 square feet, I believe. The North Tower rooms are the most recently renovated rooms at Ballys, and I wasn't disappointed. Nice, comfortable king bed. Small love seat with a small, glass coffee table. There were also 2 other desks each with their own chair. The bathroom was decorated with nice, clean marble. The shower was a tub-shower combo, but in decent shape. I prefer to have separate walk-in showers and tubs, but I knew in advance that the regular rooms here only have tub/shower combos. The shower head was the only thing that could have been improved; very uneven water flow, and adjustments didn't help. But shower pressure was good, and temperature was never a problem. I had a smoking room, but the room always smelled fresh upon my return. And the maid refreshed the room each day while I was gone, and kept the room looking nice and fresh. Always a fresh supply of towels and soaps/shampoos. I did use the safe, so I didn't mind the $3 per day fee. I was able to use my comps to pay for those, so my final bill at check-out was still $0. Yay! Check-out over the TV was simple, quick and easy, of course. I don't understand the need to ever stand in line to check-out of a hotel, when the TV check-out is available. I used the pool and the spa, and enjoyed both. The casino at Ballys is decent, although I didn't have much luck, here. I won at other casinos during my trip, but not at Ballys. But that's how luck flows....... The central location of Ballys allowed me to wander the strip as far down as MGM, NYNY, and as far up as Mirage. Easy walking around, and the monorial in back is very convenient to use for longer travels. I had very little to complain about my stay at Ballys, and I hope to be back. The only reason I will stay elsewhere is that I enjoy trying out other hotels on the strip, and to make the most of my players club offers.

Reviews.Title: “If you want your throat to burn because of all the smokers....stay here!”
Reviews.Author: NoDumbPeople
Reviews.Content: Bally's is like any other casino - loud, crowded, and smoke-filled. If you want your throat to burn because of all the smokers....stay here! One hour in a casino equals 6 months of passive smoke they say. This is bad for your lungs and could eventually lead to lung cancer, I believe. The other problem with Ballys is you get no rest, anywhere. Why people come here is the million dollar question. This is NOT a vacation. This is NOT a place to rest your weary mind. And if you gamble? You could possibly go insane or have a nervous breakdown - I've seen it with several of my friends. What happens in Vegas really does stay in Vegas unfortunately.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasantly Surprised!”
Reviews.Author: ADARIA20103
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Bally's for the first time while a friend went to a convention. Was a little nervous with all the mediocre reviews. i didn't want ot pay extra for a North Tower room, so I told the very friendly lady at the check in desk (with no line at 12 noon on a Saturday) that the only request I have is a "renovated room"....She gave us an almost new room in the north tower for no additonal cost. Our maid service was excellent. We had room service twice and it was very tasty. The pool scene was good (a little quiet) but they had a DJ on the weekends, which made for more fun. Wines were under $10 a glass - it was nice not to be ripped off. The Indigo Lounge had a great band every night. I ate most of my meals in the Paris Hotel, attached to Bally's. You need to keep in mind that this is not a five star resort. For $55 a night I was VERY pleased. I talked to a lot of people at the pool and everyone agreed that Bally's is a good value with a great location (on a monorail stop)! All that being said, I would not stay here if I was looking for a romantic, luxury trip with your mate.

Reviews.Title: “On the strip and won't strip your wallet”
Reviews.Author: TownDrunk
Reviews.Content: Bally's is getting a little old now but is still a really nice place to stay. This was our third trip to Vegas and our least expensive Hotel yet and we have decded ther is no reason to pay more money for a Hotel room you barely see anyway. The staff ay Bally's was nice from the front desk to the concierge and room service staff, they were all very professionall and seemed to enjoy theirs jobs. The room was large with two beds a sitting area, desk, safe, wife hook up, and lots of room for luggage to be laid out. We utlilzed the restaurant which was nice the gift shops. I also went for a massage in the spa which was a full service with seperated male and female sides.The mens side had hot tub, cold tub, body temp tub, steam room , dry sauna , and wet sauna. The staff in the sauna was top notch. I would stay in this Hotel again, it is centrally located and the price is right.

Reviews.Title: “Totally worth the money, no complaints”
Reviews.Author: EnglandShell
Reviews.Content: Before we booked our hotel we read loads of reviews and Ballys had mixed reviews - from really bad to excellent........ we had a great stay there. The room was big and clean and there was a lot of storage space and surface space in the bathroom. The shower was brilliant - could spend forever in there! The casino was big and always busy, but welcoming - not intimidating like some of the other hotels. We received the free 24 hour buffet and chose to eat in the Paris restaurant - the food was lovely - the only downside is that there is often a long queue - but there is nearly everywhere! I can't fault the hotel with anything, would definitly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “BAD SERVICE...GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: mommak_10
Reviews.Content: Long line up to check in. We were upgraded to a suite. I believe the last time this rom was remodeled must have been in the late 60's early 70's. I think it was the last time the carpet and drapes were cleanned too. I do smoke, the the smell of stale cigarette smoke in the room was discusting. I purchased a scented candle to try and mask the smell, but that was an exercise in futility. Housekeeping did the minimal, such as making the bed and leaving clean towels. The ice bucket was never emptied, and the shower smelled of mold. We did see some rooms in the newer tower that look much nicer than our so-called upgrade. The only thing that this place has going for it is the location. Spend a little more money and stay in a another hotel in the same area.

Reviews.Title: “Bally's Las Vegas is the place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: WhereyatNewOrleans
Reviews.Content: I have told everyone I talk to who is planning a trip to Vegas to stay at Bally's. The location on the strip was PERFECT, especially the view of the Belagio. The room in the North tower was extremely LARGE and very clean. The maid service was right on time every morning with fresh towels, trash was emptied, etc. The staff at the front desk was fabulous. I noticed that the lines formed everyday around check-in and check-out time, but you do not have to wait to check out if you clear out your balance prior to those times. I arrived 2 hours before check-in and my room was ready. The Jubilee show at the Bally's should be on your top 10 to see while in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great position,clean and good value & helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Semoi
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel at 12.00am on a Saturday night. A great time to arrive as lines at the check-in can be enormous. We had no line. We were pre-warned from tripadvisor about the old South Tower, so we immediately checked that we had a room in the North Tower. We told them about the reports here, might have helped. Receptionist said the South tower was just older. We had non-smoking room with King bed on 8th floor.Nice size, clean with everything in working order. Plenty of towels,. good. Eating wise, the express breakfast for $10 was excellent value, and while not very varied, the food was good, and the staff were very helpful. Messed up the combination of the room safe ( $3 per day, a bit stingy) and they sent the house locksmith to open it within 15 minutes. Great service, no charge. The Nosh Bar was a bit of a let down, expensive and nothing special but might suit some people. Great direct access through a shopping arcade ( full of restaurants) to the Parisian Hotel and Casino. We also booked a show ( O - must see) through the hotel booking desk. Not the cheapest place, but great seats. Hassle free. Used the business center too. Reasonable prices and helpful staff. Internet in the rooms cost $14 per day. There are some restaurants that give it free, and you can get internet for $3 at the business center, yours or their computers. The booking was made by the Show people who got a great price ($39 p.n.) We needed to add another night , a Friday, and they charged us $79. Didn't resent it, it was worth it. This was 50% business, 50% pleasure, taking my wife to LV for the first time. We had a great time and the Hotel was perfect, not as flash as some, but smack in the middle of the strip. Forgot to mention, we came out on top with gambling, made $12 profit. I guess were were just lucky !

Reviews.Title: “Great price, great location!”
Reviews.Author: sunny9625
Reviews.Content: We weren't too sure about staying at the Bally because of some of the reviews we had read. From the reviews, I'm not sure what rooms some people stayed in, what floor it was on, etc. but for us we had a beautiful (and very large room) in the North Wing. It was very clean, it had been recently updated, the housekeeping service was great....so I'm not really sure what people are complaining about. This isn't a 5 Star Hotel, if you want a 5 Star, find another place! Value was great, it was a very clean place, staff were very polite, our check out was fast..you can do it.over the phone or on the TV set in your room. Thanks for a pleasant stay, we really enjoyed it and will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Older Hotel - With Still Some Style”
Reviews.Author: travellbugge
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had two nights comped at Bally's. We upgraded for $20.00 per night to the North Tower since it is newer. The front desk did offer this after I mentioned I wanted a nicer room. It was a good idea. The rooms were clean, light and large. If I had one thing to say that bothered me - I noticed dust on the night stand the next day which means housekeeping did not dust that morning when the were in. I don't fault Bally's completely - sometimes good help is hard to find. So if you find this happens to you let the front desk know so they can discuss this with houskeeping. It was also quiet. The hallways were clean and quiet as well. I would stay there again. The casino was light, spacious without your neighbor's chair behind you at another slot machine bumping into you. I could not smell the smoke, it connects to Paris which is great - some nice little places to eat there. While I love children - it was nice to see there weren't really any there walking across the casino floor. I believe this is more of an adult hotel since there is nothing for children. If you stay - ask for the North Tower and you should not be disappointed. I have stayed at some expensive hotels so I think I can give you an honest about the value at Bally's

Reviews.Title: “3 Generations Satisfied at Bally's”
Reviews.Author: RScher
Reviews.Content: I loved the location of Bally's, the price is so right for its location. Everybody from the front desk upgrade to the daily maid service. The first night with sandwich trick we were upgraded to a South Suite - OMG amazingly beautiful that room gets a 4/5 (only cause there was some wear & tear on furniture). The South Tower room was adequate for the remainder of our 3 nights. Since this resort is connected to Paris there is vertually everything you need here. The slots were the loosest we found the whole trip at Bally's. The ACE/Duece stop was conventiently located, lots of variety of eats within close walking distance. Take time to explore this facility before you move on, the pool level has eating/shopping as well. Daughter 21, Mom 45, Grandma 64 - all enjoyed ourselves, there was something for everybody here. Will definately be back

Reviews.Title: “This is what you get on the strip????”
Reviews.Author: The_Original_Brandi
Reviews.Content: I can not believe the kind of service I got at Bally's in Las Vegas!! They are supposed to be top notch, but I received better service and cleaner rooms at smaller chains. My room has something sticky and dirty in the dresser. There was something brown and sticky on the carpet by the table, and something really nasty looking on the door (like someone threw up) to the bathroom. I have pictures to prove it. The room had holes in the sheets, chipped paint & peeling wallpaper. I thought I was going to a high classed hotel, but was really disappointed. When I complained, I was moved to another room, much smaller and way back in the corner, a long way from the elevator. Don’t think I will go there again, and would not recommend it to anyone, not at that price.

Reviews.Title: “Typical Vegas Strip Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ATLTRVLGUY
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a business meeting for one week. Room not bad and recently renovated. Housekeeping lags here. When I checked in there were dirty glasses sitting on the desk chair, trash on the floor of the closet, and used soap in the shower. Dishes in the hallway were there for most of the week. Otherwise rooms were great. Pool decent. Did not use spa. ALL outlets in this hotel are slow. It takes ages to get any service from anybody.

Reviews.Title: “Great location.”
Reviews.Author: Traveler0317
Reviews.Content: Great value- ideal location on the strip, smaller casino hotel, big rooms. The first room we were given had a great view of Paris and Bellagio- but it looked like it was in the middle of an unfinished renovation! We were moved to another room which had recently been updated. It was very nice, large bathroom and room. The hotel is large, so it was a long walk to our room. There is a food court and some small restaurants and a sandwich shop. The hotel is connected to the Paris hotel, so it is just a short walk to another large selection of shopping, entertainment, and dining options- including the buffet. The free valet parking is a must- very easy to use. The pool looked nice but we didn't use it- I wish we had! A no-frills hotel, but definitely worth the low price for its location!

Reviews.Title: “Bally's nice, but Paris or Caesars next time”
Reviews.Author: fenton27
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Bally's in Las Vegas for five nights over Easter. Selected this room because it looked liked the nicest room we could get free and we wanted a jacuzzi. Stayed in the North Tower Grand Suite. Room was very old, and the casino was very small. We spent most of our time at Paris and Caesars. The good points about Bally's: Steakhouse incredible, table dealers and pit boss great, location, location, location. Low points: older rooms, small casino, slow drink wait. The staff was not well informed, said there was a 7* club at Caesars which was actually a Diamond lounge, and said they had rental car service by the box office location (it was moved over to Paris and no one knew). If you go to Vegas for a vacation, rent a car for the day and see the Hoover Damm or Lake Meade - we did a 3/4 day fishing trip on the lake and it was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Fairly decent room in on a great part of the strip”
Reviews.Author: Kat&John
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a convention at the Paris. Just a tip... If the convention is at The Paris, this is a less expensive option that is as close to the Paris Convention rooms as the Paris' own rooms are. A bit apprehensive to book at first since I have been through the casino and it's getting a bit worn as is the 70's era tube enclosed star trek moving walkway. Check in was the Vegas normal long line... 25 guests waiting and only 4 agents to get people checked in. Once you get your turn, the agent makes what must be 42,000 key strokes to get you checked in. What the heck are they typing? After what appeared to be a doctoral dissertation on string theory was completed, I got my keys and headed to the room. I was pleasantly surprised that the room was large, clean, well lit and had a very comfortable bed. The bath was remodeled and had some fairly high end tile work done. Bath towels needed to be replaced, they were all getting thin. As I do with Vegas hotels, I like to position it relative to its peers in the area, so here goes: Equal to: Planet Hollywood, Flamingo, Sahara, Monte Carlo. Better Than: Luxor, Tropicana, Hooters, Imperial Palace, Riviera, Terribles. Not as good as: NYNY, MGM, Rio, Mirage, TI, Paris The Casino is not large and it's pretty smokey compared to newer properties. The location is great so you can easily walk to some of the best such as Paris, Bellagio, Mirage etc. Staff are a little more friendly than you'd expect in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable room in a big, splashy environment”
Reviews.Author: glbkge
Reviews.Content: We had a large room with two double beds. The room was clean, quiet & well-appointed. We lacked a view (roof of the convention centre & wall of adjoining building). The only complaint we would have regarding the room was the fact that we were not able to control the temperature & we would have liked it cooler. The hallways were very cold, but the room warmer than we wanted. We had one complaint for the hotel at large & that is that there was no concierge. We were frustrated by the difficulty in getting answers to our questions. There were many time-share salespeople around but we didn't trust them to give answers to our questions.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the budget traveller”
Reviews.Author: travelcrazy5
Reviews.Content: Been to Vegas 27 times and have stayed in 15 different hotels over the years. This is my 3rd stay at Bally's - stayed in the North tower the first 2 times- did have some plumbing issues the 2nd time I was there. This time, 4 of us (girlfriends get away) got an extremely low rate (of my lifetime) at Bally's in the South tower and we were there for 6 days starting on a Sunday. We were on the 10th floor fairly close to the elevator. Yes, the decor is very dated but the rooms were massive in size and immaculate every day we were there. We don't spend a lot of time in the room so a fancy room was not important for us. The service was very good in the hotel and there is an awesome deli right at the bottom of the elevator that has great breakfast and lunch foods. It was quiet at night as well, no screaming partiers. My only issue was that they close the cafe at 2 pm so if you want food at supper time, it has to be either the fancier restaurants there or the Mexican Tequila bar or go elsewhere. I think it is a big mistake to not have a cafe with long hours (open at least until midnight) but that was the only thing I really didn't like. Anyway, if you want a smokin' deal on a clean, convenient room- I absolutely recommend Bally's. If you want a more modern, up-to-date room, it might not be for you. Again, Harrah's properties come through. They are by far the best in my opinion. Thanks Harrah's!

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price but some updating and repairs needed soon”
Reviews.Author: zaney
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights in the north building on the top floor. Room was basic but clean, however it is begining to show wear and tear (grout in shower looks dirty, few burn holes in carpet, few stains on wall) and could definitley use some updating (outdated bathrooms, outdated furniture). All this aside, the room was spotless and well maintained by housekeeping during our stay. We had issues almost everday with getting internet connection in our room. Maintenance was prompt to show up and attempt to repair the loose modem wiring. They do charge $13.99 per day for this service which I think is a bit high considering the inconsistancy and poor condition of the equipment. Bell, valet, housekeeping, bar, casino, and check in staff were wonderful professional and very courteous. Casino a bit small but there are so many other places to play that it was not an issue. We ate at both the cafe and onsite restaurant called Tequilla which were both very good. All in all considering the price this was a good deal

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting!!!”
Reviews.Author: friendlyskies00
Reviews.Content: While in the shower I noticed a spot on the tub. Tried rinsing it off but on closer inspection it was a bugger. ...Gross! Then, thought there was a moth on the mirror but it was as if someone had sneezed over and over. How horrible. Informed the cleaning staff outside my room but they didn't seem to care. Made me wonder what else what in that room. This was an "upgraded" room in the North Tower. Additionally, walls are thin and heard the "partying" going on in the next room all night. Will never, never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very, very adequate...”
Reviews.Author: JOJJP
Reviews.Content: Stayed at ballys april 18-22, The check in line had about 20-25 people in it when we arrived, around 2-3 pm, it moved very quickly. Upon checking in I had put a 20 in my passport and the guy at the desk said ``you know how it works I dont want to hear its my birthday, anniversary, or whatever`` we had booked a regular room and he upgraded us to the north tower and said I will give you something nice. The room we did get was on the 12 th floor it was abit dated but definetly clean. It was all we needed for the amount of time we spent in the room. Housekeeping came everyday. Noise was a non factor. The hotel had alot of blue hairs, but we didn``t spend all day there gambling. The only thing that we didn`t like the choice in restaraunts. There were cheap beers and magaritas in the tequila bar. I think a few more middle of the road rest. with good food would of helped. as for the location its hard to beat. The monorail is right there and walking distance to most hotels. overall this hotel met all of our needs and we had no issues at all. Although next time I think I will look at staying at the Mirage or even TI there not that much further down the strip. Remember the 20 it saved us from all the bad reviews of the south tower...

Reviews.Title: “Great Location..Good Value”
Reviews.Author: drrob2
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at Bally's for a 4 day vacation. We usually stay at more upscale properties in Vegas like Mandalay Bay of the Venetian, but got a great rate so decided to give this a try. Stayed in the newly refurbished North Tower. Found the rooms to be clean and adequete, no real frills but for a room to sleep and get ready in, it was fine. The only place you really see the difference between this hotel and some of the nicer hotels is in the amenities like the pool, etc. The location is great, very central. Easily connects to the Paris which has nicer restaurants. we tried to extend our stay but the raised the rates to over 200. For this price, the hotel is not worth it. If you can get a good rate andbook the North Tower, you can't really go wrong here

Reviews.Title: “Great Room and Location, Excellent Price”
Reviews.Author: lotsafun_2004
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 3 nights and loved it. This was my 7th (or 8th?) time to Vegas and I've stayed in everything from Mandalay Bay and Bellagio to Riviera and Excalibur. This hotel was perfect. Sure, the rooms aren't fancy and we didn't have a flat screen TV, but I'm not in Vegas to watch TV. The bathroom was clean, the towels replaced everyday and our bed made... what more do you want? The casino is fun with a great crowd with the drinks coming very regularly (at the cheap Blackjack tables). The buffet wasn't fantastic (not a large selection of anything healthy, but this IS Vegas!); I prefer a light breakfast, so I didn't feel like I got my money's worth, the food was fine, just not my style. Bally's is right across the street from Wild Bill's - home of the $1 margarita and $2 Dos X (XX) bottled beer. We didn't venture to the pool on this trip, so I can't comment on that. I would (and probably will) stay at Bally's again in a minute.

Reviews.Title: “What is there not to like here... ?”
Reviews.Author: jthutmd
Reviews.Content: The tram, central location, a mall in the casino, access to the tunnel to Paris Paris, and easy entrance and exit from the side by car. Easy ride from the airport form the rental car stations on Gilespie. Ballys is on the left as you come north into town from the airport. I have been here so many times. Each visit is marked by friendly staff, comped rooms and food, and a fabulous array of gambling options. Rooms are comfortable, easy to access elevators, and lots of staff to help you. Tipping helps move the world however. I never hold back on the tips, especially in this economy. The headliners have dropped off a bit, and the .99 cent shrimp cocktails downtown are gone now up to 1.99. (But you can get a .99 version at the Tropicana). I hit about 10 casinos. Ballys is always the best all around. Bring a car and park outside behind the hotel. Its faster than the lot at Paris. If you think it is too much to take, book the Tuscany behind Ballys a short walk to the strip. UNLV is down the street going to Henderson and the Desert Springs Hospital and Emergency Room is there if you have elderly with you needing help. There is a 24 hour market across from Ballys for beer and snacks but who stops to go there ? Not me if I am on a roll ! Caesars is on the other side and the pedestrian escalators make the crossing a dream across the streets. The Big Kitchen Buffet is gone. But there are many other places to eat in both Ballys and Paris. Security is everywhere. I felt safe every minute of the day. Rules of the Game...you spend the money there and tip waitresses it will be on camera and you are remembered for your kindness, unlike some places. Some of the carpeting is worn but they have been so good to me over the years, I keep going back.

Reviews.Title: “If your used to dirty filthy places it's ok...”
Reviews.Author: Bellepotter
Reviews.Content: Cons: Nasty, filthy "suite" rooms. The first room wasn't even cleaned after the last guest used it (except the sheets were fresh). The carpet was littered with burn marks, wall paper held on by scotch tape and it even came with blood splatter on the curtains!!! I stood in 3 inches of water in the shower so we asked to switched rooms. It was a little nicer and a bit cleaner. But every morning there after I woke up with a nasty rash. Pros: Awesome strip location On a Monorail stop Nice view of the back of the strip facing north (which is still impressive all lit up), We could see for miles (the rest of the city and the surrounding mountains too) Tip: When we booked the package, we paid for the standard room. The check in lady asked us if we wanted to upgrade for an extra $20 dollars a night to the "suite" rooms (because the standard rooms have never been remodeled). At first we said no. Then she offered it again for 1/2 price & we took it. So instead of paying $90 a night, we payed $100 a night... had I know that we would have stayed at the much newer and nicer Paris hotel next door for a $110 a night!!! (which is connected to bally's and just as close to the monorail). We also walked through Imperial Palace and the Harrah's hotel.... they looked even scarier than Bally's!!! The Flamingo was surprisingly nice and is also in the middle of the strip!!!

Reviews.Title: “Massive rooms Cleaned and serviced everyday!”
Reviews.Author: rich112Brit
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 7 nights. Speedy check in and was upgraded as we were staying for the week to a room overlooking the strip and the Bellagio fountains. (well we could see half of them) The room was fantastic considering we got a cheap deal (worked out roughly to be £55 a night). Hotel staff very friendly and helpful but a word of warning..watch out for the Wyndhams reps they will offer you free show tickets etc all you have to do is sit through a 2 hour presentation that turned in a 4 hour presentation. It is a time share .....they do hard sell but we did do it and said NO and got our free night heli flight over the strip which would have cost us 200 dollars!. The casino in the hotel did not have enough black jack tables in my opinion but there are plenty of other hotels/casinos to choose from. Bally's links directly to Paris hotel and casino. The Pool is ok for swimming and lazing around and because is has no slides is relatively kids free! (lovely) We stayed chose this hotel as it has one of the largest rooms and that is was opposite the Bellagio where our friends were getting married.

Reviews.Title: “Was worth it in the end!”
Reviews.Author: scottish_scrooge
Reviews.Content: We booked to stay in this hotel for several nights in one of their cheapest rooms, it seemed such a good deal. The hotel is connected to Paris and the parking is shared with it. We parked and travelled downstairs to check-in, not as easy as you would think with a lot of luggage, down escalators, past shops, past the casino floor and join the long check in line. I would certainly recommend using the valet at the door on check-in (I blame it on being scottish I didn't even think this to begin with!). Once we checked in we went to the south tower. We went upstairs and walked into the room and within 30 seconds walked out again. The room was one of the worst I have ever seen. Here's just a few parts - the window was so dirty we couldn't see out, the bedcovers were ripped and the throw over had a stain on it (don't even want to think about it), the carpet was filthy and the bathroom was falling apart. We immediately went back downstairs and asked to be upgraded and for (I think) $30 extra per night we were put in the south tower. What a difference, the room was larger, far better fittings, clean and ideal for what we wanted. In short I wouldn't think about taking a basic room again here, only consider the one up in the south tower (I think it's called the deluxe). The hotel is most definately not up to the same 5-star standard as the likes of the Bellagio in terms of overall cleanliness and quality BUT it does have a number of positives: -Monorail attached to the hotel, still takes a few minutes to walk to the back of the hotel to get there (internal walk) but is convenient for getting around the strip -price compared to other hotels in the area it is a bargain even taking into account the upgrade -location location location - magnificent, right in the middle of the strip and by far the key selling point of this hotel, easy to walk to all other places Overall I would recommend it but you HAVE to get the upgrade, it's like it's 2 hotels in terms of difference in quality.

Reviews.Title: “Nicer than expected!”
Reviews.Author: Dreamers78
Reviews.Content: I've never been to Las Vegas and didn't really know what to expect. Friendsof ours typically stay at Bally's and I knew if it was nice enough for them, it would be for us too. We did not upgrade our room and we were pleasantly surprised how spacious and nice our room was. We simply wanted a clean place to sleep and this more than met our expectations! Our plane arrived in the morning and we wondered if we would be able to check in so early. There was no problem checking in at 11 am! We were thrilled! The location on the strip was perfect! We would stay here again, especially at such great prices. We paid about $50 per night.

Reviews.Title: “A racist staff”
Reviews.Author: Plum25
Reviews.Content: My husband, siblings and baby were walking to our room in the south tower and we crossed around the slot machine area when a skinny 50 year-old looking blond waitress called SHERRY from the bar station near to the coffee shop made a very rude gesture to take us out of the area and we weren't even playing or touching the machines we were just walking by, since me and my siblings have dark skin she started saying ANDALE ANDALE and laughing behind our back. My husband turned around and asked her why was she being rude and all she did was call security to escort us out. Upon my arrival to my room, I made a call to the Food and Beverage Manager called GENE and I went down to tell her about the incident, I pointed the waitress and instead of apologizing to me for her racist comments she denied the whole incident and started whining saying that all I wanted if for her to lose her job, she went back to her station and started taking her apron off and pretending she was leaving (but she didn't). Gene told me that I was confused and that she probably didn't mean that way or that maybe she was having a bad day, frankly she seemed more worried about being short of staff if Sherri left than apologizing for someone who had being rude to a customer. On a happier note, I do have some praise to the house keeping department who cleaned my room and replaced all my towels and sheets at 1 am after my child who got a stomach bug started vomiting everywhere, his name was Herman, a very nice hispanic guy and hopefully he never bumps into racist Sherry. Also the guy who worked in the emergency was nice to us since he called us a cab to the hospital after he came over to our room to check our child. In conclusion the place is not that bad for the price and there is some nice people who works there but if you look Hispanic avoid the the bar staion near the south tower avoid the old blond waitress works

Reviews.Title: “Everything to like about Bally's”
Reviews.Author: StateRef
Reviews.Content: Check in service was first rate. Unloading our bags by the Bell Captain was most professional. The desk clerk was friendly, helpful, and found us a better accomodation in the North Tower. Delivery of our luggage was speedy. The room was clean, spacious, and quiet. We were not charged for use of the in-room safe. Also the hallways were clean. Never a long wait for an elevator. Others have said that the casino seemed to be dead, and catered to a "mature" group. Not so this stay! It was a most active, entertaining place. The walkway to Paris was convenient, too. On several occasions one of the moving sidewalks to Las Vegas Blvd was not in service. Taking a cab to Bally's, left turn off Flamingo can be a several dollar wait. It was easier arriving from I-15 onto Flamingo (right turn). We ate breakfast at the Sidewalk Cafe. It's small buffet served our needs and is inexpensive at $9.99. We would gladly stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Just Right!”
Reviews.Author: travel0907
Reviews.Content: I checked into Bally's on April 2nd for a 3 night stay. It took about 10 minutes to check in. We booked a South Tower room but were upgraded to a North Tower. This also happened the previous time we stayed here. The room was HUGE compared to other Vegas rooms. We had 4 people in it and it never felt cramped. It was very clean and looked recently renovated. There was a little wear and tear but millions of people visit Vegas each year so you have to expect it a little. Nothing you would notice unless your searching or looking for it. Our view was of Bill's, Flamingo, Imperial Palace, etc. I have stayed in almost all properties on the strip. This is one of the best deals for your money. It is by no means a luxury hotel if you want that your going to have to pay for it. Especially in Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “South Tower Not Up to Vegas Standards”
Reviews.Author: lchin
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel several times but only once before in the south tower, the oldest of the towers, and that was in 1993. It doesn't look like they have done one thing since that time to upgrade this space. The carpet is the same, the rooms were not as clean as they could be with the carpeting worn in many spots, and the furniture is so worn it would be better thrown out or burned. I was sorely disappointed, but if you wanted to stay in the other towers, it was $20 per night more. You would think that a large corporation like the conglomerate that owns Bally's would have updated this tower by this time. Personally, I would have rather stayed off the strip at The Orleans where the rooms are pristine. This hotel seems to be going downhill.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but that's about it!”
Reviews.Author: PedroPerth
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel was brilliant and easy walking to the shows I had booked at Caeser's Palace and The Mirage so I would recommend it for that alone but be warned. The hotel itself is nothing to get excited about. Seeing all the food trays outside the rooms was a bit yuk but I had read about this on TA before I arrived so expected that. I guess they have cut costs by reducing staff. I had one of the poorest occurances at a hotel ever one afternoon when I decided to come back to my room for a nap and put the 'do not disturb' card on the door but then the room attendant rang me on the phone in my room asking me if I wanted my room made up. I thought that was really disrespectful as the 'do not disturb' sign speaks for itself (including calling on the telephone). This was my first hotel in years all over the world that did not provide free internet access. I thought that was incredible. Just really poor customer service all round really. My other gripe was that the in-room safes were not free and were charged per day to your room account and as I had already prepaid for my room was unable to use it without returning to the long queues at reception to re-jig my account to allow for further charges (I didn't bother). I loved Vegas but would look for a hotel with higher customer service standards next time. I am happy to pay for the extras but, please, just build that into the cost of the room and stop having your hand out for every little extra!

Reviews.Title: “Loved,loved loved Bally's”
Reviews.Author: WinnipegWendy
Reviews.Content: I don't care what other have to complain about Bally's. They treated us great! Quick, friendly check in (check out too and they even comped our safe fee). Upgraded us for free the North tower. Large, clean room. Big beautiful bathroom. Great side angled view of the strip! (Okay the windows were a little dirty.. boo hoo). Ice machine right by the elevator. Really comfortable king bed! Pool was nice (cool that the monorail goes right by it). Would have been nice to have an outdoor hot tub after walking all those miles up and down the Strip? Found the $1 margaritas (they even tasted like they had alcohol)and $2 draft in the Tequila bar at the far right corner of the casino on the last day, wish we had found it day 1. $3 all you can eat chips and salsa made a good snack after a long day shopping. Bally's is nicely located on the strip right in the middle. Easy walk to everything including the Miracle Mile Mall (great$3.95 breakfast at La Cantina's til 11A.M.) and Fashion Show Mall. New Ace/Bullet bus service to the outlet malls (the Deuce doesn't go there anymore). Just started this week in fact, and was really fast and easy, though you do need exact change to purchase ticket at kiosk at the bus stops ($3 for 2 hours, or $7 for 24 hours?). Saw the Beatle's Love show and it was amazing! Ask at the Mirage box office if there are any discounts or go to any of the many Tickets for Less places? Box office doesn't offer up the info but if you ask, they did offer us 35% off of $175 Saturday night tickets, bringing them down to about $114 each. Well worth it! Will book at Bally's next time again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Great price”
Reviews.Author: gmon
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Bally's for spring break March 28 thru the 30th. I got the room for a decent price $59 dollars a night in the north tower. The hotel is old but it was clean. Check in took about 5 minutes but the line got pretty long after I had checked in. Best feature, the location plus it is one of the stops for the monorail. I wanted to see the new city center so I took the monorail to mgm, crossed the street to nyny then walked to monte carlo where they have a tram to aria. Thats a new and beautiful hotel, but back to Bally's. One other thing I like about Bally's is that it has the old fashion pool where one side is deep, I believe there used to be a diving board there, but no longer. Overall, no complaints. For the price, I would go back.

Reviews.Title: “The best deal for the location!!!”
Reviews.Author: my2centsontravel
Reviews.Content: This hotel has one of the best locations on the strip! Right in the center of everything. Since this was our first visit, the location was everything. The room was spacious and clean with a good view. The service desk attendants could have been a little more helpful (maybe b/c we booked through another source.) The casino is not as swanky as the Mirage or some of the others, but this hotel was a great deal for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great price!!”
Reviews.Author: sjsNewCastle_IN
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Vegas this morning, and our stay at Bally's was GREAT. I had checked prices, and this was an awesome deal. In the past, we had stayed at neighboring Paris, and enjoy the casinos in both places. Bally's deal was the reason we chose this hotel. We were upgraded to the North Tower, but we had only rooftop views. No big deal....you are really only in your room to sleep and shower. Our room was large, bed was great, and the bathroom had been remodeled with marble. Our maids were topnotch, and the check in was easy, but I think that depends on your arrival time. We will stay at Bally's again, soon I hope.

Reviews.Title: “Bally's was a bad idea”
Reviews.Author: henrylucyChicago
Reviews.Content: Too bad I did not read the reviews before we went. Bath tub handle broke, one was repaired with a simple phone call but the other is an accident waiting to happen. Wallpaper held together with tape and in some other spots just curling up. Common people! Get someone to scrape off that wall paper and buy a can of paint. The carpet was worn and needed a good scrub. A far cry from the Bally's we stayed at years ago. A++ for housekeeping as they seemed to be the only ones responding.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: MarkSSeattle
Reviews.Content: Just got back from five days/four nights at Bally's. We've stayed at Bally's several times and have never been disappointed, but have learned it's worth the effort (money?) to get a north tower room after once being in the south tower. We'd booked the "standard" room, but Joey at check-in was great and put us in a king non-smoking "suite" (just a larger room with extra vanity and dressing area) in the north tower. I did the $20 tip routine when I gave him my credit card and ID, but I think he'd likely have done it regardless. He made sure we were on the quiet side due to road construction at night on Flamingo. The room was huge by Vegas standards, and bright with floor-to-ceiling windows. The bed was very comfortable and we slept soundly every night. The view was southerly, over the pool, tennis courts, part of the strip and the airport. Housekeeping was thorough and even put out extra soap, toiletries and towels when they noticed we were using both vanities. The room and hallway were quite clean, in contrast to what some others posting here have experienced. Bally's is a gem in terms of accommodations, staff quality, and location relative to price. Yes, it's a bit shopworn in places (as are many of the casinos at this point), but they don't charge you as if it's the newest thing in town either. I sure hope they don't change their niche. My biggest gripe is with Harrah's and other strip locations in general. The gaming odds (blackjack, video poker) are poor. Heck, I always lose anyway, but at least I do it more slowly at the places with better payouts. Harrah's, maybe you'd make more in the long run with better odds, since some of your patrons might spend more time gambling in-house rather than elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Tips Tips Tips”
Reviews.Author: visitvacations
Reviews.Content: Stayed on this hotel last March 21 for 3 days... got it from hotwire but could have gotten a better deal by going direct through it's promo over the internet. We read all the story about the south tower wing... so we opted for the $20 sandwich tips which we read from some forum over the net. The lady at the front desk graciously accepted the tip on our check-in and ask us about which bed we like and smoking or non smoking...We were placed in the north tower wing which were the newer rooms. She even gave us some coupons which we didn't really found any good value. There are no free wifi on the room and it will cost you $13.98 per day for their wiredLan. Using their in-room safe will also cost you money. Room amenities are average, coffee is not good. No complimentary water bottles, no room ref. Our bed linens had some minor stain when we arrived. We were so tired that we didn't bother to call up the house keeping to change it. We were hoping that next day they would change... however we found out that you have to contact them for change before they would do it. On the following day we forgot to leave a tip on our table and when we return to our room it was not properly made up. The trash were not taken out. The beddings were not changed.... very bad service I believe for this hotel. They expect you have to give tip just for them to work.... isn't it that tips are given when they do an excellent job? a job that is way above and beyond the normal standard that clients feel were superior than what they expect... Oh well.. I guess this is Vegas and everything is just money... The hotel is centrally located on the strip but the Tower wing is set back for about a block or so away so going back to your room from the Las Vegas strip is a bit of a walk especially with a child involve it could be a bit of a walk... but this is vegas where everywhere on the strip is a walk away... There is a free parking building that they share with the Paris hotel at the side of the hotel. The luggage storage was free..but the bellman tells you up front that they do expect to be tipped. I won't mind giving tip but I just hope they would do an excellent work...

Reviews.Title: “Location good, service sucks!”
Reviews.Author: sophiegrayy
Reviews.Content: Location is center strip,so this hotel has a great location. We got the room in north tower, and they say that north tower has better rooms than south. The room was spacious but I doubt it was really cleaned before we checked in. There was a hair pin lying on the bathroom floor that wasn't mine. The sheets has tiny stains on it, so that means the sheets were not changed. You need to pay extra if you want to use the safety deposit box. The line on the check in counter was long. I saw a note on the night table, saying that we need to call a certain number if we want to have our sheets changed. I thought that it was just a card, and when i turned it over, it was an envelope. Because of their service, I rate this hotel terrible despite of its good location and spacious rooms. Their service and extra charges were a big turn offs. Customer service in the U.S. is pretty bad in general. I've been to Japan, and they really work with integrity. They don't demand tip, and doesn't even accept them, but they still do their job well, and they are very customer oriented.

Reviews.Title: “rooms are nowheres near a 4 star, not even a 3”
Reviews.Author: riverratWells
Reviews.Content: writing this while laying on my lumpy king sized bed trying not to roll to the middle. looking up i can see my multi shaded ceiling, which i assume should be all one color. at least 3 different stain hues from water above or something. look down and i can see the matted worn carpeting and dust build up in the corner of the room entry door. the furniture is something you would expect in maybe a 2 star, well worn and faded. booked thru orbit ,. it was described as a 3 to 4 star. called the front desk to complain but we got the run around about this being the deluxe room we booked thru orbitz, we could however upgrade to a better room at a cost of over twice as much as we originally booked for. and for some reason they wanted to know how much we paid to begin with before they could tell us the upgrade price. room is located on 5th floor north tower, just overlooking the beautiful 4th floor roof and airconditioners. because of the room i would say stay away from the north tower, because of the front desks handling of the situation i would say stay away from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Served its purpose”
Reviews.Author: Brisas
Reviews.Content: I received a free upgrade to the North Tower with double beds. Not much of a view from the 7th floor, but it was a lot nicer than what I was expecting. Some chipped paint in the room and the shower fixture looked like it had popped off the wall, but nothing unworkable. Room was clean, beds were comfortable. Only issue I had were the sheets were very 'linty.' I brought two black pants to wear, and both were covered in lint whenever I laid in bed. Reverted to wearing jeans for the rest of the stay. We walked through Paris more and often caught the shuttle to Rio (to eat at the Carnival buffet-there was a special for $24 all you can eat throughout the day). The shuttle to Rio is located on the corner, when you exit the Paris hotel. Great location and close by Tix4Tonight sales at Bills Gambling Hall & Casino, across the street from Bally's. We had a car rental for a week and parked in the free Paris Hotel parking structure. Very convenient and closeby.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks for the room with the horrible view”
Reviews.Author: luciob1
Reviews.Content: I am about to take my 3rd trip to Vegas in the past year. Last year I had a North Tower Grand Suite. The room ws nice, but I literally had a view of a roof area that contained air conditioning units...or some such thing. I could see nothing besides that and another Bally building past that. Since then, when making my reservations, I have learned to request a nice view. During my last trip, when the desk clerk at Caesars read the wording of my "not a crappy view" request, he kind of smiled, and I told him about what Bally's gave me...so he gave me a very nice room on the 30+ floor with a gorgeous view of the Bellagio water show and the strip. I know all of the money goes into a Harrah's bucket, but I'm very unlikely to choose Bally's again for future stays.

Reviews.Title: “On the fence, but good for the price.”
Reviews.Author: FishGirl22
Reviews.Content: Hunny and I just returned from 5 days at Ballys, Las Vegas. Upon arrival we were comped a suite due to the fact they had no 'standard' rooms left, we were told we would have to come back and change rooms when they became available the day after next. Good for us! The suite was in the North tower, Huge, his and her vanities, 2 bathrooms, and a jacuzzi tub big enough for 4, (well maybe not that big...) Large living area. Kitchen complete with coffee maker, 2 televisions and couches, with extra seating. Bed was comfortable. And a great view of Ceasars Palace and the Flamingo side of the strip. But if you pressed your cheek to the window in the living room, you could see the fountains at the Bellagio... Clean for the most part, the shower in the bathroom was dirty, paint was chipping, older so whatever. The bed was clean but under it hadn't been vacuumed in a very long time. When we had to swich, it was done quickly and efficiently. Went into a standard room also in the North tower. Nothing special, but it was larger than we expected for a regular room. T.V. was tiny. no coffee maker. The room was dirty. The bathroom floor had not been washed. The tub had several questionable 'hairs' in it. Used soap and shampoo in the tub. Under the bed and around it were not vacuumed, crumbs and paper bits, dirt, as well as very dirty around the perimeter of the room. I had slippers so didn't care too much.
