Bed, sheets and pillows were clean. The shower had horrible water pressure, mixed with a need of a new shower head that would spray any which way but straight..., it was really horrible. Hot water supply was good at night, don't know about the mornings. I would of requested a room change had we been in there longer, but for 3 days, we were fine. Housekeeping comes at 8am, they knock once and come on in. Put your sign out if you don't want to be bothered. The hotel was pretty cool, the location was perfect. The casino was good, not great service with waitresses if your playing slots they are pretty sparse. And as I remember when they did come around were 'bothered' by taking drink orders, really didn't seem to be happy to be there(not all of them, but most that we encountered). and always waited around for a tip. (not that they shoudn't but they don't have to be so obvious,and rude.) Didn't do any shopping at the hotel, prices were very high, cigs were $8.95 in the hotel, and $4 at the ampm a block away. There is a pizza place, and icecream shop,candy store near the south enterance. Prices again were high. Really neat walkway between Ballys and Paris, Very cool! Filled with restraunts and shops. For the price we paid, I was happy. If we would of been put into the dirty showerless room right off the bat, I don't think i'd be so pleased. I'd go back for sure, the location is everything, and with the secrets of nearby shopping and dining for less $$$ I felt that it was a great place for us. Go with an open mind, and don't be too fussy. But if cleanliness is at the top of your priority list, and would ruin your trip, then probably not the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location”
Reviews.Author: echoboy
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Bally's for 3 nights (Mar 20-22) and had a good time. Spent almost no time in the casino as it is small, older and does not have much atmosphere. Check-in and out were very quick and easy. Easy to get to/from rooms (lots of elevators). The room was nice and clean, exceeding my expectations based on other reviews. Stayed in the north tower, so maybe that made a difference. Was able to get a good deal using Harrah Total Rewards, so it was cheaper than anywhere else on the strip. Love being in the middle of the strip, although the distance from the strip to the hotel entrance is a pain. Did not eat there or really use any of their services, so no opinions there. Overall, I would recommend Bally's as a good low-cost, center of the strip base for your Vegas vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Try to avoid getting a room near the elevator”
Reviews.Author: AussieSlumDog
Reviews.Content: On the first night the only room they had left was next to the elevator. Luckily I was too tired to hear it, but believe me, it was loud. I managed to get upgraded to the north tower for the subsequent nights. Much better quality in the north tower. Internet access was limited, which was disappointing. The room was clean enough but pretty basic. The bed was hard but manageable

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: Terre033
Reviews.Content: So I had heard Pros and Cons about Bally's so I thought I would just give it a shot. The hotel is in a perfect location and if that is what you are looking for go for it. Everything else is awful. I booked a king room but was told there were none when we arrived, they gave us a single queen room and told us it was a bigger room. Our room was huge as it was part of a suite combo. Our bed was a hide away bed. The Hallway leading to are room was, and still is, littered with room service trays. There are some that have been out there since we arrived on Sat.(I am writting this on Tues) The whole hotel is old and out dated. The windows frames are aluminum, just to give you some indication of the age, oh and they are all screwed shut. The hotel/ Casino is in no better shape. Everything smells of smoke and old liquor. There is nothing modern, or glamorous. On our visit to Vegas last year we stayed at TI and it was like night and day! The only good news about this hotel is it is attached to Paris. We sleep and and stay over there.

Reviews.Title: “Bally's has seen better days.”
Reviews.Author: RealSnook
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Bally's for a wedding at Caesar's, as the rooms were ~$100 cheaper per night. We had a south tower suite; it felt like a tired room in a Pullman, WA motel. The decor was dated and the floors (especially in the shower) were gross. For $220/night, I've stayed in 4-5 star hotels in San Francisco, NYC, etc. that were miles ahead of this one. See pics for proof.

Reviews.Title: “Fair hotel, fair price”
Reviews.Author: np206100
Reviews.Content: Pros: fair price for the room, upgraded to the newer north tower for $10 a day after booking a room in the south tower ($30 difference during booking), free parking, good location, use of Paris Hotel's facilities Cons: no frills, have to pay for internet, gym, coffee, parking lot is kind of far from the hotel, no pool, no sport book, outdated looking casino, expensive restaurants I saw a friend's room in the south tower and thought the $10 upgrade was fair, I wouldn't have paid $30, maybe $20 though

Reviews.Title: “never againnnn”
Reviews.Author: Nurse_Roya
Reviews.Content: I got a deal of hotel + air for Las Vegas in winter; I stayed in Bally’s hotel. If you decide to stay in this hotel please think again. First of all room and hallway did smell so bad and never went away. Secondly, room that I stayed had nothing. no fridge, no coffee maker, no micro wave… Furniture was so old and worn out. Window was so dirty that you could barely see the view outside. Room was not even vacuumed properly. Under bed was full of dust. So, for the money I paid I did not get any service.

Reviews.Title: “never stay again”
Reviews.Author: Dalulan
Reviews.Content: We booked the package with allegiant air and arrived at 1:00 AM. We have 3 rooms and request at least 2 rooms have to be connecting room. The lady said this is a request and not guarantee ,all the connecting rooms are gone and I need to pay $25 more per night to get a room and suite connected. After I said No, than she said she could waive the $25. After we get in the room .We find out that all rooms are right above the monorail, it is extremely noisy. I went down to the lobby and complained and they said there is no more room. We need to wait to next day to get change. Because too noisy My parents go to complain again in 1 hour later and the lady said if they want to change the room tonight my parents need to pay $25. They just want to get the extra money from your pocket. The rooms are big but every things are very old. If you get the room # 5504 5604 5704 5804 5904 try to refuse it right away. the sound like an airplane flying all night long.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value on Hotwire for Center Strip Property.”
Reviews.Author: JustinH
Reviews.Content: Picked this hotel up on Hotwire for $54 per night. We were assigned a room in the south tower on the 6th floor. This is one of the lower floors, and we did not get a strip view. We had a view of a parking garage. I was still very impressed with this property and the room. Everything was clean and upgraded. Granite counter tops in the bathroom, nice carpeting, nice decoration. Lots of space in their "bottom of the line" room.. Totally worth the money, and great location. The pool looked great, we didn't swim but other people were. This is a first class establishment. I would stay there again for sure. There was only one weird fee, $3 for "in room safe rental". I found this odd, but it was too cheap to argue them over this. I didn't like that they charged $12.95 per night for internet usage. I passed on that. Parking is free (as per usual in Vegas), unless you want to Valet. Surrounding properties are 100+ per night, this is a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: jg1983
Reviews.Content: Good value through Orbitz.com. Room was huge, it was like having two regular rooms in one. Nice king size bed not to hard or soft. The pillows were ok, they looked fluffy but flattened out when you laid on them. Hotel is next next door to Paris and connects with it. The Hotel feels like its right in the middle of the strip which is nice. Planning on going back to Vegas in September and going to stay here again. "Tip" Fremont street is a must. Go early so that way you have time to spend but leave when it gets dark since a whole other element likes to come out when its dark. Bally's has a shopping area below the casino floor which is something that was didnt get a chance to see since we didnt know :(

Reviews.Title: “good value; great location”
Reviews.Author: RoamCat
Reviews.Content: 6 nights in south tower. big room; great view of Bellagio fountains; hard bed; clean but tired and stained; friendly,helpful personnel. rec'd good value for the low price we paid. would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location Best Part of Bally's”
Reviews.Author: jewelgirl22000
Reviews.Content: Beware the Time Share Sellers - they are everywhere and relentless! They are stationed at the front doors and will approach you every time you walk by them. The check in people are not very helpful or friendly. We couldn't get an upgrade without waiting in avery long line. We got two queen size bed on the 6th floor of the North Tower. We had a nice view of Wild Bill's and the Flamingo and could also see part of the Bellagio. Our room was spacious and clean but very old and worn. We had a lots of pillows, comfortable beds, blackout drapes and good temperature control so we slept very well. There is no complimentary coffee and a cup costs between $3 and $4. The food and drinks were very expensive and not very good. Tip: Go next door past Paris Las Vegas to the Miracle Mile Shopping Center for some inexpensive and good food.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: kar344
Reviews.Content: Bally's was excellent. My room was cleaned spotlessly every day I was there. The location is perfect if one wants to stay on the Strip--it's right in the middle of everything. All employees from check-in to check-out were friendly and helpful. Cocktail service at the slots was good. The room needed a little maintenance (peeling wallpaper corners, etc.), but overall it was very nice. My only hesitation would be the long, isolated walk from the Monorail stop at night. It is enclosed, but it's really isolated. I would definitely stay at Bally's again, though.

Reviews.Title: “Inept reservation dept, even worse customer service”
Reviews.Author: Sean_L_AZ
Reviews.Content: We made reservations WELL in advance for a non-smoking king. They overbooked and told us we could upgrade for free. We signed the agreement and spent 3 days in a jacuzzi suite. We were barely there, so we were enraged when they charged us the total value of the room. It was their fault for overbooking and their fault for promising the same rate for an upgrade. They were dismissive when we explained our case citing our agreement. We had the name of the clerk. They never talked to her and blew me off when I explained that they were costing more in future visits than gaining by overcharging us then. We stayed at Bally's 6 times prior to that visit. We will NEVER go back. Oh, and the room was dirty and outdated and many things were broken (curtain rods, trim, bed frame, and table-side lamp).

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Trip at Ballys”
Reviews.Author: jamton34
Reviews.Content: I was on business this trip and stayed at Ballys where the convention was held. Checked in on tuesday at 11am, since it was a convention the line took a few minutes but wasn't unacceptable. At check in the desk person informed me that no non-smoking rooms were ready let but had smoking rooms ready. Since I was traveling alone and wouldnt spend much time in the room I took the smoking room and was upgraded free of chrage to a full suite in the north tower. Nice, clean room but all of the rooms at ballys are somewhat dated. The room was clean with small wear and tear showing. I played exclusively at HET properties and had a great time. I enjoyed playing near the party pit around 9 pm during the week. The music was going and everyone was having a good time. Thank you to Ballys for another fun trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Beautiful Interior, Great Food, Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: triniphotographer
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for my stay in Las Vegas While working in the NAB convention. It is located around the middle of "The Strip" so at night you can walk to pretty much anywhere you need to go very easily. I walked to the end one way one night and the other way the other night. This hotel is also a short shuttle ride away from the convention center so took no more than 10 minutes to get there in the Mornings. The Casino is very large and there is also great live entertainment at night. Our room Had a great view and was very relaxing to sit and stare out the window at night. I thoroughly enjoyed my stay here and would recommend it to anyone looking to spend some time up and down "The Strip"

Reviews.Title: “Not accomodating at all, very rude staff”
Reviews.Author: nancinmofo
Reviews.Content: Okay here goes, first of all, I hereby swear that all of these events took place and I am withholding the names to protect the privacy of the ladies I was with. I booked the room through priceline and requested a king sized bed due to my height (6ft7 for all you ladies interested). Anyway I was picked up at the airport by my friend ans she brought her friend along as well so the three of us could spend the night together. I got to the hotel and the clerk gave me a room with two double beds knowing that the three of us were to spend the night together and I was 6ft 7.Oy Vay! She refused to accomidate us so I talked to the manager and she was more of a hater than the first girl I spoke to (she was in her fifties and the girls I was with were 21 and 19 respectively). Anyway I didnt get much sleep that night and didnt like my experiance with the hotel. Please read part two of my Vegas venture at the Bally hotel that will be posted in the coming days. I complained to the general manager and he comped me two nights plus four buffett tickets

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: azeddie
Reviews.Content: First trip to Vegas and lucked out this hotel has a great location in the middle of the strip easy walking distance to rest of the strip. Not the plushest of hotels, but the rooms were nice, clean, and quiet with comfortable beds. The price was much less than the plush hotels across the street and I didn't stay in my room much anyway. The only negative is that Las Vegas Blvd (the strip) is a very long walk though the casino. The spa was great and restaurants delightful. Will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Housekeeping is unacceptable with leaving rooms unfinished and dirty”
Reviews.Author: TheLoLo
Reviews.Content: In the time I was there (8 nights) the room was never vacuumed properly and there was dirt and dust under everything They would take the old soap away but not leave new soap, they would forget to leave an extra roll of toilette paper when they only left half a roll (had to phone down to ask for some), they would forget to leave us glasses or the ones they did leave (or we had to ask them) were dirty, we were short of towels constantly and when asking them in the hall for something they forgot, they were rude and grumpy. The old tower could have the very old and disgusting furniture replaced. There are holes, chips and chunks taken out of the the furniture. The linen is just as disgusting with stains and discoloring of the bed-throws. Can you get some new pillows????? I will NEVER go back to that hotel again. They have no consideration or respect for their customers. There is no excuse for bad housekeeping. Lorraine from Montreal

Reviews.Title: “Would probably go back to Bally's”
Reviews.Author: 2crazyladies
Reviews.Content: Our check in was fairly quick with no problems as well as the check out. They offered us the upgrade to the North Tower for an extra $20 per night and we accepted. We requested a non-smoking room and it smelled like a smoking room. The room was very large and the bathroom was terrific with great lighting. Unfortunately, the wallpaper was peeling off the walls, the paint was chipping off the bathroom "vanity", the shower faucet was loose and in danger of breaking off and the t.v. also didn't work well. We requested a new room the next morning and were given a much better room. It certainly didn't smell smokey which was a big concern. The beds were comfortable and the cleaning service was good. We spoke to a couple who were upgraded to a suite - free of charge - so we believe that this upgrade business is definitely a bit of a scam. Some people get charged and others don't. Not very impressed with that. The location is good as it is the centre of the strip but be prepared to walk. If you're not interested in walking check out the Deuce bus. Pretty cheap transportation but if you are going a fair distance and it's busy, it will definitely take some time. Since Bally's and Paris are connected, we did eat a number of times in Paris but it can be costly. The casino in Paris is better than Bally's if you're into alot of gambling. Rates are reasonable at Bally's so would like go back but it's always nice to try somewhere new.

Reviews.Title: “Ballys the most bang for my buck”
Reviews.Author: twinyman
Reviews.Content: It was my first time in Vegas Feb 22nd - 26th, and I loved the place. Ballys wasn't my first choice Hard Rock was, but I cancelled my reservations when I had accumulated enough points on my Total Rewards card to stay for free. Upon arrival they offered an upgrade to a junior suite for $20 a day so I took it. I would have liked to see the free room they had originally offered me, although the room I had was nice I believe the other room would have been the same quality. I was on the 23rd floor and it was quiet and spacious two sinks and a couch. The sheets were thin and the heat took a while to kick in. The water pressure was low and the carpet looked like it had seen better days. One set of pillows had feathers that poked out and stuck you if you weren't careful. The housekeepers didn't pick up a Corona bottle from under the nightstand table that was left there from the previous occupants. But the locations was excellent right in the middle of everything. Walking distance from Ceasers, New York, Flamingo and connected to the Paris. Everything looks close but it's not I was glad that the hotel offered a free shuttle to the Rio (over @ 1 am). Good food in Ballys but it was better in the Paris. Friendly staff and side deals could be made just for a offering a tip. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Bally's: Always Consistent!”
Reviews.Author: Yukon2010
Reviews.Content: Each year we wonder off to Vegas to enjoy the many offerings the city has. Bally's consistently is a winner....Even though it is middle of the road...in price and location the hotel is always the same. The casino is alot of fun...the slots are favourable and the wait staff are friendlly.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms Need Updating”
Reviews.Author: calgarysam
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Ballys Las Vegas after staying from Feb. 21-27th. Booked thru Expedia and price was average. After looking at many hotels as to what they had to offer as far as room etc. decided to stay a Ballys because thought location would be close to stripe and rooms looked clean and attractive enough WITHOUT stretching the budget . Well this is an understatment. We paid extra for a deluxe room, dont bother as the room looks nothing like what is shown on their website or expedias website. Room shows royal blue beddings, ottomon and chair - when walking into the room it actually looked like the bed had not been finished made. All there was was a white striped thin sheet covering a thin duvet and pillow covered in white plain pillowcases. NOT ATTRACTIVE AT ALL. Nothing close to what room was advertished as. Went to the front desk to see if maybe we had the wrong room, thought maybe this was the classic room, clerk at front desk said we received what we paid for (Deluxe room) Carpet was very dirty - bathroom was fine. Yes although Ballys is in the centre of the strip you need to walk some way to get to the stripe from the hotel. We have stayed at the Excalibur and Flamingo in the past and if I were to choose between these 3 - the Flamingo would win hands down. I did not feel we got our moneys worth at Ballys - especially when the rooms averaged $89.00 from Sun to Thur. and $179.00 on Friday. Will never stay at Ballys again. Also if you go to the Price is Right show and get your free picture taken (which you print from the internet after coming home) you might want to tell the people taking the picture that pics can not be retreived even after entering into on their trouble site. WHAT A JOKE.....Dont bother eating at Ballys, we ate at Paris restaurants which were great especially the french bistro on the strip attached to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: Sparky187
Reviews.Content: Carpet, drapes, walls, bathroom, t.v., beds, furniture all old and in desperate need of a renovation. Customer service is non existant. I had a small very easily rectofiable issue that I spoke to 4 differant people there and nothing was done. Emailed Ballys when I got home. Said would contact me within 24hours 5 days later nothing. As a result, myself and everyone that I was travelling with threw out our Ballys cards and spent the remaining 3 days spending our gambling, sportsbook, restaunt, bar, night clubbing and entertainment dollers in any place but a Harrahs property. Spend the extra $15 a night and stay in a nice place like treasure island. Honestly if I just woke up in a room in Ballys and didn't know where I was I would guess a $19.95 special in Raleigh North Carolina

Reviews.Title: “Going to Vegas baby!!”
Reviews.Author: stevenketa2003
Reviews.Content: It's a good location on the strip and in walking distance to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: CUTE_TORONTO_COUPLE
Reviews.Content: LOCATION Staying at Ballys was a great spot because its in the center of the main strip which does reduce your walking time. Although you will definately need a great pair of runners no matter where you stay. Paris and Ballys are connected, and I must say that Paris was our favourite place to eat, fantastic food and a good variety. APPEARANCE Ballys is not one of the sparkily new hotels but they have done some upgrades to rooms in the north tower, elevators, and lobby. Expect your usual tired looking carpets and furniture seen in an old hotel, however everything was clean. EXTRAS We requested a room in the North Tower, they also tossed in a fridge and even paid for the safe costs which is 3$/day. Ask and you shall receive, they want to make you happy. Definately a non-smoking room. The view was nice as well. SERVICES The cleaning staff did a good job, but they come early. if you like to sleep in place your DND sign on the door. We did call for extra towels and blankets, they came with in 10 minutes, quick service. SLEEP QUALITY Its not a sound proof hotel, like most. You hear the party people comming and going at all hours, but over all this was not a problem. What can you expect, nothing ever closes. We had a great big king bed and slept like babes. VALUE Ballys is one of the cheaper hotels, unless you are willing to stay further off the strip in which case there are some great deals. For the price we would stay here again. TALK We were worried about staying at Ballys because of some bad reviews on TripAdvisor HOWEVER everything was just fine and we had a wonderful trip.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Beat the Price and Location”
Reviews.Author: doodie61
Reviews.Content: I have been to vegas around 15 times and this is my second stay at Ballys. We stayed for 5 nights 2/3 to 2/8. I have not been here for several years and travelled with 3 friends for a boys trip for Super Bowl weekend. Check in was no problem and rooms were clean, we stayed in the North Tower. Originally we booked the south tower and I received an email to upgrade to the north tower for $10 per night so thats what we did. If your a total rewards member then you can get discounts on the rooms. Also you can get a limo at the airport for $38 and I always do that. We did not see room service trays or carts in the hallways as stated in other reviews. Our room was cleaned every day and we had no issues with stains or outdated furniture. When your in vegas your not in the room that much only for a couple of hours of shut eye. My only complaint was there was no coffee pot. I cant function without coffee so every morning I would throw on some clothes and go to the coffee kiosk next to the reception area. The beauty of this hotel is that it is connected to Paris and you dont need to leave the hotel to have a variey of bars, restaurants, and gambling. It was raining one entire day during our stay so we did not leave the hotel. Check out the circle bar at Paris great place to people watch. We played golf at the rio secco and it was a great course but expensive. $50 cab ride to the course and $150 to play with rental clubs. Worthwhile we almost played a 2nd time. Check out was easy, you dial a number to check out or you can check out on the tv, No problems there. I would definetly do a boys trip here again.

Reviews.Title: “Ballys review”
Reviews.Author: StaciM2
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and the staff was very courteous!

Reviews.Title: “Vegas”
Reviews.Author: enortep163
Reviews.Content: The last few times i've been staying at Bally's--nice sized rooms/clean/great location--awesome pool---used to stay at Harrah's all the time that's great too--good time to be had

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: SuzanneF3
Reviews.Content: Older hotel but good bargain and great location. Al Dente restaurant was good. Tequila bar was not - I was completely ignored - ordered water and got it, but I wanted dinner, too. No one came near me after bringing me the water! But Al Dente had excellent food and friendly and attentive staff - ate there twice. Pool was closed, but I could use the one at Paris, next door.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good for the price”
Reviews.Author: RosieS
Reviews.Content: I was upgraded to the North tower because I have a Harrah's total rewards card. I'm fairly loyal to their casinos because they have the best comps. Have stayed in several hotels on the strip over time. For the mid-price range I was happy with this one. Very convenient to other places. Easy walkover to Caesars, and you can go in Paris Hotel without getting outside. Service was friendly. Never knew where to park, but valet was quick and easy. Can pull right out on Flamingo and take it over to Paradise drive to avoid traffic on the strip if you want to go north or south.

Reviews.Title: “Business Presentation at Bally's”
Reviews.Author: Jinxed
Reviews.Content: The room was nice, the gambling was fun, and the restuarants were good.

Reviews.Title: “Getaway”
Reviews.Author: JosephS4
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went out to Vegas for her birthday and really enjoyed ourselves. We didn't gamble at all. We saw a few shows and enjoyed our time away. Bally's Hotel was great. The staff were great and the facility was also great.

Reviews.Title: “An Absolutley Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: Bettyboop37
Reviews.Content: I made the reservation to surprise my husband for an early 50th anniversary celebration. Then I started reading the reviews - and some of them were so negative that I almost cancelled. I AM SO GLAD I DID NOT DO THAT!!! Our room was on the 20th floor of the south tower with a fantastic view of the strip from Caesar's north. The room was huge; the carpet was in perfect condition as were the walls, the bathroom, and everything else. Yes - the windows were a bit dirty but no more than to be expected from even the bit of rain they have there. We checked in at 9:00 p.m. on Valentines Day; the line was a bit long but the process went very quickly and smoothly and all of the front desk people we observed were friendly and efficient. We never saw food trays in the halls. We went to Jubilee and even though we saw it about 15 years ago, we thought it was outstanding. We will definitely stay at Bally's again if we have the opportunity.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but needs work”
Reviews.Author: adventurer1218
Reviews.Content: Good location but the hotel is looking old and tired. Here is the good and bad of it: -good location -spacious rooms -the rooms are clean -the staff is friendly -the windows are dirty -the street location is noisy -the bath towels thin -the halls were filled with dirty dishes for 2.5 days. The hotel needs to pick up room service trays more often than they do. -No more bedspreads? Need more blankets in the closets. -the hallways smell because of all of the old food -the garages are dirty and need to be cleaned up more often -Pool has been closed down for several months --Glad to see that Las Vegas looks like it is getting busier.

Reviews.Title: “This room is huge!”
Reviews.Author: missfishlips
Reviews.Content: Like my title reads, the room is huge! For $59/night I was picturing some cramped, worn, ghetto room...clean, but still small and worn. While there are definitely signs of age in the room (the carpet is the heavy-duty kind for a reason!) and in the hotel itself, I was impressed with the cleanliness and, as I mentioned, the size. Even the bathroom is big! For a plain room that's more a place to crash than spend any extended period of time, our room was perfect: we weren't paying much, we had lots of space, and it was in an awesome location (although it is a long walk to the door, as it is with any hotel in Vegas, although definitely not as long of a walk as it is in Mirage or MGM). Only con for the room was the view kinda sucked but, again, we aren't there to stare out the window so we managed. The pool was just average in terms of scenery; it could be a pool in any hotel in any hot city. It's nice that they offer multiple pools to swim in but the beach chairs could use replacing (serious signs of use!) and the towels they give you are chintzy. All that said, make sure you splurge on a strawberry daquiri; for $16 there's nothing like drinking a triple-shot drink before 10am! Room service was decent. Just decent. Although I will give them credit for being quick!

Reviews.Title: “Spring Break in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: NH4Fun
Reviews.Content: Hotel was average for Vegas. Really enjoyed the classic Donn Arden show.

Reviews.Title: “Great Customer Service and Spacious Rooms”
Reviews.Author: RunawayGirl
Reviews.Content: Stay here. The location is excellent and the customer service was great. Rooms are spacious unlike the new hotels. I had an issue with my room, just my own issue, and my room was changed immediately. The Assistant Manager on Duty, Vicki, took care of it immediately and with no fuss and offered me an even better room. The hallways were pretty quiet not full of rowdy people and the hallways like the rooms are large and spacious to cut down on noise right outside your door. It was President's Day Weekend/Valentine's Day a very crowded weekend there and still great service. My close friends live in Vegas so I go there a lot but this is the first time I have stayed on the strip in 25 years and it was worth it. Great experience I can't wait to go back and stay at Ballys.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location On The Strip”
Reviews.Author: JerseyShoreGal57
Reviews.Content: We stayed for five nights comped in a North Tower. We only had to wait about ten minutes to check in and the clerk at the front desk was personable and friendly. The room is very large with plenty of space for your personal belongings and luggage.The bathroom is large with a tub/shower and the shower had great water pressure and drainage.We had a sliding mirrored door closet that was big for a hotel. The bed was comfortable even though it wasn't a pillow top. The sheets stayed on and didn't slip all over the bed.( One of my pet peeves.) It isn't the Encore,but we weren't expecting it to be either. It's centrally located on the strip.The room was clean but the carpet was filthy. Wear flip flops! Do not go barefoot!! The t.v. is an older tube t.v. but I'm not in Vegas to watch t.v. We had a non smoking room and it didn't have any odors in it. We only used the room for sleeping and showering. It served that purpose. Housekeeping was quick when I requested extra towels up to our room. They were there within ten minutes. Check out took ten minutes and that clerk was very nice also. We always found a parking spot near the elevators every night. We would return!!

Reviews.Title: “Good value at $49 a night.”
Reviews.Author: ChinaShrek
Reviews.Content: I just finished a two night stay at this hotel. It is definitely a tired property but the rooms were clean and large. Room quality varies at this hotel. So, I suggest checking in early so that if there are any problems you can get them fixed (or a different room). The pool was closed when we there but you can use the Paris pool. The location is great, right next to Paris. We had a nice view out of our window. I would not pay more than $60 for a night here. We got our rooms for $49 a night plus tax and I thought it was a very good value.

Reviews.Title: “DON'T GO TO JUBILEE SHOW AT BALLY'S - SUCKS!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ANGERChicago
Reviews.Content: I don't allow to bring camera to the show, everyone asked to checked in before the show even we don't use it....I didn't really want to give away my valueable camera to the person who don't look very good impression...when I return back my camera after show, it broken.. I tried to call box office manager - Martin and Frank many times but they totally ignored... It looks like they drop it on the floor and camera lens broken, can't use it anymore and lost all my good picture. don't go to Jubilee show at bally's

Reviews.Title: “a pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: LindaSusan51
Reviews.Content: Booked in with a group for a meeting, you never know what you will get. Our room in the newly refurbished North Tower was spacious and comfortable with great bed and room to spread our papers and laptops. All was kept perfectly clean and the staff was most helpful. Check-in took 2 or 3 minutes. We originally asked for a room with a view and were given the south tower, overlooking the Eiffel tower and Bellagio fountains. However, the room was dingy and sparsely furnished, even lacking a comfortable reading chair. These rooms are awaiting remodeling. We returned to the front desk, where they moved us immediately to the North Tower. The next available room had a refrigerator, which was so helpful, and a table that fit 4 easily, more room than we needed. The desk warned that the room had no "view" but we found the view of the mountains and the Venetian perfectly fine. The hotel location is perfect, which helped in the February rain. Being able to walk over to the "cobblestoned" Paris without having to leave the building was terrific. While my husband was in a morning meeting I enjoyed breakfast at La Madeleine, just a few steps away. All in all, we could not have asked for a more perfect spot. TIP: if you are taking a taxi to the airport, ask for the $12 route and NOT the $20 route (which is how we came in from the airport!) A bellman gave us that tip and it worked. We got back to the airport in just under $12!

Reviews.Title: “Junior Suite a bit worn, but we had a great stay”
Reviews.Author: luci5
Reviews.Content: No line at check in just before 7pm on a Friday night. Got a nice female check in clerk. I had booked 2 nights North Tower at $39.50/night Fri & Sat on a promo which I think was a mistake as it went up to $199/night the day after I booked. Those nights were booked in my name and 3 nights South Tower in OH’s name, $45/$40/$40. The North Tower rooms have been remodelled, but the South Tower rooms have better views. We asked for the bookings to be linked so we wouldn't have to change rooms. We were offered a Junior Suite in the South Tower for an extra $25/night and decided to take it. We were allocated Room 6211 on the 12th floor. Got to the suite at 7pm and it was massive. King bed, 2 armchairs and table, round table and 2 chairs, lots of drawer space. Huge empty space in the middle of the floor where you could have had a dance. It was big enough to fit another 4 king size beds into. There were 2 steps up to the sunken bath and 2 built-in mirrored double closets, one at each side of the bath. His and hers sinks with lots of counter space and mirrors. The safe was in one of the closets and is charged at $3/day. Toilet in a separate room and bidet in another room. Large separate shower. Lots of toiletries at each sink and the bath. The huge floor to ceiling window was the length of the room and we had a great view of Paris, the Eiffel Tower and Paris balloon, Planet Hollywood, Bellagio, the new City Centre development and south as far as Mandalay Bay. We could also see the fountains at Bellagio. There was a light duvet on the bed and the room was quite old. The carpet was a bit stained, but the rest of the room was clean. There was wired internet access at $13.99/24 hours. Our room is similar to this one, same size, but without the sofa and no whirlpool in the bath: http://www.ballyslasvegas.com/casinos/ballys-las-vegas/casino-misc/grand-suite-detail.html Maid service was excellent and the room was serviced before 10.30am. I called technical services when I found the internet cable was broken. An engineer arrived 10 mins later and had to go and get a new modem. It was fixed an hour later. The casino is large with lots of slot machines. There are several good restaurants including a Steakhouse and Italian as well as a sandwich bar called Nosh. This is our first stay at Bally's, but I would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location-Large Rooms”
Reviews.Author: CatherineB5
Reviews.Content: Good location as BALLY'S is attached (behind) the PARIS hotel. Rooms are large, but need to be updated. Casino is quieter. Pool area is small, and uninviting.

Reviews.Title: “awesome time in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: nicagboi21
Reviews.Content: whats done in vegas stays in vegas, went w my friend Manuel, he was auditioning for model agencies around the us of a and i got to watch him walk the cat walk among other promising soon to be models.. it was awesome.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous”
Reviews.Author: chancesare99
Reviews.Content: we arrived feb 7 stayed till feb 12 had a wonderful time ballys check in was a walk in the park the service was ok the only thing i personally missed was coffee in the room my girl frien doesnt drink it so she didnt care the strip was awesome and the shows were great i was really impressed with jubalee i didnt want to go to looke at a lot of bare bums but was pleasantly surprised the special effects were exeptional go see it we saw a few dinner theatres ad we went down town to have a look around it was unbelievable we saw the rat pack is back it was incredible i saw them in canada and they were ever better here i won a little and love the casinos cause i love to gamble but my friend doesnt so we compromised and saw all the other things the dam the fountain dancing to ballet music the buchanneers and the girls trhe bodies the knights of the round table a magic matinee mac was great and not to forget the venetian sail n the gondala i could go and on my only really complaint was the cost of food but one has to eat and down town was more affordable but all in all it was a wonderful experience and would love to do it again

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended...other than the Breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: shamyhay
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights in February of 2010. The staff was very accomodating to all of our needs, and even upgraded us to a jacuzzi suite free of charge. The check in process for us at Midnight was not a problem. The greatest thing about this hotel is its location. It is right in the heart of the strip with easy access to many surrounding attractions. We ate breakfast in the hotel our first morning there. The service level was very high but the food was tasteless and ridiculously overpriced for the quality. I definitely will stay at Bally's on my next trip to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Over all happy”
Reviews.Author: jailere
Reviews.Content: My wife and I arrived to Ballys around 2 pm the Saturday before the superbowl. Check in was a breeze. We were greeted by friendly staff and I asked about a room upgrade. They stated it was a busy weekend but they could do it for 20.00 extra per night and was advised that the North Tower upgrade was a newer room but less of a view than the South Tower rooms. We opted for the newer room. Since I had stayed at the Flamingo two months earlier I was comparing that room to ours at Ballys (both comprable hotels IMO). Our room was on the 20th floor. It was clean, all things worked properly and was a pleasant room. We had a king bed and not much of a view, as expected. As the room went one word comes to mind "Standard" nothing special nor nothing poor. The two main differences between the Ballys standard room and the Flamingos standard room was the Flamingo had a pillow top mattress, very comfortable bed and ceiling to floor window with a nice view. The service was good and the casino was basic. Ballys Sports book was very nice. The restaraunt food was very good but service was slower that I wuold have expected. You cant go wrong with Ballys or the Flamingo. I happen to prefer the Flamingo, had better luck there too. My Daughter is getting married at Caesers Palace in September and I would expect I will stay across the street at the Flamingo. We will have teenages this time and the pool at the Flamingo is very nice and it is cheaper to stay there for the relatives coming for the event and my kids and theirs can be in the same hotel then.

Reviews.Title: “very nice”
Reviews.Author: TylorA
Reviews.Content: wonderful hotel with a beautiful view and right in the middle of the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Go Elsewhere - Ballys guest service is awful!”
Reviews.Author: SquidGallery
Reviews.Content: With so many great deals now in Vegas, I'm surprised that Ballys doesn't try to be a better place to stay. It's definitely showing wear and tear. But the worst thing about my stay there was that someone from housekeeping was VACUUMING the room next door at 5:00AM and woke me up!!!! When I went next door and asked her what she was doing making so much noise at 5:00AM, her response was, "I'm almost finished." I called the front desk and asked them why someone was vacuuming at 5:00AM and their response was equally bizarre, "we're a 24-hour hotel". First of all, what hotel isn't and secondly what about their paying guests who just want a decent amount of sleep?? I checked out before 7AM!

Reviews.Title: “Clean but old/dated room”
Reviews.Author: freebirdVT
Reviews.Content: My room was updated to a suite when I got there at no extra charge. The suite was huge, but the furniture was very dated. I obviously was not in the updated towers. In its day, this room was top of the line, but had seen better days. The linens were old, but the bed was comfortable. A bit noisy, but tolerable. I would stay here again if there were no better options. The staff was very helpful. The pay for use internet access in the casino was not a good option. It ended up costing me $10 to print a boarding pass and all my personal information was advertised to anyone walking by. The only reason I would not recommend this hotel to a friend is that there are other places out there that are a little nicer for the same price

Reviews.Title: “bed bugs”
Reviews.Author: trusha10
Reviews.Content: six of us went to lasvegas we all stayed at ballys three of us came home with bed bug bites it was awful and when i contacted the hotel they did not care. i have been there probably 10 times even the food was not as good as ussual or the service . i was realy dissapointed......

Reviews.Title: “Had a good time”
Reviews.Author: TCrawford
Reviews.Content: Traveled to Las Vegas for a few days in December. I went with my girlfriend and her two teenage daughters. Check-in was easy and fast. Upgraded to the North Tower, room was great and the girls really enjoyed it, whew! No problems with the room or restroom. Quiet the whole trip and a decent view. Did some gambling at Bally's, didn't do to bad. The roulette dealer was very patient with me, I was a bit tipsy after the Vikings game and spilled a beer on the table. Thought I might get taken out back for that, but she was real cool. Tipped her nicely and left. We will stay at Bally's again. It's fun to walk through Paris everyday and very close to all the strip fun!

Reviews.Title: “Good value; great location!”
Reviews.Author: Wahoo73
Reviews.Content: Checked-in at 3PM on Friday, Jan. 29. Had about twenty people in line, but it moved quickly. Clerk at desk was friendly, courteous and professional. I requested a complimentary upgrade and was assigned a "junior suite" in the remodeled North Tower. (I had booked a standard room in unrenovated South Tower at $190 total for a three-night, weekend stay.) I tipped the clerk for the upgrade and we were in our room three minutes later. (TIP: Bally's is generous with complimentary upgrades, BUT only if you request them. Also, ask for a room on the 16th floor or higher because you can use express elevators to these floors.) The room was clean and spacious, but carpet and furnishings were slightly worn. Although not really a suite in the true sense of the word, it was an oversized room with sitting area and with a separate dressing area w/ sink, vanity and closet, and separate large bathroom, both appointed with a lot of marble. Hot water from the taps was instantaneous. Although the bed did not feel particularly comfortable to sit on, it provided us with restful sleep. House cleaning services were adequate. The only criticism of the room is, as others have noted, that the windows are very dirty and desperately need cleaning. The casino itself is rather small and non-descript. However, it is attached to the Paris Hotel and Casino which is a bit more colorful. Access to the parking garage, which the two hotels share, is fairly convenient, although you must walk through the casino. Among the entertainment venues, I do recommend Napoleon's which features "dueling pianos."

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: WeeBillWestLothian
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 7 nights from 23-30 Jan. $20 trick worked upon check in and we were upgraded to a Junior Suite. Room was spacious and clean. Good view to Paris and Bellagio. Location great, in centre of strip. We never found the Avenue Shoppes until second last day. Cheaper places to eat there. Good link to Paris hotel. Overall i would definately rate this hotel for location and good rates.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: M_B_Lovers
Reviews.Content: Reserved the Guest room for 2 nights, did the $20 trick, got upgrade to Junior Suite. Room was very nice and big. View was great. A little wear and tear but appointments very good. Bed was very comfortable. Check-in was long. So was check-out, wan't to conclude check-out at hotel, but line was so long, used express, now waiting to see what's on credit card. Location of hotel is great, just about the middle of the strip. Towels were not soft, but never been to a hotel where they were. Gave us coupons which looked great, but didn't have time to use. Next time in Vegas, if we stay here, will take up on their all day buffet, if it still exists in the future. Why 3 stars when it sounds like a 4? Pillows were made of feathers. The needle of the feathers poked through and constantly poked my head. You'll need to bring your own pillows. Otherwise, liked my stay very much. Just in case you thought about it, don't take shuttle, take cab. Shuttle is $6 per person. Taxi's range between $10-$20, but way faster. Got out of airport around 2:20pm. Check-in at 3pm. It's what, 5-7 minutes to hotel. Wondered how to kill time while carrying luggage. No problem, take shuttle, after loading full with passengers and various stops, we got to Bally's around 3:45pm. Take the cab!!! On way back, ate the $12 round trip fee and paid $10 for cab ride back to airport (paid $5 more because driver was so nice). Really, take the cab!!!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised!”
Reviews.Author: mntraveler51
Reviews.Content: Long check-in lines but got upgrade without the $20.!! Good room-carpet looks like it should be cleaned but otherwise everything else very nice!! Casino a little small-had coffee and rolls in Paris each morning. Just 1/2 block away-indoors!! Location is fantastic!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: Wy0traveler
Reviews.Content: The rooms need some upgrading and attention. The room was considered a delux room, but the sheets and towels were below par. If you are truely only using your room for a shower and some sleep, then it will work.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service”
Reviews.Author: ibkookin
Reviews.Content: We were a group of 11 women (family) ages 23 - 85 so I am rating the hotel on what we experienced over all. We originally booked the south tower because of the low price but we were offered an upgrade to the south (renovated) tower a week before we arrived for only $10 extra per night. So we took it. Of course tax is added on so it amounted to $11.22/per night. We arrived via Viator/Grey LIne shuttle from the airport $12.00 round trip at 10:30am. We waited in line for a short while but then we were able to get our North Tower rooms (3) at that time. We inquired about a wheelchair for my sister for the long walk to the room but they only rented them by the day. We found out later we should have rented it right then because we ended up renting it anyway the next day for the following three days - only cost $40 for the entire time - well worth it. The next day the rest of our group arrived and they too experienced a good check in. Rooms are very large and comfy. They had tables that we used to play cards. The bath was large with very nice marble counter tops. The rooms with two double beds had a very large, comfy chair. The room with king bed had a large love seat. All room had large foot stools at foot of beds. Need to mention there are NO coffee makers, microwaves or refrigerators in any of the rooms unless you book a suite. You can get a fridge for $50 or get it free if you need it for medicine. Those of us who requested room service for the Coffee Express in the morning were very satisfied. Whenever service was requested, whether to replace a light bulb, pick up extra trash, provide extra blanket -no real blankets on beds, just nice comforters) they were there within 10-15 minutes. Slot machines were tight. Food a little pricey. We found two great finds. Tickets for shows that day are cheaper next door at Bills or other such places along the strip. Sometimes you get a voucher. Then you have to go to the actual hotel to get your ticket. These tickets cannot be exchanged for a different time. Then just down that same street along side Bills down one block (with Bally's on your right) is a wonderful Italian Rest. They have a huge sign that says they have been in business for 28 years. Can't remember the name. Carafes of red and white wine came with the meal along with a hot drink to top it off for dessert. Bally's has a wonderful spa. If you book any service, such as a massage, you have use of the spa for the day. They have exercise machines, sauna, steam room, hot tubs, lounge area. They also provide lockers, warm robes and slippers. We spend quite a bit of time there the second day. It is located in the basement area of Bally's and it was great. Bally's is connected to Paris which has nice shops and restaurants. Walk through Paris and exit outside and you cross the street to Planet Hollywood and the Miracle MIle of shops. Check out was a breeze. They stored my luggage for a few hours because I wasn't leaving until later. Overall, I would recommend Bally's to anyone who wants a clean, large room in a great location with good service.

Reviews.Title: “Good Rates, a Bit Tired”
Reviews.Author: WVUNeal
Reviews.Content: Bally's Las Vegas is part of the Harrah's group of casino/hotels bunched together on the Las Vegas Strip. The room rates were excellent at this time of year, and the room itself was large and clean. Nothing worth mentioning, good view, roomy, but a bit dated. The pool area was sufficient but not open, we were sent to Paris Hotel for their hot tub, although Paris is "next door" it appeared to be a long walk. It is the outside that needs a bit of brightening and updating. The entrance area is a bit bleak, although once inside, the hotel is reminiscent of an older Las Vegas. A last note. All the Harrah's casinos have tightened up their gaming rules. Of particular note is that a Blackjack pays 6:5 at their tables rather than the usual and long term 3:2. Avoid their blackjack.

Reviews.Title: “Take the reviews with a grain of salt...this place was great value for the money.”
Reviews.Author: retiredbird
Reviews.Content: Remember, you are paying very little for a premium location on the strip. The room was very large and clean. The windows were clean. There was no wallpaper peeling off the walls. The sheets were clean, the carpets were clean etc.etc.. The TV was clear. We had a little mix-up with our reservations, and it was handled quickly and graciously at the front desk. What are all these other people talking about? I read all the reviews here AFTER I had booked our room, and was scared to death at what I had gotten myself into. Thanks goodness I didnt cancel the reservation. The only complaint I can muster is that there is no place to put a bar of soap in the shower except on the floor. Inconvenient, yes,,,a showstopper, definitely not. Would I stay there again. You bet.

Reviews.Title: “20 dollar trick worked for us!”
Reviews.Author: OregonNymbus
Reviews.Content: We booked our trip through Allegiant Air as a package for the lowest price. I was a bit tentative after reading all the reviews here, and it was going to be a South Tower double queen standard room, but I had read about the 20 dollar trick online through a search and decided to try for something better. We arrived late (after a delayed plane trip,) around 11 in the evening and immediatly checked in. There was no wait, we just walked right up, with my id, credit card, and a 20 dollar bill folded up and presented it to the gentleman checking us in. I asked if we could possibly have a north tower upgrade, and he asked if we would like a higher floor. (Sure!) Since it was my first trip ever to Vegas, he suggested the 21st (Blackjack) floor. :) We ended up with a North Tower room, not a very good view, but high up and VERY clean and spacious. It was completely rennovated, with a big bathroom full of tile- a king size no smoking floor/room, big couch, lots of towels, small coffee maker with all the fixings, a hair blow dryer and safe. The room was quite large and very clean! I am TOTALLY impressed with Bally's, everyone we spoke with was kind, the housekeeping staff kept the room perfect and refilled all the little lotions/potions and coffee everyday (a $2 tip per night may have helped,) and the trick TOTALLY worked for us! We didn't eat in house at all, but we found several places close by that were both cheap and tasty. (Ellis Island, Bill's Casino Victorian Room, Bellagio lunch/dinner buffet on a weekday...) We aren't huge nightclub people, but the downstairs casino area was always busy and had a good vibe, and my BF hit it on a progressive 5 cent slot in a big way! For location, it can't be beat. We just wanted someplace clean, pretty quiet and in the middle of it all, and we found it!

Reviews.Title: “Great option if you get a deal”
Reviews.Author: BadgerCT
Reviews.Content: Ballys is in the best location on the strip, within walking distance of most of the major resorts. Check-in queues seemed long at all times of day and night. Don't queue for check-out; if you've given your credit card details you can check-out via the TV in your room. If you are travelling to the MGM don't bother with the monorail. The walk to the station at the back of Ballys, and then back from the MGM station to the main hotel areas is almost as long as the walk along the strip. Valet parking was easy and free. Definately ask the valet guys for directions to the airport. It's not as easy as it may seem and if they hadn't offered directions to us we would still be lost. Our South Tower room was huge and reasonably clean, if showing its age in places. If you can get in here cheaper than Paris, Flamingo or similar places then it will be worthwhile, otherwise the risk of getting a bad room seems too high.

Reviews.Title: “Our Wedding”
Reviews.Author: BeverlyVaughn
Reviews.Content: The Hotel staff was very accomodating, we were actually early from our flight and were upgraded to a room on the 22nd floor (only 23) and we were amazed at the view from our window, the Eiffel Tower straight ahead and the Bellagio Fountain on the right!!! Awesome time and yes we were married their when we went!

Reviews.Title: “did not like the service”
Reviews.Author: ihave2kidsChicago
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my 22 yr. old daughter. This was our first trip to Vegas. It was her gift for college graduation. I wanted to make this a special trip for her. I explained at check in why we were there and asked about upgrades. OMG the prices to upgrade were so HIGH! We were brought in to check in at the vip room and the clerk had no personality. For 2 days there were 2 room service carts outside my room. It looked like a gurny with a dead body. The room was ok pretty old and needed to be redone. I will not stay at Ballys again I am a believer in customer service. Maybe I should have COMPED them in a seminar on customer service. I am going back to Vegas in April and thank goodness I booked at Paris.

Reviews.Title: “great location; which room you get is a mixed bag”
Reviews.Author: saylorchicLA
Reviews.Content: Best location! Right in the middle of the strip. Also, great value! The rooms are a mixed bag. I've gotten some classic style hotel rooms, and then some with a strange layout. I've heard it depends on which tower you stay in.

Reviews.Title: “great!!!!! cheap and luxury!!”
Reviews.Author: AnaC12
Reviews.Content: me and my boyfriend stayed in bally's for two days in the middle of las vegas boulevard!!! good choice

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Time at Ballys!”
Reviews.Author: gmarkham
Reviews.Content: We arrived Dec 26th and left Dec 31st. Our room was perfect! We booked a "classic" room through Orbitz and when we checked in I asked if that was a renovated room in the North tower- she said no, that the classic is a room in the South tower and then she said we could upgrade to a suite for $25 a night. That was too much for me so I told her that I read on the internet that we could upgrade to a renovated room in the North tower for $10 a night so she let us. I can not speak for the South tower but the North tower room was spacious and clean with an updated bathroom and had a great view of Paris and a side view of the fountains at Bellagio. I loved the casino- it was bright and busy as heck! The Indigo lounge at Ballys had a FABULOUS band every night! Ballys is connected to Paris so it is great to walk back and forth- Paris is super neat! This was my 5th trip to Vegas and my husband's first- we both decided if we come back that we would stay at Ballys because of the location and the price. Yes- some of the other casinos are nicer, bigger and have themes but who cares! You can walk to all of them in a matter of minutes. We visited the Planet Hollywood casino a lot and ate at the Miracle Mile Mall Shops beside it 4 times - try the Cheeseburger restaurant! DO NOT go to the "V" Variety Show at Planet Hollywood- it was TERRIBLE! I waited in line for over an hour at Tix4Tonight to get "vouchers" 1/2 off and then had to wait in line at the show to pick up the "real" tickets and then they said the tickets were general admission so we better show up early to get good seats- we showed up an hour before the show started and our seats were HORRIBLE- huge column in the way and we had to stack 2 seats on top of each other to see anything- I would not consider this show a Las Vegas show- not even for half price! I wouldn't go to this show for free! It was really busy when we were there- (we took a cab to old Vegas and the cabbie said that Vegas had been dead until that week) we decided to take the public transportation back to Ballys (I think it is called the Deuce) I don't recommend this either- we stopped a hundred times on the way back to let people on and off- what would have taken 10 to 15 minutes in a cab took over an hour on the bus! Ballys is great - you can not beat the location- it is central to everything! The only change I would make is more liquor in the free drinks while you are gambling. Buy a "real" drink at the bar and you will taste the difference! Have fun!!

Reviews.Title: “Travelled Alone....Treated like a King!”
Reviews.Author: mikan7
Reviews.Content: l had arranged to spend four nights at Bally's with my daughter and had booked a room with 2 Double beds. Unfortunately at the last minute my daughter had to cancel. No problem said the polite young man at Check-In pocketing the $20.00 bill. Let's see if we can find you a room in the North Tower (Always try to get a room in the North Tower) with a King size bed. Room was excellent, staff were terrific and helpful and even the Casino was kind to me. Will l stay at Bally's on my next visit....You're damn right l will.

Reviews.Title: “Decent place to stay - good value”
Reviews.Author: Nonester
Reviews.Content: We stayed here Jan 16 - 19th - the line up to check in was fairly short at around 11 a.m. on a Saturday and we were able to get into our room right away which I wasn't expecting. We had a king bed on the 17th floor looking north towards Bill's and Flamingo. The room is huge with 2 big chairs as well as a table and a couple of chairs around it. No, there is no flat-screen t.v. but you're not in Vegas to watch much t.v. anyway. The room was cleaned daily and new towels provided. The king-sized bed itself was ok - it wasn't as comfy as other queen sized beds I've stayed at in Bally's, but I still managed to sleep ok. The time share people were annoying but I think because it's a slow time of the year they pounce on everyone, no matter how many times you come through the door. Drink service while playing the slots was good and although we never ate at any restaurants, it was nice to be convenient to the restaurants in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel pulled back from The Strip”
Reviews.Author: Blue_Norseman
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at several hotels on and around the strip, I think Bally's might be my favorite. The location is great (close to monorail) and it´s close to other resorts. Rooms are spacious, clean and prices very decent.

Reviews.Title: “worried for nothing”
Reviews.Author: DEE480
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Ballys at a 5 day stay. Looked at reviews on websites after we made our reservations, I was worried about the bad reviews. Checked in at 5:00 didnt take that long I told the agent about the concerns I saw on websites, gave me an upgrade to north tower no additional cost. Put on 17th floor not a strip view but a great view of vegas. Our room was very clean, big and updated. Had a great time would go back again for price and location. slots were paying off

Reviews.Title: “Very reasonable!”
Reviews.Author: HappySoCal
Reviews.Content: I had to stay there because of a trade show...I was reluctant first ...but at the end...Great location! Easy to navigate with kids! Great pool!

Reviews.Title: “filthy windows ever !”
Reviews.Author: patanete
Reviews.Content: As foreigners we wanted an quintaessential american experience and Ballys wasn`t an european or historical recreation. We managed to have a very good deal through the hotel website.The room was enormous to european standards,in very good condition and very clean,except for the windows,very filthy,but being Las Vegas in the middle of a desert....maybe the view was worthwhile,although we feel intimidated by the other hotel in front,a parisian thing,I think. Bathroom size and fixtures were very good too.We slept well thanks to the a/c. Check in and out was very efficient and quick,although being surrounded by gamble machines even there was bizarre. Breakfast and diner buffets were average,but we try some other hotels with the same results. Best is location,close to the airport and in the middle of the action,we visit several hotels and casinos by foot and other by the very difficult and tiring of find monorail

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location and the package deal I got on Orbitz”
Reviews.Author: SunAndThorns
Reviews.Content: Only view from our room was 50 foot Wayne Newton on the side of the Tropicana, but the BEST PLACE on the strip to stay location wise!

Reviews.Title: “So so Angry”
Reviews.Author: ritacorona59
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Bally's for the first time on the 2nd and 3rd of Jan. 2010 i had a fun time, the room was a good size but had extremely old furnishings definitely needs an update. I have stayed at all Harrah's properties except Imperial Palace and this was definitely the worst room i have stayed in. I am a diamond player and get comped everywhere and my room was not good at all i was disappointed. But i had a good time gambling, and i gambled a lot i think i slept a total of 5 hours for the whole three days. I love my slots. Anyway the big gripe i have is that the day we were to leave i called the front desk and got a late check out so that i could get a few hours sleep before the drive home so they gave me until 2 o clock so that was great i could get about 3 to 4 hours sleep. So i was asleep about a half hour and they start knocking on my door, so i was a little angry but i got up and was very nice to the lady and explained to her that i got a late check out at 2 so please let me sleep. Then i fell asleep for about another 40 minutes and then another knock, it was a different lady, then i was so angry that i just packed my bags and left vowing to never stay there again, come on Bally's get your stuff together and communicate, i'm sure that you want us to gamble but let us sleep too.

Reviews.Title: “Ballys -- in the middle of the strip!”
Reviews.Author: suesue
Reviews.Content: My husband and I (50's) spent 4 days at Bally's during January 2010. The reason that we chose THIS hotel was BECAUSE OF THE PRICE, and it's location on the strip. Check-in was ok, we arrived around 7:30pm. The clerk at the desk offered us "the north tower". When we asked about "the south tower" -- which overlooks the strip -- we were told we'd have to wait about 3 hours. She offered us an upgrade at the cost of $25 per day. We declined. She gave us a room in the north tower with a king-sized bed instead, at no additional cost. Note that Internet access is expensive -- about $12 for 24 hours! There is no free wifi in the vicinity of this hotel. The room was quite spacious, bathroom had been upgraded with marble tiles. There were plenty of towels, complimentary soaps, shampoo, body lotion, as well as a hair dryer. The bed was comfy with 4 fluffy pillows. We overlooked Flamingo Ave, which is undergoing construction. (The construction did not bother us at all, considering they work at night.) The biggest complaint that we had was the fact that food deliveries by room service were NEVER picked up. In fact, one table with food scraps sat in the hall across from our room for 3 days. Each day, there was another table in the hall. By the end of our stay, there were 4 tables with dried-up food on them! yuk. We informed the hotel manager the evening before we left, and he said he'd look after it immediately. The next morning, ALL leftovers were still there in the hall. Regarding the casino, we only played video poker at the bar. The bartender informed us that as long as we put at least $10 in the machine, and maxxed each bet, we could drink for free. (We played video poker at plenty of other casinos with about the same winnings/losses.) The location on the strip was perfect for our needs, as it is pretty well in the middle. We could easily walk up and down the strip, and the shuttle to the Rio was a simple walk to Paris. We chose to eat breakfast at Ellis Island, which is a block away from Ballys. We would probably NOT stay at this hotel again, as there are MANY other hotels that would be happy to have tourists just like us.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: jsskgriggs
Reviews.Content: Just recently got back from Vegas and hotel definitely met all our needs. The location is perfect and very convenient to all attractions. Room was very spacious and well kept. Front desk personnel very friendly and attentive to all needs. Only thing with room was TV had not been upgraded to flatscreen LCD. However we were only in the room for short periods other than to sleep so not big issue.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here even if for free”
Reviews.Author: Adonis_L
Reviews.Content: Pros: Location. Though not right on the strip, a half-mile walk will take you to the strip. Also, connected to the Paris hotel Cons: Rude staff. They lie about prices and availability of services Bathroom had black mold and one towel had blood stains! Cleanliness is a big issue in this hotel Check-in, even on a weekday, was nightmare. Two other groups of friends had stayed in NYNY and MGM, and had a much better experience

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC Hotel, Location & Pool”
Reviews.Author: kjm79
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I spent a week in Vegas and stayed at Bally's ... This was a fantastic deal, well worth every penny! Right in the heart of the strip (just set back a bit but the moving walk way does the walking for you) The pool is AWESOME! Great dj playing tunes throughout the afternoon, poolside waitress that would come to you in the middle of the pool to take your order. Room was nice and clean as well as the bathroom. We rented a car this visit & valet was always quick & free (other than tip) Can't wait for this year as we will be staying at Bally's again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Holiday”
Reviews.Author: ksuth
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit and not my last, our room was clean and well cared for, we were offered to move to a deluxe room which we took on a newer floor. Our room was cleaned everyday and when we came back after our days outing it was like coming home. The meals in the Sidewalk cafe were delicious and everyone was very friendly and helpful. I loved the complementary drinks when we were playing the slots, i found the staff very efficent and pleasant. I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very large comfortable room; slightly retro”
Reviews.Author: charlylou
Reviews.Content: Great hotel if you want a little bit more than you're Imperial Palace, Motel 6 etc. Very Reasonable prices, upgraded to the North Tower for next to nothing. No Mini-bar/slash fridge though. Bally's Casino a little bit garish but fantastic little walkway into Paris which is truly beautiful with great places to eat. Shopping very good in the basement, couple of nice cafe type eateries. All in all an excellent central location on the strip, fantastic service always, very reasonable, would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “sportsbook too far away”
Reviews.Author: texasaggie1
Reviews.Content: I got a great rate, especially for an nfl weekend; got checked in early with excellent front desk service. Room view was amazing; great view of Paris and strip from 13th floor; room was older, but fine for my needs. Sportsbook was biggest disappointment, both for location and cocktail service. Sportsbook is a long walk from hotel elevators, and requirement to get drink tickets for drinks while gambling is embarrassing and outdated, especially for a nicer hotel. I will not stay here or any Harrahs property again since there are so many other sportsbooks that treat you much better.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: kphan619
Reviews.Content: I underestimated this hotel. In order to get what i experienced in this hotel, you must go all-out and upgrade to at least a suite. If I hadn't, I don't think I would be giving such a good review. You can fell like a movie star without actually spending too much money. The spa and room service made our stay memorable!

Reviews.Title: “Christmas In Vegas”
Reviews.Author: bigjac1952
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from spending Christmas in Las Vegas. Bally's upgraded our room to North Tower 22nd floor, huge room with a great view looking North up the strip. The room was clean and the service was good. Not much luck in the casino but we enjoyed our trip and would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: jmschn
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at Bally's before in the past, I was not in the least bit reluctant to stay with them again. As all of the reviews will indicate, the location of Bally's is excellent. Conveniently located in the middle of the strip, you really don't need to hassle with getting a taxi to get around. I've stayed in the South Strip (TheHotel, Mandalay Bay, Luxor) in the past and it was a psychological downer each day to head out and visit some of the North Strip hotels (Wynn, Encore, Venetian, etc). However, if you have never been to Vegas before, I would not recommend Bally's (unless you're going on a budget trip) because you would want to spoil yourself with some of the more luxurious hotels and rooms that Vegas has to offer. I booked a south tower room for 3 nights for $85 after tax total and I knew what to expect going in, in terms of room layout, casino layout, and amenities. Checked in at 1pm when there was no line on Saturday and was offered a complimentary upgrade to a room in the north tower. As everyone has mentioned, the room was very spacious and cleanliness was in line with what I expected. I would not hesitate to go stay at Bally's again in the future if I were looking for a convenient and affordable place to stay on the Strip and this is coming from someone who has stayed at: Paris, Luxor, Mandalay Bay, TheHotel, Monte Carlo, Four Seasons, and Imperial Palace.

Reviews.Title: “WORST HOTEL EXPERIENCE EVER!!!”
Reviews.Author: TravelJunkieGA
Reviews.Content: This was our first, and last, stay at this casino. Since I can't go into every detail, I'll simply list: (1) At check-in, they wouldn't honor the rate quoted, even with an e-mail confirmation. Said the rate quoted was an error. Had we known it would be down hill from here, we would have walked out the door then. Stupidly, we paid the higher rate and stayed. (2) We booked two "king" rooms, and were given two "queens", which we refused to accept after the 45 minute check-in nightmare, so we had to move to different rooms. (3) A lamp shade was broken, the bedspread was stained with God knows what, as well as the loveseat cushion. The stain on the sofa looked like the the ones you see on CSI (If you know what I mean), and I don't mean blood. See the pic posted top right. ( 4) I called a week before arriving to ask about wireless internet access in our rooms. Was told it was available for $13.99 per day. Tried to purchase the wireless access code from the front desk, and was told they don't offer wireless, only cable access for, again, $13.99 per day. Only this time they said they would need a credit card on file. Went down to rent cable and give credit card info, when I was told that in addition to th $14/day, $100 per day would be deducted from my card, and would be credited back to me at check out. The front desk rep said the hotel can't control this charge, "It's just how the system is set up." ( 5) The T.V. was so fuzzy it wasn't worth watching. (6) The vending machine on our floor (10th) took our money. And though it's hard to believe, all of these ridiculous, dishonest things happened within the first 24 hours of check in. I would sleep in my car before I would stay in that pathetic hell hole again!

Reviews.Title: “Try the $20 Trick, it worked great for me!”
Reviews.Author: Texantt
Reviews.Content: Yes, you get what you pay for, but you can't beat the location. Plus, the $20 trick worked great and we were upgraded to a corner suite with hot tub. Just ask the hotel registrar at check-in if you could get a free room upgrade and place the $20 on the desk. We got the upgrade for all 3 nights. What's the worst thing that could happen? I lose $20 and no upgrade. I'd lose that at the tables in 5 seconds any way.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Vacation I've Had in a Long Time”
Reviews.Author: cjdixon4
Reviews.Content: This was my husband's and my very first trip to Las Vegas, and we were celebrating our 30th wedding anniversary. We were beyond pleased when we checked into Bally's that the front desk clerk gave us a North Tower room on a high floor with a partial view of the strip. I had requested a strip view when I booked our reservations, and expected that I might not get exactly what I wanted without the classic "sandwich trick", but OOOOILA!!!! The 24th floor room was perfect; it was clean, the bed was cushy, and the room was absolutely HUGE...which is a rarity in newer hotels without paying a fortune. The location was fantastic, and dead-center on the strip so that you can virtually get to any point by foot without getting too tired. We aren't really gamblers (or drinkers for that matter), but the excitement of watching everybody ELSE lose their money was hilarious and Bally's has one of the most exciting casinos on the strip. The only noticeable shortcoming that the hotel had was somewhat slow front desk service and nearly no bellmen to assist with our bags. In all fairness though, we had been told that due to the recession (which has REALLY hit Las Vegas hard) most of the hotels had been doing a lot of laying-off of staff. They gave us a lot of freebies and 2 for 1 coupons. Bally's isn't the fanciest hotel, nor do they have all the bells and whistles of a Caesars, Bellagio, Mandalay Bay or a Palazzo....but would we stay here again? You bet your bottom dollar we would!

Reviews.Title: “nice stay”
Reviews.Author: lindak07
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Bally's from 12/14 to 12/19/09. This was a quick get-away and didn't want to pay a lot for a room. We have stayed at Bally's before but was very worried due to all the negative reviews. From arrival to departure, no complaints. We were booked for a South Tower Suite but that area was closed for the week. I had a $20.00 in my hand and without say anything, the clerk gave us a hugh suite with a two person jacuzzi. I also requested a non smoking floor and a quiet room which we got. We paid $75.00 a night for the suite. The room was clean, no nicks on the furniture. Maid service was excellent. Everyone at Bally's were so kind and very helpful. The only complaint was the Wyndom time share staff - they were so annoying. I know times are tough but I don't like being harassed. Food is expensive where ever you go. For breakfast and lunch, we recommend the bakery/deli in Paris - very good food.
