No coffee makers or fridge in rooms. Food was so-so.The moving sidewalk was broken. Front desk staff not friendly and moved way too slow , they need more training. The casino was ok. Over all not worth the money. Maybe the place should be imploded !!

Reviews.Title: “Good for a quick stop...”
Reviews.Author: rossbo1
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Bally's last week passing through on a business trip. Having stayed there several times before, I knew what to expect but after this visit, I'm about done. Bally's is an old property - no denying that. The steakhouse is not very good, the spa is average at best and the rooms are really showing their age. Though Harrhas tried to dress up the bathrooms with some granite, the mattresses are either old or cheap, and the pillows are rock hard. Plus, I was put on the 7th floor right above Flamingo, and I never went to sleep because of the noise. Nothing to write home about here - plenty of options elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: webfeetmama
Reviews.Content: Our family attended a wedding at Paris Hotel and many of us stayed at Bally's. Our stay was from Oct 23 to Oct 27 and between us we had 4 rooms all in the south tower.Check in was fast and they didn't bother us for an upgrade. Our room was clean as well as the bathroom but they did show some ware and beds were comfortable and both rooms was very large. Our maid service was good and you could get any extras you needed by just asking. We had a partial view of the Bellagio and the fountain and the Paris Hotel, the lights were spectaular at night. Our a/c worked very well and was not loud and there was very little hall noise, we never had to wait more than a minute or two to use elevators up or down. Yes on Thursday there were food trays left in the hallway but by Friday they were gone and the hallways were clear rhe rest of the week-end. We used the pool once and it was fine and we did get our drinks in the little store by the pool towels. We didn't eat any meals at Bally's but did some some slots but didn't win much. The drink servers came around quite often when gambling and all the staff we dealt with were very pleasant . I would stay again and my other family members would too and the location was excellent .

Reviews.Title: “Another Satisfied Customer”
Reviews.Author: travelinbuisnessman
Reviews.Content: The rooms were nice. I was skeptical about staying here, but was very impressed overall. I thought the hotel would be outdated, but it wasn't. We had a lot of fun and the staff was great. The location was perfect!!! We will definatly be back.

Reviews.Title: “Solid hotel, Nothing Fancy”
Reviews.Author: MDFreqTvlr
Reviews.Content: Stayed overnight on business, and the room was solid but nothing fancy or spectacular. As hotel rooms go, however, it was larger than typical which would have been a benefit on a longer visit. The service was good, although the lines at check in were incredible and the hotel seemed understaffed. Finally, I only had a dinner at the hotel and had a very marginal steak (overcooked and tough) but the rest of the dinner was okay. Given all of the options on the Strip, I would use this as a back up plan.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly as expected”
Reviews.Author: BNA2LAS
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Bally's south tower Room # 6827 for 3 nights Oct 15-17, 2008. We paid $70, $80, and $180 for the 3 nights. Booked directly thru the hotel website. Our room was in the South tower (closest to the strip), on the 18th floor, with a south facing view of Paris and Bellagio, and the south part of the strip. The room was basic in decor, at little dated, but not bad. Two queen beds (comfortable), a six drawer chest, a small round table and two chairs, a large closet with mirrored doors, a big bathroom with loads of mirrors, and a fantasic window wall overlooking the south strip. The South tower has one set of six elevators, 3 for the lower floors and 3 for the upper floors. The South tower is closest to the strip, but furtherest from the restaurants, connector to Paris, pool, spa and parking. If you drive, you have to park behind Paris or use the Bally's valet. Check-in and out was super, super easy. Ordered room service for one breakfast. A little slow, but very nice and tasty. Ate at the Sidewalk Cafe twice. Good food, good service, reasonable prices. Order the fruit plate (not on the menu, but a real good option!). Bally's has no buffet currently, but Paris has a good one next door. The pool is a long walk, as is the spa and the monorail station. The South tower has better views than the North tower, but the North tower had more recently decorated and updated rooms. You will pay more for North tower rooms. Any questions, please email: rmw5597@hotmail.com. Good luck!

Reviews.Title: “Great tiime at Ballys”
Reviews.Author: globespan
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Ballys for a week recently and thoroughly enjoyed it we asked for a room in the north tower and got it however after one night we asked to change due to noise from Flamingo Rd Staff were excellent and changed my room to the other side of the north tower and a higher floor. Both rooms were nice and the room on the 16th floor had a coffee maker ! . Staff at Ballys very pleasant My main criticism was not about Ballys but the large number of timeshare people both in the hotels and on the strip. At times they are almost pulling you into places so beware. Huge amount of construction in and around the strip if able hire a car and see around the area outwith the strip well worth a look.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Maoser
Reviews.Content: We would definitely stay at Bally's again. Best features: (1) Standard rooms are bright, clean and very large with comfortable beds. (3) Room prices are reasonable. (3) Center strip location is great - Paris, Bellagio, Caesar's Palace and Flamingo all within a short walk. Casino and restaurants are fairly average, but there are dozens of alternatives nearby. The only complaint ... why don't the major strip hotels put coffee makers in their rooms?? Oh yeah, they want you to go downstairs for the fancy $3 coffee. :)

Reviews.Title: “Bally's was Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: 0Lenster1
Reviews.Content: Bally's Hotel & Casino was awesome! The hotel was very nice -not as glamorous as some of the other hotels on the strip, but a classic. It connects into the Paris Hotel & Casino. The location was pretty good too, right on the strip and in front of the Bellagio and neighbors to Caesar's Palace, the Flamingo and Paris hotels. The sevice at Bally's were excellent from the front desk to the housekeeping staff. The rooms were very comfortable and a good size. Amenities were plentiful here!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place! Great Location! Great Service”
Reviews.Author: marko1974
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights- great location- super clean- staff very attentive especially bringing drinks around constantly on casino floor. Got upgraded to suite for free on 24 th floor 2433A excellent!!! this is a great hotel have stayed before and will stay here agaiN!

Reviews.Title: “Decent place to stay on the strip”
Reviews.Author: MSBG
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were in Las Vegas for 7 days in September to attend Mine Expo. I tried to book online at Bally's but when I hit the button to make a reservation, it told me that I would need to call the 800 number directly, which I did. I was looking at the "hot deal" prices on the computer as I was talking to the booking agent. She quoted me a price that was higher...I had to tell her that I wanted a "hot deal" (there is a button on the website to see the "hot deal" price). So we sorted out the nights and the price but I was distracted when she quoted me the final price. It was only when we went to check out that I realized that I didn't not get the hot deal price that I had asked for. Granted, it was only a difference on $20 for the two nights, but it could have been 200. Incidentally, I was so sure that we had agreed on the lower rate that I had them pull the recording of the phone call, but all they needed was to hear me agree to a total regardless of the rates we had discussed during the course of the call. They wouldn't budge. We were given a decent room in the South tower...it was clean and always had lots of towels. It looked out on to Bill's Gambling Hall and we could see the end of the Bellagio fountains. We were on the 16th floor and it was remarkably quiet. From where we were, you practically needed a shuttle to get to the pool and the monorail, but the pool area was quiet and there was no shortage of chairs (North Tower rooms would be a bit closer to pool) We ate at Al Dente using a Tix 4 Tonight deal...it was well worth it. We each had a drink ($10 for a single!), an appetizer and an entree and the bill was about $80 including tip. The casino was smoky; there were others that were worse but there were quite a few that were better too. All in all, I feel pretty confident that Bally's was as good as anything that we could have gotten on the Strip for the price we paid. At the end of the day, 7 days on the Strip is about 3 too many regardless of where you stay!

Reviews.Title: “Bally's is Fantastic and Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: gregg1969
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Bally’s on October 13-17, 2008. I had been in the casino previously (very nice, and I always do well in there), but had never stayed at the hotel. After reading many of the reviews on this website and other websites, I had my doubt about whether Bally's was a good choice. All of my doubts were erased within 20 minutes of being inside the hotel. Check-in - I had absolutely no trouble in checking in. There were plenty of desk clerks working and I only had to wait 10 minutes before I was able to check in. Although check in was 4:00pm, I was able to check in 2 hours early. My reserved room was in the south tower, but I asked to upgrade to the north tower ($20 a day charge). I decided to live it up a little, and upgraded to a grand suite. This upgrade was $100.00 per day, but since I hadn't paid a lot for my original vacation package, I thought it worth doing. The suite was on the 20th floor (also a non-smoking floor) and faced the north. The Suite - The suite itself was very beautiful, and looked exactly like it does in the virtual overview on Bally’s website. Bally’s website says that these suites have a wet bar and refrigerator in them (mine didn’t), but this was not an issue to me. The safes do require a $3.00 fee per day, but I never used it, nor was I ever charged for it. And for those who have complained about the dirty windows, yes, my windows had the usual dirt and grime on the outside of it. My windows were also dirty when I stayed at the Monte Carlo, MGM Grand, Stardust, and Bellagio, so this is not a phenomenon that is unique to Bally’s. I did have a balcony, but the door to it was bolted shut. I am sure that the hotel does this for safety reasons. I never noticed any stains on the carpet in my suite, nor did I notice any on the hallway floors. The ventilation system in the suite was adjustable and did not make any excessive noise. The only flaw in the suite was that a little of the fiberglass was wearing off next to one of the handrails on the Jacuzzi. It was only a small spot, but it was nothing for me to call management about. I only had the TV on a few times to check my room balance and to check out of the hotel, but I did notice that the channels were limited. Since I didn’t come to Las Vegas to watch TV, this was something else that I could easily overlook. Housekeeping allowed me to peek into other rooms that were not occupied. I am satisfied that the north tower rooms at Bally’s are quite nice and would have no qualms about staying in one on a future visit. Dining - The Sidewalk Café serves good food and it is fast, depending on what time of day you go. I went in the mid-afternoons and was in and out in under an hour. Pricewise, I did not find this place expensive. I ate at the Tequila Bar a few times; great food and great prices, plus they have half price margaritas from 4:00pm until 7:00pm. I also ate at Johnny’s Deli my first night, but it closed permanently a few days later. I’m not sure why the hotel closed it, because it was busy the night I was there (Monday night football, plus the race and sports book was directly across from it) and it was busy when I walked past it several times on Tuesday. I thought about going to Bally’s Steakhouse, but opted for the steak house at Bill’s Gambling Hall instead. Excellent food at Bill’s, with prices somewhat cheaper than Bally’s. Hotel Staff - Every single Bally’s employee that I encountered went out of their way to be friendly. I never once encountered a rude hotel employee in the 5 days that I stayed. Even the Housekeeping staff were polite and would make small talk as I passed them in the hallways. Pool - The pool is a good distance from the rooms, but if you take the elevator to the pool level, you only have to walk past the shops to get to where you are going. I never used the pool, but walked around the grounds a few times. Although it wasn’t packed, the pool area was quite busy in the afternoons. Elevators - The longest I ever had to wait for an elevator was about 45 seconds. There are 2 banks of elevators, with 6 or 8 elevators in each bank. One bank is for the for the 2-15th floors and the other serves the 16-26th floors. The elevators were even speedy when I checked out on Friday morning at 9:30am. Would I stay at Bally’s again? Absolutely. Although Bally’s isn’t as flashy and opulent as the Bellagio, Venetian, and Caesars Palace, it is still a very elegant, classy hotel. I would not recommend this hotel to people with children, but then I would never take a child to Las Vegas anyway. Time to start planning my next trip to Bally’s Las Vegas………..

Reviews.Title: “Central Location - Standard Clean Room”
Reviews.Author: pinkdebbieON
Reviews.Content: 3 Night Stay at Bally's Las Vegas. This was our third trip to Las Vegas, first stay at Bally's. Previously stayed at the Flamingo and MGM Grand. When booking Bally's - we requested an early check-in as our flight was 10:30 am arrival. The McCarren Airport is so easy to navigate through, we waited 10 minutes for our luggage and then we were off.....we decided to hire a taxi this time - we split the cost with another couple - the total for the 4 of us was $15 (incl. tip). We arrived at Bally's around 11:00 am - the check-in line was long - but it moved very quickly. We booked a South Tower room for $59/Night (Hotel Website Hot Deal Special) The desk clerk asked us if we would like to upgrade our room to the North Tower for $20 extra a night, we said no thank you - she continued to push the North Tower on us by saying that we wouldn't like the South Tower room because it's old and needs renovating - when we didn't bite at first - she then said we'd have to wait as the room was not available until after 4:00 pm. When we didn't respond - she added that she would give us an extra upgrade that she normally was not allowed to do and we could have the room immediately and she would only charge us $20/night. Of course we thought we were getting a huge deal here so we signed up - my friend was getting antsy and wanted to hit the pool area and get our vacation started. When we arrived at our upgraded room - we found that it was the standard North Tower Room (not the extra upgrade she led us to believe) we requested a King Bed - but received 2 doubles. The window view was a roof top and the swimming pool in the distance. Not a big deal to us - as we just wanted a clean bed and bath area as we don't plan to spend much time in our room anyway. I would class this room as "standard" it may have been updated as they stated - but seemed just standard to me - it made me courious to know what the South Tower room looked like. (but I never did see a South Tower Room to compare). We settled in - for $79/night - This room was very clean - the bathroom was spotless - we never heard any noise during the night - from hallways or other rooms - the bed and pillows were comfortable - the daily housekeeping excellent - replenished towels daily. My only complaint about the room - it was extremely "dry" and we all had sore throats and dry noses - not sure if it was the ventilation of the hotel or just the Vegas weather (wind) at this time of year. This hotel is so easy to navigate through - you can take the elevator straight down to a hallway leading to the pool without walking through the casino area in your swimwear. I loved the pool area - towels and lounge chairs were plentiful. We found the bar drinks by the pool very expensive - so the next day we brought our own drinks down to the pool (we purchased from a variety store down the strip for less than half the cost). We gambled at Bally's most days - we found that all the staff were very friendly especially at the Roulette Table. Bally's is connected to Paris - so that was also a plus. Bally's location on the strip (to me) is perfect - you can walk in either direction to all the major hotels on the Strip. We walked to The Luxor one night - another night to the Palazzo. We took The Deuce for $5 (24hr pass) to Downtown one night - I wouldn't take the bus again - it took over an hour each way - next time I would taxi it - faster and less crowded. Downtown is fun as always - the gambling is looser on the machines and the table limits so much lower then the Strip - Hotels are older - a little seedy - but lots of fun. I found the casino(s) very smokey this time.... We had the Prime Rib Dinner Special at Bill's Gambling Hall for $7.99 - It was delicious. The Paris Buffet Breakfast for $14.99 was amazing. We went to the "V" Variety Show this visit - $75 each - The show was entertaining for sure - but I think a little over priced. I've been to Cirque Shows and for the value - so much better. We love Las Vegas and plan to go every year - Bally's is a nice hotel "Standard" and "Clean" and you can't beat the location. I will probably not stay here again as there are so many choices to choose from. But I did enjoy my experience here. Remember.....bring comfortable shoes (lots of walking) - a daily gambling budget - be sure to take in at least 1 show - and relax and have a great time - don't sweat the small stuff - you are after all - on vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Was just as reviewed-okay because it was on the strip but dirty windows, etc.”
Reviews.Author: ArvadaLiketoTravel
Reviews.Content: Most importantly we booked through Travelocity. I read on tripadvisor that people got stuck with smoking rooms. I called the hotel to make sure we got a nonsmoking room. They said since I did not book directly through them but a third party I could not request such. The third party had to. I called Travelocity and one of their reps called the hotel. I thought I was set. When we got to the check-in at Bally's I said, "Nonsmoking room right?" Their counter person said that since I had booked through a third party she would try to get me one. I said Travelocity called you and made arrangements. She told me that all they could do is request one. She then made a big deal about how fortunate we were they had a nonsmoking room available. She then tried to offer us an upgraded room which I read they would do. Most of the things we read in the reviews happened which we took as comical. Yes, it is true, the windows are dirty on the outside! We had a view so we got a good chuckle eveytime we watched a Bellagio water fountain show. We also counted the number of days a glass remained in the hallway a couple of rooms down from us-three. I did like the price for staying on the strip but it was far back as we had read in a comment. Our room was dated, carpet stained, and I pulled the bedcover off the bed altogether because I did not trust it had been washed. Still we got are forth night free. As we were at our high school reunion we did not spend much, if any, time in our room. For us the location was good enough to be worth staying there. Next time though I will stay somewhere else as we are still looking for a favorite hotel. The north tower is supposedly redone but we didn't care enough to upgrade. Essentailly what you read in the reviews here is what you get. So as long as you expectations are not higher you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: KristineD
Reviews.Content: We've been to Vegas every year for the last 5 years and always end up gambling at Bally's. Great dealers & pit bosses who remember you year after year. Bally's is not the glitz and glam of some of the others but a great location with access to everything. The Sidewalk cafe has diner type food that is open all hours with a reasonable price. The small bar right next to it has amazing nachos. We stayed in the North Tower with reduced rates from our Rewards Card, $400 for 4 nights, 5 days. We've paid double that prior years. The room was clean and updated. We are smokers so we get the stinky floor,lol. The room could have had better ventilation but it's the price you pay for smoking. Check in was easy and the bell service was very fast at checkout. Came to get our bags and held them until our flight, brought them very quickly to the cabs when we were ready to leave. Would definately stay at Bally's again.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: bluebells22
Reviews.Content: Stayed 6 nights in Oct. Total price $550 which was OK Room was ok, bit dingy and old. Air conditioning was loud. Bed linen was ok, maid service was good. Ate in side walk cafe, not nice and quite pricey. The corridors were terrible, a whiteish stain on the carpet and a funny smell. A previous poster mentioned the room service trays were left, and my experience was the same, 4 days a tray was left outside a room!! There are timeshare touts in the main door way, and they are persisit. Every time you came in or out The location is great, very central. Would not stay again though

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Holiday in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: tcbmemphis
Reviews.Content: We had been planning our family holiday for 7 of us for over a year to Las Vegas for 5 nights & Memphis for 4 nights and I liked the look of Ballys when we had been to Las Vegas previously and found a great room rate so I booked it. I was very wary of certain comments made on Tripadvisor and contemplated changing hotels but my husband told me to stick with it and we would worry about it when we got there. We arrived on a sunday night at about 10pm and there was no one in the check in queue. We went to the desk and my husband spoke to the man and explained that we had 4 non smoking rooms booked and he told us that there were none available that evening so he kindly gave us an upgrade on all 4 rooms to suites for the first night. We couldn't believe it when we walked in them, the suites were huge!! they were fabulous and the jacuzzi in the middle of the room was a talking point for the whole holiday. The rooms were that great and my husband went down the next morning and negotiated a rate to keep them for the holiday!!! The rooms were always spotlessly cleaned daily and there was everything we needed and if we used coffee etc it was replenished everyday without fail. Most importantly the bed was really comfortable. We ordered room service one morning for breakfast and it was delivered promptly and the food was piping hot. The hotel was in the most central part of the strip and we would much rather stay here than the bellagio or caesars palace for the same location for about a third of the price! We got a view of the Bellagio fountains from our window so what more could you ask for. We thought we were very lucky to get 4 good rooms at this hotel after the unpleasant reviews we have read. We would definitely stay at Ballys again without fail.

Reviews.Title: “Ballys north tower upgrade fee”
Reviews.Author: caesar27
Reviews.Content: I usually have comp rooms because of all the gambling i do at Ballys and other Harrahs hotels. On the last visit in Sept 2008 I was told that rooms in the North Tower would cost me $20 a night in the future, they called it an upgrade fee! That's even if the rooms were comped! This is of course, absolutely ridiculous--because COMP means FREE. No extras off any kind. I have been coming to Ballys for many years but I've made my last visit. Harrahs is really ruining the old Las Vegas Ballys. Next time, I'm at Bellagio.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: OwenLiam
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Ballys and had a wonderful trip. We stayed in the south tower and had no issues. I would class the hotel as a 3 1/2 star. The location was terrific, the price was right and the staff were excellent except for the lady at the booking desk. We would certainly stay there again. We checked all the hotels/casinos/grand canyon/Hoover Dam/Fremont Street and two shows (Love and Jersey Boys). As for smoke in the casino - there is smoke in every casino except for the Palazzo and Venetian as they have some type of freshener blowing through the vents at all times.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, rooms north tower OK”
Reviews.Author: Piet_Roosendaal_NL
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a Sunday and Monday night in September for USD 70 per night. The single king room was in the north tower and was clean and nice size. No fridge or other extra's. The location is excelent, right on the middle of the strip

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad, but definetly not good”
Reviews.Author: Dibbley
Reviews.Content: Hi, We stayed in this hotel for 5 nights, we booked it about 6 months ago. On arrival we had to stand in a queue, quite a long queue, and only 25% of the check-in desks were occupied, so much for service. When we did eventually make it to a desk we were informed there were no no-smoking rooms left, remember we booked this 6 months ago, but we could have an upgrade at $50 per night to a superior room that would be non smoking. Given that I will not sleep in a room that smells of smoke I took the upgrade, I think railroaded is the phrase americans use! The room was ok, not brilliant but ok, it had a jakuzi (Bad Spelling), but even that was tempermental, and when someone above used the toilet at 0700 I would have willingly strangled them, the pipework made noises I had not heard before and woke us both up. We did see two bottles of water waiting for us in out 'Superior' room, priced at $4.00 each. Would I stay there again, no, would I go to Las Vegas again, probably, there is still a bit more to see, not much, and unlike most Americans I will be going to Paris and Venice, so I don't need to make to with cheap fake's!

Reviews.Title: “Need to improvie oerall atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: wraightj
Reviews.Content: I spent a week at Bally's during the Mining Expo 2008, as I did 4 years ago. It is a great place to stay since you are right in the middle of everything, but I simply cannot handle the smell of the lobby again. It is the only casino in Vegas that smells like an ashtray, even older ones like the Golden Nugget and the Flamingo have a good enough ventilation system to make you comfortable, Bally's is TERRIBLE for the smoke. Plus, they need a lot more people working the front desk during peak times, it shouldn't take over an hour in line to fix something with your room. Next time I'll stay at the Rio, and take the free shuttle back and forth to the middle of things.

Reviews.Title: “A dump.”
Reviews.Author: Hellb0y
Reviews.Content: A run-down place by any standards, but the fact that it is supposed to be a 3.5 star Vegas hotel and the corresponding price makes things a lot worse. I had a standard south-tower room, heard the suites are a lot nicer... First, the good: the location is absolutely briliant. Right in the middle of the Strip. That's about it. Oh, and the room was spacious. Then on to the bad: Bally's is a hotel from the seventies, and that must have been when the room they gave me was last remodelled. I have to be fair and add that they probably changed the beds since then, but that's it. Aside from the bed, the room was virtually empty, exept for some run-down furniture. No fridge, no sofa, just a chair, a table, and one cupboard that looked like it belonged in a garage. There were dice-sized dents in the wall, and the carpet was full of stains. The whatever-it-is-called device that gets fresh air into the bathroom made as much noise a fighter jet, fortunately I could turn it off. Only that didn't make much difference, since it was audible as long as someone else in a nearby room had it on, which was just about all the time. Did I mention that the sheets actually had holes in them? Overall, these are defects I can live with if I sleep at Motel 6 -if there are no alternatives and the price is right- but at Bally's neither is the case, which makes it a rip-off in my book. I moved to the Golden Nugget, paid a lot less and got a waaaaay nicer room. But seriously, just about any Vegas hotel with 3 or more stars should easily beat this dinosaur.

Reviews.Title: “Another good stay and already booked the 4th!”
Reviews.Author: Anji Page
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel directly with the hotel on their website. I'd stayed there twice before and had signed up for email offers - and we got a great one! We paid $70 (plus tax) a night for a delux North Tower room - we had already booked our flights and were delighted when we saw the offer was available for our chosen dates. I love this hotel because of it's location, it's right in the middle of the Strip. And as this was my 8th trip to Las Vegas (3rd at Ballys) I know my way around the back roads so find it easy to get to the hotel. We had room 888 (easy to remember after one too many cocktails!) We've had nicer rooms in the past but this was big and roomy and clean. Two very comfy double beds. We didn't have much of a view and the windows aren't very clean anyway but I don't go to Vegas to look at the view from my window. I suppose the downside of this hotel is that it's quite a long walk from the car park to the hotel reception, particularly when you are dragging a suitcase but it's not that big a deal and you can always use valet park if you want to but we don't find it necessary. We got the bus to Fremont Street one night which was fun, we always do it and i would recommend a couple of hours down there. You need the correct change for the bus ($2 per person) as the drivers don't carry change. We had dinner at Tony Roma's which is in the Fremont Casino then got huge cocktails and watched two light shows (the best I've ever seen) and danced to the live band before getting the bus back up the Strip and went dancing at the Carnaval Court until 3am. There is no cover charge and no poseurs strutting their stuff - just the average person out for a dance and some fun. An extremely large vodka (Smirnoff) and coke was $10. There was a band for a while and then a DJ but nothing arsey. We also went to the top of the Stratosphere and got there just before it started getting dark which is a great time to go as you see the Strip 'come alive' and it was amazing. My friend made me ride X-Scream which was the scariest thing I have ever done but I'm so glad I did! I now have to persuade my husband to do it next time we go. We've already booked the hotel again for a trip next year but as it's part of a bigger trip and a package I don't know what we're paying for the hotel itself but we're pleased to be heading back.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but a bit tired”
Reviews.Author: gascondomi
Reviews.Content: Our family stay did not start well as no no-smoking room was available when we arrived, change of room second night was very much welcome. Prime location but hotel feels tired with dirty windows and not so clean swimming-pool.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay at Ballys”
Reviews.Author: horsetrader64
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Bally's 9-9-08 thru 9-12-08. We have stayed here 3-4 times in the past 3 years...Ballys is always a great place for us..convenient location on the strip..clean and nice rooms..we stayed in the north tower..1934A...nice room with all the amenities we needed or wanted. Great service whenever we asked for it. We will always look at Bally's first when coming to the strip...Thanks Bally's....

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: NSutton1103
Reviews.Content: First time in Las Vegas and we were so glad that we booked at Bally's! The location was perfect and the hotel service, size and food choices excellent! My husband and I researched many of the hotels and we were glad that we did not book at one of the "flashy" hotels because they were too big to maneuver around! Great to visit them, but that's about it! The pool was the perfect size and not too crowded. There were always lounge chairs available and the poolside drink service was great! The room was huge located in the North tower and had a lovely view of the mountains and nearby casinos. The bed was so comfortable, even though we didn't sleep much! Recommended dining that we tried: Johnny's Deli huge delicious portions and free refills on sodas and coffee, Ichiban Sushi (if you like sushi, it was yummy and fresh and they do take out too)! Sidewalk cafe-great for all meals, but we had breakfast there (Eggs Benedict and fluffy pancakes). The gambling was fun, we mostly stayed on the penny slots and won several times. Free drinks to be had even if you're on the penny slots, but don't forget to tip waitress $1/drink ro she wont come back! Behind the hotel was a great breakfast place where the locals go called "Ellis Island"... huge portions for half the price of hotel dining. (for $3.99 you get 2 pancakes, 2 eggs and 2 bacon or sausage)! Across the street at Bill's Gamblng hall and saloon, we had a prime rib dinner for $14.99 that came with salad and potato of your choice. The Paris hotel is joined to Bally's and is spectacular ! French cafes, shops and fountains make you feel like you're in France! I can't say enough about this hotel! We will be back and will recommend to all!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, great location - would definitely go again!”
Reviews.Author: Kay-Marie7
Reviews.Content: When we checked in we went to our room which was in the "older" tower - we were a little disappointed until we got there and realised that right outside our window was Paris, the Eiffel Tower, and to the right you could see the fantastic Bellagio water fountains from the window - amazing! Our toilet was broken when we got there but within 5 minutes of phoning reception a lovely gentleman came and fixed it immediately and was gone in no time - now that's what I call service! Our room was really big and spacious and the furniture, although rather old and dark wood, was extremely clean and comfortable. Couldn't fault our hotel, it was great and you could walk straight onto the monorail station at the back. Will definitely return - can't wait!!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good stay, could have been better”
Reviews.Author: larryb78
Reviews.Content: As a regular player at Harrah's properties I received a pretty good rate for Bally's Las Vegas so I decided to give it a shot. After receiving a little something from me, the receptionist managed to move me to the North Tower - highly recommended because while it is the older of the two towers, it is the most recently renovated and is also closest to the casino, restaurants etc. The room was very big & decently appointed. The bed was quite comfortable, the love seat was a nice touch and the thermostat was easy to use & kept the room at a nice cool temperature. Really the only complaints I have about the room are that I think the shower should have doors instead of the dollar store curtain they throw up, and also the housekeepers need to do a better job of refilling the towels. As for the Bally's property, since I wasn't there 24/7 it was allright. The choice of restaurants could've been better, and the lack of a decent place to get coffee (other than a way overprices wannabe starbucks kiosk) was a bit of a turn-off. The problem with Bally's is that it's a long walk to get anywhere on property. Also, the pool area is pretty dull. The fact that they have a deep end - a rarity on the strip - is nice, but there's really nothing going on there, sort of a letdown if you've been to mandalay, mirage or any of the other places on the strip that have superb pools. Overall I really can't complain too much. Employees who I encountered were very nice, dealers were mostly very nice, and they were very accomodating with anything I asked for. I guess I'm just a little bit jaded having stayed at more upscale properties, but for the price I paid I think I got my moneys worth.

Reviews.Title: “loved it!”
Reviews.Author: vancwa78
Reviews.Content: for my first time staying in a big hotel on the strip, i absolutely loved ballys! i loved the gambling, the location, the view from our room, most everything! our bed was super comfy and oddly enough i also remember absolutely loving the coffee there! (which was a good things since to have room service bring a pot of coffee up was about $15 if i remember correctly). this year we're going to try a different hotel, and i hope it lives up to the cleanliness and fun we had staying at Ballys!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Bally's”
Reviews.Author: seahound
Reviews.Content: Just got back from attending a wedding in 'Fabulous' las Vegas, it was my first time there! I loved it! will be back again, I intended using 'hotwire' to book my hotel, as the last time i used them, I got a great rate, so i was hoping for the same again! as you know with 'hotwire' you do not know the hotel until after you pay, so I decided to go for a higher rate ( just to ensure a better property) we paid $99 per person per night and we ended up in 'Bally's' it is so central to everything, especially for us, as the wedding was next door in the 'Flamingo' by the way, you can check into your hotel at the airport! this is so quick and convenient, we had checked in while waiting for our bags, thus we were able to avoid a huge line-up of people checking -in! we took a shuttle bus to the hotel, but next time I will take a taxi, as you miss seeing Vegas, as the shuttle takes side streets to get to the hotels! we did not eat in Bally's, and we did find the desk staff to be friendly, coffee and snacks are pricey, EVERYWHERE in Vegas, but hey its Vegas! I won $100 in the Giant slot machine located in the walkway, between Bally's and 'Paris' Las Vegas Rocks! what an amazing city, my only regret is not going to see the 'Grand Canyon' next time!!

Reviews.Title: “Not in my top ten”
Reviews.Author: SallyFoodie
Reviews.Content: We travel to Vegas 2-4 times a year for pleasure or conferences. We love the atmosphere, energy, and dining options. We vary where we stay. This was our first stay at Bally's, primarily because of location and an acquaintance recommended it, as he stays on comps. Upon arrival, we 'upgraded to a suite' for $50 per night. Virtually every hotel will 'offer' you this. It was a very large room, with the bathroom occupying nearly half of it. An old steam shower flanked by toilets, sinks, and vanities, with a jacuzzi tub in the middle composed the upper level of the room. It was all open to the bed, desk, and couch area that were a few steps down. The decor is very dated and tired. I'd give the maids a C for cleanliness....that was most bothersome to me. We waited a long time at checkin. However, our room wasn't ready and we needed to come back later for our key. We returned about 9 pm, only to wait 45 minutes, not to check in, but just for our key! The staff was brusk. The location is great, but the hotel seems old and faded.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good hotel, but hard to get customer service”
Reviews.Author: travellingtonk
Reviews.Content: Bally's is located centrally on the strip, and we got our rooms for less than 100 a night (even after I'd inadvertently paid an extra $20 a night to 'upgrade' to the North Tower). As I never saw the south tower, I don't know whether this was money well spent or not - but I should comment that North tower rooms certainly weren't being doled out on request when I checked in and it was made clear that you had to pay extra for this. Anyway, our room was big, well-furnished, clean, and had a giant window with a bit of a view (unfortunately the window was VERY grubby on the outside, so it was somewhat muted). Another bummer was the lack of free wi-fi, which surprised me. We didn't have to wait too long for check-in or check-out, but could not get a hold of anyone on the phone whenever we called reception; it just rang out. My partner bought me a massage in the Bally's Day Spa, and the Spa was a bit dated, but pleasant enough, and had reasonable facilities including hot tub, steam room and sauna.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: chriskitten8
Reviews.Content: January was my first time to Vegas. I booked based on price and location. Turned out well- Bally's was so nice! Our room was totally updated and really clean, we had a great view and we stayed on a Sat. night for $99. Check in and out was a bit slow, but worth the wait.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel, I had fun.”
Reviews.Author: nmith511
Reviews.Content: I cannot complain about the hotel. The room was clean, the food was decent. We used the spa facility and got a massage one day, it was very nice, although it was my first time at a spa ever. It's tough for this hotel to compete with all the lavish new hotels on the strip with exotic and outlandish themes. This hotel does not stand out. However, it is in a very good location, pretty much centrally located on "the strip". It's connected to Paris which is really nice. Not to mention the free shuttle bus service to all it's affiliate hotels; Ceasar's Harrah's Paris/Bally's The Rio Flamingo It's definitely worth the stay!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised!”
Reviews.Author: jenjenboo
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a weekend at Bally's. I wasn't sure what to expect, but I was very surprised. To make it easy let me list the Pros and Cons: Pros: Asked for a north tower room and was upgraded for free -- excellent room! Bigger than most Strip rooms, newly remodeled, very clean, very impressed overall. Love the old Vegas style feel of the exterior of Bally's...lots of neon, lots of water. Check-in was about 20 minutes -- not bad considering how long (and it was loooong) the line was. The front desk staff we dealt with was very nice. Love that the hotel is joined with Paris Hotel and that navigating to other Strip hotels is fairly easy given all the escalators/walkways outside of Bally's...and there is a free shuttle to Rio. Casion was always very lively. Valet parking was much faster than other hotels. Cons: Bed could have been better for sure. A little too firm for us. Stay FAR away from the 'Sidewalk Cafe' NASTY food and terrible, terrible service...don't say you haven't been warned. We weren't the only ones in there complaining. Dining options are pretty limited. Did experience a bit of noise inside the room...some noise from the side road that our tower faced (we were on the 7th floor), and noise from adjoining rooms...not nearly as bad as the noise we had at The Mirage though. Gift Shops there were much more expensive than Rio. Overall -- very surprised that we enjoyed it as much as we did. We would not hesitate to stay back there again in a North Tower room.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: BigdawgChicago
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel at least 25 times in the last 25 years-first stayed here when it was called the MGM before the fire in the 80's and before Bally's bought it. Location is excellent and the casino is smaller than many others but still large enough for your needs. The Sports Book is one of the larger, nicer ones to watch sporting events at. Also, the hotel/casino is a bit less hectic than the others. Most recent stay was in July for one night. Stayed in the North Tower. Room was very large and well furnished. No complaints about the room. The rate when I was there was in the range of $70 a night and was an excellent bang for the buck. I like the food at the Sidewalk Cafe but the service is unpredictable-sometimes very slow and sometimes good. The Big Kitchen Buffet was closed for remodeling but in the past has been a decent place to eat. I recommend Ballys.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you would expect”
Reviews.Author: jarvol
Reviews.Content: Everything was great. Got upgraded to a North Tower room for free. Room was large and clean. No view to speak of but everything else was as to be expected (this isn't the 4 Seasons so don't expect it to be). I paid $180 for 5 nights so for that you can't complain about anything. Check-in took about 20 or 30 minutes, checkout was a breeze on the TV, bellhops and everybody on the staff was helpful and pleasant. Will be staying here again on my next trip to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location only......”
Reviews.Author: Sandmeister
Reviews.Content: Likes: Location, location, location! Dislikes: Front desk staff was very unfriendly (worked with 3 or 4 of them). NO FAN IN THE BATHROOM (in both the suite or deluxe room). Casino and room air quality was worst of any strip hotel I've stayed in. Recommendation: I would only recommend this hotel if you get a great deal on the room and plan only on doing minimal sleeping there and gambling at other casinos. The location is great....that is about the only good thing I can say. Word of advice, the suites on the North Tower are NOT worth the extra cost per night. I actually thought the deluxe room was better. Experience: Bally's is in one of the best locations on the strip. Not only is it dead center in the middle of the other major casinos, but it has a monorail stop which makes it easy to travel around to other casinos on the strip. My wife and I booked out room a few months in advance via a web special Ballys was offereing. We booked a non-smoking deluxe room in the North Tower. I had called the morning we were to arrive and let them know we would be driving in. The person on the phone assured us a room was held for us even though we would be arriving at 8:00pm that night. As soon as we arrived we were told that there was no rooms available except smoking rooms. They said that they could put us up in a non-smoking suite, but it would cost an additional $100 a night. I explained that I would not be staying in a smoking room and could I get a deal on the suite since I booked so far in advance. They ended up giving us the suite for the night at no additional charge and said that the next day our regular room would be ready and to come down in the morning. I ended up having to stop by the desk every few hours until at 6:00ish when I finally got my new room. The room quality was okay....but in each room we were in (including our friends who were staying there as well), the air quality was sub-standard. Both my wife and I woke up multiple times throughout the nights with a sore throat or issues with breathing (with or without the AC unit on). As soon as we left the room we seemed fine. The casino portion was okay....though I would recommend walking to the Paris if you want to do local gambling. There is nothing special about any of the eateries. Parking was good.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Bally's”
Reviews.Author: GAVINEVAN
Reviews.Content: My husband and I attended a convention in Las Vegas staying at Bally's. We were told to ask for the North Tower when we checked in, and we did, and they accomidated us. Very nice! We had a great room, clean, the hotel personnel were very very nice. I would definately stay there again. The slots were very good to us there, and of course we put it all back, but still had fun. The pool was great, but drinks are expensive. We found you could buy beer, cold, right next to where you get your towels when you enter the pool at a fraction of the outside bar price. We had a great time, visited other casinos and enjoyed ourselves very much at Planet Hollywood.

Reviews.Title: “Best Place to stay; But beware if you travel with your Pets”
Reviews.Author: luvvegas58
Reviews.Content: Bally's has huge, luxurious rooms with great views of the strip, and is centrally located when hopping from casino to casino. The only problem we've ever had was when travelling with our little show dog. We made arrangements when booking the room and mentioned our dog would be staying with us. On the phone they said it was no problem, that there would be a small deposit of 50 dollars which we paid along with our room fares when booking. When we arrived we were informed that our dog had to be taken up with the luggage, instead of on our leash. At the front check in, we were greeted very nicely until we mentioned we were looking for our dog which was taken by baggage handlers. The desk clerk at first insisted they did not allow pets, and after a short "near argument" in which we had to show her the website states they were pet friendly,she said that we had to immediately pay an additional "50 dollars per day!" We had been booked for nine days, which meant she expected us to pay 400 dollars more for the remaining unpaid pet deposit, (the other eight days that our dog was staying with at the hotel.) She would'nt the baggage handlers to take Mutley up to the room or release him to us until the balance was paid. Ultimately I the baggage handler, who was not equipped to hold the dog released him to me outside on a side street, and we sneaked him up to our room through a side entrance. Because we are not rich people, we had saved for this trip, unbelievably we had to "pretend" to board the dog after the first day. Which meant we hid "Mutley" out and made us feel like criminals. Sneaking him out at odd hours through the back entrances to do his business. In addition the over zealous desk clerk called the room 5-7 times the first evening to ask us to come down and pay the 400 dollar balance, and eventually began calling making sure we had gotten the dog out. She made it her mission to question and watch us everytime we passed by the front desk into the casino. We love to stay at this hotel but worry each time we take our dog and hope that the desk clerk from hell has quit Bally's and gone back to work for Osama Bin Laden.

Reviews.Title: “Bally's - 8/24-8/28 weekend Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: FastMazz
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel way back in March and specifically requested a room on a high floor that had a view of the Bellagio water fountains. I called several times before my arrival to make sure that my requests would be honored, which was for a North Tower room with a view of the Bellagio water fountains. When I arrived at this hotel at 10:30 AM (wearing my tripadvisor hat), check-in line was a breeze. I was told then that I check in is at 3 PM but they would accommodate me to give me a room at 10:30 AM. I told them that I really wanted a view of Bellagio and they said "yes we see your request." I got my key and went to the room. The check in agent never once mentioned that I wasn't going to get the view I wanted. When I got to the room, the first thing I went towards was the windows which I opened them and lo and behold, the view I had was towards the mountains, casino parking lot and some trailer parking lot (which is a bit boring) and disappointed me already. I felt that the hotel should have offered right away that they want to accommodate our requests and offer to watch our bags with the bellhop so we could get the room we wanted later while we would do whatever we wanted in Vegas from 10:30 am to 3 pm. I even wore my trip advisor hat in hopes that I might get upgraded to something nicer. That never happened. Instead they didn't say anything about the room I was going to get, and put me in a room looking back towards the mountains instead. I wasn't happy with that. Considering that Bally's was a hotel and its interiors were clean, the outside windows were really dirty (soot build up or dried mud from dust/rain). I wondered when was the last time Bally's washed their exterior windows? How often do they clean their exterior windows? The room: The room I was in, 2272, I was told then that I check in is at 3 PM and was given a room in the North tower. When I walked into the room, the first thing I noticed right away was that it had a big red stain on the rug in front of the bed about the size of a small pancake. I called the hotel several times before I arrived, was assured that the room I was booked in had a view of the Bellagio water fountains. I wondered all week where that red stain came from, as it did look like it was a wine stain however it was really red. Ugh already...... The room itself wasn't as big as I expected it to be, inside there was a marble desk attached to the wall, that had a telephone and internet access which is $11.99 per day billable to the room or credit card. The television remote control took some learning when switching between closed captioning and television mode, however there were no “premium” channels but had the standard channels with USA/TNT, etc. Television reception was clear. The air conditioner worked great, I liked having my room really cold as the heat outside during July is a little unbearable as I felt like I was being baked and not sweating because of how dry outside is. There was no refrigerator inside the room. The hotel provided an ironing board and iron which came in handy when I needed it. I did not use the safe, as previous posters reported the safe has a daily fee of usage. The curtains were great for keeping the lights out if you wanted to sleep late, it did keep the room dark when it wasn't open, then again in the back of the hotel is a shade. The bathroom: The shower water pressure was not that great and you had to use high pressure (which wasn't really high pressure) to take a shower. Towels provided by the hotel were nice, large and soft. When requested extra towels, they were available. A single sink. The hotel provided soap, shampoo, conditioners and lotion. The soap left my skin feeling a bit dry after the shower, but the shampoo & conditioner worked well. The room itself was provided with a coffee maker & hair dryer. I never got around to drinking the coffee as the brand was something not familiar with so never got around to making a cup of coffee. I was disappointed already that my accommodation requests were not made, right away my roommate did not want to pack everything again to move and wanted to go out and not stay in so we never got around to changing the room. I really wanted a strip view, and instead got a view of the mountains. As I don't always see mountains I didn't mind this, but the fact that Bally's did not honor my specific request going back from March left a negative feeling. Bally's is in two sections, North Tower and South Tower. When I was in the North Tower, I felt like that was all Bally's had to offer by the ambience of it. I recommend that you take the time to explore the subterranean section connecting the two hotels and going to see what is inside the South Tower, as I still wonder. There is a pool that I never got to use, but from the view in my room, it didn't appear to be small as some people say, and it did look like there were always available chairs. The casino: On the casino floor there was a bar behind the poker room with video poker, and they had Rapid roulette which I played and thought it was fun as it is quicker than regular roulette, the standard blackjack, Texas hold em, pai gow, Bet the Set, etc, and a variety of table games, however the tables itself was limited to about 12-15 tables which made the casino look small to me. I did not realize until the last day of my stay when we wanted a quick bite to eat that there is a sub-terranean section of the hotel connecting North and South tower. I felt that there should have been signs posted pointing to "South Tower" or the subterranean section but did not see any. So, I never got around to seeing the South Tower so I have no idea what's inside the main area. There's this casino that might be considered small by Las Vegas standards. The poker room had about 10 tables, and there was always a game going on. The poker room staff were very nice and quickly came with our chips whenever we wanted more. Drink service was good, as I didn't have to wait very long for the chips. There was an abundance of a variety of slot machines and did have a high roller area for slot machines but did not see that many people use it. I played poker most of the time and lost a few hundred on the slot machines there. Poker games offered was 1-2 no limit and 2-4 limit. Other games could be available and Bally's had poker tournaments as well. Underground there is a few places to eat, Sabarros, a New York deli, Chinese and several stores. There were tournament slot machines in the middle and it made me wonder what was in the South tower and never got around to it. The point I'm making here is that while staying at the North Tower, it felt like that was all Bally's building had to offer itself. I never ate inside Bally’s except for the deli on the last day. I usually had my breakfasts and lunches at Paris at Le Buffet which was good but nothing to rave about except the large selection of foods. I did however enjoy the breakfast across from Le Buffet which made excellent croissant egg and ham sandwiches, a bit steep though $9.99, I'd recommend the restaurant across from Le Buffet if you don't want to wait on line (the lines were usually so long that it was outside the door, it took some time to get a table every morning. I played a couple slot machines in Paris, and I felt claustrophobic with its low curved ceilings that are painted to resemble a sky. I did like the interior of Paris as it did feel like I was in Paris. The lobby of North tower: The lobby was really pretty and easy on the eyes, however from the check in to the elevators was a bit of a walk as you had to walk through the slot machine area in order to get to the elevators. Even the bathrooms were far back in the casino near the elevators. I did not think the casino was that smoky as reported in the past, and I am a smoker. I felt like I never had to wait for an elevator from the first floor and it did not take that long to get an elevator from the 22nd floor either. Outside of Bally’s: I always felt like it was a bit of a long walk from the people mover at "Station Entrance" to the checkout desk to access the outside of the hotel. Due to the heat in July, it made getting to the hotel feel far and long. There is a side entrance in the North Tower which gives you close access to "Bills Gambling Hall", which I used most of the time to exit. However I ended up getting into the hotel via the Station Entrance. I don't think I'll be returning to Bally's again in the future unless was offered comp rooms with the views I wanted. I would not depend on them in the future to honor my requests. Most likely if I was spending money for hotel, I would stay someplace else.

Reviews.Title: “poker”
Reviews.Author: vonkluck
Reviews.Content: Like others I received a room upgrade at check in. The room was large and very comfortable. What I really wanted to report was the terrific staff of the poker room. I was made to feel welcome, the games were good and my luck wasn't so bad either. All in all, I thought Bally's was a good value. Von Kluck

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed Our Stay at Bally's!”
Reviews.Author: dolphinspj
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Bally's at around 9 am on 7/11. We figured that a room would not be available so early on a Friday, so we checked our luggage with the bellman. The check-in line was open and the wait was about 5 minutes. The front desk staff was very pleasant and efficient. We asked for a North tower room (preferring a renovated room over a view), which was provided. We were advised to return later when the room was ready to pick up the keys. We returned a little before noon and our room was ready. We were very pleased with the room. It was a non-smoking king, as requested, and had not a hint of smokiness. The location was on the12th floor, with another room only on one side of us and an emergency stairwell on the other side (It was nice and quiet throughout our stay). The room was large, clean, bright, and in great condition. At first we thought the mattress seemed too firm and we thought it was going to be uncomfortable, but we actually slept great. The bathroom was a comfortable size, with a tub/shower combo. The sundries included the basic shampoo, conditioner, lotion, soap, and a compact wall mount Conair hairdryer. One thing we weren't used to was the $3 charge to use the room safe, oh well, guess it's worth it. Our view was basically of the back of the Paris. We could see a glimpse of the Paris Eiffel Tower between buildings and, standing at the window, an angled partial glimpse of the Bellagio fountains. Not a great view… we have had better, but we have also had worse! I forgot about the long walk through the Avenue Shoppes/food court/sports bar area to get to Bally's pool. I’m glad I had a good cover-up! We were there around 1:15 (Friday) and the pool was busy, but not too crowded. We had no problem getting two lounge chairs in the sun. The music the DJ was playing seemed pretty loud, and it took a little getting used to when we were in the pool right in front of the speakers. Drink service was good, and the water temperature was perfect! Bally's location on the strip is great, close to center, so it is convenient to Caesar's, Bellagio, Planet Hollywood, Flamingo, and much more. It's easy to head out one direction one day, and the other the next. We spent most of our gambling time at the Paris, and there are more dining options there, so the indoor connection is also a great plus. We would stay at Bally's again.

Reviews.Title: “North tower great for a saturday night”
Reviews.Author: edboogie
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were staying at the Paris July 13th to 16th. We had the opportunity to go a day earlier and didn’t want to pay Saturday night rates at the Paris so we booked Bally’s. It was a $70 difference. I was torn between asking for an upgrade to a North tower room and staying with my booked South tower room, but with a chance of having a view of the Bellagio water fountains or strip view. I decided to leave it to chance. When we checked in, around 11am, we only waited for 10 minutes and we were upgraded to a North tower room without even asking. It was a good start to our trip. We were on the 15th floor, nonsmoking room, king size bed. The room was very nice and HUGE. You could practice ballroom dancing in this room. It had a desk with a granite top which had seating on both sides. The bathroom was very large and roomy, with granite tiles on the floor and in the shower. The granite counter top was nice also. The only down side to this room was the view was of the roof of the building next door. But we didn’t spend much time looking out the window in our room. The room was very clean and the bed was comfortable. There was no smoky smell in the room at all. The casino did smell a little of smoke, but not as bad as I had read about. We used the voice check out on the phone and then walked across the inside connecting corridor to the Paris. The location of the hotel is perfect, in the middle of the strip and right next to the walkways over the roads. It’s not the fanciest hotel, but it was clean and comfortable, and we wouldn’t hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Stay at Ballys - North Tower”
Reviews.Author: cptguy
Reviews.Content: To ensure a more recently renovated room the north tower is much nicer than the south however provide no real views . The room itself was very clean and comfortable with crisp clean linens. The room was decorated with simple colors and the bathroom was very large suited with marble tile. There was no mini bar but there was a coffee maker, iron/board and an in room safe (for a small daily fee). Check in was smooth with no issues and very little wait. The pool is very basic and provides a view of the monorail tram that comes through every so often, however - unlike the Flamingo I never had a problem finding a lounger. The poolside drink service was attentive although somewhat expensive for drinks. The casino itself seems to attract an older crowd and since I am in my late 30's I tended to spend more of my time at other casinos. While playing vp at the bar, the bartenders were terrific keeping your drink full. The steakhouse at Ballys was terrific. This was my 2nd time dining there and again I was not disappointed. Including wine etc. the bill was about 300 for 3 people. Overall a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Room. Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: OBTeresa
Reviews.Content: My husband and I very much enjoyed our stay at Bally's. Following the advice on this website we asked for a North Tower room and were not disappointed. Very spacious room with a very nice, clean bathroom. Without exception, every staff member was extremely friendly and pleasant. The housekeeping service was great. No matter what time of day we left our room, our room was straightened when we came back. A word of advice, do not pay the outrageous $4 charge for the water bottles in your room. There is a convenience store just a short walk away, with bottled water for 0 .79. Also, downstairs, on the way to the pool, there is an inexpensive Deli where everything we tried was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “North Tower Only!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: WellTraveledLady
Reviews.Content: I waited in line to check in for 50minutes!!!!!!!! When I made my reservation I requested the NORTH TOWER ONLY and a non-smoking room. On check in I was told that the only room available was in the south tower and was a smoking room 5450. I was very tired and all the hotels were full so I took it. When I opened the door I couldn't believe my eyes ...the disgusting stench of smoke and mildew hit me in the face and the air conditioner cover was coming off the wall. The carpet was filthy and torn, The bathroom was a horror and the windows were so dirty you literally couldn't see out and had a lovely view of a utility roof and a wall .....and best of all was this room was right next to the elevator and you could clearly hear it shaking the wall . I called down and asked for a manager, I was disconnected and had to call back three times. Finally I told the manager how disappointed I was and she moved us to room 1860 in the NORTH tower. I was told to go back to the check-in were I waited another 30 min in the VIP Platinum service line!!!!! haha! When I finally got to the front of the line the clerk never said a word to me and just waived me off and left for the day ...leaving me to figure out what to do next on my own. I couldn't believe it! Once I eventually got in a room in the NORTH tower it was nice and clean ....except for the rusted towel rack in the shower. We ate at the Al Dente restaurant in the hotel, the service was amazing and the food excellent I do recommend the restaurant it almost made up for the mess at check-in. The only way I would ever stay here again was if I was guaranteed the NORTH tower in writing and got a $60 per night rate.

Reviews.Title: “A better deal than the Mirage”
Reviews.Author: water7996
Reviews.Content: I visited with my sister, stayed in Vegas to see the Beatles "LOVE" Cirque du Soleil @ The Mirage acriss the street. The show was wonderful - don't miss it! Rooms at Bally's are spacious and clean; last time we came we stayed at the Mirage and it was more expensive and not as nice. My only complaints are that there are only two accessible electrical outlets in the room (they must have thought electricity was a passing fad when they built this place) and the lack of ventilation in the room. We stayed in a smoking room because my sister smokes, and the room smelled really bad, even before she lit up. The windows can't be opened so there's no way to get rid of the smoke. I slept with the sheet over my face to kind of filter the smell and the smoke. The staff is friendly and if you like to gamble, there are lots of tables and it's fun to play here. The slots, just like everywhere in Vegas and any casino venue now, are just bandits; I truly think they have figured out that people will play them even if they consistently lose. But playing cards is just like it's always been, especially if you play at a single deck table. It's incredible how many people are here in this 107 degree heat; I find it hard to believe this place is such a popular attraction. It also embarasses me to know that this is what foreigners think the US is all about. I'm ready to go home!

Reviews.Title: “Surprise upgade - a dream come true”
Reviews.Author: BrokenAlice
Reviews.Content: This was my first time staying at Bally's and I was very pleased. I had booked a South Tower room on a special promotion for $50/night, for two nights. I didn't get to check-in until almost 8pm because I had been in Laughlin all day. The check-in experience went like this: There were only two clerks working the desk and there wasn't a line, but both clerks were helping someone. I stand at the front of the rope waiting to be next. Here comes this woman stomping up to the counter and demands to be helped. The clerk was helping someone else and told the lady to get in line. So the woman stomps over and stands right in front of me and tells me in no uncertain terms that she was going to be next. Whatever, lady. When the clerk was done the lady stomps over and starts freaking out about something. Honestly, I don't know what she was yelling about and I didn't bother listening. I just zoned out and waited. The clerk tells the woman to go down to another desk and wait for a manager. The same clerk waves me over to be helped and the lady steps a couple feet over. I was planning on asking the clerk if I could get any kind of view of the fountains with my South Tower room, but after she just got done being yelled at I didn't say a thing. I just handed her my reservation paper and my ID/CC. She click, click, clicked away and then handed me some keys and told me I'd be in the North Tower. I REALLY wanted to be in the South Tower for the potential of a fountain view, but didn't object. I knew this was an upgrade since North Tower was a few years more renovated than South. So I thanked her and went on my way. I'm dragging my bags down a really long hallway. I am really annoyed because I am all the way at the end of the hall. Last door! I practically walked to Ellis Island! I open the door, put my bags against the wall, see the armoir, couch, bed, and then my head keeps turning to the right and I see I have a HUGE JACUZZI and marble floors and two huge closets, and two sink/vanity areas. There's even a separate room for a toilet, a separate room for a bidet, and a standing glass shower. I could not believe it. I have never had a complimentary upgrade before and this was the upgrade of a lifetime. I got a magnificent suite for $50/night! It was a dream come true. To celebrate I ordered room service and the order was handled promptly. Well within the 30 minutes I was quotes over the phone. I had a grilled chicken sandwich and some creme brule. Both were of great quality.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: jaysmom
Reviews.Content: Stayed of Bally's because of the great location! You're near a lot of great hotels within a short walk away. Got a free upgrade to a North Tower room (just ask at registration desk). It was a very clean and huge room with nice comfy bed. Not impressed with their casino or service at casino but who needs Bally's when there's lots of others nearby!Next time I go back I'll definately stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: pekoUSA
Reviews.Content: Loved this place! Got a great deal online (be sure to check their websites if your travel dates are flexible), and the location in the middle of the strip is perfect for exploring both ends by foot - plus there is a monorail station right outside if you get tired, shuttle to off strip hotels like the Rio! Very friendly and helpful front desk too. Also liked the fact that it was joined to Paris so that you could use some of their amenities (business services etc).

Reviews.Title: “Okay stay for two nights”
Reviews.Author: HarmonyIsle
Reviews.Content: This was my second trip to Vegas and my husband I had a very different experience. We stayed at Bally's for two nights($84.00 a night June). The check in line was extremely long and when we got to our room we had an okay view and an okay room. Nothing like the MGM ($98.00 a night in October), which we stayed at for our first visit to Vegas, very chic, but not too stuffy. Overall, the stay at Bally's was decent, however the shower was a disaster. It was like camping, there was just a lonely old shower curtain that "kept" the water from escaping the stall. After every shower we had to tend to cleaning duty by mopping up the floor :( Good thing our stay was for a wedding. I don't recommend this hotel for a vacation. MGM & Paris are a great bet.

Reviews.Title: “Contrary to Reviews...Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Group54
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through a package deal with one of the Airlines. I was a little nervous after reviewing some of the feedback on the hotel. However, I could not turn down the excellent price offered if staying at Bally's. I requested the North Tower as this site recommended. I found the room to be very nice. The bed was comfortable with feather pillows - a must for me. The furniture was nice. The bathroom was very nice. The room was very spacious. The only drawback - the air conditioner didn't make the room as cool as I would have liked. I would recommend this hotel. You can't beat the location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, rude employees”
Reviews.Author: simplisexij27
Reviews.Content: My first time at Bally's and the place looks lovely. I had the perfect view of the Eifel Tower, and the amenites were acceptable. However, the employees were rude when there was a problem that needed to be addressed that included an error of an employee. Instread of helping me, they played dumb and they ignored me. The manager never came to help, AND they hung up on me in my room. I was overcharged and wasnt even allowed to complete my stay. Lovely place..... very lovely. But I will not be staying there ever again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room great service”
Reviews.Author: wgraff
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the North Tower, room was large and clean. Had a problem with the internet service the 1st morning technician was up within 15 minutes and had it fixed shortly thereafter. Had a light out in the bathroom again the maintenance person was there within 15 minutes and had it fixed. Staff was friendly. 1st time staying at Bally's and you can't beat the location. Only complaint is that the Casino was smokey but you are so close to so many other hotels it was easy to find a less smokey environment. Dealers were friendly but the best fun gambling was had at Planet Hollywood next door. Visit the passion pit after 9 and you will have a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Bally's has definately changed...”
Reviews.Author: JoGo13
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed for 3 nights. We booked the North Tower as we were aware that the South Tower contained rooms that had not been renovated. The rooms were great. They were large and clean. The beds were not horrible but the pilllows left me with a stiff neck every day. Beware!!! If you use the safe, they charge you $3.00 a day...can you imagine that...not even in Italy, where they try to charge you for the air you breathe, do they charge for using the safe. You would think that they would want your belongings safe in the room. The Indigo lounge, one of our favorite late night spots has a new band...way too loud and no longer to our liking...we loved the great group that used to perform regularly and miss them. We also miss the Ballys breakfast buffet that enabled you to have choices but not overwhelmingly huge. We had reservations for the "Sterling Brunch" at Ballys and although a bit pricey at $75. a person, it was elegant and the food was delicious. The Del Coronado Hotel in San Diego boasts the best brunch in California and it could learn a lot from this amazing brunch at Ballys. You will not be disappointed...even the unlimited champaigne is wonderful. I have read numerous comments about the casino and the smoke issue. Compared to other casinos, the smoke seems much worse at Ballys...maybe the air is not filtered as well...but our eyes did seem to burn whenever we stayed for a while in the casino, a problem that did not happen anywhere else. The pool area is about as blah as one could imagine. The music is loud, the drinks expensive and yes, it is true that there are always enough chairs, I think because there is nothing to keep you by the pool. It is hot, no misters or shade...and it is simply a concete yard with an inground pool...nothing special in any way. Also, while gambling, the drink girls are few and far between...if you order a drink, chances are, you will have lost all your money before they return with your drink...a little annoying. All in all Ballys is OK...but nothing more. I usually stay at Paris but they did not allow for Saturday check in and 2 people in our group were joining us on Saturday morning...so we opted to stay where we all could be together... I would not stay at Ballys again...maybe if they brought back the old lounge group, opened their breakfast buffet, stopped charging to use the safe and filtered their air...not to mention that a little atmosphere at the pool would be greatly appreciated... I think Ballys needs to upgrade itself...come into the modern era. Renovate the South Tower, clean up the casino air, put good louge music back, and make the hotel a place you want to stay, spend and enjoy yourself in.

Reviews.Title: “Problem Resolved by Good Manager”
Reviews.Author: JC2
Reviews.Content: After spending four days in Utah visiting Zion and Bryce Canyon national parks, we spent one night in Las Vegas before flying home the following day. I had checked rates at Vegas hotels on the Internet and then called the property to make a reservation for that night while driving to LV. When we arrived at Bally's to check in we were told that our request for 2 beds in a nonsmoking room could not be honored. Our choice was one bed or a smoking room. Finally, the woman at the front desk gave us a two bed nonsmoking room by the elevators in a south tower room. Once up in that room I decided that I could not sleep with the noise of the elevators so I called the front desk and talked to the manager Kit who quickly volunteered to find us a 2 bed room. He called right back and then met us in front of the check in area with the key cards to the new room in the north tower. Kit saved the day but the whole experience would have been much better if our request for a 2 bed nonsmoking room had been honored in the first place. The new room was very nice and very quiet. One note -- the check in line was very long and very slow. Several employees were walking around behind the counter but I have no idea what they were doing or what their job was. It obviously wasn't to check in guests. Also, there were two employees standing near the front of the line seemingly observing the check in line and counter.
