I didn't get the point of this -- it seems to me it would have been much more efficient for them to be behind the counter checking people in!

Reviews.Title: “A few changes”
Reviews.Author: sanderkai
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our fourth stay at Bally's and thought I'd let everyone know that a few things have changed. First, you can no longer check in at the airport which means standing in line at the hotel. We only waited about 20 minutes to check in but I imagine that at peak times it could be a lot longer. Second, the shuttle to Rio no longer leaves from Bally's, you have to go to Paris, not a long walk, no big deal, I just don't want anyone standing in front of Bally's waiting for a bus that will never show up. Third, the deli "Nosh" located on the casino floor is open until at least 1:00 am so you can grab a bite to eat late without paying for room service. Fourth, you can no longer cash out your gaming tickets from Paris at Bally's, something about Paris being sold by Bally's, even the bartenders couldn't explain exactly why. Other than that everything seemed to be the same. The rooms are quite large, the staff is friendly and you can lose money here just as fast as ever. The pool area is nothing special but is always clean and a nice place to relax, and never had a problem finding a chair. Overall I would still recommend Bally's for it's reasonable price and great central location on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “We love Bally's!”
Reviews.Author: travel2muchIndiana
Reviews.Content: This was my second time to Vegas. I had stayed at Harrahs the first time. We really like Bally's. The layout of the casino was great. We stayed in the North Towers and the rooms were very roomy and clean. They had a nice selection of restraunts with different price ranges. The location was just awesome. All employees were very friendly and never had a problem finding a waitress. It's not the fanciest hotel but for the money it is very nice. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fun in Sin City at Bally's!”
Reviews.Author: ph0t0_chick
Reviews.Content: I went to Vegas for a convention which was held at Bally's - and for the money, it was a very nice stay! Front desk was efficient and helpful. The meeting rooms were not too cold (I get chilly easily). The guest rooms were all very clean, well-decorated and modern. Room service was quick, and the food was better than I expected for room service. The casino was a bit smokey at times, but not so bad that you couldn't breathe or anything. They have a big choice of restaurants and bars - and I loved the conveyor belt that takes you out to the strip for sight-seeing all the hotels. The best part is that Bally's is connected to Paris - via a interior walkway - so you don't have to go outside in the hot sun to get to their shops. Love the crepes! I can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Bally's South Tower...Good, not Great”
Reviews.Author: Roam the World
Reviews.Content: The south tower rooms are in need of updating. The furniture, while functional, is tired and in need of replacing. I hope Bally's is intending on updating the south towers rooms soon, as our room had several issues; -The shower head needed replacing -There was no stopper for the sink -The toilet ran constantly -Windows were dirty -Carpets were dirty in corners (clean elsewhere) Based on the pics on Tripadvisor, the north tower rooms are much more contemporary. Hopefully the south tower rooms don't fall into total disrepair prior to be updated. On the up side, the beds were comfortable, the air conditioning worked well, the staff were friendly, the price was reasonable, and the location can't be beat. If I were to return to Bally's and couldn't get a north tower room, I'd go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay. Spacious rooms. Nice......nice.”
Reviews.Author: zimmazimm
Reviews.Content: We were in town for a conference, but we had plenty to do at the hotel. The Bally's is definitely not the most expensive on the strip, but it was very classy. Their sportsbook was not the best....go down to the New York, New York for that....but overall, the casino was nice. I would have no problem staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Tired Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jslt41
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Las Vegas. We booked the trip through Expedia to join a group of friends already in Las Vegas for several days during the week. We travel extensively for work and pleasure and are experienced travelers. If you want an honest review read further. If offended by not being politically correct or blunt move on to another review. Hotel: This hotel is as centrally located as one can get. That being the only positive. The hotel has two towers - north and south. From the previous reviews it appears the north tower has been renovated while the south tower remains untouched since about 1985. The check-in went well, but we were turned down when we asked for a north tower room based on reading Trip Advisor. We were told that no king beds remained and that the only remaining rooms were double beds even though we booked a king. We were offered an upgrade to a junior suite for $25/night. Wanting to have the process over we accepted and were directed to the south tower - 7201. The room had a large king bed with an elevated platform with a central bathtub and other bathroom essentials. The room was in desperate need of renovation with old furnishings, a moldy shower and cracked wash basins. We had a 'wonderful' view of the back of the Paris hotel. Although it was a non-smoking room we could still smell the faint odor of smoke throughout the room and floor. Smoking: For you smokers, Las Vegas is the place to be. We come from a state that thankfully does not permit indoor smoking. Smokers are everywhere in Las Vegas, but some of the higher end casinos and hotels provide excellent smoke filtration. Not so in Bally's. The casino and hotel in general smell of smoke everwhere. Those hotels that we visited that the smokers did not bother us include Madalay Bay, NY NY, Ceasar's, Rio, and the Venetian. The Venetian and its new wing, The Palazzo, seemed to have the best filtration systems. Because of the smoke we did not use any of the hotel facilities. We traveled over to Paris and to Ceasar's for meals, gaming and to walk around. Paris has its issues too, but far less than the dated Bally's. Time Share Vultures: Travel to Las Vegas has been reduced with the downturn in the economy. One of our cab drivers said that his business was off as much as 30%. The downturn has not impacted the Time Share Vultures that lurk just inside the main entrance and to the right. The approach is friendly enough if you appear to hesitate for just a moment once inside. We simply ignored them, but at times they often blocked our path. They even were inside some of the higher end casinos although were more subtle in approach. Foreign Travelers: Welcome to Las Vegas! Again with the economic downturn there are a number of foreign travelers in Las Vegas. We have been to Europe several times and have enjoyed the sights and people we have met. We respected the countries we visited by learning the basics of the language and trying to fit in. Now to the U.S. - what angers me is when certain people travel in large gaggles on the escalators and then stop at the top in one mass group deciding where to go next. Make a decision and move on. It is likely a cultural thing, but it is frustrating none the less. Also, you will find that some do not respect the tradition of waiting your turn in line. Equally as frustrating, but we just pushed back. Overall we will be back to Las Vegas but never to Bally's. The few extra dollars to stay at Mandalay Bay, Ceasar's or the new Palazzo are well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad of a Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: sgtjtittle
Reviews.Content: Loved it. Had monorail station at location. Food not to bad. Ate at the pizza place. Casino a little smoky. Bed super comfy. Stayed in s. tower. Had a few of Paris pool and Eiffel Tower. Would stay again. CHeck in was fast and check out faster. Did it through the television in the room. Only bad part was the TV reception but not suppose to be in the room anyway.

Reviews.Title: “North Tower room rocked!”
Reviews.Author: bundyone
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Ballys over the memorial Day weekend. Check in took about 10 minutes and the front desk put me in a room in the North Tower on the 26th floor. The room was HUGE. Ballys was fantastic. The bed was plush, heaps of pillows and everything was terrific. Bathroom was a good size and everything clean. The only issue I had was the car parking. You need a cut lunch and a compass as you have to park behind Paris and drag your bags a fair way. Regardless, I will be back to Ballys!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay at Bally's!”
Reviews.Author: slane2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Bally's Las Vegas for three nights last week. We were given a room with two queen-sized beds in the South Tower (the non-renovated one) when we checked in as this was the only non-smoking option left; the room was very large and very clean. We were upgraded very early the next day to a King-sized room in the North Tower (renovated). The room was slightly smaller but newly renovated and very nice. Everything in the hotel was great; housekeeping was efficient and timely, check-in and check-out were quick and painless, and the staff were excellent- extremely helpful and friendly. Bally's is in a great central location and near great shopping and other casinos and resorts. Having the monorail at the hotel is fantastic. Highly recommended while you're in Vegas: -La Creperie restaurant in Paris Hotel -The Tequila Grill in Bally's -"Love" by Cirque du Soleil at The Mirage. Have a great trip!

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: urhamm
Reviews.Content: I reserved my room at Bally's on line and it couldn't have been better. North tower 10 th floor. I will stay there again and hopefully soon. Location is the best, clean rooms two queen beds as reserved. I stayed there seven nights saw several shows visited many hotels and lost in all of them. If you need to contact me,,urhamm ( at ) sbcglobal.net.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed in Bally's”
Reviews.Author: Baskgrl
Reviews.Content: Location is great and that is about all. We arrived at 8:30am and asked for early check-in - not available. We were told to come back at 10:30am for "pre check in". When we came back to the check in area at 10:30 the line was very long and there were only two people working. After about 30 minutes we got to the desk. The girl working was very nice (we booked three rooms and she got us all on the same floor). We were "checked in" but had to come back between 1 and 3 to get our keys (and stand in another long line). When we finally got to the room it was very disappointing. The carpet was very worn, the windows were extremely dirty, the paint was peeling off the wall in the bathroom, the fixtures in the bathroom were rusted and there were holes in our sheets. We were staying in the North Tower. We have stayed at other hotels on the strip and the experience at Bally's has been our least favorite. We will not stay at Bally's again.

Reviews.Title: “Location is the best thing to say about it....”
Reviews.Author: SeattleWinelover
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at Bally's on May 10 and 11th. It was our first trip to Vegas in about 12 years and we'd previously stayed there. It is very centrally located so I was happy about that, but the rooms hadn't been updated since long before we were there before. And I say rooms as in plural because we stayed in two different ones. The first room was across the hall from some kind of mechanical room and the noise from it kept us awake all night so we requested a change. They were accommodating and moved us to another one in the same (older) tower - it was quieter, but still pretty tacky and outdated. I must say that we also found Bally's to be one of the smokier casino/hotels on the strip, as well. On the good side, however (in addition to the location) - I left some personal belongings in the room when we checked out and as soon as I called Lost & Found they were immediately sent to my home (and I haven't received a bill for it yet).

Reviews.Title: “Good experience!”
Reviews.Author: cauliflower18
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Bally's over the Memorial Day weekend (Friday and Saturday night) after getting an awesome deal off of the hotel's website using a coupon code (ended up being about $360USD for the two nights which is excellent considering it was over the long weekend and Fri/Sat nights)... Originally offered upgrade for $20 a night to the North Tower and after looking at the South Tower rooms, we decided to upgrade. North Tower rooms are significantly nicer than the South rooms and as we were a room of 5 people for the first night, 7 for the second, we appreciated the newer floors as well. We arrived Friday in the late morning and tried to do an early check in. Was not a long wait and let us know that a room would be available in a couple of hours. We really appreciated the early check in. Room itself was very clean and looked quite new. Lots of space for all of us to hang out and we really liked the big table, comfy sofa chair and the two end benches (they came in handy as an extra bed). Amenities included the iron and ironing board, shampoo/conditioner/body soap/facial soap/body lotion and a hairdryer. Lots of lights and towels - we had to order extra blankets and towels and amenities which were quickly sent to our rooms on a couple of occasions. Our room was on the 14th floor and had a view of the room of another building and we could see the pool - it was not as nice as the South Tower room (which had a view of Paris hotel and the Bellagio fountains - but we didn't mind so much). Overall the hotel suited our needs and we enjoyed ourselves a lot! I would stay there again, but definitely in the North Tower until they renovate the South one.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Time At Bally's”
Reviews.Author: JohnFromNC
Reviews.Content: Booked a room for two beds/two adults on American Express for a business meeting being held at the hotel. When we arrived on our flights from the east coast around 9:30 PM we were told the only available room with two real beds was next to the elevators. We were offered a room change for the following night, but once you've unpacked, who wants to move? The elevators sounded like jumbo jets taking off and of course Las Vegas never sleeps! Also, the entire hotel reeks of cigarette smoke. I wanted a shower everytime I walked through the lobby. I've had better at a cheap hotel on the highway most anywhere. Of course, the desk clerk's attitude was "we only guarantee a room - we can't guarantee the type of room you request". "You should have arrived earlier" Unbelievable.

Reviews.Title: “Best bang for the buck!”
Reviews.Author: KHOJA1
Reviews.Content: Had our annual Vegas trip and stayed at Ballys for the past 5 yrs. Ballys is the bang for the buck for center strip. We booked our stay on the hotel site and got a great deal (midweek avg $70 a night). Checked in hotel Tuesday evening and all went smooth. Politely asked for upgrade suite and was offered a north tower suite but turned it down since it was just a King bed..Had three of staying there and needed 2 beds. Casino was clean and not much smoke. Great daily maid service. Havent been disspointed at any time.

Reviews.Title: “Ballys is Great”
Reviews.Author: IshLaTay
Reviews.Content: Ballys is located right in the heart of the Strip. It has a Monorail station in the back for getting to all the different Hotels on the strip that the monorail services. Room was spacious and quiet. We stayed in the renovated North Tower. We always enjoy the hospitality of the staff at Ballys. There are no Time share people anywhere inside the Hotel. You can get a meal at the Sidewalk cafe for a reasonable price. We prefer to walk out back for the short walk to Ellis Island for a nice price, good quality meal.

Reviews.Title: “OK Mid Range Property”
Reviews.Author: Member From Shellharbour Australia
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights in a 14th floor deluxe north tower room. Wasnt as nice as the north tower photos on this website, but still OK. Ballys is generally nice but nothing particularly special. It is of a mid range standard with a mid range price. It is in a very ,very good location, easy to get to almost anywhere, and this is its strong suit. If I got a good deal next time I go, I would return. I would also consider Harrahs or Flamingo in this price range, but would stay in Paris next door to Ballys if it were closer in price to the others.

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary Trip to Balleys May 4-8,2008”
Reviews.Author: poolejkp17
Reviews.Content: We had a beartiful room on the 25th floor of the North Tower with great views of the Eiffel Tower, Bellagio Fountains, Caesar's, and the Rio. Room was large, only one TV, but who's watching Tv? As soon as I put my Diamond Card in a machine I was welcomed by a slot host, and introduced to his boss. The Diamond lounge was closed when we checked in at 11pm, but other than that our trip was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Great time at Ballys”
Reviews.Author: Lindsey0604
Reviews.Content: Hi! I was a little nervous to stay here - I had read some really bad reviews. I travel a lot - at least a few times a year so I have a basis for comparison - and my experiences always seem to be better than the reviews I read which makes me think I'm not a very picky traveler. But here are some of my thoughts on Ballys: We stayed in the South Tower - the non-renovated side. I guess the North Tower is brand new and really nice. I didn't have any problems with the South Tower - it was clean, smelled good, big and easy to access from the casino. The bathroom worked just fine, it was quiet, housekeeping came everyday...no problems at all. The Casino was big, clean and a lot of fun. There were a couple lounges in it too that were nice to sit in - there was live music every night. They had a Sbarros pizza, a couple delis too - there were some options for people who didn't want to go broke eating. The pool was great - it gets busy and by noon-ish most chairs are gone. It was however, 100 degrees everyday we were there so that's probably why it was so busy. But, there was plenty of room for everyone - we never had a problem getting a seat. They have a DJ, bar and restaurant at the pool too. We extended our stay for 1 night and didn't have any problems at the front desk. The location was great - you could walk anywhere. We ate next door at the Flamingo, watched the fountain show at the Bellagio, rode the roller coaster at NYNY and never had more than a 10 min. walk. The only bad things: EVERYTHING costs extra - pool rafts, room safes, pretty much anything. But, that's Vegas - you don't go there to save money. All in all a great stay. I would stay at this hotel again in a second.

Reviews.Title: “They only give you a room--nothing more”
Reviews.Author: AnotherMark
Reviews.Content: Very disappointed with hotel. They provided a room and nothing more. For almost $200 a night, I expected better. Room had seen better days. A missing tile along bathroom floor. Scratches on paint. A deeply gouged toilet seat. A partially clogged bathroom sink. Air conditioner could not be controlled. It worked at maximum and I could not change temperature or lower fan speed. Came home sick as a result. No coffee maker in room. No mini-bar. No daily newspaper delivered to room (you can buy one in lobby). Highest charge for internet access I have ever experienced. High charge for phone usage. $3 a day charge if you use the in room safe. A bottle of room temperature water in bathroom costs $4. Unable to get an itemized bill or receipt at check out because they said they disconnected their computer for an upgrade. They had the arrogance to tell me that I would find my charge billed to my credit card in a day and if it was wrong, I could dispute it with my credit card company.

Reviews.Title: “pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: MCarlo2006
Reviews.Content: Stayed Sun-Thurs-comped room, so wasn't sure what to expect. Check in was rather quick and lady checking us in gave us a north tower and offered a suite up-grade for $25, declined, maybe next time. Very impressed with our room, very clean, bed very comfortable and loved the bathroom. Nice to have a loveseat so you don't have to sit on the bed all the time. I was very leery of what to expect with some of the reviews that I had read, but we sure got lucky, and I would definitely go back. Every employee that we came across was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “more than i expected”
Reviews.Author: Hairless
Reviews.Content: i made a 30day advance reservation to take advantage of a promo rate. i asked for a North tower room, which was advised on TA by other reviewers, on arrival and got it. The front desk person was so friendly and helpful as were all employees i came into contact with. The room was large and so comfortable and clean. Great location but lost money on the slots, its Vegas baby! Easy checkout. Didn't have a view but i did not ask for one. I stayed mid week and it may be different weekends. Have fun.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Go Wrong with Bally's”
Reviews.Author: enginerd487
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at Bally’s from Dec 13-18. I have previously stayed at Imperial Palace and the Golden Palm (glad they tore it down). We arrived by plane and the cab fare was about $20 with tip. Very reasonable. The check-in process was smooth without any hiccups. We stayed in the “Grand Suite” which is in the north tower, and wow! The place was huge! The suite consisted of 3 rooms linked together with a total of 4 beds (easily enough for 8-10 people if some want to sleep on the ground). We stayed for almost a week, through the weekend and the price with a few bouts of room service was a bit under $2,000. Seems pricy, but for that long a stay, huge Jacuzzi in the main room and enough space to throw a massive after party, the price comes down fast when you have a few people chip in. (Be sure to only book the room for 2 people…they will give you as many keycards as you want). The normal soaps and things were provided in each room, room was made up and fresh towels added every day. Very nice housekeeping, be sure to tip them well, at Bally’s they work hard. Room service was amazing! We ate room service for dinner probably 3 nights and I was always quick and delish. Besides there is something to be said for eating a perfectly cooked steak in a Jacuzzi with your significant other. Highly recommend this option, its not really expensive (we usually spent more eating out) and the food was always perfect. Did a lot of gambling. The slots were hit and miss, but they seemed to be relatively loose compared to Paris. Biggest win was probably $80 on quarters. Tables are usually open so you can get a seat or a rail at about $10-15min. Dealers are cool, and the party pit is fun if you want to win beads, a deck of cards, or a stuffed animal for getting lucky. All in all, probably brought $800 to gamble with and left with $850. The comps however are a joke! I was at the tables everyday for about 7 hours with $20-30 average bet, at the end of the trip ended up with $4.65 in comps. Truly abysmal, no comps whatsoever thrown at me after 4 hours straight at a craps table. I asked for a free buffet and the pit boss said he couldn’t do it. Mostly an older crowd here but there a few 20-somethings running around. Over all nice stay, I would recommend it to anyone looking for a great room on the cheap in the middle of the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Average and a Bit Overpriced For What You Get”
Reviews.Author: johnva8312
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Ballys for the National American Planning Association Conference from April 26th to May 1st. Overall, I just considered Bally's a place to sleep while at the Conference and in Las Vegas. Overall, the Hotel offers a great location on the strip, clean rooms, with little amenities (unless you want to pay quite a bit). I have stayed at Holiday Inn Expresses that offered more. My room was in the south tower, which apparently makes a difference in how people felt about Bally's. I talked to several other conference attendees who stayed in the south tower and did not like it while others staying in the north seemed to have a better opinion. I have posted some thoughts below. Location: The location on the strip is probably Bally's primary strength. It is centralized on the strip meaning that it is just a short walk to places like the MGM and Treasure Island. There is a sky bridge right outside Bally's, which makes it easy to get to the Bellagio and Cesars Palace. Bally's is also a stop on the Monorail line, in case you do not want to walk to the other locations. It costs about $5 a ride. Rooms: The rooms in the south tower are quite large and clean. The bathroom water pressure was good and they stock the bathrooms with shampoo, conditioner, and lotion.The elevators leading up to the rooms in the south tower were the slowest I have ever experienced. I once waited 9 minutes to have the elevator come to my floor. The beds were comfortable and the rooms had quite a bit of lamps, a table, and chairs. Lack of amenities: The hotel does not offer much in the way of in-room amenities or other services without a charge. There is no in-room complimentary coffee for example. I did not have a mini-fridge either. The in-room safe costs $3.00/day or so and it is best not to touch it. If you shut it, that is when the charges kick ensue. Workout Room: The most disappointing for me was the fact that the fitness center is not complimentary to hotel guests. A day pass to use the fitness center will cost you $22.50. Needless to say I ran the strip to get in my exercise. I was not willing to pay that much for a 45 minute workout. Food: There is a small coffee kiosk in the lobby, another small coffee shop serving sandwiches, and a 24-hour diner. The food was just okay but really expensive. It is probably better to go to the strip to get food. There is also a shopping complex downstairs with a deli, Sbarro pizza, Japanese restaurant, sports bar, Haagen Das (sp?), and New York Pretzel. There are two shops that provide sundries within the hotel. TV: If you get tired of the strip, the TV channels are really limited. Other than the basic channels, there were not much else except for a block of Chinese television channels. Hotel staff: I found the staff to be a mixed bag. Some were very helpful and some were not. I appreciated the bag storage provided by the bell captains. Check-in/Check out: When you first arrive, chances are you will have to stand in a very long line to check in. It moves relatively quickly. The hotel offers express check out. Casino: I did not gamble, however, the casino seemed a bit dated compared to others along the strip. There is quite a bit of floor space at the casino. Bally's is connected to Paris through a corridor of shops. The conference took place in meeting rooms in both facilities. I would not recommend this set up for future conferences as it was a hike to get from one session to another if you had a session starting in the other hotel. Overall, the hotel was clean but to me, there was really nothing special about Ballys, other than the location. If you want your hotel to be part of your overall Vegas experience, you may want to consider another location. If you want to use your hotel as a home base while cruising the Strip, then Bally's will suit your needs.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: cat09Ohio
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for the price. In a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Central Strip Location”
Reviews.Author: Matt N
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Bally's from April 26 to May 1 for a conference and really enjoyed the experience. It's mid-strip and walking in either direction gets you to any casino you want in just a few minutes. The Deuce (double decker bus that runs the strip and to downtown) is a great way to get around if you need to go further. And unless you absolutely must avoid fresh air, get outside and go to Red Rock Canyon or one of the other natural wonders just beyond the outer edge of the city. Pros: Friendly staff, good food in both Bally's and Paris which is connected to Bally's. In fact, the food at a Le Provencal in Paris was excellent, as was Le Village Buffet. Nice casino with $5 tables most of the week, average decor for the strip. Excellent rooms in the North Tower (avoid the South Tower until its renovated). The pictures of my room show a damaged tub, that was probably chipped during installation, but the room really was very comfortable. Astonishingly huge property. Cons: We requested a non-smoking room when we made reservations and none were available on Saturday when we arrived. They upgrade us to a Jr. Suite, but it was still a smoking room and it was a very bad night. The smoke in the casino gets worse during the night and isn't as well filtered out as in some of the other casinos (Bellagio, Caesars, Bill's, and the Flamingo - these last two had less smoke because the casino was open to outside). Astonishingly huge property. They charge extra for *everything*! $1.25 to make a call to an 800 number, $12.99 for internet access, $22.00 per day for access to the fitness room, $3 per day for the in-room safe, everything! Small and average pool area compared to the Bellagio, Caesars, and the Flamingo (which also has a European style pool area). Extremely limited cable selections for those late nights you just want to rest for an hour.

Reviews.Title: “What a dump!”
Reviews.Author: StacyJ179
Reviews.Content: We came to Vegas for a conference. The conference hotels were Bally's & Paris. Everyone I know who has stayed here said it was nice but dated. They must have been drunk while they were here. We reserved a room that was non-smoking w/ a King-size bed. What we got when we checked in was a smoking room with two queens. The folks who had the room prior to us must have chain-smoked in there. I don't mind smoke as do most, but this was like one of those smoking rooms in airports or malls. We were promised a new room the next day that met our original request. By noon we had our new nonsmoking room but no King bed. At this point, I just let it ride. On top of that, the staff sucks and you don't feel very welcome. If you come to Vegas, spend a little more money and stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “My Favorite Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Gigi94
Reviews.Content: I just returned from Las Vegas 4-08. This was my 9th trip to Vegas and we have stayed at Bally's 4 times. I stayed at the Flamingo 1 time, Mirage 2 times, and Excalibur 2 times. Bally's is my favorite for 3 reasons: location, large rooms, and the casino is small so the rooms are quick to get to from the entrance. They have recently closed the buffet and have moved the shuttle bus that goes to the Rio to the Paris casino. Because of this I am rating it above average instead of excellent. I do not like the restaurant food at the Paris. I'm not sure I will stay at Bally's my next trip but will never stay at the Excalibur or Mirage again. You just can't beat the Harrah's reward program, so I will stay at a Harrah's property so the comps will keep coming. I may split my next 5 night trip and stay 2 nights at Ballys and 3 nights on Freemont street. We love to go there but it is very crowded at night. I will check out the reviews first! More about Bally's - Every stay the rooms have been very clean and are very big. You will love the size of the bathroom! The beds have been very comfortable. No smells or noise. I have never had a bad room. We have stayed in both the North and South towers. My son likes the North tower the best because it is close to the Sports bar which he says is Great. The service is good and the employees are very nice. I don't usually ask for anything but have requested some additional towels, etc. and they were very accommodating. There are no coffee pots in any room but I have never stayed in a hotel in Vegas were there was. I am a big coffee drinker so I hate this fact. The best about Bally's is the location. It is centrally located on the strip so you can go visit a lot of casinos easily. The casino area at Ballys is not big, so there are not a lot of slot machines. I usually don't win, in fact I have never come out ahead so I can't say the slots are loose. I am a big slot player so if anyone can tell me which casinos have loose slots, I would like to know.

Reviews.Title: “Dreadful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: steve26London
Reviews.Content: Don't book into this dump if you are over 25 and like a clean hotel. We went to the pool on a saturday morning and after 10 minutes a pool disco started up playing deafening rap music. When i asked them to turn it down i was ignored. I then went to the hotel manager who replied "There is nothing i can do about it". Well who can?????? She really was the most unhelpful hotel worker i have ever come across. she could not care less. When i spoke to one of the lifeguards he told me these pool parties happen every weekend and guests were always complaining. On top of this our roon was dingy and grubby and the whole wing stunk of stale smoke. Stay away from this nightmare. Our holiday was ruined by this place. Without a doubt the worst hotel i have ever stayed in and i spend 6 weeks per year touring the U S A.

Reviews.Title: “Breat Location, Very Good Deluxe Room. Suite Well....”
Reviews.Author: Ellenwood
Reviews.Content: I checked into the hotel late at night and the Deluxe room I reserved was not available so I was upgraded(?) the first night to a suite. I am sensitive to mold and upon entering the suite the first thing that hit me was the moldy smell. The outdated furnishings hit me later after I went down a short halway. I think the moldy smell was coming from the carpet which looked like it was original to the hotel's 1973 opening. The main area was a very large vaulted room with very dated flea market scratched up chairs. It also had this large fake dead looking plant protruding from an oversized tarnished silver plantholder.The bathroom was open to the bedroom with a largejetted tub built into a platform with a great view of the stip. There were also two vanity areas, a water closet with the toilet, another room with the bidet, an enclosed ahower, and two closets. The pink marble everwhere was kind of a turnoff. The bed was comfortable but as with a lot of buildings from the70's there was not great soundproofing. Although I was roung 20 floors up I was awakened a couple of times by traffic noise from below. Apparently there was s small opening in the padio door that magnified the sounds to the extent that it was almost like trying to sleep in the middle of a highway. I have a feeling they only use this room when other rooms are unavailable. The room has some great features but the carpet and some of the furnishing needs to be replaces along with soundproofing added around the windows. The tub layout kind of reminded me of Tony Montana puffing his cigar in Scarface. Fortunately when I moved to the deluxe room the next day it was a total 180 degree turn for the positive. No moldy smell, tastefful furnishings a granite topped desk as well a granite bathroom. The bead, coucn, and bench were very comfortable. If you are out late and you want something to eat just be warned that room service cuts off at midnight and the hotel does not have a 24 hour cafe as is the case with most other Las Vegas Hotels. There is a 24 hour cafe on the Paris side which gets extremely crowded as it serves both hotels. The two hotels are joined by a shopping promenade. If I were given the room I book initially I would have rated the hotel four stars but the suite episode caused me to lower my rating to three stars.

Reviews.Title: “pleasantly suprised”
Reviews.Author: dane1606
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a seven night stay in Vegas.We spent the first 3 nights at the Palazzo and then 4 at Ballys.We had booked the 4 nights in the south tower for a total of $250 and to be honest we werent expecting much especially after checking out of the beautiful Palazzo.Check in was a breeze and the lovely lady at the desk ,without me even knowing ,put us on the 25th floor of the much better rated north tower.Result.The room was large,clean and in good order.We had a partial view of the Bellagio fountains.Bathroom was small but functional.It was warm enough to use the pool and was happy with it.There was always loads of space and you could buy a beer ($3) from the pool shop,a better option than the $7 beer from the pool bar.We used the Paris casino and bars as the Ballys casino is fairly bland.Infact to all intents and purposes you feel like you are actually staying at the Paris but for half the price.We enjoyed our stay at Ballys and would definetly consider staying there again.Ps .for mega cheap good grub exit Ballys at the sports book and walk the 200yds to Ellis Island.You wont regret it!!

Reviews.Title: “Huge rooms and very clean!”
Reviews.Author: SJdolly
Reviews.Content: This was my 6th year in Vegas but my first stay in Ballys. I was quite nervous after reading some of these reviews but we really enjoyed it. At check-in I was unsure whether to offer $20 for a North Tower room but tried just asking first. The reception guy was lovely and happily obliged. The room was MASSIVE!!! We had 2 double beds and still enough room to have a party :-) The decor was fresh and clean and plenty of hot running water all day. We did have a blocked sink one morning but I told reception on the way out and it was fixed on our return. The reception staff always seemed very friendly unlike the cleaners who never responded when you said Good Morning ! My only negative was that the room had a safe but you had to pay $3 a day which made me feel I was staying in a motel instead of Vegas strip hotel with such history! The pool area was closed for renovations whilst we were there but we could use the Paris pool instead which was lovely (except for expensive bar drinks). The singers in the entertainment lounge were fantastic and its a nice evening sat playing the machines listening to the tunes. I've stayed at both Excalibur and Tropicana but these rooms were far better. I suspect standards are not as good as the Bellagio or Caesars but to be honest in Vegas you'll be out and about and only ever sleep in them anyway!! Enjoy your trip to Vegas :-)

Reviews.Title: “Classic, not luxurious”
Reviews.Author: nyuszi
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at Bally's and I think they must have renovated since last year. The furniture in the room was considerably nicer than I remember, though the new euro-style linens were a bit scratchy. The bathroom was the most disappointing, with pretty bad water pressure and a pathetic hair dryer, but it was still serviceable. The property itself is decent, the casino is not as upscale as the newer hotels, but not as seedy as the Flamingo. I wasn't very impressed with the onsite food choices, but Bally's is connected to Paris so it's an easy, air conditioned walk to those better options. Finally, it is a stop on the monorail, which is very convenient, particularly if you are visiting for a convention.

Reviews.Title: “weird woman entering hotel rooms”
Reviews.Author: mele-hawaii
Reviews.Content: my husband and i stayed april 15 - 20, 2008. our friend had his own room. he had just undressed when someone knocked twice and threw open the door. "she said "is everything alright?" he put his pants back on and saw her walking briskly down the hallway. we thought it was because he had just checked in. but the next day while i was in my room, she did it to me. we went down to the desk to ask if this was common. they said no. i saw the maid each day and she knocked and announced herself before opening the door. the best we could surmise is that it's a thief robbing rooms. so put your valuables in the safe and throw the bolt on the door. there is no "do not disturb" sign for the door. also we had to talk to the front desk three times to straighten out the bill. it was supposed to be in my husband's name but for some reason they put 2 days in his name and 3 days in mine. they had not scanned my credit card, only his (we keep separate cards) since his business was paying for it we needed one bill. they finally transferred it over to his name, but it didn't read easily. it looked like he had payed for 2 days and had several hundreds of dollars transferred to his account, which could have been for ammenities like the spa or food. the hotel was centrally located and on the monorail route so it was easy to get around the strip. our room was clean and quiet on the south tower. but our next trip is booked for the mgm grand instead.

Reviews.Title: “North Tower - Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: al_kennedy
Reviews.Content: After reading through the reviews here on TripAdvisor, I asked for a North tower room when checking in. I was with three other people and they all requested the same. Since we arrived quite late, there were not many rooms left. Two of my co-workers are smokers and got smoking rooms. Without asking, they upgraded my other co-worker and I to a junior suite for the first night if we were willing to move the second night which wasn't a problem. The front desk staff was friendly and very helpful. Moving rooms the next day only took a moment and I never saw a very big line at the front desk. The junior suite was massive (see photos) but it was mostly just big vs nice. Nothing wrong with the room at all, just nothing spectacular. The second room was also quite nice and nothing to complain about. Bathrooms in both were large and spotless. Beds were very comfortable and there was a nice selection of foam and down pillows to choose from. The only complaint was that I lost $60 playing roulette :) Perfectly acceptable hotel and a decent price. I'd definitly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Bally Needs Attention”
Reviews.Author: cdntraveladdicts
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a stay at Bally's Hotel & Casino. I was very disappointed upon arrrival to find that they could not supply the room that was reserved. They put me in the South wing, to the noise of a fan that was unbearable. I then asked to be moved and received another room that needed a thorough cleaning. I stayed one night and then the next day had to return to the hotel between the hours of 1:00 to 6:00 to move to the North Tower, as that suited the hotel. I was at a conference and this posed problems. However, I complied and was moved to the North wing which was much better. Bally's needs to at least conduct a thorough cleaning of their South wing, though it is old, a good cleaning would help a great deal.

Reviews.Title: “get a North Tower room!”
Reviews.Author: motorcitytoby
Reviews.Content: my wife and I went back to Ballys for our second stay in the last 6 months. last stay we were in the north tower, which was recently renovated, with better beds, linens, and a great TV. This time we stayed in the South tower since we had an early check-in and didn't want to wait so we could chill by the pool. Suffice to say the south tower is similar to the reviews we had read--OLD. the rooms were fairly clean, however the bed was a bit stiff and the pillows were like bricks and firm. the room was large and the bathroom was big, but when we stay there again it is worth the wait for a room in the North tower. The furniture was dated, and the carpet behind the beds and lamps were dusty and dated. The TV was small, but for vegas you don't spend a lot of time in the beds anyway. Ballys is a GREAT VALUE for their location on the strip. there is a food stand called NOSH which is great for a quick bagel and coffee. the AC worked great and the service was good. The pool is great and not really that packed. but again, GET A NORTH TOWER ROOM, it is worth the few hour wait you might have to endure. The South tower was OK and the view was fantastic, but everything is dated in the room, including the showerhead. We will be back to ballys for sure. Eat over in Paris, since it is attached; the cafe's are great and the atmosphere is a little classier but for a room you can't beat Ballys' price. A superb value. Can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “WAY Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: GSueC
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the North Tower at Bally's, and it was GREAT. Our room was spacious, clean and comfortable. The staff was pleasant and eager to help. Bally's is attached to Paris, so you can go there with a short walk (all indoor). The casino is a little more smokey than others, and the restaurants are not very exciting, but Bally's is centrally located on the strip, so you can easily travel to other hotels to eat, shop, gamble, etc. There is a monorail stop at Bally's and the overhead crosswalk for Las Vegas Blvd. is directly in front. I would definitely stay there again, and I am picky about hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Ballys will do the job”
Reviews.Author: marcnshirl
Reviews.Content: I just got home from a 4 night stay at Ballys. Room 1976 in the North Tower, king non smoking. Over all I would rate Ballys as pretty good value for money. The location is fantastic, right at the center of the strip. Next door is Paris on one side, Bills on the other, then across the road you have the Bellagio and Caesars. The staff at Ballys could not have been more helpful. Friendly and effiecient. My room was large. King bed, sofa chair, work desk and chair, decent armoit with tv. Large clean bathroom with seperate make up area and a large closet for hanging space. Pleasantly decorated in light coffee coloured wall paper with blue accessories. Ballys pins itself as a 4 star hotel....I think this may have once been true, but I would say it is now a very good 3 and a half solid star property. I'm not sure if I would stay here again, nothing wrong with the hotel, just a personal preference. For an all round decent hotel, center strip at reasonable prices, I should think Ballys is a fair bet.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great stay at Bally's!!!”
Reviews.Author: CHOTCHKEY
Reviews.Content: After having numerous panic attacks before staying here...(and reading all the reviews from Trip Advisor) I had a wonderful stay at Bally's! I read all about the "old hotel" but it's not bad...at all...I'm pretty picky (It only looks old on the outside)...I stayed in a renovated room, I asked specifically for...it was clean and fresh, not a great view but really close to everything...literally, it is! Need I mention that I stayed for free due to Harrah's gaming credit points...Took the Monorail to where I needed to go and walked everywhere else. Had a great happy hour lunch at RA sushi...good sushi deals...overall...great stay at Bally's!!!

Reviews.Title: “North Tower-Decent”
Reviews.Author: malvlover
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Bally's once before so I knew to ask for a North Tower room. Had a view of looking down on Flamingo and could see Caesar's. The room was spacious enough, had a king bed, love seat, armoire, and 2 desks. Bathroom was nice, no separate shower, sink area was large enough for all my junk! Had a bit of a walk to the room and the hallways are kept ice cold! I noticed the halls need a little updating, too, but no big deal. Bed was comfortable, not the best I have ever slept in. LOTS of pillows!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: co60
Reviews.Content: Great location right in the heart of The Strip and connected to Paris. Plenty of room on the gaming floor. The rooms were a bit on the small side, but I go to Vegas to get out not spend time in my hotel room. The bathrooms were clean and had plenty of room. We stayed on the 18th floor and had a decent view of The Strip. Minor complaint: You have to park in the Paris parking garage and walk over to Bally's. Parking is free and the walk is nice, so this is a very minor complaint.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for...”
Reviews.Author: shaina_loves2travel
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at Bally's in Las Vegas in summer 2004. The best part about Bally's was the location, right across from the Bellagio light show. The rooms were okay. They were quite small and the beds were so-so, but they were very clean so I guess I shouldn't complain too much. The biggest problem we had is that we are used to staying in resorts where they provide many amenities. So when we got there we drank some of the water and what-not only to realize after that the water was $8 a bottle. I guess that's average in Vegas?!? It was insane but I guess you live and learn! The service was average. It took awhile to get towels, but not too horribly long. Downstairs is very busy and nobody really looks to help you. When we checked in the people were a little on the rude side. I think if I ever did return to Vegas I would skip Bally's. I definitely think we would have been happier using our timeshare to go to a nicer hotel. Like they say, you get what you pay for.... I think Bally's was even a little too expensive for what we got.

Reviews.Title: “Ballys is a wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: harlemgirl720
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Ballys in the North Tower room 1259. It was a nice hotel room and had plenty of space. The bed was comfortable and the room was decorated in a pale blue and brown color scheme. I stayed from March 23 to the 25th. I arrived at the hotel Easter morning around 10am and was quickly given a room. I had no complaints with this hotel and it was conveniently connected to the Paris. Its mid strip location was perfect if I decided to head north or south on the strip. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “I like Ballys”
Reviews.Author: tch912
Reviews.Content: I was five hours late getting to the hotel because I took a free ticket to give up my seat. My friend who was leaving from another state called to let them know I would be arriving arrive 6pm. Check in was quick. My room was on the 15th floor with views of Bills and the Flamingo. It was large and we got an extra bed. My overall impression is I like the location, everyone was friendly and the beds were comfortable. We spent very little time in our room. I would stay there again in the future because of the location, the size of the room and the friendliness of the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Booked there for convenience.....”
Reviews.Author: balmiesgirl
Reviews.Content: I booked at Bally's for convenience...I was attending the WPPI tradeshow. At first I was turned off by the exterior, nothing special compared to the other "strip" properties. The interior is very nice. The rooms were very clean and maintained well. The staff was very helpful and professional. The hotel hosted the tradeshow & convention very well. They were very organized and helped the overall flow of the event. The pool area was very nice and the staff very accomodating. It was convenient (and cheaper) to be able to eat at the food court in the level below the lobby/casino. The room service hours were too limited (I always have my breakfast before 9 am) but their prices and sevice were not bad for a "strip" hotel. All said & done, I am glad I stayed at Bally's.

Reviews.Title: “Needs to be remodeled”
Reviews.Author: JulieK56
Reviews.Content: Although this is well located on the strip and a place I have stayed at many times, something has changed. We had rooms that had been hidden since the 70's. The furniture was banged up as though it had been in a frat house. We had 3 rooms and none of them had bedspreads. They also charged $30 a day for an extra person (over 2 people). It was my 1 year old grandson! Also, the buffet that used to be great, is closed. It is probably a good spot for a spring break trip for college kids, but for a family looking to enjoy a nice hotel, I'd go elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “North Tower room was great!”
Reviews.Author: TeentyOne
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews here, we requested a North Tower room and had a large, very clean room on a non-smoking floor. Asked for and received extra pillows. Staff was very friendly-dealers were super!! LIked the central location on the Strip. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value - clean and convenient in the North Tower!”
Reviews.Author: SillyTrix
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at Bally's over the Easter long weekend. We had booked the classic room, thinking that we would be stuck with the South Tower rooms. There was a Bally's Hot Deal discount happening on their website so we were ok with paying a great price for the South Tower rooms. (Couldn't be that bad, right?) We arrived at the hotel and saw quite a bit of people in the regular check-in line up. However, the line moved quickly and we were able to check in within 15 minutes. I asked if we could get a room in the North Tower and we were granted with that request! The reception/lobby area wasn't very crowded; the way towards the North Tower elevators could be a little crowded since there are many slot machines there but it wasn't terrible to get through. We were on the 7th floor and although the view was non-existant, the room was clean! The bathrooms were clean and honestly, we were absolutely thrilled with our decision to stay at Ballys! We didn't eat at Bally's (we ate at Le Creperie and the Paris buffet, which is right next door). We didn't even gamble at Bally's because it was quite busy and the casino is a little smaller than others. But all in all, it is an excellent place to stay as it is comfortable, clean and convenient to get elsewhere on the strip! So, we highly recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to stay in the central strip and would like a simple, yet clean, room! Cheers!

Reviews.Title: “Not wowed by Ballys in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: TravellerforBusiness
Reviews.Content: I stayed overnight at Ballys and was a little under-impressed by the room and mish-mash of complex hysteria at Reception. I thought distant car-park location, crowded Reception area and tired room decor were a little disappointing. The staff weren't anything special but granted I stayed only one night and Vegas is Vegas with never-ending crowds of people. Although my group was very fortunate on the Slot Machines at Ballys, I think I will stay elsewhere next time I'm in Vegas. Something about Ballys didn't 'wow' me at all.

Reviews.Title: “Bally's was just perfect”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Chica079
Reviews.Content: Our first time to Vegas, and this hotel was perfect. We managed to get a really good deal when we booked. We could not have asked for more. The rooms were modern and very clean. Lots of fresh towels everyday. Bally's is in a central location, connected to the Paris, which is where we spent lots of time having crepes! Across from the Bellagio and easy access to the Monorail, which can help get you from end to end. Day pass was $9, not bad since they come by every 2-3 minutes. If you are in Vegas on a Friday/Saturday night, make sure you visit the Bellagio buffet (it's a gourmet buffet on those nights only) $35.95 a person, but the best buffet in town. Menu had rack of lamb, kobe beef, filet medaillions, peeled jumbo shrimp, opened king crab legs, lobster filled ravioli....and a dessert bar like you have never seen!!! Highly recommend! Also the Paris buffet was wonderful, they make fresh crepes filled with fruit of your choice for breakfast. Lots of really nice cheeses and bread. We disliked the Luxor buffet the most, food was not fresh, and that hotel seemed quite empty. Tried Emeril's restaurant at the MGM Grand, good food, but the servers there are barely 21 years old, seemed like they were in a rush to get you out and get new people in. Caught the David Copperfield show there also, it was entertaining. A must is to see Mystiere (at the Treasure Island hotel) was truely amazing and entertaining. We ate at the Italian restaurant there (Francescos) and the food was great, recommend this one also! The most happening hotel though would have to be the New York, New York, lots of music and dancing, went to the Coyote Ugly there and it was so much fun. There really is lots to do in Vegas, had a great time and would definitely recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location Excellent Rooms”
Reviews.Author: deanlou05
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Ballys between 4th Mar-8th Mar 08. Having read other reviews, I decided to try for a North Tower room on check in. Receptionist said there was only 1 Queen room left in North Tower, which had a "pull down" bed. DO NOT LET THIS PUT YOU OFF! We expected a tiny room and requested to change the next day, before viewing the room iteself. However, the room was more of a suite, with 3 piece, dining table etc, plus the bed did not need to be pulled down each night and was always made up ready, so no need to change. TIP: Our safe was broken on the first night, so we were told to use a safety deposit box in the cashier station. Lady there told us to use this for the whole of our stay - which saved us $15!! Highly recommend Les Artistes Steakhouse in Paris - best steaks ever! (go to Tix4tonight to get 50% reduction on mains). Also try and see David Copperfield @ MGM Grand if you can - amazing!! Studio 54 in MGM is great for a late drink / dance. Also for Breakfast - recommend American in New York New York - great choice and great price. Tried Buffet in Bellagio - not as good as the American. Must see the Fountains though! Would stay here next time we visit - very clean, tidy and central to The Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: videostar
Reviews.Content: We booked Bally's hotel on the strip booked it direct as we did the flights we arrived at the airport got a cab very quickly and at hotel in a very short time booked in and were immediately upgrade to a strip view room (LOOKING DOWN THE LAS VEGAS STRIP!) fantastic night views loads of room massive bed massive bathroom with power shower mini bar hotel has snacks restaurants free drinks what more can I say we stayed for 7 nights and the weekends are really busy with locals we also booked some trips from UK before we left which we saved 50% on a must is helicopter trip over the dam and into the canyon and visit Freemont street in old Vegas you don't need much cash here but have your wits about you go before 11pm and have a great steak at Ballys don't forget your comps card it will make you money for your gambling and meals

Reviews.Title: “Bathroom with a bed in it”
Reviews.Author: elbigote
Reviews.Content: We took advantage of a 2 nights free promo from Harrah's and chose Bally's based on reviews in TripAdvisor. We upgraded to a Jacuzzi room in the north tower. The Jacuzzi, focal point of the room, was fantastic although a bit awkward to get in and out of. There was also a spacious shower. We had a view of half of the wonderful fountains at Bellagio (through very dirty windows but the wash crew had begun work on the building) The furniture was pretty worn and uncomfortable so we appropriated 2 chairs from the hall and remedied that problem! The bed was very comfortable. The buffet at Bally's was closed so we ate breakfast at Le Village in Paris - a short walk down the connecting corridor. We can highly recommend the food and service of this unhurried buffet. Long, delicious, leisurely meals. All in all, we had a very nice stay at Bally's.

Reviews.Title: “North Tower is Best; Centrally Located”
Reviews.Author: RueCler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is centrally located which is handy for walking (which you will do a lot of). The mono rail stops here and that is a plus. Bally's connects directly to the Paris which is wonderful. The NORTH TOWER rooms I were in are very, very nice. I saw two rooms in the SOUTH TOWER. One was a suite and it was nice. The other room I saw in the SOUTH TOWER was a basic, two bed hotel room and looked run down, although it had a great view. So I recommend staying in the NORTH TOWER or in a newly refurbished suite in the SOUTH TOWER. Check rates carefully as some nights were nearly half the price of others.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room with a view”
Reviews.Author: boomslang_sg
Reviews.Content: Huge hotel and room. not too old or new. Nice view of the LV strip at night with lights. Nice clean bathroom and spacious too. Friendly hotel staff who did my check in.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel and Casino”
Reviews.Author: guspike
Reviews.Content: For the price and location on the strip, Bally's is a wonderful choice. We are a married couple, i'm 42 my wife is 30. We stayed for 2 nights in late Feb. 2008 and found the hotel to be a perfect choice for us. The room was very big compared to other rooms of similar price. The staff at Bally's are very helpful and the room was quiet and the bed very comfortable. Perhaps the greatest advantage of Bally's is its location on the strip. If this is your first trip to Las Vegas, it is one of the best locations to get a feel for where you are at on the Strip and makes touring the different casinos fun and easy. Another great feature of Bally's is that it is connected to the Paris casino property which is more of an upscale place. We dined at the Le Buffet at Paris which was simply awesome. The rooms at Bally's are only ten to fifteen dollars more a night than some of the other properties nearby and the difference in the quality and comfort are well worth the extra few bucks. While it may not be as opulent as the high end properties, the hotel is a great value and you will not be disappointed in choosing Bally's.

Reviews.Title: “Bally's, the perfect location”
Reviews.Author: joanna2144
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay on the Las Vegas strip, this is the place to stay. The hotel is conveniently located on Las Vegas Blvd. with several major hotel/casino within a 5 to 15 minute walk. Bally's also offers a free shuttle to its sister hotels (Rio, Caesars and Harrah's) so it makes it very convenient to visit other casinos and restaurants. You are also convenient to the tram system which stops at the back of hotel so if you want to move up and down the strip but don't want to walk , it's one of the best ways to get around. I stayed in a standard room which was huge with comfortable beds and pillows. It was a great room for the price.

Reviews.Title: “SOUTH TOWER, dreadful. Just dreadful.”
Reviews.Author: Ithakan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Bally's in Las Vegas twice--once on our way to the Grand Canyon and again on our way back. The two stays could not have been more different--this review is for the first stay, February 19-20. It is important to note that Bally's is essentially TWO DIFFERENT HOTELS. We were assigned a room in the SOUTH TOWER which is characterized by ancient furniture (70's style, but not retro cool by any stretch of the imagination) and unbelievably bad housekeeping. We viewed rooms on the 18th and 20th floors. We had asked for a non-smoking king room, and we were assigned a non-smoking room with two queen beds. Our first room had some sticky substance all over the flat surfaces, so we phoned the front desk and asked for another room. After an interminable slog down the endless, dark, dingy corridors littered with room service detritus, we got another room--and this one had shards of broken glass and pennies on the carpeting. We tried the front desk once more and asked if there were any "updated" rooms. We were told that the only rooms available in the North Tower were suites for $100 per night more, and that we basically had the best option we were going to get since the hotel was quite full. We were offered the chance to switch to a king room on the same floor the following day, if one became available. We finally gave up, went to the nearby Walgreen's and bought a giant can of Lysol disinfectant, then hoped for the best. Fortunately, the linens had been changed, but be aware that these beds do not have anything resembling a bedspread/coverlet/duvet/comforter--they have a double-sheeted blanket and a weird little strip of fabric that goes over the foot of the bed. If you like a really firm mattress, then you're in luck, but if you're used to a plush or pillow-top mattress, these beds will come as a shock. The shower had plexiglas doors instead of a shower curtain, which prove difficult to clean for even the most detail-oriented housekeeping staff, so be prepared for mold and mildew. Several tiles in the bathroom had been cracked or broken, adding to the overall shabby appearance. If you're interested in toiletries, they provide Gilchrist & Soames (although our toiletries had clearly been opened and used by the prior guests). There are no coffee makers in these rooms. As far as the carpet goes, bring slippers or an extra pair of socks to wear. You don't want your bare feet touching it. On the plus side, we had a sliver of view of the Bellagio fountains. And to be fair, with a MasterCard promotional discount, we paid about $75 per night on Travelocity (including taxes and fees)--but we learned that it's not a bargain when you buy the room, it's a bargain when you can sleep in it without wondering whether you're being exposed to something vile. Our second stay was absolutely the reverse--I'll rate that separately.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, tired rooms, high minimums”
Reviews.Author: Compucrruiser
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as a cheap alternative to Paris (where a conference was being held). Use your Harrahs Total Rewards number when reserving a room - I got $29 off the midweek internet room rate of $89. The rooms are showing their age. I've seen furniture with much less wear at the Salvation Army. The windows are sealed shut, and they should be cleaned 'cause they are so brown with dust that you can see the dirt even at night. The shower had so little pressure that I had to use the hand towel to finish rinsing my hair. On the other hand, it has a great location - right at the center of the Las Vegas strip, with a monorail stop. A short walk-through to get to Paris, which is much nicer, and BTW allows room charges at their restaurants if you are staying at Ballys. Tables were extremely tight. At 9 AM on a Wednesday they had only one regular BJ table and one 6-5 BJ table open. Both were $25 minimum. Slots were tight too - I went through $100 on a quarter machine without one jackpot. Craps were $10 minimum, and I did win some back on a Fire Bet. But of course YMMV. If I could get the same rate during a major convention, I'd stay here all the time, due to its location. But unfortunately they always up the price way beyond what the stay is worth.

Reviews.Title: “bed bugs in junior suite - i could not believe it!”
Reviews.Author: JacquelineOnyc
Reviews.Content: My husband and i stayed at the Ballys junior suite, 3 nights to celebrate Valentine's Day, the room was beautiful view of the Paris Eiffel tower, soak in tub, we were very pleased, until i woke up with a swollen upper lid (as a result of a bite) and bites on my wrist. i initially thought it was probably mosquitos, but i did not recall seeing bugs flying in the room, plus in Vegas the humidity is so low, i just could not figure it out. I iced the bites, becuase i had swelling and lots of itching and kept it moving, i'm on vacation, okay, then on Saturday morning, day of check out, i was awakened to sharp pain on my left forearm, my arm was itchy and i turned on the lights, looked on the bed, and there it was a bed bug, i had not seen one before, and when i called housekeeping, they confirmed what it was, asked me in a not too convincing manner that if i wanted i could report it to security to file incident report, and took the bug away in a glass cup. i was outraged, she probably thought i would not go through with reporting it. i sure did report it, and not only that, while security was in the room, my husband found another bug on the bed. I was livid, i called the front desk manager who asked me to see him on the way out, since i was checking out that same day. He comped the junior suite down to a standard rate, (reduced it to about $90.) then gave me a card for it i wanted to submit complaint to their claims department. I just could not believe that a supposed four star hotel such as Ballys would have bed bugs, then not be able to compensate my inconvenience. I had several bites that were very itchy for days... i would not return to this hotel, and will tell my story on any and every website that i have gone to in the past for reviews, i travel several times a year both internationally and domestic and just could not believe that i experienced this, i took photos of my bites and will be sending them along with a letter to the claims department, and by the way, my husband recorded video clips of the bug he found when security was in the room, taking my incident report in vivo, i also reported to travelocity when i returned, they gave me a voucher for $50 towards a future stay, which was nice, i have not heard from Ballys till this date...so let's see what happens.

Reviews.Title: “Super Bowl Sunday”
Reviews.Author: memaamber
Reviews.Content: When I booked our stay at Bally's months before. I wanted to spend my birthday in Las Vegas. I didn't realize that my birthday was the day after the Super Bowl. We arrived on Sunday and the game was underway. Being from Massachussetts, we are of course Patriots fans. I think we were a minority, at Bally's anyway. We did have our room comped for 3 nights and were in the South Tower. The room was clean and roomy. I don't spend that much time in the room, so as long as my bed is comfortable and room reasonably quiet, I'm happy. It was both. Being a non-high roller, I was not happy with the $25 table limits for both craps and Let it Ride. We played some slots and ventured outside and across the street to "Bill's Gambling Casino" formally "The Gold Coast" We found $5 and $10 tables, loose slots and on top of that "Fat Elvis" (sounds remarkably like Elvis, but BOY IS HE FAT). We had my birthday dinner at their steakhouse (can't remember the name) It was great. Wonderful service and food. Back to Bally's and through to Paris. The casino at Paris has a great open feel with the sky above. I just kept walking with my eyes to the sky. Loved it. We ate at their buffet and there were tons of different choices, not your run of the mill buffet. Took the shuttle to the "Rio" and saw the show in the air. Definately a must see and it's free. I, myself enjoy the older casinos along with the new. Outdated does not matter to me. I go to gamble and have a good time. Bally's is older but comfortable, with good service and very attentive staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay at Bally's”
Reviews.Author: p_jay2001
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights at Bally's, comped from a mail offer. I was given a "Grand" Suite, in the South tower. The room was very large, with a large raised bath area. The room had not been renovated in some time, but was clean and comfortable. Slept very well in the king size bed. The raised bath area had a soaking (non-jetted) tub in the middle, with closets and sinks on both sides. A small room on one side contained the toilet, and a bidet was in a small room on the other side. A walk in shower was behind the tub, separated from it by a wall. The towels were large and plush. There was a safe in one of the closets, with a $3 a day charge to use. The view from the room was of the Paris Hotel pool deck, and you could see the Bellagio fountains off to the right. No complaints about the room. Despite the dated decor, it was well worth the $0 I paid. Bally's is in a great central strip location. Good choices for food in the hotel, and nearby. I would definitely stay here again, especially if comped!

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased with Ballys”
Reviews.Author: fortwaynejerry
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Ballys over Valentine's Day and were quite pleased. We were comped for two nights and received a rate of $77 for the third in the north tower. The room was very nice with a nice view toward Wynn's, Venitian and Palazzo. The window was very dirty on the outside, but we really liked the room and the maid service was excellent. We have stayed at several places in Las Vegas but I don't recall any other hotel where all the service people were so nice. It made for a very pleasant stay. With Paris being connected and Bellagio and Caesers just across the strip, it is a great location We mostly ate at Paris, Mon Ami Gabi's and the Eiffel Tower restaurant, but did eat at the Al Dente Italian restaurant in Ballys and the food was excellent. The only down side was the casino seems kind of dinghy and old fashioned but maybe it was just the beige color scheme. All in all we had a great stay and would go back again as long as we could get the north tower.

Reviews.Title: “Central Location on Strip”
Reviews.Author: Vermont95
Reviews.Content: Stayed in North Tower, requested because of reviews on this site. Very spacious room, art deco furniture. Room faced back of Flamingo but could see the Wynn in the distance. Agree with other reviewers that the windows were dirty. Room was clean however with daily maid service. Good stay overall. Best part was location, walk right out to the middle of the strip to escalator to Bellagio or Flamingo, or just walk through the connected hallway to the Paris. Highly recommend Le Village Buffet at the Paris! Also PF Changs in Planet Hollywood (a short walk south), reasonable prices for great food. Middle of strip location is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Ballys Please pass over this Hotel....needs remodeling”
Reviews.Author: onthewater1
Reviews.Content: I normally stay at Harrah's(six times last year alone) just up the street but it was full. I have stayed at Bally’s' before with no problem. This time I checked in and was sent to the south Tower room 1539. When I got off the elevator all I could smell was cleaning fluids. Found the room and opened the doors on to be overwhelmed but a stale smell. The furniture and carpet looked like it came out of the 60's. NO way was I going to stay in this dump! I want back to front desk and got another room in the north tower. After a very long walk to the end of the hall I opened the door (room629) to see a much more lively color scheme. After looking around I found that the carpet was gross stains next to bed and near doorway. I opened the curtains only to find the windows had not been cleaned in years. I can’t remember the last time I went to a Las Vegas Hotel that did not have clean windows. The room was on the third of fourth directly above the buses that keep the motor running all night. It got very windy later in the evening and the windows shook in the wind. I will continue to use Harrahs in the future but not at Ballys ever again. I just wanted you to know about this experience because I do like Harrah’s but Bally’s is not up to par with your other properties.

Reviews.Title: “Lucked Out to Luxury!”
Reviews.Author: PlainTraveler
Reviews.Content: My husband was attending the World of Concrete Conference. Other people from his office were staying at the Luxor. I wanted something more centrally located to Bellagio, Caesar's Palace, Venetian, etc. We agreed to pay the upgraded difference in price to stay at Bally's. Some other friends decided to come too and chose the Flamingo. We went to check in at 2:00 p.m. They took our bags, but we were to return at 4:00 p.m to formally get our room. We returned at 5:10 p.m.after finding out our evening Wayne Brady show had been cancelled. Our room was still not ready. We stood in the lobby and my husband's friend had his photo taken with a "Bally Chorus Girl". By 6:00 p.m. we were extremely frustrated. My husband and his friend went up to the desk and before you know it, we had a suite for the night. We were told that we would have to vacate in the a.m. and get another room at our rate. I started to think about having to unpack and then repack to unpack again. In the a.m. my husband went and spoke with a manager. He said we could stay in the suite for the entire three days at our original price of $158 a night. We were so pleased. We celebrated our spacious suite with our friends by having a glass of wine in the suite one lazy afternoon. They loved our room and thought we really lucked out compared to their Flamingo room. I bought a very reasonably priced wine down the street at the ABC Drugstore inside of Planet Hollywood's mall-Miracle Mile. The room itself had multiple art prints everywhere and boasted a living area, a full jacuzzi, two mirrored closets,2 mirrored sink areas, a bidet, toilet, and shower stall. We received a multitude of toiletries each day. Bally's is connected to Paris where we enjoyed their buffet 2 times. It's well worth the money. My husband had pancakes in Bally's coffee shop. A bit pricy, but beautifully presented with a flower. I had a spicy soup which was excellent. Bellagio also has a dynamite nightly buffet for $30. We ate in Mon Ami Gabi two times, once for lunch and once for dinner. Great hamburger at lunch time. Lots of wines to choose from at dinner. Bally's did give us some coupons on entry. Our friend's were able to use of them to see the Producers for 2/1 ticket prices.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Gerty1223
Reviews.Content: Check in was a breeze.Used the $20.00 trick and was givin a nice North Tower room on the 26th floor facing the Bellagio Fountains at 1100 am !! Room was nice and big,bed comfortable,bathroom was a little worn but not bad ,due to age of property.To be expected. Casino slots were very tight,did not even win enough to keep playing,went to Bill's and and Tuscany Suites (Short Walk) .Excellent luck there. Just seems like their machines don't pay and this was my 3rd time there. Maybe my luck? Also used the sportsbook,excellent to watch the big game.Did not see any waitresses for freebies,had to either sit at bar and Play video poker or purchase from the bar. All in all a very good time.Probably will not stay again since this is our 8th trip to vegas.We will change it up next time.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Toomy1234
Reviews.Content: great room, great location, great price. Slightly slow check in and a confusion with our room but this got sorted overall a great stay. I would reccomend this place in a flash.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't fault Ballys”
Reviews.Author: patnsue
Reviews.Content: Booked a week in Bally's via lastminute.co.uk for a round £500 each including flights with Air Canada. Hotel was excellent, great location, very large, clean and well maintained rooms. Upgraded for first night only to Jacuzzi suite on 7th N. View was a bit awful from JS - roof of Paris, but move to king size room on 11th N gave views over towards Stratosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Bally's Not What it Use To Be”
Reviews.Author: filmmaker55
Reviews.Content: Again, better late than never with this review. We stayed at Bally's in Las Vegas over the summer. The trip was booked through where my husband works and they decided to go with Bally's. First of all, the rooms were not ready when promised. We were told that they would be ready by 2pm and by 5pm we still did not have a room. So we asked for an upgrade to a Jr. Suite and by 6pm they finally had that ready. No discount was given for the inconvenience. The room was okay, but nothing spectacular. My in-laws had a regular guest room and their room was actually nicer then our suite! We had to call for housekeeping because the floors were dirty and the sink area didn't look like it had been cleaned.
