They never arrived and we left a note the next morning to be sure these issues we addressed. This was the first time I ever stayed at a hotel where I didn't want to walk around in my bare feet. It just felt dirty the entire time I was there. Our room had a jazucci bath which we were both excited about. That excitement was dimished the first time we used it. They only allow the water level to go so high to use it (which doesn't even come to your chest when laying down). Then the jacuzzi only worked sporadically. One night my husband wanted to use it and it just wouldn't work at all. So we called the front desk and they did send up someone to fix it (this was about 1am). After about 20 minutes, it was finally fixed, but by this point my huaband was so upset about the whole ordeal that he only stayed in it for about 10 minutes. There was also a bouday (sp?) in our room that ran all the time. Again, they sent someone to fix it, but they couldn't so we had to listen to the running water for 4 days. Upon check-out, we informed them of all of the issues while we stayed and our dissatisfaction (as we had throughout the entire stay) and nothing was done. Not even an apology. Needless to say, Bally's is not what it use to be and we will not be staying there again and definitely not worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Bally's for business”
Reviews.Author: Zanzie
Reviews.Content: Bally's Las Vegas offers great prices and large, up-to-date rooms with a nice-sized desk and workspace that made it a good choice for this working trip. Staff allowed me to check in nearly five hours early. The lobby and casino are extremely smoky-smelling, but my room was on a non-smoking floor that seemed truly non-smoking.

Reviews.Title: “Average Stay”
Reviews.Author: SiteCer
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Ballys during a recent business trip. I booked a very reasonable rate through the trade show I was attending. The room I was in was nice and spacious although the bathroom was not as clean as I would have expected. Check-in did take over a half an hour because several people for the same trade show were checking in at the same time but, to their credit, the desk was fully staffed to deal with the high volume. The shower both mornings was lukewarm, not hot, which was disappointing. The room and area of the hotel I was in was surprisingly quiet - I had no noise problems at all, and noise can be a problem at Las Vegas hotels, especially during big trade shows. The hotel warned guests that checkout could be a problem because of the high voume expected and recommended that guests check out through video check out in the room. I needed to have a receipt so I did check out at the desk early in the day but their computer system was down. However, as promised, they did fax a receipt to my office later that day. The location of the hotel is very good on the strip (near Bellagio and Ceasars) and it is on the monorail. It is also right across the street from Battistas Hole in the Wall Italian Restaurant, which is wonderful. If the rate is good, I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Positive Experiance Overall”
Reviews.Author: JDLowell
Reviews.Content: Bally's is perfectly located in the center of the Strip. All staff were helpful and polite. The room we had was in the north tower and was clean and well maintained. It did not have a great view but if you're in Vegas you are out and about, you sleep in your room and often you do little of that. I strongly recommend Rita Rudners show @ Harrahs and DO NOT SEE TONI BRAXTON! Check "things to do section" of Trip Advisor for show reviews, we wish we had. There is a great Moroccan restaurant Marrakech, six course menu, belly dancers, great service and a fun evening. It is in a strip mall off the strip, $6 cab ride. The Range Steak House at Harrahs was also excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Bally's Trip”
Reviews.Author: Spit
Reviews.Content: First thing I have to say, from all the Harrah's properties I have stayed at, I have never come acrossed a disgruntle employee. Hotel registers check in / out have been always polite, cordual and if times permit them can find a common topic between you and them to have a conversation about. For this trip to Bally's, the gentlman at the desk said that my room was not ready but offered a suite that was ready if I would like that for my comps and extra $25 a night. Although it was in the south tower I agreed to it so I can see if all the reviews for this tower is true. The suite was very nice, sunkin bathtub, shower, budet, 2 sinks, 2 closets, 2 dressing areas, king size bed, great view looking down Las Vegas Blv. of Bills, Flamingo, Caesars. Ended up paying only $13 for one night by using my comp points built up for the year. I saw no food trays in my hall my entire 3 nights and my room was serviced every day. Slots were tight at Bally's but looser at Paris. New card game WAR I played in at Bally's. Very simple that it is boring, I could only stand to play for 20 minutes when I cashed out ahead. I wish they would bring back Spanish 21 card game. For food, the buffet lines are always too long when I get hungry and the restraunts always to expensive, so I ventured to the bottom floor of Bally's and ate Sbaro's and Johny's Delacatesion. Good priced, good food, enough for me. Also in the area is Bally's Sports Book. Nice bar in area, friendly people working the area, and I did well playing on the games. One of the entertainment things I did on this trip was go see the Las Vegas Wranglers ECHL hockey team play. They had a special Thursday morning game at 9:30 for school kids, and it was a great game and fun to watch. My next trip to Vegas and Bally's is March. It will be interesting to were they put me since the comps they offer me are down to 2 nights and for Bally's my rooms are for the Deluxe only rooms and does not include there Luxery rooms any more. All of my comps for Harrah's are for 1 night less and just a basic room with no view. I am interested to see in March which tower they put me in since I have an early flight in to Vegas. As always, I use the monorail for going up and down the strip. No lines, can find discount coupons for a 24 hour ticket, clean, no trouble ever using it.

Reviews.Title: “Sweet”
Reviews.Author: LordPeterFlint
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Bally's for ten days and I loved the resort and the city. Even flying in to Vegas is amazing, hours of nothing then a city in the desert and the airport is right next to the strip. We had a Queen size room in Bally's and it was massive, a huge bed, a huge bathroom and enough space for a large dining table.The room was clean and the service what you expect in America - excellent. The casino was great and there is lessons every morning on how to play the games. There are shops, bars, resteraunts and of course a swimming pool and gym and such like. Pretty much everything you can think of Bally's has - including a bookies ! The food portions are enormous with steaks the size of a small family hatchback. Dining is quite informal too with shorts and a polo shirt quite acceptable pretty much everywhere. Bally's is connected by underground mall to a neighbouring casino Paris Paris and it really is more of a resort than just a hotel bwecause its so big and there's so much to do. Its also very central and within easy walking distance of Cesar's Palace et al. The only thing I would say negatively about this resort is the incredible heat - it is in the middle of the desert - and I found it too hot to sunbathe and even walking around outside was an effort for a fair skinned Scot like me. Death Valley, one of the hottest places in the world, is nearby. Its an amazing place though and Bally's was hugely enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Bally's!!!”
Reviews.Author: txmimi
Reviews.Content: This was my first time to stay at Bally's and I loved it. We got a room in the north tower and it was huge with very nice furnishings and very comfortable beds. The rooms were not at all cheesy like some of the hotels in Vegas and the bathroom was very nice also. All the employees we encountered were very friendly and helpful. I really enjoyed everything about our stay at Ballys and plan to stay there again. The location is fantastic. You can go straight into Paris from Ballys and there are alot of the high end hotels right around there. I would highly recommend staying there but I do recommend getting a room in the North Tower. The only place we ate in the hotel was Johnny's Deli and it was very good. Didn't win alot in the casino but did okay on video poker. All-in-all, we had a really good stay at Ballys!!

Reviews.Title: “I'll never stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: Michael N
Reviews.Content: The room was comfortable but as soon as I checked into my room, and tried to get a shower and relax for a while I discovered that the water in my room had been turned off for a 2 hour maintenence work session. THE SERVICE WAS HORRIBLE! The place is such a cheesey ripoff. From charging for internet service, outragous charges for local phone calls, and no coffee maker in the room(so they can make a few extra bucks buying it elsewhere in the hotel). I used the in room phone line to connect my laptop to the internet using dial-up. I was charged the $1.50 for a local call but unknown to me, they charge you so much per minute over the 1st 30 minutes. I was handed a $417 bill for local phone calls upon checkout. If the management of Bally's wants to run a top notch operation instead of a bush league impersonation of a top notch hotel I recommend that they charge a few extra bucks per room per night and stop the practice of nickel and dimeing their patrons to death.

Reviews.Title: “Get the North Tower”
Reviews.Author: weezer37
Reviews.Content: We chose the hotel due to it's location, and relatively cheap price over New Years.. from other reivews i made sure to request nonsmoking rooms inthe North Tower. We confirmed it the day before by calling the hotel direct. At check-in the staff were pleasent enough- our flight arrived around 230pm, so the 3pm check-in should not have been a problem, however we were told there were no nonsmoking rooms left in the North Tower. Also that if we wanted the North Tower, they actually only had 1 room clean right now. We chose the smoking in the North Tower over Non-smoking in the South, and were pleasently suprised that the room we got straight away (on the 23rd floor) had a great view of the strip and didn't smell overtly smokey. New decor and bathrooms were pretty high end considering its a moderate hotel. We went out for dinner and came back at midnight to get the other room, and were shocked to be told it still wasnt clean!. That being said- the front desk staff were very nice and tried to get housekeeping to confirm whether that just hadn't updated the system... after a 30 min delay- wherein they offered us a 1500 sq ft suite in the south tower (which didnt work for us as we had 4 people in the room and it only had a King bed.. too bad :)).. they finally found us a junior suite on the 25th floor which was slightly larger than the room on the 23rd floor... again very nicely done up and even though on a smoking floor- no hint of smoke smell. They also gave us some breakfast buffet vouchers for the inconvienence-- that we never used because we were never up by 10am! all in all a great hotel- relatively cheap gambling for the location mid strip, great access to Paris and other hotels- and the staff were super friendly even though swamped with New Years craziness!! Bell staff at check-out were a bit slow and not terrible helpful, but i think they had just had it as well!

Reviews.Title: “Go North or go somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: TBegay
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here before and loved it now I know why....we were always in the North tower. South side is a dive.. Like a motel 6 for the price of the HIlton. Bad furniture old beds dirty carpet mold in the bathrooms and squeaky fans. I would stay here again but only with the guarantee of the North tower. They need to implode the other side

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: JoLe-FL
Reviews.Content: After putting in a lot of time, looking for the best location and price for New Year and after selecting Bally's, a colleague who goes to Las Vegas a lot, said that I'd made a bad decision. I'd read the reviews and hoping for the best, I stuck with Bally's. Checking in at 1000pm, we were asked if we'd mind terribly staying in a suite for the 1st (of the 4) nights, since there was no non-smoking room available until the next day. The suite was beautiful, with a raised marble-tiled area with sunken whirlpool in the centre; one side of the area with closet, vanity and bidet for "her" and the other side for "him". A glass shower stall in the middle. The following 3 nights, in a large beautiful room, still in the North tower, view of the East, we were just as pleased. Everything is good: bed, bath, elevators and the location.... Walk to "Paris" via indoors shop- and restaurant lined French "rue". Airport shuttle is always parked outside next to check-out, ready to go (6.00). We've stayed in many nice rooms, but this was one of the nicest and definitely the biggest. We'd love to stay there again.....

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: chilee21
Reviews.Content: Location is GREAT!!! Right next to Paris and across from The Bellagio.. We had a very nice view - we were located right by the corner so we had the Eiffel Tower right in front and about an 80% view of all the fountains in front of the Bellagio when they were on display. The casino was good & a lot of choices for food.

Reviews.Title: “Headed back for a third visit”
Reviews.Author: bogie924
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at Bally's twice. Both times I didn't have a single issue (and I am one of those people who can complain about anything). I checked in at the airport both visits. No problems. $20 to the girl at the desk assured me rooms in the North Tower. From what I have read it is well worth the $20. We are headed back next week and I am hopeful that my third visit goes as well. For great meals check out Le Provencal on the walk between Paris and Ballys. The Cheesecake Factory in Caesar's Palace and P.F. Changs in Aladin are also very consistantly good. For breakfast you got to take a trip to the Main St. Station downtown. AWESOME buffett and it's very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Jubilee Show was Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: liberty49
Reviews.Content: The show was more spectacular than expected. This made up for the yucky room in the "old" tower. I didn't know about a new tower. And even if your a smoker the SMOKE is awful. I couldn't find 1 "21" slot machine.

Reviews.Title: “Book the suites”
Reviews.Author: flyingkiwipoms
Reviews.Content: Ballys is a very well situated Hotel for staying on the Strip. very close to many of the main Hotels/ cafe's, the monorail, shopping and car hire facilities.. It is budget accomodation on the Strip and our room was very tired ( 70's furniture and decor) but clean and remarkably large. However, our friends stayed at the same time and for the same rate and had a suite and it looked much more up to date and had a view of the Strip. I would recommend staying here if you can get a suite.. otherwise shop around a bit.

Reviews.Title: “New Years at Ballu”
Reviews.Author: RaviDoshi
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from 29 Dec to 1 January, and we had been lucky to made our booking 6 months in advance. I secured a Best Rate Garantee and see they gave me a rate of about $130 for each night when in fact new years was about $300. I had spent the earlier 4 nights in this trip at Mirage and when we checked in we were disappointed with our rooms. In spite of having booked 6 months in advance, they could not even offer us a king bed as requested. I remember speaking to an Asian lady quite short and middle aged, who was so very rude to us. I asked her if we could change from 2 single to 1 large bed, and she really shouted at me like I was nobody. I was trying to find out from her if there was any difference in the south tower (where were currently checked in) or the north tower (where she offered us a king bed after 7pm). My wife was unwell so I did not want to move her around if the room was no better. i was really put off by her, but I let it go so we could have a nice holiday. We ended up staying in the room with 2 single beds because the view was THE BEST YOU CAN GET IN VEGAS, COMPLETELY UN-OBSTRUCTED OF THE SOTH STRIP! so we decided to stay put and enjoy the evening view. Each time I ever come to vegas, for some reason we eat at Sbarro in Ballys. This time we also had pretzels and hagan das icecream, we had these BOGOF coupns so every bit helps! The restaurants are nothing great, so we ate 2 times in Paris at teh burger brasserie, very nice burgers I thought, plus hot waitress in tiny shorts! maximum price for 2 hungry people with fries and drinks is about $30, cheap! Location is decent, close enough to walk to MGM lots of tourist shops along the way, and you can buy cheap water, tourist trips, souvenirs, etc so worth a morning stroll! Overall we would have preferred to stay at a themed hotel but since Ballys gave us very good room rates, we stayed there. New years was silly, the area outside the hotel was so crowded, lots of security and this was quite dangerous with so many people. Unluckily my wife became very ill, and we had no wayy to get to a hospital so we had to walk round the back way to harmon medicla centre. When I told ballys reception my wife was ill, they sent security within 5 minutes, who spent 30 minutes with us trying to help. I was very impressed with them. What was weird was with reception next morning, I wanted a checkout for 1 pm, stating my wife needs to rest before her flights which was 4pm, but they kept messing us about, saying to call back later. I really doubt all 3000 rooms were required to be cleaned at once, they could have just let us keep the room till later. In any event we checked out in the post box, and I doubt they even cleaned up until much later.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: MarylandBeachBabe
Reviews.Content: What I like most about Bally's is that there was only a 5-10 minute wait to check-in. The line moved very fast. Customer Service was exceptional. I was attending a conference and I chose this hotel for convenience. I loved tthat the Monorail was ran at the hotel. It was very hot and brought my mother along and taking the monorail was our best way to get to several hotels. There was a lounge were people were performing. This was absolutely fabulous. I don't care too much for gambling but there was plenty to do. The Jacuzzi was oversized it was perfect. My mother loved the shops and the Jacuzzi the best. I would definitely recommend this hotel. Owings Mills, MD

Reviews.Title: “Bally's Charming Location”
Reviews.Author: MNCondoDude
Reviews.Content: I was at this hotel from December 20 - 27 and found the hotel to be generally fine. My room was large, clean and in good shape. The hotel was well-kept in most cases. The location is perfect for anyone that wants to walk or take the monorail to other locations on the stripe. Food and beverage options are reasonable and it is between two major Vegas shopping areas located in other nearby properties. A few critical remarks: the check-in desk needs more staff; the hallway cleaning staff needs to check for and remove things from those areas faster; and one odd thing - security called me at 9:30 AM on my final day to tell me they had a noise compliant at a time when I was alone in the room reading a book! The two hotel featured shows "Jubilee"and "The Prince Is Right" are great ways to spend time. "Jubilee" was a surprise in terms of the production level and the quality of the performers. Located next to "Paris", you can walk through it and get close to the giant mall at "Planet Hollywood". "Paris" offers some fine dining and entertainment venues. Be aware of the long line to the "Paris" buffet - at times over an hour in the mornings to get in. If you want a buffet, the Bally's hotel offers you discounts at three other buffets that are at other locations that their chain owns, I used the express check-out and found cab service to the airport easy and cheap from the hotel. I would consider going back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: 2newaussietravellers
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 4 days and were looking for a reasonable price in the middle of the strip and thats what we got. Can't complain about the price, the rooms were quite big with a nice bathroom and comfortable beds. Luckily our room was fairly close to the elevators but friends were in rooms along way down the corridor and the corridors are long! Great location where you can walk through to Paris and the start of the monorail is located at Ballys which is very handy. Recommend you get the 3 day pass for good value. Also recommend the buffet at the MGM where we had a late breakfast/lunch on our last day.

Reviews.Title: “Love it!”
Reviews.Author: glistenpearls
Reviews.Content: Husband and I stayed for one night (Dec 25). Our room is in the north tower (20th floor). We were surprise on how large the room was considering how much we paid for it (79 + tax). The room was clean and beautiful, however I wish they give a free internet connection. But no big deal really. Also we were there during one of the busiest time I guess..that's why the check in was slow and I kept hearing ppl talking and slamming doors on the hallway (thats Vegas! and it was Xmas night), but I still can tolerate it. Other than that, everything was great and staff has been very helpful. Definitely recommended to stay in the Nth Tower, I will definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing visit”
Reviews.Author: TMLK
Reviews.Content: I don't plan on staying here again. This hotel is a favorite for gambling and staying for a lot of my friends, including a few who go to Vegas several times a year. I was looking forward to checking this hotel out, but was very disappointed. The hotel decor and furnishings, facilities, etc., are all very nice and beautifully decorated. Our king room was spacious and the rooms had clearly been renovated/redecorated so were in great condition. The bathrooms were also beautiful, with granite-type vanity, tiling, and a well-designed shower. Bad things: 1. The room hadn't been cleaned thoroughly, there was a sticky spot from a glass or other food container on the bedside table. The rest of the room, however, appeared very clean. 2. The internet is $12/day, and the business center charges a RIP-OFF rate of $8 for some short period of use and $1/page for printing in bw. 3. We had a problem with checking in (2 rooms booked at same time, 1 came up 1 didn't). The service at time of check-in sucked, and I'm not being overly critical. We weren't mean, cranky, or difficult guests, and the check-in staff seemed to be interested in how quickly they could get us out of the way to check in the next person. The first person we talked to wouldn't call Hotels.com to try and help us solve the problem, referred us to the business center (where we got ripped off to try and get access to our reservation). The second person was curt and unhelpful when we asked for the hotel fax number, so Hotels.com could refax our confirmation. It took us almost 2 hours to check-in to our room, extra inconvenient with an energetic 4-year old waiting to run amok. Once again, a sterling example of how the difference between a four star and five star hotel is service service service. I'm sure Bally's doesn't care because they have ten million other gambling guests eager to stay at the hotel, but I don't plan on ever staying there again, and I will dis-recommend it to anyone. Why bother staying here when there a a million other good hotels on the Strip?

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: BigBobJoylove
Reviews.Content: Helpful , fast Check-In Room comfortable , slightly small but more than adequate Casino and Poker Room are excellent and very good atmosphere. The Hotel is linked by a walkway to the Paris which is useful. Breakfast Buffet excellent. OK so the location is good but this hotel has so much more to it than location and it is very affordable. Tip ... there is a free shuttle to the Rio , ideal if you are playing in the Poker , it runs every 30 mins.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in the middle of the Strip”
Reviews.Author: Ohioroadtripper
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Bally's December 6th through 9th 2007. I had never stayed there in my prior visits to Las Vegas, so I did not know what to expect. We found the stay pleasant and the rooms nice and comfortable. The housekeeping staff did a good job in keeping th room clean. All in all, it was a good stay in a very good location, with an indoor connection to the Paris Hotel and Casino (with the best breakfast buffet in Las Vegas) and a monorail stop in the rear of the hotel. I would recommend Bally's for a stay, it is not nearly as expensive as some of the newer Hotels in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!!”
Reviews.Author: jennwelch_99
Reviews.Content: Although I have stayed in many Vegas hotels, this was the best strip location yet. Bally's is centrally located across the fountains and offers a free shuttle to the Rio. We stayed in the "old" tower, but the room was spacious and offered a great view. The Bell staff was wonderful and extremely friendly. The bathroom had a full length mirror which was really nice. Very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value and Location Can't Be Beat”
Reviews.Author: Susan90
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Bally's the night of December 9, 2007. The check-in was quick and the agent was friendly. Stayed in North Tower and room was large and clean. Location is great. Food was so-so. Casino needs a facelift and it is very, very smokey with tight slots. Only complaint is the previous reviewer stated they got their room for the 9th for $59 while I paid $79. Interesting they charge $20 difference for room in same tower.

Reviews.Title: “$20 tip works”
Reviews.Author: dhammer53
Reviews.Content: Was able to book a $59 rate for December 9 - 14. That's a slow time in Las Vegas. Originally book Planet Hollywood at $79, but after a friend vouched for Bally's, I decided to save $100 (5 x $20 per night) and stay here. When I checked in, I gave the clerk a $20 and asked for a suite, or upgraded room. After reading lots on this topic, I decided to test it! Got an over-sized room (length and width) on a higher floor. I peaked in to another room, and verified that in fact, my room was larger. It was nicely decorated. Same for the hallways. The bathroom was bigger than a standard Hilton or Sheraton. Great water pressure in the shower! Have to agree with the previous poster about the noise. Even high up, you can hear everything. Sounded worse than an airport hotel, where you usually can't hear a thing. Old style casino vs the more modern ones ie Paris, MGM etc. Limited shopping. This isn't Caesars or the Bellagio folks. Hotel is centrally located. My room was in the north tower over-looking the Flamingo. Monorail station is at Bally's. Cost is $5 per ride, or $9 R/T. They're currently offering $9. all day. Good deal! Outdoor pool closed in the winter. You can use the Paris hotel pool now. Friendly staff. Security patrols hallways!! I like that. For the price paid, I'd go back.

Reviews.Title: “so rundown”
Reviews.Author: UkieMel
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the 17th floor and could hear the street noise like it was right outside our window. The first night we couldn't sleep because of the ambulance sirens, the second night we couldn't sleep because the walls are paper thin and you can hear conversations next door word for word. If you plan on staying out all night and sleeping during the day, this might be the place for you, otherwise avoid, avoid, avoid!!!

Reviews.Title: “great location, super room service”
Reviews.Author: khlm
Reviews.Content: First time to Vegas wow... Ballys is a nice hotel, clean rooms with a good bathroom and nice beds.The rooms are a bit dated and are in need of a bit of tlc,but for the price its very nice. Thanks again to all comments on trip advisor. The room service is lovely, huge servings.A few negative aspects a safe in the room is provided,at a cost . And the laundry costs are quite staggering when you stay for eight days as we did. Check in was great, very lucky as we only had to wait 10 minutes. The checkin staff were very helpful, and if you can ask for the North Tower Rooms the view is outstanding especially at night. The casino is busy so it EVERYWHERE in Vegas. The Indigo Lounge has fantastic entertainment. The pool is quite good for vegas, and is very clean. Taxis are very efficent so are the staff at Ballys. If I went back to Vegas I would quite happily stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: Quiltbee
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with our three night stay at Bally's. All of the people that we came in contact with, who worked for the hotel, were cordial and eager to please. There were four of us in the room and we needed more towels, etc. We made our request and upon returning to our room, found four of everything, including bathmats, soaps, shampoos, etc. We just giggled at the service. The hotel is very conveniently located to everything with fabulous elevated walkways that will take you across Las Vegas Blvd to the Bellagio and Caesar's Palace, and just a hallway away from the Paris. Our only complaint, which was true for all of the hotels, was the amount of smoke in the casinos. We are not gamblers and did not spend more than 15 minutes a day in the casinos, but honestly, found that that was our limit because of the smoke. We do recommend this hotel - we stayed on the sixth floor - a non-smoking floor and were very pleased with the cleanliness of the room. We noticed that the bathroom must have recently been remodeled because it was quite beautiful - granite everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “In the heart of the strip!”
Reviews.Author: daymeeyan
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is the location. Right in the middle of the strip. Not highly over priced since it is an older establishment. The rooms were indeed dated and could use some new carpets and furniture, but it served its purpose. We didn't go to vegas to be stuck in a room. Our room was located in the South Tower. I've heard these rooms are older than the North Tower, but are a bit roomier. The only part I didn't like was the long walk from the elevators to the room.

Reviews.Title: “great central L.V.Strip location”
Reviews.Author: silvergate
Reviews.Content: After a long absence and despite some negative reviews we booked three nights to attend a Celine Dion concert across the street at the Colosseum Theater. To say it right up front, we were pleasantly surprised and will stay here again at our next visit , We requested the North Tower on check-in and were given a 400 sq.ft room, larger than a suite in some other hotels on the Strip and big enough to have friends over for a party. The king size bed was very comfortable, and the room on the 7th floor was as quiet as a church, making for a good night of sleep. A shortcoming is the absence of a coffee/tea maker in the room, forcing one to trek to the lobby for a cup of eye-opener. Although the hotel was very busy, the elevator system is simply amazing, one rarely has to wait more than a few seconds for one to appear. Based on our observation, negative comments about wear and tear in rooms and common areas are not deserved, as Bally's can compare favorably to a number of other Strip hotels in this regard. Located in the center of the Strip, one can explore a number of casinos easily on foot. One block left or right takes in just about all. Being attached to the Paris Hotel with its myriad of shops and dining places is a plus, as is the ability to charge to your room in any of the five Harrah's casinos. A monorail connects the hotel with either end of the strip and the L.V. Convention center. All in all, considering the room rates of Bally's, this hotel offers a great deal for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Suite stay at Ballys”
Reviews.Author: Fishgirl1
Reviews.Content: We were bumped by Harrahs to Ballys and were bitter when we were told. All that changed when we got to Ballys - virtually no wait at check-in and the lovely lady at the desk felt sorry for us and gave us a suite. Well, it was fantastic. Won't rave about that here because I can't even tell you what it cost (fancy and free!), but I wanted to add my comments about the staff , who were great. And the atmosphere in the casino we found fabulous. we played Rapid Roulette and the dealers Arce(?) and Sharon were absolutely a blast - best fun we had in a casino in our week in Vegas. We also ate in the Big Kitchen buffet for dinner - didn't see the discount voucher in our check-in pack or we could have saved some money. But it was a very nice selction and all delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good”
Reviews.Author: mikep06
Reviews.Content: Bally's was a good choice for us, since it's a four star hotel, big rooms and right in the middle of the strip. At the check in we requested the North tower that we heard so much about and got a room on the 22nd floor, no problem. Evenb though when I called a few days before asking them for a North tower room they wanted to charge me twice as much, so make sure you just ask them during check in. The room itself was big and clean, a dated TV set and somewhat moderately used furniture, so I am not sure what exactly they remodeled. The bed was a double, not even a queen, but that was not a big problem and yes, it was comfy. The hotel is right in the middle of the strip, across from Bellagio and Ceaser's Palace, everyone was friendly and nice. I would come back again if the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Ok..nothing spectacular”
Reviews.Author: Giddy-up
Reviews.Content: Being 2 young 30 something males we both thought nothing out of the ordinary for this hotel. Ya the rooms were big and clean i guess. But nothing special. We did just use it to grab a shower and a place to crash. We had a room in the north tower facing Stratosphere. Nice view. Check in and out was a breeze. Got checked in at noon which surprised me. Great little tequila bar with a great happy hour. Beer and shot of tequila for $4.50 and free nachos and salsa. Very friendly staff all around. I did get to checkout the rooms at the Luxor and thought they were much nicer than Ballys however no view and down the strip aways . However gambled at Planet Hollywood because the atmosphere was so much better. Will probably stay there my next trip to Vegas. Had to check out the shopping and went to the outlet mall in the south cant remember the name of it but it was a waste of time. Overall cant wait to go back..

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Good Size Rooms but Motel Quality”
Reviews.Author: 2BusyMom
Reviews.Content: I stayed Nov 14th and 15th for a conference. I was impressed with the staff at this hotel, all that I met were friendly and helpful. The size of the room was very impressive. However, the decor was very dated. Also the linens and bedding and pillows were uncomfortable and reminded me of a MUCH less expensive property. Our rates were overpriced...at $169 a night. The hotel catered most of the meals for the conference and I was surprised at how good (quality and flavor) of the meals that were served there. Overall, I wouldn't come back unless another conference was there and it was the main hotel. It wasn't horrible, but nothing very home like or comforting about it. Also the Casino was extremely smokey (their HVAC system seems to need an upgrade).

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Ballys”
Reviews.Author: musuco
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Ballys during a slow period for hotels. We didn't book a room but walked in and got the lowest rate plus an AAA discount. So for around $63 we got a room (Sun and Mon nights) in the north tower. The room was huge, very clean and quiet. All of the staff was courteous and pleasant. We even found a coupon in the room for $5 off the buffet at the Flamingo (a sister hotel). The location was great and the price was right. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Customer Service all Around!”
Reviews.Author: webcentrik
Reviews.Content: Got a very nice room in the North Tower with a View of the Bellagio and the Water show. Room was very clean and very spacious. Hotel carpet in hallways and room was very clean and maid service was pretty great. No complaints at all with my stay at Ballys. The room was comped for a total of 3 days because of my Total rewards and i was treated like a 7 Star even though im only at the platinum level. Ballys Las Vegas has my approval.

Reviews.Title: “Ballys A OK”
Reviews.Author: Marjim
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Ballys in November 2007. We arrived at the check in and there was no wait at all which pleasantly surprised me after all I have read on TA. We asked for a room in the north tower and were given one no problem at all. Our room had a king size bed and was really quite spacious. We are clean freaks and the room met our standards easily. The bathroom was large and had a sitting room outside with a table and mirror for my wife to do her thing. The shower must have been using a water saver as there was just enough flow to be able to use it. The breakfast buffet had a large variety and we found it to be very tasty. The buffet servers we had were extremely helpful and polite. We didn't eat at the dinner buffet so i cannot comment on it. The only negative I had about the facility was the casino. I found it to be small and extemely smokey. We would definitely stay at Ballys again.

Reviews.Title: “brilliant ballys”
Reviews.Author: kate055
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights in ballys it is one of the older hotels but is a gem!! location rooms large and clean, stafff helpful and friendly and a lot cheaper than other hotels . las vegas is amazing but 4 nights is enough, to see all. There is a great irish pub in new york new york great music and craic !!! Food excellent in pf changs in planet holly wood also great food in Bills gambling casino steak house, would highly recommend Ballys !! Little mexican bar tender in pf changs great mine of in formation he was very friendly .

Reviews.Title: “Our Stay in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: turkeyroll
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Bally's 11/6-11/9. We upgraded our room to a premium and stayed in the North Tower. The room was big with marble in the bathroom. We ate once in the hotel at their breakfast buffet . It was a very good with lots of selections, including chicken & waffles and omelets made to order. Buffet price was $13.99 but had a $5 off coupon. A highly recommend seeing Cirque de Soleil's Mystere playing at Treasure Island. We got our tickets from a tickets4tonight kiosk on the strip. They offer half price tickets for most of the shows. Don't purchase tickets in Vegas without checking out tix4tonite as you can save lots of money. Overall Ballys was nice but we didn't spend much time there. My complaints are the pool was closed for the season and the hotel charges $22 to use the fitness center which is located in their spa.

Reviews.Title: “Ballly's is OK!”
Reviews.Author: TheTravelersFour
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we have stayed at Bally's. We enjoy the location. The rooms have been great and we are very particular when it comes to cleanliness and a comfortable bed. We have only stayed in the north tower. We will stay at Bally's again.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Wrong with the South Tower!”
Reviews.Author: H0ppers
Reviews.Content: Just back from my 4th time in Vegas. Have previously stayed at Mirage, NY NY, Stratosphere & Sahara. This time we chose Ballys due to it's price and location. We arrived at Ballys at 6pm as our flight was delayed. We'd booked 2 kings rooms in the North Tower. Due to our late arrival all they had were 2 twin rooms in the dreaded South Tower. We were tired so agreed to take them on the understanding that we would be moved to a king and a twin room in the North Tower the next afternoon which they were happy to arrange. We found our rooms easily and were surprised how big and clean they were. Two (UK) king sized beds in both rooms with a fantastic view of the Flamingo and Caesars. The next day we headed out onto the Strip for the day and were miles from Ballys when we should have been changing rooms. We agreed that we were happy with the rooms we'd got in the South Tower and decided to stay there. Inside Ballys we ate at the deli out the back of the property which was decent value as the sandwiches are massive. Also got my morning coffee from Nosh which is at the bottom of the South Tower lifts - overpriced but it was decent coffee and convenient. Gambled all over the strip - had great fun at Planet Hollywood & Stratosphere but ended up at Ballys in the Party Pit most evenings, as did our friends who were staying at Bellagio and Caesars. Didn't visit the pool but did see it and it looked clean and uncrowded. Drinks - the free drinks flowed in Planet Hollywood, Stratosphere and Ballys. Caesars was terrible, you could die of thirst in there! Got my nails done at the Regis Salon inside Ballys - $50 for a French manicure - still on and chip free 6 days later. The 4 of us staying at Ballys all agreed that we would stay there again - even in the South Tower! Friendly staff, dealers who help you out at the tables, fast drinks service, clean rooms - we had no complaints at all.

Reviews.Title: “One Word- GREAT”
Reviews.Author: oaklandparkmark
Reviews.Content: I will preface this review by saying I was kind of nervous about staying at Ballys due to some unflattering pictures and some mediocre reviews posted on this site. We went so far as to call about two weeks before we were due to arrive, to insist on a North Tower room. We were told it would be $20 extra per night. We figured since we were getting 5 nights for $200 to begin with that the extra $100 was not a big deal and would be worth not being unhappy with our accomodations. Check in was a literal breeze; I hadn't put my confirmation paper back in my carry-on and we already had keys to 2226 North Tower. ( No mention of the $20 extra per night ). North Tower elevators are divided into two banks; one set for floors 6 thru 16 and another set of eight elevators for floors 17 and higher.Elevators arrived quickly no matter what time of day or night. Elevator interiors were always clean. Vending and ice machines were located as you stepped out of the elevator area on the 22nd floor.It was a bit of a trek to 2226 from the elevator , but carpeting and hallway was a lot cleaner than others had reviewed on this site. Room keys always worked first time, every time. Very rarely did room service dishes sit in the hallways for more than a few hours. Room 2226 was a standard room; two queen beds; smoking. A full mirrored closet with at least 20 wooden hangars is to your right as you walk in. The bathroom is to your right, with a granite topped vanity and granite walled shower around the tub. There were always 4 washcloths,hand towels and bath towels stocked in bathroom each day . Complimentary toiletries were shampoo, conditioner,hand lotion and face soap by Gilchrest and Soames. The room itself was at least 20% larger than the standard rooms at TI and Planet Hollywood. Two beds with no nasty comforters, a total of seven pillows and an extra blanket in the closet. Beds were very comfortable. The room had a standard armoire with a television and six drawers. There was also a standard desk AND a granite topped work station desk. Besides the three straight backed chairs at the desks, there was also a large oversized chair by the window. The windows were a little on the dirty side and the view of 2226 was of another wing of the north tower to the east, Paris tower to the south, and if you put your face against the window, you could see a partial view of the Bellagio lake and fountains to the west.Otilia was our room person for the entire stay; I never even had to leave a note asking for kleenex or more shampoo. Our hallway was a little cold the first two days, but I never heard a word from other guests. The casino was laid out with slot machines all over and tables and poker room in the middle . The newer slots were located near the registration area and the North Tower elevators, while some of the older slots were basically relegated to the southern part of the casino. They also seemed to have quite a lot of video poker machines. The inner connecting hallway takes you to another whole casino at Paris without going outdoors. A quick note: Vouchers cashed out of machines at Ballys work in the machines at Paris and vice versa. Quite convenient. We did not avail ourselves of the pool or the spa facilities. On the way to the pool and the monorail are two affordable places to eat, in addition to the four restaurants located just off the casino floor. There is another affordable eatery, Nosh, near the South Tower elevators. In the connecting hallway to Paris , there are more affordable eating options. Directly across from registration there is a Java Coast coffee and snack stand.Our room did not have a coffeemaker, so I was quite the regular at Java Coast. There is a $3 a day charge to use the in room safe, which is located inside the aforementioned mirrored closet. We were double charged for the safe on one of our five days, but Joan removed the extra charge at checkout. In room television checkout is available , but we had accumulated and graduated to platinum Total Rewards this trip, so we checked out in person. We also had a day that the safe did not open, but it only took 6 to 7 minutes for someone to come and remedy that. Across Flamingo road ,next to Battista's Hole in the Wall Italian restaurant, is a convenience store that had liters of water for 79 cents!!! I believe the water available in the room was $4 a liter bottle. The five nights that we stayed were Mon 10/22 thru Sat 10/27. The hotel and casino were busier early in the week and quieter later in the week due to high volume conventions. Everywhere else we've ever stayed on a Mon thru Sat stay, has been quiet early in the week building to a crush on Friday night. Sign up for and use a players club card when you gamble, because a percentage of money gambled at Paris/Ballys/Flamingo/Harrahs/Caesars and Rio can be used towards room charges at check-out.We ended up getting all 5 nights for free due to this system and were never charged the quoted $20 upgrade charge for the North Tower. All in all I would give this stay a solid B+, only missing an A, because there is not a 24 hour restaurant in Ballys proper ( there is a 24 hour restaurant in Paris ) and the common area bathrooms were a little worn for wear.The staff from checkin through checkout were friendly and accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “What a nice experience”
Reviews.Author: biusas
Reviews.Content: My wife and I are approaching retirement age (70 & 64), and found that our 5 night stay in October at Bally's was a perfect fit. Check in was easy and fast at 4:00 PM on a Sunday. Our request for a non-smoking two bed room with a strip view (although only partial) was met, and we found ourselves checking into a spacious and clean room on the 20th floor. We have never stayed in a quieter room, which was a relief from the craziness of the casino. Not a peep from neighbors or the corridor. And contrary to what we were told when we booked, there was indeed a coffee maker in the room. The staff without exception was pleasant and friendly, including valet attendants, dealers, waiters, etc. The location is tops, and I don't think can be beaten on the Strip. The price was fair ($550 for 5 nights before taxes). The only cons were minor: no grab bar in the tub/shower, very dirty windows impeding the great view, and tight comps in the casino. Idon't think you can go wrong at Bally's. Steve S., Massachusetts

Reviews.Title: “Bally's was average”
Reviews.Author: JWC1978
Reviews.Content: A group of friends and I stayed at Bally's Las Vegas for a bachelor party. Originally, we made reservations at Caesars but the hotel was overbooked upon arrival because of a convention that was in-town. In lieu, the staff offered us free accommodations across the street at Bally's [another Harrah's property]. In the beginning things did not start off well. We originally requested the premium palace tower room at Caesars. The staff promised us "comparable or better" if we moved to Bally's. Of course, when we arrived at Bally's they had two regular guest rooms waiting for eight guys. When we informed the desk clerk at Bally’s what Caesars had promised she looked at us like we were crazy people visiting from MARS. To add insult to injury, the Bally's desk clerk called the front desk at Caesars to confirm whether or not what we were saying was true. The clerk who had helped us at Caesars must have suffered a memory lapse [in the thirty minutes that had passed] because Bally’s was not going to honor the promise. As a compromise the Bally’s clerk offered us a similar room at a 50% room rate. After an hour of arguing we finally wore them down to give us the room they originally promised. Thank god because after seeing their premium room I would have been extremely upset to pay what they were asking given the dated motif. Once we got settled things got better and overall the stay was pleasant. Although Bally’s Las Vegas would not be in my top pick of places to stay the accommodations were very clean and the view from the room was terrific. If you’re a pool person this is not the place for you. The pool at Bally’s is a nice place to grab a cocktail and sit in the sun for a while if you want to escape the tables. At night the floor seemed refined for older players and the sports book was okay. In the evening we spent more time at the Hard Rock than Bally’s which hosts a younger and more energetic clientele. This was my second stay at Bally’s so I don’t mind staying there but would prefer elsewhere. I would compare Bally’s to a larger version of their Joliet Casino Hotel for those who have been.

Reviews.Title: “Resistance is Futile!”
Reviews.Author: hootwemb
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights here recently and everything was excellent. We were upgraded at check-in to a jr. suite in the South Tower on a non-smoking floor. The room was huge and clean. Comfy bed. Great bath amenities and plenty of towels--usually have to call about not enough towels, but not at Bally's! The staff that we talked to was very friendly and helpful each time. It was very windy during our stay and the windows made quite a rattle at night. Not much of a view when staying in the South Tower, which doesn't really matter in Vegas. We picked this hotel over others for its mid-Strip location and overall good reviews in Frommer's and on Trip Advisor. We weren't disappointed! We would stay here again and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: sitemaster
Reviews.Content: saw mixed reviews before going, but we found Ballys to be a great hotel. Had a north tower room (9th flloor). We asked at reception for this and they were very helpful. No view to speak of, but who cares! We had far better things to do than look out of the window. Location could not be better. We were able to turn left out of the hotel and visit Luxor, New York, New York etc, or turn right and visit Treasure Island, The Venetian etc. Directly opposite the Bellagio. Great! My husband went to Las Vegas particularly for the rides on top of the Stratosphere and he went on all three. He said they were brilliant! Also did a helicopter tour over the Grand Canyon, with Sundance helicopters. Booked this at our hotel. Do not miss this experience! Ballys had a great band on in the indigo loung most nighst. We really enjoyed this. All in all a great holiday!

Reviews.Title: “Nice at Balley's”
Reviews.Author: familytravelsguy
Reviews.Content: Good, clean hotel. Rooms are nicely furnished and up to date. The entire place has a very modern decor and friendly, fast service. Location is at ok, but not perfect place on Vegas strip. Would go back if price was right, but would rather stay at the Mirage because of other benefits, location, and more things to see and do in and around the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “BALLY'S is alright!”
Reviews.Author: BoltonInxtc
Reviews.Content: For those of you staying at Bally's: Very clean and very friendly personnel. Enjoyed everything; for those of you who love food, visit Bellagio for buffet at breakfast and night; I went to Wynn's for breakfast and it was terrible! Also to eat really good food without spending a fortune, go to Caesar's and eat at Cheesecake Factory; good prices and awesome food. As for you gamblers; take it from me; all the $1.00 machines were empty and now I see why. No one wins! I heard one jackpot go off in 4 days; One cent machines are popular at least. Even the 25 cent machines were not doing well. Not a lot of winners anywhere. Anyway have a great time when you go; just don't expect to win!

Reviews.Title: “Ballys was wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Sumotartan
Reviews.Content: Had 2 nights in Ballys during the week. Got a fantastic deal of $60 per night by calling them direct on the same day. Had non smoking room on the 10th floor and could not be any less happier with the size and facilities. Ballys boasts one of the biggest standard rooms on the Strip and I ha ve to agree. Had a massive twin room - beds were king sized absolutely brilliant. Would recommend Ballys s it is central strip and also hs a a monorail station making it a great location

Reviews.Title: “Great just grea!!”
Reviews.Author: joerad
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Bally's for 2 nights at the end of weeks tour. I loved everything about it. Our check in was painless, we were allocated a room straight away (even though we were early). After reading some of the Trip Advisor reviews, I specifically booked a "North Tower" room and we were not disappointed. It was huge, clean, modern, had good view and a great bed. The hotel has a whole was extremely clean. It had 2 great soul groups playing in the bar area and I didn't feel out of place having a go on the slots. The location was as central as you can get. It is attached to "Paris" which has a great looking interior and lots of shops and restaurants. Everything was within walking distance for us. We didn't bother with the monorail (which is attached to the hotel and runs along the strip), as it is quite a walk to get to and drops of at the back of the other hotels. Having said that I am sure for the less mobile it would be ideal. We booked for the famous "Sterling Brunch" on Sunday and although a little extravagant for a buffet, I can't help but recommend it. I will stay here again, hopefully for a bit longer next time.

Reviews.Title: “what's not to like ?”
Reviews.Author: messier11
Reviews.Content: my wife and i stayed at ballys from october 9 thru october 13. this was our third stay at ballys always a good time with a great location. car rental is available in the main lobby . our room in thenorth tower was spacious and very clean. the maid service was exceptional.the staff in general were very friendly and helpful. the check in and out, was uneventful,easy in-easy out . the only negative was a couple of bartenders, not all, were not that pleasant!!! resturants were good but the drinks a little pricey. slots were very tight!!!! overall another great time...

Reviews.Title: “A great time but....”
Reviews.Author: Sandy032
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed in Balley's from Oct 7 to 11. We went to Las Vegas for our nephew's wedding and our family were all staying in this hotel. We arrived at 6:00 PM to be told by a crabby lady at the front desk that they could not honour our request for a non smoking room in the North tower where everyone else was. She put us in a smoking room which was just not acceptable for a lung cancer survivor. We were moved to another room that at least was non smoking but only one bed with cot. After two days and continuous requests, a nice man named Vern moved us to the room that was requested at check in. We enjoyed the hotel and the convenience of the location and found the food to be good but expensive. We loved the Le Village Buffet in the Paris hotel. I have been to Vegas many, many times and loved every minute of it but everyone in our party found the smoking atmosphere so overwhelming that it made it uncomfortable. I realize that smoking goes with gambling and went there knowing that but Balley's seems worse than the bigger hotels. Perhaps it's time the Vegas hotels catered a little more to the non smoker. The highlight of the trip was seeing Celine Dion.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: loseapoint
Reviews.Content: This hotel gets mixed reviews but I have to say I was very impressed with it. There was no delay at check-in and our room (high up in the North Tower,facing the strip NB I had noted this was the best place to be from a previous reviewer, so I asked for - and got - this spec at check-in) was fabulous. The room had recently been renovated so all the fixtures and fittings were in pristine order. We also liked the fact that we could take advantage of our stay there to enjoy facilities of other hotels in the group. The hotel's location is ideal - what more would you want for a stay in Vegas?

Reviews.Title: “Nice, decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: TacoHead
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Bally's for 5 days last September. Overall, it is a nice, decent hotel. Better than the Imperial Palace's, but not as luxurious as a Mandalay Bay. Some pros and cons that I experienced about staying at Bally's: Housekeeping will bring you coffee if you call them, which is nice. Maids did a good job cleaning our rooms. Pool wasn't too crowded, and allowed me to cool off and rest my tired feet for a few minutes. Hotel room windows were very dirty, which was a bit annoying. This also made taking decent photos from them impossible. We asked for and were given rooms in the North Tower. They are nice and clean. Nothing to get excited about, but good enough. Strange TV lineup in the hotel room. Several were cable channels from China, most of which did not have any English subtitles, so I had no idea what was going on. Medium-sized tube TV with a channel picture quality that ranged from decent to poor. None were razor sharp. Casino staff and cocktail waitresses were very friendly. Elevators ran fast and smoothly. It was a loooooong walk from my hotel room to the Monorail Station and the pool. Good thing I'm in decent shape and had new gym shoes. Plenty of restaurants and small shops to buy snacks or supplies. As usual in Las Vegas, Internet kiosks are overpriced. Web browsing speed not as fast as I would have liked. Tunnel connecting Bally's with Paris Hotel was neat and convenient. The Strip entrance to Bally's has a very long escalator you can use to enter the casino, which is great for tired feet. As dozens have already mentioned, Bally's central Strip location is very nice and handy.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for the Strip”
Reviews.Author: nunyakhOklahoma
Reviews.Content: This is the first time we've stayed on the Las Vegas Strip in about four trips. We chose Bally's based on it's closeness to Ceasar's as we had a wedding to attend. The rooms were clean and adequate but the view out our window at night was awesome. We were looking at the Eiffel Tower at the Paris, and further down the Strip. Beautiful at night. Gone, though, are the cheap breakfast buffets and other meal deals. The Margarita Bar was a good place for a really tasty margarita and some great nachos. Two drinks and an order of nachos was $32.00 - not just a drop in the bucket. Drink service while gaming isn't nearly as frequent as it used to be and the cost of a drink at the bar has become exorbitant. The bands they booked were really entertaining - music from the 50's through current. We thoroughly enjoyed them. We will likely try another spot the next go round. We're most fond of the downtown area, though. Things are more reasonably priced (or were last time we went) and I never tire of the Freemont Street Experience. Lot's of casinos in easy walking distance down there as well.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Aimster77
Reviews.Content: Bally's is great! First of all, it is incredibly convenient. You can walk over to Paris or Caesars in a jiff. They also have a shuttle that runs to Rio. If you do need to catch a cab it is fairly cheap to get almost anywhere. The rooms were very clean and large. The elevators are clean, smooth and efficient. The staff is friendly. They have a ton of restaurants inside the hotel in all different price ranges. Our floor had an ice machine that worked (you'd be suprised how many hotels don't) and a snack machine with tons of choices. I didn't gamble too much at the hotel, but my travel companions were complanining that there wasn't enough nickel machines. If you are unable to park in the valet (our truck is too tall), the parking lot is a little shabby. All in all, it was a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasanly surprised with Bally's”
Reviews.Author: handlebar7
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Bally's for four nights Sept. 18 to 22nd. Arrived around noon checked in at Bally's requested North Tower room by reading this board, received room wtih Coffee pot, said this was supposed to be a Diamond room, she told us the only difference with delux room. & Diamond was the coffee pot. Room was a very good size, very clean and maid service was good. View was looking at Bill's, part of Ceasurs. Coffee pot came in handy in the morning, didn't have to run downstairs. The only little problem was the distance to the pool area, but glad we went there because didn't know there was a food court and sports bar down on that level. I found all the staff to be very friendly and helpful. Won a little bit at the casino, to me a casino is a casino, they all are about the same, some bigger some smaller, they all take my money the same lol. We would stay there again, but we like trying different proberties.

Reviews.Title: “Good but disappointed”
Reviews.Author: area1tx
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival we checked in at the airport, and that was a big mistake. We booked our vacation in May for travel in September and had requested the North tower. We were immediately told that there were no rooms available. I explained to the clerk that we made our reservations in May and could not understand why our request was not being honored. I also asked what was the point of the request if they were going to overlook it. She said that the only rooms available were in the south tower and smoking. We explained we requested a non-smoking, double bed room but it did not seem to phase her, and did not offer an upgrade to compensate us. We ended up taking a room on the south tower and it was fine, although, I can't understand why the furniture was so old. I was angry at their apathy but made the decision that this would not ruin our vacation. We were overall content with the room but I don't know if I would chose this property again. The location is great with easy access to eveything, but we did not appreciate their poor service.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, good service, good location, but boring”
Reviews.Author: TXVegasgirl
Reviews.Content: We checked in 9/16 around 11pm, I asked for the North Tower after hearing that the rooms are nicer in the North Tower. The room was very large and very clean, except for the carpet, which looked filthy. Check-in service was great, the maid was great, the rooms were pretty quiet. The bed was not very comfortable and the pillows were awful. The location is in the center of everything, which is nice. The main things that will keep me from going back is that I don't like the casino there. Also at night, the casino seemed to be full of hookers. There wasn't a fun vibe, it was more for an older, quiet crowd.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed our stay-great room!”
Reviews.Author: bettyc38
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed 4 nights and really enjoyed our stay. I had checked other reviews of this hotel and so many would suggest that we ask for a room in the north tower. We arrived around 08:30 pm and check in was a breeze. I asked if there were any rooms available in the north tower and lucky for us they had some available. We were not charged any difference in price (our room was comped). The room was very nice, clean and very big in size. Our room faced the side of Bills hotel and casino and the Flamingo. The buffet was ok-not great. I was switched to diamond level during our stay and the buffet seemed to be much better then. They have a special area diamond level guest eat in and you are offered certain foods that are not on the buffet at the time, such as steamed crab. We usually stay at the Bellagio (not comped) which is great place, but we have already decided to stay at Bally's again for our next trip. It is in a great location, easy to get to other casinos and a tram station is located there.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Location”
Reviews.Author: ExCoggs
Reviews.Content: Absolutely brilliant value for money! A great location, smack bang in the middle of the strip. My advice is not to stay anyway else, as you will be paying over the odds. The room was spacious, with a super king size bed, sofa, desks, TV, bath and shower. We stayed on the 7th floor. We got the towers mixed up at check in - we had read that we should ask for the south tower, as we should get a view of the Bellagio and the rooms were more modern, but we asked for the north tower by mistake. However, the room was lovely. We had a view of the Wynn and the Stratosphere. Only criticism is that the windows outside had not been cleaned and were very dirty. The couple we went with were across the corridor from us, and hence had a view of the back of the Paris hotel - not brilliant, but for the amount of time spent in the room (ie sleeping and therefore minimal in Sin City!) it wasn't too bad. All the themed hotels are within walking distance of Bally's (although you may be too tired to walk back!!) The shape of Bally's isn't too confusing unlike the big hotels on the tripod basis. Go through the front entrance, through the casino and the lifts to the north tower are on the left. We had a breakfast buffet once, and it was great with tremendous choice. The pool area was clean and tidy, with ample towels and loungers for everyone. The monorail was great for getting about also. Will definitely be staying here again, as it gives everything you need in Vegas, in a fabulous location.

Reviews.Title: “Probably a bit better than you expect.”
Reviews.Author: Talldarkhandsomest
Reviews.Content: I go to Vegas about 8 times per year so I have seen quite a bit of what this adult playground has to offer. The reviews are a bit mixed on this site so here's my two cents geared for making an informed choice: This property is nicer aesthetically than Rio, Harrahs, and Flamingo--which are also owned by the giant Harrah's Entertainment. It is way nicer and cleaner than many of the other vegas strip casinos that cater to budget travelers. Conversely, it is a very small step behind Treasure Island. The casino itself is large and clean and most of the restaurants are above average in decor. You do definitely want a North Tower room as these have all been renovated. I have never stayed in the South tower. The biggest drawback of this resort is the pool area--very dated and way behind the majority of glitzy vegas pools. So obviously, this isn't an issue at all in the winter months but could be annoying in the summer. The gym is a bit small but adequate. The property has a very large sportsbook with lots of TV's that is located adjacent to the food court so is very popular during football season. What are the best things about Bally's? I'm surprised that I have never heard anyone say this on this site, but staying at Bally's is pretty much like staying at TWO hotels! This is because there is a large hallway off the main casino floor that connects you directly into the Paris Hotel which is very ritzy and upscale. Since both resorts are owned by Harrah's, you can go eat in Paris and have it charged to your room at Bally's. When it's 110 degrees outside or there is a thunderstorm outside you have no idea how convenient this connecting hallway is! The other great things are the rooms in the North Tower which are about 450 sq. feet (larger than average) They are comfortable and clean and the resort usually offers rates that are about 20-30% cheaper than other Strip resorts. I do not think that the ambiance of this resort, especially when combined with the usage of Paris, deserves an average 3 star rating; I would say it's just a tad shy of 4 stars because the South Tower hasn't been renovated and the pool. If the Bally's restaurants don't meet your expectations simply walk a couple hundred yards, indoors, and you will have all the glitz and glamour of Paris--Mon Ami Gabi, The Eiffel Tower Restaurant (amazing!) and some terrific cafe's and quaint spots. Paris has a great feel to it because it is much smaller than many mega hotels--so it feels cozy and not overwhelming--it lends itself to a feeling of romance. There is a great spot located right in the hallway between the two resorts that is a "dueling piano bar". They serve champagne and the talented pianists take requests from the audience--it's very fun and a great meeting spot or place to kill a couple hours in the evening or after dinner perhaps. Bally's has a terrific center of the strip location; very close to Bellagio and Caesar's Palace. Have fun on your trip and feel free to contact me for more tips. :)

Reviews.Title: “Good But Not Great”
Reviews.Author: scsokrboi
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Bally's on a Wednesday night at 11:30pm. The hotel lobby was empty and the Diamond check-in was closed. The staff behind the desk seemed "bothered" that we were there checking in so late. We were also told that we had an upgraded room. The room turned out to be a regular king bed room facing Bill's (no upgrade in my book). The decor in the lobby and the casino is bland and boring - a theme which Bally's carries throughout the rest of the hotel. Our room was average size with comfortable beds and the regular lotions, soaps and shampoos in the bathroom. I was suprised at how nice the pool area was: although it is REALLY far away from the hotel. There is a super-giant "hot tub" next to the pool, which really looks like an old kiddie pool with some luke warm water. The pool bar was very nice (drink prices were high as usual). You get to see the monorail upclose - as it passes almost right over the main pool area. There were quite a few folks in the 60+ range - I think that this must be who Bally's really appeals to. Entering Bally's from LV Blvd. is a waste of time - they have this double football field length people mover that takes 10 minutes to ride before you get to the hotel - enter fom the side it is much faster. The location is great - as it is in the middle of everything on the strip. The Jubilee is a Vegas tradition that you have to see once. It has been running for 25 years and is a huge production of dancing, singing and acrobatics. The Diamond lounge at Bally's is closed, but the Paris casino's lounge is right down the corridor and is a great lounge. Also check out Napoleon's dueling pianos down that hallway. It is free to come in and the entertainment is great. Finally, I would just say that we found Bally's very average in every way except location. I would only stay here if the rooms were cheaper than any nearby hotels or your rooms were comped.

Reviews.Title: “Okay For the Price, Wouldn't Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: tk1783
Reviews.Content: Went to Vegas with a group July 18th-23rd. We stayed at Bally's because others in our party were staying there for a business convention. When you stay here--what you get is a clean large room with a central location--the casino is small but is also less crowded than some of the other more popular casinos. The Big Kitchen Buffet was mediocre but we didn't pay for it--we had two free passes. Basically, this hotel cater to an older crowd and doesn't really have a theme or anything interesting about it. When I go to Vegas again, I will be staying somewhere else. Service was great, had a massage which was okay. Do go see O at the Bellagio--it was fantastic and worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “bally's”
Reviews.Author: sillyguy
Reviews.Content: stayed in the North tower, nice room for the price. Hotel is in a great location, service is okay, for the average person it is fine

Reviews.Title: “Loving South Tower views from Ballys”
Reviews.Author: CJayDJ
Reviews.Content: We stayed in South Tower which is slightly older decor than the North Tower apparently (but it was still great) but it had fantastic views of the strip - absolutely fantastic. The room was a brilliant size and very quiet and clean. Absolutely no complaints about Ballys. The location is very central to the main part of the strip - beside a huge shopping mall and opposite another main hotel with great shopping. There is also a CAT stop right at the bottom of the elevator. The breakfast buffet was also of good quality. Loved this hotel - will definately stay again. We booked through Expedia and got a fantastic rate.

Reviews.Title: “No customer Service!”
Reviews.Author: Trippers112202
Reviews.Content: We checked in at the airport hotel check-in and were offered an upgrade to a suite. We were given several to choose from, and in the end, just asked for the best non-smoking view room they had available. We received our room keys and confirmed that the suite was non-smoking. We arrived at the hotel to find a smoking suite (it was also dirty). We went downstairs to let them know we had received a smoking suite by mistake and asked to be moved to a non-smoking room. We were told that even though they did have suites available, they were not giving any out, but instead, saving them for tournament players who might be interested in upgrading upon check-in. We explained that our original reservation was for a non-smoking room and that we had asked for same at the airport. Still nothing. We asked for a manager who said he had suites available, but that he was not making any available to the general public. He said that the airport should not have been offering suites and that he had no obligation to offer us one of his non-smoking suites. We then asked to be given a non-smoking standard room instead. We were told that the additional charges for the suite would be reversed immediately. In checking our "express" check-out bill, the additional suite charges remained. We had to stand in line for what seemed like forever on a Sunday to have the charges removed. Also, food trays remained in the hallway throughout our 4 day visit. Even when calls were placed to the front desk to have the days old trays removed (left by prior guests, not us) we were met with rude, short answers. When some of the trays were removed, dirty silverware was left behind stuck to the carpet! And not all of the trays were removed - only the one that was called about was taken away! So we got to walk through halls to and from our room smelling old food. Maybe the days are gone where hotels had to please you to retain your business. We won't be staying at Ballys again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, poor customer service”
Reviews.Author: Scooter1970
Reviews.Content: I won't get into a lengthy write-up on this hotel, but will point out what was obvious to me. We were lucky enough to get a suite in the North tower... very clean, spacious - but other than that nothing over the top. The hotel is very big, as most are in Vegas. The situation is fantastic - right in the middle of the strip and close to everything. About the only drawback to this hotel was the customer service. In a city where a tip goes a long way, they sure don't work for it. The employees working the desks seemed crabby and that it was a big bother to check you in or check you out. Guess they don't care if people come back... lol. Back to the brighter things... the hotel was always clean, there are alot of amenities and the pool looked like a nice place to cool off from the heat. Couple of tips: the "$20 between your ID and reservation" trick worked for us... got us an upgrade to a suite. If you want to get served quick free drinks, plunk a couple of bucks into one of the machines located right on the bar - the bartenders are right there (some said you had to put in a minimum of $10 to get the drink, but we never ran into this problem). All in all... a pretty good 4 nights in the town that never sleeps.

Reviews.Title: “Bally's was great”
Reviews.Author: lilsorrel
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Bally's from August 18-22nd. I have stayed at Flamingo and Paris in the past. This was my wife's first trip to Vegas. We chose Bally's because of the deal I received through TR. To sum it all up we had a great stay at Bally's. The room was clean, no wait for the elevators, and the fact that it was connected to Paris is great. We spent just as much time at Paris as we did at Bally's. We would stay at Bally's again, and recommend it to anyone who is looking for a good price, clean room, and great location.

Reviews.Title: “Another good stay at Ballys”
Reviews.Author: oaklay18
Reviews.Content: Been both with a group of friends and went back with my boyfriend. Great stay both times. Hotel: This is a nice hotel. Vegas has a lot of offer as far as accomadations. For the money AND location you will not find anything better. This is right in the center of the strip and the rooms are HUGE. Comfortably fit me and a group of friends and was perfect when it was just me and my bf. Recent upgrades to the hotel only make it better. Ask for a room facing Belagio fountains. Pool: Decent pool. Nice to lay out by. Not the best I've been to far from the worst. Great food, shopping, shows and nightlife. Tons to do. Unless I win lots and lots of money gambling I'll be staying at Bally's in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Bally's No Customer Focus”
Reviews.Author: dek76
Reviews.Content: We reserved a “king” room, upon check-in we were told no king rooms were available only queens were available. When we arrived to our room - 846A, it smelled smoky and very musty and had a queen bed that came out from the wall. The room had loud outside motor noise and the mattress was so hard we knew we would not have a good nights rest in this room so we called down to the front desk to see how long it would be if we waited to get a “king” room. The front desk agent told us we have king rooms and told us to meet Security at our new room – 1286. We then waited 20 minutes and no security guard came. I then searched for a house phone and called the Operator to find out when security would be coming – they then transferred me to Security. Security told me they knew nothing about meeting anyone at our room. I gave Security my name and I was told I was not on the room and he was argumentative with me. He said he would send Security to Room 1286 and my husband would have to show ID since I was not on the room. Security then let us in our room 30 minutes after check-in.
