We wanted to use the safe in the room but could not read the instructions on the safe as the instructions were worn off. The bedspread was very old and worn out looking. Not what we expected at Bally’s. When we went to the front desk to get our new key, we asked that I be put on the room since Security said I was not. The front desk girl said I was in fact already on the room and the person I talked to in Security must have been "new". We wanted to let the manager on duty know about the experience we were having at our stay at Bally’s and talked to Crystal - the manager on duty. She basically did not care about our experience at Bally’s and did not have answers as to why we had to wait for Security that was never called or why Security was arguing with me that I was not on the room or why we were told no king rooms when in fact you had king rooms. To top off our experience at Bally’s, upon check out we were waiting behind 3 people. The front desk agent was saying over and over for us all to go into the rope area and wait instead of standing where we were. By the time we got into the rope area like cattle - we were standing in the same place we were when we started. I think if it is mandatory that you wait in the rope area even if the line is short you should put up signs saying so. The agent that checked us out asked how our stay was and we told her our stay at Bally’s should have been better, but she did not appear to care. I sent a letter to Marilyn Winn - President of Bally's to make here aware of what we experienced. We received a reply back to try them again... no real sorry or explanation.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel In A Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Kalvnhobbz
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at Bally's from 8/31 to 9/2. My room was in the North Tower and was HUGE!!!! The room itself is very non-nondescript and won't offend anyone who stays there. It suited my purposes just fine. Actually it was a little overkill for my stay since it was only 2 days. It was the Deluxe room and truth be told, I probably could have gotten a way with a Classic room. I did find that the walls are very thin especially if you have an adjoining room. I didn't spend much time in the room, but when I was there, I heard the people next door living it up. I wasn't upset or anything, it just made me a little jealous that they were having more fun than me!!! Overall, it's a nice place to stay. I'm just an average traveler who wanted a nice place to throw my bags and get some sleep after venturing through Vegas. I'd recommend Bally's to anyone needing a big room and is on a budget. The place really isn't geared toward very demanding visitors who are fortunate enough to spend over 500 bucks a night on a room and spend about 2 waking hours in the room. I say spend that money on drinking, shopping, shows or God forbid...gambling.

Reviews.Title: “Old Vegas with Some Hope for the Future”
Reviews.Author: Fiveoclockcaptain
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights at Bally's as part of a conference. The hotel is extremely well located just back from the Strip and connected by walkways and sidewalks to most of the major casinos (there is also a shuttle to Rio). Check in is the normal slow Vegas shuffle whenever it's a busy weekend. The staff were cheerful and made the best of the situation. I got a room in the North Tower, which I think is preferable as being a little quieter, but I don't think anyone should lose sleep over which tower they are in (there are two). The room decor was quite nice and modern with a very comfortable bed and good quality furnishings. The bath was fine with a good shower set up. The big complaint here was the fact that although this was a non-smoking room on the non-smoking floor, it clearer had been occupied many times by smokers - not only smoke but also the lingering mask of the chemicals used to mask the smoke. I ate at the Steakhouse in the hotel and the service was surprisingly good, very good in a European smother the customer like way. I felt a little like a rat packer in the dark dining room getting yes sirred and not a problem sirred all night. The food was much better than expected. I had the shrimp cocktail, beefsteak salad and petit filet - all prepared and served perfectly. I'd give the restaurant a solid 4 star rating, not fancy 5 star, but definitely worth looking at as in casino restaurants go - especially with it's old Vegas feel and charm, would be good for a romantic tryst in a booth too. The coffee bar in the lobby was OK, always 30 deep people in line. The casino itself is not as large or flashy as most in Vegas but has its own special feel. I would probably not stay at Bally's if I could stay at Mirage, Treasure Island or Paris for a comparable price (based on location) or if not concerned with price would have preferred to have stayed at Mandalay/Hotel or Bellagio. I would not use Bally's for a guy/gals weekend base as it is really not as hip or in the mainstream as the other hotels close to it.

Reviews.Title: “So, so experience”
Reviews.Author: NJdudette
Reviews.Content: I was a bit disappointed by this hotel. The outside appearance of this hotel is a bit worn and in my opinion is in need of an overhaul. I did think the staff was more than helpful and went out of their way to welcome me to their hotel; it was simply the property itself I wasn’t wowed by. I was waited on fairly quickly at Bally’s since I’m a Platinum member and for grins I requested a room upgrade. I was told a spa suite (North Tower room #833) was available for an extra $100/night charge – I quickly went for it. What I didn’t realize was that I would be charged $100/night for each of my two comped nights and an additional $100 for the night I was already paying for ($85 + $100) – my stupid mistake so I really can’t complain too much. The room was decorated nicely and a good size for one or two people. The first problem I noticed was the room location – I was on the eighth floor and just above Flamingo Road – yup, lots of traffic all night long. I’m a rather heavy sleeper so I figured it wouldn’t bother me - I was wrong. I should have requested room change, but I was only staying for three nights and didn’t want to go through the hassle of re-packing and then un-packing again. In addition, I discovered on the last night that the spa didn’t work – I should have said something upon check-out, but for whatever reason I chose not to - mistake number three. Oh yes, the shower stall had an awful smell and there was mold in each of the corners. I sprayed Febreeze and tried airing the shower out, but all I managed to do was stink up the rest of the room. The safe also didn’t work and when I called down to the front desk to have someone look at it they said I needed to wait for maintenance, I had plans and couldn’t wait so I told them I’d call back. I never got around to calling them back. All and all the room was ok, but I thought it was a tad bit beat up. I thought the North Tower was recently upgraded? It’s highly unlikely I’d stay there again as I like a few of the other Harrah properties a lot more. The pool was a bit of a walk from the elevators, but I could always use some exercise <LOL>. Make no mistake, you will not visit Bally’s for their pool scene, it’s non-existent, but large enough to hang for a couple of hours and relax. The pool itself is in bad shape, it’s in serious need of general maintenance. The pool decking is faded and in need of painting and the pool itself is somewhat of a hazard. The paint around the edges has chipped/worn away in certain areas where people could cut themselves or stub a toe. The hand railings were very loose/wobbly and I was nervous that one of the kids would get hurt while swinging/hanging on it (hence the reason it’s wobbly). Many of the chairs were broken and it became irritating as the day went on and the pool became more crowded – searching for a working chair was a pain in the butt to put it mildly. Like most pools the drink prices were exorbitant and there were only two waitresses on staff, although, I think they did a fairly good job keeping everyone hydrated. Harrah’s can do much better with this pool area. Bally’s version of the infamous Vegas buffet: Big Kitchen Buffet is nothing to rave about. In many ways it reminded me of the buffet at the Flamingo. Not so much in appearance as in food choices. The food wasn’t bad by any means, just nothing to write home about. The waitstaff was extremely friendly and very attentive to my needs. If I were there again I’d probably hit them up for breakfast, but skip any other meals.

Reviews.Title: “Bally's LV - Great Deal, Big Clean Room, Nice Hotel, Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: jcarrol4
Reviews.Content: My wife and I returned from our first Vegas vacation at Bally's a week ago with no complaints. We requested and received a room in the North Tower. We did have to wait a few hours for a room with a king bed (two queens were available right away), but this wasn't an issue. We checked our bags with the bell hop and Bally's and Paris provide lots to do to pass the time. The room itself was spacious and clean but not much of a view (not a big deal for us). The AC worked well but did have to be turned real low for the room to stay cool. Room service provided fresh towels, soap, and shampoo everyday. The pool was OK, nothing special but not overly crowded. The hotel's location was great, right in the middle of the strip directly across from the Bellagio. A small casino right next door had $5 Blackjack which was great also. I definitely plan on returning soon.

Reviews.Title: “Bally's is just O.K.”
Reviews.Author: MarianLing
Reviews.Content: Bally's Hotel north tower has recently been renovated but it still looks like it is in the sixties or seventies. This room was assigned to me by someone in the Diamond Registration area, apparently these are the nicest room available for Diamond players. The beds are the worse I have slept on since my first visit to Vegas in 1984. The Casino is pretty nice and they have a great variety of slot machines. In all my stay was o.k.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome girlfriend getaway!”
Reviews.Author: Slavco
Reviews.Content: First of all let me begin by thanking all reviewers from this site for making my stay in Las Vegas exceptional. I stayed at the Bally's from 8/23 to 8/26. I met my girlfriend at the airport since we both flew from different cities, and 2 friends of mine had already checked in that same day at the Bally's. The first thing that I asked him is "what tower did you get?" and he said "South" and he also said that he requested that I'd be given a room in the same floor as they. After reading all the reviews of the feared south tower I freaked out, because I did a lot of research about both towers and even printed photos of both towers to show the staff when I'd check in. I arrived at the airport at aorund 6 pm and didn't find the "Airport Check-in" that I read so much about, so I just decided to go straight to the hotel and do it there. I got there, and there is a huge line of people checking in, so I freaked out a little because it was already late and I didn't want to lose anymore time. Staff was so efficient that I was in line roughly 10 minutes. When I was checking in, the lady told me that my friend requested that I'd get my room in the same tower, and I told her about my research of how I'd read that the North was a lot better. She told me that North Tower is INDEED better. So I asked her if I could get a room there, and no problem. The room was absolutely gorgeous. It was huge, clean, modern, had a bar....just amazing! When my friend saw it got pissed at me, because he said that my room was A LOT better than his. They even offered to move him to the North Tower, but he was lazy to move his stuff so he stayed in the South Tower. Elevators were so quick I don't think I ever waited over 1 minute to get one. Pool was big, no problem finding beds for the 4 of us, filled with young beautiful party people....I think is the first pool that I've ever seen without kids. There's a ton of little fast food restaurants.....not the fancy type, but good enough for grabbing something to eat at 5 am. The casino is filled with old people though that didn't bothered me because none of us like to gamble. Staff was friendly. Walking distance from the coolest hotels. I checked out the last day using the TV in my room, so I didn't waste a second checking out. I would definetly stay at Bally's again. The price was just a bit over the cheap hotels in the Strip, but we definetly got a lot more for our money. I'm the next link in this chain that did a lot for me in having an awesome vacation, so I encourage people to keep submitting their reviews of every place they go to.

Reviews.Title: “Useful tips about Ballys”
Reviews.Author: macdashark
Reviews.Content: The North Tower is more recently renovated, generally cleaner. To get a room in the North Tower say the following to the clerk when you check in "My travel agent said that I could not reserve a room in the North Tower until I checked in, but they called to confirm there were rooms available as of this morning", if they say $100 upgrade charge say "We are planning to spend hundreds, thousand, (depending) in your Casino over the next 3/4 days and you want me to pay a $100 upgrade charge?", if those don't work, probably even in the suites in the North Tower are full. As for gambling, for slots we had the most luck with a $0.60 to $1.00 bet on the penny unicorn near the front entrance of Ballys, and $0.50 to $0.75 (15 lines time 5) bet on the penny whales near the craps tables in the flamingo, but our best outcomes were on the craps tables in excalibur. also the tournament of the kings in excalibur ($50) was worth it, and the best restaurant remains to be gonzalas in new york, new york.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Place”
Reviews.Author: almostawinner
Reviews.Content: Well we were a little worried after reading so many bad reviews.. but we decided to ask for the North tower. Arriving we went to the hotel to check in.. the desk wasnt too busy a few in line... that was ok.. The woman who checked us in was very nice... we laughed and joked very fast service . Went up to our room , it was huge very clean, we had a view of mountains and strip from cesars to Hilton.. what a beautiful view.. even got to see a rainbow one nite.. The housekeeper was very nice. We saw security every morning around the same time as we came out of our room... we were there for 5 days. Never met any rude people working there... Our room was on the 25th floor, very comfortable it was our first time staying there... tried sidewalk cafe food was excellen, and the buffet for breakfast very good... so I dont know what people are talking about...our experience was great and we would definitely stay there again..

Reviews.Title: “Older, less fanicer that others, but still great!”
Reviews.Author: ryan2000
Reviews.Content: I had a confrence to attend at Bally's/Paris casino's. We got a special rate of $100 a night. Bally's as a casino itself is not that great and a little small (and outdated) but the Hotel in the North Tower is great! We got a HUGE room with 2 x king size beds with a view overlooking the Flamingo. I was very happy with the service at Ballys and the deals that they have. We recieved a 2 for 1 coupon to see The Producers at Paris Hotel & Casino. (side note:- The theatre for the Producers has a great view from anywhere! We had the cheapest seats in the back row and we saw everything and felt so close to the stage). The only thing i really didn't like at Bally's was their Buffett.........it made my girlfriend a bit ill and i really didn't want to eat any of the food. Apart from that......................i REALLY enjoyed my stay at Bally's.

Reviews.Title: “Dated and Depressing!”
Reviews.Author: globeseekerpa
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Bally's for a conference so it was not my personal selection. I had never been to Bally's in Las Vegas but my stay at Bally's in Atlantic City was fairly good so I was somewhat optimistic. That optimism turned out to be entirely misplaced. Fortunately we checked in at the airport so avoided the madness that was the check in in the hotel lobby. The lobby clearly has not been touched since the late 1980s and has low ceilings which give it a cramped, dark feeling. Upon arriving in my room I was even more disappointed. The hallways on the guest room floors were dank and poorly lit. The room was incredibly dated and looked it was in dire need of a deep steam cleaning. You could hear the sound of the TV in the next room coming through the connecting door which was sealed. I attempted to use the hi-speed internet connection via Ethernet cord but could not get it to work. I had to call the help desk on 2 separate occasions to get connected. This was emblematic of the service in the hotel-- there was no assistance with minor problems or queries, you were essentially on your own. Trying to get anywhere in the hotel required a massive trek. From my room to the pool took almost 10 minutes of walking through the casino floor and then a tired, tacky shopping arcade. The pool area was very plain and had no ambiance. The food at the hotel was of decent quality, however. The Big Kitchen Buffet had a wide variety of items and our banquet food was actually quite good. Asides from the good location in the center of the strip, Bally's has no redeeming features.

Reviews.Title: “sleepless in vegas!”
Reviews.Author: Marly610
Reviews.Content: when you r in vegas, expect not to sleep as there r too many things to keep you awake and having fun. however this rule applies in Bally's in a different way. bed bugs, human hair and belongings of the last guest r what may keep you all night with open eyes. staff r a kind of careless. housekeeping is disastrous. Dusty carpets and furniture. towels full of multi coloured stains leaving you with 100 thoughts! we lost almost 4 hours changing rooms with almost same problems at the end. location is ok. i have stayed in the excalibur before and it was much better in 2002, compared to Bally's. nothing special about the hotel, no theme, no vast choice of shops and average breakfast.. spend more money and stay in a better hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, stay in the North Tower”
Reviews.Author: wouldbeworldtraveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed on a Sunday and Monday night and got a great rate on the hotel's website. Check-in was smooth and agent was reasonably friendly. I was asked if I wanted to upgrade and inquired on cost. However, I decided I was in Vegas to see sights, not sit in a room so declined before even hearing the price. I think the agent upgraded me anyway as she told me she was putting me in the North Tower. I read on this site to try to stay in the North Tower and when I inquired the agent confirmed the North Tower is the better one. I was amazed by the size and decor of the room I received for the price! Very comfortable and was a great view from the 24th floor. Very central location on the Strip and that alone pretty much makes it worth considering Bally's - though admittedly location isn't everything. If you're room isn't clean and comfortable, location probably doesn't matter much. Yes, Bally's does overcharge and nickel-and-dime for just about everything, which I suppose helps make up for the low room price. Room service and restaurants are very expensive to what you get - you're in a tourist market and have to decide if the convenience is worth the extra cash. You will have to pay for use of the in-room safe; I guess you'll have to consider if it's worth the $3/day to use the safe. Yes, the bottle of water in the room is $4 if you take it or drink it; walk down the hallway to the machine and save $2. Ultimately, Bally's isn't doing anything every other hotel is doing and I personally just accept these things as part of my vacation funds. However, I also am usually inclined to find alternatives - they're out there if you look. Room was always well cleaned by housekeeping, though I also made sure to leave a $2 tip/day. I've found just a few bucks isn't that much to a vacation budget and makes for a great stay. If you're going to spend money on a vacation, is it that big a deal to leave a few bucks for someone to clean after you, especially if it makes for a better stay? I can't speak to condition of the South Tower, but I would definitely stay again, especially if I can get the North Tower (based on what others here say and my experience in the North Tower)..

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Special”
Reviews.Author: jonz113
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Bally's for two nights (08/20-08/22) as I had two free midweek nights. Paid $25 extra per night to upgrade to North Tower. I was scared to stay in South Tower based on reviews. The room was clean though some of the furniture was banged up. The hotel was a little smokey and the building and pool were very 70s. I did enjoy the spa and thought the staff was wonderful. I made friends with several dealers and pitt bosses. The location is fantastic and I love Paris which is conviently connected. Overall, The price was right but wouldn't go out of my way to stay there again. I stayed at Paris last time and loved it. I am staying in a Go Room at the Flamingo in Nov and hope to have a better experience.

Reviews.Title: “First Time In Vegas”
Reviews.Author: plumbing
Reviews.Content: This was our first time in Las Vegas. We are in our early 30's and went with my parents. My dad is a slot machine freak and goes to Atlantic City regularly so we thought this would be a great trip for him. But, sadly, by the end, we all realized for the flight distance, that Vegas isn't much better than Atlantic City. Plus, the slots are super tight. My dad is willing to pour money into the machines, so it isn't that he plays $20 and expects to win thousands. As far as Bally's is concerned, the hotel is nice - if you stay in the North Tower. I read bad things about the South Tower but can't say it is true, as both of us got to stay in the North Tower. Unfortunately, the front desk clerk my husband and I had wanted us to pay $100 extra for this "upgrade". Luckily, my parents were being waited on right beside us and their clerk told them they could stay in the North Tower for free. When I heard this, I informed our clerk, who didn't seem too happy about this, but relented and put us in the North Tower. The rooms were very nice, bathroom nice, toiletries replenished daily. I do feel Vegas nickels and dimes you for anything they consider an add-on. Bally's charged us $3.00 per day for use of the safe. They know everyone is going to use it, so it is just a money maker for them. We joined the gym for 4 days, which cost us $65 per person. The gym is okay for a few days, not the greatest, but they did provide water, juice, apples and bananas in the spa. You could also use the spa free of charge - the showers, toiletries, steam room, dry sauna, and 2 jacuzzis. The connection to Paris was nice but the hallway back and forth was so crowded with people, it made it very difficult to walk through at times. The food is WAY overpriced - $4.00 for a bottle of water in your room, $3.00 for coffee, $10 for a few pieces of lettuce, etc. We ate at Bally's buffet, it was adequate for a night, especially with the $5/off per person coupon we had. We ate at Le Burger, which was overpriced for burgers, but they were good. The Carnival buffet at Rio was huge and good, plus we had another $5/off coupon. The seafood buffet at Rio was $37/per person and the line was huge. I guess it would be worth it if you love lobster, for us, it wasn't worth the line or the cost. The best deal we found was a block down from Ballys at Ellis Island. We walked there for breakfast after our first day of eating at the Sidewalk Cafe at Ballys. For eggs and coffee, our bill was $60, so I knew we had to find an alternative. Ellis Island was it - they have french toast for $2.95, a 10 oz sirloin, eggs, toast and potatoes for $6.95. They also have a NY strip, eggs, toast, and potatoes for $3.95, but this was smaller and a little fatty. The 10 oz sirloin was all meat and very good quality. Coffee is also only $.95 here. We lounged around the pool at Bally's every day - they provide towels free of charge. The chairs are a little old and uncomfortable, but it was so hot the week we were there, we made the best of it and only stayed out 2 hours at the most. The drinks are way overpriced around the pool. We also got free tickets to see Jubilee as we signed up for the Total Rewards card. The show was okay, the little acts in between the major acts were the best. I wouldn't pay money to see this show. Overall the trip was okay, but we most likely won't go back. I'd rather lay by a beach.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but so-so hotel”
Reviews.Author: plev
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights here 8/15-8/18. Check in at the airport was quick and our request for North Tower rooms were met although they couldn't put us on the floor I wanted (16, the first stop on the elevator so you don't need to make stops on other floors) Our room wasn't ready so we needed to check out bags at the hotel. I've never had to wait to do this at any other hotel (vegas or otherwise) but this process took over 15 minutes---just to drop off bags. They bellhops seemed confused. However, to be honest, when we did get our room and called down for our bags they were delivered in under 5 minutes. Our room was clean, but tired. The furniture had chips, the carpet was a little worn, and the lighting and bathroom fixtures had seen better days. The bed however was pretty comfortable and everything in the room worked well. Common areas of the hotel were fine but smokey---even by vegas standards. I'm guessing the ventilation system is much older and probably less advanced then those at the newer hotels and you can tell. The pool was ok--not great but not bad either. It's a lesser walk then some other places I've stayed. I wasn't crazy about the music they were playing but that's a personal preference. This is the 5th Vegas hotel i've stayed in and where this hotel stands out is in it's location. It's connected to Paris so it's like having two hotels and one. Go out the front door and Bellagio and Caesars are right across the street. To the right are Bills and the Flamingo. What I really liked though is there is a side door on the low level (where the shops are) which puts you literally across the street from a convenience store, a decent "blue collar" bar, and Battista's hole in the hole (recommend highly for dinner). The same set of doors puts you about a 7 minute walk from Ellis Island Casino (when you want to get some "old vegas" feel) and the Westin Causarina --4 minute walk--which has some really good happy hour gambling. I'd stay here again but only if I got a good rate and only if it was a boys trip--i don't think I'd stay here with my wife. This hotel is owned by Harrah's and I've noticed that they have REALLY tightened up the video poker and video blackjack machines. if these are important to you, you should stay in a hotel owned by MGM/Mirage----they still offer you a fighting chance....

Reviews.Title: “A Tale of Two Hotels”
Reviews.Author: VelsD
Reviews.Content: Bally's offers two very different hotel experiences under one roof. Rooms in the "North Tower" have been renovated, and offer standard modern hotel fare -- bright rooms with a little whimsy. Rooms in the "South Tower" are grim and smelly, leaving you wondering if you should lie in the bed fully-clothed. Service is also a problem. Though there were only 6 people in front of me, I waited in line for 30 minutes to change my room after opening the door to my first room (in the South Tower) and discovering it had not been cleaned (the bed had been slept in and left as-is). As customers waited patiently in line desk staff walked at a leisurely pace back and forth to the offices. There was rarely more than one person at the front desk at the time though it appeared at least four were working (in rotation?). My first request to speak to a manager got what was almost a sneer and no result, my second the same sneer, but a manager. I waited in a similarly long line at the casino's deli. On the upside, it was cheap...but not cheap enough to make up for what's in store for travellers.

Reviews.Title: “WARNING! DO NOT STAY AT BALLY'S”
Reviews.Author: kevinc
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our 2 week trip, began it in Las Vegas (3 nights) ended in Denver. We toured several national parks, stayed in 5 other hotels and had a spectacular vacation EXCEPT for Bally's. Our decision to stay here was based on reviews by other TA members. In fact, we chose all of the other hotels based on reviews on this site as well! All were very accurate except for Bally's! As suggested, we checked in at the airport, took the shuttle that we paid for at check-in and waited and waited for the shuttle. When it finally arrived we realized that we had overpaid. If you pay the driver the cost is $6.00 per person, we paid Bally's $7.00 per person. We thought no big deal, vacation time! We arrived at our hotel 45 minutes later as the driver had to make 3 OTHER stops. The driver dropped us off at the side entrance to Bally"s(close to the NORTH tower) No bellhop could be found. We asked for help from other employees with no one responding. Now we were steaming as we had tickets to Spamalot. We hauled our own 4 bags to our room in the SOUTH tower. What a haul! Upon entering our room , we noticed a large trash bag next to the door. When we walked in it looked like my 90 year old grandmothers bedroom, and furniture to match! Then we noticed the hole in the wall, peeling wallpaper and a " large paint bubble" above the bathtub. We headed for the show out the front entrance and observed several bellman standing around. We mentioned about the side entrance, they laughed! Upon returning late and very exhausted we headed to the room, observed the same trash bag next to the door. We had several other issue's to include a stale stagnant (nasty) odor when entering Bally"s, front escalotors not working, dirty slot machines, cig. butts everywhere, very poor housekeeping and a staff that did not seem to care about guest service. The manager that we spoke to (Jose) gave us the same care free attitude as rest of the staff. He made us fell like we were just another complainer! The bag of trash next to our door lasted until we thru it out. We are shocked how this property has received favorable reviews in the past, it is a very nasty hotel. We walked thru several other hotels along the strip and noticed a huge improvement in housekeeping. In addition, room rate's and location are very comparable. Do not make the mistake that we did by staying at Bally's!

Reviews.Title: “Nice public areas, but rooms are raggedy”
Reviews.Author: Kaseyj1313
Reviews.Content: I took my first trip to Las Vegas for a convention August 6 through 11, 2007. The convention hotel was Bally's, so I stayed there for five days. The hotel room was a big disappointment. Bally's public areas are relatively nice -- full of slot machines, gaming tables and Keno sites, plenty of high end shops, and lots of restaurants, ranging from coffee shops and donut kiosks to expensive steakhouses. But the rooms (at least in the South Tower, where I stayed) are very much down at the heels. The carpeting in the hallways is a dull and stained putrid brown. The rooms are large, but most of the space is wasted. The furnishings look like Goodwill rejects. The rooms are dark, with brown carpeting and circa 1950s chairs, end tables and dressers. Instead of a proper desk with a wheeled chair, there is a small, round, badly scratched and marked dining table and two mismatched dining chairs. On the table is the high-speed Internet connection (more about that later), awkwardly located for plugging in one's laptop. There were only two electric outlets in the wall near the table, so I had to plug my cell phone charger into another poorly located plug next to the dresser. The two lounging chairs were too soft to sit in comfortably. Lighting was also poorly located, with not enough light anywhere in the room. It was hard to work on my laptop or to read in bed. The inadequate lighting just added to the dreariness of the room. My room had a view of Caesar's Palace and the Flamingo. The king-size bed was about the right firmness for me. The 27-inch TV was not on a swivel table, so there was no way to change its position to watch from the lounging chairs. It was watch from the bed or don't watch at all (when the TV worked). During my first night, the television did not work, apparently a hotel-wide problem, according to the front desk. The bathroom was clean, with ceramic tile and soap, lotion, shampoo and conditioner, with enough towels for one person; I fear two would be caught short. I was shocked to find that the hotel charges $11.99 per 24 hours for broadband Internet access. Many hotel chains these days are offering free high-speed Internet access, and often it's wifi. To charge so much for what most people will only use a few hours is simply gouging, IMHO. I ate at the Big Kitchen Buffet most times. For $19.99 at dinner, and $12.99 for breakfast, one can pig out on American, Japanese and Chinese foods. It was not the best buffet I've ever had, but the selection was broad, and the quality was higher than, say, Golden Corral. The dessert selection was awesome, with flan and bananas Foster, assorted cookies, cheesecake, ice cream and cakes. There is a news stand, several all-night sundries and snacking places at which one can purchase sodas, bottled water and snacks. Despite my unhappiness with the room, the hotel seemed to be a good place to hold a convention. The meeting rooms were spacious and conveniently located; the staff was helpful; and the food provided at the receptions was tasty and plentiful. The hotel itself is on the Strip, and has a monorail stop. It is walking distance to many popular casinos and restaurants, and is attached to the Paris. There is a shopping mall nearby. I would not stay at Bally's again. I realize that many people visiting Vegas only use their rooms for sleeping and showering. But if you are a business traveler who needs to check e-mail daily, who would like to catch the news on TV, who would like a free newspaper every morning, and who craves bright, functional surroundings, skip this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “lovely rooms”
Reviews.Author: crosspatch
Reviews.Content: Again we found it just as cheap to get in touch with the hotel directly and we didn't have to put any money up front,also if you had to cancel you could do so without losing any money. We stayed in the front tower the one overlooking Paris and the Bellageio. Great view!! I would not like to be at the other tower it is supposed to be very old fashioed. The Bally's steak house is great ,food is 1st class, I cant remember the waiters name but he is brill about recomending food.We ate in every night. We took the bus up to the Ria all suites 1 night it was o k. We loved the pool area but the bar was just getting started up the week we were there and they only had 1 person on which was a disaster, and Fri was crowded out, 1 idiot was trying to keep 16 sunbeds for some of his friends that might turn up.we loved the place . this was our second time in Ballys,last year was cheaper. i had my own room and it cost an average of £100 per night,but you could have at least 4 sleeping in the room comfortable for that price and some more. lovely and clean,go there if you can our room no. was 6769 i think great views.

Reviews.Title: “We liked it but....”
Reviews.Author: StephenF
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 5 night stay at Bally's. Myself, my wife and 15 year old child. This was our first trip to Vegas but we do a lot of travelling overall. Pluses: Centrally located on the strip. Take a cab to and from the airport if there are 2 or more people rather than a shuttle its cheaper and you'll get there faster. The lobby is bright and large. I liked the marble finish all over the place....very nice. There is a small concession infront of the main checkin counter to grab a snack or a drink. This was convenient especially when coming back to the hotel and you felt you needed a water or something. Check in staff were very accommodating. I wanted a North Tower room and they found one for me although I had to wait for an hour for the room to be made up. I dropped my cell phone getting out of a cab at about 2 a.m. and the valet services found it and turned it into security. I was very grateful to get it back so quickly. Huge room, nice comfortable beds and pillows. I don't like those big bouncy pillows....these ones were just right. Nice shower. Large soaps and lots of shampoo and conditioner. They even supply mouthwash. We loved the little strip mall between Bally's and the Paris. We ate in the restraunts and delli in this mall several times. We also ate at Bally's buffet twice, lunch once and dinner once. Almost the same spread each time. We enjoyed it both times. Our elevator was quick. We were on the 16th floor and it was the first stop for that set of elevators so we always got to the room quickly. Check in was quick, check out was very quick. Minuses: I never considered safety as an issue until our fourth night. A well enough dressed guy followed me off the elevator onto the 16th floor and stopped me and proceeded to tell me a story about not having his wallet because it was in his friends rental car which was now at the airport and he was desperate for cab fare. He said his friends were now in the air, his wallet in the glove box of a rental car and he was all alone and had no way of getting his ID. He was a very good con artist and needed $40 to get a taxi. There should be a security door to the elevators that only card carrying guests can pass by! The room smelled and I finally figured out why. The airconditioning outflow is too close to the carpet and condenses leaving a puddle of water directly under it. If you're not wearing shoes you'll get soaked. You don't have to be a biologist to know there has to be mold and fungus growing under such conditions. Room safe was too costly considering I paid way more than the $58 I saw in other postings! I paid $138, $105, $105,$169, $190. Wednesday and Thursday where the $105 nights. Sat was the $190. I think I could have easily stayed at a better hotel if I shopped arround. The internet sucked. I paided $10.99 per day I used it and it was slow and not dependable or secure!

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms in the North Tower”
Reviews.Author: ycroxme
Reviews.Content: After reading all the reviews before we arrived I suggested that our party ask for the North Tower upon check in. We had a party of 12 with three different rooms and we weren't sure if they would accommodate us or not. They did end up putting us all in the North Tower and put all three of our rooms all by eachother. Another suggestion would be to Valet. My group decided to Valet and that was much quicker than the other two groups who self-parked. The walk for them was quite a distance. The staff was very friendly even after we forgot one of our bags in our car and didn't realize until an hour later. The pool was nice, not too small. There were plenty of lounge chairs, even for our large group. The best part is that they allowed drinks in the pool and played music the whole time to keep the "party" atmosphere going. The only downside was the walk to the pool. It is very out of the way. The rooms were very nice and spacious in the North Tower. I would definitely stay there again. The location is excellent and the price is definitely a great deal.

Reviews.Title: “South Tower Needs Serious Overhaul”
Reviews.Author: NYNYGirlie
Reviews.Content: I just returned from Vegas where I met some friends. I decided to stay an additional day and used a free room offer I had from Bally's. Now I know why it was free. I had walked through the place before and it seemed bright and clean near the check in and the bands in the lounge always sounded great. However, once I stayed there, it was a totally different experience. Check in was quick and efficient. Got my room on the 7th floor. First thing I notice is there is no security personnel at the elevators checking for room keys. I find that deeply concerning especially since anyone can walk up to guest floors and be up to no good. Every time I walked from my room to the elevator, I saw not a single person. I was very unnerved that if there was a problem, I'd be hard pressed to find security. The room. Large, old, faded plush carpet, stained velour sofa, 70's era bedspread. You get the picture. There are signs posted all over that you need to secure your valuables as the management is not responsible. Ok, point taken. But, they charge you $3.00 A DAY for the privilege of using their safe. Come on. In this day and age of folks having ipods, cameras, cell phones, etc. you can't expect them not to lock things up. To take advantage of that daily is ridiculous. Not staying here again, even on a comp. There are nicer hotels in Vegas and I wouldn't have the safety issues either.

Reviews.Title: “A Very Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: lancerodman
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Bally's for two nights in early August. Here's what I liked about it: Price: $59 per night, for a large, very nicely appointed room, with comfortable bed, and (almost) soundproof windows that faced onto Flamingo (a busy street) Pool: big, and no charge to enter, and no charge for towels Elevators: always come quickly Show in the hotel: Jubilee, entertaining, standard over-the-top Las Vegas show. Look for a 2-1 coupon from the Las Vegas Advisor, because otherwise good seats are $88 Tour: Jubilee backstage tour -- interesting, though a bit long Early check-in: I was able to get into my room at 11:30 a.m. -- a big plus on a very hot day Food: vending machines in hallway Location: center of the strip, and also connected to the Monorail Layout of hotel: it’s rather easy to get from the lobby of the hotel to your room, particularly compared to other large hotels. You have to talk through a bit of the casino, but it's not extreme like the MGM. Indeed, one other overall plus to being at Bally's is it simply doesn't feel like a zoo environment, as I suspect that most of the people in the casino are people staying in the hotel. Because it doesn't have all the shops of Bellagio, Caesar's, or Wynn, the crowds aren't too bad (granted, I was there on a Sunday-Tuesday, in August -- not peak times). As for complaints, the water pressure in my shower could have been better, and the water in the pool didn't strike me as being as clean as it should be (I was wearing goggles, so I could get some sense of what the water looked like). But I can't think of too much else to complain about. I would gladly stay again, and most likely will.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - average hotel”
Reviews.Author: travellingteachers
Reviews.Content: My best friend and I decided that we wanted to take a break from reality so we booked a trip to Vegas. We stayed at Bally's from July 31st to Aug 3rd. When we arrived (about 9pm), there was no line up and check in was quick. Due to the later arrival, there weren't any non-smoking rooms available so they upgraded us to a "junior" suite on the sixth floor. Essentially, it's about twice the size of the regular room but with a murphy bed. I would have preferred a king size but it wasn't a problem. We didn't have a view, well unless you like the view of the monorail. The room was clean and quite comfortable. Some issues we had included: a very loud a/c system, a hair dryer that blew up and very slow service to fix it (called 2x and then had to go to the front desk to complain), a dirty glass with ashes left by housekeeping, and noise carried easily at night from the main suite next door. That night, we ate at the Tequila Bar. It was decent food - I thoroughly enjoyed my mojito. Altogether with dinner, drinks and a tip, it cost us about 20$. We also ate breakfast at the Sidewalk Cafe. Decent food but nothing too overwhelming. We often used the monorail to get from one end of the Strip to the other so that was a nice convenience. The casino was your typical casino but it seemed more smoky than the others I've been to. Also, the waitresses weren't as friendly nor as apt to return. As a result, we played the slots at the Paris more often - less smoke and quick bar service. The fact that it's connected to the Paris is the major bonus. We quite enjoyed the faux cobblestones and the facades. We also had the Producers package and thoroughly enjoyed the production. It was a ton of fun! Because of it's location, affordable price, good service (front desk rocked), and clean rooms, I would definitely stay at Bally's again.

Reviews.Title: “Horrifically bad”
Reviews.Author: audreyport2001
Reviews.Content: How do I begin about how horrific this property is? In my room---no ironing board, dirty linens and carpet, two wall outlets that don't work, the light near the front door doesn't work, the light on the desk doesn't work. The pool gal who gives you your towels is surly and literally doesn't even look at you as she literally throws them at you. Pool service? One waitress for an entire large area. Concierge refuses to print boarding passes and if you have to do an online check-in for your airline, the business center closes at 7 so screw you--too bad. Ain't that great service? And the worst part? Go up the escalator toward the front of the hotel in an effort to get out an inhale the lovely, spore-laden from mildew air blowing out of the air ducts there..it STINKS.... I had to hold my breath going up and down that escalator---DISGUSTING.

Reviews.Title: “Can Always Count on Bally's!”
Reviews.Author: DaveT555
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Bally's 7/22-7/29 and enjoyed every minute! Check in at airport took 5 minutes,room wasn't ready but by the time it took to go from airport to hotel I stopped at front desk and was given keys. Hotel staff was very nice and friendly.Room in north tower was large,comfortable and clean.Room was serviced every day by noon. Ate at deli and pizza place in shopping area.Good food,reasonably priced.Did not try buffet.If you want coffee in the morning,go to casino floor and see a cocktail waitress,tell her your going for a walk and she will bring you 2 16oz. coffees with lids and also waters.We tipped $2(total) for this service,instead of paying $4(for 1) at the stand by check in area. Location can't be beat,walking distance to all other casino's.If you want to take a nice walk in the morning,go out side door on Flamingo and head away from strip.You will see the Terrible's casino marquee.This is a fun place 10 min walk from Bally's.Sign up for their players card and you will recieve a funbook.Buy 1 get 1 buffet which was very good(quality food) and 2 can eat for $4.99.There are also many other good coupons(free drinks,ect) in this funbook. Entertainment in Indigo Lounge was excellent and free. The swimming pool is also very nice.Not crowded,clean and with a 12 ft deep end where you can actually swim around. I just don't understand some of the reviews I read.I am not snobby,but I am hard to please and Bally's never lets me down. If I had to pick something to complain about,I would sat the pool needs to be painted,which i'm sure they will do this off season.There is some chipping paint. Also take your own drinks to the pool area,They don't mind.I took my own cooler every day.Only suckers pay $6-$7 dollars for a beer.There is a market on Flamingo,right out the side door of Bally's.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: redvette1
Reviews.Content: Stayed July 21, thru July 24. Was able to check in on a Saturday afternoon at 1:00 with no line. Also asked for and received the north tower. Awesome room. Large with nice furnishing and upscale granite in bath. Air on all the time so never had to worry about outside noise, not that there was any. Spent several hours at the pool. Drinks a little on the high side, $7 for bottle of beer, $6 for large soda but does it really matter as you are in Vegas. GREAT location on the strip. We had rental car and parked at Paris, came in from the back street and not bad at all. Did not find the casino to be any smokier than any other. Roomy gaming area but wasn't very lucky at the slots. But wasn't lucky at any of them. Rio's buffet was not that great. Alot of selections but none that were very decent. Prime rib was still mooing and I like my meat on the rare side but.... We will stay again......

Reviews.Title: “Bally's is a Bust”
Reviews.Author: LAtraveler2CA
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Bally's in early July 2007 for a business meeting. Someone else in the group booked the rooms late in the game and Bally's was one of the only hotels available that weekend - and with very good reason. It is old, out-of-date, out-of-style and aesthetically unpleasing. The room was dingy and musty and not visually appealing. Linens were threadbare and the mattress was awful. I wouldn't walk on the carpet barefeet. The bathroom had old fixtures and peeling wallpaper. Don't stay unless you truly don't care what your room looks like and/or a low price point is your most important criteria.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for smokers”
Reviews.Author: SWanjiru
Reviews.Content: Thanks to Trip Advisor and their candid hotel photos, I booked a room in the North Tower and our room was beautiful--spacious and nicely furnished. The buffet was OK; there are better buffets to be found in Vegas. The casino was smokier than that found in other hotels, so that can be a hardship for non-smokers that have to cross the casino every time they enter or exit the hotel. The spa services were very good and they have a nice variety of shops on the lower level. The location is right in the heart of the strip and it’s convenient to the monorail with a stop right there at the back of the hotel. Wouldn’t stay there again only because of the smoke.

Reviews.Title: “nice place, good price!”
Reviews.Author: Jellybeans1004
Reviews.Content: When we arrived, our room (standard king) were all occupied, so we were upgraded to the suite for no extra charge. The room was HUGE!!! The hotel itself is very nice and clean. The rooms were clean and housekeeping always does a good job with cleaning everything up. The staff were always friendly. There's a shuttle that goes to RIO (which is off the strip) right outside of the hotel for free! It comes by every half hour to pick you up and drop you off, and a shuttle from RIO right back to BALLYS. If you're a coffee person like I am, Nosh on the lobby level close to the south tower elevators are much friendlier than the Java Coast in the lobby. The Big Kitchen Buffet in Bally's isnt the greatest. The indoor walkway to Paris was VERY nice. It's like staying in 2 hotels at the same time. Very convient. I would stay here again on my next visit to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: vegascrazy96761
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at Ballys from 7/15/2007 thru 7/20/2007. I have stayed several times in the past. I booked the cheaper room but was upgraded to the North tower. I had a renovated room overlooking half of the Aladdin Caesars and could also see red rock from the window. The beds were the most comforatable I have had in a hotel room. Large bathroom with tons of towels. I did have a slight problem with the front desk 2 days after checking in saying that I needed payment even though I had given them my credit card but that was soon resolved. I didnt gamble there much. Slots seem to be tight. I would rather stay downtown but since I was there for two weeks I wanted a change. It was a nice stay and would stay again if I need to be in that area of Las Vegas. Went to Barry Manillow and he canceled the first night that was when I had 2nd row tickets, but got a 5th row seat for my last night there and it was fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: BornToTravel
Reviews.Content: Every year my company has our annual trade show at Paris and the employees (ie me) stay at Bally's. I think that this hotel is an ok place to stay. It does need upgrading but everything is clean and the service is also good. The location on the strip is excellent. I also enjoyed the spaciousness of the room. If I were traveling to Vegas for pleasure I would definitely think about staying at Bally's. I always ask to stay in the North Tower which is supposedly the more updated wing. I have not been disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, choose the North Tower”
Reviews.Author: brev
Reviews.Content: First of all I got a great price. When I checked in I asked for a room in the North Tower as suggested by several other reviewers. I got a room in the North Tower and it was spacious and clean and furnitures were up to date. Overall it's the nicest hotel room I ever stayed in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised!”
Reviews.Author: citygirl118
Reviews.Content: I have been to Vegas nearly a dozen times in the last 10 years, and have only stayed in one hotel twice. There are so many places to try that I always like to find something different (as well as get a good deal so I can spend my money elsewhere). I usually lean towards the 'big name' hotels, simply because I know they are going to be safe and clean in a city where those are definitely not givens. I had avoided Bally's in the past mostly due to its age. After reading reviews on here, I decided to give it a shot. I was initially irritated upon check-in because, although we arrived on a Thursday evening (thinking it would be quieter than Friday), we were unable to get a non-smoking room as requested. I HATE smoking rooms, but there was really no choice as the hotel was full. The room was a very pleasant surprise. First of all, it was huge. There was a lovely blue velvety couch in the corner with a nice potted plant- just a nice touch. The furniture all looked very new, and the room had obviously been recently renovated. The bed was comfortable enough. This is an awesome location. The hotel is attached to the Paris, which is my personal favorite place to gamble. Lots of restaurants there, too. It is also across the street from the Bellagio and the lovely fountains there. Food available within Bally's is pretty disappointing (avoid the expensive and yucky coffee cart thing by the front desk!), but again, you're so close to a ton of other places that it doesn't matter. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for Strip location”
Reviews.Author: sardross
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is just fabulous, you can walk to every major casino on the strip. The car park is too far from the reception and you need to drop your cases off at the front of the hotel and then go and park. The entrance to the car poark is just down the road from the front entrance but a long, long walk to the main area of Bally's. You have to walk through Paris Paris and with no one to give directions you have to just keep asking people as you pull your luggage to the reception. The reception was quick and helpfull, we asked for a room with a view in the North tower, we got a seventh floor room with a view of the air conditioning ducts! But the room made up for it, a big twin bedded room and great value for the money. The buffet was not worth the money, go next door to Alladin's their buffet was great value with seafood and a mixture of spicy and American fare. We played the slots and won ziltch, better at Paris Paris slots at least we won our money back. Would go there again as the location is hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay Here!”
Reviews.Author: FlyTiger
Reviews.Content: I will preface by saying this was my second visit to Vegas and I was on a business trip for a trade show at Bally's. The reason I stayed at Bally's was because it's convention center hosted the trade show my $60Billion dollar company was participating in. I have traveled extensively in numerous hotels across the world from Istanbul to Islip and this was one of the worst I have ever stayed at. What I liked: The room was large. What I did not like: 1) Dirty room (dusty furniture and moldy shower tiles) with furniture that looked like it was from the Salvation Army! This was the type of room that made me want to sleep with my shoes on! 2) Rude service 3) Ask for a renovated room, BUT be forewarned my room was so raggedy that I asked for a renovated room and the guy at the front desk said I would have to pay $20 more...a small price to pay given I was on corp. expense, but it was the principle so I refused. 4) Don't believe the pics...at the front desk they have a portfolio of illlustrated pictures of the rooms and mine in the south tower looked nothing like what was shown. 5) My last day here (today 7/14), I decided to go to the pool following the end of our trade show and witnessed a scene out of MTV Spring Break. with drunk 30 somethings falling all over each other. Within 15min. they closed the pool because there was a skirmish and some drunk guy puked in it and the life guards indicated it would not reopen for :45 min. as chlorine levels were too low. I asked a pool waitress if I could get a beer and she rudely indicated they were no longer serving drinks, I would have to go to the bar. 6) The fitness center/spa is a dump. The worst I have ever seen with trash in cup holders, dark and in the basement and you have to pay $22 to use it! 7) The casino looks like something out of a 70's movies set. 8) The elevators were technically challenge, at times I would press the down button and would have to hold it continously to get an elevator. One time I had an elevator on my floor that refused to close its doors until I held down the door close button continuously while pressing the "lobby" button. 8) "The Big Kitchen Buffet" restaurant was so dirty, you did not even have to go far to eat, just grab a plate and chances were there was enough left over food on it to feed you with out even hitting the buffet! Several times I saw multiple plates in the "clean" plates stack with caked on food.

Reviews.Title: “Major Overhaul Needed”
Reviews.Author: RidlerGirl67
Reviews.Content: While you can't beat the location, right smack in the middle of the Strip, this hotel needs LOVE in a big way. Everything is there - casino, pool, shows, shopping arcade, restaurants its just OLD which does keep the prices down (so something to consider) but I'd rather spend a bit more for more comfort and more style. Our standard room overlooked the pool at Paris, which was fine but not a great view. We were on the 6th floor. The room itself was spacious with a king bed, table and chair, dresser, TV, lounge chair and table. Furniture is just beaten up. Bathroom was small, close quarters for 2 people. Tub was small and had stains. Showerhead was barely high enough for me at 5'6" and had one of those needle-like heads, sort of painful on the eyes. Don't get me wrong, the room overall was clean but you can only help but so much. Bottom line, we're 40, no kids and are willing to endure a little bit for a bargain but the hotel seemed full of either younger families on a budget or singles in there 20s, also on a budget who would endure more than we. I've been to Vegas 7 times now over the past 5 years and while I'll gamble here, I won't return to Bally's to stay unless they undergo a renovation.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome stay”
Reviews.Author: jenlee
Reviews.Content: This was my 2nd stay at Bally's and it was great. We arrived around 10ish and was told the room wasn't ready. Was told to check back around 1 or 2. Came back at 12 and was given the room keys! We stayed in the North Towers on both occasions. Rooms/bathrooms are clean, spacious, and inviting. The only problem I had during the 2nd stay was our door lock. For some reason, it required us to slide it a gazzilion times before the key system was able to read the card (this is room 1018). Pool is nice and they play a variety of music. Hotel allowed for us to check out 1 hour after checkout time.

Reviews.Title: “Central location”
Reviews.Author: AsianVista
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Bally's for two days. The location is convenient especially on those hot summer Vegas days and nights. It's in the center of the strip close to Bellagio, Caesar's Palace, Paris and Planet Hollywood. Within a short walk is the MGM and NY NY. The room and bathroom is large, clean and comfortable. The hotel also has a parking structure. During the two days, we never used our car. We either walked or took advantage of the free shuttle service. The shuttle service to the Rio was on-time and we rarely waited more than 5 minutes. Perfect timing on our part I guess. From the Rio you can take the one of the designated shuttles to Caesar's, Harrahs or back to Bally's.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC LOCATION - A TRUELY AMAZING HOLIDAY”
Reviews.Author: europeangirl
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I spent 3 days in Vegas and paid $300 for our AMAZING room in the beautiful ballys hotel on the strip. First off - WHAT A VIEW!!! our huge window had a perfect view of the eiffel tower in the adjoining paris hotel, the bellagio fountains, down the strip as far as the eye could see and was spectacular at night! The room was just fantastic, the size of a small apartment! there were 2 queen beds, a chest of drawers, large TV, table and chairs, wardrobe and loads of storage space. Very large bathroom with plenty of mirrors, bathtub and shower and again lots of space. Great AC to keep out the 42 degree celius heat!!! Pool is lovely there too, if a little far from the lobby, a pleasant walk through the shops though. nice casino and bar and all that but there is so much to choose from all around that it wouldnt even matter if there was nothing to do in the hotel! The location of ballys is perfect, right across from the bellagio and caesers...bellagio and paris/PH along side it and the monte carlo and NYNY a short walk also. I couldnt recommend this hotel highly enough, we had a truely amazing time here and I cant wait to return in a few years time to the wonderful sin city!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: honey18
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Bally's North Tower and were very impressed, the room was large, clean and the bed was very comfortable. The room was very quiet and convenient for the lift. We were impressed with Bally's on the whole, the casino was good and not as large and overwhelming as some of the larger hotels. The staff were very friendly and accommodating. We asked for a strip view room and were given one no problem, we even had a view of the Bellagio foundations. The pool area was very nice but on the weekend was crowed with a DJ playing very loud music. This is the only fault I found at Bally's and would definately stay again (in the North Tower). It is in an excellent location and good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Center of Strip Bally's as a Home Base”
Reviews.Author: sixkids
Reviews.Content: We selected Bally's for our first visit to Vegas and were quite pleased. We wanted a mid-range priced hotel as we were there to spend our money on dining and gaming. EASY check in at the airport, saved a lot of time standing in the lobby waiting to check in. Asked for a North Tower (recently remodeled) room and we were quite happy with our accommodations. Clean and comfortable. Easy to access the monorail outside the back of the property. Enjoyed our meals at several resturants in Bally's and at the Paris hotel which is attached via an indoor mall walkway. The casino is fine, fully appointed with all the slots/tables. Not huge or overwhelming but big enough to spend time playing in. We LOVED the location on the strip. We visited the other hotels and Bally's location made it simple. We either rode the monorail, got in a taxi or walked! We wouldn't hesitate staying at Bally's again, it was a good "home" base. We really didn't spend much time in our room and didn't think we wanted to spend top dollar on a room we weren't going to use that much! We would stay at Bally's again, would like to be in the other Tower for the view of the strip, hope they remodel them soon!!

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: beachbum97
Reviews.Content: We went to Vegas in June 2007. We checked into Bally's right at the Vegas Airport which was nice. When we got there we were put in a South Tower Room. The room was very big but outdated and gross. It was misleading compared to the pictures that were shown on the website for this hotel. After sleeping in this room 1 night and then getting no hot water in the shower I decided to call the front desk. The person I spoke to was rude and said our South Tower gets a lot of complaints. Most people want to stay in the remodeled North Tower but we have no rooms. I hung up annoyed. My husband called back and explained to them how upset i was, especially after we spent a good amount of money to get this room. We were there for a Fri. and Sat. night stay so there were no cheap deals. Somehow, the person he spoke to found us a room in the North Tower and it was great. It is unbeleivable how a customer could pay the same rate for two totally differnt style rooms. I also felt it was a gender issue that they ignored me and responded to a mans request to be moved. The hotel pool was nice but it sure felt like spring break on Sat. afternoon. Loud music by a DJ and drunk screaming people everywhere. The hotel is conncted to the Paris Hotel which is nice. There was a great restaurant on a side street next to Bally's called Battista's Hole in the Wall. For about $20 a person you get a full meal plus unlimited carafets of wine. We also ate inside Bally's at Asia and that was good as well. We saw the Celine show and Mystere by Cirque du. Both were amazing. There are 4 boothes in town that sell half price tickets for shows for that evening only. They didn't have top choices but many good ones to select from. Overall I would recommend speinding a little extra money and staying at the Paris or Mirage.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location and Friendly Service!”
Reviews.Author: vtxriders
Reviews.Content: Just returning from a conference in Vegas where we enjoyed our 1st stay at Bally's. The hotel is in the most central location and the staff could not have been any friendlier. I had booked a room through the conference and wasn't quite sure what it would be for the price especially after reading some of the reviews on here. However, we were given our choice of three room types upon arrival. Our room was in the North Tower and was very clean. It had a single queen bed, a dining table and 4 chairs, a smaller table w/ 2 chairs, a couch, chair, desk and coffee table. It also had a desk, fridge dressing area and large bathroom. Internet was available for $11.99/day but only worked the first 3 of the 5 days we were there. Now for a complaint - we called and were told they would come up but did not. Had we been there any longer, we would have called again. The only other complaint might be that housekeeping was way too eager to clean the room daily. For those who tend to be overly critical - Yes, this hotel is showing a little wear. Mostly in the hallway areas where the carpet is starting to look a little worn. Also, the wallpaper design is out of date. Neither of these are a bid deal for us. We don't look for perfection in a place we do not own (nor paid top dollar for). We are more concerned with cleanliness, location and staff friendliness. We have stayed at several other hotels (some higher end) and I just can't complain about this one any more than any of the others I have stayed at. The Indigo bar in the casino had excellent Motown type bands nightly which was very enjoyable to listen too. I can not recommend the Sidewalk Cafe but would recommend Bally's Steakhouse and the Sterling Brunch. Both a little pricey but worth it. Once again, the staff friendliness is above and beyond! The connection to The Paris was also nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great time at Ballys !”
Reviews.Author: Pauleo
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Ballys for 4 nights in June and had a great time ! Check-in only took a few minutes and i got upgraded to a suite in the north tower for $100 - it was huge and had a great view over the flamingo and ceasars palace hotels. Ballys is ideally situated in the middle of the strip and the staff i encountered couldn't have been more polite and helpful. Had such a great time in Las Vegas i'm gonna go back in october and i'll be staying at Ballys !

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: wincie
Reviews.Content: checked in at the airport on the 27th may for 4 nights. Check-in was quick and simple. Our room had two really big beds as there were 4 of us and they were really comfortable.we had a room on the 22nd fllor of the north tower I requested non-smoking but there was only smoking rooms left or go into the south tower, i took the smoking in the north tower it was ok. The view we had looked over to bills gambling hall and flamingos, we could also see the hilton and stratosphere hotels. the casino in ballys was my favourite along with the venetian it was smaller and friendly then the others we went in. we ate the sidewalk cafe which was excellent but the times on the notice was a bit confusing, they said it was open until 11.00pm but we went there on two occassions at 8.30pm and it was closed. This was my first time in vegas i hope it wont be my last and when i do return i will definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate But Not With Children”
Reviews.Author: welovefrance7
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Bally's over the New year period 2006. I've only just joined Tripadvisor but decided to give my review on this and as many hotels as we can remember staying in! This hotel is adequate in that you are in a good location for visiting the other hotels on the strip. We only stayed here as we got a great deal to visit Las Vegas as a two centre holiday with New York. Trouble is, we dont gamble and had our two year old son with us so we needn't have bothered with Las Vegas at all! It really is only suitable for those who want to play the machines night and day or spend time at the bar all day! I found the whole experience pointless. We visited most of the other hotels within a day and a half and, especially as the weather was awful, found very little else to do. Bally's is like most of the other hotels on the strip in that it is dark and smoky and of course, full of gamblers. Our room was huge, that was one bonus. Our son enjoyed running up and down the room more than anything else. We did have a view of the "Eiffel Tower" at the next door Paris hotel which was nice and were close enough to watch the fountains at the Bellagio each evening. We were unable to go in any area where alcohol was served with our son as they are so strict on the under age drinking....not that he was going to have a stiff whisky or anything! So we only indulged in around two beers drank hastily in the lobby area the whole holiday. The pool was small and not in use. The breakfast at the Buffett Venue was very good, never seen such a huge choice. Eggs any style, fish, meat, fruit, yoghurt, breads, cheeses....you name it. My husband took full advantage and ate his way through around 14 eggs benedict in 4 days. The dinner in the Buffett venue was also very good. Every type of dish available, huge king prawns, as many as you could eat. In general I wouldn't urge anyone to stay in Las Vegas unless they love gambling however, I would suggest Bally's for value for money if nothing else. If you have got the dough, stay at Caesars Palace...or at least shop there!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: Cartman88
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Bally’s from Fri 25 May to Mon 28 May (Memorial weekend) after getting a nice deal through Expedia for around $109 per night. We had read some of the mixed reviews about Bally’s so did have some concerns about what we may end up with – we did call a few days before arriving to request a North Tower suite and make sure we got non smoking. We checked in around 8pm on the Fri we arrived and the clerk said all they had was South Tower and smoking rooms. After a couple of minutes she did manage to find us a suite that met our original request. The suites were actually very spacious and the bathrooms in particular was very large. The suites were clean and had all the standard amenities you would expect. The bed was quite hard which some people may dislike. The walls are a bit thin as we could hear constantly talking and laughing in the next room – wasn’t too bad though. The best thing about Bally’s is definitely location – right in the middle of the strip and within a few minutes walk to many of the major casinos including: Planet Hollywood Paris Bellagio Caesars Palace Flamingo The Mirage They also have a free shuttle that regularly goes to casinos under the same ownership such as Rio. The dealers in the Bally’s casino were very friendly and seemed to genuinely feelbad if you lost a hand. We didn’t really get time to check out the rest of Bally’s such as the shops or restaurants. We did have breakfast at the Big Kitchen which was nice but nothing special. The self parking for Bally’s can be very confusing and is actually some distance from Bally’s. You actually park at the Paris and walk back through to Bally’s. If you are coming in from Las Vegas Blvd it is ok but if you come in via Audrie Street it is very easy to miss.

Reviews.Title: “great stay at Bally's”
Reviews.Author: luvvacay
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Bally's June 5-8 and had a great stay. We stayed at Bally's last December, and did not hesitate to stay there again. This time we had a room in the North tower on the 6th floor. Not much of a view, but the room was very nice, with a sitting area, mini-fridge and counter, and large bathroom. The room was very clean and the furnishings were in good condition and looked newer. Had some luck at the Bally's casino the first night (slots and table games). We went to the Price is Right show, which is in the Bally's theater. It was about 90 minutes and was entertaining, although we didn't get to "come on down". If you are a Bally's guest, the tickets are 25% off. The location of Bally's can't be beat, and there is a free shuttle to/from the Rio if you want to check that out. The casino isn't the biggest, but it's easy to get around. Pool was nice and not crowded, although many of the lounge chairs were broken. The gym was nice and never crowded, but it did cost $22/day to use it, which I thought was a bit pricey. I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Just Ok This Year”
Reviews.Author: fernh
Reviews.Content: I am 57 and my husband is 61. We have been traveling to Las Vegas once or twice a year since 1973 and have stayed at many hotels there. We have stayed at Bally's for the last few years because of price, location, and quality. Our days are usually spent at the pool and the evenings are usually spent gambling and seeing a show. We have always been pleased with the rooms at Bally's and, also, the pool area where we never have any trouble finding chairs. That's the background. Now, as for this year...we checked in at the airport on Sunday, around 6pm. I had requested a king bed, high floor, north tower. The person checking us in said, "no problem, I have a nice room with a sitting area on the 21st floor". I asked if it had a king bed and she said yes. So I thought that there was no problem. I was wrong. The room was large and it did have a nice sitting area. The bed was a small queen size murphy bed that was pulled down from the wall. There was a kitchenette on one side of the room and a door to a connecting room on each side. I realized that this was the living room area of a suite. This was totally unacceptable so we called the front desk to complain. They said that the hotel was totally sold out and we could change tomorrow. I then went down to the front desk to speak with them personally. They said we could switch to a room with 2 queen beds on the 19th floor tonight and then they would give us a king bed room with a really nice view the next day. We could stay in our room and check in to the new one between 1-6. I asked if she knew exactly which floor and room that would be on and she said yes, the 16th floor. OK, we switched to the room with the two queens for the night. The next day, on our way back from the pool around 3:30, we made the switch to the new room. However, it was not the room with a view that we were told we were getting, it was a room on the 14th floor with a view of Paris and the parking lot. When I complained that I didn't get what was promised to me, I was told that the people had not checked out of the room that we were supposed to have. OK, at least we had a king bed which was comfortable. The pillows were small though, and, after staying at hotels in other cities who have upgraded their bedding, I think It's time that Bally's gets with the times. A corner of one of the chairs in the room had stuffing coming out of it. Our major complaint were the drapes which did not block the lights at night all along the top. Maybe they were hung too low. Also, the windows were filthy. The room was nice and large. The bathroom was nice and clean. Towels were very thin. This bathroom had a makeup mirror attached to the wall that I could adjust and that was great. The showerhead was OK, needs updating. Never a long wait for the elevator. Now as for the pool area, we had no problem getting chairs. However, we had to spend some time looking for ones that weren't broken. We were there last year at the same time and the water was warmer. this year, both pools were cold. It still felt good. The last day we were at the pool felt like kids day. The smaller pool is the "jacuzzi" with room for 50 people. Unfortunately, some parents use it as the kiddie pool and there were a ton of kids in there on rafts, floats, or just splashing each other. Their parents could not have cared less at what their kids were doing. Anyway, would I return to Bally's, sure, for the right price.

Reviews.Title: “Meh. Many errors made by Bally's staff”
Reviews.Author: zigs777
Reviews.Content: I just got back from my bachelor party and we stayed at Bally's. I had a lot of fun with my buddies but was really disappointed with Bally's service. We requested our rooms be in the North Tower (newly renovated section of the hotel) and close to one another. Our rooms ended up being in the SOUTH tower and all on different floors. One buddy got the key to his room and there were already people checked into it. It took him nearly 2 hours of talking and waiting around for the problem to be resolved. The part of the South Tower we were in was not as bad as some people make it out here on TripAdvisor -- the room was clean and the bed was very comfortable. (On a non-smoking floor) We reserved a cabana by the pool for Saturday -- when we arrived they said they had 'left messages' for us saying that 'we were bumped for a 7 star' (which I assumed was a high roller) ---this was the one thing I was really looking forward to for my bachelor party and they told us, in those words 'we were bumped'. We waited for about 20 minutes for a manager that never came down to speak to us and hopefully offer us some kind of compensation -- then we were told they had made a mistake and then walked us to our cabana. Okaaay. Thanks for wasting our time!
