Leaving Bally's we asked our baggage be brought to us so that we could take it to a cab -- 15 minutes later they couldn't find it --- 5 minutes after that it magically reappeared. I have stayed at the MGM Grand and at the Mirage in Vegas and both places were FAR more 'with it' than Bally's. Granted -- the location of Bally's is great -- you have quick access to the Bellagio and Caesar's at an affordable price -- but sometimes it's worth paying a little more for a hotel that knows how to serve its customers.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with a great location”
Reviews.Author: Can_Cancun
Reviews.Content: Got a great rate with a Hot Deal and stayed from Monday - Friday. Excellent location if you want to walk the strip and visit the other hotels. Check in was easy, room extra large with king size bed, bathroom also clean with nice amenities. We had a view of the strip and the Bellagio fountains. We liked having the elevators to the rooms close to the entrance of the hotel as our feet were tired by the end of the day. Pool was nice, but nothing spectacular. Being attached to the Paris hotel & casino is a real bonus. In terms of gambling, we found the Ballys machines to be very tight and prefered to go over to Paris and play the machines. Food court was nothing special - we tried the pizza and ice cream. Paris has more selection for places to eat. We stayed at the Luxor on Sunday night and would recommend staying at Ballys over the Luxor if you like convenience.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Bally's”
Reviews.Author: hey_that's_mine
Reviews.Content: I recently returned from the annual APA Congress. This year it was held at the Bally's and Paris hotels in Las Vegas. I stayed at Bally's and I brought my mom with me to enjoy a vacation while I worked. I have stayed at Bally's prior to the Harrah's take-over and I must say, I was really impressed this time. Every hotel employee I encountered was extremely polite and helpful. I had a room in the North Tower on the 11th floor. The room was clean and the beds were comfortable. I never had to wait more than a few seconds for an elevator and even with the large number of conventioners, I never waited more than a few minutes for a table at any of the restaurants. The next time I return I will try to stay at Paris only because I've never stayed there before, but if Paris is not available I won't hesitate to stay at Bally's.

Reviews.Title: “Bally's - a pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: rcbtravels
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 4 days in Vegas and because of a very large convention in town we were unable to stay at the hotel we normally go to. I had my reservations after reading the reviews but would just like to say my husband and I were pleasantly surprised by the helpful staff, large clean rooms (ask for the North Tower) and the easy access to the Paris casino. Our bathroom was large and updated and the room had an ok view. No, Bally's is not in the same category as some of the other hotels across the strip - but neither was our bill at check-out. Do you really spend much time in your room when you go to Vegas? All in all, I would recommend Bally's to anyone wanting a nice, comfortable room with a friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Bally's sucks!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ceeniebinks
Reviews.Content: We booked Bally's as it was listed as a three star hotel. Upon checking in, this was certainly not the case...The hotel is permeated with cigarette smoke from top to bottom. The pool is actually quite dirty & poorly maintained. They also play loud music by the pool all day long, with an added bonus of an annoying DJ on weekends who plays rap music ad nauseum! Our room had a hole in the wall behind the TV, the smoke detector was dangling from the ceiling, wallpaper was peeling off the walls, & the glass doors in the bathtub eventually came off the track. The only thing this hotel has going for it is that it is on the strip & beside Paris which is lovely. We did not eat anything in Bally's restaurants as they all looked mediocre. Thank god for Paris! I am sure they will be blowing Bally's up in the next few years but until then, don't book a room here!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: JupiterGirl
Reviews.Content: Bally's is centrally-located on the Strip, and that was my primary reason for choosing to stay there. There's a monorail stop that was convenient for me to get to my conference location, and for my traveling companion to do tourist-y things on her own. The room was very clean, though not lavish. We had everything we needed for our stay. The room looked like it had some upgrades done, esp. in the bathroom and the workspace. The carpet still looks dated, but it was clean. The price for this hotel is a good value for its location and for the quality of the room. It's not a WOW, but you won't be disappointed if you want a clean place to stay with everything you need.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Myntcat
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a three night visit to Bally's - I was a bit nervous due to the mixed reviews bit shouldn't have been. Check in was a breeze and we received exactly the type of room we asked for.I found all the staff members to be outstanding - polite and professional. The mid strip location can not be beat and the connection to Paris hotel is a plus.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, great location”
Reviews.Author: ruby22
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Bally's for three nights last week. We were a bit skeptical because of the mixed reviews here but everything turned out great. We had a nice room on the 23rd floor with a view directly facing the Bellagio fountains. The room was very large with a comfortable bed, a desk, loveseat and coffee table. The bathroom was also spacious and clean with granite on the countertop, floor and tub surround. We ordered room service a couple of times and thought the food was good, but not great. Excellent service though. I cannot comment on the hotel pool, spa or restaurants as we didn't use those facilities. Overall, I would definitely stay here again. The mid-strip location was great!

Reviews.Title: “Bally's rivals any luxury hotel in Las Vegas!!”
Reviews.Author: zambukamum
Reviews.Content: After reading mixed reviews about Bally's Las Vegas, we decided to stay there this May for the Kentucky Derby on the 5th. We try to stay in a different hotel each May that we visit. We found it very exciting to stay in a hotel that was built in 1973, and was the original MGM Hotel and Casino! We had been staying at the newer luxury hotels, but thought this would be a pleasant change and we were not disappointed! We were greeted very friendly as we had a 11:30 PM check-in. Our room was in the North Tower, and as soon as we opened our door, we were so happy! The room was huge! We had one king bed, seperate sitting area with a couch, love seat, coffee table, and another area with a table and four padded chairs. There was a sink and fridge near the bed, and a very spacious bathroom. The shower was very powerful, and plenty of hot water. We stayed on a non smoking floor. The Casino hosts were gracious and helpful. The casino floor was not crowded and the ventilation was great. I sat next to a smoker at the machines and wouldn't even know it, if I hadn't of seen them smoking. We saw the Price is Right Show, which is so much fun, you should try it. Room Service is a definite plus! We ordered the Filet Mignon, which in actuality was enough to feed two people, as was the Cobb Salad. Service was prompt and efficient. Upon checking out, we were directed to the VIP check out and were told that our room service bill and two of our nights were "complimentary" based on our play! They went out of their way to be sure to take care of us, we didn't even know we were entitled to these things, but the staff did! It is amazing, all I played was penny slots and my husband the sports book, and we got all this. I can't say enough about how well this hotel treats their customers, and the high quality of service. I think this hotel rivals any of the new luxury hotels, and would HIGHLY recommend this to anyone. Let alone the history factor involved with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed there in May 2007”
Reviews.Author: Crammer
Reviews.Content: We just returned home from staying at Bally's in Las Vegas. If you should go there, DO NOT stay in rooms in the South Tower that end in 06. They back on to the elevators and you do not sleep any at night as you hear them go up and down during the hours you should be sleeping. They also have weird bathrooms. We were moved the next morning to the North Tower and everything was great after that. I would stay again, but not in the South Tower. We did not eat at Bally's so I can not comment on the food service. The staff, though, were very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly good.”
Reviews.Author: Sunnyhoney00
Reviews.Content: Surprisingly good. We had a spacious room with a good view. The double sided desk was good for working, a separate comfy chair with reading lamp. The marble bath area was large. There was a separate vanity area. Plenty of closet/drawer space. It's easy to get everywhere from this central location. We had the north tower and have stayed at more expensive hotels that had less desirable rooms and staff. The check in/out staff was courteous and quick.

Reviews.Title: “View vs. Room Quality”
Reviews.Author: cmurphy1210
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the 2nd time 4/07. On check in we stated we would like a room in the North tower because of the refinished rooms. We were given a room on the 5th floor looking directly at the Flamingo's parking garage. We went back to the front desk to see if anything else was available, there wasn't in the north tower. We were given the option of switching to south tower, which we deceided to do, and I was glad we did. The room was definately dated, but it was clean. The view was awesome, and that is important to me when visiting Vegas. We were on the 27th floor with a view of the strip. The Eifel tower was right outside our window, and we had a side view of Bellagios fountains. Just something to consider when checking in if there are no rooms with a view in the north tower. Another note- stayed here because of a convention. Not my first choice of hotels in Vegas. For a little more money you can do a lot better. The biggest advantage to staying here is it's mid strip location.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in a crazy city”
Reviews.Author: Dolmi
Reviews.Content: Bally's is where they stay in "Honeymoon in Vegas". The real place does not have a pool but apart from that it's a great place to stay. We booked a month in advance, paid around 70 dollars a night and had a huge room in the North Tower at the 16th floor with enormous beds, a sofa and a gigantic bathroom. Everything was very clean and fres, with lots of towels and toiletries. I have never been to Vegas before, and if you prefer a theme hotel or more extravaganza you should probably book at another place since Bally's don't have a theme. We thought it felt nice to come home to a relatively neutral place, though. More: The check in queues were loooong but there are many desks open so it was OK, and there is an express checkout. The hotel is connected to Paris and there is a free shuttle every 30 minutes to Rio.

Reviews.Title: “Had a Great Time at Bally's”
Reviews.Author: ScudderFLA
Reviews.Content: I was a bit concerned about the quality of the rooms after reading some reviews. When we got to the hotel, we requested a NORTH TOWER room, high floor. We got it without a problem. The room was huge! Modern decor, clean, comfortable bed, a lot of space to relax as it had a dining table and a sofa bed - in addition to a queen. After reading some of the reviews, we were pleasantly surprised and very happy! The service at Bally's was quite good! Front desk staff were very helpful. Houskeeping was good and consistent. Never had a problem at all. We had breakfast in the hotel every AM ... fairly good. The Asian restaurant and the Deli (for lunch) were excellent! Other than this, we ate at other places. We did venture over to the South Tower, and the decor in the hallways was older and not as nice as the North tower. We suspect that the rooms there were not as nice. The casino was large and smoke did not bother us at all. The live entertainment there was great! We got a great price on the Hotel's website (approx. $100 per night) and were very happy with the selection. Bally's was in the heart of everything on the strip! We had a car, so that didn't matter too much. Valet service was very good. Had a great time at Bally's and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Drew69
Reviews.Content: This was my second time to stay at this hotel and I will definatley stay here the next time I return to Vegas. The price given the location is brilliant. I would highly recomend this hotel. Try to get a room in the North Tower, I hear that the rooms in the South Tower are not that nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay in a Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LasVegasGalWausau
Reviews.Content: We booked a room at Bally's because our friends who would be with us were going to be staying there. We checked in at 11:00 am and was given a room upgrade for $25 a night. The room was one of their older suites, but it had the most beautiful view of the strip and the Sierra Nevadas. It was clean and the bed was comfortable (as I immediately took a nap). The bathroom was HUGE and clean. The only thing was that this room had not been updated yet and the furniture was a bit worn. Housekeeping was excellent and they were even concerned when we chose to let them clean every other day as we wanted to conserve water. I used the exercise room at the spa and while expensive was worth it. They included bottled water and towels at no extra charge. Had their buffet on saturday morning as it was less expensive and less crowded than the Bellagio's. You get what you pay for, the food was good but not outstanding. Overall it was a good stay and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “good value, good service”
Reviews.Author: 1037wolf
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our trip to Las Vegas. Stayed at Bally's for four nights and was very pleased with the service, friendliness and efficiency of the hotel. You really need to stay in the North Tower, we were on the 8th floor, non smoking, and it was very, very, nice. Very basic, not a luxurious setting, but very adequate and clean. Housekeeping was excellent. A very good value for the money, but if you want something really upscale, go next door to Paris. They are connected, but you don't have to pay the big price. A very enjoyable stay at Bally's.

Reviews.Title: “Bally’s – loved it, great stay”
Reviews.Author: myinfo
Reviews.Content: I also stayed at the MGM, but since this was my 11th trip and I was staying 9 days, I wanted to finally try different hotels. So I choose Bally’s due to location (mid-strip) and cost. I stayed April 8th, 2007 for 3 nights.. Room – 7325 – South Tower I got a good deal at $59.00 per night for premium rooms (North Tower), but I choose the South Tower (older rooms) because I wanted a view of the Bellagio fountains. The South Tower is not fancy and has not been renovated. Which I was aware of. The hallways are kind of dim and seem to have the same ceiling light fixtures from 20 years ago. The carpet was a dark brown color and the walls were beige. I opened the door and the room was huge, many people say they are the largest on the strip. There were 2 queen size beds, white linens and a brown throw, dresser, TV, table with 2 chairs. They could have fitted a sofa and love seat, the rooms are that large. The bathroom was very cleans and just fine. The View was beyond beautiful. I couldn’t wait until dark to see the strip lit up and the fountains at night. See link to room photos: http://travel.webshots.com/photo/2845319360098700899zaVprn?vhost=travel The personnel in the entire hotel were very friendly and helpful. I attended the Price is Right show which was corny and fun. If you get a players card before you purchase ticket, you will receive a $10.00 discount. I also enjoyed the short walk from the room to the strip. If you want a fancier room, choose the North Towers. If you want a great view try the older rooms in the South Towers. I would stay here again in a minute. The hallways were very quiet, we never heard a sound.

Reviews.Title: “Beware before booking "Hot Deal"”
Reviews.Author: LeighW
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Bally's April 10-13th, 2007. I have to say that for the price, it is a good deal. You won't find anything less expensive middle strip during the week. I called Bally's the day before we were scheduled to arrive to see if I needed to let them know were we coming in kind of late - 9:00 PM. The girl I spoke with said it was no problem, especially since we were arriving on a Tues and there were no big conventions in town at the time. We did the hotel check-in at the airport. As soon as we told the lady at the counter that we were staying at Bally's she got a real negative attitude and told us they always overbook and that we would not be getting a king non-smoking room, they were all sold out on those. Then she offered to put us up in a very nice suite at the cost of $100 extra per night. I told her no thanks, we would just take whatever they had and maybe change rooms the next morning. Fortunately, the room did not smell like smoke so that part was OK. When I checked downstairs the next morning real early, they did have king non-smoking rooms available but my husband and I decided not to move rooms, as it is a hassle, and it did not smell bad. I think I learned from this that even though they have available what you have requested, if you have booked it at their really good hot deals rate, they will tell you at check in there is not that kind of room available and try to make you pay more for a nicer room. The room they had us in was in need of renovating, as the tiles in the bathroom were coming off in places and it looked very old. But for the price we paid, I did not expect the Ritz. Bally's is in a great location and with the way it is connected to Paris, it is easy access to shopping and the Paris casino. We did take a tip from a previous trip advisor review and walked behind to Koval street and went to Ellis Island for their $4.95 steak dinner special. It was an excellent meal and their machines were loose. We liked that place. I would stay at Bally's again because of the location, but we do prefer the Flamingo if we are staying in that area.

Reviews.Title: “Bally's, Better than Expected”
Reviews.Author: jpaducah
Reviews.Content: This is my first review for TripAdvisor. I had comp rooms at Bally's April 8-11, and was a bit apprehensive about the trip after reading the usual negative reviews many people seem to post (and not only for this property). I was pleasantly surprised. I arrived late Sunday night and was immediately checked in. I asked what upgrades were available and was offered a large suite in the North Tower for an additional $50 per night, which I accepted. The room was huge, the amenities were upscale if not opulent, and the hotel was VERY quiet. I have stayed off strip (at SouthCoast) my last two trips and enjoyed those stays also. Bally's is an older hotel now and showing some signs of wear.....but....my stay was a genuinely pleasurable experience. Did I win in the casinos......another story!

Reviews.Title: “An Awesome Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: SHERONJENNINGS
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Bally's 4/10 until 4/13/07 and had a great time. It was my first trip to Vegas and choosing Bally's was a good idea. I had a few reservations because of the bad reviews about service and smoky rooms, but I had a FANTASTIC TIME, the staff were all great, check-in and check out was a breeze. I stayed in the West Tower room 2096 and it was fabulous. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “okay”
Reviews.Author: kymberramone
Reviews.Content: This trip was March 31st thru April 4th. This trip was my boyfriends first experience in Las Vegas, and for me I normally travel to Vegas twice a year. I let my boyfriend make all the arrangements, I was a little scared but he did a good job!. I stay only at TI when I come to Vegas, but again I let my man make all the arrangements, after reading a few reviews on Tripadvisor regarding Bally's, I was a little nervous. Also after looking at pictures of the rooms I didn't know if I was going to be real happy with this stay but my boyfriend had received coupons for 3 free nights @ Bally's, so all I could say to myself was it's free. We didn't actually stay at Bally's until April 1st. When we arrived at the hotel, I advised my boyfriend that we should get in line early to check- in, it may be a long line, we arrived about 1:30 got in line maybe 6-7 people in front of us, so I told my boyfriend to ask for North Tower (per reviews) I went to gamble while he stood in line. He comes to tell me that the room will be ready in 15 minutes, ( I was shocked) when we were told check-in was at 4pm, I was really surprised. Meanwhile he goes up to the room to wait on our luggage, I go up maybe 20 minutes later, scared to see this room, as walking up the hallway I was like okay not bad, I opened up the door to see our room, it took my breath away, I was really surprised. I have this big thing about being able to walk around the room with my shoes off and if I can walk around with my shoes off then it's okay with me. And Bally's you are alright with me, as far as that is concern. Don't get me wrong, I didn't have many problems with my stay, but a few small things. My first thing I wasn't happy with is that the next morning we got up to go to breakfast, when we returned our room was cleaned and bed was made up, but they didn't change our sheets, I thought that was tacky. My next complaint is I know this might sound a little anal but I like a view, no view North Tower. Last thing, (dang) why is it such a walk to the pool? But over all it was a okay stay, if the price was right I would stay again, only if the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Large Room Clean, Comfortable Quiet”
Reviews.Author: georgiagin
Reviews.Content: You know, it's always scary when you read on this site the good and the bad reviews. You think to yourself, which experience will I have? Should I do this? Should I not. But in the end, price won out. And I'm so glad it did. For an average of $74/night via Hotels.com we got a great room (only disappointment was the unavailable King Bed. had to settle for 2 Queens) It was clean, new, big, well lit. We stayed in the North Tower on the 21st floor. Central to everything. Loved being so close to Paris Las Vegas without having to pay their rates. I won $350 on a nickles slots the first night at Bally's so I was set up on day one for a great trip. We did most of our gambling at the Bellagio which was an easy trip across the moving sidewalks and escalators. We will be back. Due to me being sick on day one we got to sample the room service and while it's expensive (but then to us, all the food was!!) it was very fast, hot and tasty. We also sampled the buffet twice...once for breakfast and once for supper. The supper one was delicious. Nothing wrong with the breakfast, just not as elegant or expansive as the one in Paris Las Vegas. On the last day we sampled the small bakery/bagel place inside the casino and it was good too.

Reviews.Title: “really enjoyed my stay at Bally's.”
Reviews.Author: reid41999
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Bally's for four nights, April 2-April 5. I really enjoyed my stay. Checked in at the airport which was terrific and so quick and painless. Room was very spacious and well maintained by maid service. Definitely would go again and stay at Bally's. Also location couldn't be better. Right in the middle of the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location + North Tower = Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: GrandOhioTraveler
Reviews.Content: Arguably at the epicenter of The Strip on Las Vegas Blvd. and Flamingo Road, flanked by Paris hotel/casino and The Flamingo/Bill's Gamblin Hall Casino/hotels, across from the Bellagio, this place is all about location. Caesars and the Forum shops is a 15 minute walk only, too. Plus, if you can request a North Tower room that's been recently renovated, this is a decent place to stay. The table game area is inviting, not intimidating. Dealers try to make it a fun atmosphere. Food is just ok, nothing to brag about

Reviews.Title: “Ballys is great value for money!”
Reviews.Author: VegasBabyKent
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Ballys from March 13th to 20th this year and had a great time! On the first day as the hotel was fully booked they were only able to give us a room on the fourth floor so we were told to come back to reception the next day if we wanted a better room, although the fourth floor room we had was really nice anyway. When we went back we were given the option of upgrading to a jacuzzi room which we did. Both of our rooms were in the South tower and we fail to see why people would not want to stay here, we had magnificent strip views from the 21st floor which could even be seen from the jacuzzi in the room, behind this was the steam room. The central strip location with monorail station on site and bus stop outside is ideal for exploring Vegas. Last year we stayed at Hotel New York New York where we felt like just a number but Ballys staff were very friendly and accomodating and we would rather go back to Ballys where we felt very welcome indeed.

Reviews.Title: “Ask for the North Tower”
Reviews.Author: COSusan
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at Bally's for years. We love it because it is a little smaller. You can actually find other members of your party without sending out the St. Bernards. The coffee shop (they call it the Sidewalk Cafe now), has really good food at decent prices. On this trip, I found that the spa has been remodeled since I was there last, and is very lovely. It is worth the extra $20 a night to stay in the North Tower. Those rooms have been remodeled and are very nice. If you have a craving for a mega-hotel, you can step right over to the Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: PurpleToyLady
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Bally's because my company’s convention was there. I was told I would get the North Tower because of being in the event center the entire weekend. Not only was I put in the South tower against my wishes, the room I was in was so out dated it was scary. There were stains on the bed and the room had no real benefits. I was also told when booking that the internet was included, NOT TRUE! It was $12.00 for 24 hours. Every restaurant on site is so over priced it was scary. $24.00 for 2 slices of Sabarro Pizza & a pop! I am also VERY allergic to cigarette smoke & chose to attend convention in Las Vegas because of the new law preventing smoking in general areas & where children could be. I left with the worst Migraine I have ever had & my eyes almost swollen shut because I had to walk through a smoky casino to get to the event center. There was no way to get to the event center with out going through a smoky casino. Which I do not know is even legal! Our Convention is going to be there next year & if I even go, I will be staying at the Embassy Suites!

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed our stay in the North Tower!”
Reviews.Author: rochelle.alexis
Reviews.Content: I was a little nervous staying at Bally's because of the mixed reviews. But, we were very pleasantly surprised! We stayed in the North Tower. I think knowing this is important because we had friends stay in the other tower and were very disappointed. Our room was massive, two full queen beds, a rather large bathroom, plus a desk and sitting area. Note, there was no mini-bar in the room, but the ice machine was just down the hall. Also, when we called for more towels, it took 40 minutes. She did warn me that they were backed up, so I was prepared to wait. I can't fault them on the last point, it was one of the busiest weekends in Vegas (March 15-18, 1st weekend of March Madness). The only other negative about the hotel is that the pool is small and has weird hours. I think it closed at 4 PM one day. That being said, it was Mid-March and unusally hot!! The location of Bally's is ideal. It is attached to the Paris, next door to a large shopping center (I think Planet Hollywood is taking over the shopping center, but don't quote me on that!!) & across from the Bellagio. It truly felt like we were in the middle of everything. They also have a free shuttle to the Rio (which is across the street from the Palms). I must admit that we didn't eat at any of the buffet's or restaurant at Bally's, so I can't comment. There was a coffee bar in the lobby that was just OK. I love vegas and have stayed a handful of places up and down the strip. I think Bally's is one of my favorite locations for the places that I wanted to go and the things I wanted to do! I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “affordable stay in the heart of the strip”
Reviews.Author: 407Gator
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Bally's from March 20th-30th for a convention. We have stayed here every year, but I am finally writing a review! We were asked if we wanted to upgrade to a suite this year, so we said yes. It was in the South tower. It was a HUGE room, but there was very little furniture and no desk. We were here for a work convention - and had two laptops that needed a spot. The bathroom was pretty much IN the room - with a big tub in the middle and stairs leading up to it. It was odd - very outdated, but I was fine. Then I took a shower (it was behind the tub) and since the bathroom was in the room, there was no steam buildup and it was cold in the room, but hot with the water. I didn't like this at all. The shower was also dirty looking. Then a motion light triggered since the tub was up a few stairs. My husband gets up a lot in the night, and the light kept waking me up. After one night, I was done. We asked to move rooms. We moved to the South tower, where we stayed last year. The rooms are very nice, new and remodeled and large. I was much more comfortable, and we had two desks! A work desk and a makeup type desk. We also had a loveseat. The hotel is not the most impressive as far as The Strip is concerned. We had friends at the Bellagio across the street - that was much nicer and impressive. But we paid half of what they paid. We went to the pool at the Bellagio with our friends - it was gorgeous, clean, I wanted to skip classes and stay there all day. Then we tried the Bally's pool. We were spoiled by the Bellagio and it made it seem like the pool at Bally's was awful. It was crowded, chairs all messed up everywhere and it smelled like a fraternity house after a late night party. Sour beer and vomit. Yuck! Won't be going back to the pool. It was always closed in years past since we were there early in the season. But you could use the pool at Paris in years past - we just never did.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay as always”
Reviews.Author: eagletrailer
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Bally's for the fifth time in the past four years March 25 thru 29. As always, everything was fine. The room was large and clean, what more can you ask for. Saw Vinnie Favorito and Anthony Cools, laughed til we cried! Ate dinners at Bellagio Buffet and Spice Market Buffet, both worth the money. Ate dinner at MGM Grand buffet, it was more plain jane but food tasted good. Played slots and video poker everywhere between Tropicana and Treasure Island, lost everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Bally's OK”
Reviews.Author: Traveler084
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Bally's and it was just OK. Our room in the North Tower was large and clean. Called room services right after checking in to get a refrigerator sent up, but was told there wasn't any on the property. They need to stop advertising that they have refrigerators. The food was OK but the prices are way to high for what you get. The restaurants away from the big casinos are priced more reasonable. We did not see any security guards during our entire trip. I didn't like this. Anyone coming off the street could have had access to our room. The wait staff in the casino was a little rude. Just trying to get a soda turned into a 30 minute wait. We will go back to Las Vegas, but I don't think we will stay at Bally's.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay during March Madness”
Reviews.Author: mst2432
Reviews.Content: Las Vegas: Ballys Hotel - "Great Stay" March 29,2007 Reviewer: mst2432 - Arvada, CO Stayed at Ballys last weekend for March Madness and was very happy with everything the hotel had to offer. Checked in at the airport - one employee very rude, the other very accomodating. Got a free upgrade to the North Tower and the room was ready when we got to the hotel - around 11:00 a.m. The rooms in the North Tower are more udated, but seem smaller than the South Tower rooms, especially the bathrooms. Had no problems with the room - the safe had a low battery, and was not working properly, but maintenance was up and fixed it within 15 minutes. Both the Indigo Lounge and Tequilia Bar were fun. The band in the Lounge plays until 4:00 a.m. on weekends. Flight did not leave Monday until 3:00 p.m. - called and got a late check out for 1:00 p.m. with no hassle. This was the 3rd time I have stayed at Ballys, and it continues to be a great hotel for the price. Going back in July and staying at Mirage - can't wait!

Reviews.Title: “Dated - not thematic - but great location and price”
Reviews.Author: slce123
Reviews.Content: Casino host at Paris VERY NICE but Paris booked so put in room at Ballys. Connected - short walk. Good location to Ceasars and other locations. Tram stop in hotel. But was told remodeled - maybe 50 years ago? Wallpaper peeling - moldings all scuffed up. But beds were very comfortable - room very large. Bathroom dated but adequate. Windows very dirty. Couldnt tell how view was actually.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, lovely room”
Reviews.Author: The-V-Man
Reviews.Content: Had heard many dodgy reviews about this hotel but decided to go there because it was cheaper. Was in the most perfect location directly opposite the Bellagio and interlinked with Paris. Check-in was no longer than 5 minutes and we were taken to our room straight away. Room in the North Wing was surprisingly spacious, modern and had two queen beds. Bathroom was also lovely with marble floor and tiles. The lobby, shops and restaurants were also great. Casino was very old and smoggy compared to the others but we weren't in Las Vegas just to gamble it was more about the sights and shopping for us. I am glad we chose this hotel and would gladly go again!

Reviews.Title: “Bathroom Play”
Reviews.Author: 3boys2much
Reviews.Content: We couldnt believe it. We heard people going pee all the time. I think they had probably a party with alot of booze. I loved the band on the weekend. Didnt love the food very bad and the We R Nuts cashier was very rude. On to the next hotel going back in August.

Reviews.Title: “Stay in the North Wing”
Reviews.Author: coastlove
Reviews.Content: Bally's North Wing was updated a few years ago and is very spacious with full marble surround tub/shower in bathroom, two queen or one king bed, eating area, safe, good beds and nice, clean rooms. We got a non-smoking room on a non-smoking floor. Las Vegas needs to have MORE of these available and guaranteed. This is our only complaint always on edge that we will get a smoking room!! Price is reasonable too. Check out several dates to get the best prices. The buffet upstairs at the Big Kitchen Buffet is excellent. More food that you could possibily want for $20. (all seafood, chicken, turkey, ribs, roast beef, 3 pasta choices, 10 salads, potatoes many ways, complete with lots of dessert choices). We especially like that the wait was only 10 minutes to pay, get a seat and help ourselves. Our friends were searching out 5 restaurants in their hotel and had to settle for a hamburg as the lines were too long everywhere. Las Vegas is very busy and seemed a lot more people visiting that 4 years ago. Fastest growing city in the U.S. The casino is busy, not too loud and the smoke is minimal compared with the older hotels to the north of the strip. Great location. Connector train is $5 one way or $9 round trip per person. If you have more than 2 people take a taxi it's cheaper. Really think Bally's is the best for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Bally's not so pleasing at it may seem”
Reviews.Author: Rocknel
Reviews.Content: This past weekend was NASCAR weekend in Vegas. The hotels were jam packed full of people from everywhere. I had made my reservations sometimes back for Bally's, seeing how I thought, it was a nice hotel. We get to check in and I was not pleased at all. I had booked a non-smoking room and there were none available. The clerk said she would move us to a high rollers room where we wouldn't smell the smoke. I am a smoker and it was disgusting to me. Last fall I stayed at the Paris which adjoins Bally's. I would highly recommend Paris but I will NEVER go back to Bally's. The rooms were clean. The beds were comfortable. The service in the hotel was horrible. The prices in the hotel cafe are really expensive. The entertainment in the lounge was awesome. Oh, the gambling wasn't too great either. They do not have lose slots.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in the middle of the strip - otherwise, not so wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Megalomac
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed @ Ballys for 2 nights and were underwhelmed immediately. We checked in around 6pm and had to wait in line 1 hour before getting our room. We requested a king bed with a few, but got 2 queens with absolutely no view. The desk clerk who acted as if he clearly hated his job also did no service to the hotels reputation. He offered to upgrade us for the low price of $100 (we paid a total of $60 for the other room) and didn't appear to care about any of our concerns. The room was adequate, but old and uninspiring. The bathroom was nicer than expected, but there was no fan (or it didn't work). This same room would've cost us $240 1 week later and I certainly would have lowered its rating accordingly. The Ballys buffet was one of the best I've ever had, but expect to pay $19/person for this privileg. You pay for what you get I guess. Though the desserts were bland, it didn't hurt the restaurant as I was full from all the other selections. Like other buffets on the strip, they have foods available from several parts of the world. Ballys is connected to other hotels via the Monorail. This train is a joy to ride as it's fast, scenic, and comfortable, though expensive. The problem with the monorail is you have to walk to the furthest end of every hotel to get to it. Save time & $$ by taking the excellent Deuce bus line. We discovered it on the last day we were there, but better late than never. Though the bus gets very full, they seem to come by every few minutes, so no need to rush to get on.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: lemmingstone
Reviews.Content: Last visit here was November 2006. We had intended to stay in the Excalibur as we were after a pretty central hotel to the main attractions on the strip. Fortunately for us there was a problem with our rooms and our travel agent booked us into Bally's 2 days before leaving Australia. I am very glad that happened. Very clean, large well presented rooms. Great service, buffet etc etc. No complaints at all. the location right in the middle of the strip was perfect. In 2005 we stayed at Circus Circus but Bally's wins hands down. Will definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A great base”
Reviews.Author: GlobetrotterSue
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Ballys for on week in February. When checking in I requested a North Tower room as I understood these were of a better quality. The receptionist obliged and said " I think this one has a nice view". She was right. We could see down the strip and had a good (though interupted by a tower) view of the Bellagio fountains. The first thing I noticed about Ballys was the noise associated with the machines. I found this annoying and therefore spent as little time as possible in the casino area. We were not here to gamble and therefore I can not comment on the comps. Back to our room...clean, spacious and well equipt. No trouble with external noise and decent quality blackout blinds so sleep is a possibility should you not be able to keep up with Sin City life. Ballys Big Kitchen provided decent quality food at a reaonable price. Nosh is great for a snack - the bagels were additctive! We experenced a different hotel each day and I recommend the Bellagio buffet, TI buffet and downtown Mainstreet Station buffet. The monorail leaves from Ballys and whilst I believe this to be overpriced, it does provide a quick and easy means of navigating the strip. Taxis are reasonably priced and plentiful. Ballys is old fashioned but very well placed on the strip and is fairly priced. When in Vegas, very little time is spent in your base hotel so stay here and you will have more money to spend on bags and shoes at the malls and outlets!

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Austin, Texas (We're full...so come visit, then leave)
Reviews.Title: “Bally's: Bland and Boring”
Reviews.Author: ap3266
Reviews.Content: Bally's has some of the better room rates on the strip. Check their website for "Hot Deals" before booking from any other source. The casino was pretty good and seemed above average in payouts. The clientele was a little older than at some other places. All ages are represented, but they don't offer anything that most of the late 20's-early 30's crowd might be attracted to. Depending on what kind of experience you want, that might not be a negative thing. I would estimate there is, overall, about a 2-to-1 grandma in a motorized scooter-to-hottie ratio. In other words: If you're coming to Vegas to find or make something happen that will stay in Vegas, Bally's is probably not for you. We stayed in a luxury room in the north tower. It was huge and farily comfortable. I wasn't thrilled with the couch and upholstered seat. They looked a little on the dingy side. However, the king sized bed was very nice. It looked and smelled clean. The bathroom was good. The hot water got to lava-like temperature in no time. I would update the shower head. No matter how I adjusted the flow, it was either too little or wide. I would also update the bath to the curved shower curtain for a more luxury style feel. Downstairs in the Tequila Bar, it was a little overpriced ($9 for a margarita). The mixed drinks, while flavorful, lacked their expected potency. Bally's has a steakhouse and some sort of Asian restaraunt but we did not eat there. They do have a buffet with a great view of the Strip. Based on the atmosphere, one might expect the food to be fancy and really good. It instead was about average on taste and quality while above average on price (about $24/person for dinner). They also feature a coffee bar. The price of a large cup of regular joe was $4. The coffee bar also sells pastries, which average $3-4. As far as entertainment, we did not see the Jubilee show. Instead, I bought tickets for "The Price is Right Live." Having watched the show my entire life, I was hoping it would be a special experience. Especially for $40/person. They advertise that "Everyone Can Play and Win" and that they use "Interactive terminals" at each seat. However, the operative word is "Can." Players are chosen at random based on correct responses using keypads to pricing questions on various products from various years. Four people chosen at random based on the correct response move forward to check out the next item up for bid, and then the winner of that goes up on stage to play one of the trademark pricing games. There were 3 different sets of 4 contestants and then two chosen at random based on more polling to vie for the showcase. I was disappointed that I got nothing out of the game other than 90 minutes of watching several other people guess the wrong price on stuff. They also have a lounge which is immediately adjacent to the casino. It's not in a seperate room and not very intimate. Live music plays nightly until 3-4AM and the bands were fairly good, which is a plus because the lounge is basically open to the casino, the music flows out everywhere. The sign in front says that there is a 2-drink minimum for entering the lounge. First, if it were in a seperate area away from the casino and lobby I would find that acceptable. Since the lounge is connected and open except for some railings and half-walls, I can stand outside and look in to watch and listen to the band for free. Which is probably the better choice because the seating in the lounge is very limited. People had to move tables out of the way to make dancing room so the amount of room to "get jiggy with it" was limited by the few people "getting their groove on." The age group in the lounge was decidedly 40's-50's. If it was a larger style venue, I could see it possibly attracting a younger set, or at least more people and increasing the probability for a younger set. I did not see any wheelchair ramps for grandma into the lounge, so that was a factor as well. Outside, there is a moving walkway that connects the main lobby to the strip. Bally's is also connected to Paris Las Vegas, which has a better paying casino especially during late nights, was less crowded and less smoky. Bally's bills itself as "The Classic Vegas Experience." I would describe that as accurate. While they do have good lodging rates, they also charge more for other things, but it certainly is not cost prohibitive.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: BordaInc
Reviews.Content: I am 27 and vist Vegas roughly 4 times a year or more for either business or pleasure so I have stayed at many of the hotels on the strip. So far I like Ballys the best for all around entertainment, location, quality, tables, value and more. Bally's has the following: Advantages: Location (connects to Paris) Food selection Table games Nice and clean beds/room (ask for the remodeled rooms, they are superb!) Rooms are very quite Fun atmosphere Connects with Paris Priced right (sometimes) Disadvatages: - I did not like the bar/club scene at either Bally's or Paris - Tends to be pricey sometimes We had a great time staying here and would choose Ballys again in a heart beat. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Janasayqua
Reviews.Content: The check in was fairly fast, and we requested the North Tower but got the South Tower (not sure if I needed to tip him?) so I was a bit disappointed, but when we got to the room we had a great view of the Bellagio fountains and a nice view of the Paris. We ate a few times at "Nosh" for a quick bite to eat and enjoyed the slots. I got my hair done at the Regis Hair Salon but it was a pretty long walk from the South Tower. I would recommend staying here for the first trip to Vegas because of its great location and the escalators are easy on worn feet, but I will not be staying here again. We want to try something new.

Reviews.Title: “First time Vegas trip”
Reviews.Author: Highlandscots
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Las Vegas and we chose Ballys because of it's central location and excellent price. After reading the reviews over many months we quite often thought "have we made the correct decision?" and hoped that we got a good room in whatever tower is best. We arrived late on the Tuesday night, too late to check-in at the airport, so took a cab directly to the hotel. Upon check-in we were given a room in the south tower at no extra cost so decided to keep our mouths shut and check out our room. Upon entering our room we noticed all was not quite right. The pillows on the bed were a bit crumpled and empty juice bottles were lying about. The rubbish bin was full and then on opening the wardrobe we found some clothes! We immediately contacted reception and were instantly moved a few doors along to an identical room but this time it was spotless. Wow, what can we say! The rooms in the south tower are great. We were worried after seeing pics of the north tower, but our room was huge, with 2 king size beds, and high quality furnishings plus a very nice marble bathroom. We stayed here for 3 nights and for only £45 per night it was most definitely good value for money and we would not hesitate to go back again, but we do fancy trying Ceasers Palace the next time.

Reviews.Title: “Descent!”
Reviews.Author: traveler5Chicago
Reviews.Content: We were in Vegas for the NBA All-star game and stayed at Bally's and had a descent stay!! I was nervous after reading all the previoius reviews about how people were not pleased with their stay at Ballys but I must say our stay was nice. I was even able to check in early and not be charged, the young lady at the front desk was very nice and the room was clean!! The carpet wasn't new neither was the furniture but it was clean and that is important to me!! I can't stay anywhere shabby and unclean!! We were in the north tower on the the 18th floor now seeing as how I had a descent room I would stay at bally's again!! I can't say anything about the food or other services there because I actually wasn't in the room a lot, ok guys we are talking vegas and who wants to stay in there room!! The bathroom was clean and floors were nice, so all in all it was a nice stay, even though they raised the prices on all the hotels in vegas that weekend, which was why I chose ballys because their price was one of the least expensive and it was in the middle of the strip which made for getting to and fro a lot easier, and I am one who doesn't like to stay in anything less than a 4 star hotel, I was alright with ballys.

Reviews.Title: “A room prefilled with PEOPLE!”
Reviews.Author: xaiuz
Reviews.Content: I booked a room on the night of Fed 20th and when I got to my room there were people inside! It was really a horrible experience. I would never recommend this hotel to someone who cares about their privacy. When I went down to the desk to see about another room the front desk worker, Hazel, told me this happens every once in awhile. She didn't seem concerned at all! Stay away from this hotel. They don't care about their guests.

Reviews.Title: “Ballys - always dependable”
Reviews.Author: mkpingree
Reviews.Content: This was our 5th trip to LV and our 4th time to stay at Ballys. As always we never encounter any problems and always have a great time. We were comped 2 nights and paid $69 a night for the other two nights. We were in the North Tower and our room overlooked the strip with a slight view of the Bellagio fountains, the Rio Casino, Caesar's Palace and Barbary Coast. Room was clean and fresh as always and everything was in good working order. This was our second stay in the North Tower. We prefer the South Tower because we generally have a better strip view but were certainly not disappointed. We had sandwiches at Nosh and several meals at the Big Kitchen buffet. We are huge fans of the buffet and have never been disappointed. We spend most of slot machine gambling at both Bally's and Paris and ended up breaking even for the trip. There's certainly nothing spectacular or breath taking but everyone is friendly and it's never been too crowded.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms and amazing location”
Reviews.Author: kroshkaxx
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at Bally's in April of 2005. We chose to stay here because we were traveling on a budget and this hotel offered lower rates than some of the others in the area. First of all, our room was great. It was extremely spacious and clean. The service at the hotel was great as well. One morning, we ordered room service and the breakfast was just beautiful and very tasty. Secondly, the location of the hotel was perfect. It's close to all the main attractions on the strip - across the street from the Bellagio and a very short walk to Paris. Although this hotel is not one of the major 'theme' hotels, all the action of the strip is at your fingertips. Would recommend this hotel to anyone. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: CharlotteStaffs
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Bally's in August 2006, it was the first hotel on a round the world trip. It's location is dead central, it's right opposite the Bellagio and Caesars Palace, it's also next door to Paris and the Barbary Coast. Our check in was quick and easy, we were soon up to an immaculate room that looked down the monorail towards the north end of Vegas. We really couldn't fault the room, everything was clean and new, there was lots of space and it felt comfortable. I think we paid about 70 dollars a night. There wasn't much to do other than gamble at the hotel so we got out and looked around the others for something to do. Bally's is attached to Paris which offers good eating options for breakfast. Drinks were a bit dear so we went next door to the Barbary coast, this was well cheap with free live entertainment, can't go wrong! Overall we liked Bally's, maybe we got lucky with the room, who knows!

Reviews.Title: “What a Super Holiday”
Reviews.Author: Flossies-mum
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the rather negative comments about Bally's Hotel in Las Vegas, it was with mixed feelings that we decided to go ahead with our Honeymoon stay there. (We had originally booked the Monte Carlo only to find out, 4weeks before we where due to travel, that there was a lot of noisy, dusty building work in progress) We had a super holiday , the staff where courteous and efficient especially Michael at the front desk. The room we where allocated was in the North Tower, very large, immaculately clean, quiet, and furnished to a very high standard. Houskeeping was excellent with fresh linen daily, and again the staff where helpful and courteous.( I might add that no one was aware that it was our Honeymoon so we did not recieve 'preferential treatment' just normal was more than good enough for us)

Reviews.Title: “Dirty & Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: kwiley3077
Reviews.Content: We were greeted with a friendly gal who asked us if we wanted to upgrade to a suite for $25/night. We accepted. The room was just ok. Kind of disappointed because the bath tub was dirty. Pretty gross. We were married in Vegas and after eating a terrible meal with horrible service at Bally's Steakhouse, the people in the next room were having one hell of a party. Screaming & pounding on the walls till 3 am. We started calling security at 11:00. They said they would send someone. Nothing ever happened. We called security again at 12:30am. Again they said they would send someone. It seemed like the party got louder. We did not get to sleep until after 3am. Bally's did not care at all. I do not recommend staying here, stay somewhere where they have better service and cleaner rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Loved The Room!”
Reviews.Author: allxth4tx1vexg0t
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel!! My family and I went down to Las Vegas during winter break for a little fun, and i LOVED the hotel room!! it is very very spacious, clean, etc. My favorite part of the room though, was the bathroom! it has marvelous marble floors, very very very wide sink/counter, and a wonderful shower! the towels were also very great!! also in the hotel room, i loved how they had really comfy sofa chairs and a very convenient table! the view however, was not so great. if you ever get a chance to stay here, i recommend paying a higher price so you can stay in the north tower. the north tower is better reviewed than the south tower. the south tower is the same building as the lobby/casino. Room service was VERY nice, caring to our every need. If we needed new towels, BOOM: they were there knocking on our door within the next 2 minutes. It is also located in the heart of the strip, which gives you fun write where you are!

Reviews.Title: “The truth on Bally's”
Reviews.Author: fidodidoChicago
Reviews.Content: OK, so you can't afford Bellagio or the Venetian. Have no fear, Bally's is here! The Hotel is old, mostly senior citizens doing the gambling. The in-room carpet is kind of mildew and old, no odd smells though. Bring your slippers, it is worth the price! Sheets were clean-cotton-white, bathroom was clean and also white. Shower was perfect. Beds were comfortable (and my friend has back problems, no complaints!).The location is excellent, plus you get a bridge to access Bellagio across the street, no fuss! The monorail has its station right at the Hotel. There is a passage from Bally's to Paris, where we had our morning breakfast everyday. The best feature was the view: we could see the Eiffel Tower and the Bellagio fountains show without having to pay a fountain-view room at the 5 star Hotel. A great stay, worth the price!

Reviews.Title: “Vegas Bally's hotel rooms unclean and unsanitary.”
Reviews.Author: love2travel1818
Reviews.Content: We came to the Bally's this week for a few days prior to a conference we were attending. At check-in they offered to upgrade us to a suite for $25 a night which we accepted. The room had a great view, the bed's were not so comfortable and the furniture was circa 1975 in look and durability. But, this did not bother us as we didn't spend much time in the room. The problem arised when on day 4 we decided to take a bath in the jacuzzi tub and found small hairs all over the bottom of the tub. Disgusting and unsanitary. When we called the desk they offered to either move the room or send housekeeping up. This was not acceptable as we spent 4 days in a room that was obviously unclean and who knows what else was present that we may have missed as I do not thoroughly inspect all crevises of a room when checking in. We had to escalate this to the manager on duty asking simply to be refunded the $25/night upgrade fee for our entire stay. She refused saying that since we did not notice the problem till that day then they would not do anything for us. We considered this silly and unreasonable since the problem existed all along. If you are considering staying at Bally's think twice. There are many other beautiful options on the strip that are clean, up-to-date and have staff who are friendly an willing to do whatever it takes to make your stay a pleasant one.

Reviews.Title: “Just as we expected”
Reviews.Author: elizabNorthDakota
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Bally's in the North tower, room 1670. View of the parking garage. We didn't have any trouble checking in or out. The room was clean with a small coffee maker in the bathroom. A welcome addition since it was not listed as a room ammenity. The food was marginal and the buffet (Grandma's Kitchen)tended to have stale breads and desserts. Try the buffet at Ceasar's. It had less of a selection but the quality of food was far superior. We stayed at Bally's for a family wedding located at Ceasar's which is right across the street. We have 2 small children and I would not reccomend this hotel for kids. There is way too much smoke in the lobby/casino area. Everytime we asked for to-go cups for the kids at the Sidewalk cafe we were told to get them ourselves from the lobby coffee shop. This hotel's location is it's best asset.

Reviews.Title: “run-down room, horrid breakfast buffet”
Reviews.Author: beaujoe2
Reviews.Content: We are Diamond reward members, and were comped room for a slot tournament. Room was in North tower, old and outdated furnishings, track on closet door so worn out that it would not roll, check in at airport was nice. Our view was of parking garage. Strip location is nice, but it is a horrible contrast to other Harrah's properties. It seems very low-class compared to Caesars, Rio, etc. I also felt concerned that anyone could use the elebators and no security checked for room key even at wee hours of am. Breakfast buffet was $14.99 each, and was greasy horrible food.

Reviews.Title: “Bally's for Thanksgiving”
Reviews.Author: NeilBelfastN/Ireland
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights at Bally's , over thanksgiving, great location on the strip, nice big comfortable rooms (huge k/s bed), plenty of restaurant choices (from fast food to steak house), also when you stay here you are also staying at Paris Casino , the casinos are connected, found the slots very tight , so tight they almost put me off playing at all, hopefully just bad luck. The casino was very busy , as was the whole strip , and we felt slightly overwhelmed , so we spent more time in the room than we normally would. Luckily the rooms are excellent and a joy to be in .

Reviews.Title: “Christmas at Bally's”
Reviews.Author: macmaroon
Reviews.Content: This was the first time that my seventy-three year old mother and I have stayed on “The Strip,” and we didn’t know what to expect. We usually stay downtown, but my brother had never been to Las Vegas before, so I thought “The Strip” would be better for him to experience Sin City. I did a lot of research and concluded that the best place to stay would be Bally’s. They have a great location, right in the center of “The Strip,” as well as a reasonable price. I booked the room well in advance (April) for our trip at Christmas (December 24th-28th, 2006). Check-in at the airport was quick, as we arrived by plane at around 1:30pm and there was only one person in line ahead of us. When I made the reservations, I requested non-smoking, North Tower rooms. We both received North Tower rooms, but my mother and I had to settle for a smoking room, as no non-smoking rooms with two queen beds were available. I was told that requests made at the time of booking are not guaranteed by Bally’s (or most casinos in Las Vegas). While our room was still not ready by the time we arrived at Bally’s (around 2:30pm), we dropped off our stuff in my brother’s room on the fifteenth floor. Unlike some of the other casino/hotel’s my mother and I have stayed at (Golden Nugget and Eldorado-Reno), Bally’s does not have a security guard posted at the elevators to check to see if you are actually staying at the hotel. I didn’t like that at all. When our room was finally ready (around 5:30pm), we headed up to the twenty-second floor. When we got off the elevator, we passed a nice little sitting area before heading to Room 2235. We could smell the smoke as we entered, but we didn’t complain. The casino was full of smoke, so we would be smelling like an ashtray after an evening of gambling anyway. The room was very large, with two queen beds, a clock radio, a table, a writing desk, three chairs, a comfy chair, two bed ottomans, a television (with limited amount of channels) in a cabinet with remote, and two telephones. There was also an iron/ironing board, a safe, and an extra pillow in the walk-in closet. The carpet had a few stains on it, which may have been cigarette burns (I’m not used to seeing that). The view from our room looked west towards Bally’s South Tower and the Fountains of Bellagio Show. We could also see part of the Eiffel Tower, if you looked off to the side. The bathroom was large as well, with a wall long mirror over the sink. There were shelves under the sink with extra towels, face cloths, facial tissue, and toilet paper. They also provided a bar of soap, shampoo, conditioner, body lotion, and a shower cap. The shower was easy to operate, but did not have a handle to hold on to, which made it difficult for my mother. Unfortunately, the “sitting area” near the elevator was right beside our room, and we could hear all the noisy people who seem to hang out there. The first night they were yelling, screaming, swearing, and banging on doors all night long. They were still at it, even after we got up in the morning to do some early gambling (5:00am). The next three nights were not as bad as the first, as I think the alcohol and lack of sleep finally caught up with them. Bally’s is adjoined to the Paris Hotel/Casino through a walkway which gets very crowded, especially with the lineups for Le Village Buffet and some of the other restaurants and eateries. While the casino area at the Paris is very large, the casino at Bally’s is medium sided with a large gaming area separating the north slot room with the south slot room. None of us came away winners from the casino at Bally’s, but my mother managed to win a few times to cut her losses a bit. Both my brother and mother were able to get a free Bally’s sweatshirt for earning ten Reward Points on their new slot cards. I was not able to get one as I joined in 1996, oh well…. Parking is a bit of a problem at Bally’s. They share a parkade with Paris and it seems to be quite full all of the time. After being frustrated in not finding a parking spot right away, I learned a valuable lesson…PARK ON THE FIFTH FLOOR! It will save you from a headache, trust me! Check-out was very easy, and I was asked if I enjoyed my stay. I had mentioned about the noise and she said if I had phoned security? I told her what was the point, Bally’s did not have security for the elevators, so what could they have done. I did not get a response, so I left it at that. After taxes, the room cost $97.01 U.S. Funds per night for the four nights. All three of us thought the rooms we had were very nice. They were large, relatively clean, and quite comfortable. Despite the noise, if we were to stay on “The Strip” again, we would give Bally’s another try. However, I think we will be staying at the Golden Nugget next time, as the room was nicer and quieter!

Reviews.Title: “No robes/ toothbrush when you request, plus cracky noise all through the night..”
Reviews.Author: aiyaya75
Reviews.Content: Staying there for tournament, room for free, but service is not acceptable for this huge hotel and casino... without robes and toothbrush to provide and cracky sound from the door because of the wind, couldnt sleep all night......

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Stay at Bally's”
Reviews.Author: TravelerBaby
Reviews.Content: We were placed in the crappy tower of the hotel (apparently there is another, more updated tower). Everything in the room was old, beyond well-worn and looked unsanitary. When I look back at the pictures, I can't believe we actually paid to stay there! The room and the lobby are smokey. The best part of the stay was every time we left the hotel to go somewhere else. I would not pay hard-earned money to stay at this or any other hotel related to Bally's ever again. Just look at the pictures . . .

Reviews.Title: “Won't Be Back”
Reviews.Author: candid-TRIP
Reviews.Content: Booked a four-night stay here on Vegas.com after trying to book directly without success for Jan 1-5, 2007 based on location, price and other reviews. Requested two-bed, non-smoking room was "not available" on check-in after midnight; however, refused this and did get same in South Tower but last room in hall away from elevator. Requested North Tower based on advice and told could switch after 1st night but didn't bother. South Tower is very shabby, although room is spacious with clean bathroom and comfortable, clean beds. Poor room experience made us decide to skip any of Bally's restaurants and cut trip short for last night. Casino area is good but no way is this a four-star property. This was first rip to Las Vegas and a real disappointment, "Okay" at best. Recommend fantastic Aladdin buffet and shopping around the corner, and Barbary Coast midnight breakfast specials across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: tigerflounder
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Bally's for 5 nights in Nov. We had a great time. We upgraded our room without any hassle. The room was clean and attractively decorated. Bally's may not be as glitzy as some hotels in LV but when you can go enjoy all of the others that are so close who cares. We enjoyed being able to walk to the Paris and we felt like we got the ammentities of two hotels for the price of one. The location of Bally's is great, right in the middle of everything. When we go back we will be sure to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: VSR
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Ballys for a week while in vegas. We arrived about 2 hours early for check in and since this has happened before we always have been able to check in early. My husband went to the counter and explained we are a little early and the guy said we have to come back in 2 hours.... ok so now we have 2 big suitcases and no place to really go but the casino. We sat in a very smokey casino there and waited. The hotel looks very dated and the air is terrible. After visiting the other casinos while on our trip i realized that Ballys is lacking in good air exchange. You end up stinking of smoke. The staff was ok but not overly friendly. There is a tunnel connecting the hotel with the paris las vegas so we spent alot of time in that casino and having dinner there. We had a terrible experience in the Ballys italian restaurant that we wouldnt eat in the hotel again. The food was salty and just not enjoyable at all. Definitely check out the restaurants in the Paris if you are there! If you are looking for a place to just crash and you dont care too much about the smoke then ballys is a good cheap choice. Otherwise i would definitely choose the Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Very Rude Front Desk/ Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Kit45
Reviews.Content: My first time staying at Ballys. I booked my room through Ballys website. Important to note on their website, they have 2 different room options Deluxe or Luxury rooms. They use the same photo for both rooms but the luxury room says it has "spectacular views". I also called the hotel to ask them the difference between the two rooms and they told me the luxury room is renovated in the North Tower with a a great view guarnteed. I asked if I can have connecting rooms, they said absolutley. I booked the luxury room online. 2 rooms for myself and my family. I comfirmed it twice before I left. The Front Desk person was the rudest front desk person I have ever encountered in my life and I've traveled all over the world, been to Vegas numerous times since 1996. As she was checking us in I told her I wanted to make sure we had connecting rooms. She got very hostile with me and replied that they have no connecting rooms and the other room we booked would be 10 floors above the other room. She also said they had no double beds which we requested. I needed double beds since 2 of my family members were sharing a room..She told me very angrily there are no double beds available at all. Then I asked her what the views would be.. She replied in a very hostile and angry way that we would have no view at all. I told her I called to confirm and was told I was guarnteed a room with a view. She got very angry and snapped at me, saying the hotel gurantees nothing and we have no view. ... I then got very angry at this point. I told her in a nasty tone that is lie because on Ballys online booking, the luxury rooms come with a "spectacular view" .. I then said I called the hotel to ask the difference bewteen the Luxury and Deluxe room and was told all of the Luxury rooms come with a "spectacular" view and thats why I booked it and payed more money otherwise I would have payed less for the Deluxe Room without a view. So after that she says nothing and for about 10 minutes, types into her computer. We are just waiting there. She finally says, ok I found 2 rooms for you, next to each other with a great view in the renovated North tower..She said One with a 2 double beds and one with a King that you requested.. She did not even say shes sorry, she was still being very rude and sarcastic. We got to our rooms and everything was fine, large room, new furniture, very clean,, and the view was nice-nothing spectacular.-- side view of the Flamingo, wynn, stratosphere, ceasers palace, the mountains.. The huge positive for me is the location, connected to Paris, right center strip, near Bellaggio, Ceasers, Alladin. Easy to get around. I also like that the hotel is not as crowded as other hotels that are themed like Ceasers or Venetian. I ordered room service often, thought the food and service was very good. I ate only at Sidewalk Cafe. Thought it was nice, casual place to grab something for a quick bite. I did most of my eating at other hotels at Emerils, Top of The world, Mix The Negative for me is the rude and hostile Front Desk. The hotel really needs to improve their customer service. The hotels for the elevators are not so safe, anyone can get on them. You don't need a room key to access them. I found this to be unsafe for anyone traveling alone. The wait for a taxi at the hotel, takes forever. Not too many cabs pull up at Ballys. If you stay at Ballys don't let the Front Desk people put you into a room that you did not book or a bad room. Make sure you get what you payed for..Be sure to be aggressive and firm until they give you the room you booked. I would not be staying again, I don't care to fight with front desk people. A good hotel does not treat guests like that. Ashame could be a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly good”
Reviews.Author: NorthCoastTraveller
Reviews.Content: We've enjoyed compedand discounted stays at Harrah's previously, and decided to try one of the other hotels in the Harrah's family for our most recent trip in November '06. Bally's had a really reasonable rate, so we booked two nights, leaving the third night of our 4 day/3 night vacation free. Check in at McCarran airport was easy and quick, and we asked for and received a North Tower room. We opted to try the shuttle to the hotel ($14 for the two of us). After navigating to the correct exit, we waited in line for about 20 minutes, and boarding the 15 passengers took another 10 minutes. We took the "tunnel route" and dropped off passengers at Caeser's, Bellagio and Paris before finally arriving at the hotel. Next time, we'll stick to our usual cab transportation - maybe a dollar or two more, but so much quicker. Even during NAB we never had to wait more than 5 minutes for a cab. The room at Bally's had a view towards the Westin and the Wynn. It was a standard king room, one of the largest I've seen, a little worn around the edges but extremely clean. They changed out the bedding during our stay (new mattress pads) and the beds were even more comfy. The marble bath was nothing special, but nicely appointed with a mirrored wall and great-smelling toletries. We ordered room service twice, once for a late night snack and once for breakfast. Both times, it was delived within 25 minutes on a rolling cart with white linen and generous condiment selections. Breakfast was garnished with both the sweetest strawberries we've ever had and orchids. Service throughout our stay (and we ended up staying our third night here, rather than trying someplace else) was friendly and almost unfailingly impeccable. The only exception was a cranky server at the coffee stand in the lobby. We tried the buffet, which had excellent prime rib and desserts, and the deli in the shopping concourse, which featured Boar's Head meats and so was as good as expected. We now have two favorites in the Harrah's family!

Reviews.Title: “A pretty good deal, but not as good as it used to be”
Reviews.Author: tbrowntx
Reviews.Content: Bally's is still a pretty good deal in a great location, however ... We've stayed at Bally's numerous times over the last 13 years and I can see a slow consistent decline in the property for the last 2 years. One small example - our bed did not have a dust ruffle - the box spring was exposed (and we were in the North tower and I am a moderate level member of Harrahs' player's club w/ the perks associated). The furnishings are showing wear, and a lack of maintenance is apparent. Our shower head was pathetic - very little power and water spraying all over the place. The slots are consistently tight tight tight. The buffet is OK, but nothing spectacular. Harrah's ownership has taken much of the fun out of it - definitely lost the small perks and general upkeep of the past. We had a free room for a few nights at an off-the-strip property that isn't ranked in the same league as Bally's, and I found that property and room to be much more clean, inviting, comfortable and fun. One final word - don't waste your time and money on "The Price is Right Live". Gamble or eat instead...

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: ArtNYC
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from Dec 17 to 20. Had a room on the 25th floor in the North Tower. Room is big with sitting area and 2 desks. It's clean, quiet and nicely furnished. The only bad thing is poor television reception and very limited channels. I know one does not go to Vegas to watch TV but when I do, I like to have clear reception instead of seeing lines and flickering screen. Apart from that, I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant base of operations--good value”
Reviews.Author: croenenberg
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at about a dozen Las Vegas hotels, and was very favorably impressed by Bally's. The room was large, quiet and well layed-out. It had the modern features one needs (high-speed internet connection) but not the ones you don't (toilet telephone, plasma screen TV). Bally's central-strip location (directly across from Bellagio) is unbeatable. The casino has a relatively sane floorplan (i.e., you don't get disorieted), and a good variety of games and good restaurants. The breakfast buffet was comfortable and very good, with good service and a nice view, though not super-cheap among buffets (I think it was $12 for breakfast). Bally's is literally connected to Paris--an interior walkway leads from one to the other--so if you are fond of anything at Paris, you are, for all practical purposes, staying there when you stay at Bally's. If you want the ultimate in luxury, glitz, or youth appeal, look elsewhere--Bally's is relatively staid. But for most of us, Bally's will seem quite luxurious, very comfortable, and, if you get the room at the lower end of their price rage, a great bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location”
Reviews.Author: radiolysis
Reviews.Content: This was my third great experience staying at Ballys. The rooms are noticably larger than other hotel/casinos in Las Vegas. Plenty of room to stretch out and relax. The rooms are showing a little wear-and-tear; there was a red juice stain on the carpet and some wallpaper in the bathroom was peeling, but nothing horrible. The beds are also not the best but will do just fine. What i like most about Ballys is the location. Not only do they have a good casino themselves (very spacious and not very smokey) but they're connected via an indoor walkway to Paris Las Vegas. A totally different vibe is down that walkway. Ballys also features a stop on the Las Vegas Monorail so you have easy access from MGM Grand to the Las Vegas Hilton/Convention Center. Overall, the hotel/casino complex is very nice and refined. I will recommend this highly and will stay again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time at Bally's”
Reviews.Author: DramaQueen71
Reviews.Content: I got a really cheap rate at Bally's because I'm a member of their rewards program. We had a huge room in the North Tower. We didn't have a view but that was okay. The location of Bally's can't be beat. It is really at the center of the strip so anywhere you want to go is pretty much walking distance. It was nice to be connected to the Paris as well.
