To me Bally's was the perfect size. I got really lost walking around some of the other hotels because they are huge and there aren't a lot of signs. We have no complaints about our stay at Bally's all of the staff was friendly and helpful. We really didn't eat too much so I can't say anything about their restaurants but the buffet was good. The gambling was also good here I went home a winner thanks to their slot machines. I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again, all considered”
Reviews.Author: JoeGa
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 1st Bally's trip. Was either here or MGM due to best prices we could find for booking 2 weeks ago. Went thru Expedia to save some dough... tried to book directly w/ hotel via rewards card but they were not impressed and would not even come close to matching the Expedia rate. Almost drove me to MGM (which was cheaper) but wife wanted more central location, so went w/ Bally's. Booked North tower based on many reviews that said avoid the "run down" south tower (more on this in a moment.) Tip: if you fly in check in at Harrah's airport kiosk. No one in line at 1:30 p.m- in and out in 3 minutes. Arrived at hotel and glad checked in at airport- big crowds at front desk- can't comment on service. Room: if north tower is the best of Bally's, would hate to see south tower. Not that room our was bad, but it is showing some wear and tear. Clean though, and nice beds. But would not pay more than the $90 a night I got thru web. Room faced north for "great" view of roof , parking deck and air conditioners- get what you pay for there, I guess. The Good: nice, smaller more sedate casino; great location w/ easy access to Bellagio, Paris, Flamingo, C- Palace; staff seemed friendly, price/ quality for room ok. The Bad: breakfast buffet a horrible greasy mess ( Paris or Flamingo MUCH better for same price); Rewards card a joke- comps non -existant unless high- high roller; $3 a day to use room safe is silly. Would probably stay again though, unless I could get C -Palace or Bellagio for a super price.

Reviews.Title: “Cant Beat Bally's”
Reviews.Author: Tonyrosenalex
Reviews.Content: After reading many reviews of the hotel on this site we were hopeful we had booked a okay hotel in a great location and we were not disappointed. Check in and out was quick. We were worried when allocated a room in the South Tower but this proved to be un necessary as the room was a hit. Yes it was looking a little dated but was really large, no need to book a suite if all the standard rooms are this big. The room and bathroom (also good size) was kept spotless by the maids. We even had a side view of the fountains at the Bellagio. The location of the hotel is really good and link between two hotels was really excellent. The casino had plenty of low value slots and we did reasonably well. The girls bringing round the cocktails were really friendly as were all the staff we encountered. Having visited twice before and stayed at the north end of the strip Bally's is in a great position. We will definately be back!

Reviews.Title: “Prostitutes galore”
Reviews.Author: mexicangirl2
Reviews.Content: Some friends and my husband stayed at Bally's Dec 2nd thru the 5th. We arrived at the hotel at 11:30 but didn't get our room until about 5:30 PM. We entered the room to discover our toilet was backed up. Maintenance came right away. There was a huge group two rooms down from us that would party until 6 AM every day of our stay. I know this is Vegas & all, but come on now! The room next to us we would hear the guy next door actually going #1, and I have to say that the flushing of the toilets was very loud. Needless to say the walls are paper thin. The room was kept clean everyday so thank you to the housekeeping staff. They do charge you $3 a day to use the in room safe. Down in the casino, you can tell which girls are the "working girls" and if you think that the staff disapproves this, we actually heard one of the security officers (who was in uniform!) asking her how much. I don't belive in taking kids to Vegas but if you do please do not bring them to Bally's because of the prostitutes. I don't mean just one or two, I mean we counted at least 6 differnet girls that we saw. Bring platform shoes, short dresses, usually sat by themselves until they would see a man by themselves. I saw this happen many times. Shame on Bally's for allowing this to go on. There was a confirtation in the lounge Sunday night with a drunk girl and a man who was with his wife but the drunk got escorted out. We did have a good time tho, we did eat at the Steakhouse which was good but highly overpriced for what you got. We had a fantastic meal at a place behind the Barbary Coast Casino (which is right across the street from Bally's) called Ballisto Italian (Hole in the Wall) Restaurant. Great food, huge portions and fair prices for what you get. They even give you cappuccino (which was the best I ever had) after dinner. We also ate lunch at the Rio (excellent)

Reviews.Title: “Prime Location for all the Action on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: jmcbreartyiii
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Bally's Las Vegas over Labor Day weekend and New Year's Eve weekend in 2004. The first and best thing to be said about Bally's Las Vegas is the location. The hotel/casino is connected to Paris Las Vegas, adjacent to the Flamingo and across the Street from the Bellagio, not to mention it is situated in the heart of the strip, equi-distant to the MGM on one end and the Venetian on the other. The casino was a decent size with plenty of slots and tables, and had an overall good vibe about the joint. The lobby was large and broad with check-in/out lines that were well staffed and moved reasonably quickly. Our room was average in size and quality as far as major hotel brands go and was fairly clean both stays. The hotel had a few places to eat including a steak house, a few chain restaurants, like Sbarros et al. There was a coffee shop-diner type eatery right off the main casino floor and lobby, which is where we ate our only meals on the premises (specifically, we ate only a breakfast or two and some late night drunk food, aside from room service). The hotel had several shops on the main and sub levels where we found an enormous sports book room. The hotel staff was pretty courteous and had promptly responded to our calls for room service. Lastly, the room was afforadble over Labor Day weekend, $89 USD a night (I think) and even more reasonable from $189 to $289 USD over New Year's Eve weekend, considering the prices of rooms in other hotels were going for $500 a night. All in all, a good stay. Really, you barely sleep while you are in Vegas anyway so the location and rates sell the room all on their own.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and pleasant rooms, good value”
Reviews.Author: pattie-supper
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay directly on the Bally's website. After looking through the reviews we were looking forward to checking into the hotel at the airport, but when we went to do this the girl advised us they were not taking check-ins for Bally's that evening - we'd have to do it at the hotel. Thankfully not much of a line at the hotel. I forgot the golden rules I read on here to ask for the north tower and a room near the elevator, but we must have been lucky as we got both. The room was clean, modern and a lot bigger than the one we paid a lot more money for at Luxor last year. The location is really great as you are centre strip and can pretty much walk to any of the major casinos. Do try their buffet for breakfast. It's not so large as the Paris buffet next door but we found the lines shorter and the food was equally as good. You get some coupons when you check in but none are actually for Bally's - mostly their other properties which they want you to visit. They especially push Rio so we decided to jump on the free shuttle bus and go for a look as we fancied seeing the Masquerade in the Sky free show. Unfortunately it was dark for a few days as they were changing it and we were going home the same day it started again. There were not any visible notices in Rio to advise it or anything on the promotional info in Bally's to advise so we felt a little disappointed about that. Was highly amused by the pub called "Tilted Kilt" in Rio. Being scottish it's funny to see their interpretation of a scottish theme - only things that are scottish is the name and the fact there's a tiny bit of tartan making up the waitresses uniforms!

Reviews.Title: “I remembered it better...”
Reviews.Author: Travelmom73
Reviews.Content: I have been to Vegas three years in a row, always in the fall. Last year we spent a night at Bally's and loved it. From that one night we received all kinds of free offers, and had alot of our food comped. When we booked this year, they offered us our room for free (upgraded in North Tower) so we stayed all four nights. Overall, I really like Bally's, but like I said, I remembered it better. The one thing that really bothered me was that most of the restaurants were closed entirely or at 3pm when we were there this year. The day before Thanksgiving, I couldn't see the excuse for this. The Sidewalk Cafe, which used to be (and is still advertised as) a 24 hour restaurant closes in the afternoon. And while the food that I did have there was excellent, the menu is decidedly very boring. Not a lot for choices. Three of the nights we were there, our choices to eat in the hotel were the Steakhouse (very expensive) or the buffet (which is pretty good, but who wants to eat at a buffet for every meal), or the Mexican pub/bar. Apparently this is now normal if you aren't there on a weekend. Also, we gambled substantially more this trip than our one night last trip but received only a fraction of the comps in the hotel. Last year most of our food for the day was free, this year I got a few dollars off a T-shirt. I'm attributing this to the change to Total Rewards, and the takeover from Harrah's. I can't really complain though, since our room was free. As a side note, I sent my mother and Grandmother to see Wayne Newton's Christmas show, and they loved it. Still raving about it now. We also stopped in to see The Price is Right live. Great entertainment value, although some of the prices seemed quite wonky. Lastly, if you want to go to an awesome (but affordable) buffet, the one at Harrah's is great. It's very easy to get to and the food is really good. I don't think I got to sample everything but I was stuffed and it was well worth it. Ok, really lastly. This was the first time we rented a car for entire trip - I've heard people comment about how intimidating the traffic can be in Vegas. However, if you avoid the strip at rush hour and keep an eye out for the kamikaze taxi drivers it's really not that bad. We saw more in these four days than the other eight combined. The self park garages are usually quite handy and if you want an easy listing of the locations for most of them, check out the transportation section of Vegas.com, their list is quite useful. Book your car early and keep checking - I got a luxury rental for $15/day just by checking it often and rebooking when necessary. You are allowed to do that.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing for free in the Bally's LV”
Reviews.Author: ibizznizz
Reviews.Content: When I looked at the Bally's I was given 2 options a cheaper and a more expensive room. The more expensive one was supposed to have HS internet access, that seemed to be free of charge. Well, in the Bally's nothing is free of charge. Internet is 11,99 per/24hrs. and using a toll free number will also be charged. Thank you Bally's, but no thanks.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the money...”
Reviews.Author: Dave148
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed there wirth friends for four nights. I booked it as a package with air through Expedia. It was about $100 cheaper vs booking it seperately. First off, if you're flying in, definitely use the airport hotel check-in. There was nobody in line. My room wasn't ready (it was 10 AM). But picking up keys later at the hotel was a breeze. I stayed in the south tower on the 22nd floor. The view down the strip was great. As previously noted on other reviews, my room was in serious need of remodeling. But my feeling is that in Las Vegas, I don't spend much time in the room except for sleeping. Based on the price I paid for the room, it was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Balls's has seen better days...”
Reviews.Author: PCTraveller
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the South Tower, 20th floor. I travel frequently and this was the dirtiest hotel room I have ever seen. It was filthy! Upon my arrival, a bedroom lamp was in the middle of the floor and unplugged as was the clock radio. The Internet modem had been pulled from the wall, bare wires showing. The engineer who came to fix that was a little embarrased about the condition of the room. There were crumbs on the carpet by the windows, not my crumbs, which were still there on my departure day. The shower/tub had hair in it and a used band-aid was stuck to a wall. These also were there upon both my arrival and on departure day, three days later. The maids did make the beds each day! There was no in-room coffee and, being from the east coast, I was up early yet even the coffee shops did not open untill 6:00 AM local time, the middle of my day. I resorted to a cab ride to McDonalds each morning for coffee. There is still a smell of smoke in the casino area, most likely left over from the MGM fire 26 years ago. I used to not understand why they blow up old hotels to build new ones. I know now! Thank goodness I was travelling alone this trip and not with my family and children! My suggestion, unless the town is full and you have no other choice, stay elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: natalie-77
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 3-night stay at Bally's. You really cannot beat the location: center Strip, across from Bellagio. It was the perfect location to begin our exploring every day. My husband and I traveled with two other couples and we are all in our early 30's. About the hotel: This is not a theme hotel but we didn't care. We wanted a great location and a nice room. And that's what we got. We had reserved a king, non-smoking room. When we arrived we were told that was not available and they upgraded us to a non-smoking suite for one night. We were told we'd have to move our room the next day or pay an extra $100/night to stay in the suite. We decided we'd move. The suite was beautiful with a huge sunken jacuzzi in the room and marble tile throughout the bath. Our friends were given the same upgrade for the first night. (Although, beware because another front desk clerk told one couple they'd have to stay in a smoking room. When they found out that we'd been upgraded to the suite without even having to ask, they pushed back and insisted they get the same and they did.) The next day we moved to a king, non-smoking room which was lovely as well. The bed was comfortable, the room clean, and the bathroom very nice. NOTE: I recommend getting a room in the North Tower where we stayed. It's more updated than the South Tower and apparently a lot nicer (our friends stayed in the South Tower the first night.) We ate breakfast twice at the Big Breakfast Buffet and were really pleased. For $12.99 the food and choices were excellent. There's an omelet station, pastries, fruit, breakfast meats, salad, pancakes, french toast. Bally's is connected to Paris which is a beautiful theme hotel. We went there every day for a meal or snack. There are a few quaint cafe-type restaurants there and, our favorite, the Creperie. It's a stand that serves made-to-order crepes filled with everthing from berries and cream to bananas and peanut butter to ham and cheese. They were delicious! That's actually the last place we went before heading off to the airport. Other things I enjoyed: We saw the Phantom of the Opera at the Venetian which was phenomenal. I have seen it 3 times before and loved every moment of it. My husband had never seen it and loved it as well. Our friends went to the Beatles Love cirque du soleil and couldn't stop raving about it. I also loved exploring the Venetian, Caesar's Palace, Bellagio and New York New York. All in all, I recommend Bally's. For the price, the location and rooms are terrific.

Reviews.Title: “NOT TAKING CARE”
Reviews.Author: yardenit
Reviews.Content: We were at the hotel 4 nights. It is in a good location and our room was o.k. toward the fountain. But we have some remarks: 1. We asked several times to raise the temperature of the aircondition in the corridor and the performance hall, and no one care. It was freesing. 2. Why to pay extra for the safe in the room? 3. No coffee maker nor refrigerator in the room. most of the hotels in the USA has it. 4. The signs toward the shops and the pool are not enough.

Reviews.Title: “Great location..ok hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelgetaway
Reviews.Content: Booked a package deal with Southwest Ailrine for three night stay at Bally's. Stayed Nov. 5 - 7th. The airport check-in was fast and easy. We did upgrade to the north tower for $20. I have stayed at other Harrah's properties thoughout the US and also gambled at their hotels. I always am comped the hotel room and usually meal vouchers too. Bally's did nothing as far as comps and in fact, were very stingy with comps. I would gamble elsewhere. New York-New York comped a four night stay on my last trip to LV, in a suite along with all our meals and I played less than I did on this trip! Hotel staff was pleasant up until the check-out time. Front desk was disorganized and not friendly. I ended up waiting so long to do a simple checkout, my shuttle to the airport arrived and I told the front desk employee to keep my players card and figure it out after I left and we walked out. Not real competent. Cafe had good food for lunch...not much night life. Rooms were ok...not as clean as they could have been. I'm pretty easy to please but found the bathroom mirrors were spotted and dirty and shower drains were plugged with hair. My friend ended up removing the drain stop and cleaning the drain with his pocket knife....gross. Windows to the room were filthy and if you did have a view it would be hard to see through the grime. The location can't be beat. It is conveinant to the strip and all the fun places to go. I probably would pay a little more next time and stay somewhere else, but for the price we paid, it was ok.

Reviews.Title: “Bally's Impresses Again!”
Reviews.Author: Ling12
Reviews.Content: Once again, Bally's impressed us beyond belief! This was our second stay at Ballys, and everything was perfect. We arrived very late on a Thursday night, and were given great rooms with wonderful views. The check-in service was immediate, and upon seeing our room we were very pleased! The sidewalk cafe, though with long lines, has a great breakfast, as does the buffet (they will make your omelettes to order). You are in perfect walking distance to everything, and visiting the Paris (which it is connnected to) is great. The marble bathrooms are wonderful, and the housekeeping service is impeccable. We had fresh towels and toiletries before we could blink an eye. The rooms are also huge compared to normal Vegas standards. Overall, I am not a huge fan of the city of Las Vegas, but we have had several weddings in the last few years to attend. I will never hesitate to stay at Ballys again. I don't think there is anywhere else I would stay, given the value you get for your money!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good breakfast buffet, has monorail station.”
Reviews.Author: 3kings1queen
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Paris last year and he really didn't care for it. We found ourselves walking through the short corridor to Ballys (they are connected indoors which makes it very convenient) most of the time to gamble there or take a shortcut to head North up Las Vegas Boulevard. One morning we tried the breakfast buffet and he loved it. Omelets made to order and just a huge amount of food choices. It was never super crowded (though we did go early). We decided on the next trip that the location couldn't be beaten and we would stay at Bally's. Ballys and several other LV casinos (Caesars, Mirage, Paris) share the Total Rewards card and I used it minimally on our trip when we stayed at the Paris. Well, even so, I kept getting free offers to stay in Vegas through the program so we decided to book a Trip and came out in early October to stay 2 nights free at Bally's. Though I enjoyed their casino and buffet, I wasn't too sure about the rooms since we hadn't stayed before. When we got off the plane, we used the airport checkin for Bally's and were asked if we would like to upgrade to a suite. After viewing the pictures they had we decided why not pay $100 to upgrade since we were already getting the rooms for nothing. WOW! I'm so glad we did. Our suite was gigantic at 750 square feet. There was a large living room area, large bedroom area attached his and hers sinks, a separate toilet, shower and in the very middle of the room by the bathroom was a jacuzzi tub. It was clean and roomy and we just loved it. Bally's location, I believe, is the best on the strip. It has a walkway that goes across the street if you want to visit Bellagio or Caesars and one going north if you want to head up to Barbary Coast, Flamingo, Harrah's, the Venetian and The Wynn. Also, as a sidenote, my husband loved that there was a small convenience store east of Barbary Coat that we could get reasonably priced items for our room (and not have to go to Bally's gift shop) and just cross the street back into Bally's. Also, It's right around the corner from Ellis Island if you want to try their famous food special there. We were going to move to MGM for our last night to see KA so we just video checked out and hopped on the Monorail from Bally's for a 1 minute tram ride to the MGM. To the east of the casino are stairs that lead you down to the lower level and monorail station. And guess what? There was a little shopping/food area down there by the spa I didn't even know was there (Sparros and other lower price food places) Who Knew? Overall, we thought for the price and location, Bally's was a good choice to fit our needs for this trip.

Reviews.Title: “Bally's is always a great choice!”
Reviews.Author: briehl01
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at Bally's Las Vegas for the second time. The big perks of this place are its location (middle of the strip) and price ($115 per night). We got a king room on the 23rd floor and it was incredibly spacious. The room included a king bed, desk, working chair, lounge chair, large bathroom, and a separate dressing area. The room was very comfortable and clean (housekeeping staff does a great job). The pool is nice - though I didn't spend too much time there on this visit. The restaurant selection is good - buffet, casual restaurant, Sabarro, coffee stand, and a few snack places - I visited them all and have no complaints. I am not a huge gambler, but the casino seemed very nice - same as all the others! One note - the vending machines on our floor did not work for our entire stay. I called and was told they would be fixed the next day -two days later, the machines were still broken. This also appeared to be the case on other floors. One afternoon, I searched four floors before finding a machine that worked. Overall, I would HIGHLY recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Bally's is a Great value !!”
Reviews.Author: keeprothestrz
Reviews.Content: I totally enjoyed my stay at Bally's. The location is perfect if you want to be on the strip. Close to everything and the hotel has a monorail station, which we used a lot. It was so easy to buy the monorail ticket / pass that I don't know why more people don't use it. We saved a lot on walking to somewhere else on the strip then you could always walk back to see the sights or ride back again. Beats the crowded buses. We enjoyed our meal in the cafe of the Bally's and also the sandwiches at Nosh were very good. I enjoyed having a coffee station in the registration lobby, we also used that quite often. Room service was reasonable and the portion size for breakfast was enough for 2 to share. North Tower room was newly renovated and was very nice. My pictures are of the front that faces the strip (right at the foot of the walk over) and also the view I saw every morning and night, this one is while the sun was setting. Nice shine off of the Wynn. The monorail is seen down in front and from Bally's it will take you to the Sahara end and the MGM end.

Reviews.Title: “Basic hotel, great location, nothing special”
Reviews.Author: Belasaria
Reviews.Content: If you want to have the best, lavish hotel room on the Strip, then take a pass on Bally's. However, if you want a basic hotel with a friendly staff and a great location, Bally's works fine. This was my second stay in Vegas and quite an improvement from the frustration I had while staying at the Excalibur. The lack of themes didn't bother me at all; actually, I found it refreshing. I stayed at Bally's as part of a small conference and paid $149/night. I was given a room in the South Tower, which worked out better because the first two days of meetings were held in the South Tower. I arrived around noon to check in; I didn't see the counter at the airport although admittedly, I didn't actively search for it. Bally's didn't have any King rooms ready, but said they could do everything but assign me a room. All I would have to do after 3 p.m. was go to the VIP check in and ask for my room key. I checked my bags with the bell captain; again, they were very friendly and courteous. After reading the reviews here, I was concerned about my room location. However, the room I received in the South Tower was clean and, while it did show its age, didn't smell like stale smoke. The problem I had was that the room faced Paris and I could hear the trucks on the loading docks in the early morning. There is no work desk, just a round table and four chairs; the internet service is expensive ($12.95/day) and took a few times to log in. As a business traveler, I found this a little frustrating since when I wasn't in sessions, I had to work. The bathroom was clean and had glass tumblers instead of plastic cups. The bed was okay; again, nothing extraordinary. The hotel's location is great. If you want glitz and glamour, Paris is connected to Bally's, with a great walkway filled with theme restaurants and shops. The shops in the Bally's area are okay as well. The Bellagio is across the street. The business center is located between Bally's and Paris and while the staff is nice, the center itself is lackluster. What was most annoying was that I couldn't plug my laptop in to print and none of the computers had a USB port for my flashdrive. The prices for computer usage are very high and since there is no alternative, you have to use their computers. The first two days of conferences were held in the Las Vegas Ballrooms in the South Tower. They were accessible from casino level via the escalator and, since I was staying in the South Tower, right off the elevator. The meeting rooms were kind of dated as well and the staff seemed a little slow to respond to technical needs. We later found out that Bally's shares ALL meeting services with Paris and the meeting services are based out of Paris. This becomes an issue if you're planning an event at the hotel and need a speedy response. The food and beverages for the meetings was typical hotel food; nothing outstanding for a lunch or breakfast buffet. The third day, our conferences were in the North Tower skyview rooms on the 26th floor. Be warned: if there are a lot of people going to conferences on that floor, the elevators will be packed and slow. I had dinner at the Bally's Tequila bar the first night and the food was decent. The wait staff was friendly and prompt. I didn't have dinner at the other restaurants in the hotel, opting to go to New York New York for one night and the Aladdin for the second. Overall, the hotel has a great location but isn't business friendly.

Reviews.Title: “not a bad hotel”
Reviews.Author: shot2pieces
Reviews.Content: my wife and i stayed at ballys oct 5-8. we were invited to a slot tournament there so we accepted their offer. the room had an ok view we did ask for the north tower after reading other reviews on this site. the one thing i forgot to ask for was a room near the elevator. our room was about as far away from the elevator as you could get and it was quite a walk, this hotel is huge. the rooms were serviceable, fairly large and clean though our room was showing a little wear. the check in folks were very friendly and even though the line was long it moved quicker than a lot of other properties we have visited. water pressure in the shower was non exsistant but this seems to be the norm at vegas hotels. overall i would tell people not to worry about staying here as long as they dont pay too much for the room.

Reviews.Title: “Bally's - Good Value, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Woodcell
Reviews.Content: This was a wedding anniversary trip for my wife and I and we stayed 4 nights at Bally's from May 21-25, 2006. We originally booked on the internet and could not confirm a non-smoking room so I called Bally's directly. They advised they could not guarantee non-smoking but to request it once we arrive at the airport as they have a reservation desk near the baggage claim area. When we arrived we asked about our room and were advised we were booked in the South Tower and the rooms were about 20 years old. The gentleman offered to put us in the North Tower for a small additional charge per night ($35 per night) which we agreed to and was non-smoking. Our upgrade gave us complimentary access to the "22nd Club" which provided a lounge where we could get a quick coffee, snack in the morning or a drink, hot snack in the afternoon. The rooms were clean and we had a south-side view overlooking Paris and we could see part of Bellagio's fountains. The great advantage of Bally's is it's central location on the strip and outside of Bally's they have walkways over the street to keep people moving (one goes to Bellagio's and the other to the Flamingo). We were able to visit all the key hotels and casino's. Some of the hotels such as Bally's also have people movers so you get a bit of a break from walking. We checked out Bally's pool but it was cool the days we went out and originally they told us we could use the Paris pool but when we got there, they told us no. Perhaps because Bally's pool was open. The Bally's pool is big and deep. The shops downstairs were not overly impressive. Try the Forum Shops or visit Paris next door. Everytime we wanted to eat at the Buffet in Bally's it was lined up out the door. Paris has lots of restaurants but they were generally busy too. A few restaurants that we tried included Jimmy Buffet's (north of Bally's) and Smith Wollensky Steak House (south of Bally's). Both have balconies or outside areas to watch the action on the strip and we enjoyed both. Paris is connected with a walkway from the Bally's Casino and is very nice to visit. We also went to the Western Grand Canyon, Hoover's Dam and drove through the desert to Oatman, Arizona. The drive on Route 66 from Oatman was really interesting going through the canyons and the Mohave Desert. Car rentals are very affordable in Las Vegas. If you haven't visited Las Vegas, Bally's is a good way to do it.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time”
Reviews.Author: robinv54
Reviews.Content: We just got back from Las Vegas. Stayed at Bally's for free as we were comped. We used our total rewards card while gambling and ended up only paying $60 for a 3 night stay, food and my husband's massage. Can't beat that. The room was in the north tower -- comfortable, roomy and quiet. I will always stay at Bally's.

Reviews.Title: “nice weekend in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Corgimom
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Bally's on a recent late September weekend. We checked in at the airport with less than a two minute wait (7pm on a Thursday evening). Our bags arrived promptly, but, oh that taxi line! Tip: Always check in at the airport - the front desk usually has a line. Bally's has been one of our favs in Vegas for many years. The casino is starting to really show some age, however. They've removed some of the slots (why?) and I only saw one big winner all weekend, so I assume they are letting this Harrah's property die slowly while they boost the other properties. Too bad. There isn't a better location center strip. This one is in the center of everything. Our room in the north tower (a King Suite) was awesome. There was a huge King Bed, a jacuzzi in the middle of the marble bath, a bidet, two vanities, a separate shower and a separate potty room. There was also a connecting bedroom with a Pullman bed, a conference table and another full bath. we really enjoyed our space. The only improvement needed was a little more power to the air conditioning. Tip: bring a large clip for the drapes - the lights on the outside of the building create a virtual daytime at all hours and you can never get them totally closed. The casino at Bally's used to pay us well, especailly the dollar slots. This time, we hit nothing and ended up cruising the strip to play our dwindling bankroll. We did use our comps at the Sidewalk Cafe (great breakfast) and at Al Dente, the italian restaurant. The waiter apologized for the noise inside the usually sedate Al Dente - they had two wedding parties at one time. Nevertheless, the food was outstanding. You can do a room charge or use your comps at any of the restaurants in Ballys, Flamingo, Harrah's, Rio or Caesars. One of the best secrets in Bally's is the Indigo Lounge. The band that plays Thursday - Sunday is awesome, similar to the Platters and 60s Motown groups. It makes for a great atmosphere in the casino. It is hard to find a seat at the table games in the evenings. Most were $10 tables. Take your walking shoes. Even though this hotel has a great location, it is a ten minute walk to get to the strip in front. Use the moving sidewalk and do everyone a favor by actually "walking" on the sidewalk. There are so many folks who block the way for everyone else by standing on the moving belt - the rule is "walk left, stand right". Mon Ami Gabi in Paris is the best location to see the Bellagio water show across the street. Ask for the patio and dress for Vegas weather. The wine selection and steaks are awesome here, but a little pricey. The Eiffel Tower restaurant is not worth the extra $$. Want to shop? The Desert Passage mall is next door to Paris at the Aladdin and has dozens of stores, not just "casino" attire. I'm hoping Bally's sticks around a little longer. We've enjoyed our trips to this Vegas oldie but goodie.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid the South Tower at all costs!”
Reviews.Author: NickiP
Reviews.Content: We made a last minute decision to join some friends for the weekend in Las Vegas. They made the booking for us at Bally's since it was the most reasonably priced room they could find at such short notice. We had the unfortunate luck of being placed in the South Tower. We had a room with 2 queen beds. While spacious, the room was really ugly and old. It looked like an ugly old motel room. The furnishings in the room were in really bad condition. The carpet was frayed at the edges and stained, the curtains and bedspreads were faded. The beds didn't even have bed skirts on them - the ugly box springs were exposed! The rooms desperately need to be refurbished. The only reason that I am rating the hotel Okay instead of Terrible, is because while old and ugly, the room was clean. If I had come to Tripadvisor beforehand, I would have known to ask to be switched to the North tower, but I unfortunately did not have the opportunity to visit the site before I traveled. So I just assumed that all the rooms at Bally's looked like the one we were given and hence did not ask for a room change. Now anyone reading this knows better!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: Leogirl809
Reviews.Content: Right in the center of the Strip, is where we stayed. Great location. Right across from The Flamingo and Caesars and connected to Paris hotel. The room decor/accomodations were average...but very spacious and the view was amazing. The price was about $200-250 per night and we stayed from Saturday thru Tuesday. The weather was crappy when we went, but we were mostly indoors drinking and partying. The hotel staff was very courteous and nice...always willing to help when I asked questions regarding where to eat or something like that. The casino was very crowded, which allowed for some great people watching:). Overall, I had a great stay in this hotel...again, spacious room, bathroom...average decor.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Bally's!!”
Reviews.Author: brunelle4
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Ballys, and we loved it! We read sone reviews about the 2 different sides, nort and south. Heard horror stories about the south, so we made sure to request the north. We were told we got the north because we booked directly through the Bally's website, and by doing so got the better room. The peolpe at the check in verified that. Overall it was a great hotel with a great location, and was also connected to the paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: amormomma
Reviews.Content: Bally's in Las Vegas is a great location on the Strip in Las Vegas, close to everything, easy to hop on the Deuce, great view(we stayed in the North Tower)-room was HUGE(king bed, 2 desks,love seat, oversized chair, coffee table, marble bathroom, 25th floor).Staff is excellent & very helpful-got an upgrade without asking / there at 10am & got into the room right away. We play slots and their selection was very limited-mostly tables-spent time in Paris better selection and there is a walkway between the hotels which is very convenient. Against our better judgement & the reviews we read here we decided to try our luck at the Big Kitchen Buffet for lunch-What a mistake! Food was terrible-everything was dried out, shrimp was watery and tasted like rubber, we tried the steak-it was overdone-couldn't cut it let alone chew it. We did try the Nosh(deli sandwiches-they were great-made to order and reasonable) From then on we went to the Paradise Island Buffet in the Flamingo every AM for brunch.Excellent food & staff & started our morning looking at the Wildlife Habitat they have there.

Reviews.Title: “Standard of rooms”
Reviews.Author: naulti91
Reviews.Content: Sept 8th 2006 Reviewer: North Wales, UK My friend and I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights. We would like to warn anyone who is about to book to take some advice. We booked a Deluxe room directly through Ballys website and on arrival we were allocated a room on the 71st floor in the South Tower, as we asked for a view of the Bellagio Fountains. Unfortunately, when we arrived in the room, it was old, grubby and a dirty coffee cup sat on the well-worn dresser. This was certainly not what we had booked. We immediately contacted reception about our dissatisfaction and were allocated another room in the North Tower on the 7th floor. This room was very nice, large and clean with a side view overlooking the monorail. So, beware, make sure you ask for a room in the North Tower and insist in getting the room you originally booked.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent prices and service”
Reviews.Author: fendifendi
Reviews.Content: We decided to extend our stay in LV and reserved a room for one night at Bally's. Our room rate was based on their Web Site's Hot Deal - and was very reasonable. The day after we booked our room the rate went down even lower and after calling Bally's direct - they honored the lower rate. All of their staff members were helpful in every way. Yes, some of the furniture is chipped and the carpets need cleaning or replacement. The decor in our room was attractive but showing signs of heavy traffic. We checked out their Buffet Restaurant - it didn't look attractive to us - and decided instead to walk over to the Paris for lunch - it was excellent and we had the $5 off per person discount that Bally's gave us. The shops in Bally's are not high end...stay at Bally's for the great room prices and gamble, shop and eat at the Paris. * Sign up for Total Rewards - after check in and you will be given a small shopping bag and a discount book that has discounts for the Paris Buffet and other perks.

Reviews.Title: “Quick Trip”
Reviews.Author: RRoskelley
Reviews.Content: Bally's is a somewhat aging casino, but the location can't be beat. Directly across from the Bellagio and connected to Paris, with Ceasar's not far away. The rooms were a bit out of date and not on par with the typical vegas lavishness, but if you plan on spending all your time in the hotel this is a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed”
Reviews.Author: Phippster
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 4 day stay in Las Vegas. Once again, I ensured we reviewed all hotels in our price range and found that Bally's had the most favourable reviews. Couldn't find the airport check-in (signs in Las Vegas airport seemed to be non-existent) and so decided to get the shuttle straight to the hotel and book in there. Queues for the shuttles were very short and only 30 minutes after paying our $5.50 one way trip were checking into our hotel. We asked for a North Tower room ($20 + tax surcharge) and one by the lifts (thanks to your other reviewers for that tip) and were given room 2103. Wow! Very big, very clean. Two queen beds in the room for 2 of use. The room could have quite easily accomodated 4 people. Only small disappointments were the view, as we were on the side of the hotel opposite Barbary, and lack of wardrobe space. Only one rack and quite low down so trousers did not hang properly, but to be honest the room was so nice it made up for that. My only other criticsm of the room was the very poor TV channel choices. Only about 10 in English. Now I know you don't go to Vegas for the TV but if, like me, you like to unwind before bed with some TV then you need the channels!!!! My small criticism of the hotel in general was the wait for drinks whilst playing the slots was quite long and the Big Kitchen Breakfast Buffet was rubbish! (hence my downgrade from Excellent to Above Average) Other than this, location is great, room was fantastic (don't forget to pay the $20 a day upgrade fee and ask for a room near the lifts otherwise your walk everyday will be a long one!), all staff were very friendly and I will DEFINITELY stay in Bally's again!!

Reviews.Title: “Bally's location and rooms are GREAT!”
Reviews.Author: lindanu
Reviews.Content: Did a lot of research prior to choosing bally's for our one week stay in Sept 2006. First impression was that it was a bit blaw, we were put in a South Tower Suite that was totally huge and completely outdated. Even the view of the strip didn't make this disireable. The next day we were moved to our North Tower King on the 24th floor. It was perfect. Great big room that was updated and the bathroom was redone in granite. We liked it alot. Bally's has a lot of older guests and although that didn't make me feel like I was in the 'hip' hotel, I did appreciate that I got a good nights sleep every night because there wasn't alot of commotion in the halls or adjoining rooms. The location is perfect! When you go for a walk you will have a lot to see. We considered the MGM as well, and although we were more impressed with the newness of the hotel and dining, we are glad we stayed at Bally's so that we could walk the whole strip and see a variety. Bally's adjoins Paris which was great. We preferred to eat at Paris over Bally's. Although we did find a Bagel at Johnny Rockets in the Bally mall. We never saw another bagel in Las Vegas. Overall I give this hotel three stars, however, because of the PRIME location I think it deserves an extra star. * * * * By the way, the Bellagio Buffet wasn't worth it. We loved the Paris Buffet for breakfast. Our favorite dinner was at Olives in the Bellagio because or table was outside overlooking the lake and the lights of the strip. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “1970's disaster”
Reviews.Author: barb1730
Reviews.Content: I reviewed all pictures before booking here because I am extremely picky. I like to stay at the best for my budget. The room was nothing like the internet pictures, and the internet did not list the picture as a suite or anything special so I thought it looked good enough to book. I also thought Vegas would be competive enough for all the hotels to keep up to date. I was very wrong. Room 6520 was nothing like the picture, and neither were other rooms we looked in at cleaning time down the halls. Our room has not been updated since the 1970's. The furniture was old, the bedding old and ugly. The quality of everything in the room just appeared cheap. Overall very unimpressive! Bar drinks were so much more expensive than other casinos we played at as well. We did find the staff friendly but that alone would never make me want to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Go Wrong at Bally's”
Reviews.Author: VegasGirlOhio
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Ballys from 8/20-8/23 for the second time in 4 months. Although the slots seemed tight, the property is a great place to stay. With access to Paris and then a hop and a skip on the escalator to the other Harrah's properties, you can't beat the easy access. The North Tower definitely is nicer with the marble bathrooms and easier access to the pool. After trying the ariport check in back in May and having a 45 minute wait in line, we opted to check in at the hotel and it was with ease. It took a long time to get a drink at a slot machine. The staff was nice on the floor though and would send a waitress my way if I asked. Use the "great service" button on the slots if you need anything. If you are an early riser, make sure you go to Barbary Coast for the $3.45 breakfast until 7:00. Barbary is right across the street from Bally's. Check out Happy Hour at the Tequila Bar! You can get a shot of Tequila and a Mexican Beer or, a margarita for $3.50! There is a singer in the lounge making it a lot of fun! Go to Bally's and have fun, fun, fun.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: eldoradolady
Reviews.Content: After reading many reviews for Bally's on TripAdvisor, I was concerned about having made reservations there. However, we were quite surprised. Airport checkin was amazingly quick. We discussed South Tower vs. North Tower with the agent and we decided to go for an upgraded room and pass on the view. The agent gave us a room on the 15th floor of the North Tower which had a decent view of Ceasar's and Rio - and there was no additional charge. The room was ready for us by the time we got to the hotel around 11 AM! The room was great (although I agree with other reviewers that the rugs could use an upgrade). The staff was outstanding and the location, of course, unbeatable. And the price ended up less than $100 a night - how can you beat it! Just a side note - I did a lot of research on hotel costs and found that AAA had the lowest rates for all hotels - they beat out Expedia, Travelocity, Hotels.com, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place to Stay in the Middle of the Strip”
Reviews.Author: cvg1mrj
Reviews.Content: If you want pirates or a taste of the old Rat Pack go elsewhere. If you want to stay near the middle of the action on the Las Vegas Strip but don't want to pay steep prices stay at Bally's. Bally's is in a great location. Only a few blocks walk from the Bellagio, Harrah's, Caesars Palace and other themed hotels. As a matter of fact Bally's is connected to Paris. If you like lower max bet tables The Barbary Coast is right next door. This is a very neutral hotel, no theme! Nicely maintained cansio and accomodations were good. When I go to Vegas I like that campy feel that the themed hotels give you. That is nonexistant at Bally's. If you want that... hit the streets. For the price I would certainly stay here again. It beats staying at the north end of the strip away from the center of the action. Save your money for the tables....

Reviews.Title: “Ballys , Looks good only from outside”
Reviews.Author: GayathriN
Reviews.Content: We were very excited about our first Vegas trip and decided to choose a very good place. We chose Ballys and unfortunately it wasnt a good decision at all. 1. The floor was supposed to be non- smoking but was stinking of smoke. 2. The carpets in the room need changing. 3. The worst was the bathroom. The sink had water dripping such that I was brushing in the tub. The shower wasnt at all smooth. It was strong like a huge waterfall and you almost ached all over after a bath. The only think good was the proximity as it was right on the strip. I wonder if thats worth the price. The town itself is pretty small and even if one stays slightly away and was driving and parking in some hotel, on the strip, it would have been the same. Really hated the place. I wont stay there again for free Gayathri New Jersey

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, attentive staff”
Reviews.Author: CfmTexas
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Bally’s Las Vegas on 09/14/-09/18. I will write the pros and cons as follows: Pros Location- centrally located and monorail station was a good thing to have. Staff- Very friendly and attentive staff Sidewalk Café- Good food, good and prompt service at any hour. Cons Room’s condition- the first room smelled like mildew. No coffee available in the room either. Found out that someone smoked in it and activated the smoke sensors, carpet was wet and the room got the smell. We were switched to another room- Jacuzzi Room and this one had hairs and mildew in the shower. The Jacuzzi had residue from previous users or from the detergent they used. We had a coffee pot in this one Internet access- it’s not free… you had to pay either per hour or per day… They have facilities with computers, printer and Internet access but you have to pay extra to use those. Pool- maybe it was because it was a weekend, but it was completely packed!! Would I stay there again? If I think about the service alone, yes. But I need to get a bargain this time because for $166 average per night, I expected a little bit more than what I got.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay in Fabulous Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Tyrone03
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Ballys Hotel in Las Vegas for 3 nights. When we arrived (late on the first evening) we were immediately upgraded to a very comfortable suite, and then relocated for the second and third night to a room with a fantastic view of the Paris and Bellagio hotels. It is worth saying to the check in staff what your requirements are. Matthew, who checked us in advised us that in order to secure the best views, a slight compromise on the quality of the room itself may be made. He was right. We had amazing views, from an adequate and clean room. Our only meal at the hotel was late ( on arrival) from the sandwich counter found in a corner of the lobby. It prompted us to eat elsewhere for the remainder of our stay. Overall we had a fantastic stay in Vegas. I would love to return, and would happily stay in Ballys for its excellent location, convenience, friendly staff and value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Rude and inflexible”
Reviews.Author: desertnomad
Reviews.Content: Booked at Bally's for only one reason. To stay at the last "deep" pool on the strip. Pool was closed when we arrived due to a broken glass in the pool. Within 1 hour of arrival, management refused to allow us to cancel any of our then four day reservation as a consequence of the pool closure. We were assured by management that the pool closure would only last "a day or two" and invited us to use the pool at adjoining Paris as a substitute. For the next four days we endured a 20 minute walk through the casino at Bally's, the main concourse at Paris, and two sets of elevators to arrive at the crowded, hip-hop blaring 3 1/2 foot wading pool of Paris. In summary, we have no direct complaints about the hotel. However, the rude and inflexible manner in which management dealt with our situation says litlle about the service one should expect at Bally's. Oh by the way, the pool did re- open the day after we left. We should have gone to Palm Springs.

Reviews.Title: “Rough Start”
Reviews.Author: tsaiware
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I booked a stay at Bally's from Sept 4-9. We arrived at around 10:30pm to discover the computers were down. Believe me, we were not the only people inconvenienced. We were told to check in our luggage and come back in 1/2 an hour. This continued until around 2am when they finally started checking people in manually, checking each room one by one according to the housekeeping lists from earlier in the day. Finally they offered up some rooms at Harrah's a few hotels away, or at the Rio (off the strip). We opted for the Rio, by the time we checked in there it was already 3am and being from the east it was already 6am for us. We heard later on that the computers came up around 11am the next day. The Rio was fantastic, if you haven't been off the strip, take the time to check out the few casino/hotels on Tropicana. See my Rio review: VIP Treatment. We called Bally's before checking out of the Rio because there was a four hour difference between check out and check in at both hotels. Bally's told us that we'd have to just wait until 3pm to check in. They didn't even want to hear about how we were "walked" over to Rio by them two nights before. We were comped the two nights at Rio and made our way back to Bally's. Before we even got to say anything to the gentleman at check-in he immediately told us that check-in was at 3pm and they were sold out for the night. I have to say that I was a bit cheezed by his statement. We walked up to him and told him that we were supposed to be here on Monday, NOT Wednesday, and that we were told we could get an early check in. Funny enough he suddenly remember a list, found our names and had a room in the north tower immediately for us to go to. The first thing we saw in the room was a note from management saying that the pool was closed for maintenance until Sept 9th and that hotel guests could use the pool at the Paris next door. If we didn't have a room facing the pool, we would have never known that it was reopened a couple days earlier. Besides all of this the rest of our stay at Bally's was great. The room was excellent, clean and had a great view. We could see the south end of the strip, along with the surrounding hills and the city lights. The room was tidied up every day. The location of Bally's was great too. We've stayed at the MGM before, but found it a bit of a trek to get back from the other end (especially after alot of walking). The casino is a good size, the inhouse band was very entertaining. The Big Kitchen Buffet was good, probably not as exciting if you've gone to Paris or any of the larger buffets. And the Bally's Steakhouse is a bit pricey but well worth the money. If it wasn't for the initial check-in fiasco, I probably wouldn't have a bad thing to say about Bally's. Plus only having to pay for three nights, instead of five was a bonus!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: octopussy
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Bally's for two nights at the end of August with two children. Was asked at check-in if we wanted to up-grade to a junior suite for 25 dollars a night which was worth every cent. The room was enormous and very tasteful. The hotel staff were friendly, the location's great and we liked it being a non-themed hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Choice”
Reviews.Author: FunkyG
Reviews.Content: My family (2+2 boys) stayed for 3 nights in August 2006 as part of out San Fransisco to Grand Canyon tour. Bally's is not themed, and is a little old fashioned compared to some of the bigger hotels. This is a benefit if you want a less hyped up holiday experience, as you can visit all the exciting hotels and return to a calmer place to sleep. The check-in took about 20 minutes, but after that, all was well. The room is larger than most standard Vegas rooms (useful if sharing with four people) and cheaper as they regard children as below 16 years. Most hotels treat 12 year olds as adults. The room was well appointed, very clean and recently refurbished. Although in the North Tower, we still had a view of the strip, and the Belagio fountains. The hotel is linked to Paris, where we ate breakfast and I used the more impressive casino. Whilst I would not encourage people to take children to Vegas due to the seedy atmosphere creted by the constant bombardment for prostitutes and strip clubs, if you are planning a family trip you could do a lot worse than Bally's. The buffet is quite good, and good value if you are hungry. However, the buffet at Treasure Island was better, and only marginally more expensive. It has a central strip location (probably the best position on the strip, and very important in the heat), and it is reasonably good value. In contrast, Circus Circus, which is touted as the family hotel, looks awful, and the actual circus acts are not that great. I would strongly recommend the Blue Man Group if you are considering a show and Bally's as it is a good general compromise hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Casino is great”
Reviews.Author: susbat
Reviews.Content: The casino was very good to me, but not so much to my husband, but he tends to lose all of his money anyway. We check in at the airport and that process went great. There were no rooms in the North Tower available so we upgraded to a suite in the South Towers because of all the reviews I read about the regular rooms. The suite wasn't ready when we checked in. It was 10 am and check-in wasn't until 3. Airport staff told us that the room would be ready at noon. At noon we went to the main desk who told us the room wasn't ready and to check back in an hour. Well the room wasn't ready then and were told to check back in after 30 minutes. This routine went on until 5 pm at which time they gave us a room key and told us the room would be ready by the time we got up there. It wasn't ready for another hour. My only complaint was that we had to keep checking back with the front desk but we knew that we weren't suppose to be able to check in until 3. The suite was very clean and spacious. The furniture needed to be updated because it was a little bit scarred, but overall was very comfortable. We had a beautiful view of the Eiffel Tower and the top of the Paris and its air conditioners. We left our drapes open almost the whole time we were there. We were very pleased with our suite and the maid service was excellent. The air conditioner kept the room extremely cool. A friend of ours who went with us stayed in a regular room in the South Tower. Her room was ready when we checked in at the airport. It was very big, nice and clean. She had a beautiful view of the Eiffel Tower and Paris' swimming pool. We probably won't stay there again because we had some allergy trouble while we were there (which we figured was because Bally's was older and reported to have some mold problems). I will definitely go back to their casino because the service was great and the other players were friendly and fun. Overall it was a great place.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Trip! Love Bally's”
Reviews.Author: abucklin
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked Bally's about a month before we went August, 17-20th. I used my Total Rewards and was able to get three nights for only $180 total. I was thrilled considering it was a weekend. We were in town for the Def Leppard concert at Mandalay Bay and needed a cheap place to stay. We have stayed at Bally's three times in the past two years and have never been disapointed. One time we got North Tower, and twice the South Tower. Personally, I like the South Tower better - only if you get a good view. They generally have better views if you get a high floor. This time we have agreat room on the 12th floor with a not so good view. We weren't in the room much anyway to care. The first night we got in around 8:00. Airport check in was closed for Ballys and Paris due to computer problems so off we went to the hotel itself after getting our rental car. We grabbed a quick bite at the deli outside the south tower elevators. Awesome sandwhiches. We charged everything to our room the entire trip so we could rack up some points and have comps taken off our bill at the end of the trip. I changed and went right downstairs to gamble while my hubby relaxed a bit. We met up around 11:30 and decided to roam the strip. Loved Margaritaville music and drinks. Loved Osheas drinks even better as they were so cheap. Did some people watching and went to bed around 4:00. We slept in the next day (I was hungover) and decided a late lunch/early dinner would be nice. Drove to Venetian in order to eat at the Grand Lux Cafe which was excellent. Ran into a problem all weekend with valet parking as everything was full except for hotel guests, but we actually had no problem parking in the hotel garages and lucked out with close spots everywhere. Home to Ballys for naps and then off to the concert. It was great! Explored Mandalay Bay a bit after and then I ended up gambling at Barbury Coast for 6 hours until 7 am (only losing $5). Stopped at Nosh in Ballys to grap a bagel snadwhich for me and hubby which he appreciated. Honestly, it was the best breakfast sandwhich I have ever had. Slept in again and decided to eat at Sabarro in Ballys downstains (yummy). Then off to do touristy (sp?) things throughout the strip. This included the MGM lions which were the cutest babies I have ever seen. We loved it! Also checked out the Shark Reef at Mandalay Bay and walking around Luxor and Excalibur. The Shark Reef was ok - mostly uneventful. I like the aquarium here in Baltimore so much better. Afterwards we drove home to Ballys and walked to Outback Steakhouse for a late dinner. Somehow whenever we come to Vegas we always end up eating at Outback for some reason. More gambling for me and then off to bed around 4:00. Woke the next day to check out and leave our bags with bell hop. Our favorite thing to do on our last day here is go to the highest deck at Margaritaville and spend the day looking out at the strip while enjoying some beers and awesome nachos. We usually get a late flight back home and enjoy the relaxing atmosphere. Traveled to the airport for check in and home we went. I am planning on going back again in December and will either we staying at Ballys again or Flamingo. Overall, we had a wonderful stay and loved the great location of Ballys and mostly the great rate!

Reviews.Title: “Dark old room in the South tower!”
Reviews.Author: Enii
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Ballys on the 29th and 30th of August of this year. We were given a room in the south tower. the bathroom was fine - old but clean. The room was clean enough but very dark, drab and dreary. Lukily we barely spent any time in our room. the pool area is very pleasant. We had a short line for both check in and check out. All in all we had an OK time at this hotel but I would not reccommend it to friends. There are far too many nicer hotels on the strip to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “Totally worth it”
Reviews.Author: weasel9517
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Bally's mid August. Being that it was our first trip to Vegas, I did a lot of research before deciding on someplace that would be nice yet friendly to our wallets. Our plane got in early, about 10:30 on a Tuesday, so I was a little nervous about not getting to check in. Upon arriving, the bellhops, took our luggage right away. At the check in desk, a gentleman by the name of Lloyd helped us out. It was very easy. We asked for the north tower and he said no problem. We asked if we could get in early, and he found us a room right away! The room was nice and clean. Sure it wasn't the nicest hotel on the strip, but I wasn't there to sit in my hotel room all day! I would stay there again because it was laid back and great location! If you stay here, walk to your south a block or so and check out O'sheas casino!!! So, if you are looking for value and cleanliness and a friendly staff...check Bally's out!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: knickfan10
Reviews.Content: Just completed a 3-night stay (Sun-Wed) at Bally's Las Vegas and had an enjoyable experience. Booked air/hotel package through Costco Travel and rooms cost appx. $70/nt. If arriving by air, highly recommend using the airport check-in (this hotel and others in the Caesar's Palace group) as it allows you to get room keys, etc., prior to leaving the airport. Once you get to the hotel, just go straight to the room without waiting in line at the desk. North Tower is slightly farther from the Strip, but closer to the shops, pool, and monorail station. Room was clean and larger than most, but not much of a view. Hair dryer was broken, but guest services provided a replacement in about 15 minutes. There is a free shuttle to the Rio that stops close to the North Tower elevators (very convenient if you plan to go to Rio/Harrah's/Caesar's Palace). Casino seemed on the small side compared to some of the others. Pool was OK, but mostly for older adults or families on vacation. There are a few shops and fast food available on the lower level (pool and monorail). Convenient access is definitely the best aspect about this hotel (next to Paris, across from Bellagio, diagonal from Caesar's Palace). In addition, there is a monorail station on-site that connects to MGM, Flamingo, Harrah's, Convention Center, Hilton, and Sahara) and the free shuttle that goes to the Rio. Basically, you can get just about anywhere on the Strip from here either by walking or taking monorail/shuttle. Of course, taxis are also available (about $20 to get downtown, $15 to airport, $10 to Hard Rock). Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Bally's was better than I remembered...”
Reviews.Author: 49Traveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Bally's with friends (each had our own room) just this past two nights. My third time at Bally's, and we had a good experience overall. No complaints except that our non-smoking floor definitely had some smokers present. People refuse to obey the rules and that's that, despite the signs on the walls. We requested refurbished rooms at check-in and were first given the runaround and the girl said it's $20 more per night. So we figured forget it, we'll take whatever. But...it was too early to check in and actually GET the rooms (only 9 a.m.!) so we decided to try our luck around noon. BINGO -- went to the fabulous breakfast buffet at Paris, next door, and returned to Bally's. A different check in clerk this time, and a different story. He gave us three rooms together, all refurbished, no extra charge, and on 14th floor. Now this room refurbishment did not take place last week or anything, but the rooms were lovely, really. Granite in tub/counter -- sparkling faucets, etc. Nice furniture and carpet in very good condition. And the rooms are HUGE. Only complaint I had was paying $3 per night for the safe. It's not like a mini-bar where you actually TAKE something, but I decided not to argue since we paid very low prices for the rooms by doing so in advance. I did make my displeasure known and let it go at that. The guy at the desk at check-out was apologetic but said it's their "policy." I get it, I just don't like it. :) Had seen an ad in L.A. Times two months earlier, called, and got the rooms for about $70 so figured I could live with the "safe" charge. And you can't argue with Bally's locale -- right next to Paris, and they share the business center which is nice. Our rooms, 14th floor and not sure which tower it is but it's east/west facing windows and set way back from the Strip, which is where the rehabbed rooms are. To tell the truth, the rehabbed floors and rooms reminded me a LOT of the Paris in decor -- very nice. I love Bally's for it's LACK of obvious "theme" and would recommend it to anyone for all-around good time. It's really close to Bellagio, Flamingo and Caesar's as well as being connected to Paris. Who can argue with THAT?

Reviews.Title: “could've been better”
Reviews.Author: lasvegaschick
Reviews.Content: What originally drew me and my husband to Bally's was the price. We actually got a really great deal at what we thought was going to be an exceptional hotel --the name "Bally's" to me, was synonomous with a five star hotel -- I'm assuming that was because of it's reputation back in it's hey day which was some decades ago. While I don't want to give this hotel a bad rap, I do want readers to know there are better, newer, more modern hotels that may be just a little higher in price, but in my opinion well worth the extra dollars. My dissatisfaction with Bally's is as follows: It's age is obvious as you drive up to the hotel. While it is not in particularly bad shape, next to it's counterparts the architecture is a bit outdated and just looks worn. The interior also has this same aged appearance. It's obvious at one point in time it was a magnificent hotel but it seems there were no remodels to keep up with the more modern times. The "check in line" was a about a 30-35 minute wait. This is something I am not used since I am usually a NYNY or Monte Carlo guest where I can usually walk up to a receptionist or at worst have nothing more than a 10 min wait. The "check out" was much worse and something that constitutes a legitmate complaint. There were people everywhere and that wait exceeded 45min at the very least. The rooms again were older, not as modern and the decor seemed out of style. The bathroom also the same. While I can't complain about the cleanliness, just the fact that it's older things just don't appear to be as fresh and clean as the newer hotels. Service definitely could have been better and in Las Vegas I expect it to be so with all the money that is being played by it's guests. The very least a hotel could do is treat it's guests like we are "winners" even if we are not! Staff was not rude, but certainly not on the better end of hospitality. There is plenty of room for improvement here. I want to see smiling faces, friendly welcoming personalities and staff who goes the mile, however small the request. I know this is not an impossible expectation because I have had this wonderful experience elsewhere. I ate a small pizza and hot dog shop right off the casino floor. Not enough tables and they were all dirty. Once I found one that was available I had to get some napkins and wipe down myself. The casino was a little dark and dreary and seemed to be a little lifeless. For those who are like me -- I came to Vegas for the excitement and adrenaline. I like to hear machines paying out, people yelling at a crap table and somebody's cheer when they've got a blackjack. I didn't get this vibe here so I don't have anymore of an opinion regarding the rest of the gambling experience at Bally's -- I took my money somewhere a little more livelier. For those who are interested in the type of demographic -- mostly an older more mature crowd. Very few 20 somethings, so at least you don't need to be concerned about any obnoxious antics. I have read other reviews about a more updated tower -- obviously this was not the one I stayed in. Or perhaps the author of those other reviews has not had a lot of experiences elsewhere to compare. My general advice would be to continue to look for a competive rate in a newer casino. It seems to me you will get more for your money all around. But if you can't find a better rate at least you will know what to expect.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: pattie627
Reviews.Content: ballys was just as i expected. my sisters and i arrived at ballys at 11am there was no check in line and our room was ready. we were given a room in the north tower and it was larger then i expected. the room service was great by the time we got back from the pool our room was done and we only stayed at the pool 3 hours or so. on the first floor there is a little resturant the food was cheap and the portions were very large its next to the stairs near the lounge. the location is in the center of the strip with a monorail stop a trolley stop and the shuttle to the rio. the lounge music is fantastic and they dont push you to keep buying drinks. i would recommend this hotel to anyone especially for a first time trip. i cannot wait to go back and ballys will be the place to go

Reviews.Title: “Birthday celebration at Ballys”
Reviews.Author: Jill&Ralph
Reviews.Content: Just got back yesterday from 5 night stay at Ballys. Carpet was dirty in our roon we told them we would like it clean. Went out for the day and came back to a nice clean carpet. The room was great and I loved the bathroom. We rented a cabana #7 for my husbands birthday the people were great to us. Advice, do not eat breakfeast at Big buffet! I was the first in line, they were 10 minutes late opening and the food was cold and some of it burned. The cashier told us it was because people were hung over from the night before and some of them called in. From then on we ate at the Sidewalk Cafe it was good there! Overall our stay was very nice. Would stay ther again.

Reviews.Title: “God value for the non-gambler”
Reviews.Author: GeraldA
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 days in this hotel. Chose it after looking at this site, as central and good value for money. Great room in the North Tower- the biggest we have ever had in a hotel. Cleanliness excellent. Speedy reception. View from our room unexciting. We were there to see the strip and visit the Grand Canyon, so we found all the gaming going on all the time, rather depressing. Found the in-house fixed price buffet excellent value. Enjoyed visiting all the other hotels to see their different decoration, styles and shops.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Bally's - Great value!”
Reviews.Author: Kdoobie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Bally's August 12th - 16th, 2006 and had a wonderful vacation! The staff was courteous, the rooms were clean and the restaurants were first-rate! We will definitely stay there again. It's located in the heart of the Las Vegas Strip near Paris, Bellagio and Caesar's Palace. Bally's may be one of the "older" hotels in LV, however, when it comes to "amenities", they can certainly compete with any of the newer hotels. Stay at Bally's - you won't regret it!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: al.bertino
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Bally's!!!Had a great time!!!Everything perfect!Got there at around 7 pm.No line to check in.Very nice person at front desk.Asked for a north tower room.See sayed it would be 20$ extra a night.After all the reviews I read here about the south tower I accepted.I had heard Bally's was an old hotel.Not in my tower.Amazing room!Very clean and well maintained.And very very big.A nice view , not of the strip but nice, overlooking the mountains.Good bathroom not very big but with a lot of marble.Very nice. The only thing with the room was that some lights didn't work.Little detail.We didn´t even wasked for someone to fix it.It was fine. At the hotel everyone was very nice and helpful.The casino isn't as big as the newer ones but I found it to have the right size. Not to small not to big. And the ambiance is very nice.No drunks and no wird looking fellows like in some other casinos.The pool was ok.Nothing very fancy but good enought.Chairs always available and never too crowed.The location couldn't better.In the center of the strip with a monorail stop just outside the hotel. I just loved Bally's and would definitly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Bally's was Grand, Impressive, Dazzling............ back in 1981”
Reviews.Author: phoward
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 day weekend at Bally's, where we stayed because of the location and "Value". We paid $175 per night with the two nights averaged together. I'm sure that when the old MGM Grand was remodeled and expanded after the tragic 1980 fire, it was pretty impressive. Unfortunately, the overall look and appearance does not seem to have changed much, other than maybe new carpet. Here is my take on the various aspects of our stay: Reception - excellent, got in very early Friday a.m. and was checked in, checked our luggage, and told to pick up key at noon. Staff was friendly, and very helpful. This being our first trip to a Vegas Casino Hotel on the Strip, initial impression of Lobby and casino was that it was "Nice", but we had nothing to compare it to. After walking around and seeing Ceasar's, Paris, Ballagio, Wynn, NY NY, Venetian, MGM Grand, those readers who have stayed at those places will know Bally's is a has been, not unlike Sratosphere, Harrah's, Riviera, Imperial Palace, and others built or last renovated around the same time. Checked into room in South Tower, great view of the Strip, large room, very cold A/C which was great. Furniture and decor are a - la - 80's, except TV which is a 25" stereo and worked well. Room was very clean, had two queens as requested, and firm but "sleepable" mattresses. Bath too was dated, with cracks in sink and toilet seat. Cold water came out of the shower at a drizzle, therefore we had to either scald ourselves in the shower, with all pressure coming from the hot water side, or fill the tub an hour ahead of time and let it cool down to bathing temp. Called for repair, but am reasonably certain no one ever came to check it. We had unpacked our stuff, and didn't want to mess with changing rooms, so we put up with it. Pool - is a very long walk from the So. Tower, winding you through the casino in your bathing suit, down an escalator, past a very third rate shopping area all the way to the end where you emerge into a grossly undersized pool area that was wall to wall loungers, with limited shady areas to escape the 110 degree heat. Small frozen drinks (12 oz.) from the pool bar are $9, plus tip. A 16 oz. beer is $6. At those prices, you would think they would have waitresses running around all over trying to get you to drink up; however two people were waiting on the 500 or so sunbathers. Bally's does its part for the homeless though, given that two derelict wino looking guys were walking around picking up trash, bottles, empty glasses, etc. Uniforms are apparently not provided to, nor worn by these guys. Pool is small, black algae in the grout joints is provided free of charge, paint chipping off of the edge coping adds to the overall "Route 66" budget motel motif. The only food we ate at Bally's was the Big Kitchen Buffet for Breakfast Saturday A.M. It was $14 with tax, and was in fact very good, with typical fair, and an omelet station. The much touted "Best View of the Strip" from the buffet was the back side of the Barbary Coast Hotel next door. Two conveniences of Bally's are the monorail stop, and trolly stop at the property. The Monorail is expensive, and has limited stops at the back of a few hotels on the east side of the strip, so unless you are there for a convention at the convention center, which it goes right to, it is of little value for getting around.
