The trolley, which is $6.50 for a day pass, is much more convenient, stopping closer to the strip at many, many more hotels, particularly on the west side of the strip. Be prepared to spend about one hour for the ride from one end of the strip to the other. The location is the only saving grace for Bally's. Ceasar's and the Bellagio are across the street and it is connected to Paris, a superior sister property. It is actually more convenient to shop at Paris than at Bally's, and the shopping experience is superior, with many more shops and eateries, in the "streets of Paris" under the sky atmosphere. In summary, I tend to be about value. I don't expect Bellagio decor and shops for $100 bucks a night, but I expected alot more from Bally's at $175, and it just isn't worth it. It can best be summed up by saying it is probably worth every penny, if you can stay there for well under $100 a night. Having accompanied my 20 year old to Vegas, I gambled very little and went to no clubs, so we saw three shows, and sightseed alot, so here are some other observations, very briefly. Mystere at TI by Cirque - Got $95 second row seats, worth every penny, absolutely breathtaking, amazing, cute, funny, highly recomend it. The Sirens of TI show in front of Treasure Island - It is also worth every penny, insofar as it's free. Don't waste your time putting up with the hot, smelly, elbow to elbow crowds, they would have to pay me to wait for that 20 minute absurdity again. The Mac King Comedy Magic Show at Harrah's - It's $20, and very much worth it. Very clean, no profanity, several gut busting laughs to offset some gags that are on the corny side, two or three nifty, mouth agape with "how'd he do that?" illusions, but no Lance Burton, and not $100 bucks either, so I would recommend it as well. Rita Rudner at NY NY - If you don't know her, be prepared for the type of humor in the style of Bob Newhart, or even earlier, Jack Benny. Very low key and very funny, with very little sexual innuendo and no profanity, and alot of self depracating humor. She is kind of a permanent headliner, so she gets $62.50 for her show, but again I felt it was worth it. Finally, having spent most of three days walking into and around hotels, short impressions of each I visited other than Bally's: Ceasars - Probably the grandest and most over the top themed hotel, very impressive, even if you know that all that architecture, columns, statuary, fountains, and such is fiberglass. Most authentic looking fake plants I've ever seen. It looks good, but virtually everything in the place is fake. If it ever burned up, it would produce more black smoke than the oil well fires from Desert Storm. Bellagio - Very elegant, very well done, half the fiberglass of Ceasars. Wynn - Other than the astroturf all over, this is the real deal. (story behind the astroturf, which really does look almost like real grass, is that it is more environmentally friendy by having 0 water consumption). All other landscaping, both exterior and interior, which is extensive, is real. Interior landscaping is so absolutely perfect, it is the fakest looking real plants I have ever seen. By far the most elegant, authentically expensive decor on the strip. Only theme here is genuine opulence. MGM Grand - Not in the same class anymore as Bellagio or Wynn, but very nice nonetheless. Paris, Venetian, NY NY, TI - All pretty impressive themed hotels, I would spend $200 a night at Paris or NY NY, TI is the least impressive of the four, the Venetian has some construction going on which is a temporary setback for it. Harrah's - Wow, really needs to be refurbished. Imperial Palace - Good candidate to be leveled. Barabary Coast - Why is it still around? Because it doesn't sit on enough land to do anything else with. Features $2.00 drinks, even if you gamble! However, $5 min wager tables are aplenty. Actaully ate at the restuarant, do yourself a huge favor, and don't. Stratosphere - So far north, so hard to get anywhere else, the only reason it's not leveled is the 1100 foot tower, which was also very impressive in 1963 when it was built, and mildly interesting now. Great night view of the strip and all of Vegas, to be sure. Since it's $10 buck a head to ride up the elevator, which was a 30 minute wait each way on a slow day, send your kid or spouse up with a camera while you gamble. The three "Thrill rides" at the top, which are $10 bucks each also, are lame. Seriously, this place needs a super face lift, or start over altogether. Didn't get to any others close enough or long enough to opine. As I said, I did little gambling, but did some at Bally's, Harrah's, and NY NY. Drinks are still free if you are gambling. The process is the same as at other casinos I've been to in other destinations. A waitress will come by every two hours or so at the penny/nickel/quarter slots, and every 10 minutes at the $25 min. wager tables. Go figure. One last tip, if you are souvenir hunting or thirsty as you walk around, go to the shops in free standing centers along the strip. Here, $1 souvenirs actually cost $1 instead of $7 at the hotel shops. Also, the best bargain in town is $1.79 beers from convenience stores and many little shops scattered around, which I would happily carry around with me to beat the heat as we ventured in and out of various hotels, stores, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Very good experience.....mostly.”
Reviews.Author: iriegirl
Reviews.Content: This was a birthday trip for my father (and his first time in Vegas), and since we were going to be sharing a room I wanted to get one larger than most in Vegas....so I chose Bally's. At the time that I booked the reservation I requested a North Tower room because I'd read about the 70's motif in the South Tower. I even reiterated that request at the hotel check-in counter at the airport--which was SUCH a timesaver. The agent just smiled and nodded at my request. Imagine my surprise when we got to the hotel and I realized I'd been put in the South Tower!! After going back downstairs and paying the upgrade fee of an extra $20.00 per night, we settled in. I think if Bally's is going to charge an upgrade fee for that building then, they need to be upfront about it and tell people in upon making reservations that those rooms are an extra $20.00 per night. Other than that, we had a FANTASTIC time in Vegas. I'm not a big gambler, but I managed to take home a few hundred dollars from the Rio/Mandalay Bay/Harrahs slot machines. The casino in Bally's was far too smoky for me and I didn't have much luck there--neither did my dad. We enjoyed taking advantage of the free shuttle to the Rio, Harrah's, Caesars, etc. We also liked that we didn't have to go outside to get to the Paris. All in all, it was a fabulous trip and we will probably stay at Bally's again.

Reviews.Title: “Bally's is alright but nothing spectacular”
Reviews.Author: lovestotravel29
Reviews.Content: I had been to LV once before and stayed at TI and for some reason thought Bally's would be fancier...I was wrong. It is by no means a "bad" hotel...the location is great (connected inside to Paris--walkways to Bellagio and then a connection to Caesar's) but the rooms were not nearly as nice as TI. Bally's also does have better coupons for buffets/shows than TI did so that helped as we did a buffet and the Flamingo and one at Harrahs. We were told upon check-in we could "upgrade" to the "renovated" part of the hotel (north tower) for $20.00 more per night...I think the only thing "renovated" in the north tower were the hallways and the bathrooms in the rooms because the actual rooms were sure not. I noticed several carpet stains and one of the bedspreads had several holes in it in our room. We had a "strip" view if you count the huge beam dead center out our window that blocked the view of the Bellagio water fountains. Rooms are kept up nicely but I thought the hotel exterior looked worn. Inside in the casino area it is nice as there are various slots/table games and one night we ate at the Sidewalk Cafe which wasn't bad, also the connection to the monorail proved to be great as we ventured via monorail to places like MGM, Sahara and LV Hilton. Overall--OK but if I go back to Vegas I would probably try another place for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Bally's was Great!”
Reviews.Author: VegasinTX
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at Bally's August 3rd through the 6th. We arrived at Bally's at 11am on Thursday. Upon check in, one room was ready and one was not, but we just had the bell boy bring all the luggage up to one room until ther other was ready. Bell service was fast and very polite. We had two rooms in the North tower. The view was OK, but the rooms were very nice and much larger than your average standard rooms. We booked the North tower specifically based upon traveler reviews from this site, and I am glad we did. We gambled quite a bit, and I cannot say enough good things about the casino staff. The pit bosses and dealers were EXTREMELY friendly. We came to Vegas not knowing everything about games like Craps and Let it Ride poker, but the dealers showed us what plays to make, when to make them, etc. The craps tables were by far the best anywhere. Super nice staff and drinks service was great. The slots were not loose at all. We lost a lot of $ on the slots, and the drink service by the slots was not that great either. I would recommend playing the slots elsewhere. We ate at Sidewalk Cafe inside Bally's, the food was OK, but I would not eat there again. We also ate at the Champagne brunch at the Bally's buffet. It was great, no long lines, and the food was good. We specifically ate there because it is one of the few buffets in Vegas that serves hot, steamed crab legs. I would eat there again, for sure. The pool was somewhat crowded, and the drinks were overpriced, but their were no kids running around and the atmosphere was nice. Overall, Bally's was great. Friendly staff, great location(attached to Paris, try their breakfast buffet), beautiful,BIG rooms. I would recommend this hotel. They have a lot of things going on, make sure you take a full walk of the place when you get there. We had been looking for a quick bite to eat when we got there, and thought they only had sit down restaurants, but after being there a couple days and exploring everything, they have shopping on the way to the pool, fast food, and a host of many other things going on in "hidden" areas. Also, try The Price is Right game show, it is good fun for the price. If your staying at the hotel, you get the tickets for $33. Highly recommend Bally's, we will stay there again, and again, and again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: bigblindbob
Reviews.Content: 7 cpls just got back from 4- nts / 5 days at Bally's. We all enjoyed our stay and agreed we would consider returning next yr. Although, depending on prices, we probably will look at upgrading a notch - Paris, Mirage, etc. Here's my take on the property (no particular order): 1. South Tower rooms- Clean, spacious, & pretty good view of strip...beds were not overly comfortable North Tower rooms- a bit nicer but not much of a view 2. The hotel is in good/decent shape and not overly smokey (good ventilation) 3. Pool is not fancy but very practical. We rented a cabana by the pool one day and had a blast (comes w/ TV, a mini-fridge, rafts,assigned caban boy, etc). If you have a group of people, I highly recommend it 4. Restaurants are just OK. Good news, Vegas has tons of great places to eat so this was not a big deal in our opinion 5. Connection to Paris (good restaurants) is a real plus 6. For what it's worth, slot machines seemed moderately loose and they have quite a few craps / BJ tables. Poker room is fun but almost always crowded (30 minute wait was not uncommon) 7. Entire staff was very friendly I've stayed at quite a few Vegas hotels . I would absolutely recommend Bally's to anyone who is looking for mid-priced strip hotel. It is certainly not fancy but than again it is not a dump.

Reviews.Title: “Big rooms but not so easy to get in and out of”
Reviews.Author: naper1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Ballys' in June and found the experience ok. The good: Rooms are big and the location on the strip is great. The not so good: It is not so easy to get into and out of your room. You have to cut throught the casino with all of your luggage (a pain). The bathrooms are old and need to be mainted/updated. The hotel itself is a bit old and can not compare with some of the newer hotels in the area. I can see this property be reworked in the next 5 years because the location is prime.

Reviews.Title: “Best priced hotel in centre of the Strip”
Reviews.Author: goldy_travels
Reviews.Content: We were in Vegas for 4th July long weekend. It's a no frill plain and simple Las Vegas hotel in the centre of the strip. Previously we had stayed at MGM which I thought was one of the best Hotels to stay in Las Vegas. It was in the south of the strip. This time we decided to stay more in the centre of the strip as we had seen most of the hotels next to MGM (Luxor, New York New York etc). It was the best deal we could find for a hotel in the centre strip. We thought of Flamingo, but stayed away from it because of bad reviews it got. We went to check out Flamingos and we like what we saw there. Next time we may stay consider staying at that hotel. It seemed very lively and enjoyable for the Kids. Location: Best part of Bally's is that it's not a bad walk from the hotel room to get to the strip. This was the best thing we liked about Bally's. In MGM it took us at least 15-20 just to get from our room to the strip. It seemed like a long walk. There is people mover in Bally's which makes it easier. I didn't see like that in any other hotel. It's right next to Paris and opposite to Bellagio. Also Caeser's is just across from it. You also get a ride from here to Rio if you want to go there. Food: Except for their breakfast I didn’t like the food much in there. We stayed away from their buffet. There is Paris buffet next door which is really good, but you have to be in queue for at least 20-30 mins before you see the food. Pool: I like the Bally's Pool. It was not very crowded, but was a plain and simple rectangle shape. Not a playful water place for Kids. What I like is that on one side it's 8-13 ft deep, so it was fun to swim in there. Rarely do you find pools more than 6ft deep. Shows: We saw the "Jubilee" show at Bally's, which was OK. Nothing great about the show. I would have rather go over to Bellagio and watch the O show. Overall great experience. No complaints.

Reviews.Title: “I Love Las Vegas!!!”
Reviews.Author: Blondie3604
Reviews.Content: I love Las Vegas and I loved Bally's. Great location and we had an excellent view. Giant casino and was attached to the Paris Casino. Good dealf or room. We had a blast!

Reviews.Title: “Stay in the North Tower!”
Reviews.Author: Geezo
Reviews.Content: As the title suggests, if you stay at Bally's you MUST stay in the North Tower. I cannot stress this enough. We chose Bally's because of the reasonable rates, tripadvisor reviews, and most importantly its location (heart of strip). At check-in we were told it would cost $20 extra for the North Tower. Foolishly we turned down the upgrade. Our room in the South Tower was woefully out-of-date. The furniture looked like it was picked up at a flea market and the room looked like a motor lodge (see attached photos, Exhibit A). The view, however, was fantastic. We had a good view of the strip and could see 1/2 of the Bellagio water show (Ex. B) and were looking directly at the Eiffel Tower (Ex. C). Unfortunately, the view did not make up for the shoddy room. Ordinarily we wouldn’t have minded the room, but we chose to pay $40 per night more to stay at Bally’s versus Aladdins thinking it would be a nicer room. We were wrong. Anyway, we went down and talked to the front desk and they were EXTREMELY understanding and offered to move us into a renovated, North Tower room that night. However, because they only had smoking rooms available we decided to wait until the next day to get a non-smoking North Tower room. The North Tower room was fantastic! Everything was immaculate and posh. It was large; it had a large tree-like plant in the corner (Ex. D); it had a beautiful desk with leather upholstered chairs (Ex. E); it had granite countertops in the bathroom (Ex. F) and vanity (Ex. G); the bed had lots of pillows and was soft and comfy (Ex. H); the TV was in an entertainment center (Ex. I), and not on a cheap four-legged table; and the decor was perfect and tastefully done. The North Tower feels like a completely different hotel. You can probably tell how much the room impressed us by the number of photos that we took. One of the great advantages of Bally’s is that it is connected to Paris. We loved Paris (the casino, not the country). It has a great buffet and a cool cobblestone roadway with shops leading from Bally’s to the casino. The Paris casino has a unique design that makes you feel like you’re outside while gambling. As far as things to do, one of our favorite "free" shows was the piano bar at Harrah's. Check it out if you get a chance.

Reviews.Title: “Vegas first-timer”
Reviews.Author: ChrissyRDH
Reviews.Content: Just got back last night from a four day stay in Las Vegas. I was there with a co-worker/friend for a dental hygiene meeting. The meeting was at the convention center at the Rio. The Rio was filled, so my boss booked us at their sister hotel, Bally's. When we first got there, Tuesday evening, there were no regular rooms available. They put the two of us in a suite! We were so impressed by this room, we took photos of it! Neither of us had ever stayed in such a swanky place!! Needless to say, the next day, we moved to a regular room. I really have no complaints with the traditional room but it was nice have a bath and a half for one night!! The staff at Bally's couldn't have been more accommodating! Vearn, at the front desk went out of his way, not just with us, but with everyone he waited on!! We even spent some time down by the pool!! Everyone was terrific! I went down for coffee one morning at the Java cafe. Is that the name of it? Can't remember. Anyway, it's opposite the registration desk and the pastries and the coffee were very yummy! Most of our meals were either eaten out or we were fed by the convention folks. There was a free shuttle that went to the Rio every half hour so we never had to catch a cab! We did walk to a lot of places and I probably put 70 miles on my trainers!! Only one blister to speak of but it was well worth it!! The temperature topped out at 112 degrees farenheit during our stay but, quite honestly, I didn't mind it. I prefere the heat to the cold so I didn't complain! It's hot here just outside of St. Louis too but it's also humid. Much different from Vegas. Bally's is very centrally located so you can walk to so many cool hotels and casinos! It was terrific just being able to view all of these incredible places! (Bally's has it's own charm and was fun to tour too! Also, you're connected to Paris so you don't have to go out on the sidewalk to visit there!) My friend drove up from L.A. to meet us and go to the meeting also and was treated very well in spite of the fact that she was a late-comer to the convention. They managed to get her the convention rate when it was all said and done. From the start though, she was charged the regular room rate. So they really are winners, in my eyes!! Speaking of winning, I won around $100 in the beginning of our stay!! Not too bad for a non-seasoned gambler!! Can't say I held onto the dough for too long, but it was entertaining! If my husband and I ever visit Las Vegas or I'm involved in a girl's getaway or another convention, I will try to book with Bally's!! I am posting some photos of the suite and a few others so you can see what it all looks like!! Email me at bdalindy@accessus.net if you'd like more info regarding my stay there!! Have a great time and good luck!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Excellent Room!”
Reviews.Author: queenamy
Reviews.Content: Bally's was an excellent choice for our recent visit to Las Vegas. We stayed there July 20 and 21st (Thursday and Friday nights) and paid just a little more than $200 total for both nights. After reading reviews on Trip Advisor we decided on Bally's and were sure to request a room in the North Tower. Although our room was only on the 5th floor (non-smoking floor, so our options were limited) and our view was of a roof, the room was spacious and gorgeous! We didn't miss having a view for more than 5 seconds. I'm not sure what their other rooms look like, but we certainly felt like we hit the jackpot with ours! Some friends were staying at Paris and we saw their room. Our room at Bally's was much bigger and prettier. We were not all that impressed with the Paris room, especially knowing how much more expensive it is. We will definitely return to Bally's next time we visit Las Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice!”
Reviews.Author: schnorfik
Reviews.Content: My husband, 19 year old daughter and I stayed at Bally's July 17-22. We got there at 3:00am and as they were out of double rooms they put us in a King bed suite. It was very nice with a large jacuzzi tub open to the living area and shower located behind a wall, but not ideal for privacy. It would be great for a couple. They brought in a rollaway for my daughter. The next day we moved to a standard room with two queen beds which worked out much better for us. This is what we had originally reserved. The hotel does guarantee a room with your reservation, but not a particular room type. This was a large north tower room and very pleasant. The bathroom is altogether, so only one person can use it at a time. We loved the location in mid strip and easily walked south to the Aladdin Desert Passage and north as far as the Venetian. Even though it was hot and humid we were surprised at how much you could see and do while staying inside. We enjoyed the Desert Passage, Paris(connected to Bally's through the Casino) , Forum Shops, New York and Venetian shopping areas. We liked the fact that Bally's with no particular theme or attraction for tourists was relatively peaceful and less crowded. It was also nice that you could quickly get to your room without a long walk. We never has to wait for the elevators. The restaurants did not appeal to us at Bally's. Coffee was much better in Paris than at the Java Coast stand by the Casino. The pool was nothing special, but fine for sunning and cooling off. We would return because of good price, clean rooms, and location, nice staff, convenient entrance to the valet parking and self parking right in front of the hotel from both Las Vegas Blvd. and Flamingo.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic! Huge rooms very comfortable very clean”
Reviews.Author: ChoosyPerson
Reviews.Content: Our double room in Bally's was enormous with a huge bed plus a comfortable sofa with glass coffee table, a large desk with chair, huge TV, lots of storage space with drawers and wardrobe and really felt like a suite. The bathroom was also big with a bath/shower and plenty of surface space around the sink. The best thing is how perfectly clean everything is kept - housekeeping was excellent and very efficient. The room was one of the most comfortable I've ever stayed in and perfect for our 5 night stay. The hotel has no theme so feels a bit more classy than some of the other hotels - but it is centrally located for easy access to the rest of the strip so you can enjoy all the themed hotels as well. The indoor access to Paris was most convenient so that you felt you were staying in both hotels. Bally's is also connected via the Monorail to many other hotels which was useful. The staff were very efficient but the hotel is so huge there was no personal touch - everyone is extremely professional and everything is set up for convenience - a dedicated desk for booking tours and shows was very useful and the baggage service on our last day was excellent. There is a safe in the room but it incurs a $3 charge each day that you use it. We were forced to use the inroom telephone to call internationally a few times and EACH 10 second call home to say "call me back!" racked up a $17 connection charge! We will definitely return to Bally's and recommend it to friends, we got a very good rate through the hotel's website and the the room was faultless. Do not hesitate to book!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Huge Rooms, Great Services”
Reviews.Author: FortMacDude
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Bally's - North Tower - Room 1633A - From July 9-15. Here's My Review : Check In: - This was the only slight dissapointment in Bally's services. As per advice from many others, decided to try to check in to Bally's at their Airport registration desk. I politely asked for a non-smoking King Bed room on a high floor in the newly renovated North Tower. The rude older lady quickly retorted that all North Tower rooms required a $20/night upgrade fee..no exceptions. I had a 20 under my credit card as a tip, but she pretended not to see it. She even said that the room wasn't ready yet and that we had to pick up keys at the front desk of Bally's. Though I was glad to get the North Tower, I wasn't happy that I had to pay $120 for the "luxory" (20*6 nights). When we got to Bally's there was only 3 people in line on an early Sunday evening. Should have just checked in person there. They had a room, but it only had a Queen, but they compensated that with a free fridge, a couch and extra chairs and a huge bathroom with seperate vanity area. We were impressed when we walked in. Room : The north tower rooms look like the pictures on the web site. Modern, CLEAN and HUGE. Bed was comfortable, view was of the north strip (Flamingo, Wynn,etc..). Room was at the end of a long hall but the hallway was extremely quiet. Neighbors were quiet, and stay was very peaceful. Room included hair dryer, ironing board/iron, nice size TV on a swivel stand within an armoire and other usual decor/amenities. Soaps and shampoos were of good quality, and shower nice and hot though not the best pressure. Bed was very comfortable and air conditioning worked like a charm and was fully adjustable. Services : Room service never intruded early in the morning and brought extra pillows and towels when requested. I recommend tipping housekeeping $5/day. They clean your toilet and bath and bed...why wouldn't you want them to do the best job possible? All hotel personnel from the dealers, waitresses, desk cleks, cashiers etc were very pleasant and helpful. All wished us luck in our gambling and inquired if we were enjoying our stay. Pool/Amenities : Yes, the walk to the pool is long from both North and South Towers. The trick in the North Tower is to choose the Pool Level button that brings you to the basement and not to the casino. The pool itself is nice, has a deep end and good towel service. Not the fanciest pool in town, but you should be able to find a chair anytime of day. Restaurants : We only dined in 2 restaurants : Chang's -Chinese Restaurant - This was excellent but pricey americanized chinese food . Gourmet Dinner for 2 that had 2 appetizers, 2 coctails, 4 entres and a dessert was slightly over $100 for the two of us, Johnny's Delicatessan was visited twice for quick bagels in the morning. Yummy! Location & Value: It would be hard pressed to choose a better location on the strip for the price (Flamingo would be similar in ranking as pervalue/location). Bally's has the monorail station in the back to ride to the south strip (MGM) and up the north strip. It has good taxi services and bus stop northbound and across the strip at the Bellagio southbound. It's walking distance to ponts north as far as Wynn if you are fit/agile and south to MGM/Tropicana. Odds&Ends : Bally's probably has the oldest dealers and coctail waitresses on the strip. Not the most attractive ones either but they do the job. The bartenders make darn strong and good cocktails. ! Overall : It's not the hippest, loudest. best thematic hotel/casino on the strip. But if you value great location, comfortable rooms that give you a good nights sleep and good services...Bally's should be on the top of your list ! P.S. Review of room only based on North Tower rooms !!.. Always request north tower !!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel experience, bad checkin experience”
Reviews.Author: MileHighMe
Reviews.Content: We had booked the hotel through Southwest Vacations. When we checked in at the airport, we asked for a North Tower room on the advice of other reviewers. The clerk insisted that we had reserved a South Tower room and that we'd have to pay $20 more for a North Tower room. This was not true, of course--we had not reserved a South Tower room, nor were we ever even asked that question. We showed her our reservation materials but this had no effect. We kept "discussing" the issue and finally she offered us a lower floor North Tower room without the extra $20. This room didn't have much of a view, but it was spacious, comfortable, and nicely decorated. Still, I wouldn't stay there again. The experience with the bait-and-switch at the registration desk left us with a bad feeling about Bally's.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: Anndi626
Reviews.Content: After seeing the reviews I was a bit apprehensive. Our room was comped but we had other choices as to which hotel to choose. I chose Bally's because I had not stayed there before and wanted to give it a try. We had requested the North Tower as I had seen in other reviews. We were given that tower without the 20.00 trick or having to pay more for an upgrade. Since I haven't seen the South Tower rooms, I can not say if it's worth paying more for the North Tower or not. I thought the room was pretty good. It was big and was true to the picture on the website. There was a one cup coffee maker in the bathroom and from reading other reviews I don't know if this is just in the North Tower or not. I liked the decor, not overwhelming. The bathroom floor though.. if you miss the bathmat after getting out of the shower, you'll be hurting. I really liked the pool area too. It's a nice big pool with areas to sit around the perimeter and just hang out. The water wasn't ice cold either. The only bad part is no umbrellas for shade. There is about one row of loungers by the eatery for shade but get up early to snag those. That's about the only negative I saw at the pool area. Some people can't be in the sun all day. I would say the only negative I had about the hotel portion was housekeeping. It was TERRIBLE. I had to hunt down a cart and snag toilet paper because it was never replenshed and we were out. The only thing she did was make the beds or change them. I'm not sure because I wasn't there when she came in. I would definately stay there again, comp or no comp.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value at Bally's”
Reviews.Author: iamjava
Reviews.Content: We just came back from Vegas, and we stayed at the Bally's. Initially we were given two rooms in the South Tower, however we didn't like the rooms, we approched the front desk to see if we can change rooms, we were then given two rooms in the North Tower, and I have to say it was so much better coz it's all newly renovated. So I'll recommend that if all possible, ask for a room in the North Tower coz it's more enjoyable. And for the price, it's definitely above average. Also we took the advice from this board, and went to Ellis Island - we went twice to have their $4.95 10 oz steak, and it was definitely a good deal! It's just a short walk from Bally's - it's behind the hotel, and they have the sign up saying they have $4.95 special. Their root beer and drafts were good too, be sure to try it! We ate at a few different buffets in hotels, such as Bellagio, Mirage, Paris & Golden Nuggets, and they were all very good. If you are looking for a cheap and good deal, I would recommend Golden Nuggets' lunch buffet. As for transportation, we got a day pass for the Deuce 1 day, and also for the Trolley for another day - I would say the Deuce's a better choice if you don't mind walking a little coz you can also ride on different systems with the same pass, and the air conditioning is much stronger.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: Saratogatraveler
Reviews.Content: Spent four days at Bally's July 7-11. We got what we paid for, which means no problems, clean and good size rooms, fast elevators and clean bathrooms with good water pressure and plenty of hot water no matter the time of day. Liked the location, except that the side street facing the hotel was quite run down and contained more than one unaffiliated applicant for private sector funding (that's p/c for panhandler). Did not eat at any of the restaurants so no comments there. We did hit the adjacent Paris buffet one evening and it was quite good.

Reviews.Title: “great”
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Ballys from July 6,2006 to July 10,2006 had a wonderful time although didn`t win any money in casino had to go to other properties to win. Room we had was very spacious with a view of pool. Stayed in North Tower. Would reccomend it to any one staying there. Talked with couple who was staying in South Tower said they had to request another room because the bathroom had cracked tiles and mildew in corner of tub. The furniture they said looked like Moses had used it during his era. The Big Kitchen Buffet was the best had some great seafood for seafood lovers, and a variety of other foods plus an assortment of cakes and pies and fresh fruit. Definately would reccomend. The property it self was very nice. Was easy to get from one side of the street to other properties with the use of esclators and people movers.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, average hotel room”
Reviews.Author: Indyjaybird
Reviews.Content: My friend and I checked into Bally's for a three night stay without our husbands. I checked in at the airport while my friend waited on the luggage. The clerk spotted the $20 under my credit card and said she had us in the north tower which is what we wanted. I don't know if the $20 really made any difference or not. We were in room 1583 which looked just like the photo on their website. The room was very clean, quiet, and spacious. I only heard sirens and a little traffic and hallway noise at night - nothing terrible. We used the pool, spa, Dollar rental car, valets, casino, and ate at the Big Kitchen Buffet one morning for breakfast (very good). We had no complaints and thought the hotel was a great bargain. The casino was nice and we liked that it was connected to Paris. It was also nice to be in the middle of the strip and so close to the Bellagio's water show. The staff everywhere were very nice and helpful. The frozen drinks at the pool were a little pricey - $17 for a 32 oz. margarita. Soft drinks were $4 but you could refill it all day. Don't bother with Batista's across the street - it was very overpriced, bland, average Italian food with bad service.

Reviews.Title: “Neglected, but great location”
Reviews.Author: kkatz
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a long weekend at the Bally's hotel in Vegas. We went with a large group and this hotel was in a terrific location, right in the center of the strip and was reasonably priced. The property, however, is in a sorry state of disrepair. We upgraded to a suite for just $50 per night extra. It must have been stunning in its heyday -- very large with a spectacular view, large jacuzzi, shower big enough for a family of four. The carpet, though, was badly stained and needed to be replaced ages ago. The toilet was broken, the steam sauna in the shower was broken with the controls hanging off the wall, one of the doors to the armoire didn't work properly (same for one of the drawers). The rest of the hotel is decidedly lower tier. But if you want to spend a lot of time at the magnificent Bellagio but can't afford to stay there, Bally's is just across the street with escalators and moving sidewalks connecting the two hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for its price”
Reviews.Author: mhernan44
Reviews.Content: this hotel actually suprised me, it was nicer then i thought it was going to be. booked for room for $100 bux a night and shared with 3 other friends PERFECT LOCATION walking distance from all the right hotels, cheap taxi ride to mirage & Palms (less than $9 bux) it was nice that Bally's had a monorail station, since it runs all along the strip. the monorail ride cost $5 for one ride, $9 for 2 rides, & you have an option to purchase a weekend pass POOL: nothing exciting. just a big pool, Music, plenty of chairs, cocktail waitresses, although,my friends were laying out for an hour and were never approached by a waitress. too many people leave towels on chairs to save spot and never come back. CUSTOMER SERVICE: very friendly staff. ordered room service breakfast, it came within 20mins, but plates were not picked up from the hallway for hours. asked for more towels, they sent someone up within 10mins. cocktail waitress in 25 cent slot machine area rearly came around and when they did they would speed walk down the isles. i heard a cocktail waitress say "Cocktails" right behind me, and as soon as i could turn around she was all the way down the isle...haha $20 TRICK: the front desk guy spotted the $20 bill under my credit card and he knew what i wanted. he said he could give me a "Jr. Suite", once i got into the room is was the same room i booked online, the Deluxe room. but, it was on the 24th floor with a view of the mountains. he said if i wanted a view of the Bellagio water show it would be in a smaller room, i turned that down. so was it worth the $20? bux look at my pictures and decide for yourself ROOM: extremely spacious, stayed in North Tower (the remodeled one), pleased with the room and style, nice new furniture, a small couch, two chairs, desk w/ a rolling chair & a vanity with chair. there were 5 lamps in the room 2 of them didnt work, vent fan in bathroom didnt work, i could have called & complained but it wasnt a big deal to me, plenty of mirrors in the room two of them were full length. Ballys is mainly an older crowd gambling, more younger people out at pool. but still not the hippest place to hang out. to my fellow college students trying to save $$$: if your going to vegas to party, the rooms are so big if your going with a large group of friends there is plenty of room for people to crash out on the floor. OH! MONEY SAVING ADVICE! if you take a taxi ask the driver if they have any VIP passes to clubs, if they try and charge you dont pay. I spoke with bouncer from Club Rain, he said the taxi drivers are supposed to give them out for free, and if they try to charge you can file a report to the taxi company. people also try to sell them on the street those should be free too. overall: good for the price, i will return for sure

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointing Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My suggestion. STAY AWAY!!! You will be very disappointed with the accommodations. We had a very disappointing stay. The first room that we were in had a bad air conditioner. It did cool the room, but the room never got cold. It smelled musty and the room felt humid. We stayed in this room one night. The hotel refunded us $50 of our $125 per night rate to change rooms. We were happy with this refund . . . until we entered the next room. This room had two lights burned out. Mildew on the shower walls. The iron left a black stain on a white blouse. Overall, it was ugly. The lampshades were the wrong size for the lamps, spots were on the floor and curtains. WORST OF ALL, there was a QUESTIONALBE BROWN SMEAR on the wall by the toilet. Very disgusting. When we complained again at the end of our stay, we were told that we should have asked to move again. Personally, I don't think the rooms get better than that.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value On The Strip”
Reviews.Author: kiltipper
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Bally's for 7 nights and was unsure what to expect having stayed at Luxor and NYNY on previous visits to LV. There were 8 men in our group and we chose Bally's due to the central location at a reasonable price. We checked in at the airport and were amazed to find NO queue at 5pm on a Friday afternoon. We asked for rooms in the North Tower based on reviews on this site but were told there were none available. We decided to take our chances with the South Tower and were pleasntly surprised to find the rooms were very spacious and spotlessly clean. The decor was a bit dated but who cares, you don't go to Vegas to study interion design. Our view on the 10th floor was of Caesars and Barbary Coast which didn't bother us as the rooms were only used for sleeping and showering. The bathroom was big, clean and had plenty of clean towels and toiletries. We ate dinner at the Big Kitchen Buffet on 3 occasions with mixed success - once was excellent, once was OK and once the selection was very poor. Having said that it was fine for breakfast. "Nosh" at the bottom of the South Tower elevators does a fine breakfast bagel with a wide selection of fillings. For dinner I would recommend the buffets at Paris or the new Wynn, although this is more expensive and the queue can be quite long - go early. Do not eat at the buffet in Caesar's - this was the worst food I've had on 3 trips to LV. The casion was quite big, clean and not at all smokey. They laid new carpet in the casino while we were there and this gave the place a slightly "newer" feel. The waitress service was very good - never more than 3 minutes waiting, although I had to ask for more coke with my Black Russian which was very strong. This was not a problem and I didn't have to ask again for the rest of the trip - Great service, Thanks Monica. The walk to the pool is very long (I was surprised to discover how big this hotel really is, very deceiving from the outside) but the pool is clean and well maintained. Drinks at the pool don't come cheap - $32 for 2 strawberry daiquiris. Parking in the self parking garage is very confusing until you get to grips with the layout. Overall we were delighted with our stay at Bally's. The hotel is clean, the staff are friendly and the location is second to none. Having stayed at Luxor and NYNY which are nicer themed hotels I would still opt for Bally's as you can't beat it for location or price.

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable Stay at Bally's”
Reviews.Author: tracy07
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 7 night stay at Bally's, although not as palatial as Caesars or Bellagio's this hotel has lovely rooms at a very reasonable cost. We were offered an upgrade which we accepted, at a nominal cost. The room is very large and had a chice of beds, we opted for two king size beds, which were so comfortable, after all the walking it is a must. The room had ample wardrobe space, with iron and ironing board. The bathroom had a full size bath and shower over, toilet and wash basin all very clean and beautifully decorated. Ample storage for toiletries and full sized mirrors, with coffee making facilities. Bottled water every day at a cost, but no bar. Exquisite beds with decent pilllows and ample coverings. Nicely furnished with foot stalls at the end of each bed. Dressing table and chair and mirror, desk and chairs, armchair, bedside cabinet, big tv and drawers, air conditioning, full length curtains, and good sound proofing!! A very comfortable stay. The hotel adjoins Paris Hotel like many of them. Resident band were terrific singing Motown on stage every night. The show Jubilee is a must. Plenty of places to eat snack/main meal. The big breakfast dining room serves all meals, and the standard and cost was second to none. Concerige was most helpful as was the front desk. The staff were happy to help at all times. Pool was delightful, sectioned for deep and shallow swimming. Good selection of drinks and reasonable prices from pool bar, lovely surroundings. I could go on and on about this hotel as the cost was so insignificant to the high standard in which we found.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: Clive1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Bally's Hotel for 4 nights and loved it. After reading the reviews here, we asked to be in the north tower (the recently refurbished one) and the room was huge, spotless and quiet. The pool was was the only other facility we used and this was fine. Bally's location is right in the middle of the strip and has a monorail stop that runs to MGM one way and the Stratosphere the other. Some general suggestions; when arriving at Vegas airport, check-in at at the office for Bally's, Paris & Caesers Hotels there as it is much quieter and quicker, and you can do this whilst waiting for your luggage (the office was near luggage conveyor 1). Also, use a taxi and not a shuttle van from the airport as these are a similar price whereas the vans can drop off at 7/8 different locations hence wasting your valuable time. The final suggestion is see one of the Cirque de Soleil shows as they are spectacular. We would definitely stay at Bally's again.

Reviews.Title: “No place like Bally's”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The BEST!!!! I stayed here from June 4-8, and I am so ready to go back. I will never stay anywhere else again. I have stayed at the Flamingo, Mirage, Trop, Excalibur, all reasonably priced hotels but this was my best stay. The location is great, the service was wonderful and upon check in they gave me the location of room that I requested. I wanted to be able to see the Bellagio Fountains and I was accomodated. Elevators are fast and plentiful. I never had to wait for one. I stayed in the North Tower(of course) on the 21st floor and had a great room at the end of the hall.. The room was big and not the most well appointed I've seen but the size and the conveniences in the room more than made up for lack of beauty and who spends time in the room anyway!. The bathroom and the dressing area is well lit-lots of mirrors and closet space, drawer space and that is all I cared about. Getting ready for the evening was easy with those accomodations. I had a couch and two chairs which never got used nor did the big dining room table! Housekeeping got me whatever I wanted-(for a small price-I left $5 evrytime I needed something). My room had a safe and a refrigerator in it, the latter being free and the safe was only $3 per day. I always had iced tea or juice in the refrigerator so when I woke up in the morning with dry mouth......could take a swig of cold juice. No coffee maker in the room tho but there is coffee everywhere for $2.75. The cafe at the pool told me I could have a free refill of coffee. The walk to the pool is no big deal at all. There is an elevator in the North Tower that goes right down to the pool level and its a pleasant walk, if you can walk. If you have a hard time walking..........well, Vegas isn't for you anyway!!!! The location is great, the walkways to the Paris and the Bellagio is such a convenience. The walkway to the Bellagio puts you right into their shopping mall but then you can take the walkway from therer to the forum shops at Ceasars...you couldn't ask for a better spot. I walked through the Paris to get to the Aladdin's wonderful shopping mall which is a must. So I was outside in the heat walking for that extended of a period. Everything I needed was at my fingertips. The pool service was terrific, I never found myself looking for a cocktail waitress and the service at the pool cafe where I ate breakfast everyday was just as accomodating. I ordered breakfast, they recommended what they thought I would like based on what the majority ordered. Breakfast Burrito, and a small fruit bowl-fresh as can be. Lunch was a turkey wrap that was huge and then in between my cocktails I drank water which was readily available at the bar-they have a cooler of water and a bucket of ice with cups at your disposal. What more can you ask for?? Friendly atmosphere. You can't go wrong. The show at the Indigo Lounge in the casino area was absolutely great. We sat in the front row and danced with the band, they are like the old Temptations-very entertaining. Cocktail service was great in the lounge as well. NEGATIVES-no big winning. I stayed alive with the slots but that is about it. I entered the slot tournament. That was fun . Its free if you register for your rewards card which is a must also if you are going to gamble. Your rewards card entitles you to a 10-15% discouunt in all of the affilitated hotel shops that are hotel owned. IE-Rio, Paris, Ballys, Flamingo and Ceasars. The "NOSH" in the back corner near the Big Buffet is a great late night snack place. That was the only place we found open for a sandwich at !0:00 PM. Everything is sooooo fresh. Don't forget to walk over to Barbary Coast-on the opposite corner of Bally's-to see Big Elvis-from 3-6 everyday. Also, I recommend using the side door to get to the Barbary Coast-you don't have to deal with the slow moving walkways. There is a free shuttle as well to the Rio(on the side entrance) if you want to visit the Voo Doo Lounge at the top to watch the sunset and the 'lights of Vegas" sparkle. What a sight. Get there before 8:00 or you will have to pay $20 to get into the Lounge. Cocktails are $10.50 but the view makes it all worth it. A Coke was $8.00 so you might as well have a martini.

Reviews.Title: “NASCAR WEEKEND”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for Nascar Weekend got rates at $159 + tax per night for the first two noghts and $99 for he last night. This is a great rate for that weekend. We checked in at the airport even though we drove from California we wanted a quicker check in the process took about 25 minutes and that is pretty fast onthe busy weekend. The airport check in are always very helpful and I've always got a nice room in the North Tower. I;ve stayed on the 16th and 14th floors here. I like staying here because I love the Sports Book very large, Plus there is a sopparra pizza, NY pretzel and a lil deli right off the side of the sports book. Also We enjoy Battista's restraunt located just next door on Audry it is the best place to eat. Also the rooms are always very clean I have stayed at the palms and also the Hard rock and it's like both of those places have a bad cleaning staff my rooms always turn up something left behind or dirty counter tops etc. Bally's room are always very clean. I agree the casino smells of smoke bad due to the low ceilings, I don't ever like to gamble here as I don't win but other surrounding casinos are a better bet. We have eaten at the Buffet, the side walk cafe and they are pretty good not great. Room service is always nice. Monorail is very close and conveinant if you buy a 24 hour pass its like ten or 15 bucks and worth it so you can drink al day and night and not have to worry about driving and at the same time ride all over. Never saw a show here but we did see the "V" show at the Venetian and liked that a lot. Never got to use the pool here but it looked like your basic pool. ALl and all I'll give Bally's a thumbs up However hearing that Harrah's Bought them (Harrahs rate are alwys so high) I proboly will never stay again if the rates climb as yu mught as well stay at the Bellagio Or MGM for Alot less. PS I was married at MGM and give the hotel and resort thumbs up on being a nice place to stay. Terrace Suite overlooking the strip with a 750 sq ft patio Amazing $1000 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Nice To Be On The Strip”
Reviews.Author: LeonaSantaRosa
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Bally's for three nights. We got a great deal and it was nice to be on the strip. However, the hotel is starting to show it's age and the non smoking rooms smell like smoke from the low ceilings in the casino. It was refreshing to enter other hotels with high ceilings. Not a good place for kids. I would probably stay again for the bargain and it's central location.

Reviews.Title: “Fun getaway, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: VEGASRUSS
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 2 night, 3 day stay at Ballys. Had a great time! We stayed on the 19th floor of the north tower and the room was very BIG, clean and comfortable. The service throughout our entire stay was great from check- in, maid service, pool side and at every resturant and shop. Ballys is in a great location on the strip, easy access to alot of great attractions. Ballys is actually connected to Paris so it is like getting two casinos, several resturants and shops in one. The only downfall of this hotel is the pool area, it is far from the room and you have to walk through a casino area, by resturants and shops in your swim gear to get there. Although the service by the pool was great the pool itself is kinda old and needs a little makeover. Lastly, we stayed there with our 6 year old daughter, she had a great time by the pool but I do have to say she was probably the only kid staying at the hotel. We have stayed at several other hotels on the strip that are much more kid friendly. Overall, great getaway and a FUN few days!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location; good price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returning from first trip to Las Vegas. Got a good deal thru [----------------------]. Found the location to be excellent: in the middle of strip right in mid of elaborate hotels: Bellagio, Caesars, near the Mirage, next to Paris. Bally's does not have special attractions, but I found pool to be plain, uncrowded, and pleasant. Pool was a trip from room. Found the room to be large, bathroom spotless. Bedcovers could be updated. They should drop the daily $3 nuisance charge for security safe use. Would have liked a mini refrigerator. The Kitchen Buffet was excellent. All food kept boiling hot--selection wonderful. Ate dinner and breakfast there a few times, using card comps. Drink price at pool area--$16 for a pina colada--I thought was outrageous. Should have stopped for a drink in casino for free and brought with me for a dollar tip. Would not invest in monorail tickets again--too far of a walk to get to monorail from many places. The music in lounge connected to casino was excellent. Two groups playing there were outstanding. Check in and check out were easy. Would stay there again if price is right, but probably would explore another location next time--south part of strip. North part of strip: Circus, circus, etc I found to be depressing and old. Saw Celine at Caesars--she has outstanding voice and it didn't feel like she had been doing it for four years. We had good seats in first mezzanine, front; but it was quite pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Offers a total package”
Reviews.Author: peabrain25
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a four night trip to Las Vegas staying at Bally’s. It was our first trip out to Sin City and we were pleased with the accommodations that Bally’s offered. Don’t get me wrong, Bally’s is no 5 star hotel, but its no ‘Joe’s Hideaway Inn’ either. But let’s get to it… Check-in – We checked in at McCarran Airport and found the staff to be very knowledgeable and accommodating. We requested a North tower room as most people seem to do, and we were surprised when they had a non-smoking room available for us at 11:30am. The woman at the counter also gave us advise on how to get to the hotel cheaply (remember to tell the cab driver NOT to take the tunnel). The room – Having checked in at the airport we were able to cruise right past the lengthy check-in line at Bally’s and go right to our room. It was spacious and nicely decorated with a couple of desks, two queen beds, and a comfortable chair. The bathroom had marble floors and counters and offered the standard hotel amenities but the room did not include a coffee maker, mini-bar, or a free safe (you had to pay $3.00 per day to use it). Our view was of Flamingo Road and the northern strip which was nice, though light sleepers may want to consider staying elsewhere as the ambulance sirens can be heard throughout the night. It should be noted that some of our party stayed next door at the Paris and their room was comparable to ours except they had one extra bench, free safe, bright blue carpet, and a mini-bar. I would have to say, however, that if I had to choose between the two hotels, I would sacrifice the expensive booze at Paris for the discount rates at Bally’s. The location – I read tons of reviews claiming that Bally’s is in a prime location, right in the center of the strip. This is true, but it doesn’t really matter because EVERYWHERE you go in Vegas will involve more walking than you might expect. It would take us around 10 to 15 minutes to walk from our room across the moving sidewalks crowded with standing people along for the ride, up an escalator, and across the street to Belagio or Caesar’s Palace. The monorail station and pool are also a hike across the lower level of the hotel. The best part about the location is that Bally’s and Paris are practically seamlessly connected via a clutter of bakeries and Parisian themed restaurants (the Nutella crepes are well worth the $6.95). The food – We only ate at the Bally’s buffet once for breakfast. Save your $12.95 and go over to the Paris for their breakfast buffet. It is the same price and noticeably better. The drinks at Bally’s were expensive if you weren’t playing. I spent $6.00 for a Corona one night after my first two only cost $1.00 each for a tip. Gaming and Entertainment – We didn’t play too much at Bally’s because the casino was relatively small and busy compared to the adjacent Paris and Aladdin. I did play cards for a while in the tiny poker room which required no wait on a Saturday night and in which the pit staff gets your chips for you so you can jump right into the game. We were able to get great Saturday night Jubilee tickets for $77.00 per ticket ($5 off for hotel guests) but I hear they are offered for cheaper elsewhere on the strip. The show was a lot more extravagant than I thought a topless, rhinestone and feather costume performance would offer – definitely worth a look. Overall we would stay at Bally’s again if the price is right. The location is relatively convenient to other properties and the renovated rooms are in pretty good condition. Besides sleeping and maybe a litte gambling, this is probably not the exciting Vegas hotel you would want to spend your whole day at, but you will feel safe and possibly see a great show while you are there.

Reviews.Title: “Bad front desk service and worrying fire alarm proceedure”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed seven nights in South Tower. On arrival asked for north tower room but was told company policy is to charge for this. Firstly, I was offered $35 extra per night to get the north tower room. This would include breakfast buffet and spa mambership for partner and myself. When I declined this, I was then offered the room at $20 per night extra (something I had seen others prev write here also). I then tried waving a print out of traveladvisor showing people got free upgrades but to no advail. The excuse this time was that upgrades are given to people spending only a few nights there. This sounds like poor business practise to me as it would be better to keep on the right side of someone spending money over 7 days in town, rather than just two nights. I didnt gamble there as a result of this poor service, and was glad. The surrounding casinos are alot nicer and more spacious. AT 4AM ON SECOND NIGHT, WAS WOKEN BY VOICE OVER TANOY IN ROOM SAYING FIRE ALARM HAD GONE OFF AND THEY WERE TRYING TO FIND OUT THE PROBLEM, AND TO STAY ALERT FOR UPDATES. AS A RESULT, GOT DRESSED AND WAITED FOR MORE INFO. IT NEVER CAME. AFTER 30 MINS LATER I WENT DOWN TO THE FRONT DESK TO BE TOLD THAT SOMEONE HAD TOUCHED THE FIRE ALARM BY MISTAKE. WHEN ASKED WHY WASNT A SECOND MESSAGE BROADCAST INTO THE ROOMS, FONT DESK LADY IMMEDIATELY FOBBD ME OFF WITH "THEY ARE WORKING ON THAT". THE SECOND MESSAGE NEVER CAME. SEEING AS THIS HOTEL USED TO BE THE MGM GRAND UNTIL A FIRE CLAIMED SEVERAL LIVES HERE, I CONSIDER THIS BORDERING ON THE NEGLEGENT AND INSENSITIVE. Having said that, the room in the south tower was large and had a great view of the paris and down the strip to ny-ny. The furniture is stuck in the 80's and should had been renovated long ago. The main lamp was broken into 3 pieces and had been stuck together. Bathroom was aveage and again showing signs of age. The toliet was too low to the floor. Big tv was good but $3 charge a day to use the room safe - rip off. The reason this hotel gets two circles is for its location and great little coffee shop by the buffet escalators. If going to the breakfast buffet, save some cash and get a ham, egg and cheese bagel from NOSH, its large enough to fill you up and save $10. Service is brilliant here and these people should be promoted to front of house. Buffet looks tired again and a bit run down, walk throught the adjoinging paris hotel to the aladin, which does great spice market buffet. The pool is halfway out to the hard rock hotel, at the back next to the momorail but is nice and deep enough for a proper swim. Excellent set of tunes blasting out. Sports book is huge but lacks atmosphere, go across to ceasrs palace, osheas or bellagio. If you stay here, use it as a cheap base and go out and explore, theres alot better waiting for you casinos out there. For this to get better feedback, the front desk need to improve and most of the place could do with a make over. Good thinds are that room was large and had a great view.

Reviews.Title: “won't stay again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We won't stay here again. We paid for our trip 6 weeks in advance, just to find out when we got there that they were sold out and didn't have a room for us. They did put us in a suite for the night and moved us the next day to a room. The front desk lady was very short and rude and the suite was terrible, hard pillows, hard bed. The room was much nicer. The service in the sidewalk cafe was not great, food was sometimes cold and the keno runner's were not there for you all the time. The good side of this is that the staff at the main keno lounge, the lady's that cleaned our room and the staff at the store were very, very nice, can't say the same for the rest of the place.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location”
Reviews.Author: divalibrarian
Reviews.Content: My Fiance and I stayed for 6 nights as part of a 'once in a lifetime trip'! Chose Bally's for its price, location and facilities and it lived up to all of this. I requested a room in the south tower and got lucky with a room facing the south strip so we had views of the Eiffel Tower and the Bellagio fountains. Even though our room was right next to the service lifts we slept soundly every night. Friends stayed in the Luxor and our room was much bigger with the added bonus of a separate dressing room area and extra sink. Ok so the casino isn't themed but with Paris next door whose facilities you can use it was great. Also, what you get with Ballys that you don't have up near the Luxor is atmosphere as soon as you step onto the Strip. Over all it was a great place to start our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Return visit to Ballys”
Reviews.Author: BenzBen
Reviews.Content: I am back with an addendum to my previous review of Bally’s Las Vegas titled “Diamond In The Rough”. Once again my stay at Bally’s Las Vegas was quite a pleasant one. The rooms are still the same size (approximately 450 square feet, larger than most standard rooms in Las Vegas), and the room that I stayed in was recently renovated (see the picture). Some of the hotel’s shops and restaurants have changed since the acquisition of Park Place Entertainment (with includes Bally’s, Paris, Caesar’s Palace, amongst others) by Harrah’s Entertainment. My room was located on the 26th floor of what I thought was the North Tower. The room was nice and clean, except for a used condom that I found in the hallway outside of the room. The hotel was very quiet despite the large amount of guests staying at the hotel; I’ve never had a problem with noise while at Bally’s. The bathroom was clean and had marble countertops and floors. One bad point that I experienced was the extremely long wait for extra towels from housekeeping. As for the casino, the table games have upped their minimums. I was there for a midweek to weekend stay and there were no $5 tables at any point in time. Ten-dollar tables are easily found and are generally open with the exception of peak hours. With the arrival of a new owner, Harrah’s Entertainment has come higher room rates. There is a significant increase in Bally’s room rates on weekends and peak days; prices that rival luxury hotels. Example: On Saturday June 24th, 2006 Bally’s is going for $299 while Bellagio goes for $359. Rates in general have increased between 30 to 40 percent. Still, Bally’s offers a center-of-it-all location and overall good service. In the past, I would not have hesitated to say that Bally’s offered the best value on the strip. However, with the increasing room rates, I would only consider staying at Bally’s if their rates were competitive. Please rate my review. I will be adding more reviews of Las Vegas hotels in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Highlight of our holiday!”
Reviews.Author: ClareWLondon
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 fantastic nights at Ballys. Upon arrival, we were advised that we had been upgraded to an Executive Suite, which was truly fantastic - an enormous room complete with luxury bathroom and amazing views over the Strip. The location of the hotel is fantastic - right in the centre of the strip and close to a Monorail station; and the swimming pool is lovely and a great place to spend the day. My only slight criticisms would be the length of time it takes to get to the carpark, which was about a day's march from our hotel room (although I guess this may be the same at most of the large casinos!), and the eagerness of the housekeeping staff to clean your room (if you don't want to be woken up at 9am by a banging on your door, I would suggest hanging a Do Not Disturb sign outside!).

Reviews.Title: “Very central location - big rooms”
Reviews.Author: Stylus70
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Ballys for 4 nights during my first trip to Las Vegas. The location is excellent because it;s right at the centre of the strip, with a lot of the big attractions (Bellagio, Caeser's Palace, Paris Hotel) a 5 min walk away.It also has a monorail connection in the hotel which is very useful for getting around or going to the Convention Centre if you are on business (as I was). The room was very big and clean. Like all Vegas hotels, the place is massive and the casino floor right in the middle of everything. The buffet restaurent is very good - good value breakfast buffet. Plus there is a small diner if you just want a coffee in the morning. It's not the newest or swankiest hotel on the strip by any means, but the location and nice swimming pool area make it a really good choice. You can walk through an internal walkway to reach the Paris hotel. Taxi from the airport is cheap - don't bother waiting hours for the shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: LCarpenter
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Bally's for one night in April 2006 waiting for our flight out of Las Vegas. Although not as swanky as some of the other hotels we have stayed in Vegas our room was big and clean. We had a slight view of the fountains but I am not in Vegas to gaze out the window all day. For the price we paid on a Friday night I would definately recommend it. My only complaint was that the shower pressure was horrible. Our dinner and breakfast were both good. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Hotel good overall”
Reviews.Author: Bobbie007
Reviews.Content: The hotel’s location was great. It’s right in the middle of the strip. Had a great view of the Paris’ Eiffel Tower and of Bellagio’s fountains/ water show. The hotel was great in that they were able to honor all of our requests - room type, non smoking and so forth. I stayed in the South Tower. There is a lot of character in the South Tower due to the fact that it still retains the details from the past BUT it is time that this tower is refurbished as well. The rooms, bathroom included were large so size can’t be beaten but there were some dusty lamp shades and one too many chips in the furniture. The staff was very helpful and I do suggest one of the packages that include show tickets. It is a good deal. TICKETS THAT CAME WITH THE PACKAGE My only complaint is that when we went to pick up the show tickets the hotel agent offered an upgrade (which would have cost an additional 40 dollars). She failed to mention that there were seats still available in the section that came with the package. I had to ask and then she gave me the seats that came with the package. The seat by the way were is the back but just fine. Full view of the front stage and the over head stage. THE SHOW It was a good show. Nice number. Can’t beat it for the price (came as part of a package). Not a good as a B’way show but a good way to spend the evening. FOOD Not bad. Buffet was good (not over the top but good). The side walk café is good for a snack. There are so many choices on the strip and Bally’s is close to so many other hotels so you can eat at those as well. The Paris which is connected to Bally’s via a walk way has tons of options and Caesars and the Bellogio is just an overpass way away. BAR Cool! There is a free show club off the bar. It is good for dancing and listening. CASINO Not bad. Slots were readily available and the over all atmosphere was enjoyable. Had a good time and over all enjoyed the hotel. When I return I will ask for one of the newer rooms. I also suggest a walk through the out door gardens (good for picture taking) and a walk through the Paris and the Caesar – there is a lot to see

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Convenient Airport Check-In”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Ballys Hotel and Casino in Las Vegas from April 14-17, 2006. We were celebrating my 30th birthday. We picked Ballys primarily because AAA offered a very affordable discounted rate on their website. After reading the reviews posted on tripadvisor, I must say that I was somewhat hesitant about our choice. Needless to say neither my wife nor I were disappointed. Ballys offers a very convenient airport check in process. Upon arriving in las vegas, my wife noticed the ballys/paris check in area and we promptly obtained our room keys. In terms of the hotel, we stayed in the South Tower. I would recommend the North Tower if are planning to stay at Ballys. Although the room's furnishings were outdated to say the least, the room itself was very spacious and clean. Also, the Ballys provides a great location near the middle of the strip. I would stay here again and would recommend this property to others. I use this site pretty often so I felt obligated to provide my feedback. Hope this helps!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Overall the hotel needs some reconditioning. The rooms are okay but not exceptional, not a good value for the money. Our room was not too clean (crumbs on the floor) and parts of the carpet were wet on our arrival. The staff refused our request to relocate to the type of room we had requested. There are so many good places to stay in Vegas that there is no reason to go here. MGM (for example) has comparable rates and is much, much nicer.

Reviews.Title: “A Real Treat in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: chachachio
Reviews.Content: Last summer, we vacationed in Vegas and stayed at Bally's. So far, after a recent not-so-good experience at the Mirage, Bally's has our vote. The price is great for all that you get out of the deal. The polished marble bathroom was large, modern and sparking clean. There was a comfortable love seat near the window, and other great amenities. The gambling was enjoyable, the servers were attentive and friendly and the slot machines were clean. The champaigne brunch was fabulous, pricey, and worth every dollar. The ladies were given a box with two truffles and a long stemmed rose. The location of Bally's is great. It's right across from the Bellagio and next to Paris. A short mall area connects Bally's with Paris and has lots of little shops and places to catch a bite or sip. There is a walkway that goes over the street to the Bellagio where there's a great buffet. The Spice Market Buffet is down the street in what was the Alladin and soon to be the new Planet Hollywood. That was voted the best buffet by the locals. We agree! It's fantastic! It's true that when in Vegas, a person usually does not plan to spend much time in their hotel room, but, you might want to kick back and relax a while. So, pick a great hotel. All the nice things you do for yourself add up and make the trip a great experience. Great night time views are from the top of the Eifel Tower and from the Voodoo Lounge at the Rio. That one is well worth the short cab ride to see the most spectacular view of all the city lights.

Reviews.Title: “Great value even better location”
Reviews.Author: mini-chippers
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Ballys 3 weeks ago for 5 nights and had a brilliant time, there was 6 couples of us and we got the rooms for $69 of their website. We stayed in the North tower and the rooms were the best we have had in Vegas. We have previously stayed in the Luxor and the NYNY and Ballys is the best yet. The main attraction was the location, just opposite is the Bellagio and Caesars Palace and there is a walkway inside the hotel to Paris. We had room service dinners a couple of nights as we were exhausted and the food was to a very good standard and reasonably priced. I would recommend this hotel to anyone, especially first timers to Vegas as it in the heart of the strip and the casino is not too noisy, like hotels such as the NYNY.

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS TIME @ BALLY'S”
Reviews.Author: Elecia0424
Reviews.Content: We loved it at Bally's. My girlfriend's and I stayed at Bally's for her Bachelorette party. At first I was slightly upset with how long the receptionist took to check us in. We complained about that and they dropped our first night room rate to $60. After that, we had nothing but a wonderful time at Bally's. Be sure to ask for the NORTH TOWER. I was amazed and glad that the casino did not smell like smoke. I would DEFINITELY stay at Bally's again. It is perfectly in the middle of the strip!

Reviews.Title: “Great room for the price!”
Reviews.Author: nankie
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my husband and 13 yr old daughter and we were all very pleased. The room (in North Tower) was very spacious, comfortable, attractively decorated and clean - especiallyfor the price. Bathroom was fresh and clean, with shiny new fixtures and marble. Service, at front desk, and housekeeping, was fine. No view (overlooked a low rooftop) but that didn't bother us.. Good location. We liked being able to walk over to the Paris. Buffet was so-so, though my husband liked it. The food seemed like quantity over quality (though aren't most buffets?). We liked the sidewalk cafe at the Paris. Would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value for stay at Ballys”
Reviews.Author: Bathonion
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a three week tour of California, Navada and Arizona. First time visit to Las Vegas which we thought was fantastic. After reading the mixed reviews on accomodation at Ballys I wasn't sure what kind of room we would get. Requested North Tower room when I booked through their website, but was told would have to wait until check in. North Tower was not available upon check in, so reluctantly took a south tower room. However we were not disappointed. The room was huge, clean and nice. We had no problems with it.(I don't know if it has had a makeover but it was really good!) Had fantastic views of Ballagio fountains and of The Eiffel tower and swimming pool. The hotel is in a fantastic position on the strip, and for the $59.00 per nt we paid I thought that we had a bargain!

Reviews.Title: “North Tower”
Reviews.Author: monroe2020
Reviews.Content: Stayed two days in the North Tower, 19th floor, Room faced Barbary Coast parking lot overlooking Flamingo Road. View of the strip was blocked by the Flamingo Hotel. Room was dated but in good condition and maintained. Average bed and bathroom. But did like the fact the standard rooms are oversized compared to standard rooms at newer properties in the area. Included a couch and coffe table. Probably 50% roomier that most other properties. No fridge. Not a lot of drawer/cubbie space for a couple. Ballys is easy to navigate, I never got lost or confused. Adjacent to monorail station, Close to strip (it isn't set back far like Ceasars or Bellagio) My only disappointment was the amount of noise from the street (Flamingo). We awoke several times to sirens from emergency vehicles. This is because the tower is so close to the street. Excellent location. Staff (dealers, front desk, bell staff, waitstaff) were all experienced, mature, and professional. Friendly, prompt, and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed”
Reviews.Author: LBAK
Reviews.Content: The good: Had a fabulous view of the Eifel Tower and Bellagio fountain show from our ##39 South Tower Room on the 20th floor. The bad: South tower rooms are in serious need of a re-model compared to the beautiful North Tower rooms. The ugly: Not much action and excitement in the immediate vicinity. Staff rather stuffy. Odds terrible. Buffet just OK. High Speed Internet not worth the exhorbitant fee.

Reviews.Title: “Big Fun at Bally's”
Reviews.Author: javarai
Reviews.Content: Firstly, other than a night at Viva Las Vegas Wedding Chapel/Hotel, Bally's was my/our first real stay in Vegas. My review of Bally's is partly probably tinted a bit by my then newfound love of Vegas as a vacation spot, and should be viewed as such. With that said, I LOVED my trip to Vegas and stay at Bally's!! I asked for a room with a view and got a big room looking at Paris' Eiffel Tower and off the right right the fountains of Bellagio (later stayed at Bellagio and got a true view, which I liked immensely). The room was really big and the bathroom big and well lit. The windows were HUGE so standing and looking down south strip was a lot of fun at night. Now, the casino was just a regular casino, but it also connects with Paris, so you have two in one, one themed, and one not. That also meant having access to dining and shopping from both areas. I loved the basic sidewalk (near shopping area) cafe because it had a REALLY good big noodle soup which I crave now. There was a good mix of reasonably priced places as well as high end places. I don't usually go for the high end restaurants, but if I did, I would opt for Bellagio's fine dining, or maybe Paris. We had a couple of pool days because our stay was in the hot season. I loved the fact that there weren't millions of kids at Bally's with which to share the pool. Their poolside drinks were incredible along with the drink service. We had no trouble finding lounge chairs. The only drawback was the LONGGGGGGGGGG walk from our tower to the pool.
