Jubilee was fun, and we got free tickets with our hotel that trip, which is an added bonus. Still, someday I will stay again. They don't have the deals they had the year I went lately.

Reviews.Title: “Check-in at the airport”
Reviews.Author: kymiss
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Bally's for 4 nights during Nascar weekend. The entire town was busy and filled with tons of people. This was our first stay at Bally's and we also requested the North Tower. We checked in at the airport while everyone else on our packed flight were waiting for bags. The line was short and quick and by the time we had our room key in hand we still waited 10 minutes for our bag. We threw our bags in the trunk of the rental car and went out to enjoy the town. We didn't even go back to our room until close to midnight. No hassle, no waiting just straight up to the room for a good nights sleep. Service was awesome, room was big and very clean and view of part of the water show from Bellagio was spectacular. Bally's is much cheaper than most strip hotels and a great value for location, service and friendliness. We will stay again!!

Reviews.Title: “South Tower Suite a Dump”
Reviews.Author: winser821
Reviews.Content: I arrived late Thursday night (3/1) and asked for a North Tower room and any free upgrades. She upgraded me to a small suite in the South Tower. There were 4 in our party, so I figured we could use the extra space. They gave us a free roll away bed. Get there, the room was a dump and very outdated. If I were Bally's, I would be ashamed of the room. We kept the room b/c we liked the extra space and knew we wouldn't spend too much time in the room. We were only paying $60/night even for Fri/Sat, so didn't argue too much. Other than the condition of the room, everything else was good. Casino dealers were nice and courteous. For the price, you can't beat it.

Reviews.Title: “Best 33rd Birthday Ever - Bally's helped me enjoy myself even better”
Reviews.Author: cheriyah8
Reviews.Content: Me and 6 friends of mine came to Las Vegas for my b-day. The check in line was long but moved rather quickly. I ask for the North tower as everyone else did in there prev reviews. I had a very large room with a great view of Paris hotel and the Aladdin Hotel. Room service was good except for one day they forgot to clean our room because we left late and when I called the front desk the manager immediately sent someone up and discounted my hotel room. The casino was good. Won a few dollars at Bally's and Paris Hotel. Beware at night the bar maids hardly circle the flr and you have to look for them but in Paris you can literally be drunk within a hour bec they constantly come to you for more drinks. Bellagio and Ceasar Hotel is wonderful for the clubs. The food is really good downstairs by the bar near the stage where the band plays. I would also tell anyone coming to vegas to use the Deuce Decuce and purchase the unlimited rides for $5 and go to see old Las Vegas. You will pay off beautifully at the older casinoes. I won alot of money at the Frontier,Circus Circus,, Stratosphere, Rivera and the slot machine by Circus Circus. I would definetly stay again at Bally's.

Reviews.Title: “Glad I chose this hotel”
Reviews.Author: biminibound
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a weekend in Vegas. I chose Bally's based on other TripAdvisor reviews and a personal recommendation. I made reservations through the 800 number and received the AAA discount. A few weeks later, I noticed on their website the per night rate had dropped. I called and asked them to honor the newer, lower price, which they did and again included my AAA discount. Based on the reviews I'd read, I wasn't really positive if the North or South Tower was better; people seem to have strong opinions about both, so I decided to take my chances. We arrived at approx. 10 pm. on a Friday night. No problem with check-in; friendly desk staff; good explanation of amenities. We received a room in the North Tower on a non-smoking floor. It was larger than some apartments I've had; comfortable, but no view. The shower had enough pressure for me. The easy chair was comfortable as well. Plenty of towels, glasses, extra toilet paper and kleenix, and soaps - even some mouthwash. The casino was not nearly as smoky as I thought it would be. I have a high sensitivity to smoke, but was hardly bothered at all in Bally's or Paris. I loved that in all the restrooms I went in, the automatic faucets delivered warm water! The Big Kitchen Cafe served a tasty brunch on Saturday. Gone are the days of the cheap brunch, but it was reasonably priced. Orantique on the Paris side was superb for dinner and worth every cent. Our flight didn't leave until very late Sunday night, so for a reasonable amount of money, I was able to obtain a check out time of 6 pm. It was wonderful to be able to take a nap and relax in a quiet room before heading to the airport. Overall, the staff was friendly, courteous and helpful. The whole experience was a positive one and I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Bally's Hotel & Casino”
Reviews.Author: Bogeyman100
Reviews.Content: The location of Bally's is excellent. We stayed in the North Tower and the room was big, clean and in good condition. I was mostly surprised by the size of the room. I thought the room would be very small. The hotel was great for the price we paid. It is just a basic casino/hotel for Las Vegas. It doesn't have all the glamour and glitz of the other hotels. I am allergic to cigarette smoke and the casino did not have very good ventilation and the ceiling was lower than other hotels. The cigarette smoke was over-whelming in Bally's. I went next door to Paris, to gamble, and it was much better. The spa was great. The food at Bally's Steakhouse is very good but expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay!”
Reviews.Author: wwscharffe
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Bally's the week of Feb. 28th and was very pleased with our stay. The hotel check-in at the airport was conveinant. The line was long however, it was nice not having to wait in line at the hotel. We got our keys and were able to take a cab to the hotel and go right to our room! The North Tower rooms were very spacious and clean. Make note to ask for a North Tower room since they were renovated late last year. The hotel staff were nice and always willing to assist us. The casino was clean and the location was right on the heart of the Las Vegas Strip. I would definitly stay here again and would recommend it to anyone who is looking for a Vegas hotel with a great location and reasonable rates. Thank you Ballys!

Reviews.Title: “Impressed with Ballys”
Reviews.Author: CJRBedfordshire_UK
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights in October. Got upgraded to a suite on the 5th floor on arrival, with views over the Barbary Cost/Flamingos side of the Hotel. Room clean and tidy, staff helpful. Casino not as huge or glitzy as some of the newer hotels but can't beat the location of the hotel - very centrally placed with easy access to the monorail. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It has been 8 years since I was in Vegas, and I must say it has changed much. My family was planning on a family vacation, and were looking at various hotels. The one that looked the best (for price and location) was Bally's. At first arrival, the valet car attendants were fast to open the doors and take the car. The hotel check in line went fast, and the employees were VERY polite. Our rooms were in the North Tower, on the 20th & 25th floor. The view from my room was not that great, although my parents view was of the Bellagio fountains! The rooms were very large, clean, smelled fresh, and the linens were very bright. I was very pleased by that. The casino is a bit old, but (as I said earlier) the location is so great, because you can walk to most of the major new casinos. Paris (which connects to Bally's) was a wonderful alternative to the Bally's casino. All in all, the employees were very polite and helpful. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone who likes large, clean rooms, at an affordable cost!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Bally's”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just got back today from our visit to Vegas. I have stayed in many hotels on the strip and in downtown, and so far for the money, Bally's has my vote. If you want luxury and pampering, pay the money and go to the Venetian or Bellagio. If you just want space, comfort, and service, then Bally's ranks right up there. We had planned on checking in at the airport, but after wrestling our way to our bags and being stressed by inconsiderate people and crowds in the airport, we didn't even bother looking for the check in desk. We just hit a cab and went to the hotel to check in there. No problem with check in lines. We got early check in with no problem; though I don't think they offer the same upgrades at the hotel that they do at the airport. I didn't think there would be any difference, but when I asked for an upgrade, I was handed a book that listed a "renovated" room for an extra $20 per night, you don't want to know what a real upgrade costs. We decided to go with what we had. We got a south tower room and I am happy to say that it wouldn't have been worth it for an "upgraded" north tower room. Our room was absolutely huge compared to most rooms. The bed was comfortable, the maid service great, a sitting area and a large bathroom. I will agree with previous reviews that say that the shower pressure leaves something to be desired. The water is hot and the shower is great, but you cannot adjust the shower head. So, if you are spoiled to massage shower heads, you might be dissapointed. The showers spray and that is it. But, I paid 3 times the price for a room at Harrahs and that room was so cramped and crammed, I will tradean adjustable shower head for some comfort and space(not to mention the $$$ savings). If you are in the south tower, your elevators are just to the right of the entrance which is nice. Just a few steps from that elevator is Nosh which serves wonderful pastries and strong coffee, a few more steps and you are at the Java (something) that has better coffee. As far as room service prices, they are the best I have seen so far. I wouldn't complain about almost $8 plus a $2 room service fee for a pot of coffee when I have paid over $22 for it at a less comfortable hotel. Another thing about Bally's is that the casino is wide and open and rarely crowded. You can actually walk through the place. They have the shoppe avenue and then there is a mall that connects them to the Paris. No, the rooms don't have a coffee pot or a fridge, but really, do you expect them to at the price? They have hair dryers and ironing board/iron. As far as ammenities, for the price I can't see how you can expect more. If you don't want to order room service or travel down for coffee, then bring your own pot. There is plenty of room for you to set it up in. We intended to, but ran off & left the thing. Price, location, room comfort, service; on all of those things I think Bally's rates 5 stars. The rooms are very clean, and very comfortable. I'd rather stay here and pay less for a great room yet be right in the middle of all of the action in just a few steps. Bally's is our pick for hotels and a great place to stay for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Bally's is pretty good”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I met some friends in Vegas Feb 24-27. Check In: there was a line but it went by fast. Room: GREAT PRICE for the location and size of the room. There was plenty of space for 3 people. We had 2 queens and a roll away. GREAT VIEW of bellagio fountains, Eiffel tower and south down the strip. Bathroom was OK. The shower could have been better. There wasn't a fridge or a coffee maker. The casino floor is kind of blah. Overall there's plenty of space. PERFECT LOCATION ON THE STRIP (did I mention that?) There's a free shuttle to the Rio. The biggest negative was the cafe. the lady was rude, didn't seem happy and acted like we were putting her out by making her do her job. She tried to get us out as fast as she could. I love staying at the Rio but I'd stay at Bally's again if the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “FAB Time at Bally's”
Reviews.Author: mamie222
Reviews.Content: Received excellent rates by booking directly through Bally's. Per reviews on this site, requested NS rooms in the North Tower. We upgraded to a really nice Suite with a Jacuzzi for $50/night. We checked in to our hotel at the airport, and it saved us tons of time. The staff, at the airport check-in, the hotel and the casino was friendly and courteous. The bartenders and wait staff at the casino kept our drinks fresh. The room was nice and large with an awesome view of the strip. The window/sliding glass door didn't open, but that was not a problem for us. The bathroom was quite large with an adequate shower and tub. The staff kept the room clean and tidy. When items were ordered from housekeeping they arrived in a timely manner. Great location on the strip. Us amateurs gambled at the lower stakes tables in the Paris Casino (attached to Bally's). Buy a couple of bottles of H2O at a convenience store, as they are $5 in your room. Got a Hot Stone Massage at the Spa at Bally's...overall the spa ambiance/experience was nice although the massage was somewhat average, but much less expensive than the other spas in the area. We are very happy with our experience, especially when location and price is factored in. Bally's is a great staging area, as it is in the middle of it all with a train stop in the back of the hotel. We will definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “a bit surprised”
Reviews.Author: Berts06
Reviews.Content: My family spent a few days at Bally's before going on to the Grand Canyon and I was a bit surprised the lack of things you come to expect at hotels. No coffee in the rooms, which we ended up ordering daily for $15+. Internet that you had to pay for at $11/day, which was totally unexpected since I was working out of the room for the few days there. Drinking water! My family is used to drinking a lot and the bottles in the room were about $5, I ended up buying a few gallons at a local store for $1.75. Another thing that I didn't expect was the smoke in every location. When you come from a state with many no-smoking rules you get used to not smelling that gross smell. Out there if you are a non-smoker, plan on many showers, you can't avoid the smoke.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant”
Reviews.Author: parishioner
Reviews.Content: We have been visiting Las Vegas from Calgary, AB Canada every year for the past 20+ years (along with most members of our families). Over the years, we've stayed at many hotels -- Stardust, Circus Circus, Monte Carlo, Excalibur, Flamingo, Imperial Palace and Mirage to name a few. We usually just try to get the best deal on the strip when booking our trips. Bally's happened to be the best deal at the time of booking using an online travel booking service. Upon arrival in Vegas, we could not locate the airport check-in counter (different terminal?) but check-in at the hotel was quick and fairly painless (a bit of an attitude and feeling rushed by attendant though). Travelled with our kids and elderly parents and we were appointed two rooms close to each other, located in the South Tower. Had I known better, I would've booked the North Tower instead (have to walk through the casino to get to the South elevators...not something I enjoy doing with my kids but then again, this is Vegas). Rooms were okay...nothing fancy but clean. Windows don't open which was a negative for us as we enjoy fresh air, especially while sleeping. But had a great view of the Eiffel Tower and partial view of Bellagio's fountains. Bathroom was a good size but tub was a bit small and there was not much pressure from the shower head. Really miss having a coffeemaker in the room but was able to buy fairly decent coffees each morning right downstairs from our room. Enjoyed the hotel buffet several times but breakfast was especially good there. And the restaurant itself was impressive and had actual, real daylight (not often found in Vegas restaurants!!). Did not use the pool as it was too cold that week in Vegas to do much of anything outside. Really liked the close proximity to the strip and other hotels (Caesars, Bellagio, Paris)...easy and quick to get to from inside the hotel lobby. Parking is shared with Paris and quite a hike to get to from our room. This was probably the biggest complaint as we had rented a car and drove around a lot. Slots were okay -- paid sometimes and not other times. Casino has plenty of 'penny' slots, which were great for my parents who enjoy gambling alot. Drink service while playing slots was not reliable (we tip $1 per order). Used the handy TV check-out service which worked great (nothing extra or unusual showed up on my credit card bill). All in all, I can probably best sum up our experience at Bally's from what my youngest daughter said "This hotel is nice but it doesn't have a theme like the other ones do". If its a decent, fairly quiet, clean, smaller hotel that is "themeless", Bally's is the one for you. I would definitely stay again if the price is right.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: ajox
Reviews.Content: We stayed 1 night, mid-week in February, 2006, at Bally's. We got a great rate and were upgraded to a suite. We had the "Vintage Vegas" package that included $50 in coupons toward the hotel restaraunts; some were usuable, but because the largest coupon was for the most expensive restaraunt we felt a little cheated because we had thought we could use the full $50 toward any restaraunt. Nice room, with a jacuzzi tub. We were surprised that the room did not have shampoo in the shower. We had an average dinner at the Sidewalk Cafe. A plus is that Bally's is attached to Paris, and it's an easy walk to go to Paris. Bally's is good choice for mid-strip, but we didn't find much exceptional about it.

Reviews.Title: “Good Basic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Bally's from 2/12-2/15 2006. We picked this hotel for value and location. This was only our second trip to Vegas. Checked in at the airport which had no waiting and very friendly service. We got a room in the north tower as requested. Took the $5 shuttle to hotel, Bally's was last stop, for a dollar or two more, taxis are much quicker. Our room wasn't ready yet at 11:00AM. Requested different room in north tower and got one on the sixth floor. Bellman had the bags to our room in just a few minutes. Room was clean and roomy-a basic hotel room. We had a view of the roof of the sports betting parlor- I didn't care. Casino is nothing special, although I requested a five dollar blackjack table the last morning of our stay and they opened one- can't beat that. Drink service was scarce unless you're playing table games. The only restaurant we tried was the sidewalk cafe. The food and service was very good. We spent most of our time at other properties on the strip. The Paris is a really neat place, just a short walk through the casino. We really enjoyed the trip up the Eifel Tower at night and the live music in the Paris casino. We were looking for a clean room in the middle of the strip that wouldn't break the bank and Bally's delivered.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: rckbtm9999
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Bally's for the weekend of Feb. 10-13. No complaints at all. We stayed in the North Tower. Great location on the strip. Great pricing. Good food. Easy access to the Paris. Room was very clean. Service was top-notch. I would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Super Bowl XL at Ballys...lots of Funnnnn”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: REALLY Enjoyed OUR stay. Checked in saturday evening February 4, 2006 with intentions of having a good time for SUPER BOWL XL. Since we arrived around 11:00 P.M. and it was our first stay at BALLYS we experienced a delay in check-in but after finally getting to the reservation desk things got better. BALLYS comped us a roll-away bed since we were put in a room by an elevator and that saved us $90.00 over three nights. We did not spend alot of time in the rooms even though they were clean and comfortable. most our time was spent on the floor playing BLACKJACK and ROULETTE. We were treated very proffessionally and already looking forward to a return visit. After the SUPER BOWL the next couple of days was alot of fun exploring and eating. Fortunatley i qualified as a PLATNIUM REWARDS visitor and things just got bettter and better. WE will be back...THANKS to ALL the STAFF ...ESPECIALLY the ROULETTE area....ed

Reviews.Title: “Treated well at Ball'y....no complaints”
Reviews.Author: snowyowl6
Reviews.Content: Check in was great, valet service staff very friendly. Front desk check in went smoothly, my husband asked for the North tower and was given the choice of two rooms, we took the 21st floor for a better view and less street noise. When we got off the elevator the hallway was clean neat and smelled so fresh, we are nonsmokers. Our room was clean and fresh also. The casino was slightly smoky at times but nothing to drive us away or stop us from returning. The cocktail waitress made her rounds frequently, we are not heavy drinkers but to us she was available for our needs even to answer questions. We were so tired at night we slept well so I can't comment on noise if there was any. The view was just okay since we were on the 21st floor nothing like looking at the Paris side but we could see neon lights and city lights in the distance. The show at Bally's is great too take the 1.5 hours to enjoy it. Getting to "The Paris" Hotel is so easy so that is a big plus. This review is from people in there 50's, we stayed weekdays so week ends may be different.

Reviews.Title: “Very basic, good location”
Reviews.Author: Patrick58
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the north tower of Bally's from 2-3-06 to 2-7-06 with 10 friends from Pennsylvania. You probably remember us if you saw the intoxicated "shrimp chef" running around the casino on Saturday afternoon. Anyway, the rooms were very basic, but clean. Not as big and modern as those in the MGM Grand when I visited in 2003. Housekeeping staff was very courteous. They provided us with everything we needed. Chicken Parm at the Sidewalk Cafe was great. Guess it's tough to screw that up. The lunch buffet was just OK. Breakfast was a little better. Staff in general was very helpful and friendly. If you are looking for vast dining options and a luxurious setting, stay somewhere else. My group was just looking for a clean and inexpensive place to stay at the center of everything. That's what we got. If you are looking for some cheap drinks and eats, stop in the Ellis Island Casino located behind Bally's. Obviously a "locals" place. However, you can't beat the $1.00 drafts (own Brewery) and loose slots.

Reviews.Title: “Ballys disappointed us, we won't be back”
Reviews.Author: JimBobTraveler
Reviews.Content: My wife and I go to Vegas once or twice a year, so we have lots of experiences and "comps" there. We stayed at Bally's over the Superbowl 40 weekend, in Saturday, out Monday, our first time there. Overall, "just OK" and we will not go back next time. Our biggest complaint is all about cigarette smoke, so if you don't mind smoke, it may be the place for you. Upon checkin, we asked what upgrades were available, and we paid an extra $109/night for a suite on Floor 11, a posted, non-smoking floor. Early Sunday morning, our suite 1161 filled up with cigarette smoke from room 1161A, which was separated by a door, not a wall. We complained to the manager, Daryl, who was not happy with US, but later the smoke had cleared, only to reappear on Monday am. Later on Sunday, the hall was filled with smoke from room 1162, you could see it coming out from under the door. Ugh!! We complained again, and the problem was caused by the other guests not the hotel, but, we won't be back. The casino smoke became overwhelming also. They will propbably never ban smoking, but they could manage the ventilation systems if they tried.. They do at the Mirage and at the new Wynn. On the plus side, the staff were well trained and very eager to help. The breakfast buffet was the best we've seen, very large selection of very high quality, well-prepared food, very attractively presented. The Steakhouse restaurant met/exceeded our expectations. Good piece of ribeye (if you want the best, you need to go to Mortons,Ruths, Smith at much greater cost), cooked just right. Exquisite onion rings, fries perfectly done, and a great banana cream pie my wife said was the best she had ever had. On the other hand, stay away from the deli next to Sbarro's by the Sports Bar on the P level. My Reuben sandwich left a puddle on my plate and the corned beef had lots of fat, I couldn't finish it. If you like fresh Asian food, Noodles in Bellagio is our favorite, and Redd in Wynns is very good also. The cocktail waitresses in Wynn are the best looking on the strip, all beautiful. Be sure and visit Wynn and Bellagio for the beautifully finished main lobbies and gardens. We see many shows, this time KA at MGM, very very good, and nerve-racking at times, in fear that the performers may fall. Still, "O" at Bellagio is the best show of all time with Zumanity at the bottle of the Cirque offerings. Celine is great but does many covers of others' work, when her own body of work is so extensive and that's what you want to here. Penn & Teller will disappoint anyone over age 8 and LaFemme at MGM will be appreciated by everone who appreciates the female body without requiring it to be a turnon. We ate at SeaBlue at MGM before the show, excellent although my rare tuna steak was not cut from the tender belly. We would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Bally's”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaKit
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed Bally's for four days with family group. Standard rooms were roomy, clean, and comfortable. Check in with Ginger made us feel quite welcome. A little trouble with maid service one day, but partly our fault: we left the DND sign on door all day. Getting fresh towels took three calls to housekeeping. Saw KA at MGM grand, great show! -must see if you are a Cirque fan, and very easy to get to on Monorail which stops at Bally's. Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Bally's was comfortable”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from 4 nights in Vegas at Bally's. The room was large, and the king size bed very comfortable. The decor was late 70's. The bathroom was large with lots of mirrors. A couple chipped tiles needed repair. The shower pressure needed work. Housekeeping was emaculate. Our room was on the south side of the south tower-a breath-taking view of the fountains at Bellagio!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at Bally's”
Reviews.Author: SVEND
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Bally's from 1/18 - 1/21. Requested the north tower at time of booking and had no problem when we checked in. The room was very spacious. Bathroom was large and updated. The only problem with the north tower rooms are the sirens and ambulances that you can hear at night because the hospital is on Flamingo Road about 5 miles east of Bally's. Otherwise, we were both very satisfied with our room. Bally's pool was closed and drained of all it's water but the pool and hot tub at Paris, which Bally's guests are allowed to use, was open from 10:00am-5:00p.m. To all the people who have written reviews that the casino is smokey, ALL CASINOS ARE SMOKEY - that's the way it is! Bally's casino is very easy to navigate. There are some casinos that are so confusing and laid out terribly - not Bally's. Had no problem finding the rest of the gang we were with when we went our separate ways gambling. Make sure you sign up for a Total Rewards card as soon as you get there (if your going to gamble). You also get a discount on all Bally's/Paris gift shop purchases with that card (whether you gamble or not). The monorail stops at Ballys but it is pretty expensive. $5.00 one way for one person or $9.00 one way for two people. All day pass is $15.00 a person and runs until about 3:00am or 4:00 am. It also runs behind the hotels so you really don't get a good view of all the hotels and action. We thought the better transportation option was the trolley. $5.00 gets you an all day pass and you can get on and off as many times as you want. They trolley stops right in front of Bally's just beyond the taxi drop off and it starts at 9:30am and ends at 1:30am. Great views of the strip and all the action. Took a craps class at the Venitian Hotel to learn the game a little better. Best thing we did. FREE class started at 11:00am, lasted 1/2 hour and at the end of the class they gave each person $15.00 of hotel money to use towards table games. Very nice! There are quite a few hotels who offer classes in craps, black jack, poker, etc. Find out about them and take advantage of them! Unfortunately Bally's did not offer any classes but Barbarry Coast right across the street does offer classes. Best dinner we had was at the Steak House Restaurant in Circus Circus. Didn't care for the hotel but the restaurant was excellent. Half the price of Prime Steakhouse at the Bellagio, and the quality was just as good. Atmosphere was elegant fine dining. Rented a car and drove to the Hover Dam. Took us less then an hour to get there. Unbelievable sight! Also drove through and had lunch at Lake Las Vegas, very nice! We had a great trip and definitely would stay at Bally's again!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: hypnoticrichard
Reviews.Content: Booked this with a "lastminute" deal through American Airlines. I came with my 14 year old son. He loved the monorail that runs at the back of the hotel up and down the strip. It was a fantastic location, and based on reviews here asked for a North tower room and got it no extra charge. I have stayed at 8 other strip hotels, and was very happy with Bally's. My expectations were low based on some other reviews but the service was good, valet was good, food was good and the room was very nice, modern, clean and although simple, quite nice. I would stay here again, the location can't be beat. Also, high speed internet access actually worked- a problem at other strip hotels.....

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mofo_phill
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the weekend and had a wonderful time. This is the 2nd time that I have visited Vegas and I still had to be dragged home kicking and screaming b/c I wasn't ready to leave. Ballys is an excellent hotel with an absolutely awesome location. A very nice, clean, well situated hotel, with plenty of amenities and close to everything that you need. The casino is a little boring, but that's where location plays. Would definetely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon at Bally's”
Reviews.Author: littleliser
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Bally's for a week on our honeymoon during the second week of Nov. 2005. Upon check in, we asked if they had any upgrades available - they offered to upgrade our standard room to a jacuzzi suite for $25 more a night, so we bit. We ended up on the top floor of the South Tower - we had a great view of Caesar's and were across from Barbary Coast. We loved sitting at our enormous floor-to-ceiling windows just "people watching" - Vegas truly never stops! The room was not a renovated one - but it was huge, clean, and quiet on our floor. We took advantage of the jacuzzi nearly every day, and enjoyed the huge steam shower - I think you could probably fit 4-5 people in there, easy. With the layout and decor of the room, I kept envisioning "Boogie NIght"-esque parties with girls in the hot tub, etc. We enjoyed it and plan to go back again for our anniversary, if not sooner.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rulebritannia
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Bally's over the New Year holidays and specifically asked for rooms in the North Tower (due to the reviews I had read on Trip Advisor). The room was very spacious and we were really pleased with it (the only drawback being the noise from the police or ambulance sirens late at night). It might not be one of the newest hotels in the strip, but we certainly found it to be in an excellent location - even better that you can walk from Bally's to Paris without going outside. The breakfast buffet in the Paris part is fantastic value and they offer an extensive choice of good food. Would certainly recommend Ballys. If you fancy a real change, take a taxi ride (about 40 minutes) to the new Ritz Carlton at Lake Las Vegas - we had a lovely New Year's day brunch - such a beautiful hotel in lovely surroundings.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during the Christmas holidays. This hotel is old and it shows in the casino and south tower rooms. Our room was large and clean and it was okay for the two of us, but was starting to show it's age. The hotel wanted $20 more per night for a renovated "standard" room. They quoted a standard room price online, and I didn't know there were two types of "standard" rooms. They did compensate by giving us a gorgeous view of the Eiffel Tower, the Paris pool and a half view of the Bellagio dancing waters. I fell asleep each night gazing at the beautifully lit Eiffel Tower! Bally's pool was closed, but we had the use of the Paris pool and hot tubs (very nice.) We played tennis on Bally's courts at $12 per hour which I thought was high considering we were their "guests". Also, we work out at the gym regularly and wanted to use the fitness center, but it was $22 per day per person which was too rich for us. The casino always smelled smoky to us non-smokers, too. But Bally's main attraction is it's location-next to Paris and Aladdin, across from Bellagio and Caesars and central on the monorail line. There is so much to do all up and down the strip that we never had a dull moment. All in all, it was a good stay and we would stay there again if the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Happy New Year 2006 at Ballys”
Reviews.Author: scott104
Reviews.Content: My wife and I rang in 2006 at Ballys. Our stay was between Dec 29-Jan 1. What a blast! If anyone has considered spending New Years Eve in Las Vegas and haven’t had a chance, make it a point to go. It is one NON STOP PARTY! I am 45; my wife is 46, so we aren’t kids. But we like to have a good time. We socialized with everyone from 21 years old to 70. The only difference between us and the 20 year olds is that we required naps. Everyone we encountered was smiling, drinking, and just having a great time! More about the party later. As usual, we left Connecticut at 5am, got into airport at 10:50am Nevada time. If you take the taxi to Ballys and he takes you through the tunnel, don’t tip him! He is taking the long way and he is ripping you off. Cab fair should about 12 bucks and the drive should be from Paradise to Flamingo to Ballys. Limos are typically $75.00 one way. Arriving at Ballys we had our bags taken from the bellman and preceded to the check in desk about 11:20am. The line was long but moved very fast. We got to the desk about 10 minutes and were given our complimentary room in the South Tower. Other people we heard had to wait for their room but we had no problem checking in early once again. This could contribute to a smoking room request. Called the bellman to bring up our bags, and he arrived at our door ten minutes later. Tipped the bell hop and got ready for the day. I have read some complaining about the South Tower. Granted, it is not as new as the North Tower but there are no problems with Housekeeping at all! Some people are harder to please. They should go another hotel at 300 dollar a night. But if you are in Vegas, how long are you staying in the room, anyways? Since the room is free, I usually end up in the older tower. But it has always been clean and the king size bed is roomy and comfortable. If you want a view of the strip you must request it. The shower was missing the floor mat. I asked one of the maids the next room over to get me one so I don’t slip and break my head while showering. Five minutes later she knocked on the door with the mat with a smile on her face. I tipped her a five dollar bill and she was so thankful, her smile turned into a glow. They work very hard for very little money. During the first night, my wife shut the door to the bathroom and the corner marble tile fell off the wall with a resounding bang! Startled by the sound, we both had a good laugh. We just left it there because it was not in the way of anything and it was directly underneath the sink. Later, I hoped that my wife and I didn’t get into an argument, remembering the loose tile, and find her hitting me over the head with it. Get a connection card. Even if you don’t really gamble that much, it will be to your advantage. All restaurants, including Ballys Steakhouse, will give you 10% off your entire bill. They won’t ask for the card. They won’t tell you about it the discount. Just hand the card to the server when paying your bill. If you do gamble, put all dinners on your room. This way, when checking out, any comps that you’ve earned can be deducted from the room bill. Personally, we like room service. Except for New Years Eve, we had our meals rolled into the room within 45 minutes after ordering. However, New Years was a 4 hour wait. So we went down the Tequila Bar, had a very delicious Quasadeas and Tacos appetizers, served with 4 different sauces, with two extremely large Margaritas at the tune of $45.00 less 10% (connection card). Phoning in room service the next day we made sure our fat intake was well satisfied with Philly Cheese Steaks, Cheeseburgers, and Shrimp Cocktail. All very good eating, always been served hot and, like anything else in Vegas, available 24 hours a day. On the casino floor, I never, ever, had a problem getting drinks. Even on a very busy New Years Eve. This is why. When I receive my first drink after sitting down at a blackjack table or slot machine, I tip my first drink 3 to 5 dollars. Few people know this but all waitresses in Las Vegas have to pay taxes on every drink they serve. Part of your token goes to paying that tax. So if you don’t tip them the first time around, although the drink is free to you, it is not to the person who is serving it. Don’t expect to see your waitress anytime in the near future. Tipping well the first time, and then a buck or so after, will secure frequent visits from your hostess while gambling. On to New Years Eve party at the Strip. Being older and, supposedly wiser, I had inquired about safety on Las Vegas Blvd at New Years. The strip is closed down to traffic for the party goers. Gucci Fireworks puts on a synchronized show from the roof tops of ten casinos which is an awesome sight to see. People everywhere drinking, yelling and screaming. Having a great time but not out of control. You can’t have bottles or cans out like normal, but drinks in plastic are ok. Las Vegas had a very heavy police presence which made it very safe. The police are great and don’t interfere with the partying unless you violate a rule. So my wife and I ventured out to the strip to see the fireworks show. It wasn’t a disappointment. It was spectacular! Unless you are claustrophobic, you are in for a real experience. It is wall to wall people and the synergy was incredible! People were just having a great time and we had absolutely no problem mingling in with the 300,000 people who left planet Earth and came to Vegas. With a two hour nap, my wife and I were good to go till 3am. Whoohoo! Ballys have never been a disappointment to me. From the pit bosses all the way down to the chamber maids, Ballys had always come though for us. All in all, the rooms, employees, and the attitudes, have always been all good. I have found that if you are nice to the people who wait on you or provide a service, in turn, you will be treated fairly with a smile. Don’t think that if you have a problem with the service, and it does happen, that screaming and carrying on like a spoiled brat is going to get you good results. Ballys’ personnel will try to resolve any issues you have. It is all on how you approach them is the key. So if you are up to a good trip to Vegas, Ballys will treat you right. Viva Las Vegas Baby!

Reviews.Title: “Great central location & space!”
Reviews.Author: Point2point
Reviews.Content: We visited during the quiet week before Xmas - Vegas was still lively, though it was definitely easier to get into shows and restaurants! Check-in was quick and easy, and we did the express check-out. We booked Bally's over the internet. For $59, we got a LARGE room on the non-smoking 18th floor of the North Tower. The room was nicely decorated. We faced onto Flamingo Road, so it wasn't the best view, although during the daytime, you could see the mountains in the distance. The King-sized bed was comfortable, the bathroom large and clean. Only one issue with the place - the towels in the bathroom had that "funky" smell like they had been balled up wet for a week and then washed. Bally's was convenient to Paris with a short underground passageway. We ate at the Boulangerie a couple of times (not gourmet, but decent). The Paris buffet was busy for breakfast & dinner - didn't try it but heard it was good. We were out most of the day/night, so we didn't experience any of the restaurants at Bally's. They did have live entertainment in their lounge every night which drew a crowd. The casino floor was smoky (what isn't here?), although other casinos were worse. The pool was closed for the season, but you could use the Paris hotel pool on the third floor (the Bally's pool is a longish walk from the lobby). This is definitely a central hotel! Mid-strip, with the fancier Bellagio and Caesars across the street. We found walking the strip easy. Yes, the blocks are long, but most people can walk it. You can also take the monorail, but we found that you had to walk quite a distance to/from it behind the strip. We would definitely stay here again, although my husband would have liked the place to have a "younger" feel - a little more hip.

Reviews.Title: “Happy New Year in the Ballys”
Reviews.Author: cherished
Reviews.Content: Just returned after speading New Year in the Ballys and it was the best New year i can remember having. We arrived there to be told our rooms were on the 25th floor of the North tower. I openeded the door and could not belived the size of the room and how lovley it was. Everything in the room was spotless and new if I every go back to Las Vegas i will stay at the ballys again

Reviews.Title: “Bed, Bathroom, Location”
Reviews.Author: Oilfan4life
Reviews.Content: Four of us stayed for 4 nights recently in 2 rooms. We stayed in the older tower and was a little worried reading the reviews. We arrived and the room was very spacious and clean. Bathroom was fine. We spent very little time in the room anyway, but had no complaints. First time to Vegas for me and the other big resorts looked a lot nicer, but if you want nicer PAY for it. Our rooms ended up being $59 per night on weeknights, can you beat that price? Pay the extra $100 a night for Ceasar's or Wynn and then you may want to spend a lot of time in the room, we spent most of our time seeing shows and gawking at the sights. I would definitely stay here again and don't care what tower I'd stay in. Central location is great for seeing shows at any hotel!

Reviews.Title: “The good and bad of Ballys”
Reviews.Author: paris_1204
Reviews.Content: I'm writing this review while staying at Ballys. This has been our third time here. Yes, there are two towers and the south tower is the non-renovated one. Unfortunately this tower is more convenient to the meeting rooms and they also face the midstrip so you'll get excellent views of the Bellagio dancing fountains and the "Eiffel Tower". Therefore, we always request a south tower room. The above are the great things about our Ballys stay. Now for the bad: Rooms need renovating and maintenance: The south tower rooms dearly need renovating and maintaining. The decor is past being tired and worn. Currently the decor is circa 1980's. Our other bathrooms in the south tower were allright, but during our current stay the bathroom, while fine with the large marble countertop, needs to be renovated immediately. The shower is horrible with the head missing part of the spray attachment so you get blasted with a 'fire hose' effect, there is terrible moldy grout between the (white) tiles, the shower door has seen better days, and the ceiling light/fan fixture is missing a cover. Poor housekeeping: No good housekeeping is available at Ballys. At least in our current room there isn't. Room service menus were taken out from the hotel info. binder but were not replaced. Laundry bags were not replaced as well. The room had terrible dust next to and behind the beds and anywhere that's not in the forefront; obviously the housekeepers are not doing a good job. Hear and feel every noise: The rooms have zero insulation so you hear every single movement, TV show, and conversation (including arguments). You can hear door slamming from not only your next door neighbors but also from your fellow guests down the hallway. Guests are so stupid and disrespectful of other guests that they allow their doors to slam and bang no matter what hour of the day or night and the noise resonates in your room. Kids and adults run up and down the corridors and this is very disturbing too. Our next door neighbors were slamming their doors from 11 p.m. to 2 a.m. and also their kids (?) were running around inside the room for a while. We tried to sleep but would be awakened rudely with the noises. As it went on for hours we had to call security to have them talk to them. In conclusion, if you want a moderately priced hotel with a great mid-Strip location, this is it. But remember it comes in the price of poor housekeeping, badly maintained south tower rooms, and there is a 100% chance that your noisy neighbors will keep you awake.

Reviews.Title: “Another great Bally's stay!”
Reviews.Author: Troy34215
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Ballys from 12/11-12/15 in the South Tower. True: The rooms aren’t quite as nicely appointed as the North Tower, but their quality is still excellent with marble bathrooms and in-room safes! These rooms are still an outstanding deal as we got a room rate of about $50 per night for an upscale resort directly on the strip. Service from the staff, and Housekeeping, was professional and courteous as always. Two tips for those going to Vegas: 1.) Play poker at Ballys and the Bellagio! The poker room at Ballys is no-frills, but the players are friendly and they run daily low buy-in ($55) tournaments. The Bellagio poker room defies explanation as it is the finest and most comfortable room I’ve had the pleasure of playing in. Not to mention that you will be, literally, rubbing elbows with the biggest names in poker: Ivey, Farha, Hellmuth, Brunson, etc. 2.) Have dinner at the Binion’s Ranch Steakhouse downtown! This classy but comfortable restaurant is on the top floor of Binion’s with food that is even more incredible than the view. A well kept Vegas secret is how tremendous this restaurant truly is. If you’re looking for a taste of how Vegas used to be, this place is hard to beat!

Reviews.Title: “Buyer Beware!”
Reviews.Author: onboard2000
Reviews.Content: When booking a room at Bally's...buyer beware! They have a new tower and an old tower. Fortunately for us, my son had stayed at this hotel before and new the difference. After much complaining hotel management agreed to move us. Would we ever stay at this hotel again....as hotel management told us...we now know the difference and can no longer use the excuse...this is totally absurd. (lol)....Bally's management, further said, that for us to get the better rooms, there was no guarantee when booking on line. I booked 4 rooms with this hotel and expected to be treated (lol) a bit better, forget it! Once again, buyer beware when booking at this hotel. We sent two emails to Bally's concerning this and A.A. Vacations. Only A.A. responded and said the pictures of the hotel rooms on the internet were provided by the hotel and that they had no control on the actual booking of the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “bally's - no complaints”
Reviews.Author: larrypharm
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a north tower room Dec. 9-12 . Room was clean and everything seemed to work. Bathtub drained a little slow. No noise that I noticed. Not much of a view, but I was hardly in the room. Would recommend if looking for a clean comortable room in a good location. If you want a lot of extras (and want to pay for them) you might consider somewhere else

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, even better location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Bally's for five nights at the end of December and was completely satisfied. Both the room and bathroom were very spacious and spotlessly clean. The weekday rates of $60 per night made me a little wary before check-in but I had no need to be it was an absolute bargain. I travelled over with a friend for the marathon who had pre-booked at Circus Circus. I'll not comment much on that place only to say read the reviews, pay a little extra and stay in Bally's - it's in a different league. Bally's is a little more understated than the rest of the hotels on the strip with no overall 'Disney World' style theme, this is subjective I know but I prefered it and of course it is reflected in their great rates. Besides within a two minute stroll along a connecting arcade your in the Paris casino and you've got Ballagio, Caesars, Mirage etc just over the strip all within five minute walk, not to mention the monorail station attached which connects you to the farther reaches of the strip. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Bally's is a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: vegasholic
Reviews.Content: For only $69 a night I wasn't really expecting much form Bally's. When we arrived at the airport we were able to check in to the hotel right there (Ceasars has a desk at the airport and bally's guests can check in there also). Even though check in was really until 3pm they let us check in at 11am for no extra charge. Once we got to the hotel and saw the room it by far exceeded my expectations. It was about 600 sq. ft. and there was a chaise lounge, a desk, TV, safe, HUGE bathroom, and great view. We ordered room service the next morning and it was pretty good, a little expensive but all room service is. The Casino itself left more to be desired. Not many table games, and nothing under $10. The slots were ok but I wish there were more pennies and nickels. Food at the restaurant was good but a little pricey. Location was AWESOME though. Right dead center on the strip and across the street from Ceasars and Bellagio. We could see the fountain show from our room (a liitle obstructed though) and walking everywhere was a breeze. Just bring good shoes. Lastly I would just recommend that you stop by either Ceasars or the Aladdin for a Frozen drink at Fat Tuesdays, it was out of this world!!!

Reviews.Title: “Bally's was great!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Bally's was a great hotel for the money. Right in the middle of the strip, neighboring Flamingo, Caesars Palace, Bellagio, Paris. You cannot beat it for the price! I would defintely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Will not stay at Bally's again.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel was definitely the low-point of my trip. First, they did not have the room I reserved (even though I was charged months ago), and had to settle for a smaller bed. The rooms have thin walls, and I could hear the phone conversation from the next room. The next morning, I ordered room service and was told it'll be ready in 45 minutes...1.5 hours later, I called room service asking about my omlette and coffee. I was told that it'll be another 15-20 minutes. When I asked why is it taking so long, I was told "If the food isn't ready, it isn't ready. What can I tell you?". Needless to say, I cancelled the order and checked out of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaGirlOC
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location on the strip. The room was a bit dated but clean with more space that you could possibly need. Good breakfast buffet and pool area. Casino was pretty standard but we're not big gamblers anyway. Only downside was the hike though the casino with luggage to find the elevators to our room. Would stay again if the rate was right.

Reviews.Title: “Thumbs Up for Bally's”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I returned yesterday after staying at Bally's for 4 days/3 nights. As soon as you walk into the hotel lobby you're blinded by the lights and dazzle of the gold rimmed stairs. Although our package offered a standard room we were upgraded at no extra charge to a honeymoon suite on the 24th floor in the north tower! It was the biggest room we had ever seen! The hotel staff were friendly and hospitable. The hotel is situated centrally on the strip which was great as we could choose which part of the strip we wished to explore without having to walk too much. The Big Kitchen Buffet on the Mezzanine Floor was spectacular...so many items to choose from..and the dessert bar was fabulous! There was a mini shopping plaza/food court downtstairs which gave us the option of eating at less expensive places or simply grabbing a bite to eat without having to spend a lot of money. We would stay at Bally's again and recommend it to to others wanting a true Vegas experience while at the same time watching their budgets!

Reviews.Title: “Not glitzy but great in most other ways”
Reviews.Author: coz1873
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Ballys on my first trip to Las Vegas, in 2003. The check in at the airport seemed like a great idea but I still had to queue to get a room key at the hotel and, despite asking for a strip-view we were given a room overlooking Bourbon Street. Didn't complain (not the British way) but would in the future. The room was excellent though, especially for what you pay here. It was very clean, a great size (much bigger than TI). The casino is not huge but is linked directly to Paris Hotel via a cobbled walkway. The slots are great & the comps are OK. The hotel is in a perfect location, right in the heart of the strip, across from the Bellagio (linked by a walkway & bridge). At the time we stayed there the pool was closed & they were building the mono-rail. There is now a monorail stop right at the hotel (Perfect for anyone less mobile) but I would be worried about it now because it cuts between the main hotel & the pool. There are loads of places to eat at Ballys. The best was the steak house though I did have a fly in my glass of wine. It was changed and refunded easily enough though I didn't like the attitude of the waiter when doing so. At that time the Buffet was great & on that trip we said it was the best we went to. Went back on our most recent trip (Aug 2005) and were disappointed though. Better going to Aladdins. I know I have listed a few negatives in this review but we really liked Bally's, especially for the price. Thing is though, the extra price in many strip hotels is needed to pay for pirate shows, gondola's, fountains etc. The fact that Bally's is cheaper does not mean less service or quality. I would go back & prefer it to TI and would only be concerned with that monorail so close to the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting Place”
Reviews.Author: phonicks
Reviews.Content: I went to Las Vegas to get married and honeymoon. It took a great deal of planning and research to book a wedding from more than a thousand miles away. Everything was perfect... except for Bally's! It looked like a great place and the location was exceptional. We used the airport check in and everything was going great until I opened the door to our room!! I am not picky, but this room was disgusting! Old, dirty, burn holes in the bedspread, stains on the wall, beat up furniture, icky bathroom, two beds instead of the one King we requested, and no view. I have traveled all over the US and this is by far the worst room I have ever walked into! I marched back down to the check in and was met by a most unfriendly clerk who basically told me "sorry, you get what you get". He then brushed me off, but I refused to leave. This was not the picture on their website and this was not the place I was going to spend my honeymoon. Finally, he told me that he could move us in the morning. I told him there was no way I spending the night in that icky room. Then, suddenly, a room opened up in the North Tower on the 20th floor! After lugging our luggage again, we opened the door to our new room. Amazing, is all I can say! It was beautiful, luxurious, huge windows with a fantastic view. It was the exact picure they show on their website. The maid service was excellent. From that point on we had a most wonderful time a Bally's. If you go to Bally's, I would suggest that you avoid, at all costs, the South Tower. To this day, I cannot believe those two rooms could be apart of the same hotel. It was like going from the slums to the lap of luxury! I wasn't sure how to rate this review. I'd have to rate the first hour as "terrible". After the move, I'd have to rate Bally's as "above average to excellent".

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Time!”
Reviews.Author: nikita1NJ
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from my very first visit ever, to Las Vegas. I stayed from October 20th - 27th. What a blast! I had the most awesome time and Bally's was just perfect! I knew I wanted to stay 7 nights, but knew I did not want to break the bank doing it. It was extremely important for me to find the best value for my money, without having to sacrifice too much "creature comfort (I'm a "Bellagio/Venetian" type of gal). Bally's fit the bill perfectly. This is not a "luxury" hotel. This is a very good hotel. I am used to luxury hotel rooms and was pleased enough with my "standard" room that I did not feel compelled to request an upgrade. However, I must admit, I stayed in the newer North Tower. Apparently, these rooms do not have the prized direct views of the strip that can be found in the older rooms in the South Tower. I was okay with that. I still had a partial view of the Bellagio fountains from my window. The housekeeping was superb. Of course that could have been because I left a few dollars for the housekeeper every day. However, on my first night, I spilled grape juice all over the carpet. Because housekeeping was dilligent in coming right away to clean it up, the next guest will not have to critique "stains on the carpet" in their review. In general, I found all the staff to be pleasant and courteous. My room was a good size, with a queen size bed (although I did request a king), 2 sitting chairs with table, a couch with coffee table and a dining table with 4 chairs. The bathroom was also a nice size, not huge, but not tiny. There was also a vanity area right outside the bathroom. All in all, a great room for under $100 a night (except on the weekend when all LV hotel rates shoot up). The one negative I have is the bed. It was kind of strange. It was comfortable, but it seemed to be on some kind of platform with sharp edges. I went home with a bruised ankle from walking into the edge one too many times. As for the casino, I can't comment other than to say it was "airy", not smokey and everyone seemed to be having a good time. I did not play at all. I ate dinner at Bally's 24 hour restaurant, The Sidewalk Cafe, but was not impressed. However, I LOVED the buffet at the Big Kitchen. It was much better than the one at the Mirage. I ordered room service only once, breakfast, and it was outstanding! Everything was hot and very tasty. Checking in and out was a breeze as I arrived and departed at non peak times. Central location on the strip, "tons" of restaurants, awesome lounge acts, nice, cozy pool, spa,what else do you need? When you want to leave, the monorail stop is in the hotel. I could definitely see myself staying at Bally's again!

Reviews.Title: “Second visit just as nice as the First”
Reviews.Author: dotravler
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at Bally's (10/27 - 10/31) and needless to say, we'll be back. We checked in at the airport - not a single person in line at 3:00 pm. We took a taxi to the hotel with a stop at an off-strip gas station for some cheap beverages. (Good tip!) Upon entering our room, we found it was cleaned, but the last guest had left some items. Upon calling the desk, we were quickly moved up two floors (both North Tower as I had requested). We waited for the key, but it didn't show up. After going downstairs to work out the situation, we asked for some compensation. The first manager said we were already in a "premium" room upgrade. Thanks to the reviewer before who said to have a color copy of the room - I was able to show that I was given the room type I booked. The second manager then bumped us to a suite in the North Tower with a huge whirlpool tub, an abundace of space and comfort, and a view of the Bellagio fountains. We were thrilled with our accomodations. The bed was actually comfortable and the room was clean. I found this upgrade to make up for the 30 minutes of inconvenience I went through. We ate at the Sidewalk Cafe at Bally's, ok - nothing to brag home about. The casino workers were ok - the Keno people were excellent. Hi Pat & Jason. The cocktail waitresses were alright - the drinks came much faster at MGM though. For what we paid - $60 two of the nights, and $170 the other (Fri/Sat) - we were very pleased. This hotel puts you into the center of everything. If you want glitz and glammer, walk across the street the Bellagio or Ceasers. If you want a theamed motel, walk through to Paris. If you want a good meal, go to Toby Keith's Bar and Grill at Harrah's. If you want a decent place to stay at a decent price, welcome to Bally's.

Reviews.Title: “Centre of strip for sensible money”
Reviews.Author: JB30
Reviews.Content: We chose Bally's because of it's location and value and we weren't disappointed. The room in the North Tower was a good size and at first sight was newly furnished and quite plush but when you looked closer it was showing signs of wear and tear. Bally's does not try to pretend to be a Theme hotel, it is the old style Vegas but if you want theme then a brief walk to the attached Paris hotel gives you all that. Swimming pool area was very pleasant and a good place to unwind and I pity the people who couldn't be bothered to walk for a few minutes to get there. Restaurants were very busy for breakfast and dinner but there is so much choice outside of the hotels you can always find something quieter. In summary thoroughly recommended, you get a comfy bed, decent room and slap bang in the heart of the action.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, not great”
Reviews.Author: IntrepidfromMontreal
Reviews.Content: First, thank-you to the traveler who suggested carrying a picture of the (North Tower) room from the website; only this saved me from getting thrown into the South Tower or else pay extra $20/night to stay in N. Tower. However, the clerk “got me back”. Instead of a king bed, I got a queen and I was assigned to the 7th flr, with zero views. Overall, the room was decent so I accepted these minor irritations. PROS: Bathroom well-furnished and well-lit. In fact, excellent lighting throughout all areas for working at the 2 desks or reading in bed. Modern décor. Nice toiletries. CONS: Bedding was disappointing – 3 small pillows, no shams. A/C extremely noisy when it kicks in. No extras like bathrobe, coffeemaker, mini-fridge, CD player. Bally’s location on center Strip is an advantage. Connection to Paris Hotel and opposite to Bellagio is a bonus. Bally’s relatively small size also turned out to be advantageous – you don’t walk too far to reach the lobby, the elevator or your room. But location is all there is to recommend about Bally’s. None of its restaurants rate a visit - ordinary yet still expensive. The casino itself is small with less slots than others. Restrooms are rather tired. Wrt service, a late checkout was extended to 1pm - which any hotel in the world would do, so again, very ordinary. FYI, you can check out until 6pm but you pay an extra $45. Shopping tip: Best are Dessert Passage, Forum Shops and Fashion Show Mall. Canal Shoppes ho-hum but worth a visit for the decor. Breakfast tip: If you just need a little substance to tide you over, go to JJ’s Boulangerie in Paris for their excellent breakfast croissant special: egg/ham/cheese croissant with large coffee or juice. $4.95 compared to buffet prices. Buffet tips: Bellagio is most expensive but also more authentic. As a Montrealer, I know French food and I found Paris to be overrated, espec. its overly sweet desserts. Aladdin had nothing really ethnic about its cuisine; ironically, the Chinese section was the weakest. Golden Nugget is inexpensive but then the food was not good. So Bellagio’s buffet wins, but be prepared to wait. VERDICT: If you find yourself staying at Bally’s but going everywhere else to eat and gamble, you might as well stay at another hotel. You would at least get credit for spending $$ in that hotel’s restaurant. Affordable alternatives: Almost recommended Paris but I just read the reviews and they were not scintillating. Flamingo’s is even older than Bally’s. Bellagio is too expensive. That leaves Aladdin for center Strip...?

Reviews.Title: “Fine Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is fine hotel. I am handicapped and they helped a lot. The airport checkin was terribly filled so we went rightmto the hotel. I picked up my electric scooter at the bell desk and went to the checkin for rich folk. I told them I couldn't stand in line so they checked me in. They and the conscierge desk were very nice. This was my 3rd time at Ballys and I will be there in November. The room was huge and the handicapped bathroom was great! We got a room with a nice view of Paris Hotel and the other Ballys Tower. Nice inexpensive fod in the 24 hour restaurant. I've eaten at Changs twice and love it. I ate for $35 on my own. My friend took us there last September(2004)and we spent a lot cause we got appetizers and dessert. Very nice service there and inmthe coffee shop. Try Ballys.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Before we even got to Vegas I had called Bally's a couple of time with questions and everyone I talked with was very friendly and helpful. After finally arriving in Vegas (ourr plane was 3.5hours late) we a got to Bally's around 3:00Am and the people at the registration desk were very nice. We had a rate issue with our room, but they fixed it up right away. Our room nice and big and very clean. We were in the North tower. The hotel overall was very nice and looked well kept. We didn't have much of a view, but I guess not everone gets a view of the strip! Overall our stay was very nice and we would stay at Bally's again. If you are looking for an "in" place to stay, this is not it. But if you want a good room for a good price, give Bally's a try. You'll get friendly service also...

Reviews.Title: “Great service from a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I travel alot for work, so I stay in lots of hotels. Some are good, some are great, but most fall in the middle. Balleys is one of the best. From being able to check in at the hotel, to great and courteous sevice then, to a very responive front desk that solved my problems with the television and phones quickly and easily. The room was incredible. I somehow got upgraded to a sweet suite. Ginourmous jet tub in the room, as well as a great veiw of the strip. Pillow top king sized bed, and lots of pillows. The price was extremely reasonable to begin with, then to get this great room!!! I plan on staying here everytime I come to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Fifth time in Vegas, first time at Ballys, usually stay at the Imperial. Rooms were better than Imperial so were the elevators, nightmare at the Imperial. Check in and out was very quick. Rooms were great. Casino was good. We ate in on one occasion and the food was good. Used the coffee shop a lot. Everything was excellent and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Our Favorite Hotel in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: wonderfulworld
Reviews.Content: Bally's has a great mid-Strip location, and it has become our favorite place to stay in Las Vegas. The rooms are spacious, they have big windows, and they are tastefully decorated. Several nearby hotels have rooms that are more luxuriously decorated, but they are also much smaller with peek-a-boo windows. Requests made to housekeeping are responded to immediately. The valet parking service is excellent. During the week, rooms are often available in the $80-$90 range. In September we paid $79 on Thursday and $169 on Friday. We thought it was a great deal.

Reviews.Title: “Excellant Location”
Reviews.Author: gallrick
Reviews.Content: We stayed 18-23rd Sept 05. The time flew by. We had no problems we got a room on the 21st Floor in the North Tower. We could see Ceasars, The Flamingo, Imperial Palace, Wynn, Stratosphere, Hilton. We couldn't see the Bellagio, but who wants to look through the window when you can see it outside upclose. We paid a very small amount and upgraded to a Junior Suite. We had a load of room, but considering some of the other hotels we have stayed in for much less, they could have aleast provided a fridge for free, microwave and coffee machine, not that we would have used them. We didn't spend much time in the room, sleeping only. It's position on the strip is excellant. We had the buffet and there was nothing wrong with it, it was reasonably priced and there was something for everyone. We Will Rock You at the Paris was great, but quite short considering the cost of the tickets, but it was our Anniversary and we did want to do something special. The dualling pianos in the Bar in the Paris on the way back to Bally's was very entertaining. I would recommend Bally's purely for its location and price. We have no complaints about the rooms or the staff, except that using a Connection Card really isn't worth it unless you think you will be spending a fortune. We had such a great time.

Reviews.Title: “POKER BARS ARE GREAT”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Bally's Oct. 2-6. Overall had a wonderful experience. At checkin which was very early (9:00 am) we were given a room on the 17th floor of the north tower. room was clean and functional. Meals were somewhat over priced and the staff of the sidewalk cafe were abrupt and not very friendly. Actually the best meal we had in vegas was at a Lone Star Steakhouse on Flamingo Blvd. we really enjoy the bars that offer free drinks as long as you are playing the poker machines built in to the bar. did not win much but the bartenders were friendly and very service oriented. checkout was easy. however beware of large conventions coming in. We waited over 30 minutes for an elevator and finally found a maid that was willing to take us down on the employee elevator so we would not miss our ride to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “NEW ATTITUDE AT BALLYS SINCE TAKEOVER”
Reviews.Author: ebenezer57
Reviews.Content: Booked through Expedia to visit Ballys on the strip Las vegas,sent e-mail and phoned to request a small refrigerator to keep my insulin in as I am diabetic,the response I got was, ask at check in and the charge will be 10 dollars per day.I COULD BUY A FRIDGE FOR THAT!!!!!!!´hence I spoke to expedia and changed my reservation to the Luxor who said they could accomodate my request free of charge.Lastly I then sent e-mail to Ballys asking if they charge for use of wheel chair ramps or any other thing relating to people with ´special needs´? WHACH THIS SPÀCE

Reviews.Title: “Ballys - Go On - It's Better Than You Think”
Reviews.Author: ksgsnooki
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Ballys Sept 5th to September 11th, two rooms in North Tower, one with view of Flamingo/Barbary Coast. Check in and out, no problem, busy but queues moved fast. Friendly Hotel, especially Cashier staff who were more helpful than reception, and Security who helped during an emergency. Clean, perfectly located, monorail a bonus. Played roulette at Barbary Coast, more relaxed atmosphere and low stakes, got lucky on the slots at Ballys. Booked direct through Ballys website, excellent rates, paid exactly rates quoted, no extras. Visited most hotels, very nice, very big, could not find the exit at MGM. Ballys is in the best location, it is small enough to get around, it is friendly and clean. Can't wait to return, and WILL stay at BALLYS.

Reviews.Title: “Great Trip, Nice Location”
Reviews.Author: kristieann
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, along with my parents, traveled to Las Vegas on 09/28 - 10/02. Overall we had a very nice trip. We stayed at Bally's in the North Tower. The hotel was very clean with a wonderful location in the center of the strip. Our stay was very affordable and I would stay there again. We arrived on Wednesday evening and checked into the hotel at the airport. We had called the hotel ahead of time and requested rooms in the North Tower. They upgraded both of our rooms. My parents had a parlor suite with a sitting area and my husband and I had a room with two double beds, instead of a king, and it was smoking, which we had requested non-smoking. The next day we were able to change rooms and we stayed in a room on the same floor as my parents that was non-smoking and had a king bed. Not a big deal, they were very helpful and accomodating when we asked to be moved. The first full day there we purchased half priced tickets to "V" at Aladdin. The show was OK, not worth the full price as it was only an hour in length. We ate breakfast at Mandalay Bay, which was very good. We went to happy hour at the Tequila Bar at Bally's - $3.50 Margaritas....yummy :) Our second day we took the "Celebration Trip" to the Grand Canyon with Papillion. This helicopter trip was very enjoyable. I would recommend the tour and the tour group to anyone interested in taking this kind of trip. We ate dinner at Belligo. Wonderful buffet! On our third day, we ate at Bally's Big Buffet for dinner, DO NOT WASTE your money! Go somewhere else, the food was OK, but not worth the price. We also saw Jubliee, which I very much enjoyed. Old Vegas, beautiful costumes! On our last day, we ate brunch at Paris the crepes were very good. Would suggest this buffet. Overall we had a nice trip, did not lose big or win big. Bally's was clean and a super location on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Clean Rooms, Good Price”
Reviews.Author: klossja
Reviews.Content: It's been about a week since we were at Ballys (Sept 20-24). We checked in at the airport around 11am. I asked for a North Tower room and told the lady I would take 1 king, 2 queens, smoking, non, or whatever, as long as it was in the North Tower. She was very friendly and said they are supposed to charge extra but she was not going to charge us. A friend of ours was at another lady and she tried to charge him extra for the North Tower but then when he asked us there we were, she then did not charge him. So I think it just depends on who checks you in. We stayed in room 1157 of North Tower and had a view out onto the strip, we could see the very corner of the Bellagio fountains once in a while, but mostly the Ballys sign out front. The rooms were very clean. I was very nervous after seeing the South Tower room photos. But was pleased when we got into our North Tower room. I will be posting pictures on this site of our room once I get them uploaded to my pc. Didn't get any pictures of the pool. It was OK. We only went one day for a couple hours, had better things to do. Maybe if the pool was more fun we would have gone back. The casino was ok. I only played slots and video blackjack and ended up getting a little bit off our room and a free Ballys T-shirt!! woohoo! We never had a problem getting drinks at any of the hotels (mostly gambled at Paris and Ballys), but you have to grab the waitresses when they walk by. They will walk by quickly saying "drinks, drinks", but if you don't turn around fast enough they will be gone. Stick to beer, the mixed drinks were very weak! I am going to post more on the forums so that everyone can see the rest the rest of our trip report that doesn't only include Ballys....

Reviews.Title: “LV Trip Report 9/19 - 9/23 Bally's, LV Shows, & Buffets”
Reviews.Author: Adventur
Reviews.Content: Thanks A Lot For The Info Received From The Bally's & Las Vegas Forums! We Just Returned From Sept 19-23 Vacation @ Bally's In Las Vegas -"Armed" With The Advise of Bally's & LV TripAdvisor Forum Folks In Advance - We Arrived At Bally's At 11 PM Following A $13 (+ $2 Tip) 15-Minute Taxi Ride From McCarran Airport. We Were First In Line At Bally's Registration Desk. (Thru-Out Our Stay There Was Almost Always A Que Line of Up To 20 People There). When Bally's Desk Clerk Mentioned They Only Had 1 Room Left In The South Tower With My Requested View of The Bellagio Fountains (A Handicapped One With Shower), I Asked If It Was A Renovated One (& Gave The Desk Clerk A Photo of The Renovated Bally's Labelled "Standard Room" From Expedia) - She Said "No" They Only Had Only One Renovated Room In The South Tower. I Also Volunteered That We Had Ordered Their "Connections (Comp) Cards" & Had Tickets To Their Bally's "Jubilee" Show. After She Went To Talk To Someone In The Back Twice She Offered Me A Renovated "Deluxe" Room On The 16th Floor of The North Tower Overlooking The Paris Hotel With Partial Views of The Fountains & Eiffel Tower - For No Extra Charge (This Upgrade Regularly Costs An Extra $30 Per Night/$120 For 4-Nights). The Room Was Big & New, & Big Bathroom Was All Marble, & All of The Highest Quality - Even The Towels & Toilet Paper. A/C Worked Very Well & Maid Service Was So Good That We Left Her A Good Tip On The Last Day. Surprisingly, We Found Everyone We Came In Contact With In LV To Be Extremely Pleasant & Went Out of Their Ways To Help Us - With The Exception of 1-Policeman (But One of His Polite Fellow Police Officer's Chased Us Down Afterwards To Give Us A Personal Helping Hand - While Apologizing For The Other's Abruptness). Our Two Shows "Jubilee" ($74) & "O" ($125) Were Beyond Fan-tas-tic! (With Casts of Over-100 Each) - They Represent The Two-Distinct Sides of The LV Show Spectrum - Ziegfield Follies - & - High-Tech Cirque de Soleil. I Ordered The Tickets For Both 3-4 Months In Advance As Soon As They Became Available - & Had The Best Seats In The House For Both - (Center Section - Center Seats).
