We Had Our Best Buffets At "Bellagio Buffet" ($14 Breakfast With Chilled Fresh Squeezed OJ) & $12 Mandalay Bay "Bay Side Buffet" (Breakfast With Great Big Chilled Raspberries, Blackberries & Blueberries With Raspberry Yogurt, Mexican Scrambled Eggs With Jalapeno Peppers & 3-Kinds of Homemade Salsa (Including One From Oaxaca Mexico!) Yum! - Were Among My Favorite Most-Memorable Foods! We Checked Out All of The Major Strip Hotels - My Favorite Was The Wynn -It's Relaxing, Colorful, Creative Elegance, Beautiful Floral Displays, Golf-Greens Manicured Lawns, Big Moving Stripside Sign, & Water Features Were All Wow Factors!(I Had A Homemade Cinnamon Roll, Large Fresh Squeezed OJ & Large (Very Good Private Blend) Coffee For A Total of $14 At It's Coffee Shop.) I Walked My Feet Off, Was Impressed By The $15 "Titanic Exhibit" @ The Tropicana & Free "Fremont Street Experience" - But The Downtown Area Where The FE Is Is Very Derelict With Pan-Handlers. (We Were Hit-Up By At Least 6 In 2-Hours – Each To Who I Suggested That They Should Contact Their Social Services Agencies.) We Would Never Recommend or Choose To Stay In Any Hotel Downtown. The Strip & The Bus Transportation System ($2 Exact Change Only) Becomes Impossibly Crowded In The Afternoon & Evening So We Especially Enjoyed Exploring In The Mornings & Early Afternoons On Bus & On Foot & Via The Excellent New, $3 Monorail & 2-Free-Hotel-To-Hotel Trams - That Are Yet Virtually "Undiscovered" By The Masses. The Bellagio Fountains (Every Hour 12 Noon-8 PM, & Every 15-Minutes 8 PM-12 Midnight )Are Romantic & Exceptionally Majestic & Magical At Night. Next Time We Go To LV, We'd Choose To Stay At A Real Nice Hotel, Eat At Only The Best Restaurants & Buffets, See The Top Rated Shows - & Spend A Lot of Time Just Relaxing By The Pool & In Our Hotel & Room - Instead of Exhausting Ourselves Trying To Do Everything! : ) btw - We Tried A Couple of $ Special-LV-Deal-Meals & Would Never Return - The Quality Just Wasn't There, In Any Way Shape or Form. In Las Vegas, You Get What You Pay For. re. Departure: Bally's Front Desk Was Very Accomodating (Offering Free Late Departure (From 11 AM - 1 PM), Luggage Storage, & Fast & Easy TV Checkout. The Massive Lines At The Security Gates At The LV McCarran Airport Were Organized But Extremely Crowded With Hundreds of Fellow Travelers. Homeland Security There Now Requires Everyone To Take Off Their Shoes! It Creates An Unfortunate & Stressful, Departure From A Vacation. But All-In-All We Had A Great Time.

Reviews.Title: “We all agree....South Tower stinks”
Reviews.Author: QueenieWashington_DC
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our stay at Bally's. I have stayed there before but in the North Tower, which was fabulous. This time we were put in the South Tower. The furniture is shabby and scarred, the carpet stained (but I have to say it was clean, it passed the white sock test). The hallways were dimly lit and freezing. Security does not check people for room keys before they get on the elevator so anyone can come up to the rooms. Pros: The bathrooms were clean, and so was the rest of the room, the location is great, the view from our rooms was nice. The Sidewalk Cafe is good (especially for breakfast) and reasonable. Overall, for the money, I don't think the rooms were worth it. Oh and the gambling...the machines seemed very tight, none of us did well, and we rarely saw a cocktail waitress. If you want to gamble, go to Freemont St. and be treated like royalty. On our next trip we are going to try another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Bally's was great!”
Reviews.Author: rawkneee
Reviews.Content: I went to Vegas over the weekend and stayed at Bally's. Our room was in the North tower. The room was very big and spacious. Great tempature control and everything was as clean as could be. Comfortable beds, nice decor. The service in the place was good too. Easy check in/out. They let us check in at 11a.m. They said check in was later, but that since he room was ready, we could take it at that time. The bellman was quick with our bags. Every one was very friendly. There is a cafe restaurant in Bally's (can't remember the exact name) that has great sandwiches...yum yum! I really enjoyed my stay, nothing to complain about!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bubba1202
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Bally's for three nights, Sept. 22 - 25. The hotel is in a fantastic location and is much less expensive than their pricey neighbors. We booked through the Ballys website and saved a significant amount and received two free tickets to the Jubilee! show. Our room was in the North Tower. Room was decent. Lovely view of the parking garage, but who comes to Vegas to look out of the room. Our only issue with the room was lack of water pressure. But my in-laws had great pressure in their room. The Jubilee show was very good. Neither my wife or I were overly thrilled with the idea of a topless show but it was tasteful and the staging and costumes were fantastic. The "Samson and Delilah" piece was a little odd, a topless Bible story. But other than that, it was good. Casino at Bally's was not friendly to me but there was always plenty of action. I would definately stay at Bally's again.

Reviews.Title: “Yuck--never again”
Reviews.Author: DrNev
Reviews.Content: We went to Vegas for a B-day party. The person who arranged the party chose Bally's in order to accommodate everyone's ability to pay. The planning and reservations had been in place for 5 months. The host's room reservations were screwed up completely and she ended up in the wrong suite the first night and was transferred to a different suite the 2nd day (which, again, did not meet her specifications). She also had problems with the catered cocktail hours in her room--always served late, never cleaned up, etc. We had problems with our reservation as well, having booked rooms and "Club 22" usage in adavance, the club usage was ignored when we checked in and we were put in the South Tower which had mold embedded in the shower grout. We straightened this out by moving everything to a different room in the North Tower. The Club 22 does not include spa usage and cocktails cost extra--hardly worth the additional $32 per day. The men's spa was closed for repairs for 2.5 days while we were there and our massgaes were cancelled. The pool is nothing spectacular and spends much of the day in the shade. The cabanas, which we rented, were overpriced and the servers frequently could not be found. Our room was never really cleaned while we were there (maid spent, on average, less than 5 minutes in the room--I know because I often would go down the hall to see a friend and reutrn and there would be new towels and, sometimes, the bed would be made). I would NEVER stay at Bally's again.

Reviews.Title: “what's wrong with the south tower”
Reviews.Author: philiplb
Reviews.Content: First of all my family and I stayed at Ballys late last year.I dont normally write reviews,but seeing as i have used this site for picking hotels in both las vegas and florida,I feel that I should write with my comments on the south tower rooms that so many people keep slating.Ballys was our second visit to vegas(and believe me it wont be our last)The first time we stayed at the Luxor,we stayed in the south tower BECAUSE of reviews on this site telling of the views of the bellagio fountains and the strip.We got a room looking right onto the dancing fountains,a site that saw my daughters face light up every evening.As for the shoddy rooms,being English we are supposed to put up with anything,not me if there is a fault with anything i will complain,and i had nothing to complain about with our south tower room.The room was large,clean and the bathroom was tidy.When we came in our room at the end of a long exhausting day it was nice to spend a little time looking onto the strip before getting a good nights sleep in a very comftable bed.The rooms on the north tower may have newer furniture,but you aint taking it home with you, are you !

Reviews.Title: “Awful!!! Do not stay in the South Tower!!!”
Reviews.Author: sfarmer20
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Bally's Sept 15th through the 18th. I have stayed at Flamingo and Paris and figured that Bally's would be just as nice if not nicer. Boy was I wrong. We checked in at the airport which was nice because once we arrived at the hotel we would have waited 30 minutes to check in. We went to our "junior suite" in the south tower which we were told we were "upgraded" to and that it was a "renovated" room. It looked like it was last renovated in 1970!! It was awful! We had HUGE burn holes in our conforters, the blankets looked to be at least 15 years old, I found HAIR on the floor of the bathroom which led me to believe that our room was not cleaned properly. Found a glow stick in the fridge which means that wasn't cleaned out. Disgusting. Do not stay here. We could have stayed at Flamingo for free but decided to try something new this time. Flamingo looks like the Bellagio in comparison to this place.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Quality Rooms on South Tower”
Reviews.Author: chadb19
Reviews.Content: I was shocked at the poor quality room I had while I stayed here. I wish I read the reviews before I went and they are right! THE ROOMS ON THE SOUTH TOWER IS OF ONE STAR QUALITY AND IS A DISGRACE FOR A CASINO HOTEL IN THE MIDDLE OF THE VEGAS STRIP!! Make sure you stay on the North Tower or just avoid this hotel all together.

Reviews.Title: “South Tower Blues”
Reviews.Author: Joisygirl_8
Reviews.Content: How come I didn't see those bad review of the South Tower vs. North Tower rooms before I went? Stayed there 9/10 & 11 and again on 9/15 & 16. Had rooms in the South Tower facing the Paris pool and Bellagio fountains. The view was fantastic as long as you were looking out the window. Went downhill when you turned around and faced the room itself. Shabby is putting it mildly. No sitting area - just a table w/2 chairs - one of which was threadbare. The bed linens & matching drapes were outdated and the sheets were patched!!! The bathroom was OK, but the second time around the decorative wood molding on the front of the vanity was split off. Don't the maids report this? Or is it that management doesn't listen? The halls had room service debris into the late afternoon (from breakfast). Location is excellent. Ate at the Bally's Steakhouse and had an excellent meal. Good entertainment at the Indigo Lounge. Staff was excellent - especially Michael at the check-out (patience of a saint). Car brought around quickly.On our next trip, we'll stay elsewhere. Maybe Paris - maybe Bellagio.

Reviews.Title: “location!”
Reviews.Author: davidphd
Reviews.Content: great location in middle of strip! very large rooms! pool was nice but in the shadow of the hotel late in the afternoon, hot tub is large but water isn't very warm and it was a little dirty. rooms were large and clean but not luxourious.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at Bally's”
Reviews.Author: travelbums
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Bally's from Aug 21-25/05 . It was our first ever stay at Bally's and it was an absolutely wonderful experience . Right from the moment we checked in (5 hours late due to flight delays) the clerk must have felt sorry for us and upgraded our room ..... now that's service . Here is a quick review in our opinion . Positives - Location (Center strip) Clean and spacious room , quiet and clean hallways . Elevators were quick and we never really had to wait . Casino was enjoyable and the cocktail waitresses were right there every 5 - 10 minutes . Didn't find it smoky at all . Pool was excellent ( we spent all afternoons at the pool) Every morning we had breakfast at Johnny's Deli downstairs (good value , decent food , bottomless coffee ) We ate 3 times at the Sidewalk Cafe ( rate it 3 out of 5) Make sure you get a comp card when you check in .... got a free dinner with it and a bit of cashback . (You have to play though ....LOL ) Security people were very good . Overall service was very good . Maid service excellent Quick and enjoyable walk to the Paris ( sister hotel) Negatives - Lifegaurds were quite unprofessional . More interested in flirting with each other than watching the patrons . People selling timeshare were a bit of a pain in the rear . (not sure they understand the words NO THANK YOU . Tips - Try and get a room in the North Tower . ( From talking with people in the South Tower it is a bit worn out and a very long walk to the pool ) Instead of the shuttle bus from the airport , take a CAB , you won't be sorry . (To save $5.00 it took us 60 minutes by shuttle to the hotel . Of course we were the last to get off . It took us 15 minutes by cab to go to the airport) The monorail is a good way to get around and stops right by the pool at Bally's . Overall terrific stay and we WILL return

Reviews.Title: “Why is South Tower NOT renovated yet????”
Reviews.Author: crickerpicker
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Bally's 3 times in the past 2 years and have always gotten a good room in the North Tower. Pray tell.....WHY are they not renovating the South Tower rooms? For God's sake, people have been complaining about the shabbiness of the South Tower for years. Don't you think people have put up with awful rooms long enough? Those rooms shouldn't even be rented! Fix the rooms or implode the South Tower. This is hurting Bally's reputation. There are better places to go than having an awful room in the South Tower. BTW...Bally's has really cut back on their comps. Another not-so-swift move on their part.

Reviews.Title: “First time in Vegas, loved Bally's”
Reviews.Author: cheecher
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Vegas and had only 24 hours of fun before heading off to a leadership seminar. So for one night, we wanted a known, nice place and we weren't at all disappointed. Our North Tower room, we stayed on a THursday night, was beautiful, spotless in fact. Our view was spectacular and the staff was great. I am disturbed by some of the pictures of a south tower room posted by a review below... What a contrast....I would say it looks like it's better to stay in a Best Western than in the south tower, but if you're in a north tower deluxe, for the money, and we got a great rate, I don't think you could get much better....

Reviews.Title: “So Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: FlyStayEat
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at Bally's for Labor Day weekend. Based on the suggestions on this site, we requested a North Tower room and ended up on the 24th floor. We had no view, but I honestly could care less about that. I was a little scared based on some of the reviews here, but I was so pleasantly surprised when we arrived. Especially because I suggested Bally's to the friends we traveled with. The room was honestly far bigger than any other standard room I've seen in Vegas and we've stayed at quite a few (and more expensive) hotels. We had a king bed, a love seat, an oversized chair, 2 regular chairs, and a desk. The room was very well decorated and clean. The carpet looked brand new and I saw nothing that was spotted, dirty, or out of place (and I'm very picky about my rooms). The bathroom really impressed me. The shower, floor, and countertops were a very pretty marble. There is a charge for the high speed Internet, but we didn't use it. The pool was nice - nothing fancy, but clean and large. Didn't use the hot tub considering it was 100 degrees. Plenty of chairs and nice towels to use. Waitresses were readily available for drink and food orders. Good daiquiris, ok pina coladas - both with fresh fruit. We chose Bally's for the price and quite honestly, I would recommend it to anyone. Our whole party agreed we'd like to stay here again. Plus, you can't beat the central location.

Reviews.Title: “Beware: Bally's Has A Bad Side”
Reviews.Author: B.Hart
Reviews.Content: Last year my wife and I stayed at Bally's with family and I gave an excellent review because of the staff service, the overall hotel, the pool, the buffet, and the beautiful North tower rooms (which we were upgraded to free of charge to accommodate our room requests). But that was then, and this is now and I've seen Bally's bad side. This year we went back and were given rooms in the South tower and that was the problem. BE AWARE! On Bally's website they show Standard rooms as pretty North tower rooms, but that is not true. Standard rooms are South tower rooms which they don't show, and North tower rooms are actually Deluxe rooms and cost $20 more per night! If you want a Deluxe room you must upgrade during check-in. The clerk should ask you, but I wasn't asked. Our clerk this time was snobby and borderline rude. That was the first and only time we had experienced that type of behavior, but her behavior shouldn't reflect on the other staff. Now on to the room. Other reviews seem to sugarcoat South tower rooms, but I won't. South tower rooms are HORRIBLE! The small lobbies and hallways are dark and dank and had a noticeable musty smell. The carpet in our room was stained, dirty, and musty as well. The bed was attached to an outdated headboard and the comforter was threadbare in patches and had crumbs and hair on the underside. The chairs in the room had flat cushions and looked dirty as if someone had jumped on them with shoes on. The dressers were stained and scratched up and some of the drawers wouldn't even close! Instead of being in a cabinet, the T.V. sat on a small, rickety table that looked as if it would fall at any moment. The bathroom was even worse. The counters were outdated and stained and the shower was mildewed and had many cracked, yellowed tiles. My wife and I agreed there was no way we could take off our shoes and get comfortable in that room. We went downstairs and spoke to the hotel manager and told her how unsatisfied we were. We told her we couldn't believe they rented out, or even had rooms like that, in such a nice hotel. The manager was very apologetic and upgraded us to the North tower free of charge. That was very nice of her, but be warned. Standard rooms are not the pretty, Deluxe North tower rooms they show on the website. Standard rooms are horrible South tower rooms, and unless you upgrade for $20 more per night or get a free upgrade that is what you will get. Some people try to make it better by saying you won't be in your room much, but trust me, it doesn't make it better. Not for the price you pay, no matter how little. Also Bally's does not send repeat guests coupons or incentives to visit the hotel again. Even Circus Circus did that when we stayed a few years ago. We will not stay at Bally's again.

Reviews.Title: “Worn out hotel, smoke stink”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: 8/18-8/22 2005 We used Bally’s check in desk at the airport - fast, convenient. They offered us a shuttle bus for $5.50 per person - bad choice, waited over an hour and another hour past before arriving to the hotel. However we took taxi back to the airport for $ 14, which is $7 when split between my buddy and me. Whole taxi ride took 15 minutes. We had a room at south tower on the top floor with a nice view. Window was very dirty, lot of greasy smears and I had to call housekeeping to clean it. Old, worn out furniture; newer remodeled bathroom. There is no sufficient ventilation and very bad smell in the room - simply terrible stink. Yes, we both smoke and I understand some smoke odor will be there but this was too much. I complained and they aired the room (opened window by removing safety screw) and sprayed with air freshener. Air-conditioning worked just fine. Room was very quiet. Comfortable beds. So-so housekeeping. We liked eating in hotel restaurants where food and service was fine. Pool is excellent however you have to take a long walk thru the casino and shops. We chose Bally’s for its central location on the strip however next time I’ll be probably looking for another hotel nearby. There is nothing really wrong with this hotel but there are better choices for the money spent.

Reviews.Title: “Ballys is Perfect for Everyone!”
Reviews.Author: Lifeman98
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel. Easy to get around, always to find a table to play, nice staff!

Reviews.Title: “Bally's is Fantastic!!!”
Reviews.Author: travelingncchick
Reviews.Content: I absolutely loved Bally's. The location is FANTASTIC!!! There is a monarail stop in the hotel so that's a definitely plus. The rooms were large and the housekeeping staff kept the rooms clean and well supplied! The whole hotel is very clean...which is amazing for a place that's open 24/7. The casino was NOT smokey and the drinks were free flowing while I gambled there. Another plus is the airport check in...and the connection to Paris (it's like having 2 hotels for the price of 1!!). I walked around and checked out almost every big strip hotel and in comparison Bally's was the BEST choice! The pool area is great...shopping down stairs is great...Tequila Bar is FANTASTIC...$3.50 margaritas during happy hour everyday! I'm telling you...I LOVE THIS PLACE!!!

Reviews.Title: “Big Rooms”
Reviews.Author: dstroke
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Bally's from July 31 thru Aug 5, paid $63.00 for the first 4 nights and $73.00 for the last. We had a room in south tower, a very big room over 500 sq ft. We were 4 people in the room 2A and 2C we were not on top of each other. pool was big and cool but quite a walk from our room, no problems getting chairs or drinks. Comps were plentyful, also got a 10% discount at restaurants with the comp card. Kind of disappointed with the "big kitchen buffet" food was good, the setting was kind of like a cafeteria. The buffet at the Rio was the best. Staff was very friendly and always helpful. Really enjoyed walking thru to the Paris Hotel strolling thru The "streets of Paris". All in all i would reccomend and return!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, but the food sucks.”
Reviews.Author: Plumlocks
Reviews.Content: My mother and I decided to choose Bally's over the Luxor for location purposes and it truly was the best choice. The rooms were incredibly spacious and it was set far enough away from the Strip that we were able to sleep comfortably without any noise interuption. The view from the room was much to write home about, but considering that we usually were asleep about 10 minutes after we stepped foot in the room it didn't much matter. The staff were nice enough, but unfortunately the help desk was not quite as knowledgable as I'd hoped. When we asked how we might get to Fremont street, they suggested a cab. When in fact there are actual shuttles that take you quite close for a lot cheaper. Of course we found that little important tidbit of info on our own on the last day of the trip. The pool was nice, a bit small, but we able to locate a lounge chair and were given free towels; something I hadn't expected since the hotel was quite cheap. The only thing that I can absolutely complain of was the food. The diner that we went to one late night had food that was disgusting, I mean how can you mess up a cheeseburger. After that experience, we didn't even attempt the buffet. Now if you want a superior buffet with a staggering array of choices and tasty fresh food in an adorable atmosphere, the Paris buffet is where you want to go. It beat out the Bellagio's buffet just for the shear volume of choice. And the best part about it was that Paris is connected to Bally's so all we had to do was role out of bed and walk about the equivalent of two blocks to the buffet. A little trick: make sure you get in by 11:00AM. Lunch starts at 11:30AM so by the time you've finished breakfast, the lunch will have been laid out and you will have paid breakfast prices for both breakfast AND lunch. Trust me it is worth it!!. All in all we had a great time and hightly recommend Bally's for it's location and it's unbelievably clean and comfortably spacious rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Bally's was Great! The flight to the Grand Canyon was not!”
Reviews.Author: myersj125
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to Las Vegas and I picked a great place to stay. Our room was large, clean and comfortable, and the bathroom was huge with granite floor, counter top and tub walls. Our room looked north toward the Stratosphere--a nice view. Beds very comfy--had 2 queens. Sirens at night sometimes a problem, even though we were on 15th floor. The Big Kitchen Buffet was something to see. Make sure you get a Comp card and you will get discounts on your meals at Bally's and Paris. One bad incident really marred the whole trip--and I had read this on the internet already and didn't pay attention--we took a trip to the Grand Canyon with Scenic Airlines--fly from Vegas on a small plane, meet bus at Canyon, sight see and have buffet at the Grand Lodge, then return to hotel via the small plane in 8 hours. Wrong! It was 2 hours before we even boarded the plane,flew for 1 1/2 hours, then waited around for a bus at the canyon. On the bus we were handed box lunches--and told "no time for the stop at the Grand Lodge and buffet"- then waited in a line of cars to get into the park--in the end we had 1/2 hour at one stop and a little over half an hour at Bright Angel Lodge--then back on the bus for 45 minutes to another tiny airport where we waited again and finally flew back to Vegas in the dark. We left our hotel at 1:20pm and returned at 11:30pm--ten hours! With all of a little over an hour at the South Rim and $438.00 for the 2 of us! What a gyp! And the bus driver was so bad on the way back to the hotel my husband said he was glad to have arrived in one piece!

Reviews.Title: “had a pleasant experience overall, but.......”
Reviews.Author: slotguy06
Reviews.Content: I recently spent 3 nights at Bally's. As usual, was very pleased with the room, even if it overlooked all the pipes and connections on the roof below. And where they find those hard-as-brick mattresses I don't know. But, otherwise the room was clean and comfortable. Made sure I had a non-connecting room to avoid noise from the next room. Still used earplugs every night just in case of late night drunks making noise in the hallways. You should always have ear plugs (the wax ones are the best), with you on a trip to Vegas. The casino seems to be getting smokier and smokier. Since they have taken away some slot machines and replaced them with more table games, the table games now go wall to wall in the middle of the casino floor. This creates a constant wave of cigarette smoke, especially through the south side of the casino. You can't spend much time at the machines there without leaving with your hair, clothes, even socks reeking of cigarette smoke. Restaurants not so good. Sidewalk cafe over priced and poor quality. Another smoking story here........Was in line late at night, about 1AM with about 12 other people. The hostess as usual asks everyone if they wanted smoking or non-smoking. Everyone wanted non-smoking and we waited and waited. I could see a whole area with no one seated there so I asked the hostess why we couldn't be seated there. She replied "oh, 'that's the smoking area." Couldn't they have opened a few tables in the end of that area for the non-smokers? Maybe they were expecting a sudden rush of about 100 smokers? I think the best deal for food at Bally's is the room service, which is always quick and efficient and good, and no more expensive than eating at the Sidewalk Cafe. The Big Buffet hasn't improved, but at least they keep breakfast items out now along with lunch items. You might enjoy the buffet if you love seafood, they serve so much of it. Also had a complaint about Johnny's deli in the mall area. Lines were long and I ordered the Trifecta, which was supposed to be a corned beef, turkey, swiss cheese, etc. I ordered it on rye toast and waited about 10 minutes for a burnt rye toast sandwich (I thought I could scrape off the burnt part,) but then I opened the sandwich and see the corned beef which was 90% fat, so I picked out all that, then noticed the turkey breast also had big globs of fat in it. There was a thin slice of tomato and thick slice of swiss cheese. Then there was a big glob of runny cole slaw right on the sandwich with a third slice of burnt rye toast. A scrawny wedge of dill pickle accompanied the mess. The line was too long so I didn't bother to complain, just left the sandwich and got out of there. Will mention the snack bar at the south end of the casino, near the tower elevators. Nothing to complain about here, excellent sandwiches and snacks at very reasonable prices. I always get their chicken salad (big chunks of all white chicken), and they are always glad to serve the chicken salad on a plate with whatever you want, lettuce, tomato, onion, etc. and give you a roll or bagel on the side. All this for an unbelievable low price of $4.95. They also have a nice variety of pastries, ready to eat salads, chips, and beverages. Wherever you eat in Bally's, be sure to show your Connection Card for an automatic discount. If you are using comps for your meals, get a comp slip out of one of the machines and use this for a line pass, especially at the Buffet where the lines can sometimes be very long.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Bally's”
Reviews.Author: A2asia
Reviews.Content: Yet another great stay at Bally’s. My husband and I stayed for the 3rd time last wee and loved it as usual. Upon arrival we were able to check in at the airport, which saved us a lot of time. We also received a free upgrade to a newly renovated room just for booking the room thru their website. As always, the Champagne Buffet was fabulous! The Tequila Bar was an awesome deal at happy hour and the hotel room was very nice, large, and clean. We had a fabulous view of the south side of the Strip. Odds on the video poker are not the best at the casino but the poker tables are fun. Tip: go in the summer and save lots of money, rooms are a lot cheaper. What we saved we put toward entertainment. Also, keep watching their website for lowering rates; they will lower then if you find them cheaper than what you paid.

Reviews.Title: “An above average stay at Bally's/Paris Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: ScottNC711
Reviews.Content: On a spur of the moment chance for a week in Las Vegas, we chose Bally's as our hotel. After reading many of the review's I was hesitatant about the whole thing and almost booked at Bellagio, Mirage, or MGM, but decided to see how things were. We were greeted at the door by a doorman who carefully took our baggage as we were quickly checked in. The desk-check-in was fast, being at 5:30pm., so I was impressed with that..and the desk clerk confirmed our room as a "King, no smoking," which was not what we had requested (thru Orbitz)..and as I stated I needed a handicapped accessiable room with two queen beds, they remade room keys and sent us to the north tower. We were surprised the vastness of this room...they had given us a large suite, complete with full kitchen, dining room, living and 2 seperate bedrooms.! Called to the front desk to make sure I wasn't being charged for this before unpacking...the reply--"no charge" we just want to make sure you are comfortable at Bally's. Hotel staff, housekeeping went beyond to answer questions and clean well daily, and had a great view of the Bellagio fountains!! Gaming was fair and fun at Bally's with an upbeat/soulful sound between 8pm - 2 am at club Indgo, just off the casino floor, and with the ease in access to the other side of the strip via overstreet walkway at the Bally's property as well as the Monorail which was quite useful all week (as the temperatures were well into the 120's daily), we had a great time at Bally's. We usually visit las vegas twice yearly if not more, and usually stay at what I now call the "cookie cutter" hotel's" (such small and predictable room/floor plan)... Mirage, TI, Bellagio, MGM, but if you want more space for less money and easy access to the strip and monorail stops..Ballys Las Vegas puts you in the middle of all of the best. We did use the pool, to which you need to grab a chair early in the morning or late in the afternoon, and it was clean and refreshing..but did not have the upgrades and "beaches" like Mandalay Bay or Mirage, but all we wanted to do was swim and cool off, so no big thing for us. The Tequila Bar had very cool and stiff drinks (a good thing) with bartenders and waiters on the ball, as well the 24 hr eatery next door to it has good food at a reasonable price. The kitchen buffet was only visited once by us, (I just am not a buffet type person..and expensive unless you can really justify eating all that food--good selection there) and since Bally's connects with the "streets" to Paris, it gave us opportunity to see more/have more options for food and shopping to use our comps.. infact, the day (night) of departure, we asked for later checkout..could give us until 3pm with no charge but since we were leaving at midnight, wanted to keep the room until later and freshen up before leaving, they only charged us $36.00...and worked with "the connection comp card" ... so that there were NO charges at all on my credit card that I left on file. I think if you ask any reasonable request of the staff, they will accommodate. They did for us, just by asking and requesting things nicely.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great City!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First of all the city is great, it has so much entertainment for everyone, not just gambling. The shows, the hotel everything is great. Second of all a BIGGG plus to having a great vacation is the hotel you stay in and for us Bally's Hotel did it. At the beginning we weren’t sure if we wanted to stay there because some nights were a little expensive but we got a great deal and decided to stay there. And we are very happy to have made the decision to stay there. I have no complaints with this hotel we even stayed some extra nights. It is a lovely hotel, very clean. The rooms are great and we had a beautiful view of the bellagio and its fountains. The rooms are very spacious, the floor lobbies are very well decorated they even have a sitting area outside the rooms lobby. A big Plus is that the PARIS Hotel is right beside it, you can walk through Bally's without even going outside so you can enjoy two great hotels for the price of one. The shows that the Bally's has are a must see, Jubilee and We Will Rock you are fantastic! The food is also very good it has a buffet reasonably priced and a food court. I would definitely stay at the Bally's again on my next trip to VEGAS.

Reviews.Title: “Pleased with Bally's”
Reviews.Author: MeanGreen
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Bally's 5 nights (Jul 10 - 14) with family of four. Center strip location is ideal. Easy walk either down strip to MGM/Luxor or up strip to Venetian/T.I. Rooms was quite large, well appointed and clean. Window needed to be cleaned. We were in the south tower facing north. Our view was of Caesar's and the Flamingo. We had a glimpse of the north end of the Bellagio fountains. You would likely have a nice view of the fountains from an odd numbered room in the south tower. Be aware that getting anywhere (Strip, pool, parking garage) from your room is an ordeal regardless of which tower you are in. My suggestion would be to request a room near the elevators. We were about as far from them as possible and this was a pain. Parking is in a shared garage with Paris. No problem getting a parking space. We were always able to park near the elevators on level 3 (the level you enter on). Spent very little time at the pool. It was a nice pool area, but was about 4 blocks from the elevators. Check-in was smooth. I would stay at Bally's again unless someone suggests a center-strip hotel that is easier to get in and out of.

Reviews.Title: “Surprised”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here June 29-July 1. I was leary about staying here after reading the reviews but I was surprised. I only paid $69/nt through their website. Check-in at the hotel was fast and friendly and I was upgraded to a room in the North Tower 24th floor. The room was huge and the bed very comfy. The bathroom was also large and the marble was very nice. The only thing I didn't like was the huge mirror next to the toilet. Not something I usually like to watch! Ate at Chang's and the Chinese food was wonderful and service prompt and efficient. The sushi restaurant downstairs had great to-go sushi. The monorail is downstairs but a pretty far walk from the rooms. Very convenient, though, for seeing a show at the Sahara. Parking garage is a haul through Paris. Wear comfortable shoes! Overall, I would recommend this hotel. You can't beat the service and location for that price!

Reviews.Title: “Bally's - Great Non-smoking room!”
Reviews.Author: RoadTripTexan
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Bally's in April 2005 for a convention. I checked in at the hotel an hour early. There wasn't a long line and the registration lady was quite helpful. She signed me up for the Connection card at check-in. I was booked to be in the North Tower, but changed to the south tower because they had rooms immediately available. (I was also concerned that I might hear the emergency trucks all night if my room faced the side street in the North tower, from reading other reviews.) I ended up in the South tower, 9th floor. The odd numbered rooms overlook the Paris Hotel and the Eiffel tower! It was far from the elevator, which translated into peace and quiet. Didn't hear an emergency truck. I could hear the Bellagio fountains, and get a glimpse of them. What an awesome site, worth getting out of the room to go see. The room size was nice! The room furnishings were clean and adequate, eventhough they do not look like the pictures of the renovated rooms (located in the North Tower) on the website. I'm allergic to cigarette smoke, so I took a small air purifier, but really didn't need it. In fact, the casino area was only smoky in the evenings, but tolerable the rest of the time. I do recommend signing up for the Connections card. Dining in any of the Bally's restaurants or buffet receives a discount, if you show your card. I enjoyed the buffet for breakfast each day. What a selection. If you're on a reduced carb diet, you can find plenty of choices and the waitresses were friendly. The bright buffet dining room was nice because of the huge windows that overlook the Bally's marquee, Caesar's, the mountains, and the Barbary Coast. The discount I mentioned earlier is also available at other Caesar's properties, like Paris. Speaking of Paris, it was so nice to be able to walk from Bally's to Paris without out having to go outdoors, plus there's all the shops and restaurants along the way. Other restaurants I enjoyed dining at: Cheesecake Factory in Caesar's Forum of Shops, Jimmy Buffet's Margaritaville in the Flamingo, the Creperie in Paris, and Roxy's Diner in the Stratosphere. I had a rent car, and recommend learning the back streets. The "strip" had non-stop traffic while I was there. The valet parking attendants at Bally's were very nice, even when they were swamped. I didn't have a chance to ride the Monorail, but the stop is at the back of the Bally's property. Had a good time playing video poker and slots in Bally's, Paris, and Barbary Coast. (nope, I didn't win.)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Bally's”
Reviews.Author: tonyraisins
Reviews.Content: Bally's, Las Vegas- Center Strip, across from Caesars' Palace, Bellagio, and the Barbary Coast. Recently upgraded, and shines without a theme! We came here for a two night getaway. Our rate of $ 69.00 per night included two completely free Jubilee tickets. Rooms are very nicely appointed, and are spotless. Oblong marble work desk, nicely coordinated color scheme, comfortable bed, couch and chair. The bathroom is splendid with marble walls, floor and counter top. Bally's holds the line and shines without a "theme," which is a throwback to the old days of Las Vegas. The show Jubilee is tremendous - with a cast of perhaps 150 dancers or more. The Titanic is sunk, and Samson pulls down the pillars of the Philistine temple to boot! For history buffs, Bally's was built as the (old) MGM Grand. You may feel like you are a guest in the home of your rich "Aunt," but you will not go wrong here.

Reviews.Title: “bait and switch”
Reviews.Author: sandiegolarmar
Reviews.Content: We travel to Vegas several times a year but do not stay on the strip but rather at one of the Marriott locations. However because we were traveling to meet friends and family for our anniversary we thought it might be fun and easier to stay on the strip. We also wanted to see a "traditional" Las Vegas show and had heard good things about Jubilee. When considering staying in your hotel, we first checked on line, however because we were traveling to Las Vegas to celebrate our 20th anniversary we phoned to ask a few questions to make sure we knew what we were getting. The reservations clerk was very helpful and informative. She explained that the Summer Sizzlin package were for rooms in the old tower which had not been upgraded and suggested that we spend an addition $20 a night to upgrade to a new room, on a higher floor with views since it was such a special occasion. Because of her recommendation we did book the more expensive room. She thanked us for choosing Bally's and said that we would be glad we made the choice to stay and upgrade. Upon check in we had already been assigned a room on the 16th floor. We asked if there were any upgrades available since it was a special occasion and the clerk rudely informed us that the anniversary was noted and everything had already been taken care of. So we were excited to get upstairs and see our room. The room was not anything like we anticipated. First the carpet was 3 different colors from some kind of cleaning or lack of cleaning, which made us feel the room was unsanitary, second the view was the top of a lower building and the other tower of the hotel. The sofa was not in front of the windows as your web page shows, but rather back against an interior wall, that it mattered as there was no view any way. Needless to say we were not satisfied so called the front desk. The desk informed us that the room was considered an upgraded room and that there was nothing else they could do. We explained in detail what our concerns were about the room and again were informed that the room was the best the hotel could offer. We asked if that was the only vacant room in the hotel and the desk informed us that they had one other room we could look at but that it was on a lower floor. We looked at the room and felt that it appeared to at least be clean and although it had no sofa, we at least could see a couple of the other hotels from the window. So we opted to change our room. When we inquired about a lesser rate since the room was on a much lower floor we were rudely informed that the rate was the same for any room in that tower because they had been remodeled. Quite a different story then what we got from the reservationist. The next morning we went to meet friends who were picking us up and witnessed one of your employees treating people waiting for cabs so rudely I would have come right back to the hotel and complained. He actually told a young mother to get in the --- car as he was shoving her things into the taxi van. We had dinner at the buffet and with the exception of the man bringing us our drinks everyone was rude. We had lunch in the 24 hour coffee shop and again your employees were rude. In a town that was created on and boasts of service, your hotel falls short. It is apparent that your employees are not happy in your hotel either. We checked out via the TV and today our record came showing a charge for the safe rental, which we never used. And while it is only a $3 charge, the safe says UPON USE not an automatic daily charge. Obviously your hotel has some severe problems in communicating to the consumer what you offer and what you charge. We feel that hotel had a bait and switch attitude and that the consumer should be aware of your tactics. We are thankful that we have been married 20 years and actually survived the stress your hotel put us through when we should have been celebrating such a wonderful occasion. We could not have been more disappointed in our stay at Bally's.

Reviews.Title: “Bartender 'Ronny' @ The Tequila Bar Was The Best!”
Reviews.Author: luvvegas1167
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at amost every hotel/casino in Vegas, however, never stayed at Bally's. We stayed there over the 4th of July weekend, and it was great. Our room was very nice, clean, roomy, closets etc. Bathroom was very clean, we especially loved their cozy towels. I didn't like the long, very long walk through casino and their shops just to get to the pool that was kind of weird. However, I was very happy to see that their pool was a fun hang out! There were plenty of chairs for it being 4th of July holiday. They also had cool music playing. I would not recommend the drinks at the pool bar. Very over priced for "not top shelf" alcohol. I actually ordered a Suaza margarita and got very nausious. Housekeeping and Nosh's Cafe staff was very friendly. However, we had the best time at the Tequila Bar. Ronny the bartendar was so friendly, informative and fun! He took great care of us! We visit Las Vegas often and this was one of the best times we have had as a couple at a bar in Vegas. Be sure to see Ronny at the Tequila Bar, he makes the best mojitos in Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, and ok for the price”
Reviews.Author: axm
Reviews.Content: The room was spacious, and comfortable, although for a nice hotel, should have been cleaner. There was dust, and spots here and there. The pool is fantastic, but you have to walk through the casino, and by various shops to get to it. The location is great. Right on the strip by several attractions. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “What a SUSPRISE!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I agree Bally’s is a great place to stay. I stayed in most of the new glamorous hotels on the strip and have always avoided Bally’s because it was not as enticing on the outside and some of the other newer casinos. The location cannot be beat its best spot on the strip for the price. I checked in at the airport, a very convenient feature. I also upgraded my room from the standard room which I had booked from a third party website. The upgrade was well worth the extra money. The room was huge! I guess approximately 800sf with a great bed and a Jacuzzi tub. The bathroom was as large as the rest of the room. I will defiantly stay at Bally’s my next time in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Bally's just one night and we had a good experience. Got a deal in the web, payed 80 bucks for a deluxe room. It was spacious and clean even if facing the back. We could have asked for a room facing the Strip but it was just for one night and we did't see the need. The pool it's OK, at 5.30pm it get's in the shadow of the hotel tower, so don't plan for sunbathing late in the afternoon. We had dinner at the buffet: good choice for 20$. Don't like gambling, so we spent the night walking in the Strip. The location of the Bally's is great, you can see the fountains of the Bellagio in front of it and even walk up to the Venetian in 15 minutes. Absolutely worth of the money, will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “very tired hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights in Vegas, all prebooked and paid for at Ballys, which was a pity as this is not a great hotel - very tired hotel - room was spacious enough, was supposedly a deluxe room, but looked very ordinary and had a couple of cracked tiles in the bathroom and no great amneties to talk of - even room safe was an extra daily $3 charge which is a bit of a cheek. Pool is extremely far to walk to, so we gave up on that idea. We had one buffet supper - don't sit in a booth - and nothing to write home about, very average food. what you should do though is definately sign up for the connection card - we didnt gamble much but still received enough comps and cash back to pay for some of the hotel bill. Breakfast at the Aladdin by the way is exceptionally good - better than Paris which gets lots of good reviews - we went to both, and yes Paris is nice (paid for with comps using connection card), but Aladdin is slightly better. Ballys location is good, in the centre of the strip, but other than that, there is no real reason to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Location location locat......”
Reviews.Author: jrtexas48
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from 4 nights at Bally's. I was there for a conference and my wife came along (for the shopping). All in all I have to say that we had an excellent time. The hotell staff at Bally's were all very helpful. Even with multiple conferences going on at the same time, the hotel was able to maintain their service. If you will be playing the slots, video poker etc. stop by and get a Connection Card. You will get discounts at all of the shops, retaurants etc. and get cash back for your time spent on the machines. I didn't play too much but still picked up $120 in addition to comp coupons of $26 and $17. The hotel rooms are dated, but they keep them clean and you can keep it as cold as you want (if you leave the fan setting on low at night, it won't keep coming on and off like it does on auto). With the Monorail right at Bally's, getting to other casino's is easy although make sure to check the map etc. for where it stops because you might still be in for some long walks. We did the breakfast buffett mornings which is the standard fare and we tried Bally's Steak place one night. It was OK but not great. We will go back to Bally's, hopefully in the not too distant future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay and Play”
Reviews.Author: smilingeyes2000
Reviews.Content: This was probably my fifth stay in Las Vegas. I love the fact that Bally's is so centrally located. We stayed in the North Tower in one of their regular rooms. It was quite nice, clean, and comfortable. Our room came with two queen beds, a writing desk which is always great if my boyfriend has to work, a nice large chair that is so comfortable it envelopes you. The TV which we have never had time to watch is quite large. The bathroom is very large which is nice and we have always found it clean. The nice part of this place is that Paris is next door which has a great buffet. I have never found time to be at the pool so I cannot judge it. My play at the slots has brought me to both Ballys and to Paris. Bally's has a great penny slot section (though small) and a good nickel section. I have always found that Bally's is a bit looser at night. I have hit at both Ballys and Paris which always brings a smile to me. I find that the shops at Bally's are not that great but Caesar's is across the street and there are some quaint shops at Paris which I frequent. I love being on the strip and the fact that this is centrally located. I will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Bally's- Positives/Negatives”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Ballys has alot of things going for it... unfortunately it as just as many negative things as positive. Lets start with the positive. 1- It is in a GREAT location, right smack dab in the middle of everything. 2- It is reasonably priced as compared to neighboring properties. 3- Marvelous view of the Strip, the nightly water ballet from the Bellagio was just outside my window. 4- Room service/maintanance was friendly and prompt. (Note that I used the word "maintanance"). 5- Early Check-in is available at the airport (Recommended because you get your room key and can bypass the massive lines at the hotel lobby.) Then, unfortunately, there is the negative. 1- While room rates are reasonable, eating at ANY of the hotels eateries and lounges negates any possible room savings. If you are here on any kind of a budget... GOOD LUCK. More reasonably priced meals are available outside the hotel. Keep in mind that Bally's is very big and it will take you a few minutes to get outside to any neighboring venues. 2- I had on-going issues with room service and maintance. Room service was always forgetting to leave toilet paper or not cleaning properly. Calling housekeeping always set things straight quickly, but you shouldn't have to call them to start with. When I first checked in, the sliding doors to the closet were off the hinges. Maintance fixed it quickly, but why didn't housekeeping report this problem when they were cleaning the room instead of making the customer do it? 3- Casino's are known for giving free drinks to guests who are gambling. The same is true here. Unfortunately, even high rollers have problems getting any service at Bally's. The waitress staff is stretched so thin that getting waited on more than once every hour is a major accomplishment. During one period of time, I sat in the KENO parlor for two hours and didn't even see a waitress... I thought this might be a one time thing, but I was at Bally's four days and the unavailability of a waitress was an ongoing hassle. Good tipper or no, good luck in getting served. 4- Since you will have a very hard time getting waited on in the casino, you will probably want to get some refreshments and snacks at nearby convience stores. BEWARE... some of the convience stores on Las Vegas Blvd will charge you $15.99 for a 12 pack of beer and $4.00 for a 2 litre soft drink. The cost in the hotel isn't any better. A 20 oz soft drink in the hotel is $2.00+tax. Shop around... 5- Be very careful if you venture outside after dark. I didn't notice any hotel security anywhere outside the hotel. You cannot walk anywhere without having someone aggressively force printed advertisements for prostitutes at you. (According to local sources, this is legally allowed under 1st amendment rights) If you refuse to take the offered porn card, they will pop the card with their finger or hand at you (symbolically flipping you the bird?). Also from what I could see, the local police are basically nonexistant on the strip. Some mounted or foot patrol police would be greatly appreciated to help keep the riff-raff from bothering the visitors. During my entire 4 day visit, I didn't see a single police officer on the strip after dark. Advice: don't go outside alone. Synopsis: Vegas is still a fun place to visit. Visit with your hand tightly on your billfold and Vegas can still be a relatively inexpensive vacation. BUT beware of the price gouging as it is virtually everywhere in Vegas. If the casino doesn't get you, the neighboring stores will. Shop around and do a bit of walking and you will find more reasonably priced offerings than those found just around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Bally's - solid value”
Reviews.Author: SoCalBeachBum
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a weekend at Bally's (Thur June 23 – Sun June 26). Four 40ish guys staying in two rooms for $197.50 total per person. Stayed in renovated North Tower. Have previously stayed in Mandalay, THEhotel, Caesars, Venetian, Flamingo, Excal, and Tropicana at various times over the past dozen years. Everyone felt Bally's offered a solid value for the dollar, especially when combined with their $35 per day room add-on for access to spa, continental breakfast, and early evening happy-hour snacks (pasta, rice and beef, cheese, fruit, and small fee for beer, wine and well drinks). Would have gladly foregone the add-on, however, and paid an additional $100 total per head to have stayed in Caesars, Mandalay, Venetian. Unwilling to pay the $200+ total per head those places wanted for that weekend. Check-in was fast, easy, friendly and very accommodating to our needs and requests. I let the person know how much it was appreciated in the usual and customary way and that person was polite and thankful in their response. We requested rooms on the smoking floor to be near each other although only one of us smokes cigars. One room smelt very smoke-free, the other of stale cigar (which didn't matter to the smoker who took that room). This is just to say that it seems to be luck of the draw and I'm certain if someone found the smell objectionable a quick call to the front desk would resulted in an offer to move us another room. Beds, bathrooms, furnishing, etc. were great. Everything was clean upon arrival and housekeeping did an excellent job throughout our stay. The casino is a little small given the size of most of its neighbors. But it is connected to Paris for those who like that property plus Caesars and Bellagio are right across the street. And the LV monorail station is connected to Bally's North Tower for those wanting to use it to get other strip properties or the LV Convention Center. Other trip reports here often state the best thing about Bally's is its location. And that certainly can’t be beat. I just wanted to contribute that those who are concerned about the quality of the property will not be disappointed if they set their expectations appropriately. It is a solid mid-tier property.

Reviews.Title: “We loved Bally's!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Bally's through the recommendation of our travel agent for my husband's 30th b-day. After reading all the reviews we had no idea what to expect. We weren't looking for over the top service, but the staff was friendly and pleasant. We asked for a King room, but were told all that was left was smoking so we took a 2 queens room in the south tower. We had a great view of the Paris pool and could see down the south end of the strip. The rooms are large and the bathrooms are large with marble flooring and large countertops. It was nothing fancy but we were only in our rooms when we went to bed and in the morning when we woke up...there is too much to do in Vegas. Always came back to a clean room with everything replaced. Never used the safe and nothing went missing. The pool is a long walk from the south tower.....down through the shops towards the monorail. Great service for drinks. Decent size pool and hot tub. Not in the class of Mandalay Bay but decent for getting some sun and relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Bally's was Great!”
Reviews.Author: trippinMom
Reviews.Content: We finished up a 2 wk trip with a 2 nt stay at Bally's, and we were not disappointed! Check-in was not bad, the staff was extremely nice, and the room was wonderful! Very spacious, clean, and the accommodations were quite nice. I loved the granite countertops in the bath and we could actually move around in the bathroom. Our spreads looked nice and clean, and I thought the color scheme was nice and soothing(after a 2 wk trip with 2 kids). The kids enjoyed the pool, although I know some hotels have splashier set-ups. The monorail system also stops here and that is sooo convenient if you want to go elsewhere. We did not eat at Bally's except to grab a doughnut on our way to the pool, so I can't vouch for the food. However, it is very convenient to other hotels and attractions! We saw "We Will Rock You" at the Paris next door and enjoyed it. I highly recommend this classy, older hotel, and I am quite picky! However, if you are looking for more of a party atmosphere I might choose another place, as I did notice a little bit older crowd. But, my pick would be Bally's for price(64.99) and convenience.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Bally's”
Reviews.Author: HannahIndiana
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 4 nights at Bally's June 10-14 and had a wonderful stay. I don't know what some people expect from a hotel--while we were there the place was spotless and lovely. We arrived around 2:30 in the morning and the standard room we had reserved was not available, so they put us in a Jacuzzi suite for the first night (which was beautiful but way more space than we needed and we're just not Jacuzzi people, I guess). The standard room we switched to for the remaining 3 nights was large and bright and clean. Housekeeping replenished all the toiletries every day, which was nice. I will say that we were in the wing that has less-than-stellar views, but the mountains were nice and at night we could see part of the strip and the lights on top of the parking garages were kind of pretty if you were looking through the sheer curtains.... The coffee shop down by the front desk has excellent muffins, and the deli kind of back in the corner by the escalators has really good sandwiches. There's a live band that plays at night in Indigo, which you can hear from the casino. I didn't think the casino was especially smoky, but I was smoking, so maybe I'm not the best judge. Won $400 on the cute slot machines with the ducks that light up and quack (I'm such girl). I think my husband broke even on the craps tables. This was our first trip to Las Vegas and it turned out great. We were so close to all the really cool properties (Paris is beautiful, as are Aladdin and Bellagio). After the first few hours I gave up all vanity and put on my comfy shoes for all the walking--what is it with women that we think we have to wear those adorable spiky-heeled shoes all the time while the guys are all happy in their tennies?

Reviews.Title: “Going Down Hill”
Reviews.Author: SusanS
Reviews.Content: I will start off by saying that I go to Vegas 4 times a year for pleasure (yes I like to gamble) and the past 2 years have been staying at Ballys/Paris because I get rooms comped. With that being said, Bally's is definately going down hill in my opinion. We checked in on 6/13/2005 at about 8 pm and was told the only non-smoking room available was in a handicapped room in the older tower. No problem we thought until we opened the door. The room smelled of smoke, the bed looked like someone had been lying on it, there were empty beer bottles in the room, and in the toilet was some cigarettes as well as some other inappropriate things, plus it was right next to the elavator and you could hear the elavator all night long. Immediately called the front desk and explained the situation. There was not another non-smoking room available until the next day, so I had to request that they send up housekeeping to re-clean a room that should have been clean in the first place. We went to the casino for a few hours and then back to the room, and it had been cleaned. The next morning we called to change rooms and finally were moved to the other tower where the rooms are updated. We ate twice at the cafe, once for breakfast and once for lunch, but the service was extremely slow. As far as gambling, the Bally's casino is just too smoky for me. I think since it's an older casino the ventilation system must not be as good as the newer casinos. Also, the cocktail waitresses take forever to bring drinks. I would recommend staying at Paris instead. I've been there before, the rooms are nicer and cleaner, and the overall service in the hotel/casino is better. This is where we will stay for our next vegas visit.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Steve&Carrie
Reviews.Content: Just did it again and glad that we did. Another fantastic, comfortable, and affordable stay at Bally's. Hard to say no with the location, rooms, and price. Love Bally's... love it!

Reviews.Title: “The experience of staying at Paris with the Affordability of Bally's”
Reviews.Author: Buffettgirl2004
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Bally's after last-minute travel changes in April. I'm usually a stickler for staying at nice places, so I was a little discouraged at first because we wouldn't be staying at MGM or one of the other big resorts. I was pleasantly surprised-- Bally's, because it isn't one of the luxury resorts, doesn't have the luxury resort prices-- but it connects flawlessly with Paris--a hotel that IS one of those expensive resorts-- and you can enjoy all the luxury and novelty of staying there, while paying for a Bally's. The rooms were clean and spacious, marble in the bathrooms. The staff was unbelievably friendly, helping us with problems with missing luggage, calling taxis, arranging rental cars, and all that sort of thing. The hotel is in a great location, so no problems there, either. I would definitely stay here again-- a great way to save money!

Reviews.Title: “Great View”
Reviews.Author: luvxpotion
Reviews.Content: Winter in Vegas was not the best. When I went it was 40º and rainy. I got a great deal online. The hotel room was "okay" but the best part was the view. I overlooked Bellagio's dancing water and had a fabulous view of Paris' Eiffel Tower. All in all, you're in Vegas to be out of your hotel room. Get the cheapest price on the strip where everything is around you. You're just staying in your room to shower & sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Bally's 3 BR Suite”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was recently traveling to Las Vegas for three night stay with elderly relatives visiting from Japan. Because of language limitations and cultural orientation, we needed to find adjacent rooms. In trying to make this type of reservation at Bally's we learned that rooms aren't assigned until check in and there were no guarentees that our needs could be accomodated. Therefore we opted for a "three room delux suite"; the expense was considerably more than we had expected, but the circumstances didn't leave us many options. The accomodations were very very adequate. The suite, was composed of three adjacent rooms with internal doors. All of the rooms were very spacious, and the three rooms could have accomodated many more than the 5 in our party. One of the rooms had a tiled bath area with sunken tub, two vanity sinks, shower, toilet and bidet. The other room had two large beds and the third "sitting room had a dining table, a comfortable fold down bed, refrigeratior. Each room had shower, tub and private toilet. The amount of space was almost humorous and the furnishings were comfortable and much more than adequate. We had a very nice stay and enjoyed ourselves very much! The down side: There is something just a bit seedy about the hotel. It could use a total refubishing. Upon our arrival there was obvious housekeeping flaws, e.g. finger prints and coffee stains on the doors and doorways and one of the rooms wasn't made up at all. A call to housekeeping took care of this. Furniture and rugs a bit worn and dirty and age shows on most of the accomodations. The exterior entrance is glitzy but chipping and rusting and the walking escalators kept breaking down. We were in the North Tower which looks out on a side street and the view was much less than the absolute spectacle of looking over at Bellagio, or Caesar's Palace or Paris. All in all the hotel worked for us, nothing to particularly recommend it, but it was adequate and the expensive 3 bedroom suite was absolutely perfect for our particular needs. If this wasnt a family oriented trip and I hoped to impress anyone, it would have been money ill spent. We didn't find the resturants and casino facilities to be the best, but it isnt hard to get to more exciting venues. I also commented to my companions that there seemed to be much less politeness and effort put forth by mainfloor staff. The service personell behind the visitors desk, were hard put to interrupt their private conversation to acknowlege my waiting presence and their response to my request for directions was inadequately answered so they could resume their private business. We used taxis and found the Las Vegas cab drivers were a treat. Helpful, interesting and accomodating. All in all I give Bally's this sorta ho-hum neutral to good review.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious Rooms”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It was the first time we had ever been to Las Vegas, we have heard many things, good and bad, and were happy with our choice! Bally's was great, considering the price though, we would loved to at least had a fridge! The room was rather large, we got an "upgrade" to a better room, it was nice with the great bathroom. The only thing wrong with that was the shower, it didn't spray well, or straight! The room was very quiet until our last day, luckily we just got up to hear the "new neighbor" talking to someone on the phone! Oh, did I forget to say the upgraded room was a joined room!?! The casino was great, not as smokey as we heard, but I am sure that it was going to get worse. I was bothered by the people all over being able to smoke "inside", the shop areas and stuff, but we kept saying "Hey, it's Vegas". We spent a lot of our gambling time in "Paris" right next door, nice layout, it's like you are outside, we wondered through some of the other casinos and hotels nearby, we went about a couple of blocks in each direction. We ate at the buffet, it was so-so, there was a fly in my salad, so I opted not to eat it, but I told the waiter.....well the manager insisted I have a glass of wine, so I did. We also ate at the Cafe, I don't remember the name, the service was fast and the food was good, prices, of course they are high,but........"Hey, it's Vegas"! We will probably stay at Bally's again, the location is great for foot travel!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in the midlle of the Strip”
Reviews.Author: jwelhwel
Reviews.Content: My 5 sisters and I stayed at Bally's for a birthday celebration and it was a very good experience. Room was huge and well kept except ofor a large stain in the entry to the room. We ahad adjoining rooms which worked out perfectly. On the 6th floor we didn't have a view but for the price we paid, it was an excellent value. The monorail made the other hotels very accessable.

Reviews.Title: “21st Birthday Celebration”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I took my 21 year daughter to Vegas for her birthday. We stayed at Bally's in the South Tower. The rooms there are large and maid service was exceptional. We ate at Mon Ami Gabi our first night there. The food was excellant and well worth the price. I have stayed at Bally's on many occasions and never have been disappointed. The hotel check in was a little longer at the airport due to a major convention in town, but in the past I never have had to wait long to check into any Ceasar's property. We shopped at the Forum Shops and Dessert Passage shops, there is lots of variety and something for everyone's pocketbook. We went to see KA! at the MGM, the show was very good and I can say the best show I have ever seen in Vegas. Love the location of Bally's it is close to all our favorite casinos and the monorail station is at their backdoor. All in all we had a great trip.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: SusieTP
Reviews.Content: and excellent view from room to Bellagio Fountains. Spent second week of Honeymoon in Ballys after a week in New York. Were given a free room upgrade and always found staff to be friendly and pleasent. Would highly recommend hotel to family/friends. Warning- watch the hotel room telephone charges. Best option is not to use it and use the pay phones in lobby instead.

Reviews.Title: “Bally's needs a face lift”
Reviews.Author: SGE01
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took a very last minute trip to Las Vegas on the weekend and chose to stay at Bally's. Two years ago we stayed at the Paris and LOVED the hotel and our stay. This time around it was a little cheaper to stay at Bally's which is connected to the Paris. We figured we would save a few bucks and try out Bally's. After all, they are owned by the same company and should be comparible..right? When we checked-in they did not have the room type we had reserved and were not prepared to upgrade us. We settled for a room with two Queen beds. It was 11pm when we checked-in and went to our room. Upon opening the door I was shocked. The room was like you were staying at some 20 year old Super 8 motel. Very run down, old and nothing special. The bathroom shower was also very tired and had mold. Also, the air conditioning system was very loud as it turned on and off...rattling each time. We found the hotel staff not very helpful and somewhat clued out. The casio did not appear to have a good ventilation system as it was always smokey...too smokey for us. The pool is nice but get there early to get a chair as they go quickly. We spent most of our time at the Paris restaurants and Casino when we weren't out experiencing the strip. For the price we paid I would have expected much much better accomodations. As far as we are concerned, Bally's has the location but the Paris is the quality hotel. Bally's is charging way too much for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: jipc
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Ballys last week for a conference. Clean room, great view and easy to get around. The airport check in was a plus- got my keys and went right to my room at 1230pm! All in all I felt it was perfect for my needs. On the negative side though, I found that the Sidewalk Cafe restaurant was awful. There are many food choices on the property but I decided to go in this 24/7 "family" restaurant for b-fast one morning. The staff are all in comas- they are not the least bit interested in the customers- they could care less if you sit in a timely manner or get the food you ordered. I usually tip well but sorry to say I did not see a reason to at this place. I will go back to Ballys in the future however- it is a fun, convienient place to stay on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Bally's”
Reviews.Author: Sledhead43
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Bally's from May 1st to May 5th. Everything was excellent, from check in to to check out. Room was excellent 19th floor, north tower. All the people wer very curtious and helpful. All in all a very excellent stay. Will be staying there in November again. (by the way did win a little money playing video poker)

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: marymcq
Reviews.Content: Friends and I stayed here for the CSEA conference last year. It is a wonderful hotel, the only complaint we had was the renovation going on, the floors torn up by the elevators and the half the elevators not working. Other than that it was great...go see the Jubilee show and the behind the scenes of the Jubilee during the day. It's in a great location!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for the money and great location”
Reviews.Author: DavidHanna
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Bally's Las Vegas for (4) days in early April and thought that it was an excellent value for the money. I had originally planned on staying at Paris Las Vegas, one of my favorite Las Vegas hotels, but a couple of weeks before the trip, Bally's sent me an offer for a room rate of $59.00 per night for the first three (3) nights, and I couldn't pass that up. The hallways were a bit dark and gloomy at Bally's but the room was nicely decorated and very well appointed. I was in the South Tower and had an excellent view of Flamingo Road with the Rio to the left down the road. The room was larger than what I had had at Paris. As other reviewers have noted, the location of Bally's cannot be beat with the Bellagio, Caesars Palace, Flamingo, and all the rest just across the street, and the fact that Bally's is connected to its sister property Paris is a big plus in my book. Since I thought that Bally's casino was a bit small and dull, I spent my time (and money) in the casino at Paris. That's the beauty of it: Sleep in the large rooms at Bally's and spend your money at Paris, Caesars Palace, or Flamingo; you get comp dollars from all those sister properties that you can apply to your bill at Bally's at check-out. The pool at Bally's is okay, nothing special. Those who are looking for an attractive pool scene will do better at the Flamingo (I've never stayed at Flamingo but I have seen its gorgeous pool) or Hard Rock on Paradise Road. I don't have any thing negative to say about Bally's. It's a functional hotel that is somewhere between moderate and upscale in my opinion. I like to gamble at all of the Caesars Palace-affiliated properties: Caesars Palace, Paris, Flamingo, Bally's, and O'Shea's. The Caesars Group has always been very generous with its offers and comp dollars with me. I hope that they continue to be so customer-oriented when Harrahs takes over this summer.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice”
Reviews.Author: bkjds
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Bally's 5/5\-5\9. We stayed at Bally's before but it was about 10 years ago so did not really have any expectations. Read reviews on here and frequented the forum. Upon arrival check in busy but moved pretty quickly. Asked about comp upgrades, they did not have any comped available but could offer us a suite for $50.00 additional a night. Decided since we are here celebrating my bday what the heck. Had to wait a couple of hours for our room but gave us time to explore. Well worth the money 23 floor- top of the south tower. Very impressive room, lots of marble and mirrors. Full wall of windows with a great strip view. Bellagio fountains, Eiffel tower, Paris pool all the way to Mandalay Bay. Very breathtaking. I have never had a view when in Vegas so this was great for me.Yes the room was in the south tower. granted a little dated and somewhat worn- yet the jacuzzi and steam shower very clean and more than adequate very nice to enjoy after a late night or a full day of walking. Staff friendly, Maid very efficent, Big Kitchen Buffet okay, Paris French market way better, Sidewalk cafe very good and Tequila Bar great 1/2 price happy hour 4-6 also enjoyed and evening in the Indigo lounge.. Awesome strip location and thought that being connected to Paris, the monorail and overhead walkways very convient and accessible. Well worth the price even with the upgrade. The jacuzzi pictures already on this page represent our room. I have attached a few of the view from our room. Can't wait to go back and try it again. Enjoy

Reviews.Title: “Bally's - A Fantastic Experience!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at the Bally's Las Vegas from 14-22 April 2005. After reading other people's reviews on this website we were a bit apprehensive about what would greet us. We shouldn't have worried as it's a fantastic Hotel. Its location is extremely central, an ideal base. We arrived at the hotel and checked in about 9pm on the Thursday night. There was not queue at all at check in and we were dealt with quickly and efficiently. When we booked our room through the travel agents we asked for a few things (North Tower, not a high floor, twin beds etc.) these were all honoured at check in. The room although not one of the newly renovated ones (these are in the South Tower) was extremely nice and well decorated in hues of beige with an accent colour of red. The 2 queen size beds we’re very comfy, and in addition to these there was also a huge easy chair, and a marble topped desk, a standard lamp, a large cupboard in which the widescreen TV was housed, and a full sized dressing table and chair. You would think having all this in one room would make it very cramped. Well you would be wrong!! These rooms are massive, and Bally's proudly boast that they have the biggest rooms on the Strip, and I can quite believe it. Having an iron and ironing board in the room as standard is a great touch, as most of my clothes were in need of a good pressing after making the 13 hour trip from Scotland.
