The maid service was also excellent. We had fresh towels to replace our used ones every day, the beds were always made and the bathroom was also cleaned on a daily basis. We made use of the in-room safe, which is highly recommend unless you want to take your valuables out with you everyday. We're in the process of figuring out if we can get out to Las Vegas again before the end of the year. If we manage to get out there again we will definitely be staying at Bally's.

Reviews.Title: “Good deal at Bally's”
Reviews.Author: Tuuli
Reviews.Content: Las Vegas was the best part of our also otherwise very good West Coast honeymoon. I and my husband got a good deal with America West from San Francisco from April 23rd to 26th. Got a good start at SFO; due to rental car return we arrived at the airport 3 h before our flight, but were offered a flight which was leaving in 30 minutes. Bally's check in at airport took a while, but husband had to wait for luggages for a while, so no time was wasted. When we arived at Bally's there weren't any lines at check in. I asked for a view and we got pretty nice Paris pool/Eiffel tower view and could see also part of Bellagio fountains. Room was big and clean with good bed and nice bathroom, not very modern, but good for the price. Alternatively they had available newly renovated room with parking lot view. We chose the wiev. We did have only one drink at the Tequila bar, it was good but we had to wait for ages to get the drinks, we concidered to have a snack there but didn't want to wait anymore. Had dinner one night at Bally's buffet, food and service was ok, but the surrounding wasn't very inviting. Location was very good for us. We love to walk, didin't see any reason to rent a car as could walk almost everywhere. We used taxi few times to get back from the end of strip and tried monorail and bus once to get to Freemont street at night. Surrounding Bellagio, Ceasar's, Paris and Alladin had excellent shopping and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Bally's”
Reviews.Author: AmigoBert
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from a 5 night stay at Bally's, and I felt compelled to add my favourable comments about this casino-hotel complex. It is not necessarily the newest and most glamourous of all the big and wonderful hotel complexes in LV, but it is the one of more enduring quality, with a capital Q. places to spend a vacation. The rooms are more than generous in size, are extremely well kept with whatever amenities one may require, and very comfortable. The facilities include all one would expect in an upper class Las Vegas hotel, such as swimming pools, one for just hanging out in and one for those who really are there to swim, the usual shopping area for people who need to shop to live, numbers of places to breakfast, lunch, snack, dine or whatever you might wish. Not to forget the half-price margarita bar between 4 and 6 pm. Room prices will vary, based on days of the week and the kind of deal one can find, but for our money, it has been the best place so far. Not by much I might add, but so far the best. The casino is what one would expect in an upper class hotel, roomy and well laid out, the bar area is jumping with entertainment that keeps the patrons quite happy, and, to top it all off, the hotel is connected by means of a very short common area to the Paris Las Vegas Hotel, which by itself increases the variety of the restaurants, bars, and entertainment available in one quantum leap two or three-fold. Maybe more. The Las Vegas monorail stops at the rear of the property, and with that one has access to parts of the Las Vegas strip previously only reached by cab, other public transportation or long walks on Las Vegas Blvd. Not a bad thing in itself, but distances in LV can be deceiving when you're on foot. In terms of location, it is right in the centre of the "happening" strip and it is connected by means of overhead walkways to the other hotels at the Las Vegas Blvd. and Flamingo Drive corner. If one never leaves that corner for a week, well maybe with a couple of side trips up and down the "strip" one will just not run out of things to do. We enjoyed it!!

Reviews.Title: “loved it”
Reviews.Author: susie26
Reviews.Content: we stayed in bally.s last august and we loved it bally.s big kitchen is great in fact we have stayed in several different hotels in vegas over the pest ten years the only complaint i have is the air conditioning in some of the hotels its to cold but we will be there again this august excalibur this time if there is anything we are not happy about we will hopefully get it sorted out it definately wont spoil our holiday after all it.s lasvegas how could it

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel for its age”
Reviews.Author: socal4na
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Bally's on several occasions and it never seems to change much. It is older hotel and shows it (which can be good and bad). Service was good, particularly the bellmen and maid staff. The room we had this stay was huge (old vegas) but also very dated (1983). The room was clean but furnishings had the dirt and wear one would expect of a room that was furnished in the early 80's. Bally's is a hotel that charges lower prices and provides a great location. The pool is good, not too big though. Poolside service and drinks are excellent. The walkway connection to Paris is very nice and leads to some excellent dining. The cafe in the walkway is excellent and a great value, the buffet looks very good aswell. We got a huge, bargain priced, clean room at Bally's. It is hard to complain about that. Dont expect the "attractions" offered at many other hotels, but Bally's will provide great gambling (nice smaller casino), great lounge entertainment and a clean room at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings about Bally's...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Las Vegas for the first time for 7 nights from April 21 - 28th. When booking our hotel, and knowing nothing about Vegas or the other hotels, we went with Bally's because of location and price... Firstly, like many others, I could not agree on its location. Right smack dab in the middle of the strip, across from Bellagio, close to Caesar's Palace and adjoining with Paris Hotel. Because we were not enjoying Bally's itself so much, we loved that we could get to all the above mentioned (amazing!) hotels so easily. As for Bally's itself, here are some more positives: -- friendly staff ** special mention to Alice in the Lost and Found Dept. who is sending my bathing suit back home as I forgot it in the room upon check-out!! She was so incredibly nice and helpful. -- check-in and check- out were quick and easy -- outdoor pool area nice and clean, though on a hot day, recommend getting a lounge chair by 10:00am at the latest. The poolside snack bar made great food and was reasonably priced. One day it was unlimited pop refills which was great! -- room was clean -- monorail was so convenient -- after reading some of the reviews before we arrived, I was worried it wouldn't be running. The monorail was running all 7 days we were there. And, as it turned out, we used it quite a bit!! The negatives: -- though the room itself was clean, that is about all it was. We kept telling ourselves that we weren't in Vegas for the room, but honestly, it was very run down and needed some serious updating. It sounds like the tower we were staying in must be the older one. Yes, we did have a view of the strip (mostly the Eiffel Tower) but we would have preferred the updated room. -- room service cost killed us one night -- $30 for chicken wings and chicken tenders!!!! Completely ridiculous. -- not impressed with the Big Kitchen (breakfast) Buffet in Bally's. Very small selection compared to the breakfast buffets in the Flamingo and Paris Hotel. We completely loved the service at the Paris buffet and the buffet in Flamingo is HUGE and only $11.99/person!! Seriously, don't waste your time at Bally's -- these other two were far better. -- DO NOT EAT AT BALLY'S STEAKHOUSE!! Please -- there are so many better options out there and they will probably cost you less. First of all, the service was absolutely horrific. We were seated practically in the back of the restaurant after making a reservation the day prior. We just found the demeanor of our waiter to be inappropriate. After selecting my main course, I asked what the side dish was and he looked at me strangely and said 'The meat just comes with the sauce." Rather than showing me where the side selections were in the menu, I fumbled through and quickly decided on the asparagus, added nearly $10 onto my already $30 entree. I honestly could not believe it. In fairness, the meat was delicious, but our waiter would not know that as he did not come back to check on us until our plates and glasses were empty. We spent $130 on a very disappointing meal. Seriously, you can eat at much more elegant places such as Chinois at Caesar's or Emeril's in MGM Grande and spend less money as these establishments include a side dish with their entree, and have impeccable service. We called after our meal to let the manager know. We made it clear we were not looking for a comp in any way, but that he needed to know that the service was severely lacking, at least in our section of the restaurant!! Oh -- if you guys make it down to the Stratosphere, you MUST eat at Fellini's, in the corner of the casino! Oh my goodness, the service was top notch and the Italian food was AMAZING!! My husband said the cheesecake was the best he had ever had. It is well worth the trip. -- We found the casino at Bally's to be relatively uneventful and small compared to others. We spent most of our time at the Paris casino as it was far less smokey, or we went across the street to Caesar's. -- We also found there was nothing to 'do' at Bally's, beyond the couple of restaurants and casino. During our stay, we had some days where the weather was less than favourable. We never stayed at Bally's. In fact, we spent most of our time at Caesar's. Though I cannot speak of the the room at Caesar's, they have tons of restaurants and the shopping is fantastic. We often said that if we had stayed there, we wouldn't have to leave the actual hotel if we didn't want to. It literally had everything. The shops in Bally's never had a customer in them that I could see and the selection of shops was poor. Bally's was very uneventful to us. Now I feel like I could rant about all the things we loved about Caesar's Palace -- but I won't. This is a review for Bally's hotel and all wrapped up, we would choose another hotel next time we visit Vegas. Was our stay terrible? No -- but it could have been better in so many ways. Wherever you stay, though -- Vegas itself is fabulous! Have fun and 'break even'!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: barney01
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Las Vegas at 10:10 am on Sunday, April 24. Checked in to Bally's at the airport. Because we had booked our room based on a special Bally's sent us, we were considered "Casino Guests." That meant that we were automatically upgraded to a room in the North (renovated) Tower. I had never stayed at Bally's before, and I had heard mixed reviews, so I didn't know what to expect. I was extremely pleased with this hotel during our entire stay. We stayed in room # 2145 facing the Strip. Our room looked exactly like the one on the Bally's website. The room was very spacious and attractive. The bathroom had a tub/shower combination and lots of marble. Maid service was unobtrusive and attentive throughout our stay. There was an in-room safe, by the way. We checked on renting a refrigerator for beer, mixers, etc., but it was going to be $10/day, so we decided we didn't need it that much. Casino was spacious, and didn't seem any smokier than other casinos, contrary to what other reviews have said. Buffet was just OK... nothing special. There's a good coffee shop in front of the front desk, and it was always busy in the morning. All in all, we had a great stay and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Felt and treated like a High Roller”
Reviews.Author: NV_Bound
Reviews.Content: Its been almost a couple of years since my last visit to Vegas and our stay at Bally's. Our trip was spur-of-the-moment and we chose Bally's simply because it is my father's favorite Vegas hotel. We booked a charter vacation and arrived at Bally's in the morning to a long line to check in. (I understand there is an alternate check-in now at McCarran). I know many people complain about waiting in long lines to check in at many of the hotels. I just took it in stride. My excitement just to be in Vegas overwhelmed any negative thoughts I may have felt otherwise. Anyway, all along the counter there were signs indicating to ask about the whirlpool rooms (they are called Grand Suites now). I had sprained my ankle right before we left, so I felt a whirlpool tub would be good for me. When we asked, we were informed they were only $50 more per night. Sure! We'll take one! So up to the room we go. (I don't remember that the elevators were very far away. Locations of everything seemed very conveniently placed throughout.) Now, I don't know if you are like me, but I'm always excited about opening the door to a hotel room for the first time. I like staying in nicer hotels and the atmosphere and amenities of a room are important to me. Let me tell you....when we opened that door and saw that room, I was amazed at how beautiful it was. Huge sunken whirlpool, huge room, sofa, two separate vanity AREAS (not sinks---AREAS). A separate shower room, separate room for the toilet, two large clothes closets, TONS of marble. WOW. Nothing compared to what came after that though! We dropped off our bags in the room and headed down to gamble. When we arrived back at our room about 10:30 pm (which is 2:30 am on our body clock) we were exhausted. But we had a message from the front desk informing us that there was a "problem with our room" and to please bring our bags down to the front desk and they will assign us a different room. I was a bit perturbed at that point. I should have called the front desk and told them to send someone up to give us a new key and take our bags to the new room. But instead we just went down and got our new room key directly from the front desk. So up we go again, anxious to just get into bed and get some sleep, but not expecting the excitement that was awaiting us. We opened the door on the very top floor figuring the same type of room. The adjectives have not been invented to explain the amazement we felt when entering that room!!! This room had two floors, a winding staircase to a mezzanine overlooking the living room, a large wet bar, dining room/living room combination, two bathrooms, 30 ft floor to ceiling windows! The bedroom was upstairs and was exactly like the room we had just come from. I found out recently that this is a room that is not available to the general public (I asked about it when I wanted to make our most recent reservations). I figure that until we become High Rollers we will never experience a room like that again! Now that we are planning another trip this July (geez is it hot then---hard to even breath outside), I cannot justify staying anywhere else no matter how hard I try. I’d like to try someplace different, and I have been in a constant quandary for 3 weeks as to where we should stay--Mandalay Bay, Mirage, Bellagio, Monte Carlo, Paris, Bally's, the Wynn. However, I cannot even force myself to stay anywhere but Bally's. Bally's just has too much going for it—the comfortably large whirlpool rooms, the tram station I’ve read about right within Bally’s (believe me—I don't prefer going outside in that heat!), the easy interior access to Paris (my favorite place to gamble because of unique outdoor atmosphere), easy access to everything within the hotel. Personally, I believe I prefer a really nice room in a three-star or four-star hotel over a standard room in a five-star hotel for the same money. I will make sure I take very specific notes on our upcoming trip so I can provide you with detail on the amenities of the hotel that may make the difference for you if you are in a quandary like me.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Oldnewtimers
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a week in Las Vegas and stayed at Ballys. First time visit for both husband and myself and we couldn't have picked a better hotel. Our premier room was very nice and really large. Bathroom was mostly granite with a nice size tub. Our view was pretty good. We looked across to the Bellagio fountains, although the South Tower blocked middle of the show. Service was good and everyone seemed friendly. Line at checkin was long but went really quickly. Played slots and ended up with 2 free t-shirts and free buffet from our players comps. That was pretty fun! Also, you can't beat the location of Ballys. Close to many and in the middle for the rest! We ate in the Buffet which was great and Johnny's Delicattessin, which was wonderful and inexpensive. Sidewalk Cafe was pretty good, though we'd go to Johnnys over it next time! Great price, great people and great location. We will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Time!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a wonderful trip to Las Vegas. Stayed at Ballys for the first time and we will stay there again. We stayed at the Bellagio in November and Bally's rooms were just as nice. A large clean room with a very comfortable bed! All of the staff we dealt with were very nice. The Lounge had a great band every night with no cover charge. Can't wait to go back and lay by the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, Spacious Room!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My first visit to Vegas was in 1980, so I was really looking forward to going back! Boy, there were a few changes! No more 24 hour a day 99 cents breakfasts, but still great value, especially if you shop around. I did not think of booking Bally's initially - I fancied, amongst others, The Luxor, Monte Carlo, New York New York - then I hit on to the idea of Bally's. Why? Because of its central position and larger than average rooms. Check-in was quick and easy, as we arrived late evening due to delayed flights form the UK. The room WAS very spacious, and clean, with comfortable beds - great to sink into after a very long journey! The safe in the room did not work, and on calling reception, we waited only a few minutes for someone to fix it, and he was very polite and friendly. The view was not great - we could see the airport, but since I like airports and watching incoming/departing planes, that was fine by me! There were small bottles of mouthwash, shower gel, shampoo, conditioner, body lotion and shower caps in the spacious bathroom, which was nicely fitted-out with lots of marble and mirrors. The bath had easy access for anyone with restricted mobility, as the sides were not too high. The towels were white and fluffy - and lots of them. The shower curtain was heavy quality. I left a small tip for the maids every day, and when I requested some shower gel, got loads of bottles of everything, including some of Bally's facial and bath soap - lovely quality French soaps. All the furnishings were solid and of high quality. The breakfast buffet was lovely. I can't fault it and will return again. The Christmas decorations everywhere are a must to see! I think overall, the people working there in the hotels and shops do a great job and I found them friendly and efficient. Hope you find this helpful! Warren

Reviews.Title: “Ballys not for me”
Reviews.Author: FingerLakes
Reviews.Content: Good news is I had a great time in LV. Bad news is Ballys was not a good hotel for me. Stayed for 5 nights last week in honor of my parents 50th anniversary. Booked online at the Ballys website about 2 months in advance and got two rooms for $142 each avg. per night. I thought this would be a step up from my last stay in LV, which was at the Exclaibur but it wasn't. Customer service at Ballys is bad. At check in the receptionist couldnt even muster a hello, just demanded my license and credit card. When I realized she was assigning a room, I spoke up to make sure we would get connecting rooms, only to be told that was not possible, even though I had requested it when I originally booked. Didn't even bother asking for an upgrade or the north tower with a strip view. She was so unfriendly, I just wanted to finish the transaction. Either the hotel or my floor was out of shampoo, went four days with tons of conditioner and no shampoo. When we finally got shampoo, the maid took all the conditioner. I had started out with a nice tip, but that dwindled as the shampoo situation got worse. On the plus side, the rooms are clean and big. A relative ordered a fruit basket from Ballys which was delivered to my parents room. Some of the fruit was over-ripe and the peanuts were so stale as to not be edible. On our last full day there, I took our connection cards to the desk to have our slot comps applied to the room. After waiting about 45 mins. while the rep. talked to someone on the phone, he advised me that since we didn't booked thru Ballys we could only use the comps for room service and a movie my Dad had ordered by mistake. I explained to him that we booked directlly through the Ballys website, but he said sorry, no go. Next morning, waiting to leave, I went back to the connection card desk and asked if there was anything I could use all those comp points for. The clerk said I could apply them to the hotel room charge! Why they put us through all that crap the day before is beyond me. When I got home, I sent a complaint via the internet and got a notice that someone would contact me within 24 hours. Never heard from them. I wouldn't even call this a three star hotel. We dumped thousands of dollars at this place but they will never get another dime from us. Thank heavens that a good time was had by all, in spite of the bad customer service of Ballys.

Reviews.Title: “Non smokers' nightmare”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was the hotel I stayed in at my first and only visit to Las Vegas. I think I will probably run into the same air quality problem at other hotels. I booked online at Bally's website directly, there was only one price. So when I checked int, they started asking if I want to "upgrade" to nicer rooms. Apparently the rate was for just the basic room with no coffee maker. Everything else is extra, internet is $12 a day (doesn't work if you watch tv at the same time), local phone call is $1.25 a min., gym access via spa for $20 a day, use of the room's safe cost a few dollars a day. In other words, beside sleeping the room, everything else cost extra. The worst is the air quality that is killing for non smoker. People smokes everywhere, and they use air freshener in the circulation to cover up the smell of the smoke. But we still inhale 100% of the second hand smoke. I got sore throat after the 2nd day. Still coughing after a week back at home. Since everyone touches everything, be carefule with what u touch so not to pick up cold or flu.

Reviews.Title: “Review of Bally's hotel & spa”
Reviews.Author: megw2
Reviews.Content: My huband (then fiance) and I stayed at Bally's from 3/30 - 04/04 while we were in Las Vegas for our wedding. Overall we had a great experience at this property. It's central location and price (compared to it's neighbors: Paris, Caesar's Bellagio) can't be beat. I would definitely consider staying at Bally's again. We used airport check-in while we were waiting for our luggage. It took about 2 minutes. They confirmed our reservation, issued us a key and explained where our room was located. I am so glad we did this. When we got to the hotel the check in line was really long so this saved a lot of time! Our room was a mini-suite: Room 7301 in the South Tower. This was a great room for us. Lots of extra space (which was good because we had people in and out of there all week). It had 2 sinks/vanities and a sunken tub in the middle. I was a little disappointed that it wasn't a jacuzzi tub. When I booked the room I had just assumed that it would be because I didn't know why they would put a regular sunken tub in the middle of a hotel room. Oh well. It was still a great room! Two of our friends wound up getting to Las Vegas a day early and didn't have a reservation anywhere so they stayed in our room. Bally's gave us an extra bed and it stayed in our room the entire weekend free of charge. They never added any charges to our bill. We were really surprised by this. From our room we had a view of the Eiffel tower and the Bellagio Fountains. This was great, especially at night. The one and only SLIGHT downside to this is that at night you can hear the fountains booming. Not a big deal though...it didn't keep me up at night. The Spa at Bally's - I woke up the morning of my wedding *SO*& worn out. I called the spa to see if they could fit me in for a massage and they could! Let me tell you, this was the best thing I did the entire trip! You walk in and they hand you a warm robe and towel and slippers show you to your locker. Then they take you on a tour. There are 2 big Jacuzzi's, a sauna, a quiet room where you can sleep, a gym, rain showers, sitting areas, hair styling areas. This would be a great place to go with a group of friends. I wish I would have known about it sooner. You can use the facilities when you book a treatment. Or you can just pay like $20 to use them. And the best part is you can come and go as you please all day. Oh...and my massage was great. Just what I needed!

Reviews.Title: “Suprising Room”
Reviews.Author: Solochicky
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Bally's from March 24 through March 27, 2005 and had made the reservation based on mostly positive reviews posted here on Trip Advisor. Our only real concern was the state of the rooms/hotel based on some reviews. When we checked in, we were given a HUGE, newly renovated room (Room 510) with a king size bed, HUGE bathroom, and a dressing area. All the furniture in it was brand new and the bathroom had marble in the shower. We were very impressed. I have to say, the only negatives were that we had a view of a wall and there were not that many options in terms of TV channels, but we weren't there to stay in the room and watch TV so it didn't effect our stay very much. The staff, from our little interaction was friendly. It was quiet enough and one of the monorail stops is in the building which was nice as is the immediate proximity to the walkway over the strip to Caesars and the Bellagio. I would definately go there again!

Reviews.Title: “Vegas Hotel Hopper Thinks Bally's Best Strip Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CJKatl
Reviews.Content: Work sends me to Vegas a lot - fifteen times in the past year. After staying at almost every hotel there is*, I choose to stay at Bally's when possible. How do I love thee - let me count the ways: Location - in the middle of the strip. Staff - always friendly and willing to fulfill any request. Tables - always a good crowd at the games. Rooms - big, comfortable, with two desk tables and sofa with coffee table. Bathrooms - nice marble. View - ask for a room where you can see the fountains. Pool - fun, without the attitude of some other properties. Spa - well equipped (free weights!) and a bargain compared to other hotels. Food - it's Vegas, so it's plentiful and there are a variety of options. Price - always a relative bargain compared to other hotels. Other - being able to check in at the airport is convenient. *Have stayed at Ceasar's. Flamingo. Luxor, Bellagio (expensive), Sahara (yuck!), Stardust (actually nicer than expected), Venetion, Mirage, Embassy Suites, MGM, Marriott, Hilton, and Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Bally's Hotel & Casino”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was mine & my husband's first trip to Las Vegas which we went there for our 32nd wedding anniversary. We stayed 3 nights at Bally's Hotel & Casino. which is located on the strip & is an excellent hotel which I would highly recommend to anyone going to Las Vegas. Didn't win any money but we had a wonderful time & will return again and we will definitely stay there again. Everyone was very nice & polite & very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Bally's”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Bally's the room was rather large. We had a great view! This was truly more than we expected! I will definately stay at Bally's again!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable room at Bally's”
Reviews.Author: cstar11
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Bally's for 2 nights in February. Room was large enough for all 4 of us in the room. Furnishings were standard Vegas hotel room but looked fairly new. Bathrooms had marble. The bed was comfortable and rooms were quiet. The casino was large and non-descript for the most part. Restaurant in hotel was standard and a bit overpriced (typical Vegas). But, a good time was had at the packed happy hour at the Tequila Bar (highly recommend!). Hotel is connected to Paris for more dining, shopping, gambling options. Also, for those that stay at Bally's you can use the pool at Paris (which is very nice). The hotel is at a good location on the strip, Ceasar's and Bellagio are near across the street. I definitely would stay at Bally's again

Reviews.Title: “Largest Room in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my boyfriend and we loved it. The buffet was delicious, the room was spacious, the pool was nice, and it is right on the monorail line. (rumor has it, there is a charge for the monorail now- sacraleige!) If you ask in advance you can get a room with a view of the Bellagio fountain show. Look for webdeals too, I think we spent 100 US$/night, which was reasonable considering the excellent service and nice accomodations.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: deadhead66
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a stay at Bally's and I highly recommend it. The North Tower rooms are spacious and clean, and are within easy access to everything. We had a fine view of Paris, although nothing special. Our rate during the week was $129 for two queen beds. The pool is top notch and the towel kids are very nice without being aggressive for your tips. If you want cheap gambling, its right across the street at Barbary. If you want first class gambling, its right down the hall at Paris. Middle of the road is right there at Bally's. Stay at Bally's and eat at the Village Buffet at Paris and you'll be working it just right!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: peachhaze
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Vegas. Bally's was great. Staff was great. We booked in advance for $79/night. We took a red eye flight home and wanted the room until 10 pm. Had to pay for another night. That was fine. I remembered the online price was $249/night. We actually paid $149 for extra night. I asked the front desk is always cheaper to just walk up. He said it was rare to be cheaper. Usually walkups pay the higher price. Stay in North Tower. Nice view and nicer rooms. We got a free upgrade w/out asking for it. Don't play slots during the day. Very tight. They get a little looser after 1 am. While we won a little here and lost a little there, the big slots paydays that make the news tend to happen in the wee hours of the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Love it”
Reviews.Author: BAKERY4DOGS
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Bally's twice now in the past 2 years I would recommend it, unless your rich then stay somewhere Glamerous, but for your average Joe Like Me Bally's is Great. it is an average Hotel with a great location easy walking to a lot of other great hotels/casinos. restuarants are good I Highly recommend if you like salad get a Cobb salad from Bally's it is unbelievable. The rooms are average but good for the price (who stays in their room when in Vegas anyway, right) very easy to get to your room with a lot of luggage there is a walkway so you don't have to walk onto the casino floor which is nice. I would Highly recommend them. 1. Great Location 2. Great food 3. Nice rooms 4. Friendly people 5. easy to get around 6. great price

Reviews.Title: “First visit was super! Had fun & won”
Reviews.Author: valpofan1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Ballys in Dec. 04 for the first time, main reason to play in their slot tourney. Very nice room, large and nearly comparable to Rio suite (tho NO floor to ceiling window wall like Rio). Clean and comfy. Food places (deli & pizza place) near sports book were reasonable & good best thing is wife was second in slot tourney (won $1,000) and we both won money on slots, from penny to $1. She especially cashed lots of tickets. In just 2 days we earned $78 in (food) comps for our next visit. We hope to stay and play in nother slot tourney this summer. Nice cozy bar at east end of casino with live music we enjoyed tho they want you to buy drinks. we definitely will stay again (got several good offers in mail and email already).

Reviews.Title: “Spacious room”
Reviews.Author: Vermonter38
Reviews.Content: Stayed at BALLY'S for 5 nights at the end of February. Experience began at the easy airport check-in. Middle of the day and absolutely no wait. The nice lady even arranged a shuttle to hotel. Large casino, but easy to get around. Long walk to the room, but it was worth it. Very large, very clean and well laid out. Loved the marble bathroom. Very quiet. Rooms must be very well insulted as we heard no noise from adjoining rooms or hallway. Advise you get a Connection card and charge everything to your room. Ended up with 2 free buffets and $20 in cash and we are NOT big gamblers. Liked the casino at Paris better than Bally's. Buffet was better there also, but it is a partner casino and a pleasant, easy walk there. See JUBILEE! It was fantastic and 2 for 1 coupon made it a real bargain. Checkout was easy and accurate. Staff was helpful and friendly. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Book a room at Bally's!”
Reviews.Author: Luv2Travel2
Reviews.Content: Highly recommend this hotel! Excellent room!!!! Main service was wonderful and very courteous!! North Tower is the bomb!! Stayed next to the swanky 22nd Club. Connection Card program is a must! Got our meals and one night upgrade comped, what a deal! and two free t-shirts. Drinks were plentiful, but casino a tad smoky. Beds were so comfy! Two desks in our room and a great view of the strip. Great location!

Reviews.Title: “Great View”
Reviews.Author: FloridaLover65
Reviews.Content: stay for 3 nights in feb 2005, what a view of bellagio fountains and south strip casino's. Room adequate, but poorly decorated and could have used a sofa or love seat noting it was 450 sq ft.Left a jacket in casino over night and security had found it and got it back the next morning (very impressed). Would have like pool area to be at least open for sun bathing, but could use Paris, but what a walk! Great location and could easily walk to over 15 casinos either way. Will return for value.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go to Bally's”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We went through a package deal and ended up with Bally's as our hotel. It was my 30th birthday and I paid for my family to go with me. We confirmed twice with the hotel that everything was under my name. When we arrived at the hotel - my name was no where to be found. That acted as if I didn't even exist. They never made any excuse or apology, just said that's the way it was made. My family and I have allergies to smoking and this hotel would not (under any circumstances) alot us two non-smoking rooms until we arrived at the hotel. "You get what you get" is what they told us. Fortunately, we did end up with the non-smoking rooms, but when we arrived back home, we found that all of our clothes (even ones not worn during trip) wreaked of smoke. That explains the headaches and coughing! The casino itself was good, but we only had 2 servers ask us if we would like drinks. I'm saying two because these two proceeded in arguing in front of us because one was not supposed to take drink orders. She was due to clock out, but did the other server ever come back to take our order - NOPE! Our complimentary cards were used the entire time we were there, but was never activated for savings! I highly recommend anything other than Ballly's. These people are rude, unaccomodating, and shouldn't be working in a customer-service oriented town as Las Vegas. I'm from Florida - and Orlando thrives on customer service. If you are allergic to smoke - make sure not to go through a travel agent. DO IT YOURSELF! The hotel will make sure that they get it through your head that they don't accomodate non-smokers!

Reviews.Title: “Great location for a great price”
Reviews.Author: WiscBride
Reviews.Content: I've been to Las Vegas twice and both times I stayed at Bally's. Next time I go, I'll stay there again. I think it's great because the price is right, it's got a great location right in the center of the strip, and it's a nice, clean place to sleep. I'm not in my room much when I'm out there, except to sleep. So I really don't want to spend a fortune on a room that I'm hardly going to see. Bally's rooms are fairly large, clean, and nicely decorated. Sure, there are no water shows like the Bellagio or pirate ships like Treasure Island, but that's what I like! All of those extras are what make those places more expensive to stay at! I walk around the strip from hotel to hotel and I get to see those things, too, except I don't have to pay to see them. That's where the location is perfect. You can walk to most places. If you like to stay within your hotel for your stay and you're looking for all of your entertainment there, Bally's may not be for you. There are no frills or extras. But if you're out and about, you won't have time to take advantage of the frills and extras, so why pay for them? And as you're out and about, you won't have to pay for a cab to get to the other end of the strip... you're right in the middle of everything!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific stay at Bally's!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Treated my husband to a birthday vacation to Vegas from 2-18-05 thru 2-21-05, this was the first time for both of us, we had a "wonderful" time at Vegas. We arrived at Bally's after 10:00p.m. because our flight was delayed, even though we arrived late we were able to get a fabulous suite in the North Tower, non-smoking room, great strip view. The suite was huge, clean and everything was new. At check in no lines, without having to ask for a upgrade nor give them the $20 I have seen posted in other reviews. We wasn't ready to leave, I would definitely stay at Bally's again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous view!”
Reviews.Author: Kizy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Bally's last week, and it was great hotel. We stayed in the older south tower, and although the room was outdated and could use some work, the view was worth it. We were on the 10th floor and faced the Paris pool, Eiffel tower and Bellagio fountain show. The pool was closed, so we used the Paris pool, which was very luxurious. Remember to use your connections card at Bally's, Paris, Caesars and Flamingo as you can get free T-shirts and discounts at many stores. Bally's was centrally located and easy to walk to many casinos. We stayed at Luxor before and the walk to other casinos north was too long. The only downside was the lack of cocktail servers in both Paris and Bally's and the smell of smoke on the casino floor, but you get that in most casinos in Vegas! Can't beat Bally's for a great price and view of the strip!

Reviews.Title: “Bad treatment here too!!!”
Reviews.Author: Michigander7
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 nights here over Xmas. It seemed like the treatment towards its customers was cold and indifferent, and sometimes bordering on hostile. They take their customers for granted, figuring there will always be someone else coming through the door, so individual attention is non-existent. Maybe its just that the employees are reflecting their casinos corporate mind-set. This attitude may be their undoing.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed at this hotel three times and will be going again. It is centrally located, friendly staff and employees. It may not be the most modern but it fits our needs perfectly. We saw the Jubilee and it was an awesome show. Food, comps, and a great atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Worst treatment on the strip”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Don't let the four-stars fool you, Bally's is more like a Motel 6 and treats its guests accordingly. Checked out immediately and relocated to the Monte Carlo, which is a much better buy. Have stayed in Vegas several times and recommend most hotels, except Bally's. Employees are rude, rooms are poorly decorated, view isn't very good. If you do stay at Bally's, watch your bill for overcharges.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just got back from Bally's and loved it. Despite me getting a really bad cold we had a great time. The room was huge I believe their website boasts 400 sqft. We wanted a non-smoking floor and all they had was a room with 2 queen beds. So there were the two beds, a 2-seater couch, an over sized chair, a desk, a big armoire for the TV and another desk One problem I found was the showerhead, it needed CLR or something like it as the water trickled out. As far a location it is amazing. Bally’s is in the centre of the strip and within walking distance to so much. It is beside Paris, across from Bellagio and kitty corner to Caesar’s Palace, which is one hotel you have to check out. We also saw the resident show at Bally's which is called Jubilee which is also a great show, very Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Big rooms, great location.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Bally's for 4 nights in November 2004 although the conference we were attending was at Caesar's across the street. The rooms at Bally's are spacious and comfortable and the price reasonable. Very central location on "the strip." Those staying at Caesar's paid alot more for a smaller room... Have stayed at Luxor and Excalibur before and thought this the best.

Reviews.Title: “Great Strip Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Traveled to Vegas in January 05. Great weather; stayed at Bally's. Perfect location on the Strip. Next to Paris, Bellagio. Across the street from Flamingo and Ceasars. Our room was big, clean, and just right. Staff at hotel were very nice and accommodating. Housekeeping was terrific. I suggest booking on Bally's site for the lowest rate. They guarantee it. If you are going to gamble, or shop, I recommend getting a Connection Card while you are there. You can earn comps and the card is also good at Paris and Ceasars. Restaurants at Bally's and Paris were good and reasonable. We took taxi's to other casinos instead of renting a car, it was cheaper and no hassle. We felt very safe out on the strip at night. See the Bellagio fountains at night, it is spectacular. It was a great winter get-away. We would stay at Bally's again.

Reviews.Title: “was ok”
Reviews.Author: Blushingbeauty
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 7 day vacation. I was not totally impressed with this Hotel.. some of the staff was Extremely nice.. but others were snotty and seemed bothered if you asked questions. They charged an extra 1.25 for a local telephone call.. and $3 a night to use a safe inside the room. The windows outside were extremely dirty, with bird droppings on them. What totally shocked me.. was they charge almost $3 for a bottle of water. Go over to the corner grocery store and get your supplies, their snack shop by the corner of the elevator is way to expensive. The sidewalk cafe on one side of the hotel, was a nice reasonable place to eat, and great waiters. Room was clean, but you had to call housekeeping EVERY day you wanted your sheets changed.. instead of just having the maid make the bed. They did supply extra towels and blankets without begging. Ice machine on the 14th floor never worked the entire time.. had to go down to another floor to get ice.

Reviews.Title: “Response to Comp Complaints”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: In a previous review I read a gentleman had several complaints about the Ballys comp card that I thought were completely unfair. Something to keep in mind when reading these reviews is the people who write them are regular people, and by virtue of that, they mess things up. First, this gentleman complained that upon arrival his comp dollars from a pervious trip were no longer available. He states that he had been there 18 months before. It is however clearly states in the Connection Card rules that comp dollars are only good for 13 months. This is the customer's fault, not Ballys. Secondly, he says to leave a card in your room cause if you lose your card, you lose your points. That is blatantly false. Having lost my card and Ballys and several casinos I can vouch for this, and if for some reason his account was erased he should have complained. Your comp dollars are stored in an account on a computer...the card simply tells the machine which account to access....that stupid little card does not contain all over your account information. Again, this is customer error...not Bally's fault. Finally this gentleman flasely advises people to make sure they use all of their comp dollars before they check out of the hotel, because as soon as you do, they erase your account. Again, this is not true. If this gentleman had read the little brochure they give you when you get the card he would have known this. He says that his relative only had a couple dollars left and wanted to use them for breakfast. Well, as the rules of the card clearly state, you can only take out a minimum of $10. So if you have less than that...you can't use them. Be wary of what other customers say...people screw things up. In my opinion Ballys is the best value on the strip. GREAT comps, nice rooms, and a nice casino. Who could ask for anything more?

Reviews.Title: “Just your average hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Ballys for 4 days for a business convention in January. It was completely fine for my purposes. The rooms were large and clean. The elevators all worked fine and were never crowded as someone else had written previously (which concerned me.) The location was fabulous. The staff was very helpful to me. I prefer more luxurious accomodations so if I were coming for a vacation I would stay at the Venetian or the Belaggio. Ballys is in need of an update. But if you just need a quiet, clean room to crash in then Ballys is a totally fine choice.

Reviews.Title: “Sensory overload!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Bally's Hotel and had an absolutely fabulous time. The Hotel was clean and amenable, the staff friendly and helpful. The range of eateries was good as well as being fairly priced. I would recommend this hotel and this resort to anyone. The resort itself if very user friendly, easy access for disabled and lots for kids to do. Everyone should visit two special places in their life - one being Las Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Bally's - one of the worse hotel in the US”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: All personel have a bad attitude and are only interested in average service if your spending a lot of money. Employees not friendly and generally unpleasant. Room was outdated.

Reviews.Title: “Great Price and HUGE Room!!”
Reviews.Author: missamilla
Reviews.Content: We went to Vegas twice in 2004, and the second time stayed at Bally's. In the month of August, we were able to stay there for $69 a night!!! The room was gigantic!! Our room did not overlook the most spectacular of views (we always seem to be placed over parking garages), but my boyfriend enjoyed watching the planes take off from McCarran airport (which, I might add, I didn't hear a plane once while in the room). Bally's is connected to the Paris casino, which was a nice plus. It also is one of the stops on the new Vegas monorail, which was finally up and running. We had a great time, and the hotel was definitely part of the reason!

Reviews.Title: “Bally's”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just spent four days at Ballys. Generally the hotel is OK but a few problems. The room we had, 1869 was spacious but the carpet looked like it had never been changed/cleaned and the hole in the bedding was good for ventilation. The slots/video poker has all been changed to so called EZ pay. This means you can no longer put coins in to the machines. Makes it more efficient and cost effective for the hotel but takes away from the traditional casino ambience (phoney sound effects of coins just don't cut it with me). Can no longer wander around and drop a coin or two in to various machines. When we asked if there were other casinos which accepted coins we were told that perhaps the old casinos on Fremont. Wrong! Every other casino on the strip we went in to offered both options. Watch out for the "Connection Card" pitch. It supposedly can be used at Paris, Caesars Palace. the Flamingo etc on all purchases. Not true. When we went to the Dinner Buffet at Paris we were advised the discount only applied for lunch. Having said that the Buffet and food at Bally's were good. The Casino is dead (my wife says quieter) when compared to other casinos ie. Bellagio. Lounge entertainment was also good, 70's Rand B. Would we go back to Bally's . Sure we would, the location, price and general service is good but there are a few things that can be tweaked.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room & great mid-strip location!”
Reviews.Author: MNGirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Bally's for a 4-night trip and were very pleased. We got an internet deal on a low price for the room and expected it to be "not so nice" because of the price. We were pleasantly surprised! The room was large and clean. The bathroom was especially nice. We had asked for a room with a view of the strip, and got a view, but it was just a sliver of a view. Since we spent very little time in the room, it didn't really matter. The remote control for the TV was missing when we arrived and we phoned to have it replaced. Within 20 minutes, we had a new remote (the maintenance man said the remotes sometimes end up in the beds and get cleared out in the sheets between guests). Nice to have quick service. The casino was nice. Enough people to make it festive but not overly crowded. The brunch buffet upstairs was very good and not too highly priced. We ate there every morning. If we return to Las Vegas again, I would return to Bally's again without question.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent start.... but slowly went downhill.......”
Reviews.Author: Lucky_Ange
Reviews.Content: Well, we returned yesterday from a 14 day (yes, 14 day) break at Ballys in Las Vegas. This write up is a long one but hopefully will help others out. We arrived on 23rd December and was greeted by a very lovely check-in clerk, Bridget who was tip top when it came to service and, noticing we were there for such a long time, gave us upgraded, inter-connected rooms in the North Tower - perfect for me and my parents. So fabulous was the service that I posted a note up on this forum that very night! We had stayed at Flamingo about 18 months previously so had already signed up for comp cards, however, we needed to get copies made and also we had subsequently lost our previously generated comp points which was a bit disappointing. Here are some overall observations, having stayed for a long time: 1) Over Christmas and New Years Eve peaks, the service really deteriorated - the staff simply couldn't cope - you were lucky to see a cocktail waitress when using slots in the evening. 2) The service in the 24 hour Sidewalk Cafe was absolutely abominable. My mother was served soup which was stone cold, when we asked for it to be heated up, the waiter made us feel like we were really putting him out! He threw the warmed up dish back at her on his return! We weren't alone with experiencing his attitude. The food was edible, but on a couple of the dishes the sauces weren't cooked out properly so lacked real flavour. 3) The Sterling Brunch is worth a visit - particularly if you like champagne and seafood - although it is expensive if you don't drink champagne or like lobster! I would also insist on seating in the Steak House area as we were pushed out into Al Dente next door meaning we had a route march back and forth to the buffet - OK if you want to walk off the course but not ideal for my partially disabled father! 4) There was some really aggressive behaviour being allowed to fester on some of the tables over the Christmas and NYE peak. My drink got knocked over twice in the space of half an hour on the roulette table - right over all my chips! A fellow gambler mentioned she also had her drink spilled by the same character! It seemed unfair that gamblers hovering over three or four tables should be allowed to brashly lean straight over seated gamblers aside without any intervention from security, even after you complain about the behaviour. I cashed in and walked - completely fed up with the whole thing. 5) Ballys as a whole needs to sharpen its act - it provides very little to its guests in the way of quality - the rooms are a good size, but tatty round the edges. I would like to see the payout rate for Ballys as I didn't witness anyone winning large amounts on the slots - unlike in other casinos. 6) The comp machines were very temperamental - meaning you had three or four attempts before being able to cash in on your hard-earned discounts. 7) My recommendation for using the in-room Internet service is DON'T! Use the terminals in the business centre instead. It is temperamental and I discovered that even though I had paid £9.99 for 24 hours access, I was then subsequently charged that same day for additional access! It was cleared up on checkout without question but would have been missed had I not already picked it up by viewing my bill on the TV screen beforehand. 8) The cleaning and in-room supplies were poorer on the days when the hotel was obviously more busy. The threshold between the two rooms was thick with dust when we first arrived and even though we left the door open - was never cleaned while we were there! Replacement of the correct number of towels, toiletries, etc was haphazard too on busy days, although the overall cleanliness was OK. 9) The service at Sully's bar was also really poor and the bar really lacked atmosphere. We found one decent bartender there, but otherwise, it seemed like there were enough tenders, but each had one side of the island bar to deal with, and the other tenders would ignore waiting customers if that wasn't their side of the bar! I am guessing it is because of the method used for tipping, but it resulted in us walking away from the bar twice - that's over $25 of drinks lost! 10) Al dente was a decent restaurant with attentive service, although the decor was very dated and for what is probably tipped to be the second best restaurant in Ballys, deserves better. 11) There is a premium charged on drinks in the Indigo bar in the evening, as well as insistence you purchase two drinks minimum if you are watching the entertainment (which is very good quality and very popular). We didn't come across any similar practices elsewhere, although no doubt this exists. 12) The shopping mall downstairs is disappointing. OK - its not meant as competition for Caesars Forum, but it is so very dated, there are quite a few empty shops and it generally lacks character and decent lighting. 13) One reason to visit the mall is to use the link to the Monorail which is fabulous and having four days of free rides over Christmas was excellent too! 14) I think being charged for a room safe is appalling practice - it was also the case at Flamingo and really is the height of meanness for any hotel to practice in my opinion. 15) Make sure you cash in your comp points before checking out. My mother had just a few dollars worth left and planned to use them for her breakfast on the last day, but once we had checked out - her card was immediately disabled - poor show really. 16) I had to rely almost entirely on web-based information and the Caesars web site for Ballys is pretty poor and out of date - no mention of car rental facilities being in the hotel (which I had to prebook as it was a rush time), Sterling brunch, parking facilities, etc. 17) The comp card will also provide you with discounts in many of the shops too, as well as breakfast buffet, so it is worth using if only for that. Following on from other comments from reviewers, it is best to get your comp information updated at the desk - we found our address information was missing and the comp machine just registered "invalid information" when we tried to claim back points. Also, request two cards when you register, keep one in your room safe and if you lose it, you won't lose points. My father lost his card and previously generated points too. Having said all this, Ballys is in a great central position, ample free self parking, a link to Paris which is a bonus, a nice steakhouse and a great Sterling brunch. On the downside, the service was inconsistent in quality, there was an air of meanness in the facilities for guests and many of the public areas and elements of the rooms are tired, tatty and dated in decor. So all in all, a pretty mixed time. Overall I think its fair to say we were disappointed with the hotel and won't stay there again, Ballys is relying almost wholly now on its central position and is not offering the value it used to offer (I stayed there about three years ago and the quality was definitely better). It didn't ruin our holiday by any means - we had a ball anyway, but it did leave a little bitter taste in the mouth at times. Time for improvements I am afraid!

Reviews.Title: “Upgrade for real luxury but take a kettle!!!!”
Reviews.Author: KerryLouLou
Reviews.Content: Generally Ballys is a great place to stay and the Big Kitchen Buffet cannot be beaten for breakfast / brunch. Ballys does not have a theme unlike most Vegas hotels - but to be honest, that comes as a bit of a relief - there is only so much fakeness you can take! We had been told about the airport check-in that was available for this hotel - but this is only available at the domestic terminal and not international. We had to queue for about 30 minutes to check in at the hotel- but it was boxing day! We had upgraded to a grand suite and were directed to a huge and stunning room with in-room jacuzzi. However when i booked from the UK, we had been told our room would be on the 16th floor or higher and have a view of Bellagio's fountains - it had neither of these. No other rooms were available, so we stayed put. But to be honest, the room was so lovely we really did not mind. The housekeeping was excellent - always plenty of fresh towels and toiletries. We rang down to request bathrobes and were quite simply told "no"! A bit disappointing considering the luxuriousness of the room. I had been pre-warned that virtually no Vegas roioms have mini-bar or kettle - so we took a travel kettle and some instant coffee which we really did use alot. My one wish, I guess is that the service was a little more personal - but with 2000+ rooms I suppose that's impossible. Overall, a really pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “OK Stay”
Reviews.Author: jochi
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Bally's between Christmas and New Year's. Room key card didn't work -maid let us in. Had notified front desk about it and eventually received a card which worked. Great location. Comfortable and clean room. Hotel personnel courteous and friendly. Had to wait almost thirty minutes to get car from the valet service on day of departure.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience At Bally's”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This past November my husband and I went to Vegas for the first time. I was overwhelmed with the number of hotels to choose from, and also concerned about cost. My husband and I have both grown up in middle-class families and have been on numerous family vacations, usually staying at Days Inns or hotels of similar value. All that is to say, I wanted to splurge a little, but neither my husband nor I have silver spoons in our mouths! We just wanted to stay somewhere a bit nicer than usual without breaking the bank. That is exactly what we found at Bally's. Its location is perfect -- right across from the Bellagio and Caesar's Palace and connected to Paris Las Vegas, it seemed like it was in the middle of the Strip. We got a great rate -- our room was $99 a night. We could have paid $20 more for an upgrade, but after going to our room, we saw that there was no need. We had a great view of the Strip and the water show at the Bellagio, and the room was clean and well-kept. Sure, it didn't look like they finished decorating it yesterday, but it was in good condition and the bed was comfortable. I must say that neither my husband nor I gamble too much and neither of us ate at Bally's, so I can't really comment on those aspects of the hotel. However, I can say that if you want a nice hotel in a great location in Vegas for a good price, Bally's is the place to go. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “We have to find a new travel agent!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our travel agent never informed us about the gastro virus warning at Bally's, we never saw the warning until about the 3rd day...TOO LATE...but at least we new what was wrong with us. We found the front desk staff to be totally useless. No coffee in the rooms (had to rent coffee pot ($30 U.S. / week) & came with the worlds worst coffee. We had the worst shower head in the history. The maids only do the bare minimum. The regular 24 hr restaurant was terrible, everything was covered in grease (you get a better breakfast at the Barbary Coast). The buffet was a 6 on a scale of 10. The steak house was a pleasant surprise, the waiters were the best ever. Over all we found ourselves going elsewhere for just about everything. Fat Elvis at the Barbary Coast is GREAT, he makes the atmosphere happen and makes the gambling a little more enjoyable...Thank You, Thank You, Thank You very much. I wish we had of seen the TRIPADVISOR web page before our holiday. Dec 12 to Dec 19, 2004

Reviews.Title: “Bally's-Great Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We took our first trip to Las Vegas in early December. With the help of our travel agent we opted to stay at Bally's because of its location and price. We knew nothing else about the hotel so we were pleasantly surprised by what a great hotel it was! The location is perfect right across from the Bellagio and Cesear's. The room was very large and we even had a view of the Bellagio fountains from our window. The room was very quiet and we didn't have a long walk from the elevator. Bally's is connected to Paris so there was lots to see and do without even venturing from our hotel. The only bad point was the monorail was still under repair. You can catch the monorail right at Bally's which would have made it very easy to travel around the strip. Bally's is an easy hotel to overlook because its lack the glitz of the "themed" hotels on the strip. But, if you are looking for a great location, great rooms and a helpful and pleasant staff, you need look no further. We will be staying here on our next visit to Las Vega which hopefully will be soon!

Reviews.Title: “Bally's slightly better this time around--but loved connection to Paris”
Reviews.Author: FoodThought
Reviews.Content: We recently came back from Vegas after a 3 night/4 day stay at Bally's. Years ago we had a terrible experience there. So I called ahead this time around to make sure they would give us a good room for no extra charge --it was our 20th anniversary. Said they would for us and friends. Tried to also secure champagne or something due to what we had experienced previously, and they hemmed and hawed over that. Finally one said they would see what they could do. (More on that later.) Friends called and we called day or two before check-in and they did give us the free up-grade and said it would not change... though it seemed one of the two people I spoke with was hesitant to do so due to us being on a charter. (MORE ON CHARTER later.) Check-in was great! We got in around 9:30a--didn't even go through airport check-in. Got on the shuttle and got going. There was no line for check-in and actually the person checking us in was great. She gave us our room keys and comp cards. Asked about the champagne, kinda said happy anniversary. The room keys didn't work. They said that might happen and sent someone up, whom we tipped, he got us in our room, but the new keys didn't work either. GREAT NEWS: We got the mini grand suite at the end of the North Tower...faced back of Paris Hotel and if you squeezed your neck to the glass balcony--which does not open--you see front of Bellagio and dancing waters. (You can however hear the BOOM from the waters when the show is over each time.) The room was very nice with sunken jacuzzi but the furnishings seemed scratched up for a renovated room. Bed was very confortable. Guy told me to go to VIP window at check-in about cards, because now there was a huge line. She was going to get the Manager to take us up with cards but friends were waiting and I didn't want to waste the am with running up and down --room was far from check-in. This person was going to check on champagne too. We were out all day having a time and didn't stop back before the clerk left for the day. She left no keys for anyone to give us that she said the Manager would make, and no news about the champagne --she was checking on that for us. She was very nice, don't get me wrong, but it would have been great if a note was left --we did think we'd be back in time, but it's Vegas, baby! Anyway, got the keys right away from a gal who was great, her co-worker (young man) seemed a little snooty, but she again was great. The champagne saga continued everyday, when a young girl supervisor said they don't even have champagne~! Egaads--I even believed her until I looked at room service items. Boy do they have champagne~!! LOL. Anyway, called on our last night there, spoke to supervisor --told her long outdrawn story. She was going to give us the champagne~! Big whoop now that the bloom was off the rose, so to speak. So I told her that and asked her what else she could do. She gave us two breakfast buffets for Paris! That was truly great! All in all---Room was great. We didn't want maid service and just kept our do not disturb sign on the whole time. Before that, we got extra towels, shampoo and soap (even one lightbulb for the vanity that was missing--so we could be at peace. It was great. Maybe not the cleanest, but clean enough. (One pistachio was found under the coach.) We hardly played at Bally's but loved walking around Paris and ate most of our meals there that the buffet--it was excellent! Good news: You can use your comp card at both Bally's and Paris. (I think Caesar's too, but we never got over there.) However, the comp cards that were given to us at check-in were no good at the comp kiosk, so we had to get them "activated" with a pin number at the comp center ---which can take a very long time if there's a line. Activate it first thing at the center, so you can just print out comps. However, it seems like you need to spend to really get any comps at all. CHARTER FLIGHT: Bad thing is: if there is bad weather coming your way and your flight is delayed or cancelled--the airline FunJet works with (Ryan Airlines) only flies every Thursday and Sunday. We just beat the bad weather. You would get your money back, but out of luck in terms of them offering to place you on regular airlines as a backup. Also: Showtime shuttle service leaving hotel to airport is the pits! Had to wait 45 minutes, called and put on hold for 8 minutes (cost me $1 per min!) but got them to come. They said there was already a shuttle there (and there was --but the driver wouldn't let anyone on and said he was there for drop-off only!) I told dispatch supervisor, who does he want to believe, the 20 people waiting for the shuttle, or the one bus driver. Even the bellman was mad~! I suggest that whatever time you want to leave your hotel and get to the airport, pad it by an extra hour. That way if they're late, they'll be right on time! Also: Don't mention how much you hate Showtime to Ryan Airlines. We asked the girl for exit row seats, and they were all gone. Said we would have gotten there on time if it weren't for Showtime. Another girl was helping out giving her ideas on other good seats. When I asked the other girl what she meant, the first girl said, "I'm handling it!" Geez--you cannot ask anything from them anymore. We got flagged for extra security! But it was fast and quick. What a trip! Hope the little hints helped someone. Next time I would stay at Barbary Coast or Sahara --latter one now that monorail is working. All in all, good time in Vegas. Still on the fence about Bally's, but a much better experience. Give it 4/5--great location! Great room for the $.

Reviews.Title: “Thanksgiving 2005 at Bally's!”
Reviews.Author: NYGIANTSFAN56INSD
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Bally's from 11/25 - 11/29. We arrived around 8pm on Thanksgiving Day, and the airport check-in was already closed. A quick taxi to the hotel and only 2 people in front of us at check-in. I tried the $20 tip trick to get upgraded, but the clerk was having nothing of it, so we paid the extra $25 a night upgrade to a mini-suite facing the Paris hotel on the 8th floor. We booked through Bally's exclusive rates online and get a good deal. The room was very nice - 2 separate vanity sinks, jacuzzi tub, bidet room, lots of space. Well worth the extra $25. Only negative were the desk drawers and night stand drawers were falling apart. View was nice - we could see the Bellagio fountains if we looked to the right from our window. Hotel was very clean, staff was friendly, the casino was pleasant. Drink service while gambling was efficient. I didn't find the sports book until the last day of my stay (far on the other side of the casino), but I liked it once I got there. We only ate at the coffe shop for breakfast and once at the Tequila Bar - which is one of my favorite bars in Vegas. For the price you pay, you cant beat the location and quality. The short walk to the Paris is excellent! I will stay at bally's again sometime. Great stay!

Reviews.Title: “decent value and good location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: this review is a bit dated as i have just discovered trip advisor. my fiancee and i took the trip from chicago to vegas in late april of last year and were excited about going to bally's because we booked a room with a spa tub and thought we received a pretty fair deal on it. we didnt get to the hotel until about 11:45 pm (quick note-just take a cab from the airport, forget the shuttle). when we arrived i thought since it was late we'd get through check in quickly. nope. super long lines and it took forever. staff didnt seem in any particular hurry. then the clerk almost set us up in a lesser room than the one we booked. anyhow-the view was of barbary coast. not very good but understandable with late late check in. the room was much less impressive in person and the walk from the elevator was a lengthy one. almost used maid art as shuttle one morning. bathroom area fairly nice but rest of room a little drab. casino was okay-pretty good energy and staff was fairly down to earth. if you wanted comp drinks while gambling though, it seemed cocktail waitresses were FAR and FEW between. the bands just off the casino floor were entertaining-i believe from indigo lounge. the inside tunnel to paris was a nice feature-made u feel like u had more options. a deli downstairs proved to be my morning savior for coffee and cheap eats. forgot the name of it but it was just off the sportsbook. dined at the al dente restaurant first full night there-it was nice. pretty tasty food-about what one would expect for the price. we went to the top of the eiffel tower-breathtaking view of las vegas from here. bellagio fountains went off while up there-nice bonus. it was pretty packed up there though. if you dont like being in tight quarters with star struck tourists posing for pics-beware. also saw blue man group at mandalay-good show but i could have saved about $100 in ticket cost if i would have seen them at briar street in chicago. bally's did have a tremendous marquee out front and the hotel itself is perfectly located. we basically used the hotel as a base and didn't spend a tremendous amount of time there. i would rate it as being right smack dab in the middle and if you get a good deal on your room dont hesitate to book it.

Reviews.Title: “Impressed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Ballys, Las Vegas Travelled from London on 28 November, stayed at Ballys for 4 nights. First time at this hotel and was suitably impressed after having been worried by some of the very negative reviews I read on this site! On arrival specifically asked for North Tower room and was given one, didn't have to pay any upgrade fee. Room was large and very comfortable. Only real downside is that rooms don't have coffee or even minibars and certainly wasn't using the bottled water at $4.50 a bottlle! Bathroom was good although water pressure could have been better. Room was kept immaculately clean by person serving that section of floor. Casino was ok but preferred the one in Paris. Tried the Big Kitchen once for breakfast and found it very good, also very impressed by the live music every night in the Indigo Lounge - we generally stopped off for a drink here on our way back from wherever we had had dinner. All in all would recommend to friends as good value for money and a marvellous location on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “We loved Bally's”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We returned from a trip to Las Vegas. We were in Vegas from November 26 - 29, 2004! I thought Bally's was great! The first night were were upgraded to a suite, and it was beautiful with two separate vanities, a separate toilet and bidet room, and a huge jacuzzi tub. I did not check in at the airport (although I would have liked to!) because they said the computers were down at the airport (for Bally's only), and could not check us in. We arrived in the evening, and literally walked right up to the check in counter so we were glad to have no wait. After the first night in a suite, we stayed in a room for the next two nights in the North tower (which are the remodeled rooms) and our view was of the south end of the strip, including the Stratosphere and the mountains beyond. The room was fantastic too! I have no idea what the rooms in the South Tower (which have the partial view of the strip) look like, but I would bet that anyone who didn't like Bally's stayed there. We ate twice in the coffee shop (the name escapes me now) and both times the food was excellent. The casino was nice, big, and not smoky at all. My hubby enjoyed the poker room, and best of all (for us anyway!) it was smoke free. The indoor walkway to Paris is terrific for those cold desert nights in the winter. I've previously stayed at Excalibur (which is okay) and Bellagio. Bally's isn't as glamourous as Bellagio, but it's a good price for a great hotel! We would definitely stay there again, and hope to make Vegas an annual trip!

Reviews.Title: “Was a bit dissapointed with Ballys...”
Reviews.Author: Cookie&JC
Reviews.Content: Just returned home from a 2 nite trip to Ballys. After much decision making and reading...we decided to stay at Ballys. Really, the pictures they show on the internet of the rooms are untruthful. Our room was dreadful...looked like an old holiday inn or something....nothing special and very, very, old. The buffet was expensive for the quality, and my son and I spent most of the rest of the day in the bathrooms! No restaraunts to just get a quick/cheap bite to eat at all. Check in was pretty long.....I think we had a new person or something...I mean our reservations were made months in advance...but no rooms had been assigned when we got there...it took forever for him to figure it out. Also....extra charges for everything...even if you have a phone card for the phone...nuts. Overall, our group did okay in the casino..won some money...but had alot more fun across the street at Barbary Coast. All in all...it was just okay...will find somewhere else to stay next time.

Reviews.Title: “Bally's is GOOD VALUE”
Reviews.Author: kanadian45
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Bally's recently and I highly recommend it. It's clean. The rooms are a good size. The staff is friendly. The food in the cafe is excellent. I can't say anything negative about the place. It's also centrally located which is good if you're going to walk to all of the other casinos. I just wish we had eaten in the steakhouse. Next time! Oh, and the pool is nice too.

Reviews.Title: “bally's”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: i stayed at the bally's the week of 11/21/04 thru 11/24/04. when we got to the hotel room we say a flyer stating they had a problem with a gastro virgus going areound and please make sure to wash hands to help keep it under control. to late. i was sick as 2 dogs on thanksgiving and the whole weekend. don't you think i should be given something for such a bad experience. 2nd of all i would have thought that since the travel agent asked it if was a special occassion or not and i said if was michael's birthday he would have had a bottle of wine, cheese, fruit basket or something from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “MY STAY AT BALLYS DURING HOLLOWEEN WEEKEND”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was in Vagas from Oct. 29-Nov1. I stayed in a palor suite (ROOM 1776 AND 1776A). There were four in my group and we needed the extra space. The room was nice, however for $325. per night there were some disappointments. The refrigerator was not cold (even after we turned the temperature up to the max), there was no microwave oven, no coffee, no complementary newspaper, and there was a charge of $1.25 for a local phone call. There was an additional charge for everything, including using the room safe which was $3.00 per day. Since there is never a discount of the suites, I thought it was overpriced for the lack of conveniences. I enjoyed there casino, there was live entertainment nightly. The staff at the checkin desk was nice. "Sidney" at the conncection desk was nice and helpful, however, others were just OK. Not too friendly. Overall, Ballys was a nice hotel, but on my next trip to Vegas, I'll do more research and will probably choose another hotel where I can get the most for the money that I was spending.

Reviews.Title: “great property for gamblers”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
