Reviews.Content: First and last place we ALWAYS go to is Bally's. We stay at either Ballys' or Paris. We love the casino, and you can actually WIN there!!!! Bally's Big Kitchen Buffet was a treat. Fresh variety of food and very clean. Waitstaff exceptionally friendly. Plus, you can't beat the location. Walking to and from other properties is easy and a good way to take in the sights and smells of the LV strip. Can't wait to go back again soon.

Reviews.Title: “First Time in Vegas - Stay at Bally's”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First time in Vegas for me! Celebrated my birthday there!! Loved it and can't wait to go back! Went there with my sister-in-law who had been there last year with her spouse but they had stayed at Fitzgerald's. Loved Bally's proximity to the airport and of course to all the newer hotels and casinos. Arrived at the hotel at noon and was able to check in immediately. Loved that!! Tried the buffet for lunch and for breakfast at Bally's and was not impressed. Also tried the little deli there and the bread was so tough my sister-in-law's dentures almost flew out when she was trying to chew it. Went to Paris for breakfast the rest of the time there. If you use your comps to eat, you don't have to stand in line. You're treated like a VIP and get to sit in a special room with several waitresses who only serve that room! Room did not have a view of the Eiffel Tower nor Bellagio Fountains but didn't really matter as not much time spent in room anyway looking out the window. Who does anyway? 100% would stay at Bally's again but eat at Paris or Excalibur. You can't beat Bally's for the room price or location! Also close to the city bus line to ride back and forth down to Freemont Street! Didn't see anybody winning at Bally's casino. MGM Grand is being rennovated and jack hammers sounding like a roller coaster gave us a headache as soon as we walked in the door. Check-out was quick and plenty of taxis to take you to the airport. Make sure if you get a Connection Card to check not only for your comps but for cash back and free t-shirts before you leave!! Hoorah for Bally's!!

Reviews.Title: “Bally's was great!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Bally's from 10/28/04 - 11/2/04 and thought it was great!!! We upgraded for $20/day to the newly renovated rooms with a partial view of the Strip and Bellagio Fountains. The airport check-in was a great time saver and the clerk was extremely helpful as we had two other couples coming in the next day and she offered to make a note to put our friends on our floor. The room was very large (I think 500 sq. ft) and well appointed. The location of Bally's is excellent which is mostly why we choose it. It was too cold for the pool but we like that it is connected to Paris where we had breakfast. Love the coffee shop in the lobby to get us started. That was our 3rd stay and it feels like home. Also, those Wild Party $1 slots were hitting big while we were there and we all won hundreds on those :-D We'll always go back to our home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “What has happened to Bally's?”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed there from 11/14-11/18, it was our third time and last time at Bally's. When we arrived, the room still had trash from the last occupant and the top of the cabinets were all sticky. Plus the wallpaper in the bathroom was coming off. The carpet didn't look like it had been vacuumed either. The machines in the casino were constantly breaking down and it would take forever for someone to come fix them. The soda machine on our floor was out of our brand of soda the entire 4 days and when we went to another floor that machine malfunctioned and we had to speak to several rude employees to get a refund. The TV checkout program crashed when we tried to check out. Their low Internet prices are not worth this!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TonyC1959
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from our first trip to Las Vegas and stayed at Bally's. We wanted a center strip location so that we could have easy access to all of the hotels. I had done some research on hotels and we selected Bally's based on it's location and moderate prices. Because I did the research, I knew what to expect and Bally's turned out to be exactly what I had read. First of all I highly recommend the airport check-in. When we arrived there was only 1 other person in front of us in line. You can also buy hotel shuttle tickets there for $5.50 each way. Bally's is the first stop for the shuttle so it's very quick. Besides the excellent location, the best feature of Bally's is the room. We paid the $20 upgrade for a North tower, newly renovated room. The room was very large, clean and in great shape. The decor was nice but nothing special. the bathroom has a lot of marble and is really nice. Only ding is water pressure is not great. I did not get to see any of the rooms in the South tower so I cannot say how much better the North tower is. In all honesty if I stayed there again I would not bother upgrading as we did not stay in the room that much. The casino is fine but nothing special compared to the newer hotels on the strip. It was not as busy as some of the other hotels. We are not big gamblers so it did not really make a difference. If I was going to spend a lot of time at the casino I would probably go next door to Paris which has an awesome casino. In fact Paris is connected to Bally's by a small mall. It is very convenient to walk over there and take advantage of that hotel which is spectacular! As far as service goes, the Housekeeping staff was by far the best. The room was always spotless and the staff always had a smile and friendly Hello in the hallways. The rest of the staff that I dealt with was so-so. The desk clerk who checked us in at the airport was not that friendly but she was efficient. Also I tried to find a Concierge but had no luck (in fact I ended up talking to a guy who I thought was the Concierge and it turned out that he was a timeshare salesman - LOL!!!) Had to wait in line at the front desk to check out - they had 3 people there but only one was waiting on people and there was a pretty good sized line. Then the one guy shuts down his station and we had to wait a few minutes for the next guy to open up. Wait staff in the restaurants and casino were efficient but nothing special. For breakfast we mainly grabbed some coffee and pastry in the lobby and brought it back to the room. There is a snack bar called Nosh and also a Java Coast(?) stand in the main lobby. They were both very good but expensive ($2.95 for a coffee - although it was great coffee). We also ate at the Big Kitchen Buffet for lunch and breakfast. The breakfast buffet is excellent - especially for $12.95 (plus you get 10% off with their slot club card). The lunch was good too but the Paris buffet is much better (and around the same price). We didn't eat at any of the other restaurants there. We also saw the Jubilee show which is a great, classic Las Vegas show. If you plan to see Jubilee I recommend that you buy the package deal with your room which gives you 2 for 1 tickets - it is a lot cheaper than buying a full price ticket ($65-70). In summary Bally's is a nice hotel, but compared so some of the others on the strip (e.g. Bellagio, Caesars, Mirage, Paris, etc.) it is behind the times. If it were located in any other city in the U.S. you would likely think it was wonderful, but for Vegas it is middle of the road. I would definitely recommend Bally's if you plan to be up and down the strip and you can get a good deal on the rooms. I would also look into Aladdin which I think is in the same price range as Bally's. It is a little bit south but close enough to everything and much nicer than Bally's. If and when I return to Vegas I would probably stay at a nicer place and forego the center strip location, but I have no regrets at all staying there. For a first time Vegas experience Bally's is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Bally's LasVegas”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I enjoy staying at Bally's in Las Vegas, except the pool time open to late I never got to use the pool. Breakfast and Dinner was excellent eating at the Hotel, I am thinking about returning, all the other casiano were just as good. Thank You

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The location was excellent. Probably about centre of the strip and it wasn't too far to walk either down the strip or up the strip. The actual casino wasn't anything special especially when compared to some of the other top names that had awesome attractions. But you can always wander around to the other casinos and check out their attractions anyway! The swimming pool was very nice but it was a bit of a long walk through a some shops (so you probably don't want to wander through in your swimming gear!) to get to it from where we were staying. The actual rooms were very nice. We couldn't hear noise from the rooms next door, and very little street noise. The bathrooms were nice, the shower didn't have very good pressure but did the job. We had a problem with the drain (water took a long time to drain), but because we were only staying for a couple of nights we didn't bother with getting it fixed. I would recommend staying here to anyone. It's a great central hotel with nice rooms and a lovely swimming pool.

Reviews.Title: “Vegas baby!”
Reviews.Author: adelangelox
Reviews.Content: In LV last week - thought i had better repay the favour of all those people who write in with their tips/ experiences! We thought Vegas was GREAT and Ballys was a great choice of hotel to experience it. Would recommend it to others... ROOM: We were in south tower 14th floor and had a great view. The room wasnt one of the renovated rooms (which disappointed me at check-in), but when we arrived in the room there was no problem at all. The room was nice - large clean and everything was present and in good working order. Top view of Paris and Bellagio fountains. Great dark curtains and no noise for easy sleep-ins in the mornings. I dont know what the renovated rooms look like in the North Tower, but save your extra $20/night because the South Tower is nice, and you really dont spend any time in your room anyway. HOTEL: LOCATION 5*! Great to be connected to a theme hotel like Paris - but even better to be able to come "home" more traditional LV experience. Checked in at the airport as per great trip advisor advice- thanks! - much faster. Yummy Italian cafe in Paris walkway, nice bagels in Nosh downstairs at Ballys for breakky too. We are not into Buffets, so didnt try Big Kitchen, but from all reports it was good. VISIT: Make sure you go see the Venetian & MGM grand, they were our favourites. The Venetian was just amazing to wander through - great romantic atmosphere. Shopping in Vegas is great too- especially at "The Fashion Show" - so dont gamble all of your money away! There is also a great outlet mall about an hour west out of Vegas, I think name of the town started with P...?!! If you are considering Vegas - GO! And I would recommend Ballys for the location and moderate price. (Any Aussie readers: prices are not moderate by our standards, but USdollar aside in Vegas I have been assured you get what you pay for) We are already planning our next trip...

Reviews.Title: “vegas baby”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We went back for our yearly vacation to Las Vegas,stayed at BALLYS as that is where we get the most comp.. Arrived Monday 25-29th. Check in was wonderful, no lines at all. I asked the check in clerk for a better room than last time and boy did that work.. We were upgrated to a Suite at no extra cost to us.. Bally is simply wonderful, .. it connects to Paris by the way, so you have the best of both worlds.. If you want to enjoy yourself without spending alot of money you must play the Men In Black 1-2 cent machines in Paris.. You never loose and are at the machine for hours on end,.. Ballys is located right in the middle of the strip so it makes it very easy going either north or south of the the vegas strip, only draw back is that the monorail still is shut down.. By all means stay at Ballys and enjoy, enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful big clean room”
Reviews.Author: Juttie1923
Reviews.Content: My family and I recently took a trip to Las Vegas in September and stayed at Bally's. The check in was quick and the man at the front desk was very nice. The room was very nice big and elegantly decorated. Granite counter tops in the bathroom and in the front room. The down side is that when we had to check out at 4 a.m. the morning we left, we wanted to go over our bill at the front desk and no one was there. There were also people waiting and the shuttle came like 15 minutes after and we had to leave. Also, the winnings at the slots at Bally's is not good. We gambled at the Flamingo and the winnings there was excellent at the slots. Bally's buffet at the hotel is also expensive. Overall, the hotel Room we stayed in was really very nice in the North Tower. I would definitely stay there again but not to Gamble.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Service, Nice Rooms”
Reviews.Author: emmi331
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at Bally's. I was on my own, prior to joining a women's hiking tour in Utah, and had always wanted to stay at Bally's, which seems like quintessential Las Vegas. No particular theme, just a big glitzy hotel with all the trimmings. Checking in at the airport made things easy, and I was given a room on a high floor as I had requested; it overlooked the Paris and its Eiffel Tower. The following day I was having some discomfort with my back, and wished I had an easy chair in the room just to sit in and read for a bit. I called the front desk, and they immediately moved me to a North Tower room that was part of a suite. It was huge, with a comfy sitting area and queen-size bed, with a larger and fancier bathroom than the other room. The view wasn't great, but who cared? It was all at no extra charge, and I was grateful to the staff, who always seemed friendly and helpful during my stay. The brunch buffet on Sunday was excellent, with lots of variety and the now-expected cheerful service. Only downside: I didn't win a dime at the slots!

Reviews.Title: “Bally's Was Top-Notch”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: On my report card, Bally's is an absolute "A" in all areas. Their location is outstanding, nightly entertainment phenomenal, casino was extremely clean and cared for and, by the way, i loved the pay-off tickets. You can re-submit the ticket in another machine to play or you can take it to the machine for actual pay-off. At another hotel, I had to stand in line for 40 minutes to get paid, and believe it or not, that was Bellagio's. Our hotel room was very clean, bathroom was outstanding with a separate make-up area (outside of the bathroom) which I loved. Like I said, all "A's" in our book!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: chocksaway
Reviews.Content: Bally's is a standard big hotel. However the room and bathroom were very good, and we got a great night's, quiet, sleep. Location is excellent as you can easily walk to most of the theme hotels and attractions. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Overpriced for weekend room, torn sheets and blankets,food overpriced at casino $4.00 sausage and bisquit, no iron and ironing board in room,Very few channels on TV, no phone books,no restaurant guides, Door on room did not fit flush to frame

Reviews.Title: “Liked Bally's”
Reviews.Author: cchancesare
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Las Vegas and spent a great deal of time researching hotels on this site. Wanted to return the favor. Finally was able to obtain a good deal at Bally's. We arrived around midnight and when checking in at that time couldn't get a room with a great view (important since this was my first visit to Vegas). The hotel is about centre strip. Great location. Nice clean hotel. there really wasn't a great deal of interaction with hotel staff so cannot comment on service. Their buffet according to conversations I overhead is one of the best on the strip (I did not try any other hotel buffets). Overall if you have an opportunity to stay at Bally's go for it!

Reviews.Title: “It was just Ok....”
Reviews.Author: Deb911
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Bally's from Sept. 21st-Sept.26th and it was just Ok. Problem is if you land in Las Vegas earlier than 3 P.M. you will probably get a room in the old section like we did. We got in at 10 A.M. and of course without paying for an upgrade we were told a newer room was not going to be available until between 3-5 p.m. So being totally exhausted we took a room in the old section. First off our view was a roof, which they did inform us when we took the room, but the problem with that is the lighting in the rooms are horrible and other patrons that had a view of the strip said the light coming in from that really helped. I had a very hard time ironing, reading etc....We had one bulb burned out and I called housekeeping which they very promptly brought one up to us and she said everyone complains about the lighting in the rooms. Basically everything in the room was old and mostly stained. We did not spend all that much time in the room so I didn't bother requesting for a room change. Also be prepared for a long hike to the pool, as nice as it is. I see where alot of people complain about checking out and long lines. Well we actually checked out the night before we were leaving and all we had to do was leave our keys in our room..much easier and quicker. Also be prepared to pay $3.00 a day for safe and $1.25 for every call regardless of making local calls or using a calling card....it all adds up. And whatever you do don't open the bottled water up in your bathroom because it is $4.50 a bottle!!!! I think my next trip I will try another hotel and then have more to compare to.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Stay”
Reviews.Author: goyagirll
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here in June of 2001 and the hotel accomodations were good. I've stayed in the standard room and it was okay. I didn't use the front desk at all so I cannot comment on that feature. But the room service was pretty good, everyday, they would change all the linens and pillows for you. The only problem with the hotel is that it has two sides or wings to the building. In order to go to their gym, you would have to walk from one end of the casino to the other end just for the gym. That would be the only problem but other than that, our stay was good.

Reviews.Title: “One of the worst”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Of the many times I've stayed in Las Vegas I would rate Ballys in the bottom two places. After "upgrading" our room, we found ourselves in a room with dirty carpeting and poor customer service. All I will say is never again will Ballys get any of my money.

Reviews.Title: “lot of fun”
Reviews.Author: justLynne43
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Vegas Labor Day weekend. We got a great deal thru America West Vacations. for 3 nites, 4 days hotel and air it was $380. pp. Flight was direct, Hotel was nice, everything you want on vacation. This is my 2nd stay there and when i go again i will stay there. Can't go wrong at Ballys, great price,location perfect.........

Reviews.Title: “Just 'OK'”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Bally's from 9/30 to 10/3. Checked in at the airport, great convienence. Had to change my room when I arrived as it was just in bad shape (North Tower, not renovated). GOt a better view room in the same tower but the room was pretty gross. THe carpet was badly stained, the room was just "old" and the bed uncomfortable. Half of the time I was sleeping on the matress pad because the sheets just would not fit the bed no matter how I tried to fix it. The location was great, the food good, the cafe I found at Paris was really good. Not sure if I would stay here again unless I was confirmed in a renovated room. Hotel People nice but could not change my room again unless I paid a stiff upgrade which I was not willling to do. FOr a weekend price of $179.00 a night I think I paid enough to get a decent room. If I wanted to pay more I would have stayed at the Paris or Venetian. Good thing my wife was not with me as I know we would have checked out....

Reviews.Title: “Bally's OK with me”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Bally's Sept 16 - 19, came in for the DeLahoya-Hopkins fight and was impressed with the decor of the hotel and its location on the strip is excellent. I stayed in 1100 sq. ft. a one-bedroom parlor suite which was actually 2 rooms with the door open in between but was very nice, our particular room did not have much view but who cares? There were several little general stores directly behind the hotel which were excellent for stocking the room with beer, snacks etc. Never got to go to the buffet it closes at like 11am! Tried the one at Paris and was not impressed at all. Staff was very friendly no problems with check-in...checkout was another story.... The Casino was DEAD I have never been in a Casino that quiet in my life! If you gamble try elsewhere, the Barbary coast was excellent, younger crowd, very lively, excellent bands but not very large. A bit of an ordeal at check-out apparently they were charging the bill from another guest to our bill because the room numbers had gotten mixed up so it took a while to straighten out to the point we missed breakfast before our flight. I read other reviews were they said they try to sneak a charge for the safe on your bill and sure enough there it was! As soon as I questioned it the desk clerk said he would "waive" the fee, funny since we never even touched the safe! All in all Ballys is very nice will stay again because of the location but gamble and eat elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “A New Bally's Fan”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Bally's from Sept. 20th - 23rd. I used the check-in at McCarran International Airport - this is highly recommended as others have mentioned. I had requested a King sized bed, but as I had arrived early (11:00am) they only had a double queen bed available. I had no problem with this. My room was in the South Tower, and as a previous advisor mentioned, you seem to have a choice between the older rooms in the South Tower with better views, or a better/refurbished room in the North Tower with perhaps not-as-nice views.. Opening my drapes I was staring straight at the Eiffel tower of the Paris Hotel, and was also able to see much of the fountain show at the Bellagio. The room itself seemed comparable to one I had stayed in months earlier at Treasure Island - Nothing too fancy but nice enough for me. I had no problems with housekeeping during my stay. Towels were replaced..all that good stuff. Some other thoughts: -The Monorail seems to be in a permanent state of broken. Who sold Vegas this thing, Lyle Lanley? (I'm a Simson's fan) -The lower level where the Sports Book, Pool, Spa are located seems a bit desolate. It doesn't seem like it is part of the hotel.... -The ability to access the Paris hotel is a definate plus. It's lovely and I preferred their casino to Bally's - but it's proximity means that you really have 2 hotels in one. So summing up, I enjoyed my stay at Bally's. The room rate ($79 per night), location, and general amenities make it a place I'll come back to on future trips to Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Rooms - attached to the Paris Hotel!!! ooh lala”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Beautiful rooms! Great place to stay for affordability and convenience to nearby "name" hotels (e.g. Paris, Bellagio, Caesar's Palace). The servers on the gambling floor were not at all attentive. For the gambling experience with ambiance and customer service, visit the other hotels which are a hop and skip away. The buffet is mediocre. For the same $12 meal, I suggest strolling on over to the Paris hotel for brunch buffet. The entrance way is a bit long after a day of hiking the Strip. Making your way to the entrance is a bit like you're being swallowed by Mobi Dick, but then again, thank God for the moving ramps and escalators.

Reviews.Title: “Ballys Was Great”
Reviews.Author: stdonatus
Reviews.Content: My first visit to Las Vegas was from Sept. 19-25. I stayed at Bally's, and I would definitely recommend it to anyone staying in Vegas. The location was great--right across the street from The Bellagio and Caesar's Palace, and directly connected to Paris Las Vegas. I checked in at Bally's check-in desk at the airport, which I would recommend, since it took less than 8 minutes to check in. I reserved my room on line about 4 months ago, and I got a $69 room rate for the first five nights. The room was not renovated, but it was so spacious and in such good shape that I called the front desk to reconfirm my rate. I was on the 10 floor, north tower, which is a non-smoking floor. The floor was very quiet--I hardly heard any noise. One minor complaint--the water pressure in the shower could have been a little better. Hotel staff I encountered were friendly. The Big Kitchen Buffet was pretty good, but I preferred the buffet at Paris. Guests at Ballys can eat at any restaurant at Paris, Caesars or The Flamingo and charge their meals to their hotel bill. I recommend getting the Bally's Connection Card even if you are going to just play the slot machines. I don't think I played that much compared to some people, and I got $49 off my bill and $11 cash back at check out. The Monorail was out of service the entire time I was there (9/19 to 9/25). I used the bus several times to go up and down the strip. Buy a $5.00 pass for 24 hours of unlimited bus rides. The light show on Fremont Street was great. Food prices in downtown Vegas seemed cheaper than on the strip. Rita Rudner puts on a very funny show at NY NY. The Neil Diamond impersonator at the Riviera was very good, but his show lasted barely one hour. La Cage female impersonators show at the Riviera were very funny. All in all, I really enjoyed myself, and would definitely stay at Ballys again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this property from 09/19/04 thru 09/25/04. We arrived at the hotel at around 10:30 PM. Upon arrival the attendant at the check in desk said that they didn't have any rooms available that we had made our reservations for so she automatically upgraded us to a suite at no additional cost for the first night. We were very pleased to hear that. Then we got up that morning and went back down to the check in desk and they said that they had our renovated room ready for us and they offered to help move our belongings to our new room. We declined the offer but we appreciated that they were willing to do that. The renovated room that we moved into was great!!There was all new furniture and it was very spacious. We had a great view of the mountains in the distance. Also, we had rented a car from Dollar Rental at the airport and much to our surprise there was a Dollar Rental right in the parking garage at Bally's so that made our drop-off very quick and easy. The location of Bally's is ideal, right in the middle of the strip. I would highly recommend Bally's to anyone who is looking for a great place to stay in Vegas. My wife and I will be staying there from now on.

Reviews.Title: “If you play cards, Bally's is no big deal”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Bally's for four days, over the 4th of July. When we arrived we were greeted to the sound of a renovating jackhammer that lasted for two days, all day, in the hotel lobby and most of the casino!! We were asked if we wanted to be upgraded to a room facing the Bellagio fountions for an extra $20.00 per night and that sounded great so we jumped on it. Turned out we could only see about 1/8 of the fountains (about like looking out your front window at your lawn sprinkler). Service? None to speak of. Casino staff need a raise to at least put smiles on their faces. They were all very unfriendly and left you with a feeling that you shouldn't be bothering them to even take your money. Cocktail waitresses, good luck in tracking one down, and yes, most of the time you'll be the one walking around looking for them instead of them looking for you. The bright spot was the Big Kitchen Buffet, the best in Vegas!! The location, although set way off the street is still a good one and right in the middle of the strip. Here's one more tip-- when you're booking your stay, not just at Bally's but anywhere in Vegas, book it through the hotel and not an internet travel site. The internet sites will get you a room and airfare but unless you book directly through the hotel don't expect to get the "advertised" freebee's like free shows, 2 for 1 specials, discount coupon books and the rest of what you have read. Check directly with the hotels first to see what they offer. Won't be doing Bally's again, to many other hotels, we just walked through during our stay, had staff that greeted you and treated you like you were one of their long time patrons will get my business.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!!”
Reviews.Author: smellyphant37
Reviews.Content: My 1st time in Vegas, I stayed at Bally's. It was a NICE hotel room. 2 Queen beds ... lots of space and I loved the bathroom. It's HUGE!!! had a GREAT view of the strip too. The people were nice & courteous =) I enjoyed my stay there. I went last year or was it 2 years ago in March or April :)

Reviews.Title: “Bally's is Nice!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Bally's for 3 nights from Thursday, Sept 2nd - Sunday morning, Sept 5th, 2004 This was my very first trip to Las Vegas and didn't know what to expect. In fact, in reading alot of the reviews here on Trip Advisor, I didn't quite know what to expect as far as my stay here at Bally's. First, I made my reservation online on August 6th, 2004, and requested my preference for a non-smoking room with king size bed. Of course in order to book your room, you have to pay for your first night in advance. In my case, it was $70.85 including taxes. My next 2 nights costs about $195.00 each, for a grand total of $495.00 . The reason I am even bringing this up is due to reading some of the other reviews on this site where some have been saying that they got such a great rate to stay here at Ballys, which makes me wonder if I went about making my resrvation the wrong way or should I have waited til almost time for me to leave Detroit before making my reservation? (last minute) Anyway, I arrived at Bally's about 2-1/2 hours early, (check in is 3pm) and even though the line was somewhat long, it moved quicker than one might expect. I would have been able to check in earlier than the official time, but my room wasn't ready, which wasn't a suprise since I did show up earlier than I was supposed to. I didn't want to pay the extra $20.00 per night to stay in a renovated room in the North tower, so I just took the room that was offered, which was located in the South tower. (room #7117 on the 21st floor) The room was on the plain side in terms of appearance, but was a nice size. I was suprised that a hotel of this size and class (rated 4 stars), didn't have a microwave in it. I called down to the front desk to inquire about it and was told by the lady who answered the phone that none of the rooms have microwaves. I later found out that this wasn't the case, the suites have microwaves and a mini fridge in them. I walked over to my window to look out and.....What a view!!! From the window in room 7117, you could see the Paris Hotel,(Bally's sister Hotel) the 1/2 scale replica of the Effiel tower, the large circular pool for Paris Hotel guests, a decent but not complete view of the Bellagio hotel across the street, with a partial view of the Bellagio fountain show. (awesome!) You can also have a very nice view of the strip, and can see Ceasar's Palace and far away in the background, you can see the back drop which is the mountains. Let me tell you, the view from my room and that high up in the south tower is simply awesome!!! For me, this was enough that I didn't care that I wasn't in a renovated room and from the impression I got, it's somewhat of a trade off...........stay in a older room and get a nice view of the strip if you are on a high enough floor, or pay an extra $20.00 per night to stay in a renovated room in the north tower with possibly a less than desireable view. The Big Kitchen Buffet (in Bally's) was nice and the staff was friendly and very attentive and provided very good service. They have a nice selection of different food, so you are bound to find something you have a taste for. Everything was fresh, the restaurant was very clean, so I do recommend eating at the Big Kitchen Buffet. Bally's staff was friendly and was helpful in answering any questions I had. I did utilize Bally's pool which is a nice size. I would advise getting to the pool by around 10am if you want to get a chaise lounge and have a better choice of where you want to set up poolside. You have the option of having drinks brought to you, since the bar is right there in the pool area. From the South tower, you have a nice little walk to get to the other side of the hotel to take the elevators down to the lower level where the shops are set up like that of a strip mall. The walk to the pool area is like a mini site seeing tour. The icecream kiosk wasn't open the whole time I was there at Bally's. (to my disapointment) I also recommend visiting the Indigo Lounge while staying at Ballys. They offer some nice live entertainment which is free! "Cat Daddy's" was good entertainment and great music! I like how Bally's and it's sister Hotel, Paris is connected. I'm not really a gambler, so I couldn't tell you anything about playing the slots or any of the tables. Also, I before comming to Las Vegas, I did as much reading about Bally's and Vegas as I could to help me make the most of my time there. I read about the Monorail having just opened up, but when I arrived in Vegas, it was down and stayed down during my stay in Vegas. The bus cost $2.00 each way to ride the strip, or you can pay $5.00, I believe to get a 24 hour pass to ride the bus. You could also rent a motor scooter from a rental place on the strip by paying a $200.00 deposit, in which your rental fee will be taken out of your deposit when you return the scooter. If you have a CVS Extra care card, bring it because they do have a huge CVS in Vegas on the strip as well as a Denny's restaurant and a Walgreens also located on the strip. I was amazed at the variety of places to eat and great prices. My first night in Vegas, I had a nice sirloin steak dinner with veggies, salad and soft drink for $7.95! While you're there, take the bus down the strip to downtown Las Vegas to Fremont street. There are more casinos at that end of the strip and you can also catch the light show which is awesome! That end of the strip is also where they have the big poker tournament that you may have seen advertised on TV and on the Travel Channel. In closing this review, I would advise not bringing children to Vegas. In my opinion, Vegas is for adults and things that aren't legal in other places is legal here in Vegas and in NV period. If there is any "kid friendly" place in Vegas, I wasn't aware of it. There are plenty of Adult entertainment news stands with free publications on the strip, out in the open for all to see. There are also plenty of people on the strip who's job is to pass out full color business cards of different strippers, escorts, call girls etc...to everyone who passes by and they didn't seem to care that some of the people had children with them. Bally's is a nice Hotel, it just doesn't have a theme like the other hotels. I would recommend Ballys to anyone. In fact, I will stay at Ballys again and will trying to get the same room (7117 in the south tower, 21st floor) because of the awesome view from that high up. Any of the odd number rooms on that floor will assure you of a nice view of the strip on the Las Vegas Blvd side. One other thing I almost forgot to mention is that if you are a Hilton Honors member, Bally's no longer accepts the Hilton Honors membership card, even though they haven't updated the Bally's website to reflect this. Bally's website is still showing across the bottom of the home page that they are still affiliated with Park Place entertainment, which is no longer the case. I would recommend signing up for a Bally's Connection Card, so you can get discounts at certain places affiliated with Bally's and earn comps for gambling and get a 3 percent rebate on your room. Bally's is Great!!! Enjoy your stay!

Reviews.Title: “long time stayer”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Whenever I go to Las Vegas, I always stay here. The rooms are a bit small, but they are definitely affordable. All of the rooms I've stayed in had great views, especially of Bellagio's fountain. What I love most about Bally's is its quiet compared to most other casinos, but it is connected to Paris, so great shops and restaurants are only steps away. It is a great kid's hotel for people not wanting to stay at Circus Circus and Excalibur.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location and price”
Reviews.Author: Shoppadownunder1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here a week ago for 4 nights and were with another couple, we both had rooms in the south tower with views from one room to paris and the eiffel tower and the other room to flamingos and the entrance to the hotel. The location is awesome for getting around as you are right in the middle of the strip, it was unfortunate though that the monorail wasnt working when we arrived and then it worked for one day and broke down again (after we had purchased a $10 all day pass! The pool and monorail entrance is a fairly long walk from the rooms through the casino so for a pit stop make sure you have a look at the magic stand on the way there are some great tricks you can buy to entertain those at home. The room was large with a big bathroom and we couldnt fault it. Would stay here again for the price and location

Reviews.Title: “Loved Bally's”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at Bally's for two nights and then he stayed on for a convention for three nights after that. We both really enjoyed Bally's! You can't beat the location for getting to other fun hotel/casinos in the middle of the strip. We got a room in the North Tower, but it was not one of the newly renovated rooms. It was a little old around the edges, but everything was very clean and nice. It was nice having several mirrors in the room (other than the bathroom) and the room was quite spacious and nice. The staff we dealt with were all very nice and helpful, although we had to call down for extra towels three times before we received them (over a couple hours). They were apologetic and friendly about it and it wasn't a big deal. Gambling at Bally's was a lot of fun. We had some great dealers there and found it to be really entertaining. The pool is nice and actually deep! One of the only ones on the strip, I guess, that goes past 3 1/2 feet deep. Other than that though, there's nothing special about the pool area. It's mostly adults there and unless you get there early, you won't get a lounger. The only other thing I'd say about Bally's, is that it's not really a place to take the kids. I'd go further down the strip to the Excalibur, MGM, or NYNY if you are bringing your kids. There aren't any "extras" for the kids there and you don't see too many there.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay at Ballys”
Reviews.Author: randyad
Reviews.Content: We went to Las Vegas to attend an apparel show. Ballys was the hotel we chose for the stay. We checked in at the Airport which went very smooth and paid $20.00 for an upgrade. When we got to our room it was excellent. Everything was new. We had two queen sized beds, an oversized chair, a desk with a marble top and a silver base, and the bathroom had marble floors and walls. Even walking through the hallways was a pleasant experience. We were told that the hotel was being renovated and that all the rooms were completed except the 5th, 6th, and 7th floors. TIP:If you want a fantastic room, stay on the 8th floor or higher. That way you won't need the upgrade. (We didn't have this information before we checked in). The slots were extremely tight and not much for winning but the entertainment was spectacular. When going be sure to see "Jubilee" at bally's. It's one of the best I've seen. (believe me I've seen plenty.) Also if you don't have much of a budget, go to the lounge near the elevators and catch the Free entertainment. It starts at 7:00 pm and runs thru 3:00 am. The acts I recommend are "Class 1" and "Cat Daddys". Even though they are free they would be well worth paying for. Oh I almost forgot, make sure you check your bill. I used the guest services option on the television and found a charge for telephone usage. I notified the front desk and they agreed to remove it, but when I checked again before using express checkout it was still on the bill. I called back and got another person who finally removed the charge. I don't know if this is a common practice but I noticed a young lady complaining about the same charge on her bill. JUST BE WARE! My overall stay was great and yes I would recommend this hotel to anyone that is coming to Vegas. Oh, by the way I finally won $300.00 when leaving to catch my shuttle for the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Nice DEEP pool...”
Reviews.Author: Drake
Reviews.Content: In a town awash in 4-foot-deep "wading" pools, it was a pleasant surprise to find that Bally's pool has a large, roped-off section that is 10-12 ft. deep and a good 25 meters long. And hold on to your hats; you can actually dive in headfirst. Imagine that! It was a great place to float about, because most guests stayed on the "wading" side of the rope (especially on the weekend when everyone was nursing a drink). Pool scene was mostly adults, too, which was great. Only a small smattering of children to trip over. I spent five nights at Bally's beginning 8/18, and was totally satisfied. The rates were great and the room was perfectly fine (it was in the newer North Tower, which I'd guess houses about 80% of Bally's rooms). The place is kept up well, so it feels adequately upscale even though it lacks the glitz and glitter of some of the newer properties. The casino floor was always crowded so I didn't really play much there. If you like hopping from one casino to the next, Bally's has about the best location on the strip. Walk out the front door and there's Barbary Coast, Flamingo, O'Sheas, Harrah's and Casino Royal lined up in a row where you walk out one casino and right into the next. Total Vegas immersion. The inside walkway to Paris was convenient, and I'd recommend eating at Paris' buffet and cafe if you want to upgrade your cuisine without having to shell out big bucks in any of the premier Bally's/Paris restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed 8/22-24. Airport check in booth was convenient. Had to wait until3 to get into the room. Overlooked the Eifeel tower. Had a feeling the room had not been one of the newer ones. It was a big room. Had dinner at the Kitchen buffet. Was very good and everyone was friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: kaboo22
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 night stay at Bally's and it was great. We did the airport check-in which I highly recommend (there was no one in line, but at the hotel the line was probably 20 people). Once we got to the hotel, I was surprised at the size of the room. We did not get a renovated room (they wanted $25 extra and I was just sleeping there) but the room we received was very clean and not bad at all. We had a king bed and plenty of room for moving around. We spent the mornings at the pool (from about 9 to noon) and it wasn't crowded at all. Around 11 or noon, more people started to show up and it got crowded. I'd recommend going early. We ate at the buffet in the hotel the first day and it was very good. Great variety and I liked the set up. We also ate the Aladdin buffet and for the price, I'd stick to Bally’s. The Aladdin was packed and we waited in line for 45 minutes. It was so spread out, you had to walk a mile to get to the other side for different foods. We gambled only at Bally's but the tables were always packed. Waitresses came around for drink orders promptly except for one time during the day. For those wanting to get their drink on, try the Tequila Bar during happy hour (4-6). Their specials are margaritas for 3.50 or a beer and a shot of tequila for 3.50. I can't even get a shot in my small town for that much! Sign up for the Comp card...it's easy to get 10 points for a free shirt (if you get 20 points, you get 2 shirts and so on). All in all, a great trip and a great casino. The location is prime and the monorail stop makes going down the strip easy as pie!

Reviews.Title: “Great location for an average hotel”
Reviews.Author: graveljack
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Bally's in part because the wedding party and our friends were all staying there. Someone decided it would be easier to round everone up if we all stayed at the same place. Our first impression of Bally's was one of total chaos. Upon our arrival four disinterested desk persons were checking in approx. 150+ people. It took us the better part of one hour to get checked in and we were in the forward third of the line. Once we got our room things took a turn for the better. The double room we got was large, clean and afforded a partial view of the strip. It was rather drab but you don't spend that much time in it anyway. The bathroom is an all in one type with vanity, toilet and tub in one room. This is inconvienent when both of you want to use a different facility at the same time. Towels were at as premium so don't drop them on the floor if you wish to shower morning and evening. And believe me you will if you go in August, the average temp was 110 during the day and never dropped below 94, even at 2 in the morning. There is no coffee maker in the room but we found the beds to be comfortable on the firm side. We ate at the buffet and found the main fare average. Deserts were delicious. If you want coffee get to the coffee bar early in the morning as a line forms fast. Apparently we weren't the only ones who wanted coffee in the morning. We did find the walkway to the Paris and located many small shops and food establishments which served everything from sandwhiches to expensive dinner. As a matter of fact, once we found the Paris was connected and next door we spent most of the next two days there instead of Bally's. The casino at Bally's is best described as average. Nothing spectacular and nothing other than table games shrouded in smoke. Tried a few of the machines but after dropping my limited limit without so much as a single cherry payout I migrated next door to the Paris where the machinery seemed much more user friendly. The one thing about Bally's that can't be beat is the location. You will be directly across from the Ballagio and kitty corner to Ceasars. Almost centrally located in the middle of the strip. With the addition of overpasses on the intersection there is no traffic to hassle. The bus, the best value in town is a short walk away. Buy the all day pass as the bus runs every 15 to 20 minutes and you save a fortune on cabs. Remember if you go in the middle of July or August the temp. will be a killer and you just can't walk any distance in comfort. We found when the 110 degree wind blew it was even difficult to breath. And the wind does blow. In summary, Bally's is a bargain if your looking for a basic, tired rather dated property in a central location. The price will probably justify the lack of frills and nicities that one would find in a more expensive hotel. I think, and this is just my opinion, I would look around for specials and will stay in a hotel that offers more variety in food service and surroundings.

Reviews.Title: “Not a very friendly atmosphere. DO NOT STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It was horrible. the construction at the front of the building does your head in, people watch you in an unpleasant way as you walk innocently through the casino to get to your room in the elevators which are extremely hard to find without asking a member of staff. When we asked where the entrance was when the construction on the front was being done, the member of staff just pointed his thumb behind him without even looking at us. The only good thing about this hotel is the feeling of leaving it on your way to the airport. I only stayed for two nights. Thank god.

Reviews.Title: “Bally's is the Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I went on our first trip to Las Vegas on June 20th and stayed for six nights. We weren't sure what to expect, after reading the wide variety of reviews, but we were hoping for the best. - the price was right, anyway (we got a great deal through our travel agent)! We were not disappointed! We arrived well before the stated check in time of 3pm, and so we checked our bags with them. The man who checked our bags was professional, friendly, and courteous, and we were assisted immediately upon arrival. We spent some time getting oriented to the hotel/casino before we checked in. The casino is spacious and clean, and I was surprised at how non-smoky it was, despite the fact that everyone was smoking. When we decided to try to check in a little early at 2pm (the official check in time is 3pm), there was no problem whatsoever. There was literally NO line; the room was available early for us, and we were even upgraded for free to a larger room that included a refrigerator at no extra charge. The woman who assisted us was friendly, cheerful, and knowledgeable. The room was VERY spacious and spotlessly clean. It didn't look new, but it wasn't worn down at all. The bedspread had a tiny hole in it - that's all I can find to complain about, haha. It was a non-smoking room, and there was no odor at all - the entire floor was non-smoking. Everything in the room was in working order, aside from the in-room fridge, which we had been warned about at the front desk. As promised, a working fridge was delivered to us within ten minutes. The bathroom was clean, and the water pressure and temperature were fantastic. Even the toiletries they provided were nicer than average, and they were refreshed every day. Our bags were brought to us immediately after we requested them, and the man who brought them was friendly and shared recoomendations with us for shows to see and things to do while we were there (shows OUTSIDE of Bally's), and housekeeping was extremely quick and friendly in accomodating our request for extra pillows. Later in our stay, they provided us with extra towels for our trip to Wet N Wild without blinking an eye. Our room was cleaned every day, earlier than we expected. The dining at Bally's was great. The buffet was very crowded in the evening, as is to be expected, but we ate breakfast there every day but the first. Great price (especially with the 10% discount you get from using their Comp card) and terrific food, with lots of variety - you can get dinner at breakfast time, for those who haven't been to bed yet. Breakfast buffet was not crowded at all if we got there early, and the staff was VERY friendly and accomodating. As it gets busier, they get more hurried and kind of rush you along, so the earlier the better. One night, the couple in the room next to ours was having a very loud argument, and we ended up calling down to security. Security promptly dealt with the situation, and they were very friendly and understanding when I called. The television went on the fritz one day, and when I called down to maintenance, they told me that they were aware of the problem and were working on it. They called back about 45 minutes later to check if it was working, and they were friendly, as well. We used express check-out, which was great and hassle-free, and we checked our bags again, as we had a late flight. We were attended to promptly when we reclaimed our bags, and we were assisted in finding airport transportation by Bally's staff. We had an extremely satisfying experience, and I would be completely comfortable recommending Bally's Las Vegas to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Overall Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights at Bally's, had nearly zero complaints. Checked in at the airport (highly recommended) and ended up with a mini-suite with a great view (no fridge though). Room was huge, bed was huge, loveseat was huge. Room was spotless every morning and marble bathroom was a nice touch. Biggest key, great center strip location. Ate at Sidewalk? Cafe in Bally's, average, go next door to Cafe St. Louis at Paris, food was awesome and well priced. Good entertainment and casino was full and had a good vibe though blackjack dealers were not the happiest of humans in Las Vegas. Next time in Vegas will be back at Bally's.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, but definitely showing its age.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a bachelor party from Aug 13-16. We did the "Guy's Getaway Package" which was a phenomenal value. $795 per night (2 night minimum) got us a 1,600 square foot suite which had it's own jacuzzi, 3 TV's, 2 toilets with 4 sinks, an in-room bar, 1 king bed, 1 shower, 4 sofas and a chaise lounge. The package also included $250 towards dinner at the Bally's Steakhouse, $100 towards a bar tab at any Bally's lounge, $100 in match play at the casino, 1 bottle of Jack Daniels, 1 bottle of Ketel One Vodka, sandwiches upon check-in, and free use of a 6-passenger limo for 2 hours. We were able to accomodate 10 guys in the room, even though I'm sure we were technically not allowed to. This is probably the best deal of its kind in Las Vegas (on the Strip, at least). When I was shopping around, the closest deal was at the Palms, but they wanted $2,000 per night. The suite itself was in very good condition, but the hotel overall has a very aged feel about it. The crowd that was staying there seemed older than most (also lots of families) and you won't find the attractive crowd that you would find at the newer hotels on the strip. We walked over to the Bellagio and were amazed at how many more beautiful women were there. Bally's seemed to attract a much more "working-class" crowd. The lobby had a very gawdy 1970's look to it and the hallways leading to the rooms were very dark. The casino was smaller than average, but had lower minimum bets that the others. On the plus side: the service was very good. We were amazed at how quickly people arrived at our door when we called. The Steakhouse was also a really big hit with the guys. The experience was very similar to what you would find at Smith & Wollensky, but I would say that the steak at Bally's was actually a little better. Don't order any side dishes though, they are overpriced and the portion sizes of the side dishes are tiny. Despite it's shortcomings in appearance, it's in a great location (connected to the Paris hotel and a short walk to the Bellagio) and we found the service to be better than at the larger hotels where every guest is just an anonymous face. This hotel may be old and ugly, but they make up for it in other ways.

Reviews.Title: “great stay! WORTH IT!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked a room here from a thursday-sunday. It was great! We were here for a family member's wedding at the Paris.We checked in at the airport (i highly recommend) and we were in luck getting a Half suite in the non-smoking building. It was nice! and roomy even had a fridge and a nice view of the strip! All of our other family members stayed at Paris hotel....but, they all loved our room better! Better price! Better Room! Better VIEW! Best of all easy access to the monarail!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned home from a 3 day visit to Las Vegas. I highly recommend Bally's. Their airport check-in saved us alot of time and enabled us to go straight to our room once arriving at the hotel. Their comps are reasonable...and we loved the free t-shirts we earned. The staff was helpful and friendly. We called for extra towels and blankets and they were brought to us within 10 minutes both times.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic vacation @ Bally's!”
Reviews.Author: kjbaby
Reviews.Content: Just got back from VEGAS. Stayed at Bally's July25-July28. Just got home today July 29 because of United airline trouble.(that's an entirely different subject though.) Bally's was awesome!! We checked in at the airport with no lines, our room was ready at 11:00 a.m. when we arrived. (Definetly do airport check-in. The lines were very long at hotel.) Our room was in N. Tower 9th floor, it was just an average hotel room, nothing spectacular, but it did the job. Who sleeps in vegas anyways? The rooms were very large we had 2 queen beds. The bathroom was large and very clean. (Excellent water pressure.) Make sure to get there comp card I earned $72 in comps and $10 cash back with very little effort and small time gambling. Which is also something good about bally's, the casino was very friendly bright, NOT overwhelming like other casinos, and easy to navigate and be comfortable. The big kitchen buffet was ok we ate there 3 times mainly for the convenience. The pool doesn't have lots of bells and whistles but it's nice clean and again comfortable. WEAR SUNSCREEN! We have already decided that our next trip to Vegas (hopefully december) will absolutely be at Bally's. We really enjoyed ourselves there. Excellent service not snooty!! Have fun if you go. (Just don't fly UNITED!!)

Reviews.Title: “Recent stay at Bally's”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 5 days at Bally's Casino. The check-in at the airport was a great convenience and we got our room assigned and received our keys in no time. The room assigned to us was not one of the new renovated ones, but it was above average. It was on the 23rd floor with a nice view of the Bellagio water show. The room was not far from the elevator, but not close enough to be noisy. There was an odor in the room (smoking room) and fingerprints on the window pane. One call to housekeeping and the room was sprayed and the window cleaned in no time. The bedspread was somewhat old and in need of cleaning. The housekeeping staff were very efficient in cleaning the room and very helpful when I asked for extra towels. All in all the room was more than satisfactory. There was a problem with the room service food. Some of my food arrived at the room amost cold and an item was left off the breakfast. I complained to room service and suggested they make a 2 or 3 dollar adjustment. To my amazement, room service personnel dispatched someone to retrieve the food which I had complained about. He said an adjustment could not be made without the food being returned. Absolutely amazing. Imagine someone being sent to retrieve a waffle !!!! Since I had started to eat with my wife, there was no waffe exchange and no adjustment made. Imagine: a person employed just to retrieve a waffle !!!. Very, very poor treatment for anyone, much less someone staying there for 5 days. A possible loss of 35 cents or maybe up to one dollar for a supposedly 4 star casino. Very funny in a way when you explain to your children that you work as a waffle retriever. Mostly the visit was pleasant, including the pool, the spa, the ease of getting around the casino and the location of the casino on the strip. Check-out was great and the line was not that long. BEWARE THE ROOM SERVICE. BEWARE THE WAFFLE RETRIEVER.

Reviews.Title: “Bally's was great!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: rudyjane
Reviews.Content: A friend and I just returned from a 3 night stay at Bally's, had gotten a $69/night room from hotels, and it was great! The check in at the airport was quick, asked for the North Tower, got it, The room was clean and quiet, the casino was not too crowded and the slots were friendly...we ate at Tequila's the first night there (I highly recommend the layered nachos!), saw Jubilee, staff was friendly...the only glitch was when we checked out, no one was available to print out my comp voucher to use toward my bill. The Card Connection office doesn't open up until 7 a.m., so if you have an early flight or shuttle, you better get your voucher the night before! I waited until a manager could be found to print it off, so I was able to use my comp dollars toward the room. I would definitely stay at Bally's again, the people mover and escalators right to the lobby are life savers after you have walked all day long!

Reviews.Title: “Never stay here!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: No problem booking room or getting great rate but . . . . #1 Check-in was a long and tedious process #2 Every employee will give you awful directions to the room elevators which are well hidden for the south tower #3 The hotel checked in our luggage and LOST IT FOR FOUR DAYS! #4 No comps were given except for a non-alchohol dinner at their crappy buffet. We will never stay in that hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Non-Accomodating for NON-SMOKERS”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you have allergies and request a NON-SMOKING room rest a assure that Bally's could careless about your request. I requested a NONSMOKING room and told that I could not be accomodated. The only way I could be accomodated was to pay a higher price than I had been quoted. Something that I was not told at the time of booking. What a disappointment. Other than that, it's great to be in the center of the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just came back from LV and loved it!. My husband and I stayed at Bally's at the corner of The Strip and Flamingo Rd. Our room was big with a view to part of the strip but facing Flamingo Rd. We had only one complaint and that is the many ambulance and firefighters sirens all the time!. We ate at the Big Kitchen Buffet and it was good, you get a 10% discount with your playing card. We rented a car for 2 of our 5 day stay and went to The Grand Canyon (Payed 35 Dlls per day with an Enterprise car rental instead of the 150 Dlls per person for the Bus Tour to the same destinations!). It's a long drive (5 hrs) to the south rim but it's well worted it. We stoped at the Hoover Dam on the way there and took a detour to scenic route 66 for about 1 hour of the trip. The first day there we bought an all day Bus Pass for 5 Dlls. and the second day we bought a 5 Dlls all day pass to the Monorail that runs from the Sahara hotel to the MGM hotel. I recomed the Bus pass because the Monorail doesn't take you downtown and it doesn't run ON the strip but on Paradise Rd (one block east). The bus 301 stops at every station (takes about 1 hour) and the 302 it's the express one and stops at only a few hotels from downtown to the last hotel on the stip (Luxor).

Reviews.Title: “Indigo Room with Cat Daddy”
Reviews.Author: Kim W
Reviews.Content: Met family at Bally's for nephew's wedding elsewhere in Vegas. Spent four great nights at Bally's. Stayed up very early Saturday/Sunday to listen and dance to Cat Daddy! The greatest group I've had the pleasure of listening to in quite some time. They can play any motown song you can think of! Also play Santana! The slots in the casino cost us all two weeks wages. Like they say when you are getting off the plane, 'welcome to lost wages!' Oh well, had a wonderful time. The staff at Bally's were great! Met a lot of wonderful people in Vegas! Thank you Jeff for an awesome night!!!

Reviews.Title: “Stayed at Bally's for a change.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Bally's in June 2004 as a change from our usual places. Liked the room...lots of towels, shampoo, etc., comfortable bed, clean. Room service was fine, although more $ than the Golden Nugget. Pool area was lovely, even tho' a bit of a trek from the room. The monorail was not operating at the time (except in test mode)...but that will be VERY convenient as it runs right by the pool area. Didn't do much slot gambling at Bally's as I couldn't seem to win....but that may just be Vegas Baby! Liked the central location to the main attractions on the strip...because boy those are LONG blocks in Vegas. Still liked my previous stays at the Hilton, Rio, Golden Nugget, Hilton Condos better than Bally's--but if I got a good deal would stay at Bally's again.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: ClaireR
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 night stay at Bally's Las Vegas. We spent our first night down in Fremont Street and were keen to see the difference between it and the strip. The taxi up was not cheap so be warned. Including tip it cost us $16 for 3mile journey!!! I've a feeling we may have been ripped off but these things happen unfortunately. On arrival at the hotel we were greeted with a huge Q at check-in but it was Sunday which, from working in the travel industry, I know is a busy day so we were not too shocked. However, the line moved quickley and in no time at all we were checked in and on our way to our room. I had asked for a renovated room in the North tower when I made my reservation and was somewhat disappointed not to get either request but after speaking to reception we got moved to a junior suite free of charge. The standard rooms are very dated and somewhat shabby so if you get the offer of upgrading you room I would def recomend taking it. I believe it only costs an extra $20 a night, certainly worthwhile. Bally's has a great location on the strip. Across the road from the Bellagio, next door to Paris and the rest of the major hotels are only a short stroll away. The food at the hotel represents good value and we tended to rotate where we ate between Bally's and the Paris which is connected by a walkway. The pool area is not the largest but perfectly adequate and we never had any problems finding a sunbed to lie on. We aren't big gamblers but did spend some time playing the slots and although we didn't win big, we did win and came away more than pleased with ourselves. It's a great hotel and I'd recommend it to anyone

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading all the negative remarks we was apprehensive about making reservation at Bally's but it was all in vain. The room was clean and a nice size. The staff was very helpful and nice. Our 37th wedding annnivesary will have a lasting memory for us.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay!”
Reviews.Author: alionka
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Bally's July 6th-9th for our anniversary. Staff was very nice, while at check-in we upgraded to a renovated room with view of Bellagio fountains, which was worth it. Room was good size, liked the sitting area and marble bathroom. Recommend the Big Kitchen Buffet, great selection! Pool area wasn't as nice as at some other hotels, but okay nevertheless. Have to admit that for entertainment and dinning we spent most of our time at Paris, Bally's sister hotel. They are connected by a wallway. Would stay at Bally's again considering that the price was right and the central LOCATION couldn't be beat!

Reviews.Title: “Stay at Bally's!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights at Bally's the end of June. This was my second trip in the past year and a half. Excellent room which was large and very clean. Everything worked. Staff was very frendly and helpful. Will most certainly stay at Bally's again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: meg26nh
Reviews.Content: VACA 7/10/04 - 7/15/04 Wonderful ! Check in at the airport. NO LINES! Tip the guy 20 bucks get in north tower! We got belligio view renovated room, clean! LARGE room, NICE bathroom. GREAT casino, we won and lost but atleast we won! Big Kitchen Buffet was very good!!! NOSH has the best sandwiches A MUST!! Sidewalk cafe was ok nuttin special. We got way better comps at ballys compared to the mirage. LOCATION LOCATION LOCATION!!! we walked to the venietien no problem, we walked to mgm no problem. The pool was great. 2nd time in vegas and we loved it at bally's. We stayed at mirage last year it was nice but couldn't win to save our lives! kinda snobby ,lousy comps but nice pool. Just give bally's a try. DAMN, monorail started the day we left bet that woulda been easier. Trollys always a fun ride tho LMAO !!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the room at Bally's”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Bally's was WONDERFUL! Beautiful spacious rooms, great service, good food, reasonable prices in the restaurants, friendly helpful staff. This was our first visit to Bally's, formerly stayed at Flamingo. Much nicer at Bally's.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience at Bally's”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Bally's for the second time for a long July 4th weekend. I checked in at the airport and didn't have to wait in any lines. I was given the option of the South Tower with a strip view; however, I asked for a renovated room and received a room in the North Tower. The room looked just like the room pictured on the Bally's website. The room was supposed to be smoking, but I could not tell that anyone had ever smoked in there and I am allergic to tobacco. The view was not great, but more importantly, the room was extremely quiet. I had stayed in the North Tower before in a room facing the side street, and while the room was great, sirens woke me up several times in the night. I can't complain about anything at Bally's; however, one minor issue was that I never had more than a tepid shower during the entire stay regardless of what time I took the shower. I suspect that the fault may be mine, but I didn't have the problem the first time. One other note is that there is construction to the casino entrance near the South Tower. Regarding the slots at Bally's, I never won anything at all in the slot machines, but my companion won $1,000 within five minutes at Bally's.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value/Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed at BALLY'S seven times over the last twelve years and we have never been disapointed omce! We get mailers from them all the time offering discounted room rates, ranging from $39 to $59 per night. We are treated very nicely by everyone at the hotel, casino and resturants. We are not big gamblers: as a matter of fact, we spend very little gambling, but we keep getting the special offers, so why should we change hotels? The location is great; within walking distance of all the new properties. It's right accross the boulevard from the BELLAGIO with their fantastic water show!! What an attraction that is!!! I would highly recommend BALLYS to anyone. PS.....The only people you see in the casino are BALLYS hotel guests....No gawking, site seeing people in the place as in other high end hotel/casinos.

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable 6 nights”
Reviews.Author: BoogSeaford_NewYork
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a relaxing six night stay at Ballys. The updated rooms are spacious, clean, fresh and very comfortable. The valet parking, the cleaning staff, the dealers and the front desk staff were all friendly and attentive. Ballys terrific location and bargain rates make it a sure thing for anyone wishing to stay center strip. Although the front entrance is being renovated, the valet parking is convenient. The parking garage is a longer but comfortable walk via the connecting shops of the Paris Hotel. We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “A Tad Bit Shabby”
Reviews.Author: Maura1007
Reviews.Content: Just returned from LV on 6/27/04 and all I can say is that there was nothing TERRIBLY wrong with Bally's. The location was great, reasonably priced, and I guess it was pretty clean, but if you're looking for luxury, keep stepping. I checked in at the airport which was a great convenience, but was told the south tower was full so I got stuck with an old room. Yes the room was huge but it was practically empty. Nothing special or nice about it whatsoever. Stayed at the Aladdin last December, Bally's can't compare. So if you're looking for a simple place to stay, in the middle of the strip, Bally's is your place. I'd consider staying again for the location and the price.

Reviews.Title: “Good price and nice size”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I went to Vegas with 2 friends and we all shared a room at Harrah's the first two nights! The hotel was just ok. Rooms were very small. The next two nights we went to Bally's. Thumbs up! We had seperate rooms but these were so large, it should have been our first two nights. They were spacious, quiet and kept up well. I will stay here again any time. I always try new places each time I come and so far Bally's has got my vote over the others.

Reviews.Title: “Bally's Won Me Over”
Reviews.Author: SanCarlosGuy
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a very pleasant and very reasonably priced four day stay at Ballys. The room was on the 24th floor (a non-smoking floor) in the north tower facing east. The room was very nice and quiet and the king size bed was perfect. The hotel was smack dab in the middle of the Strip with an easy walkway thru to Paris. I found the food at both hotels quite good. The check in at the airport worked perfectly and the express check out was a snap! (I recommend using Ballys website to make a reservation as they honored all of my special requests). A very nice experience at a moderatly priced and well run hotel. I'll return when the weather cools down.

Reviews.Title: “Hated Bally Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked my room via Hotel which had listed Bally as a 4-star hotel. When I arrived, they aggressively attempted to upgrade me at my expense to a smokers room. I refused and ended up in a non-smoking room (which I requested) next to the elevators that had not not yet been renovated. The room was missing some furniture, desk, lounge chair and tv cabinet. The tv that was in the room was placed on a coffee table. It was awful. I requested a room change and was told I would not be able to get a new room until the next day so I was stuck. Also, the food was terrible. The only favorable thing I could say was that the renovated room was better but I would never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “another nice stay at Bally's”
Reviews.Author: 15mwaltrip
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a 3-night stay at Bally's (June 16-19). I personally have stayed at Bally's every time I've been to Vegas, once or twice a year since 1997. This time I left my husband with the kids and went with the girls. We checked in at the airport. This was my first time using airport check in. I was given a room in North Tower (per my request). I also asked if they had any upgraded rooms. The mini suites all have king size beds, which would not work for 3 people. We were told we had a larger room. The room was the same as every other room I have stayed in (with the exception of the mini suite, which I stayed in on my first trip there). I was extremely disappointed to walk into a room that was dirty, with towels and garbage everywhere, especially since I had told the girls how great Bally's was. We were moved to a clean room on the same floor. They informed me they have been having computer problems and the room was "clean" in their system. Our new room was spotless. I think they could have comped us a meal or something due to the inconvenience (I even asked), but nothing was offered. We stayed on the 15th floor. The view was not great but I spend very little time in the room. We wanted the North tower due to the location in relationship to the pool. Our room looked relatively new, however, as stated above, I've been going there since 1997 and never had an issue with the quality of the room. The only suggestion I have is to put the sink and mirror outside of the bathroom so we could get ready quicker. I can't comment much on the restaurants at Bally's. The only places we ate on the property were the pool and the buffet in Paris. The buffet was the best I've ever had. My husband and I normally go to just one buffet during our trips to Vegas. We've been to Treasure Island, Rio, Bally's (two or 3 times) and the Paris Buffet is superior in quality, value, etc. We went at 3:30 and it was still considered lunchtime. We could not imagine what else they could have at dinner. The location of Bally's makes it the best value on the strip. You are directly across the street from Bellagio. The pool area is very nice and clean. In the casino, drinks are served in glasses, bottles, etc. No cheap plastic cups. They have a good selection of drinks. Waitresses are always coming by. As far as the slots, they were relatively loose. I came home with some of the money I took (which to me is a win). Our check out was flawless. I had enough comp $$$ to almost pay for one night. I am not a high roller; I play 25-cent slots and 3-card poker!!! I used my connection card each time I played at Bally's, Paris, Caesars and Flamingo. I always receive great rates and promotions from Bally's and Paris. We are already planning another girl trip for next year. I would have given this review a 5 (excellent) had it not been for the problem with the room during check in.

Reviews.Title: “Wish I was still there!”
Reviews.Author: vsikes
Reviews.Content: We just got back (17Jun04) from a few days at Ballys, and our trip was very enjoyable. We travel a lot, so I feel we have a lot of experience with hotels, etc. We booked with Southwest Vacations, checked in at the airport (recommended) and played the slots at Ballys, and all over the Strip. The rooms at Ballys were great - spacious. The staff I came in contact with were very helpful and courteous. I would stay here again because of its central location on the Strip. It's right in the middle of everything. I only ate one meal at Ballys because I was out touring the Strip most of the time, but the sandwich I had was good! I had moderate luck at their slots, but better than at the Palms or the Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Poor/Indignant Service at checkin”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Similar to another bad review, the check in person at Ballys was indignant. I wasn't poliktely told check in was at three I was told "Don't even think of coming back to check on your room until after 3 pm at least". I just happend to be standing next to others who were, chcking in. When I asked about the $400 per person promotional offer (deciding facter in choosing) Ballys in first place) and was told 'Oh, we decided to cancel that, were allowed to do that any time we want'. South Tower is a nightmare that is happening now.
