Dirty hallways not vacuumed in weeks, stale rooms with outdated coverings, drapes etc. I would recommend if you must stay at Ballys do not stay in this tower ever. Yell scream have fit whatever, but insist on the North Tower (New). Restuarants seemed limited and are all in one small corner of the casino something like door number 1, 2 3,. Pick one and walk in. Location is excellant. Pool area is ok. Not large or small. just average.

Reviews.Title: “Will do it again next tear”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I made my first trip to Las Vegas for this memorial day 2004 and stayed at Bally's I could'nt have been more pleased. The central location of the hotel made it easy for me to see as many sites as possible all within a short walking distance. The service at Bally's was great, and i am already making plans to do it all again need year at Bally's.

Reviews.Title: “Bait and Switch”
Reviews.Author: saunderspl
Reviews.Content: I came with too high an expectation, I'll admit that. But getting there and being told there were no non-smoking rooms in my reservation price range (after having paid for one night in advance) really irritated me. I have asthma and told the front desk staff so. If I were put into a non-smoking room I wouldn't do well at all. If they didn't believe me I could have provided them evidence - but instead they quizzed me on the symptoms of asthma. I asked two times if there were ANY rooms (in the next price ranges) in the hotel that were non-smoking and it wasn't until my travel companions started working with their check-in that there was mentioned that the suites were available... but only if I paid extra. I was told my reservation for a non-smoking room was only a request and that they had no requirement to meet it. I won't be staying here - or at any Caesar Corporation property again... I found out that my other coworkers were at a different Caesar hotel and got the SAME treatment.

Reviews.Title: “Had a good time at Bally's”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Got back yesterday from Vegas. Stayed at Bally's. Had a great time. We stayed in the North Tower, after reading all the reviews. I was disappointed that our room was in need of redecorating. I had asked for a renovated room. Oh well-it was clean and sufficient, and was larger than the room we stayed in at the Flamingo over Christmas. Restaurants were very good and pool was nice. We only paid 55.00 dollars a night, so couldn't complain about that! I like to try different hotels, and would probably like something a little more newer.

Reviews.Title: “I recommend asking for a room with view of Bellagio Fountain”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Bally's for 1 night on May 2nd (then moved to the Flamingo for 4 nights). Excellent rate for a Sunday night. Spacious room on 16th floor. Furniture was old and air conditioner was noisy. Not for you if you seek luxury but how much time do you spend in your room in Vegas? Asked for a room with a view of the Bellagio fountain. Had to wait an hour but it was worth it. Window opened about 6" so we could listen to the music. Also had nice view of Eiffel Tower (Paris).

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value”
Reviews.Author: doc4cn
Reviews.Content: Great location in the heart of the strip. Rooms are good, not great, but certainly adequate and clean.Nice pool and health club. Casino is small but friendly. Great access to Paris for larger more plush casino, health club and nightlife. Have stayed here 6 times and will again in Oct. Better value and nicer than Monte Carlo, NYNY, Flamingo.If you want more glitz try Paris, Caesars or Bellagio.

Reviews.Title: “Great price, great location!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was a little nervous to stay at Bally's given some of the reviews, but we couldn't have been more pleased. We had a group of nine- my husband, my parents, in-laws, and our three siblings, and had three rooms on the 68th floor (really the 18th floor, I don't understand that one) of the South Tower. This is the unrenovated tower. I asked to be upgraded but it was $20 more per night per room. After seeing our rooms, we knew that wasn't necessary (though the north tower rooms did look beautiful in the photos.) The room and furnishings are obviously old. The wood is very dark and old-looking, the bedspread was an older style and definitely had some wear and tear, but the room was clean and it was HUGE! The best part of Bally's is the location. You are connected to the Paris hotel, a skywalk away from the Bellagio, and a skywalk away from the Barbary Coast (cheap fun gambling there, including 5 cent video blackjack!) The other great thing about Bally's is the ease of getting around. Some of the strip hotels are gigantic and could take a 1/2 hour just to get outside the hotel to the strip. I think Bally's was the perfect size. It was about a $12 cab fare from the airport. The buffet was ok, the Bellagio buffet was much better for only $6 more. The "Nosh" cafe was very good, and there is a Sbarro in the lower level for a snack. The other restaurants looked great though we didn't try them. We ate at the Paris's Le Cafe and Mon Ami Gabi (very good) and could charge everything to our room at Bally's. We all agreed we would definitely stay there again! Last time we stayed at the Paris, it cost twice as much and the room was 1/2 the size. Bally's was a much better option.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised...”
Reviews.Author: ashleyE
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Bally's with 2 girlfriends during March Madness, 2004. Since we booked last minute, my favorite hotels were either full or outrageously expensive. We arrived with low expectations. We were convinced hotel check-in would be a nightmare after waiting nearly 2 hours for a taxi. We considered taking a limo, but those were booked too! Amazingly, check in was a breeze and we were upgraded, no cost, to one of the remodeled rooms. I heard this upgrade is $20 a night and after seeing the room, would have paid it without hesitation. The room was large, clean and very comfortable. Our set of elevators were closer to the casino which is always a perk. The staff members were friendly and accomodating, for the most part. I did have a few complaints. After being at a craps table for hours at $10 minimum, they raised it to $15 at 4:00 a.m. Strange time to increase bets. Usually when a bet is increased, they grandfather you in. Not this time. I eventually realized they wanted to close the table and hoped to force us out by raising the minimum. Nice. Also the pool, although not very crowded, was a disappointment. Pool time is a highlight for me while in vegas. Only 1 bar, no cocktailers (this may change in summer months, we were lucky enough to enjoy 90 degree heat in March), and overall unimpressive when compared to some of the flashier pools. For all you coffee snobs out there, the only coffee stand I found was barely adequate... but I survived. :) But all that said, I was pleasantly surprised with Bally's. The location was great, price was right and it fulfilled our needs. I have stayed at the mgm, flamingo, aladdin, and mandalay bay and would definitely consider Bally's again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Bally's”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It was our 1st trip to LV. My husbend and I went for our 13th Anny.We loved everything about it except we didnt have enough time to do all that we wanted. Came in town on a friday and left monday morning. We will be back!!!! We stayed at Bally's perfect location mid strip and had wonderful service and great food. Everyone was very friendly and helpful. We gambled a little and Hotel lobby hopped and shopped it was a wonderful time. We saw the show Jubilee! It was wonderful altough my husbend was a little dipointed in the size of the girls HEE HEE. We also had the best Steak and lobster dinner at Bally's Steakhouse. I would offer a little advise on "The Fremont Street Experience" don't wonder off the mian street and dont go hungry. We eat at Main Street Station and it was nasty food and dirty reastrunt. The taxi ride cost about $15.00

Reviews.Title: “A wrod to the wise”
Reviews.Author: Terie-V
Reviews.Content: Just read a negative review from a lady from PA. Having worked for years in hospitality, I have a word of advice to anyone who has a problem at ANY hotel. DON'T TALK TO THE CLERK!! The clerk makes about minimum wage and could care less. Always ask for the front desk manager or higher depending on where you are. And don't sound angry and yell, it isn't his/her fault. I got an upgrade from a basic lowest cost room to a beautiful mini suite at Ceasars last month by being nice and just speaking to the man as I'd like to be spoken to. He didn't have to do it, but I made him want to help me. That's the trick!! The right person and the right tone of voice works wonders when it comes to hotels!!

Reviews.Title: “Great trip”
Reviews.Author: deslo1
Reviews.Content: At the beginning of May, we stayed at Bally's for a week and we were very pleased with the room and the staff was friendly (except for this lady at the cashier's booth), but i won't go into details. The room was clean, spacious and right near the elevator. We only play the quarter slots, but were able to accumulate over $400.00 in comps, which paid for all our meals and all our extras that were added to our hotel bill. This was our 9th trip to Las Vegas and except for the Venetian, Bally's is the best hotel we've stayed at. And the location is great too. We hightly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great price ...Great Place”
Reviews.Author: Marni
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on this site I was a little skeptical going in, but learned there was nothing to worry about. We stayed at Ballys Mother's Day weekend and had the best time of our lives. Ballys is terrific from check-in to check-out. This was a girls only weekend and none of us had been Vegas before. We had so much fun that we are booking another trip in September. I highly recommend the airport check-in it took us only a couple of minutes, and since their standard rooms were booked they upgraded us to a suite for the 1st night. The pool was great but get there early if you want a lounge chair. Food was good and so was the price. The staff was wonderful, if we asked for something we got it. The casino is okay, but the machines are a little tight. Cabs are available right outside the hotel day and night for easy access. I highly recommend "O" this show is at the Bellagio and is well worth the money. Bally's is a great hotel located in the middle of the strip. I recommend this hotel with high marks and will definitely stay her again!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Ballys!”
Reviews.Author: skoobaru
Reviews.Content: My mother and I went to Vegas Feb. 29th- March 5th for a wedding and stayed at Ballys. We arrived a few hours before check in, but they gave us a room early. The room was spacious, clean and had a view of the Eiffel Tower, the strip and part of the Bellagio fountains. Every employee we came in contact with was nice and the casino was fun! I ate at the steakhouse...GREAT food but a little pricey. The buffet at Paris was much better for breakfast than the Big Kitchen Buffet, but the Big Kitchen was good. Ballys is at a great location...right in the center of everything! The only complaint about Bally's is that a cocktail waitress was very hard to find, esp. when playing the slots! I would stay at Ballys again and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD LOCATION AND VALUE”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hello! Bally's is a 3 star hotel with all the basic amenities. Hotel is in a great location and good value for your money. The rooms are nothing fancy, showers needs improvement. Big Kitchen Buffet restaurant was good about $18.00 for dinner, $13 for breakfast. Pool area needs improvement looks like a days inn pool! i definately agree with other reviewers on the gamble. Machines don't give much back. Go else where for better luck!

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: CherylM2704
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 12th-15th April. They upgraded our room free as there were none available of the standard ones we'd booked online. Room was huge and lovely. Bellhops very nice. In room safe was very expensive to use, as was the bottled water in room if you used it. Casino was extremely smoky, but then most casinos seemed to be to me (very anti-smoking). Dinner buffet had a big queue (again most seem to have at that time of night) but worth it - plentiful, tasty but expensive. Parking was a long walk away, we used the Paris car park next door as it was a little nearer. Would stay again but would probably go elsewhere to try out one of the many others!

Reviews.Title: “Great time at Bally's”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Bally’s from April 7- 11. I arrived in Vegas around 10:30 pm and took a cab to the hotel. The check in line was long but it moved fast. I requested one of the newly renovated rooms on a high floor and to my surprise it was more than what I expected. It had a king size bed with a large sitting area with a sofa and four sitting chairs along with that there was a dinning table with four chairs too. I was truly impressed. I found the casino to rather small compared to others on the strip. I lost quite a bit of money my first night in there. The next night I headed to Harrah’s – I won most of my $ back there. I eat at the buffet they have at Bally’s for lunch, that night I had such a stomach ache- I did not revisit that buffet for the rest of my stay!! Overall, I truly enjoyed my stay at Bally's. I'm planning my next trip to Vegas in July and I have already reserved my room at Bally's!

Reviews.Title: “Worth every penny”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Bally's from April 1 - 5th of 2004. I was worried about checking in since my flight was landing earlier then check-in time. Wasn't a problem at all, I checked in at noon and wasn't charged more. The room they gave me was HUGE on the 25th floor of the north tower. The room I got was the room, they show in their pictures. Even though this IS NOT a standered room it was only 10 bucks more a night. Very clean, and maid service was great on keeping the room clean. I heard thru many reviews, people couldn't find the selfserve parking. It's clearly labeled and you can enter right from the strip thru the main enterance. I didn't see what are the fuss was about. Lets face it bally's is bally's. It's not a new hotel, we all know this. It's not some huge secret. It is very affordable and right on the strip. For the price you just can't beat it. Gambling..... Bally's was very kind to me. I won some, and I lost some. I did however come out ahead. The casino is rather small, and does get packed on the weekends, but at 3am I was too drunk to notice anyway. The louge at bally's is one of the better ones I've been to. A motown group, was there putting on the best free show I've ever seen. The opening song, Princes "Purple Rain" felt like Prince was playing it. They was that dam good. The thing I didn't like was the 3 dollar per day charge to use the safe. That's just crazy. I'm not holding fort knox in it. There is no need to charge for a safe, period.

Reviews.Title: “WON"T GO BACK”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked a room for four nights at Ballys and was not very impressed. Would not stay here again!! Heres the story. We made reservations 6 months in advance because we were attending a wedding at Ceasars Palace. When we checked in I requested a renovated room if they had one and a decent view. They said they only had a double bed room available. I told them we reserved a King size bed room and I asked for an upgraded room since they were unable to accomadate us according to our reservation. The reply was when we booked (remember 6 months in advance) there is no guaranteee we would get the room we requested. They gave us a double bed room to sleep the night and said we would have to change rooms in the morning. The night clerk assured me we'll give you a renovated room with a view at no extra charge in the morning. Do you believe Ballys Casino asks for $20.00 per night extra for a room with new carpet, new bedspread, new drapery, clean walls??? He went so far as to show us a picture of the room they have in a binder at the desk. He indicated he would pass along the room number to the morning staff and we should call the desk when we get up. We had no choice but to sleep the night. It was already 12:30 am and we were exhausted from traveling all day. When we got up to our room it was HORRIBBLE!!! Old dirty carpet with stains all over, drapes that needed to be cleaned, dingy bedspreads and marked up walls. And when we opened up our drapes we saw nothing but a rooftop. No Las Vegas lights just a huge rooftop. The next day we had planned a breakfast with the Bride and Groom and family we hadn't seen in years. I called the desk in the morning (as the night clerk indicated) and asked about the time for that renovated room. The desk said "You are in a renovated room!!" I said we are not. I told her the night clerk assigned us a room on a higher floor that he said was renovated and also we do not have the King size bed we reserved. I indicated the night clerk had showed me a picture of the renovated room and that was the one we were interested in. She insisted we have a renovated room and assigned room number on a lower floor. (I was told the higher floors are the renovated floors). Well at this point I had enough. I went down to the desk and explained the entire situation to yet another clerk. (Had to stand in line for about 20 minutes) At this point I was really annoyed and frustrated. We had to sleep in this shabby room , we were totally inconvenienced because we were unable to unpack , was running late for the breakfast party with the Bride and Groom and had to re-explain the whole situation to the morning clerk at the desk. She said she didn't know what I meant by the renovated room. I said pull out the binder with the laminated room pictures in them so I can show you. OH BINGO!!! Now she knows what I mean. It was 9:00 am and to put the icing on the cake, do you believe she asked us if we could be out of thie room by 10:00 am to do the switch? I indicated we were already late for our breakfast party and we may be out of our room by 10:30 am. After breakfast, (of course before switching rooms) I looked at the new room. It was exactly like the old room but with clean carpet, clean walls, clean drapery and clean bedspread. Just an OK view. At least the room wasn't old and shabby. I dont think I could stand the other room for four days. Wouldn't you think since we were totally inconvenienced, and they did not have the accomadations we reserved that they would maybe upgrade our room? or maybe get us a better view? Possibly facing the strip? I know things happen but if Bally's had tried to accomadate us with a few extras because of our inconvenience the first night I would feel different right now. I will never return to Ballys again. We paid full price for our room and expecting the King size bed we reserved, clean drapery, clean walls and clean bedspread is not too much to ask. Isn't this a casino?? How many thousand rooms do they have between the two towers? The location of the hotel was great but thats about it!! Obviously they don't care about customer service. We will never go back.!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location! Spacious and clean rooms.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed with some girlfriends of mine at Bally's April 14-17 for a girl's weekend/bachlorette party for me. We stayed in the North Tower, since I heard that was the remodeled tower. The rooms were beautiful and very clean. Though, the view was horrible of a roof and a slight view of the pool. I would have liked to have a strip view, but I think we would have needed to be in the South Tower. If you are looking for a clean and spacious room, the North Tower is where to be. If a view is more important, you might have a better chance of getting strip view if you stay in the South Tower. We checked in at the airport and things went real quickly and everyone was nice. Emma checked us in and was real patient and nice in trying to find what we wanted. Everyone at the hotel was helpful, from the bellhops to the receptionists. The casino seemed a little small to me. The pool was large, but the bar by the pool had an awful selection of drinks. Plus there were no umbrellas to lay under by the pool, which I found very odd. Though, being connected to Paris was awesome. Also, you are extremely close to Caesar's & Bellagio. You can't beat the location! I would consider staying at Bally's again.

Reviews.Title: “Bally's great with Paris right next door!”
Reviews.Author: GenesisFan
Reviews.Content: Bally's was billed as a four star property in Expedia, it earned the four stars for the amenities offered to it guests. Though not one of the newer mega properties it's attraction is it's draw to the more middle class clientel. That and it's excellent location led us to stay here for three nights prior to Easter weekend. Here's a nice little tip, use the Bally's / Caesar's hotel check-in desk located at the airport, it only had about 5 people in line when we got there and we had our room keys and all in less than 15 minutes or so. It's off to the rental car and straight to the room from there. How could you go wrong with that? I tried in vain to talk my way into a 'strip' view room. I mentioned to the pretty young desk clerk that I had worked for Bally's in Atlantic City, no go though. She said, "A strip view would be another $30 per night." "We will have the desert view," I cheerfully offered up! She had me checked in within 2 minutes! Not quite that is what we ended up with but, we were only in our room to sleep and then it was out and up early back to the sightseeing trail. We got our king bed with 'no smoking' and it was very nice. Parking your car is yet another matter though. You can use the Paris Hotel parking garage as the two properties are joined and owned by the same company. The walk is tedious though, quite long. We used the Bally's self park which is accessible via Tropicana ave. around the back of the property on a surface lot. You may want to valet, that of course is a nice thing. Plenty of nice restaurants inside of Bally's. The Big Kitchen buffet is ok, nothing gourmet here. Just as advertised you get your food in what appears to be a big kitchen... Try the MGM Grand buffet instead at $21.99 during the week it was tops in our agenda. This is 4 stars. Get there early though, they get a crowd here. The Paris Hotel has a wonderful buffet as well called "Le Buffet", we had the $12.95 breakfast buffet that had everything but the kitchen sink, bravo! All in all, I would stay here again, although we both would probably see what the more upscale Paris Hotel would offer us on our next trip to Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4-star at all”
Reviews.Author: baltcate58
Reviews.Content: 1. I just returned from a brief stay. Let me start with my checkin at the airport. My question: "Does this room look out at the Strip?" Response from clerk: "Yes, you'll be able to see the Bellagio display" Reality, when I arrived, the room was overlooking the convention center roof and pool area. While I was able to immediately switch, the front desk clerk explained that the airport personnel have no room map of the hotel so they have no clue where your room is. 2. Housekeeping. Being a good dooby, I try and tip each night of my stay to ensure that the one actually doing the work gets the cash. Bad idea, as on day 2, only the bed was made and the towels replaced. First time ever in a hotel where dirty glasses weren't removed and replaced. 3. There was never anyone around to ask a question. When you did find someone, it was obvious that they had no interest or time in your question. 4. Even though the price was good, it would be better to pay a little more for a better establishment. Or a little less and have lower expectations.

Reviews.Title: “we loved Bally's”
Reviews.Author: bbtodd
Reviews.Content: Spent 6 nights at Bally's through Easter. Great location. rooms are huge. This is an older hotel and not as luxurious as some of the newer places. We stayed in the South Tower and friends stayed in the North Tower. We had a great view of Bellagio's water show. Unforturnately the power went out at Bellagios Easter Sunday morning about 2:00 am. Still wasn't on when we left Wednesday. Friends had a great view of the strip heading north.Long walk to get to elevator. A little confusing when you first check in. Make sure you get on the elevator for your room number. The north tower is on one side and the south tower is on another. The food at bally's wasn't so hot. Go to Paris at the St. Louis 24 hour restaurant. Better service and much better food. Had the prime rib and crab legs special at both hotels. For the same price $13.95 you can't beat the Paris. We would definitely stay at Bally's again. Cheaper than Paris (stayed there last year). Ice machines on some of the floors weren't working. Check out was a little too long. Only 3 people working. Got great comps though (over $200 off the bill at check out). Will definitely go back next year.

Reviews.Title: “The rudest staff ever!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I hated my stay at Bally's. The room rate was great, and that's why we stayed there. I booked two rooms 2 months in advance, and when I arrived they didn't have those rooms available. We were told that the two rooms would have to be in separate towers. Then finally they found two rooms close together, but they were smoking rooms. The staff I dealt with was extremely rude. I then ended up waiting in line for 45 minutes to pick up my room key because the woman working the counter decided to leave. Finally I received service when the gentleman behind me in line started yelling and making a scene. My friend's room had the air conditioner die in the middle of the night. The first repair man started to fix it, and then just left (his shift was over). Two hours later my friend called the front desk and they finally sent another person up to fix the problem. So she and her husband didn't get any sleep that night. They were not comped for the room. The next day the manager told us... "things like that happen. There is nothing I can do." Every time I needed something from the front desk, I was treated badly. I will NEVER stay at Bally's again. I don't care how cheap their rates are. The service was horrible, and the fact that the manager didn't even care made the situation even worse.

Reviews.Title: “Best value - higly recommend”
Reviews.Author: lawra09
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Bally's from 3/29 - 4/3. Checked in at airport - asked for and got a beautiful room on the 26th floor in the north tower with a view of the strip. Stayed at Paris last June and this room was far superior to the one there which was half the size and no view. Hotel & casino personnel were friendly and room was spotless. Only disappointment was that the monorail was not operating. Can't wait to go back to Bally's!

Reviews.Title: “Bally's - worth the trip”
Reviews.Author: iluvegas
Reviews.Content: Started off my week long Vegas holiday at the Travelodge - ouch! The airport shuttle dropped me off in the back lane by the dumpsters, pointed to the parking lot and said, "The check in is over there!" I knew I wouldn't find a room for the weekend but hacked it out til Sunday, then got a room at Bally's. I can't agree with the reviews that suggest that you don't sleep much anyway so it doesn't matter where you stay. Moving to Bally's made my trip! It was wonderful. Clean with a view of the fountains!! Every staff person I encountered was friendly and helpful. They had no room for my last night so I went to the Paris. Expensive but equally lovely. This was the first trip I had ever used the players club cards for comps. I thought they were just for high rollers. I reaped the benefits even though I'm a small time slot player. I'd never play again without a card. I think Paris has the best buffet ever!!! I'd highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I didn't see anything negative about Bally's. I was just there celebrating my 21st Birthday and parents' 35th wedding anniversary. The room that we stayed in was very nice. When we first got there, we asked for a renovated room, and they just booked us in a Junior Suite for only a additional $25 (AND THIS WAS FOR THE WHOLE STAY!). Finding the elevators for the tower that we were staying in was no problem. The view was okay, but it was close enough for our expectations. We had a balcony overlooking the MGM Grand, The Fountains at The Bellagio,and The Eiffel Tower at Paris. Talk about space: Getting around the room was a breeze and the bathroom was very stylish!! I would stay here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: canadarose
Reviews.Content: stayed at bally's Mar 12-14. ended up there by accident. had booked for flamingo, but when we arrived they had moved us to bally's as they were overbooked. got a north tower room, recently renovated. view of barbary coast. room was large and clean, nice amenities and good shower. bathroom was big and clean, all nicely decorated. there was a sofa, several upholstered chairs, quite roomy. ate at Terrace Cafe, buffet breakfast, both were fine, if not inspired. Service was friendly. Pool was good, casino only mediocre. Liked the location mid- strip, and especially it's proximity to Paris. Would reccomend this hotel if the price was right. It certainly was for us. I thought they were charging us the rate we had pre-paid for Flamingo, but when we arrived home, we discovered that thay had credited the whole amount to our credt card, so our stay was free.

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: Seektravel
Reviews.Content: With all the great choices of staying in Vegas, this would be one of my last choices. I have stayed in Vegas many a time. I stayed in Bally's last summer and felt it was run down and had nothing fun about the look of the hotel. I was dissappointed in dining options too. Only stay here if you have no choice.

Reviews.Title: “I had a great time”
Reviews.Author: hcs81m
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Bally's March 15-18th. I had wonderful room on the 24th floor with a view of the Paris hotel, the Eiffel Tower, the MGM, and if you stood in the right spot a view of the Bellagio and it's fountains. The room was huge, and the housekeeping staff is on top of it's game. The bathroom was completely marble. My only complaint was a lack of acessible power outlets.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked a standard room for 5 nights in march 2004. The room was spotlessly clean and well furnished, the kingsize bed was massive and so comfortable. Never saw a maid but everyday the room was made up just right. The view from the room windows and the location of this hotel are fantastic. I only have one bad thing to say and that is the breakfast buffet is expensive and nothing special at $12.99. Try the Alladin instead for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Sticky and seedy”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 nights at this hotel and upon arrival I realised that the picture shown on the internet had nothing to do with the room I got. An old smelly seedy room with a sticky carpet. Depressing! The gym and spa was a joke! Small with few machines. The hotel's casino is the worse on the strip. Low energy and cheap looking. I'll never go back to this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Ballys from Feb 15-22 2004. I found the rooms very nice, spacious & clean, the maid service efficient and daily, and had a great view outside. The room includes a safe they say charges $3 a day for use but I never did get charged for using it every day. The location was great, in the middle of the strip, and fairly quiet given the fact that it IS Las Vegas. It is also right across the street from Caesars Palace and the Bellagio; we could actually watch the dancing lights & fountain right out our window, and we had a great view of the Eiffel Tower. We were on the 18th floor and given that it is a party town, things were pretty quiet as far as other tenants go. Bottled water in the room was $4.50 USD a bottle, so I just drank out of the tap. What I was unimpressed with was that the spa and gym facility that they advertise as a drawing feature costs TWENTY DOLLARS A DAY just to go for a weight workout or a run on a treadmill. This is ridiculous. I can understand the spa costing money but not a regular fitness gym - most hotels include this. Twenty bucks a week is nominal but this was too much. I never got to eat at Ballys much because we were usually far off at a different end of the strip at mealtimes. Food could be very reasonable at the lower end of the strip (Westward Ho casino had great food for a good price) and little more expensive at the fancier end, but the portions were all great everywhere we went and we never felt ripped off. Some advice to anyone going to Vegas - if you're going to sightsee and just have a quieter fun time, go during the week (Sunday to Thursday) because the weekends are crazy! Most casinos have standing room only on weekends and the food lineups are UNREAL. Also, trying to get in on the lower-limit gaming tables on the weekend is nigh impossible. (Hey, I'm not a big spender!) However, if you're a party animal and want things rockin', the weekend in Vegas is packed, and the booze & gaming goes 24 hours a day. And bring lots of cash - not much in Vegas is cheap! Don't rush out and pay full ticket for any shows - you can usually find a two for one coupon SOMEWHERE being handed out for any given show. There is also a discount shop (covered with yellow flags and ribbons) near the Harley Davidson Cafe that sells certain tickets for same-day shows for 1/2 price - so check it out before you pay $50 or $100 each and then find out you could have saved 1/2 cost!

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My buddy and I stayed there for a bachelor party the weekend of Feb. 20th. It was nice enough and the spooksbook there is super sweet. Our room in the north tower was pretty nice witha view of the Bellagio fountain. Here is some advise: Check in at the airport, DO NOT take the shuttle (took forever and ended up saving us only $3 total vs. cab) and request the north tower because it is newly re-done. I would stay there again. Email me if you have any questions tjhooker@austin.rr.com

Reviews.Title: “Had a Great Time at Bally's”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Bally?s Feb 13-18. While we were worried about the mixed reviews from this site, our fears were diminished completely our first day. We were a party of six and all of our rooms were great. We stay on the 66th floor of the South Tower. We booked our room on hotels.com and did not pay an upgrade charge. We used the airport check-in where there was not a wait. At the hotel, the check-in line stretched for a mile. We thought the casino could have been a little looser, but it was not crowded and gave some of the new gamblers in our group time to learn (and lose). We thought the best place to gamble (and still be on the strip) was the Venetian. We really didn?t like the Sidewalk Caf? food, but The Big Kitchen Buffet, Al Dente, Nosh, Java Coast and Room Service were all excellent. Because Bally?s Spa could not do ?couple services?, we used the spa at adjoining Paris Hotel. We got massages and facials that were awesome and the ladies lounge/locker room area was extremely clean and freshly stocked. We didn?t rent a car or drive, so I cannot advise on parking. The taxi lines were sometimes long, but did move quickly. Overall, our trip was fantastic and partly because this hotel was fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “central location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Went with 6 girls from work & stayed at Bally's Feb. 8-12. We had the best time, the hotel was centrally located on the strip with a great view of Paris and the part view of Bellagio fountains. We found it easy to jump on the bus to get to everywhere we wanted to be and thouroughly enjoyed ourselves. Hint: if you plan to ride the bus buy an all day pass $5.00 ride for 24hrs as opposed to $2.00 each time you get on. Forget about going to Alladin's Ovation, the show is a small time variety show with lip-singing, the broucher was the best thing they had. The American Allstar show at Strasophere was well worth the money live band with the fabulous singers who looked and sounded the part. I'd stay at Bally's again, the rooms were very spacious, the only thig was they didn't have a lot in the hotel to offer, like stores ect. Maybe that was why it was more reasonably prices.

Reviews.Title: “I Like Bally's.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at Bally's twice and loved it both times. In Sept of 2002 I got an awesome rate of $175 for a Wed-Sun stay. I like the Big Kitchen Buffet. I have walked out stuffed every time. I think the casino is very nice. It's large, well lit, the dealers are cool (I play craps and that's about it), and my fellow gamblers are good people and fun to play with. Speaking of fun people, you can really whoop it up across the street at the Barbary Coast. Bally's is the sweetest location in Vegas, period. The bartenders are friendly and a good source of information. My room was great. Nice view, nice ironing equipment, nice spacious bathroom, and the chambermaids make the room clean and I mean clean! She also organized my stuff in the room and the bathroom. Sadly, the pool area was closed. :( I went over to the Paris and hung out but it was only 75 degrees or so and only a few people were hanging out. My only complaint now is that Bally's is charging too much for the traditional Thursday-Sunday stay. I'll just have to go Sun-Thurs. Comes to about $200 when it is not so busy. I have also stayed at the now destroyed Alladin (that old rickety place was great!) Imperial Palace and Tropicana and Bally's has them beat for various reasons. Look forward to going again and again.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Do not understand negative reviews- have stayed in many 4 star hotels in Vegas and Bally's a great place for the money- great central location- parking is not that far compared to some hotels A 20 tip at checkin with request for view got me great view and semi- remodeled room(furniture not replaced yet) Very friendly staff- Park Place Connection comps add up quick- loved eating at Changs-five star service- give a pass on breakfast buffet here- go next door to Paris Would stay here again on next trip to Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Problems Here? Don't Understand!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at Ballys several times over the last few years I don't understand the problems some of these reviews relate. All operations of this size have issues with reservations and staff, but at Ballys any problem I,ve had has been handled politely and as quickly as possible. Checking in late(flight delay)during Chinese New Year once, our room had been given away...The staff went out of their way to give us a suite that probably cost more for one night than our regular standard room for our intire 6 night stay..Rooms have always been clean, reasonablly well appointed and large. The casino is small and very functional giving more personal attention to the player than the "mega" casinos. Bottom line, if the want to be in the center of the strip close to all the "action" without spending a fortune, Ballys is hard to beat. No, I haven't tried them all, but I've tried my share of hotel/casinos in Vegas and Ballys is my hotel of choice.......

Reviews.Title: “Mother's Day Dream Vacation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was in Vegas for Mother's Day weekend and I had a great time. I stayed at Bally's for the first time and I loved it. Yes, moths are a problem, but if people would keep their windows closed it wouldn't be as much of a problem. We ate at the streak house and the food/service was excellent. The Jubilee show is very tastefully done and offers a wonderful show. You must go the the Spa, it was a wonderful experience, especially the Mohavie Stone massage. Although smaller than some of the bigger hotels, the casino is nice. We actually won some money this trip! Best of all was our view from the room, it looked straight out at the Bellagio and we watched the light show spectacular from our room. The room service was good and not too expenses. Try breakfast by the pool in the morning, it provided the right start for a day of shopping (adjacent to the Paris shopping area) and sightseeing. This was one of the best Mother's Day celebrations. I would definitely stay here again. Oh and the comps are real good also! Since our stay, I receive regular offers from Ballys for discounted stays at their hotel. It centrally located on the strip and now they have the monorail for more convenient travel on the strip-nice feature.

Reviews.Title: “Good time at Bally's”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We went to Bally's in mid-November for 4 days and had a great time. We booked directly from their web page and paid $75/night. Bally's location on the strip is great, it's close to Bellagio, Paris and Ceasar's Palace. If you drive there (like us), you'll have to park at Paris which is right next door. We had three people in one room, but since our room wasn't ready at check-in, they waived the 3rd person charge (almost $100). We had a nice and good-sized room in the upper north tower. Housekeeping was very good about coming in everyday. We had a lousy view, but I didn't go to Vegas to stare out the window. Most of the staff was friendly (there was one or two people that could have been nicer). The food was good at the restaurants we tried. The pool level (where the shops are located) had inexpensive restaurants where you could get pizza for about $3/slice. Overall, I would recommend Bally's to others and stay there again myself.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at Bally's”
Reviews.Author: mar_76
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Bally's Jan. 2-5. Would definitely stay again. Was second trip to Vegas --- first time stayed at the Venetian. Of course Bally's couldn't compare, but it was still a great place to stay. Big, confortable room. Location cannot be beat --- you can walk practically anywhere on the Strip. We liked being right next to the Paris (casino is nicer), and being able to charge expenses to our room from any of the Park Place properties.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, price and service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I recently had a big birthday party and booked a block of 10 rooms with Bally's sales office. They gave me a good rate. From the moment we all checked in, everything was great. The room decor is a bit plain, but the rooms are huge, clean and the service througout the hotel is very good. The casino is not flashy and the shops ordinary, but you can walk right to Paris without going outside, and Bellagio is just across the street. I think the location is very convenient. We ate in several of the hotel's restaurants, and found them all good. The only complaint was the long line at check-in. But you can check in at the airport, or avoid peak time: 3PM. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Pluses & Minuses of staying at Bally's Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights over New Years '03/'04. The position on the strip is perfect walking distance to all the other hotels. The room was very large and very well equipped. The only grumble was the Sidewalk Cafe, the food was adequate, portions generous, price reasonable, but they do make you stand in line for absolutely no reason. Everytime time we stood in line, when we were eventually shown to our table, we noticed plenty of empty tables. There is no need for queueing, although it seems to be an american obsession. The shopping mall is tired but it looks like they will reinvent this space when the monorail is back up and running. It is adjacent to Paris, which is fabulous. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Key point to a pleasant Bally's stay”
Reviews.Author: BenW
Reviews.Content: Bally's has a split personality. They want to be like the Paris next door (owned by the same Park Place entertainment), but they don't have the scratch or cache. As such, you can either end up in a very nice renovated room or a dank, stinky old room. The renovation is underway, but takes time. We stayed here for 3 nights over New Years. I knew going in that it is CRITICAL that you ask for an upgraded room. These rooms are in the NORTH tower and are very nice; really one of the nicest rooms I have stayed in (and I know nice!). The reality of Bally's is that you stay there because of the location, not because of the casino or resort. Eat at Mon Ami Gabi in the Paris. It is fantastic. Walk to Bellagio or Venetian (cab if you must, but come on, you need the exercise anyway). The write up that blamed Bally's for their car being broken into was off the mark. It is not their fault; stuff like that happens. You can get no better location for the price than staying here. Don't order room service coffee. One pot was $16 and was not very good. Go downstairs to the coffee bar. Bally's was $179 per night over New Years, but is usually much less. Bellagio across the street for the same period was $800. You do the math (and keep the additional $1200 in your pocket).

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Room was not cleaned from previous occupant. Over enthusiastic maid threw away things that she shouldn't. Neighbor was smoking all the time in a non-smoking floor/room, hotel did nothing. Bathroom fixtures falling off in bathroom. Stains on wallpaper in room. $10 a day for internet access. Mirage was far better. Will never stay again.

Reviews.Title: “girlfriend dont you go there”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: we got sars mad cow,power blackouts, wes nil , but at least we dont have ballys. !!!!!!!!!!! finding the parking at the hotel was like living in the twilight zone. we actually ended up at another hotel? i think its shared with the paris hotel. our room stank.we asked for non-smoking but it obviously wasnt so when we went down to change our room the clerk was rude and obnoxious. it was as if i was disturbing her. she told me your lucky some people dont get a room at all the first night and get sent to a completely different hotel. as we were going up in the elevator two other patrons were complaing of getting smoking rooms and one of them had allergies. the casino was small and not exciting. forget about morning coffee if you want a medium. they only serve small or large? any coffee drinker knows that a small just wont cut it so your forced to buy the large. the pastries are horrible and pricey, and the service is nasty. every bad thing youve heard about this place is true and more. dont go there are too many great places to stay in vegas

Reviews.Title: “Great value at convention rate!”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoBearsFan650
Reviews.Content: I visited Bally's in August of 2003 for a convention. Because I was with a group, I got a rate of $80.00 per night. I was skeptical, because from the outside Bally's isn't much to look at. I've stayed at Bellagio, Mirage, Mandalay Bay and Paris and figured nothing would really compare. As soon as I opened the door to my room, I was really impressed. The room was huge, and the decor was pleasant and up-to-date. I'm a big fan of nice bathrooms, and I was very pleased with Bally's. The entire bathroom was done in granite, with very nice fixtures. The tub and shower were clean and big (not oversized per-se, but not at all cramped.) Bally's casino is small, but that isn't necassarily a bad thing. One of the best things about Bally's is that without going outside you can access all of Paris, and its shopping, casino and restaurants. If you like good coffee, there is a fun place in the walkway between Bally's and Paris. The "Big Kitchen Buffet" isn't as extensive as some others, but for the price I can't complain. Additionally, the waitstaff was very friendly, which goes a long way for me. I have always liked Bally's 24 hour coffee shop - the Sidewalk Cafe. This visit was no different. I also ate at Al Dente, which is a fine Italian restaurant. I enjoyed my experience there - its very pleasant inside, but it wasn't the best Italian meal I've ever had. I'm sure it doesn't hold a candle to Valentino (at the Venitian and Los Angeles). Another convenience Bally's offers is the ability to charge anything to your room at any of their hotels (Park Place Entertainment - Caesar's Palace, Flamingo, Paris, Bally's and the LV Hilton). For $80 I frankly thought it was a steal, and wouldn't hesitate to go back. I think I would stay there even if the price was $120 per night, though at that price I would stay at Paris, Mandalay, Bellagio and perhaps Mirage or Treasure Island ahead, if they were all equally priced - simply because its kind of fun to have the theme aspect.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible! My car was broken into!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I went to this hotel on my Honeymoon. Rooms were large like it shows on the website but I had a nonsmoking room and it still reeked of smoke. The rooms were poorly decorated, the beds were uncomfortable. It was not a nice hotel. I stayed at a much better hotel on the strip for less. When we went out to go to dinner the next night we returned to our car and my whole dash was shattered and my stereo was gone. The place is very dirty and unattractive. The hotel staff didn't even really care about what had happened and just gave us the run around. This hotel almost ruined my honeymoon! Take my advice. Don't stay here! It really is as bad as people say.

Reviews.Title: “Most Square Footage for the $”
Reviews.Author: Tracy217
Reviews.Content: Stayed Thurs and Fri night before Christmas - always a slow time. Rate was $45 (Thur) and $75 (Fri). My parents and I have stayed at many places in Las Vegas, and Bally's gives you the LARGEST standard room by far. I asked for a nice view at check-in, and they put me high up. The restaurants are good, the casino is good, and location is great. We could walk to the Bellagio's fountain show, and its renowned lobby in five minutes. Could walk to the Paris hotel and shops in five minutes (without going outside). Walked to the Flamingo's great buffet in ten minutes. Self-parking is a little far (in Paris hotel); but valet parking is so convenient to use. Kids will like the Houdini magic shop off the lobby. I definitely recommend Bally's.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took our first trip to Las Vegas Dec 4. It was the best vacation we gave taken so far. We stayed at Bally's and had a great time. The room was bigger than standard and was very clean. The Big Kitchen buffet was ok (we liked Aladdin's Champagne brunchthe most). There was no problem getting more of the good smelling shampoo or lotion that they provide. We will definately go back and most likely stay at Bally's again.

Reviews.Title: “HUGE rooms, lots of moths in hotel in the end of May”
Reviews.Author: TechWriterCor
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Bally's Las Vegas in May, 2003. I travel to Vegas often (2-4 times a year) and was reluctant to stay at Bally's this time around (we usually stay at Caesar's - EXCELLENT if you stay in the newest tower, but you'll pay for it or the Flamingo - great rooms on 28th floor, great slots!), but it was overall really nice. The rooms are about twice the size of any other hotel that I've stayed at in Vegas (I've stayed at TI, Flamingo, Caesar's, Bellagio, Excalibur, MGM, and Tropicana). The rooms were fairly clean and the bathroom was clean, but very plain looking. Our view wasn't much, but we got a cheap rate, so it wasn't a big deal. The room service has much more variety and is MUCH cheaper than any other hotels I've stayed at in Vegas. I didn't order the room service, but I sure thought about it because the prices were right. The pool is very nice if you like to swim. The pool goes from shallow to deep and is olympic sized. There weren't many people out by the pool when I was there, but it was also close to 100 degrees out. One warning: there is not much shade by the pool, so make sure to bring a couple of bottles of water with you when you go. I ate at the Japanese place on the way to the pool -- it was ok for the price. Not authentic, but not totally fast food tasting. I also ate at the main dinning area (forget what it's called) -- the service was bad, the food was ok. The buffett there was AWESOME though. I'm not a big buffett fan, but we went to this one for breakfast and they had EVERYTHING you could ever hope for. The only complaint I have about this hotel is that I lost too much money (haha) and on a more serious note, there were moths everywhere in the room - the hallway - every where. I killed at least 10 per day. Apperntly in late May, moths get attracted to this hotel and I was told that it was a rare occurance, but it was disgusting and annoying. I would not stay at this hotel in May, but would be willing to give it a shot again in the winter for a good rate. If not for the moth problem, I would rate this hotel excellent.

Reviews.Title: “great except for my winnings......”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: which were nonexistant! Just returned last night. I stayed in the North tower, room was great, large, clean & recently remodeled. I was impressed with the Big Kitchen Buffet, compared to the sit down restaraunt the value was good, just go hungry. Casino had a good selection of games & was not too crowded. Check in at the airport was easy, had my room key before my bags came off the carosel. Recommedned restaraunts; Lawerys Prime Rib - best meal of the stay, Circo's at Bellagio- expensive but very good, Del Frisco's-great steak.
